description: Mint House combines the classic comfort of home and the modern luxury of a hotel, giving guests all the perks and none of the tradeoffs. We've ditched losable key cards, long lines, room service and other relics for the things we miss when we travel‚Äîkitchens, groceries, workout routines, and the space to spread out. Every part of the Mint House experience is powered by smart technology, making your stay personal, predictable and effortless.  Founded in 2017, the company has raised approximately $50M from leading venture capital firms like Revolution Ventures and executives from trusted hospitality and real estate brands.  Today, Mint House has 20+ artfully designed, tech-first hotels in 14 cities including NYC, Miami, Austin and Nashville, with plans to expand to more than 3,000 units in 30 markets in the next 12 months.  As our Director of Sales, you will have a hand in achieving our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company as a leading disruptive of our ever changing industry. You will be responsible for maximizing the potential in our Dallas and Austin market by executing sales strategies under the leadership of our Chief Customer Officer.  What You'll Do Build a cohesive network of business leaders that will drive occupancy in our growing portfolio of corporate housing units by prospecting new opportunities and managing existing relationships to drive future production Help scale Texas Mint House's footprint by educating companies the benefits of having their employees and clients stay at our properties Drive sales process to be the preferred travel partner of the local economy and help disrupt the hospitality space Responsible for meeting and exceeding revenue goals and building book of business Work cross-functionally and collaboratively with Market Leads, Operations, Revenue, and Sales Team Participates in weekly meetings with the broader team to discuss brand positioning, forecasting, and all aspects of the sales process  You should have 5-7 years of B2B sales experience in a high-end boutique hotel environment (upscale/unique accommodations) Notable experience developing strong partnerships with local organizations to further increase brand/product awareness Proven track record of closing mid-size large top tier travel brands Strong outbound process to cultivate new partnerships by quickly identifying the stakeholders and decision-making process Outstanding communication skills and ability to work collaboratively Passion for out-of-the-box thinking, creating long lasting relationships, and hospitality  Mint House is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a workplace of belongingness. We're committed to diversity and maintaining a work environment that is free from harassment and discrimination. Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any protected status under federal, state, or local law.
industries: Hospitality

description: Director of Business Development  Position Overview  The Chicago Bulls are seeking a Director of Business Development in Corporate Partnerships to help lead the growth and development of new partnership business for the organization. The Director of Business Development should be a dynamic senior leader with the proven ability to develop and sell impactful corporate partnerships. Partnerships will consist of Bulls, Chicago Bulls Charities, Windy City Bulls and United Center assets including but not limited to signage, promotions, digital advertising, community programming, print advertising, IP rights, and corporate hospitality. A key part of this role also includes directly managing and mentoring up to two Account Executive level sellers.  The individual in this position will be expected to help grow the organization‚Äôs corporate partnerships revenue by prospecting, building key local relationships, and nurturing existing clients while closing new business. This is an excellent opportunity for an established sales leader capable of balancing his/her own new business while also developing the organization‚Äôs next sales superstars and helping to create the long term strategy for sales team.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities  In this role, you will support the team‚Äôs business development efforts, with particular emphasis on building new business in assigned categories and managing Account Executive level sellers. Additional responsibilities include: Continuously prospect to develop new business through outreach and networking, which includes growing existing relationships and offerings of assigned accounts. Develop revenue maximization strategies across owned categories Help lead long-term department initiatives and projects Grow and mentor direct reports Manage the sales process from initial touchpoint through contract execution meeting and exceed individual and team goals. Build customer relationships through strategic conversations to understand organizational business objectives and goals; performs a basic client needs analysis with prospective partners and mirrors those objectives with a custom Bulls and/or United Center partnership proposal that builds value for both the partner and our organization. Entertain clients and prospects at Bulls home games and additional special events. Assist in the execution of various organizational functions. Involved in the servicing of Bulls and United Center clients all year long during regular office hours, at home games and at various Bulls functions. Develop and maintain positive relationships with senior executives employed by current and future Bulls corporate partners, and also with senior level executives within the organization. Education / Experience:  Role  In addition, you may be a potential fit for this role if you have a mix of the following  We are seeking an individual with an established background and knowledge of strategic account management, sales process and solution selling. Minimum four-year college degree with 5 years minimum of full-time sponsorship sales experience Proven prospector with a track record of securing initial meetings and phone calls Preferred proficiency in brand marketing and integrated partnerships Patience and affinity to mentor and teach Desire to work as a collaborative, self-starter Strong interpersonal skills and flexibility to work within a rapidly changing environment Ability to communicate articulately and confidently both verbally and in writing with individuals at every level of the organization Proficient in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint Ability to work nights/weekends/holidays as needed Previous sales management experience preferred Must have received the completed COVID-19 vaccination by date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination required. Legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.  We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description: Job Description Summary  The GE Healthcare Key Account Organization helps our most strategic customers transform their organizations and ready their businesses for future challenges in healthcare. Our solutions are engineered for the future of healthcare, and span intelligent medical devices, pharmaceuticals, services, data analytics, and digital solutions that are in the cloud. Our team is mission focused and dedicated to helping our customers to create a healthier world with more precise and efficient care.GE Healthcare is seeking a Key Account Executive for two of our most important customers ‚Äì Trinity Health and Community Health Systems (CHS). If you are the type of person who wakes up and thinks ‚Äúhow can I help my customer achieve their outcomes through a healthcare portfolio approach?‚Äù and are not afraid to be bold with a customer, then this role is for you. This role is focused for the Trinity Health and CHS enterprises, and you will represent GE Healthcare's full portfolio of products, solutions, and services to help these key accounts deliver the best patient care possible.In this role, you will have aligned territory Key Account Executives that work on your team to deliver a collaborative strategic vision and plan across all Trinity Health and CHS regions. You will be a strategic leader in GE Healthcare and will report into the VP & GM of National Accounts & GPOs.The Key Account Executive role will require leadership that spans go-to-market strategy development, key account planning and development, executive relationship mapping and alignment, cultivating deep levels of trust, balancing short term and long term sales cycles, and collaborating cross-functionally within GE Healthcare to bring unique solutions tailored Trinity Health and CHS‚Äô outcomes and goals.*This is a remote opportunity available across the continental US GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare.  Job DescriptionJob DescriptionResponsibilities   Drive sales and revenue growth through successful leadership, key account planning, customer experience, and outstanding execution of regional go-to-market programs (sales, service, digital, marketing, product management engagement). Influence an experienced team of Key Account Executives and lead the supporting field roles and resources aligned to Trinity and CHS within their respective markets. Serve as the senior leader presenting to enterprise strategic decision-making bodies to leverage existing cross-modality GE Healthcare relationships to develop and expand touchpoints within the Trinity Health and CHS systems. Build and deepen executive relationships with Trinity Health and CHS regional and corporate decision-making bodies to help influence their long-term technology and business decisions. Add value and be viewed as a trusted advisor by bringing compelling insights and ideas with follow through execution. Lead and manage entire business-cycles, and discuss contracts, terms and understand associated legal and business risks. Influence the GE Healthcare sales methodology/process, drive best practices on selling, forecasting and account management. Coach your team to drive detailed regional focused account strategies to generate and develop business growth opportunities, working cross-functionally with multiple lines of business, maximizing business impact and opening up opportunities that could scale or act as a pilot for corporate pursuits. Outstanding leadership - inspiring interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and effect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù. Foster a GEHC community across the entire account teams aligned to Trinity and CHS, from sales, service, and digital to provide the necessary technical, clinical, and business support needed.  Required Qualifications   Bachelor‚Äôs Degree 8 years of consultative sales experience in a quota-carrying environment focused on customer outcomes and including strategic selling and negotiation Experience engaging with accounts and promoting a broad portfolio of products at the C-level Previous experience in the Healthcare and Lifesciences industry Willingness and ability to live and travel within your specified geographic territory, + 50% travel   Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Shasta¬Æ has been recognized as a bottling industry pioneer and innovator for more than 130 years. Shasta features multiple flavors and has earned consumer loyalty by delivering value and convenience with such unique tastes as Raspberry Cr√®me, Tiki Punch, and California Dreamin‚Äô.  The Vice President of Sales will be responsible for the direction and implementation of all sales activities for the brand. The Vice President of Sales is responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with new and existing clients in order to achieve revenue targets for their assigned product lines, while providing leadership responsibilities to the team.  Core Role and Responsibilities:  Manage quarterly/annual sales budgets and objectives. Establish and manage broker network where needed. Manage distributors, including working with their sales managers and performing sets/resets. Attend regional and national trade shows to present the brand. Assess market conditions and identify areas of improvement, using IRI syndicated data. Develop forecasts by item/account/month, including close collaboration with internal Business Analysts, who analyze key data from all major accounts. Develop effective presentations reflecting current market trends and conditions, our customer‚Äôs needs and highlighting our competitive advantages; personally deliver sales presentations to prospective clients and major accounts. Identify and track all industry trends and issues (retail grocers, distributor changes, opportunities, segment variations, etc.). Lead sales force, in particular, several Regional Sales Managers.  Qualifications: Minimum of a Bachelor Degree in Business or appropriate equivalent from an accredited university. Previous experience in a senior sales management role for a major, national CPG company. Proven creative, aggressive sales management experience. Knowledge of professional selling techniques and use of CRM software required. Excellent oral and written communications skills (including public speaking). Strong interpersonal, sales presentation and merchandising skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook). Willingness to travel up to 40% of the time. Must reside in Southern CA.  https://www.shastapop.com/
industries: Food & Beverages

description: The National Account Region Director is responsible for managing customer accounts at a national account level, maximizing all opportunities for sales within the accounts for his/her assigned region. Regional Directors will achieve results by executing a 3 tier approach: Analytical, Strategic & Tactical.  Expected Deliverable Increased Marketshare in assigned region via National Account sales activity New account development, and incremental sales growth within existing accounts Region oversight and analysis of National Account sales for Raymond Solutions & Support Centers Analytical Responsibilities Report monthly on regions sales results to Director of National Accounts. Insure that sales reps: 1) Create and maintain customer classification, address, contacts 2) Create and maintain customer forecasts 3) Create and maintain customer Account Plans 4) Create all quotes and order all trucks Insure Quarterly Business Reviews are taking place with all relevant decision makers within the customer account. This includes holding regular business review debriefings with Sales Representative‚Äôs to assess all opportunities for sales. Insure all Account Plans are up to date, and identify specific actions to either attack or defend accounts within a specific timeframe. Monitoring the CRM pipeline, forecasting incoming orders, and ensuring these are fulfilled effectively. Analyze regional market trends and discover new opportunities for growth. Industry and geography based using ITA data. Strategic Responsibilities Evaluate National Account Sales Representatives based on results, quarterly and annually to determine future succession planning needs. Identify hiring needs, assist with selection, and assist in training new sales reps in relation to market coverage. Suggest new services/products and innovative sales techniques to increase customer satisfaction Lead new account activity, directing Raymond Solution & Support Center resources for account penetration Tactical Responsibilities Networking at all levels within assigned national accounts in order to secure all business opportunities. Ensuring both Raymond provides the highest level of customer service to national accounts. Identify large ‚ÄúB‚Äù National Accounts in territory. Penetrate and work with corresponding HQ servicing Service Center. Holding regular monthly meetings & debriefings with internal stakeholders about key accounts, both attack and defend. Investigating and resolving issues raised by national accounts. Insure true account management is taking place, proactive not reactive, coaching and supporting sales reps. Attend customer visits and coordinate factory visits representing The Raymond Corporation. Prepare and review the annual budget for the region of responsibility. Other Proven work experience as a Regional Sales Manager, Area Manager, or similar senior sales role Ability to measure and analyze key performance indicators Familiarity with CRM software Understanding of Supply Chain operations Ability to lead and motivate a high performance sales team Excellent communication skills Strong organizational skills with a problem-solving attitude 70% travel as needed Requirements  Fully competent professional sales position, requiring a Bachelor's Degree in business or a related field.

description: Who We Are  Hungryroot is your personal grocer, powered by AI and the belief that food deeply impacts your daily life. You tell us a little about yourself, and we use proprietary predictive technology to deliver groceries and recipes that best suit your individual needs and goals. We also assist with meal planning and nutritional support, helping you save time, save money, shop sustainably, and eat what makes you feel your best.  We are a distributed team built on top talent from over 10 states across the U.S. While we have an office in NYC, we support employees creating ‚Äúoffices‚Äù wherever they are. We believe in fostering team connection and collaboration across all of our ‚Äúoffices‚Äù - so don‚Äôt expect to be online at 6 am to make a meeting if you‚Äôre on the West coast. Expect to attend regular team building events, and to be able to work from the beach every once in a while. Expect to be treated like an owner who cares about our common goal, not someone who has to clock in and out of work.  Hungryroot is more than doubling in revenue year-over-year, profitable, and rapidly growing - this is why we need you!  What You‚Äôll Do  Hungryroot is looking for a Director of Sales to join our growing Operations team.  We‚Äôre looking for an experienced, hands-on Retail Sales & Online Promotions Director to launch and build out our wholesale business channel as well as drive our trade promotions program with brand partners in our DTC business. This is a new twofold position at Hungryroot and will report directly to our Senior Director of Sourcing & Supply Chain. The ideal candidate has a unique knack for building strong relationships with just about anyone, as well as a deep understanding of the retail food industry. You‚Äôre excited about the opportunity to both think strategically, as well as roll up your sleeves and execute at the tactical level. This role is a great fit for someone with a track record as a dedicated, proactive and positive team player, a passion for food & beverage sales, and who is ready for their next challenge.  You‚Äôll be joining an Operations team responsible for our sourcing, supply chain, culinary, and customer care functions. We all fit within Hungryroot‚Äôs overall team of motivated, smart and kind teammates.  How You‚Äôll Make an Impact: Lead the development of wholesale/retail business plans and objectives, including overseeing wholesale order management Strategize, plan and execute directly with key retail grocery partners and natural foods brokers. Call on retailer decision-makers to present Hungryroot items to develop, grow, and gain new business Grow wholesale/retail sales through increased distribution, promotional planning and successful item launch campaigns Own/Manage and track monthly sales forecast and targets, provide regular sales updates to internal cross functional teams Collaborate with R&D/commercialization, category leads, and marketing to launch, grow, and cultivate the retail/wholesale business as well as the DTC trade promotions program Establish rate cards and identify new promotion and monetization opportunities with existing brand partners Communicate market changes and provide recommendations to adapt and increase competitive advantages  Why We Need You: 6+ years experience in CPG food & beverage 5+ years sales or business development management experience working with major retailers Strong interpersonal and communication skills leveraged for exceptional presentations, negotiations, and relationship building Highly detailed and goal-oriented; Strong problem solving, execution, and prioritization skills Proactive and adaptable self-starter excited by the opportunities that exist with a rapidly-growing startup and industry Demonstrated experience in sales and sales planning with a strong knowledge of food & beverage retail practices and business development Proven experience with both CPG and grocery marketing, promotions, and trade spend Strong Analytical and excel skills Experience working with natural foods, a plus Experience leading teams, a plus Customary travel to trade shows and retailers as restrictions ease  Perks & Benefits Remote Work Optional: Work from home, work from our NYC office, work from anywhere, you decide! Competitive compensation + comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits Unlimited vacation policy Monthly Hungryroot credit Universal paid parental leave 401k Commuter benefits A working environment filled with passionate, happy, smart people!  Hungryroot is built on the values of being proactive, positive, and transparent in all that we do. Our mission to help make healthy eating easy, accessible, and joyful is better served by a diverse workplace.  We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building an inclusive workplace. We have zero-tolerance for harassment or discrimination. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

description: We have a great opportunity for a Director of Sales for Private Label Men's. description: Job Description Summary  The GE Healthcare Key Account Organization helps our most strategic customers transform their organizations and ready their businesses for future challenges in healthcare. Our solutions are engineered for the future of healthcare, and span intelligent medical devices, pharmaceuticals, services, data analytics, and digital solutions that are in the cloud. Our team is mission focused and dedicated to helping our customers to create a healthier world with more precise and efficient care.GE Healthcare is seeking a Key Account Executive for two of our most important customers ‚Äì Trinity Health and Community Health Systems (CHS). If you are the type of person who wakes up and thinks ‚Äúhow can I help my customer achieve their outcomes through a healthcare portfolio approach?‚Äù and are not afraid to be bold with a customer, then this role is for you. This role is focused for the Trinity Health and CHS enterprises, and you will represent GE Healthcare's full portfolio of products, solutions, and services to help these key accounts deliver the best patient care possible.In this role, you will have aligned territory Key Account Executives that work on your team to deliver a collaborative strategic vision and plan across all Trinity Health and CHS regions. You will be a strategic leader in GE Healthcare and will report into the VP & GM of National Accounts & GPOs.The Key Account Executive role will require leadership that spans go-to-market strategy development, key account planning and development, executive relationship mapping and alignment, cultivating deep levels of trust, balancing short term and long term sales cycles, and collaborating cross-functionally within GE Healthcare to bring unique solutions tailored Trinity Health and CHS‚Äô outcomes and goals.*This is a remote opportunity available across the continental US GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare.  Job DescriptionJob DescriptionResponsibilities   Drive sales and revenue growth through successful leadership, key account planning, customer experience, and outstanding execution of regional go-to-market programs (sales, service, digital, marketing, product management engagement). Influence an experienced team of Key Account Executives and lead the supporting field roles and resources aligned to Trinity and CHS within their respective markets. Serve as the senior leader presenting to enterprise strategic decision-making bodies to leverage existing cross-modality GE Healthcare relationships to develop and expand touchpoints within the Trinity Health and CHS systems. Build and deepen executive relationships with Trinity Health and CHS regional and corporate decision-making bodies to help influence their long-term technology and business decisions. Add value and be viewed as a trusted advisor by bringing compelling insights and ideas with follow through execution. Lead and manage entire business-cycles, and discuss contracts, terms and understand associated legal and business risks. Influence the GE Healthcare sales methodology/process, drive best practices on selling, forecasting and account management. Coach your team to drive detailed regional focused account strategies to generate and develop business growth opportunities, working cross-functionally with multiple lines of business, maximizing business impact and opening up opportunities that could scale or act as a pilot for corporate pursuits. Outstanding leadership - inspiring interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and effect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù. Foster a GEHC community across the entire account teams aligned to Trinity and CHS, from sales, service, and digital to provide the necessary technical, clinical, and business support needed.  Required Qualifications   Bachelor‚Äôs Degree 8 years of consultative sales experience in a quota-carrying environment focused on customer outcomes and including strategic selling and negotiation Experience engaging with accounts and promoting a broad portfolio of products at the C-level Previous experience in the Healthcare and Lifesciences industry Willingness and ability to live and travel within your specified geographic territory, + 50% travel   Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

jobTitle: Regional Account Director- Gulf Coast Region - MS, AL, GA
description: Company Description  Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients‚Äô lives and on changing the course of medicine. Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive.  Job Description  This is a field based role in the Gulf Coast region, covering GA, AL & MS. Must live in the territory.  The Regional Account Director (RAD) will secure profitable access for Biogen‚Äôs growing portfolio and serve as the single face of Biogen to develop and execute a strategic plan for key regional accounts with Payer, Integrated Health System, and Pharmacy Benefit Management customers. RADs have a deep understanding of local marketplace trends and use executive relationships to seek innovative ways to expand Biogen growth opportunities in Neuroscience. The RAD leads regional and cross-functional internal collaboration, inclusive of regional and corporate business leaders, to drive execution that optimizes portfolio revenue, facilitates broad access (pharmacy and medical benefit), and maximizes patient outcomes. The RAD reports into the Director of Regional Accounts for Biogen‚Äôs Market Access & Reimbursement division (MA&R).  What You‚Äôll Do As the main point of contact for Biogen, the RAD will take an enterprise approach to secure profitable access in both pharmacy and medical benefit design for all Biogen products with all insurer segments of the customer business Collaborate across a broad team of internal stakeholders to implement brand strategies within regional accounts to achieve Biogen business goals Communicate customer insights and market trends to HQ personnel to shape current and future strategies. Demonstrate the pharmacoeconomic value of our industry-leading products and services Accelerate innovative customer initiatives Develop strategic customer business plans aligned to Biogen Business Framework and MA&R objectives Who You Are  This role appeals to creative and strategic problem solvers who enjoy collaborating cross-functionally and can exert influence at all levels. Excellent communication skills, learning agility and a desire to constantly learn complex clinical, analytical, and environmental trends are essential to RAD success.  Qualifications  Required Skills Minimum of seven years biotech/pharma experience required with preference in specialty biologics Five years in managed markets account management with a strong understanding of healthcare dynamics within the region Working knowledge of regional payers, IDN/Integrated Health Systems, Physician Medical Groups Experience working with provider-administered drugs and infusion site of care delivery settings Product launch experience in environments that require formulary committee decision making Expertise in pharmacy and medical benefits coverage policies is essential Travel Preferred Skills Experience working with BCBS Mississippi, BCBS Alabama, BCBS South Carolina is highly preferred. Exposure to neurology disease states, multiple sclerosis or rare disease field sales experience a plus Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Saol Therapeutics (pronounced ‚ÄúSail‚Äù) is a specialty pharmaceutical company focused on providing therapies to patients from underserved patient populations with unmet medical needs.  Our seasoned management team has a broad range of experience in commercialization, acquisition, licensing, formulation, and product development. We are a dedicated group of professionals who have committed our life‚Äôs work to developing and bringing high-value, much-needed drugs to market. We are looking for highly skilled individuals who are passionate, ethical, team-oriented, and who want to help build a company that will make a difference in people‚Äôs lives.   SUMMARY The Regional Sales Director - (Southern U.S.) is responsible for driving sales, inspiring and motivating a regional sales team while collaborating closely with sales leadership and commercial stakeholders to develop an integrated strategy for success.  The RSD will drive the execution, business results and budget of the region‚Äôs sales objectives. This position provides strategic and tactical leadership for field sales, collaborates with cross-functional team members, and aligns across functions to execute the plan and accomplish results.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  Ensures sales region meets/exceeds sales goals and other key deliverables  Expert at tactical planning and execution Develops mechanisms and execute on processes to regularly monitor and track sales performance/ progress, including development of budget and use of resources Strong coaching and leadership skills Maximizes organizational talent. Hires outstanding talent; oversees and coaches direct reports in the field to ensure optimal results.  Develops others.  Helps facilitate and support professional development of sales team members to both maximize results and prepare team members for future opportunities within the organization. Develops and leads business planning to ensure sales results, including during product launches  Cultivates strong business relationships with national and regional key opinion leaders Key account management and development Supports other commercial efforts, such as hospital system initiatives and payer, access, and distribution strategies. Develops a process to obtain timely and informative field insights that influence marketing strategy and training plans Works in close partnership with cross functional partners including Sales Management, Marketing, Operations, Medical, Regulatory, Customer Service, Finance and Human Resources to meet timelines and achieve business results  Ensures compliance with all laws, regulations and policies that govern the conduct of the company Demonstrates high ethical and professional standards, and demonstrates company values consistently with all customers and business partners  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: MBA preferred.  Bachelor's degree required  KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS: Proven track record for consistently meeting or exceeding financial and/or other quantitative targets Demonstrated ability to successfully motivate, develop and coach others. Strong strategic agility with ability to manage & shape both short- & long-term sales strategy Initiative, creativity, and the ability to manage change and work effectively in a complex, rapidly changing environment. Requires strong communication skills and ability to manage several priorities  Ability to navigate cross functionally and strategically leverage relationships to achieve business results  Knowledgeable about the industry and customers to make decisions and drive team performance  Knowledge of regulatory guidelines and requirements specifically relating to promotional activities in the pharmaceutical industry Highly motivated, intelligent individual with strong project management, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills  Candidate must have a minimum of 12 years of pharmaceutical sales/ marketing or life science experience.  Two plus years of direct management experience preferred.  PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Neuroscience background (call points neurology and/ or physical medicine and rehabilitation) preferred  Product focus on biologics, expensive therapies, or injectables Product launch experience preferred Alliance experience a plus Experience managing territories with large geographies  ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Ability to travel requires attendance at business meetings, time in the field with sales team, medical conferences or working with key customers. Anticipated travel: 50-60%  To perform the essential functions of this job, candidates may be required to register with government authorities and complete trainings as well as credentialing with industry services, which may require specific background screens, drug testing and/or proof of certain vaccinations.  COVID-19 vaccination is required.  Successful Candidates Demonstrate Saol‚Äôs Values Trustworthy ‚Äì We believe that the foundation of trust is truthfulness, transparency, and fairness. These principles will be the basis for all our interactions. Focused on Patients ‚Äì We will anchor our decisions with full consideration of their impact on our patients, believing that in doing what is right for them serves a higher purpose. Passionate ‚Äì We enjoy working hard, but are not one-dimensional, being curious about the world around us and striving to be continuous learners who surround ourselves with others who inspire and challenge us. Nimble ‚Äì We embrace new and promising opportunities while adjusting quickly and efficiently to the inevitability of change. Entrepreneurial ‚Äì We create value through our focus on providing solutions, drive to deliver results, and our ability to work together in solving business challenges with integrity.  Compensation Saol Therapeutics is prepared to offer a competitive salary, bonus, and equity, as well as career advancement opportunities.  Apply or Learn More Call and/or email resume to: HR@saolrx.com

I.M. Branded is one of the nation‚Äôs leading providers of facility imaging programs. We are a full-service manufacture of fixtures, furniture and graphic products specializing in the retail automotive segment with OEMs and the dealer network. Given our growth we are currently in search of a National Sales Director to support our current workload. This is a challenging role that is accountable for the success of the company by building and maintaining relationships with new and existing clients. This is a great opportunity to join a growing company with a World class work environment!  The ideal candidate possesses excellent leadership skills and a thirst for success to make a measurable difference to company performance. The role requires well-articulated communication skills to build a strong market position and gain additional market share. The National Sales Director would be responsible for the day-to-day management of the sales account staff. This position directs all sales activity and collaborates with marketing to ensure retention and expansion of services to clients. The National Sales Director will develop sales plans and forecast and make recommendations for product development. This will be a key position on the executive leadership team and answer to the Chief Operating Officer.  The National Sales Director will also grow into new sales channels beyond our current automotive niche. Strong experiences in the retail segment will allow for a smooth transition into this new sales channel.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS (include But Are Not Limited To) Establish and maintain a national sales team that exceeds company growth targets Collaborate with senior management to identify, strategize, and target new accounts and opportunities within the region. Build and lead a high performing sales department. Prepare and manage strategic sales plans to meet short and long-term objectives and goals. Ability to build and develop an online sales channel that will drive future sales. Coordinate all aspects of the sales process from prospecting through sales presentation. Develop and manage annual Sales budget, including quotas and compensation plans. Hire and oversee account managers and direct their growth by assigning new target leads and ensure they are maintaining existing relationships. Ensure employees in Sales are trained, measured and coached in executing sales process. Provide accurate forecast and reports to measure performance and results Collaborate with Chief Operating Officer on setting pricing strategy and production capacity. Organize the workload to center around growing the company and suggest improvements to the processes as necessary. Effectively and efficiently manage the daily needs of accounts by working with Sales Support and Strategic Account Management. Sustain an in-depth knowledge about the furniture industry such as where the market is headed and determine what is required to remain ahead of the company‚Äôs competition. Ability to prioritize multiple projects and deadlines Minimum Qualifications Undergraduate degree in Business or related technical field 10 years of experience in a sales leadership role Demonstrated track record of growth and success Experience in sales in the commercial furniture industry and/or specialty graphics industries Ability to communicate effectively across a diverse customer and vendor base Proficient in Microsoft Office Ideal Candidate will be located or willing to relocate to the Metro Detroit area Preferred QUALIFICATIONS MBA Experience selling into the retail automotive space (dealerships) Strategic planning, business case development Proven track record of building/growing a National Sales Team WORK ENVIRONMENT Approximately 30-50% business travel required General office setting Minor exposure to the sounds of a variety of shop machinery (saws, etc.) With more than 25 years in business, iMBranded specializes in helping automotive dealerships maximize the impression of their facilities on their clients. State-of-the-art technology, refined installation processes and direct relationships with the world‚Äôs top automotive manufacturers give iMBranded the ability to provide OEM-approved graphic and millwork solutions to thousands of dealerships across the country. Unmatched attention to detail, and a company culture built on minimizing disruption during installation, make iMBranded the industry leader and, quite simply, best in class.

We‚Äôve been creating a new category in hospitality for the last 6 years through our proprietary self-pour systems. Our company is experiencing explosive growth for the last 12 months since accepting an investment from the largest beverage bottling company in the world. We made the 2021 Inc 5000 list_ of fastest growing private companies in the US and Forbes identified us as the Next 1000 companies to keep an eye on in America. We've also been profiled on CNBC, Bloomberg, Entrepreneur Magazine, CNN, Thrive & Cheddar. Now we‚Äôre searching for a high level Sales Executive/ Leader with at least 5 years of proven results to lead us into 2022 and beyond.  Compensation: Based on hitting agreed targets, your combined (Salary + Bonus) compensation will be $200,000 and $300,000/ year. Like most growth stage companies, stock options will be part of the compensation package as this role will be instrumental in the company‚Äôs future.   This role requires someone who is passionate about Sales. They will build, lead, and motivate a world-class team. This person will have a proven track record of growing sales organizations through structured training processes backed up with consistent follow-up and management. Some of our blue chip customers include Whole Foods, Dave & Busters, Hilton and many more growing brands that are embracing the #SelfPourRevolution. Our technology allows guests to pour their own beer, wine, and cocktails and pay for what they pour, by the ounce. Whatever they pour, automatically appears on their tab and they can check out by just dropping their RFID card connected to their tab into a box. Self-Pour is 400% more efficient than any other method of selling beverages and decreases operating costs by 50%. It‚Äôs a game changing evolution of the hospitality industry.  If you‚Äôre someone who loves to sell and wants to grow your already-excellent leadership skills while working with a collaborative sales culture, then you‚Äôre perfect for this role.  Why Join Us  You‚Äôll get a chance to put your skills to work and be a key part of building a $100M company over the next 3 years. How many people can say they‚Äôve done that? Only a very select few. Do you have what it takes to be that 1 out of 100M? If you do or someone you know does, please share this with them.  You‚Äôll be responsible for: Hiring, training, and managing a high-performing, goal-crushing sales team Leading with charisma and a strong work ethic Investigating new tools to propel greater productivity and sales performance Build and manage daily/ weekly/ monthly/ quarterly KPI‚Äôs Assist in building knowledge base and training tools to onboard new team members Modeling out budget for Sales organization Daily calls with sales team to move rocks and give clear direction Organizing weekly Sales Meetings with ongoing learning as well as contests Sharing wins and losses with leadership team weekly Forecasting sales numbers 6 and 12 months away and recording their accuracy Pipeline Management Working with Marketing to ensure we‚Äôre utilizing Hubspot to its full potential Reporting numbers to marketing and leadership regarding qualified incoming leads and leads we‚Äôre creating through other initiatives Selling! Of course! Knowing the product, inside and out  Also Important: You love inspiring others with enthusiasm You have a never-say-never attitude You love to travel You take Initiative You LOVE WINNING  The following experience is relevant to us: 3+ years of sales experience 2+ years of management experience A proven track record of overperforming Experience using CRM software to optimize sales performance Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills

Leclerc is a family business with 115 years of experience, tradition and know-how passed down from people with heart. Thanks to our 1,200 employees in eight plants in Canada and the United States, we are constantly innovating to exceed the expectations of both small and large appetites.  Position Summary  Reporting to the Senior Sales Director of Drug/Dollar/Grocery/Mass the National Account Manager (NAM) will be responsible for the growth and success of our sales in the Breakfast Bars, Nutritional Bars, Snack Bars, Cookie and Cracker categories in the above channels through the continued development of existing business and development of new business as well as management of strategic customers and other named accounts. The NAM will be a key contributor in helping set strategies and objectives for annual sales and strategic plans. Also, he/she will initiate, promote, and align strategy and achieve the sales objectives with the selected accounts located in the NAM‚Äôs assigned territory and/or customer base. The position is home office based in the United States with considerable required travel.  Responsibilities Develop strong relationships with Key customer contacts at designated accounts; Foster and enrich team relationships with our customer base within assigned area; Manage sales and promotional strategies aligned with company mandates; Target new business opportunities as directed and/or agreed upon with Sr Sales Director; Develop new techniques and plan growth strategies for achieving all the corporate sales objectives; Prepare sales forecasts and strategic planning for these customers; Negotiate and conclude agreements and contracts with these customers; Exercise leadership in managing accounts and their projects under his/her responsibility by improving the degree of client satisfaction in order to generate more revenues; Collaborate in the introduction of new products; Work in close cooperation with existing teams to ensure strong communications and to propose solutions tailored to each situation or customer; Responsible for effective account leadership and managing the day-to-day activities through timely communication, effective daily sales/reporting activities, including promotional activities, correcting out of stocks and tracking competitive activities to proactively anticipate trends and their repercussions on the market; and Continue to show added value and why Leclerc is a preferred vendor to our customers. Requirements Hold a Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field of study; Have 5-10 years of private label sales experience or retailer headquarter experience; Experience and knowledge of complex private label sales process, strategic and conceptual selling, forecasting / planning, project management, negotiation and relationship-building with multiple functions at the client level; Experience calling on and developing Private Label prograns with, Whole Foods, or other grocery customers; TEAM Player; Self Starter with the ability to work out of a home office; Knowledge of private label technical characteristics; Highly Organized; Timely and Focused follow up with customers on outstanding items; Strong strategic thinking and process development skills; Strong English oral and written communication skills; Above average ability to use Microsoft Office Functions (Powerpoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) as well as enterprise systems; Ability to create an effective presentation; Experience using Customer Relationship Management Software; Knowledge of SAP a plus; Excellent judgment, strong sense of ethics & integrity, result oriented; Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and adapt quickly to change; Ability to create presentations and other sales tools to help achieve your goals; Road Warrior- willing to travel as needed, sometimes up to 3 weeks per month; Demonstrated ability to: Define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions; Work within or lead multidisciplinary teams to work on product development; Use personal effectiveness to link relationships, processes, and business methodologies with revenue-producing activities. Working At Leclerc Is Earn a competitive salary Enjoy cookies at will Benefit from a comprehensive benefits program Save on our products Embrace high velocity technology

description: This position is remote; However, preference for candidates based in California/ Pacific Northwest *** With more than 600 Sales professionals in offices around the world, our Global Sales Team ensures our owners and operators receive the combined benefits of scale, access, competence, and experience. Our Sales teams are fully engaged in providing a differentiated selling platform for our portfolio of brands. We focus on being the most global, integrated, and relevant salesforce in the industry, relentlessly driven to grow market share. Our global sales team is consistently recognized as a top-selling and customer-service-focused organization throughout the industry. We conduct business in 42 languages serving 25,000 customers in 119 countries from offices located around the globe. This ensures that the team truly understands the unique needs and opportunities of regions worldwide, right down to the local level.  What will I be doing?  The Director of Sales Luxury Group will be responsible for identifying, developing, and handling accounts to drive revenue and market share growth for our luxury portfolio of hotels while contributing to the account growth for Hilton. We will depend on you to drive performance through internal and external development. In addition, the Director will be committed to overseeing a portfolio of accounts focused on luxury group business, which includes account qualification and compliance to account governance protocols. You will ensure the client‚Äôs day-to-day needs are met while identifying viable opportunities for deliberate initiatives designed to improve operational and financial performance. You will need to have a deep knowledge of customer procurement strategies, structure, and businesses in alignment with all partners within Hilton. Maintain and collaborate on account planning strategy to facilitate growth. Aggregate client opportunity -based growth data and evaluate areas of potential growth. Anticipate client needs and actively develop an approach that is tailored to each client. Highlight account-based trends on a regular cadence for weekly, monthly, and annual basis, and compare data with previous years' results to benchmark & support continued growth. Get results through customized solutions. This includes serving as a subject matter authority in luxury brands and closing the sale with clients. Ensure revenue targets are achieved. This involves forecasting accurately and delivering revenue monthly, quarterly, and annually for luxury hotels & resorts. Generate leads and mine opportunities within existing accounts to drive incremental revenue. This includes networking and forming positive partnerships with business decision makers and executives to encourage positive buying behaviors. Understand industry trends that impact customer buying behaviors and offer creative solutions. This includes engaging in relevant industry organizations. Plan, implement & conduct all follow up for sales trips & customer engagement, including expense reports and recaps. Accessible, responsive, and consultative to our partners: including, Clients, Owners, Brands, Colleagues, Hotels, and Sales Support. What are we looking for?  We believe the success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills: Critical thinking and both quantitative and qualitative analytics skills Well organized, deeply focused on details & able to manage a productive pipeline autonomously to meet goals Self motivated and high level of positive energy and drive and a work demeanor that exhibits flexibility, drive, good judgment, and dependability Outstanding time management skills Ability to handle multiple priorities, work well under pressure Complete discretion and confidentiality regarding sensitive information Strong customer service and communication skills (verbal, written), while employing diplomacy with high-level executives and customers within the organization on a global scale Highly collaborative mentality with ability to positively add value to engagement, internally and externally Strong negotiation skills to maximize value for internal and external partners Problem solving skills to resolve issues effectively and creatively while maintaining flexibility, professionalism, and integrity To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications: Seven (7) years of professional experience Three (3) years of managerial experience Above property national sales experience OR experience with a minimum of two (2) hotels including a convention hotel of 700+ rooms or a role covering a cluster of hotels Luxury sales experience In-depth knowledge of the Hospitality Travel industry Experience handling and maintaining all travel/expenses to remain within budget Available to work outside typical business hours Travel up to 40% It would be useful in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: BA/BS Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or MA/MS Master‚Äôs Degree Ten (10) years of professional experience Five (5) years of managerial experience Three (3) years of experience managing national and/or global accounts Experience using Salesforce International Travel Experience What is it like working for Hilton?  The future of hospitality is bright at Hilton: a leading global hospitality company with a diverse portfolio of world-class brands. Dedicated to filling the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality, we have welcomed more than 3 billion guests in our more than 100-year history. Hilton is proud to have an award-winning workplace culture, and we are consistently named among one of the World‚Äôs Best Workplaces.  We support the mental and physical wellbeing of all Team Members, so they can Thrive, thanks to innovative programs and benefits such as workplace flexibility, career growth and development, and our Go Hilton travel discount program. Hilton prioritizes understanding and integrating our Team Members‚Äô unique perspectives and voices‚Äîalong with those of our Guests, Owners, Suppliers, and Partners‚Äîto cultivate a diverse and inclusive environment for all. Check out the Hilton Careers blog and Instagram to learn more about what it‚Äôs like to be on Team Hilton!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We will ensure that qualified individuals with protected disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions of his or her role, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  For Colorado applicants only: The annual salary range for this role starts at $120,000 and is based on applicable and specialized experience and location. Hilton offers its eligible team members a comprehensive benefits package including medical and prescription drug coverage, dental coverage, vision coverage, life insurance, short-and long-term disability insurance, a 401(k) savings plan, paid time off, and our travel discount. Subject to plan terms and conditions, you will be eligible to participate in the Hilton Sales Incentive (Bonus) Plan consistent with other team members at the same level and/or position within the Company.  Work Locations  Hilton - Shared Services - McLean  Schedule  Full-time  Brand  Hilton Corporate  Shift  Day Job  Job Level  Director  Job  Sales and Marketing

through channel partners Communicate partnership strategy through an integrated communication plan to leverage promotion across all applicable channels Handle any local sponsorship initiatives as to lift up to 50 pounds, set up and tear down marketing materials.  Cambria offers a competitive benefits package that encompasses Health and Dental Insurance, Paid Time Off, 401(k) plus matching, Discretionary Profit Sharing, Flexible Spending Account, Life, Supplemental Life, and Disability Insurance, Referral Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Employee Discount and Professional Development Assistance. description: About The Team  The Zillow Advisor Team (define) works with sellers to help unlock life‚Äôs next chapter through our sell to or sell with programs. Our Advisors are licensed real estate agents who operate across our 25 markets supporting Zillow Offers.  About The Role  The Senior Director of Sales, Zillow Advisor Team, will lead the inside sales team's continued growth while driving operational excellence in a complex business environment. The role is passionate about driving metrics, developing leaders, and building a world class sales organization from top to bottom. This leader will have between 3-5 Senior Managers as direct reports and an overall organization size of 200+. The role is at the forefront of everything we do in Zillow Offers, our ibuyer product and the strategy of the team will hinge on the expertise of this leader. You will be challenged to think like an entrepreneur while partnering with numerous teams across the enterprise.  You will Be responsible for the acquisition goals for the B2C sales team Lead a team of Senior Managers across 25 total markets Partner closely with multiple teams to drive customer experience Create an environment for all to thrive in This role has been categorized as a Remote position. ‚ÄúRemote‚Äù employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.  In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $177,100.00 - $282,900.00 Annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.  Who you are 10+ years of sales leadership experience (5+ leader of leaders with large scale teams) History of working in B2C space in high growth environment Demonstrated track record of developing leaders and talent across the organization Track record of using data to drive decisions Experience working and communicating with multiple stakeholders and cross functional teams including marketing, operations, tech partners, and frontline operators Ability to exceed all metrics as outlined Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations A customer obsession In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for variable incentives and/or equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.  Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life‚Äôs next chapter.  As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow¬Æ and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it ‚Äî and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune‚Äôs 100 Best Companies to Work For¬Æ List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC‚Äôs Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.  Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

The company is developing a pipeline of carbon credits through real-world projects and creating a brand to market carbon credits.    Role: As the first dedicated sales hire, you will play a critical role in setting up our boutique retail and enterprise go-to-market strategy, helping create and implement a process for selling to retail and enterprise buyers.  Growing the customer pipeline through outreach and other sales tactics Creating and managing all assets needed for internal and external business development and sales conversations Assisting in the creation, maintenance, and distribution of sales content, including marketing materials, meeting materials, and RFPs Own and organize business development related relationships in a CRM system  Build strategic relationships with internal and external stakeholders in service of achieving business development goals Develop a network throughout the industry to increase Flow Carbon‚Äôs exposure and business opportunities.  Qualifications: Technical understanding of the voluntary carbon market, carbon offsets and the main certification bodies governing the market (i.e. Verra and Gold Standard). 3+ years of experience with a proven track record in sales and/or business development focused on carbon credits or other environmental commodities Experience with prospecting and closing new business and interfacing with senior-level decision makers Ability to collaborate with customers on their sustainability and carbon goals Collaborative leader with excellent communication and presentation skills Team player excited to collaborate on an early stage venture growing fast Proven ability to develop and maintain effective work relationships, and influence both internal and external stakeholders Strong research skills and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to learn about prospective partners or our industry Ability to gather and leverage data to develop relevant strategies, then bring a plan to fruition with seamless execution and attention to detail  This is a unique leadership opportunity on the ground floor of a well-funded startup in a rapidly evolving and incredibly exciting space. To apply, please send your resume to hiring@flowcarbon.com with ‚ÄúDirector of Business Development & Sales‚Äù in the subject line.

description: The Vice President of Sales and Marketing will be accountable for making sales directly, building out and leading the sales team to meet and exceed sales goals, and developing and executing sales strategies that drive revenue for COPE Health Solutions, and its subsidiary, Analytics for Risk Contracting (ARC) through defined products and solutions. The VP will also oversee the marketing function and staff, ensuring that thought leadership, website and public relations are supporting targeted sales efforts.  The VP of Sales and Marketing will also work closely with other executives to drive strategic sales and marketing direction and resource allocation for the company, serving as a resource and provide sales and marketing strategy, structure, support and education to all COPE Health Solutions team members, board members, clients and other key stakeholders, as appropriate.  Position Description: Close on sales, hitting or exceeding sales targets, which includes developing strategies for developing business, managing key client relationships, and leading sales team to further grow sales, as team is built out Advise team members and independent contractors on making sales and working on related areas such as thought leadership, website and PR Create a culture of success and ongoing business and goal achievement Directly engage in and support the team in the successful cross-sell of various lines of business and services to existing clients Optimize sales and marketing process and tactics; define optimal Salesforce structure Develop, recruit and manage the sales and marketing teams, operations and resources to deliver profitable growth Manage budget and provide detailed and accurate sales forecasting Define and oversee sales staff compensation and incentive programs that motivate the sales team to achieve their sales targets Define and coordinate sales training programs that enable sales and marketing staff to achieve their potential and support company sales objectives Manage customer expectations and contribute to a high level of customer satisfaction Compile information and data related to customer and prospect interactions Research and monitor customer, prospective markets and competitor data to propose strategies to introduce firm services to new or expand in existing markets Establish successful support, channel and partner programs ‚Äì leverage and grow existing channel partner relationships cultivated to date Manage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunities The VP of Sales must be willing to travel extensively as needed in order to generate necessary sales. Must be able to effectively manage sales processes at the client and company level and support team members while maintaining excellent client rapport. Create opportunities for firm experts to showcase their technical expertise, past accomplishments, current work and firm successes, as well as to ‚Äúget in front of‚Äù key decision makers and influencers in target clients Undertake and maintain an inventory of all SME, vendor, partner and other sales pipeline potential relationships and build into national and state-by-state business development plans to achieve growth roadmap goals Leverage existing tools such as Salesforce, Kimble and our website, and build out additional useful tools, processes and systems to improve firm visibility and generate leads. Tools to be developed and activities include but are not limited to: Thought Leadership: ¬ß Case study frameworks ¬ß Technical white paper frameworks ¬ß Outline talking points for presentations by SMEs ¬ß Generate requests for external articles (published in leading periodicals) ¬ß Rapid Policy Analysis Account Lead Alerts ¬ß Health Insight and Blog/Online Articles Marketing: ¬ß Update and optimize website to generate leads ¬ß Various materials (e.g., one-pagers, company overview) Proposal Development: ¬ß Framework for proposal development and RFP responses ¬ß Ensure consistent description of services and outputs across proposals, contracts, deliverables and marketing materials Branding and Communications: ¬ß Identify and optimize national/regional events and sponsorships ¬ß Day-to-day announcements and press interactions Travel extensively, as needed, to generate sales  Qualifications: Advanced degree in an applicable field (MBA, MPH, MHA) strongly preferred 10-15 years of sales experience and a strong history of sales revenue achievement for related health care consulting, software and services A strong understanding of the health care industry, analytical thinking skills and a strong and dedicated work ethic are required Able to work collaboratively and effectively while handling multiple projects on various timelines in an extremely fast-paced environment Excellent oral and written communication skills Flexible with work hours, able to travel, and be able to work evenings and weekends  Benefits: As a firm passionate about health care, we‚Äôre deeply committed to the health and wellness of our own team members. We offer comprehensive, affordable insurance plans for our team and their families, and a host of other unique benefits, such as a yearly stipend for wellness-related activities, and a paid parental leave program. You can learn more about our benefits offerings here: https://copehealthsolutions.com/careers/why-cope-health-solutions/.  What We Do: COPE Health Solutions is a national mission-driven consulting firm that partners with health systems and payor clients. We provide our clients with the tools, services and advice they need to thrive in the current complex and uncertain pluralistic payment environment and achieve visionary, organizationally relevant results. Our firm has expertise in all aspects of population health, strategy, delivery system development, payment systems reform, workforce development and population health management support services, including peerless analytics and performance improvement. We are driven by our passion to help transform health care delivery, align financial incentives to support population health management and build the workforce needed as health care moves to value-based care.  The Analytics for Risk Contracting (ARC) Suite provides a powerful array of analytic and reporting tools designed to achieve optimal value and performance for organizations currently in or planning to move to risk-based arrangements. Leveraging our extensive, hands-on expertise in helping IPAs, ACOs and health systems achieve successful outcomes in risk contracts, our team of managed care experts draw insights from the analytic outputs that are tailored to each organization‚Äôs unique circumstances to interpret the data and recommend initiatives to help improve total cost and quality.  Our multidisciplinary team of health care experts provides our clients with the experience, capabilities, and tools needed to plan for, design, implement and support both the development and execution of strategy and developing solutions to some of the industry‚Äôs most complex problems. We partner with our clients through aligned mission and financial incentives to pursue performance excellence in a challenging and rapidly evolving health care environment.  To Apply: To apply for this position or for more information about COPE Health Solutions, visit us at https://copehealthsolutions.com/careers/open-positions/.

description: SLM Solutions is a leading provider of metal based additive manufacturing technology, commonly referred to as 3D printers, utilizing selective laser melting powder bed fusion technology. Our 3D printers are designed to produce parts directly from a variety of metal powders. The customers for our metal based additive manufacturing systems come from various industries such as aerospace, energy, healthcare, and automotive. Headquartered in L√ºbeck Germany, SLM Solutions has approximately 420 employees worldwide.    POSITION DESCRIPTION:    The Vice President Sales, Americas will be responsible for:  Leading the commercial go-to-market strategy and execution for the Americas region within SLM Solutions.  Ensure that you and your team have exemplary understanding of our customers and maintain excellent long-term customer relationships. Lead a team of direct sales managers and channel partners within the region and provide regular feedback, coaching, mentoring, and leadership.  Exceed market growth with our equipment, services, and consumable revenue streams. Establish sales quotas for each sales manager and actively manage the America‚Äôs sales pipeline. Follow the sales management process and sales processes within SLM while actively drive activity management, opportunity creation, pipeline management, and closing business all to be tracked within the CRM system. Develop a regional business plan while inspecting each sales manager and channel partners‚Äô business reviews. Create annual and 90-day rolling forecasts and ensure execution and accuracy. Establish and manage Key Customers relationships within the Americas‚Äô region. Make recommendations on coverage strategy and regional investments/changes. Take action to ensure the achievement of the overall business objectives within the Americas region. Provide feedback to the Product Management team on wins/losses, opportunities, and market trends. Work and communicate with your cross-functional partners within the region and global organization.  Establish lean and efficient processes that focus on driving profitable revenue growth.  CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:  Required Education and Experience:  Prior successful sales management and leadership experience of 10+ years B2B capital equipment sales management experience Additive manufacturing/3D printing experience a plus Strong technical skills that help facilitate conversations and results with our solutions Strong sales skills, enjoy selling and winning new customers for our high-tech products Convincing communication skills and decision-making ability for both the development of long-term customer relationships and the achievement of goals within SLM Willingness to travel extensively within the region and globally, up to 75% Valid driver‚Äôs license and good driving record Hiring process includes background and reference checks which must have satisfactory results Must be authorized to work in the United States, the company will not sponsor applicants for work visas  OUR COMPREHENSIVE BENEFITS PACKAGE INCLUDES:   Diverse, global, growing organization in a trend-setting industry Competitive compensation Medical, dental, and vision insurance Short-term and long-term disability insurance Critical illness, cancer, and accidental injury insurance Life Insurance 401K with company match Flexible & Health Spending Accounts Work from home office  SLM Solutions NA, INC. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. SLM Solutions NA, Inc. participates in the E-Verify program for Employment Eligibility Verification.
