description: Head of Sales  JourneyTrack.io is looking for a Rockstar Head of Sales who loves working with enterprise clients, has a passion for customer experience, and wants to be part of the founding team that will take this company to valuations of over $500M.  JourneyTrack.io is a customer-centric start-up SaaS company that was incubated at Key Lime Interactive, a leading customer experience/user experience consulting firm. Over the last 18 months, we‚Äôve developed the best-in-class enterprise CX product with feedback from clients like Google, Amazon, and more. In June we officially launched and are currently nearing the end of our public beta. Our clients love the product as it solves many of their issues with creating, governing, and democratizing customer journey maps across the organizations. We have been wildly successful and already have a growing list of F100 companies using our product.    What You‚Äôll Do:  Working alongside our leadership team, develop and drive our sales strategy  Hire, manage and coach a team of SDRs, enabling them to exceed their quotas consistently Develop new/existing clients relationships Lead sales for key clients/deals Run weekly 1-on-1s with each direct report to help them overcome roadblocks and chart their long-term career growth Monitor team KPIs and proactively identify the actions that your team members can take to improve each month Demonstrate a ‚Äúnever quit‚Äù attitude and instill tenacity and resilience in your team Analyze team performance data to suggest scalable improvements to core sales processes and sales training  Maximize revenue per lead  Foster a transparent, inclusive, and achievement-oriented team culture  About You: At least 3 years of experience managing a team selling to enterprise F500 clients At least 7  years of experience in a quota-carrying sales position for SaaS products or working at an agency with enterprise clients You have a robust and active portfolio of CX/UX/Marketing contacts to tap for new business opportunities as well as industry insights, trends, and referrals. You can demonstrate a track record of overachievement against individual and team quotas. You have examples of SDRs you‚Äôve coached from underperforming to high-achieving. You instinctively document the training, team-building, and sales process plays that work and shares them with your colleagues to drive improvement across your organization You have strong empathy for peers, direct reports, and customers You have excellent communication skills and the ability to motivate behavior change You‚Äôre adaptable and open to changing processes when it‚Äôs right for your team, your organization, and the customers you serve  Benefits and Perks: Work at home, with travel to visit clients as needed 15 PTO days per year, on an accrual basis Stock Options Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision Flexible Spending Account Health Savings Account Basic Life Insurance Long-Term Disability Short-Term Disability  JourneyTrack, Corp is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, or military or veteran status in accordance with federal law. In addition, JourneyTrack, Corp complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. JourneyTrack also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws.  Apply for This Job

As a global organization, our teams around the world push boundaries and think beyond what is expected. Together our teammates are unified by our values and are grounded in our vision to inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed but can‚Äôt imagine living without.  Position Summary  The Regional Director is a key leadership role in our retail field organization, who will make an instant impact to the business, by taking full responsibility of their assigned region to execute strategic regional plans to achieve sales goals and be a liaison for information at all levels of the retail field department. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Proven ability to handle multiple tasks and differing priorities in a constantly changing and demanding environment using excellent organizational, communication, negotiation and scheduling skills. Strong working knowledge of recruitment network in region. Strong business acumen and skill set which enables the management and development of staff. Relocation  At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Evaluates all activities for each retailer to ensure support across categories to ensure activities will support sales goals. Provides guidance on inventory to negotiates stock & sales plans. Develop promotional calendar for North America, that includes brand programing, promotional, basic business, and dot com activations Budget ownership of advertising spend for accounts, in-store visual budget, digital spend, GWP‚Äôs/samples, markdowns, and returns,  Owns implementing visual presence in store, in market and on retailer.com Works closely with marketing on assortment, allocations, sampling, sets, exclusives, and gifts tailored to retailers‚Äô customers. Provide reporting and analyses to support sales, and other activations    QALIFICATIONS: 5+ years of related experience with proven success BA required; MBA preferred Inspiring and engaging interpersonal skills with the ability to work with people in various disciplines and cross-functions as well as present to senior leadership Strategic thinker and able to lay out a cohesive and clearly articulated strategy to drive the brand Must be a team player and a self-starter adept at problem solving Must possess strong collaboration and influencing skills to translate strategic objectives into sales-driving action Expertise to translate shopper insights and unique retailer strategies into key action steps Passion for digital and driving omni-channel sales strategy  Strong business acumen and financial ability (i.e., P&L management, business drivers, building new channels/growth, savvy with standard business analyses) and analytical thinking  Clear and concise written and oral communication skills as well as engaging presentation skills Domestic travel - when appropriate

description: We are an exciting start-up with proprietary technology that we plan to install in bars and restaurants to provide our service to the largest sports gambling companies in the country. We are looking for a National Sales Director who will build new sales teams in each state as we expand our operations and manage all aspects of the sales organization. The ideal candidate has experience selling into the bar and restaurant environment as well as in sales team management and sales analysis.

About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.  TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.  We are looking for a consultative sales leader to join our newly formed Global Accounts Team. The team will play a critical role in establishing and leading strategic partnerships between TikTok and the world's largest advertisers. This team is consultative in nature and will lead the long-term growth of each global account. The Global Account Lead will own and nurture C-level and senior business brand-side relationships and partner with TikTok's regional and local market General Managers to drive platform growth.  Our Global Account Lead will act as the strategic ambassador responsible for building TikTok's reputation and revenue for a top global brand. The Global Account Lead will anticipate the business needs of the largest advertisers, deliver measurable solutions, be proactive and anticipate business needs and opportunity areas, and shape new marketing approaches with their brand clients. They will steward industry level thought leadership in marketing and media, work cross-functionally and collaboratively with the Consumer, Content, Product and Revenue business units to drive organizational KPIs and be passionate about inspiring creativity and joy among our marketing partners around the world.  The ideal candidate is deeply passionate about cross-functional account management, proficient in high level strategic thinking and local market enablement. This role requires the ability to work across different time zones and cultures and bring a philosophy of client-centricity to the role both internally and externally. The successful candidate is a builder, intellectually curious, creative, entrepreneurial, resilient, comfortable with ambiguity, strong in strategic thinking and has deep experience leading through influence.   Key responsibilities  1. Build and shape the vision, global strategy, approach, coordination, engagement planning and success metrics for a global account. 2. Generate incremental revenue and help increase existing direct revenue from our top global accounts 3. Build a 'ground up' comprehensive business plans, global in nature and local in execution, that will drive top line revenue growth 4. Develop and maintain C-level relationships to expand our presence, and educate and inform on the power of TikTok's platform 5. Work with regional sales leadership to establish/set strategic objectives and goals that maximize business impact 6. Regularly consult with local/regional sales leadership to enhance brand and product level positioning and engagement in their markets 7. Sustain close communication and alignment with clients and local sales counterparts to maximize client strategies and engender trust and collaboration 8. Communicate global account strategies with internal stakeholders (regional GMs & local sales leads) while driving local and regional consideration 9. Partner with the internal Global Agency team and their key decision makers in order to drive collaboration and synergistic advancement at the global account and broader agency level. 10. Work collaboratively with the partner Global Agency Team to help drive 360 planning 11. Represent TikTok at key client and industry events, as a delegate and or speaker Qualifications Preferred Qualifications: 1. BA or BS degree 2. 10+ years of relevant global account management experience in client side marketing, agency, have run a global business for a platform/publisher, or have a media sales and/or consulting background with strengths in pitching and negotiating 3. Experience working cross-functionally, both internally and externally 4. Experience managing global marketing agendas across multiple markets and cultures 5. Extensive strategy development and consultative skills among sophisticated brand marketers 6. Truly global experience operating at global networks or with global brands in previous roles and have deep understanding of cultural nuances by countries, cultures, and languages 7. Strategic with strong analytical skills; experienced using quantitative and qualitative data, and can storytell to bring action to analytics 8. Driven as well as entrepreneurial with a strong sense of personal organization and project management abilities 9. Creative thinker, problem solver, and passionate about going beyond benchmarks 10. Thrive in creative and content environments requiring right-brain creative thinking 11. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills that will be showcased while working with internal and external leadership  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at accommodations@tiktok.com.

description: Job Description and Information: Surfacide provides an evidence-based, automated UV-C hard surface disinfection system that data indicate eradicates multi-drug resistant organisms including Coronavirus, C. diff, MRSA, VRE, CRE and Acinetobacter. Our approach is different. The Surfacide Helios system implements multiple emitters that allows us to disinfect all areas of the healthcare environments in a single cycle including the bathroom.   The Regional Sales Director is responsible for all of the commercial activity, execution and results of the assigned territory.  Responsibilities Lead all sales efforts and responsibilities within the defined region, including strategic accounts, Integrated Delivery Networks ‚ÄòIDNs‚Äô and key VA‚Äôs subject to approval Responsible for consistent outbound prospecting to generate leads and develop funnel with new customer deals Assists in the development of the sales plan to meet target growth and revenue goals of region. Manage to regional quota. Cross-sell supplemental products within existing customers and new opportunities  Develop strategies for launching new accounts and upselling into existing accounts. Lead targeted campaigns to convert current users of competitor technology. Collaborate with both internal stakeholders and clients to provide guidance on best practices to sell and implement UV Technology. The end result should be that Surfacide personnel are recognized as best in the industry for a comprehensive and clinical approach to the implementation of UV technology. Become a subject matter expert on UVC and the Surfacide technology and lead the sales and marketing efforts in a professional manner to achieve desired sales results. Collaborate with Implementation Specialists to coordinate aspects of system implementation during evaluations and sales installations, onsite with the customer and project team. As required, respond to requests for customer support for the use of Surfacide. Set appointments, present clinical and technical information, and be present to drive utilization of the equipment. Provide feedback and input to help the organization improve and make informed recommendations regarding effective, efficient operations and processes. Attending regional or national tradeshows, association or other meetings or venues for promotion of Surfacide. ¬∑      Develop and execute regional strategies with key strategic partners. Perform all other duties as assigned or required  Qualifications Must live in the Greater Seattle Area Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 3+ years' of experience in sales Experience in healthcare is a plus Strong leadership skills Willing to travel Experience in Capital Sales, Medical Sales or Healthcare Industry is a plus

Roles & Responsibilities:  Partnerships / BD Establish the Sales & BD department, with the intent of growing and hiring a team Identify, secure, and maintain enterprise customers and strategic partnerships in line with Company objectives Working closely with Product and Marketing teams to ensure that all information is customer-friendly, accurate, and supportive of our branding / messaging  Commercialization Ensuring customer success at launch, including seamless customer service set-up and launch logistics Establish and build salesforce, including setting metrics / KPIs for compensation and defining the structure of the organization  Product & marketing Acting as a liaison among software/hardware, marketing, and partners/customers to ensure customer feedback is incorporated into design choices Working with marketing/design teams to create marketing materials /campaigns tailored to specific audiences Working with PR to craft pitches and stories at each product stage to generate buzz and support partnership and consumer interest  Key Qualifications Seasoned sales/BD, prefer experience in pharma/medical devices, 5+ years of sales, business development or partnering experience Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and follow-through Must be able to travel 30% time (post-pandemic) Experience meeting quotas and/or Management by Objective (MBO's) targets

At Goal Zero, an NRG owned company; our mission is to empower people with a bright, safe, connected, and sustainable future by delivering smart, portable power solutions designed for everyone, everywhere. As the market leader in portable solar power, Goal Zero solar panels, power stations, and accessories give a new breed of consumers and outdoor enthusiasts the power to go farther, regardless of their gear‚Äôs battery life. We invite you to join our adventure.  Goal Zero is looking for a Director of International Sales to lead revenue and profit growth in countries outside of the United States. Primary focus will be working with our international distributors and operations teams to significantly increase sales revenue and margins across both developed and under-developed markets. This person will oversee a team based out of our Utah HQ, as well as in Europe and potential management in the APAC region.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities  Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Lead and hire distributors in numerous countries to maximize revenue and points of distribution across our Yeti Ecosystem line of products (portable power stations and solar panels) Highly effective in presenting to outside sales teams and merchants Quarterly review of individual distributors, including regular assessment of specific retail/B2B targets Work closely with Sales Operations to ensure a high level of customer service for our international partners Provide quarterly product and financial forecasts across international markets Ability to sell high-priced retail items up to $5,000 Work with Marketing to develop key global assets Collect, analyze, and communicate feedback from buyers, retailers, and distributors Run annual distributor meetings to communicate product launches and company strategies Partner as a team player across internal departments to execute and complete new item set ups, optimize retail assortments, and ensure best-in-class execution of seasonal product launches Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Ability to work and succeed in a sales environment with multiple teams/priorities Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business or a related field and/or equivalent work experience required 5+ years of international sales experience Fluency in additional languages a plus, but not required Skilled in analyzing inventory/sell thru reporting Solid understanding of ‚Äúretail math‚Äù Ability to train individuals in technical products, and simplify to sell Proficient in all aspects of Microsoft Office ‚Äì notably Excel and PowerPoint Physical Requirements/Working Conditions Open office environment Trade show set-up, tear down and weekend work as needed to fulfill job responsibilities International travel up to 40% may be required Occasionally requires lifting up to 50lbs Position located at Bluffdale, UT Headquarters Additional Details And Benefits  We aren‚Äôt just a company but a team of passionate people who live life to the fullest, with a shared desire to help others do the same. We‚Äôre mountain bikers, skiers, and climbers, world travelers and weekend warriors, technology mavens and creatives, moms, dads, soccer coaches, volunteers, and everything in between. We rely on our products to power the things that matter most in our own lives and are proud to stand behind them.  Benefits include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, 401K Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Parental Leave, Tuition Reimbursement, and more.  #CB-ZC  Goal Zero is committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. EOE AA M/F/Protected Veteran Status/Disability EEO is the Law Poster (The poster can be found at http://www.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf)  Level, Title, and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant's experience or skills.  Official description on file with Human Resources.

description: Description  Hi, we're UserZoom! We help companies get the user experience (UX) insights they need to deliver great digital experiences at scale through our all-in-one software platform and professional services teams.  We believe that every company will soon be a digital experience company, and we want to help make those digital experiences better. We do this by providing UX insights to some of the biggest brands in the world so they, in turn, can improve the experience they give their customers.  Check out more info here: www.userzoom.com  As our Senior Director, Sales for North America, you will manage a team that is focused on driving new logo acquisition across Enterprise level companies. Targeting some of the largest brands, you will lead your team to build go-to-market strategies, you‚Äôll coach and drive them so they consistently meet their targets.  Other Responsibilities Include Developing in-depth knowledge of markets and competitors Establish sales objectives by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for regions and territories; projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products Directing marketing efforts by presenting market research and suggesting strategies to expand market research Requirements  Here's what we're looking for: 3+ years of successfully leading an enterprise high-performing, vertically aligned SaaS sales team You‚Äôll be a strong, people-first leader, able to lead and build effective cross-functional teams Proven experience successfully building, implementing and driving sales processes Proven ability to coach and up-skill a sales team You'll be willing and ready to continue your learning and able to quickly embrace UserZoom's value proposition Exceptional Relationship management skills, used to build both internal and external relationships Ability to strategically plan, develop and enact long-term growth strategies Benefits  Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy as part of the UserZoom family: 15 PTO days per year, on accrual basis 10 Paid Holidays & up to two 2 Floating Holidays (dependent on hire date) Your birthday off! 401k, with match Stock Options Health Benefits: Medical, Dental and Vision Medical: UZ pays 90% for employees Dental UZ pays 100% for employees Vision: UZ pays 100% for employees Up to 75% for dependents Flexible Spending Account Health Savings Account Commuter Benefits Basic Life Insurance Long- Term Disability Short- Term Disability We seek insight from all people  At UserZoom, we're all about recognising the insights that different people bring to our company - it's what makes us so successful. We know the value and innovation a diverse group of people can create and that's why building a diverse team is a priority for us, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and perspective.  We're on a continuous journey to improve how we recognise & evaluate each person's skills and how each individual can enhance our culture & values. We are committed to being consistent in how we shortlist, assess, hire, onboard, reward and promote based on merit.

description: About The Team  The Rentals business operates in a strong team-focused environment, working together to provide the best client experience in the industry. At all levels, we work hard, roll up our sleeves, dig in and get work done; resulting in a high quality, consistent, and world-class client experience. We are looking for a dynamic, motivated, and passionate Director of Sales who can help us exponentially grow the Rentals marketplace. This role will report to the Vice President of Rentals Sales and is responsible for the overall performance of the single-family sales organization, including driving sales productivity around new account prospecting by delivering a value proposition through various channels to lay the foundation for deep, meaningful, and long-term client partnerships. This role will be responsible for providing world-class mentorship and development to a team.  Zillow has streamlined the way people search, tour, apply and pay rent for leased properties. Zillow‚Äôs rental listings offer our customers a variety of property types, from s large-scale multifamily complexes, to unique, single family homes. Simultaneously, we provide our valued partners with a complete set of digital tools to help them market their properties, identify prospective tenants, sign a lease and collect payments -- delivering a complete end-to-end online experience.  About The Role  This is a great opportunity to join an innovative company at a time of amazing growth. We are a team of high-energy individuals committed to helping Zillow Group users make smarter decisions about buying, renting, owning and selling homes. Specifically, the single-family Rental sales team works with owners and operators of rental properties throughout the US, helping to connect rental shoppers with the property they will next call home.  You Will Get To Own, develop, and lead all aspects of sales, sales strategy, and personnel development spanning every level of the single-family rentals sales org. Focuses on implementation of consistent and high-quality sales output; excited to get into the details, roll up sleeves, and push improvement through ongoing iteration. Monitor and continuously improve metrics focused on revenue, sales velocity and closing ratios. Facilitate process standardization including, but not limited to, activity metrics, sales process, and operational cadence. Collaborate with internal partners to shape and endorse the direction of supporting project initiatives. Excellent at leading teams through change in a hyper-growth environment. Grow and develop a sales culture with a focus towards a growth mentality. Obsessed toward our sales team‚Äôs employee satisfaction, leads an org focused on positivity and continual improvement, is not afraid to set big goals and has the leadership to align focus to achieve them. World-Class Leadership: At Zillow Group we hire standout colleagues, you will need to be one to win in this role. Effectively communicates ZG Rental‚Äôs value proposition through presentations, industry events, executive meetings, and sales proposals. Please note: Candidates being considered for this positon must reside in one of the following states: Washington, Oregon, or California, This role has been categorized as a Field position. ‚ÄúField‚Äù employees perform the majority of their work in the field, not at any specific corporate or other office location. Employees must live within reasonable commuting distance of their designated ZG office. ZG has not defined a reasonable distance, and expects employees will use judgment in determining this for themselves and understand the implications re: time commitment and cost of daily commute.  Who you are Proven sales leadership experience including implementation and ongoing management of goal setting, accountability metrics, and pipeline management. Flexible, with the ability to lead large scale teams, cross-functional responsibilities, and priorities in a fast paced, growth-focused and time-critical environment Proven track record to train sales teams on leading a complex sales process that may include multiple decision makers and influencers as well as transactional sales process that may include a single decision maker. Ability to communicate, present, and influence multiple levels within an organization, including at the C-level with extraordinary communication skills, both oral and written. Qualifications 10+ years sales leadership experience ‚Äì ideally across a range of sales & product environments, including organizations that combine a large outbound sales team with an outside sales team to drive growth. You have significant experience leading multiple sales organizations of 20+ representatives and leaders. The position requires 25-35% travel to meet with industry decision makers in corporate marketing as well as at divisional and national levels. Transferable Skills  Here at Zillow - we value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. We encourage you to apply if you have transferable skills or related experiences.  In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for variable incentives and/or equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.  Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life‚Äôs next chapter.  As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow¬Æ and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it ‚Äî and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune‚Äôs 100 Best Companies to Work For¬Æ List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC‚Äôs Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.  Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

description: Who We Are & What We Do  At Choco, we have the ambition to become one of the largest and most successful businesses of the next decade. Our mission is to reduce food waste on a global scale by redesigning the food industry's global value chain. The first step towards realizing this mission is our food-supply ordering platform connecting restaurants and suppliers and simplifying the way food is traded between them.  Founded in March 2018, we have already raised one of the largest series B of the last 5 years (Total raised $171.5M). We are backed by top VCs such as COATUE, Bessemer Venture Partners and Atlantic Labs, as well as startup leaders and entrepreneurs who have built companies such as Google, Facebook, Amazon, Uber, SoundCloud, DropBox, and Delivery Hero.  WHAT WILL YOU DO ?  Our Head of Sales, US is a crucial component to ensuring the US region meets its growth goals for this year. You will work directly with the US General Manager, hiring, building, and scaling our sales teams to unprecedented levels. You will lead our city expansion teams to increase market share, setting ambitious targets, serving as a strategic leader, creating layers to the sales leadership, as well as mentoring and coaching sales managers.  WHY JOIN US?  You will join one of the fastest growing teams at Choco, our US region. Our team is made up of a diverse group of individuals from across the world who share our mission in redefining food systems to positively impact the food industry.  We believe in hiring from within and promoting talent so, as the business continues to grow extremely fast, you will be given the opportunity to develop and grow alongside it.  You will be given ownership over various projects and give the opportunity to lead a number of critical projects.  WHAT DOES THE JOB ENTAIL?  Owning the success of our city expansion teams to achieve ambitious buyer growth goals, driving direction and strategy while thriving and adapting to change  Leading and managing sales managers and in turn ensuring the success of each sales person in the region  Hiring and developing the next generation of Chocorians to build elite performing teams  Aiding in developing organizational KPIs and OKRs based on evolving company structure and focus  Inspiring and motivating employees to push their limits in performance through positive encouragement and incentive initiatives  Identifying potential problems and points of friction and working to find solutions in order to maximize efficiency / potential revenue streams  Identifying opportunities to expand or shift course in order to take advantage of changes in the market  Requirements  Previous experience in a fast paced/high growth organization. This means being confident in the ability to make decisions under pressure and being able to operate effectively in the face of ambiguity.  A history of excellence. Proven ability to design, build and execute on complex high impact initiatives that have contributed to the success of an organization.  Desire to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to get the job done - we are laser focused on success at a fast pace and you must embody this to be successful here.  "Big picture" thinking. Understanding what are the most pressing needs and leading the initiative to find a solutions that satisfies all stakeholders  Energetic, inspiring charisma. Ability to hype up teams and celebrate the wins together  READY FOR THE CHALLENGE ?  Choco is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Food & Beverages, and Internet

description: About this Role As we scale, we are looking for an experienced sales leader that is excited to help drive growth and create a new category with our retail partners.  We are looking for a Director of Sales with both the experience and the energy to build a strategic plan and execute day-to-day responsibilities such as key account management, forecasting, data analysis, new product launch plans, marketing & trade programs, and in-store execution.  Core Responsibilites  Drive topline revenue growth, new customer acquisition, and same store sales through the creation of channel-specific selling strategies Effectively manage outsourced sales team and broker partners. Drive accountability and motivate the teams to achieve overall sales objectives Build bottoms-up sales targets and achieve company sales goals. Drive and regularly report on key metrics, including ACV, velocity, and customer-specific P&L Optimize selling strategy by providing retailers with a compelling, data-driven rationale for building a new meal-solution based set within Produce Develop quarterly joint business plans to drive performance at key retailers. Understand the retailer‚Äôs needs and build short & long-term strategies that support their goals and Haven‚Äôs Kitchen‚Äôs sales target‚Äôs & financial expectations Build and maintain direct relationships with key retailers ‚Äì positioning Haven‚Äôs Kitchen as a category leader, a source of innovation & consumer expertise Monitor retailer account performance utilizing distributor and syndicated data. Develop action plans to increase distribution, drive velocity, and improve pricing/promotional strategy Work with Finance to evaluate trade spend ROI and sales spend to drive profitability Ensure alignment and work closely with Marketing to develop retailer specific marketing campaigns, leveraging shopper marketing programs, in-store & digital merchandising levers, and HK owned platforms (social, website, email communication) Develop retailer-specific digital merchandising plans to drive e-commerce sales and ensure optimal selling experience across dot coms, including Target.com, Instacart, and Amazon Prime Evaluate field marketing opportunities and ensure third-party partners are delivering on KPI‚Äôs and meeting business needs Own and continuously improve selling tools, such sell sheets and sales decks Maintain and develop a sales forecast, working directly with Operations to ensure alignment on demand planning and product profitability Participate in and lead sales for industry and distributor trade shows Support initiatives to launch innovation and drive distribution of new products  You Are / Have 10+ years of experience leading sales for a fresh food company Produce experience preferred Track record of significant new customer acquisition and driving performance in existing accounts Proven success in developing retailer relationships built on trust & mutual goals Experience selling better-for-you products into multiple sales channels ‚Äì natural, conventional, mass, e-comm and club Experience with a category disruptive, innovation forward brand preferred Reputation for driving performance of and actively managing a team of salespeople & brokers Experience building selling strategies for Kroger.com, Target.com, Amazon Prime and Instacart Strong analytical skills and use a data-driven approach to decision making Effective leader with an ability to motivate others & pivot quickly to meet changing business Strong organizational and cross-functional skillsets. Ability to build process and communicate effectively with other business functions Great communicator ‚Äì you adapt to your audience and effectively communicate across the organization and with external partners Strong attention to detail allows you to closely monitor performance across multiple retailers, meet deadlines, and deliver on aggressive sales goals Reputation for working well with others. You are described as empathetic, curious, and passionate. Cooking and exploring new flavor profiles excites you  What you are looking for... A close, driven team that is constantly communicating and collaborating Competitive compensation in a high-growth startup Full health, dental and vision benefits An environment that encourages and rewards entrepreneurialism and learning An opportunity to build out a team and take a brand from great to amazing

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  Global Strategic Account Director ‚Äì Hospitality  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  The Global Account Director (GAD) is accountable for overall account ownership, developing executive relationships, leading extended account team and growing global account incremental revenue while ensuring highest levels of customer satisfaction. This leader will have responsibility for key global hotel and other hospitality customer accounts. The individual will lead and coordinate across all lines of business and board areas, orchestrating all the businesses around a single, clearly articulated medium- and long-term account plan.  The role is ultimately measured by growth in overall orders, revenue and customer satisfaction.  Key Areas Of Responsibility Overall account ownership Formulate robust strategy, develop and deliver comprehensive business plans to address customer and prospect priorities, orchestrates and owns the medium and long-term execution of the account strategy, incorporating product, software, services, support/maintenance, partners and channels Encourage innovation entrepreneurship spirit among the organization and constantly identify the new business winning opportunities and breakthrough initiatives; Becoming a strategic advisor on company's software, solution and digital transformations. Follow a disciplined and programmatic approach to generate demand, pipeline and opportunities. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve. Ensures the alignment of virtual/global account team to deliver strategic business outcomes to the customer; Leverage support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory. Work strategically to understand the customers business and provide them with new and different ways to push their thinking and provide with market differentiation Develop long term C-level relationships, creates and manages a strong customer governance model and ensures assigned executive sponsor is appropriately engaged Lead integrated account planning and ensures the HBT footprint is expanded with involvement of all relevant lines of business and strategic engagement with customers Drive revenue growth across all HBT lines of business and services Ensure operation excellence, set up rigorous and effective operating cadence, enable tools and performance management; develop and train sales, marketing or any other functions which could contribute to global account revenue growth. Act as Honeywell ambassador and build positive image in local environment and strengthen government relations where applicable with support from Corporate General Affairs YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 7 plus years of experience in combination of Enterprise Software Sales, Key Account management, and Business Development and consistent track record of exceptional software sales results with C-level clients 7 plus years of experience with a proven track record of GLOBAL Strategic Account success with enterprise software and experience managing global and regional software accounts 5 years or more selling into the hospitality industry WE VALUE Ideally B2B experience in technical diversified solution, manufacturing, mixed with digital experience is a plus; industrial/building industry domain expertise a plus Exceptional communication skills and relationship at C level within Global industrial/building technology business; Demonstrable business experience in Sales or Consulting with complex building technology/solutions Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Proven track record in negotiations Excellent leadership & communication skills MBA, Masters degree International experience Adaptable, tenacious and collaborative individuals Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environmen Incentive Eligible  Base Salary Range: $120,000 - $150,000  For benefits information please visit https://careers.honeywell.com/us/en/honeywell-benefits. Current employees may visit HR Direct.  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD137999 Category: Sales Location: 1099 Sneath Lane,San Bruno,California,94066,United States Exempt Sales (HBT)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Job Purpose Summary WishGarden Herbs has built a strong foundation of in-house sales capabilities and is looking to expand and improve, in key account and channel management. The National Sales Director will lead this new development while fostering the ongoing growth of the WishGarden Herbs brand. As a key member of our sales team, strategic contributions will play an essential role. Perform administrative duties, such as preparing sales budgets and reports, maintaining sales records, preparing price quotes and product assortment suggestions, and filing reports. Experience with managing brokers & sales reps on a national scale required. Language Skills: Comfortable speaking about health issues with sensitivity and within DSHEA guidelines is a must. Good oral and written communication skills. Ability to respond to common inquires or complaints from customers with a pleasant tone and demeanor.  Sustainability Commitment: Follow all company guidelines in regard to recycling and reducing waste in our facility Read and follow all guidelines in the company Handbook and Code of Conduct in regard to supporting local business, sourcing guidelines and sustainability practices  WishGarden Herbs is an equal opportunity employer. Strategic & Tactical Conducting market research and know Total Addressable Market for each state in region Develop strategic growth plans around regions specific TAM  Ability to manage a regional budget Cultivating strong relationships with Partners with the assistance of in-state Business Development Managers Work with marketing on lead generation and funnel flow Working closely with staff across departments to implement growth strategies Developing and implementing sales strategies, client service and retention plans Analyzing sales data to inform or update marketing strategies Assist with drafting business plans, sales pitches, presentations, reference material, and other documents as required Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet company sales goals Identify new business opportunities and partners Identify and escalate major blockers from preventing sales growth Collating and maintaining prospect information in the CRM database Know all current sales opportunities Palmetto is offering Sales member NPS tracking Anticipate and manage potential roadblocks  Qualifications 5+ years managing business development teams  Willingness to travel as needed Strong organization and time management skills Friendly and personable demeanor Proficient in Microsoft Office and relevant software  Equal Employment Opportunity Palmetto embraces diversity and is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.  Palmetto is leading our world toward a clean energy future with revolutionary technology, full turnkey sales services, industry-leading logistics, thousands of solar panel installations and an endless passion for all things sustainable. description: If you have a desire to grow with a dynamic company, make a major difference within the organization, thrive on working in a fast-paced environment and have demonstrated experience of rapidly growing a North American Territory from as little as $1M to over $10M in annual revenues, in food safety marketplace, then this opportunity may be for you. Novolyze is a rapidly growing developer of a proprietary platform that helps the food industry significantly improve its ability to produce safer and better food, while ensuring strong compliance with international food safety and quality standards. We have an immediate opening for a Director of Business Development for the North American territory. To learn more about Novolyze please visit www.novolyze.com  Job Description The Director of Business Development will be responsible for cultivating new customer opportunities in the North America region. He/She will have strong prospecting and strong relationship building skills with a successful track record of selling food safety solutions or _____________. The ideal candidate will possess a strong financial acumen, 5 years or more of experience in industrial food processing, and a successful track record of penetrating and closing enterprise accounts. In addition to direct prospecting and selling to target enterprise accounts, you will also be responsible for implementing, managing and maximizing the success of an Account Management team, holding each accountable to close targeted factories within the enterprise accounts closed. This self-starter will possess a strong work-ethic, be independent, have effective communication skills (written and verbal), excellent questioning and qualifying ability, and outstanding follow up tactics. The ideal candidate is a true ‚Äúhunter‚Äù who enjoys prospecting, follows sales processes, knows how to leverage a CRM, and has a successful track record of rapidly growing the North American territory.    Responsibilities:  ‚Ä¢ Develop targeted short term and long-term North American territory plan to drive rapid sales growth for Novolyze. ‚Ä¢ Proactively prospect targeted enterprise accounts for our innovative Food Safety solutions. ‚Ä¢ Consistently exceed Novolyze monthly sales KPI‚Äôs. ‚Ä¢ Effectively qualify prospects, evaluate the prospect‚Äôs top 3-5 pain points, capital expenditures and revenue potential. ‚Ä¢ Identify and implement independent Channel Partners in the North American market. ‚Ä¢ Manage and maximize the sales productivity of Account Managers in the North American territory. ‚Ä¢ Effectively work with our sales engineering team members to develop strong technical and business requirements for qualified opportunities. Work with our team to develop detailed proposals. ‚Ä¢ Frequently provide accurate North American monthly, quarterly, and annual bookings projections. ‚Ä¢ Use our CRM to record all prospecting and account activity daily.  Requirements:  ‚Ä¢ A result driven professional who is highly accountable. ‚Ä¢ Excellent territory development abilities. ‚Ä¢ Exceptional questioning and qualifying skills. ‚Ä¢ Outstanding problem-solving abilities ‚Ä¢ Strong financial acumen, 5 years or more of experience in the North American industrial food processing or manufacturing. ‚Ä¢ A successful track record of penetrating and closing large enterprise accounts. ‚Ä¢ Outstanding communication skills. ‚Ä¢ Strong writing skills and professional proposal development skills. ‚Ä¢ Work within the designated market with a willingness to travel minimally 60% of the time. ‚Ä¢ Minimally a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field.  Novolyze has a progressive workplace that is competitive, and team focused. We provided competitive compensation plans. In addition, you would receive comprehensive health benefits, 401k, ESOP, and paid time off. If you believe you are very qualified for this position, would be an excellent fit and would like to join the Novolyze team, please submit your resume.

Regional Sales Director                             Philadelphia, PA  Tioga Pipe is a privately held supplier of pipe, tubing, fittings, flanges, and related products in chrome-alloy steel, stainless steel, carbon steel and nickel alloy steels primarily servicing the global energy, refining, processing, and power generation business.  The Company has been in business for 75 years and is one of the top material suppliers for:  Global Power Generation Nuclear Power Oil Refining Gas and Chemical Processing U.S. Military Shipbuilding  Tioga Pipe operates from three Regional Centers located in Pennsylvania, Texas and Tennessee where the inventory is among the largest and most comprehensive in the United States. Our core competencies that support our continued success are professional project management, comprehensive inventory, worldwide mill relationships, quality programs and our unsurpassed experience and market knowledge.  Position Summary Responsible for developing profitable sales growth of Tioga‚Äôs range of products to the Power Generation, Hydrocarbon and Chemical Process Industries through Tioga‚Äôs ‚Äúchannels to market‚Äù. Plan and execute strategic and tactical plans to achieve the assigned sales objectives.  Lead the regional sales team to meet goals and objectives. Sustain and grow the sale of, and market share of, the company's products and services within their defined area of responsibility. Develop new business accounts within their region. Maintain and expand their industry and product knowledge so to be relevant and beneficial to our clients and prospects.  This position requires the ability to analyze current environments, create a compelling business solution complete with detailed financial analysis. Present the findings and have the ability to propose specific technology recommendations to improve current business processes.  The Director must possess a high degree of creativity, organizational and process development skills and have a proven track record of presenting solutions to Senior Management.  Responsibilities Have frequent contact with both internal and external customers. Have the ability to give and receive feedback, recognize and act on customer needs, building rapport and gaining closure. Have frequent contact with other departments, vendors and customers. Possess tact, charisma, and the ability to negotiate. Communicate clear and concise expectations, goals and provide feedback on results.  Have excellent internal communication via phone and in person with company staff, other sales professionals, managers, administrative, support and development personnel.  Interpret, comprehend and apply complex material, data and instructions. Prepare, provide and convey diversified information which may be of a technical nature. Understand that the work has cyclical stress due to monthly goals and deadlines, and daily stress due to the impact the incumbent's decisions have on other people.  Participate in the preparation of the regional and company strategic and financial plans. Lead and develop the sales team to support sales strategies and deliver exceptional, profitable sales growth and results. Identify and build relationships within the regional office to help produce future leaders  Maintain and expand customer base by coaching Regional Sales Representatives; build and maintain rapport with key customers; identify new customer and market opportunities.  Develop a dynamic sales team through coaching, teaching, and mentoring for improved performance. Lead execution of a successful sales cycle and selling the Tioga core line of products/services. By focusing on customer needs, provide market analysis to improve product service positioning and increase effectiveness of the sales team. Proactively assume a role in developing & executing strategies to build an outstanding sales culture. Advise senior management team on sales directions, competitors and market trends. Develop strong ties with key customers and suppliers and be proactive in understanding the trends and issues likely to impact the market.  Execute day-to-day sales management, using a wide variety of techniques, from traditional sales philosophy‚Äôs to highly technical consultative sales techniques. Be able to present a compelling and effective case for Tioga‚Äôs project management, quality programs and supply chain capability.  Recommend and obtain buy-in and implement any changes needed to align the sales organization with our overall strategy. Drive improvements in the sales process and organization to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of team.  Conduct weekly sales team meetings to address concerns & acknowledge individual/ team accomplishments. Manage the sales forecast accurately. Track results and communicate to senior management regional results. Expected to meet or exceed assigned revenue, margin and target metric objectives within the assigned region.  Create and sustain effective collaborative partnerships with all other managers and departments. Interface with Regional Operations Managers, Accounting and Purchasing to provide support and to achieve the overall company profitable growth-oriented revenue goals and objectives.  Responsible for leading the company‚Äôs sales efforts in calls, presentations, demonstrations, proof of concepts, internal training, assessment services and proposals related to our products and services. This involves applying a consultative approach and ability to direct our support resources in analyzing the customer‚Äôs requirements and developing customized solutions to fit the need.  Prepare accurate and timely sales reports. Work with Senior Vice President of Sales to identify and implement new opportunities within major accounts. Drive and coordinate account planning sessions based on revenue potential.  Maintain a commitment to the company‚Äôs sales processes, values and business code of ethics. Assist in resolving any ongoing technical or commercial issues with the customer as appropriate and requested. Protect and increase a profitable revenue stream within current accounts.    Qualifications Requires knowledge typically gained through the attainment of a four-year degree.  5-10 years‚Äô with demonstrated experience leading a sales team with a strong track record in the area of technical sales with experience calling on major accounts and selling high value complex solutions. Familiarity with distribution environment preferred.  Should be self-motivated, competitive and possess outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills with ability to assemble additional technical assistance as required.  Proficient and demonstrable experience in prospecting, qualifying, creating value-based demonstrations and presentations, ability to write and direct proposal preparation, experienced in objection handling and negotiating. Must be familiar with contractual language and provisions, terms and conditions.  Proficient computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite) with data analysis capability.  Strong verbal and written communication skills and excellent listening skills.  Compensation Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Tioga has a fully competitive compensation package including:  Incentive commission program Comprehensive health plans 401K with employer match Life and Disability Insurance  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: With over 160 years of innovation, we are moving faster than ever by introducing new products, services, and strategies to bring greater value to our business customers. If you have proven ability to establish new business relationships, advance your sales career with American Express, one of the world‚Äôs most respected and recognized brands.  The Manager of Business Development's key responsibility is to solicit merchants in southern New Jersey & Delaware to accept the American Express Card as a form of payment from their customers focusing on B2B sales. This position will identify key merchant prospects with up to $300M in annual revenue and implement effective sales strategies and solutions. Managers of Business Development utilize their in-depth knowledge of American Express, the industry and their prospects to provide solutions. Additional responsibilities include: gathering and disseminating marketplace and competitive information, coordinating all internal resources necessary to facilitate each sale, and executing proper account set-up and merchant training.  Successful Mangers of Business Development use their prospecting and cold calling skills to identify, filter and qualify leads to effectively manage a pipeline of prospects. They plan strategically, research and are knowledgeable about the industries and markets they call on. They possess strong analytical, organizational, decision-making, negotiation, oral, written and interpersonal skills. Strong financial acumen is also necessary in order to effectively explain the financial and marketing value of product solutions to close sales. Managers of Business Development must also possess the ability to prepare and present formal presentations and use their excellent consultative solution selling skills to ensure long-term relationship building and meet business goals. A University Degree and 5 years of successful outside sales experience is strongly preferred. Proficiency with PC applications (MS Office, Outlook, Excel, Power Point). Proficiency with Salesforce.com an asset. Working knowledge of related American Express products and services is considered an asset. Knowledge of the territory. Residence in the territory is required with up to 5% overnight travel within territory. Strong financial and business acumen. Self-disciplined and self-motivated to work on own in a home office environment. Experienced in prospecting for leads. Must reside in Southern New Jerey Applicant must have a valid driver's license. A motor vehicle records check will be conducted for all successful candidates at the time of offer. Disclosure of all moving violations within the last 3 years (Including, but not limited to: speeding tickets, refusal to submit to blood alcohol content, reckless driving, leaving scene of accident, and driver‚Äôs license suspension for moving violations) is required during the application process.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

About Weedmaps  Founded in 2008, WM Technology is a leading technology and software infrastructure provider to the cannabis industry, comprising a B2C platform, Weedmaps, and B2B software, WM Business. The cloud-based SaaS solutions from WM Business provide an end-to-end operating system for cannabis retailers. WM Business‚Äô tools support compliance with the complex, disparate, and constantly evolving regulations applicable to the cannabis industry. Through its website and mobile apps, WM Technology provides consumers with the latest information about cannabis retailers, brands, and products, facilitating product discovery and driving engagement with our retail and brand customers.  WM Technology holds a strong belief in the power of cannabis and the importance of enabling safe, legal access to consumers worldwide. Since inception, WM Technology has worked tirelessly, not only to become the most comprehensive platform for consumers, but to build the software solutions that power businesses compliantly in the space, to advocate for legalization, social equity, and licensing in many jurisdictions, and to facilitate further learning through partnering with subject matter experts on providing detailed, accurate information about the plant.  Headquartered in Irvine, California, WM Technology supports remote work for all eligible employees. Visit us at www.weedmaps.com.

description: Our Mission  Backed by top-tier investors, Torch is a fast-growing, mission-driven SaaS startup made up of psychologically oriented people who are passionate about helping leaders achieve their potential. Torch's platform provides coaches, clients, and customers with actionable insights into client and organizational strengths and challenges.  At Torch, we believe leadership matters. The world needs conscious leaders who drive invention, inspiration, and innovation to solve our time‚Äôs most significant opportunities and challenges. Torch exists to create and support these leaders.  Torch is a hybrid remote and distributed team with offices in San Francisco, Buffalo, and New York. Join us as we not only work to empower conscious leaders for our customers but within our internal team as well!  The Team  At Torch, the Revenue Organization exists to create new business opportunities with prospective clients while fostering strong partnerships with our existing customers.  The Director, Sales Strategy and Operations, is a key leader of our GTM Strategy & Operations team and is responsible for accelerating the growth of our Revenue Organization. In this role, you will build and lead the strategy and operations function of our Revenue Organization. You will live at the intersection of marketing, sales, and finance to influence investment and go-to-market decisions to unlock the potential of this channel. Your work will shape our long-term strategy while improving processes to accelerate short-term performance.  This position is a people manager of a small team of direct reports and you will report to the Chief Revenue Officer. We are looking for proven leadership qualities, including influencing and motivating individuals in a fast-paced environment. You will show that you can lead by example to garner trust, gain respect, effectively communicate and encourage collaboration.  Responsibilities You will execute Performance Tracking, Planning, forecasting, and target setting You can identify and unlock growth initiatives by working cross-functionally You will address the most pressing questions from our executive team regarding Revenue You will co-own long-range planning and strategy processes for our Revenue Teams You will act as liaison with finance to drive investment decisions Your Experience - Basic Qualification A BA or BS degree in a business/quantitative field 10+ years of experience in a Strategy, Consulting, or Operations analytics roles Experience managing direct reports Your Experience - Preferred Qualifications Proven track record in Strategy and Operations leadership roles Ability to drive cross-functional groups and initiatives Superb communication and problem-solving skills You can set strategy at a high level and roll up your sleeves to execute where needed You have high energy, a positive attitude, and the ability to take the initiative and delegate efficiently You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, frequently changing, and evolving environment You can multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively towards individual, team, and company goals Torch provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Duties / Responsibilities: ¬∑        Develops a business plan and sales strategy for the company that ensures attainment of company sales goals and profitability. ¬∑        Some Key account responsibility and responsible for the performance and development of the regional Account Managers ¬∑        Prepares targets and action plans with individual Account Managers and for the team for effective search of sales leads and prospects ¬∑        Initiates and coordinates development of action plans to penetrate new markets and opportunity to present value added products and ingredients to existing customers ¬∑        Assists in the development and implementation of marketing plans as needed. ¬∑        Conducts one-on-one review with Account Managers to build effective communications, to understand development needs, and to provide insight for the improvement of CDM‚Äôs sales and activity performance. ¬∑        Provides timely, accurate, competitive pricing on all completed prospect applications submitted for pricing and approval, while striving to maintain maximum profit margin ¬∑        Maintains accurate records of all pricings, sales, and activity reports submitted by Account Managers ¬∑        Forecast long range account sales, and product needs, and communicate related information regularly to management ¬∑        Ensure that customers are satisfied with Company products and services ¬∑        Complete and resolve customer requests, complaints, and problems. ¬∑        Promote products and services at trade shows and organize display material. ¬∑        Controls expenses to meet budget guidelines ¬∑        Attend meetings as required. ¬∑        Adheres to all company policies, procedures and business ethics codes and ensures that they are company by working in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, safe work practices and procedures. description: Nuvolum, an integrated marketing and PR firm headquartered in San Francisco, is seeking a dynamic, top-performing sales executive to join our core leadership team as the Vice President of Sales.  This is a high-visibility, high-impact, client-facing role with internal ownership of account management and business enablement. Responsible for meeting/exceeding sales goals as well as driving all sales-related initiatives for the company, the Vice President of Sales for Nuvolum will build upon our already robust pipeline to match prospective clients with services that will best match their goals and drive results.  What You‚Äôll Do:  For New Business: Serve as thought and action leader for all stages of the sales pipeline Ensure all sales strategies are aligned with the company‚Äôs strategic initiatives, objectives, and vision Lead the sales components of the business in organizational planning, financial forecasting, and budgetary planning Develop, coach, and manage a high performing sales and business development team to expand our portfolio of clients Cultivate a culture of high performance, results-driven action to meet the company‚Äôs growth goals Establish relationships with industry leaders that will lead to sales opportunities and new business  For Existing Business: Build successful and trusted partnerships with our amazing portfolio of clients Assist the Account Management team in driving inside sales initiatives, tailoring our services and campaigns to meet our clients‚Äô needs and goals Establish and oversee client retention targets Work hand-in-hand with the Directors of Account Management and Implementation to ensure seamless hand-off between departments post-sale  Ideal candidates will have ALL of the following: 10+ years progressively responsible experience leading the strategy and execution of company-wide sales initiatives or business development 5+ years experience growing, managing, and scaling sales teams Proven, in-depth expertise in growing sales pipelines with innovation and ingenuity as persistent foundations of its success Outstanding track record of exceeding revenue and growth goals Excellent interpersonal, presentation, negotiation, and communication skills Flexibility to work in an interactive environment with a high tolerance for ambiguity and change Work with a strong sense of urgency in a high-growth, fast-paced environment  About Our Culture  Nuvolum is a full-service, integrated marketing and PR firm that takes pride in everything we do. Our diverse and talented team is inspired to bring ideas forward, keep learning, and provide continuous mutual support. We champion each other‚Äôs successes and lean in when challenges need solving. We foster a team atmosphere and a friendly environment, so every member can rise to the occasion and exceed our clients‚Äô expectations.  While many of our teammates continue to be remote, as a core member of our senior leadership team, we expect this individual will work in-office at our San Francisco headquarters.  Fine Print  This position is located in San Francisco with the potential to work occasionally remote from the larger San Francisco Bay Area. At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis. We cannot provide visa sponsorship at this time. description: National Account Director - Midwest Chicago, IL  Job Description The Family-owned, Chicago based Importer, Winesellers, Ltd., named Importer of the Year by both Wine & Spirits and Wine Enthusiast, is looking for a top-notch, experienced performer located in the Midwest to successfully manage National Accounts, On and Off Premise, across the Central United States.  Qualifications include:  - Reside in major metropolitan area in the Midwest, Chicago or Cincinatti preferred, close proximity to a major airport - 10+ Years‚Äô Experience as a Supplier with ever increasing roles & responsibilities - 5+ Years‚Äô Experience working with On and Off Premise chain buyers; established relationships a must - Strategic thinker that can identify trends and utilize to sell to National Accounts - Experience submitting RFP‚Äôs to various National/Chain Accounts - Strong knowledge and passion for wine & spirits from around the world - Strong relationships with distributor chain teams within Winesellers Ltd. Network a plus - Proven sales record throughout career and ability to lead and influence the marketplace - Advanced knowledge of a variety of business software, including Excel, Powerpoint, iDig, etc. - Experience with Nielsen, IRI, and other industry data sources - Exceptional communication and public speaking skills - Excellent organizational and project management skills - Willingness and ability to travel up to 50% of time Duties and Responsibilities:  - Attainment of Sales & Depletion Goals - Strict Adherence to Company Provided Budgets - Manage the execution of the Business Plan & Corporate Strategy - Travel extensively while staying within T&E budget - Develop and implement National Account pricing, programming, and incentives - Develop relationships with distributor chain managers within Winesellers Ltd. Network - Communicate with Operations to monitor inventory levels - Develop relationships with Assigned National Accounts and Buyers - Develop relationships with suppliers to identify control/private label opportunities - Assist Regional Team with Regional Chain Account Presentations - Develop and Present quarterly business reviews to Senior Management. Salary and Benefits: - Competitive salary and aggressive bonus opportunity - Car allowance and T&E budget. - Benefits package consisting of health, dental and profit sharing. - Paid vacation and personal days The ideal candidate is a highly motivated team player with a strong desire to achieve goals. We are looking for an individual who can take company directives and put them into action without the need for micro-management. The person has to be smart, intuitive, highly-effective, and personally accountable. Passion and determination are critical. This is a fantastic opportunity for a top-notch professional looking to take their career to the next level! Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter.

Complete with rotating art gallery showcases by local artists, lux amenities and upscale accommodations - our property is truly an O‚ÄôHare Oasis.  This position requires a progressive Sales executive, a strong leader who can develop and implement ongoing strategic initiatives that will positively impact hotel revenues and profits. The position is responsible for selling, administration, communications, and inventory management. Sales and Catering personnel development and training are also components of this position. Executive Committee position. ongoing coaching and counseling Maintain established personnel policies and procedures of Hotel Execute one-on-one counseling to all appropriate personnel on selling techniques and closing skills department and operating departments of the hotel to assure awareness of booking and sales programs Maintain timely, responsive communication with accounts and prospects Supportive Functions And
