description: Senior Account Director  Dell Technologies customers expect great things from both our products and our services. Account Services Management is all about managing and overseeing seamless service delivery processes. It‚Äôs a hugely varied field of work. Processes range from incident management to change management, from configuration management to customer management. The team makes sure disputes and technical issues are resolved. We also provide excellent communication to the customer around every activity ‚Äì from the tactical to the strategic.  Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as an Account Services Management Director on our Account Services Management team in the United States (remote).  What you‚Äôll achieve  The Account Services Management Leader is highly skilled at understanding the complex needs of the business, translating its priorities into operational plans, and orchestrating the successful execution of the work to the specified timelines on a consistent basis. You will lead a team of resources enabling them to drive long-term, healthy customer relationships, acting as the bridge between the customer and Dell Technology Services teams. You will provide the customer a single point of contact for the acquisition and execution of services, including deploy, managed, consulting or support services. You will also act as a customer advocate to all Services teams, ensuring that customer needs and expectations are understood and properly translated to operational parameters.  You will: Drive programs and initiatives to evolve the SDE role/team to align to the DT Select concepts and overall Dell strategy  Measure and report on KPI‚Äôs to demonstrate success and establish growth  Integrate the SDE team into the other DT Select CS teams, overall Customer Success teams and cross functional organizations  Develop and execute SDE specific KPIs  Provides complex metrics and reporting support to all relevant stakeholders  Oversees service quality to ensure consistent approach, quality communication and highest level of expertise across all SDE accounts  Builds and sustains effective communications with all stakeholders and cross-functional teams in an effort to maximize the SDE and customer success brand  Build and lead a team of SDEs that leads the largest and most complex delivery of system solutions to customers  Assist the Sales organization in selling services  Drive operational programs  Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here‚Äôs what we are looking for with this role:  Essential Requirements  Executive presence (presentations and building them)  Relationship building ‚Äì tied closely with sales team and customer are paramount to success of this role  Strong influencer ‚Äì drive behavior of entire group that doesn‚Äôt report directly to them (VMware, dell/EMC, consulting, pivotal, secure works, BOOMI, etc.)  Experience leading and managing highly skilled, highly experienced teams  Skilled in selling, delivering and supporting services Building and developing strong teams  Leading teams with a history of consistent success Selling and Deploying highly complex solutions Customer service problem avoidance, escalations and resolution  Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us yours  Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We‚Äôre proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.  What‚Äôs most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.  We started with computers, but we didn‚Äôt stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what‚Äôs next in technology, starting today.  You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.  Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job Description Summary  The GE Healthcare Key Account Organization helps our most strategic customers transform their organizations and ready their businesses for future challenges in healthcare. Our solutions are engineered for the future of healthcare, and span intelligent medical devices, pharmaceuticals, services, data analytics, and digital solutions that are in the cloud. Our team is mission focused and dedicated to helping our customers to create a healthier world with more precise and efficient care.GE Healthcare is seeking a Key Account Executive for two of our most important customers ‚Äì Trinity Health and Community Health Systems (CHS). If you are the type of person who wakes up and thinks ‚Äúhow can I help my customer achieve their outcomes through a healthcare portfolio approach?‚Äù and are not afraid to be bold with a customer, then this role is for you. This role is focused for the Trinity Health and CHS enterprises, and you will represent GE Healthcare's full portfolio of products, solutions, and services to help these key accounts deliver the best patient care possible.In this role, you will have aligned territory Key Account Executives that work on your team to deliver a collaborative strategic vision and plan across all Trinity Health and CHS regions. You will be a strategic leader in GE Healthcare and will report into the VP & GM of National Accounts & GPOs.The Key Account Executive role will require leadership that spans go-to-market strategy development, key account planning and development, executive relationship mapping and alignment, cultivating deep levels of trust, balancing short term and long term sales cycles, and collaborating cross-functionally within GE Healthcare to bring unique solutions tailored Trinity Health and CHS‚Äô outcomes and goals.*This is a remote opportunity available across the continental US GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare.  Job DescriptionJob DescriptionResponsibilities   Drive sales and revenue growth through successful leadership, key account planning, customer experience, and outstanding execution of regional go-to-market programs (sales, service, digital, marketing, product management engagement). Influence an experienced team of Key Account Executives and lead the supporting field roles and resources aligned to Trinity and CHS within their respective markets. Serve as the senior leader presenting to enterprise strategic decision-making bodies to leverage existing cross-modality GE Healthcare relationships to develop and expand touchpoints within the Trinity Health and CHS systems. Build and deepen executive relationships with Trinity Health and CHS regional and corporate decision-making bodies to help influence their long-term technology and business decisions. Add value and be viewed as a trusted advisor by bringing compelling insights and ideas with follow through execution. Lead and manage entire business-cycles, and discuss contracts, terms and understand associated legal and business risks. Influence the GE Healthcare sales methodology/process, drive best practices on selling, forecasting and account management. Coach your team to drive detailed regional focused account strategies to generate and develop business growth opportunities, working cross-functionally with multiple lines of business, maximizing business impact and opening up opportunities that could scale or act as a pilot for corporate pursuits. Outstanding leadership - inspiring interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and effect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù. Foster a GEHC community across the entire account teams aligned to Trinity and CHS, from sales, service, and digital to provide the necessary technical, clinical, and business support needed.  Required Qualifications   Bachelor‚Äôs Degree 8 years of consultative sales experience in a quota-carrying environment focused on customer outcomes and including strategic selling and negotiation Experience engaging with accounts and promoting a broad portfolio of products at the C-level Previous experience in the Healthcare and Lifesciences industry Willingness and ability to live and travel within your specified geographic territory, + 50% travel   Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Why Divvy?  Over the past decade, millions of Americans have been forced to put their dreams of homeownership on hold. Home prices have outpaced wage growth while mortgage requirements continue to tighten. As a result, renters are missing out on a critical wealth-building opportunity: owning a home.  At Divvy, we're building an on-ramp to homeownership ‚Äì one that's more affordable, more flexible, and an overall better fit for the modern American family ‚Äì and it‚Äôs working.  We're hiring a sales leader to help us accelerate our growth. This role is at the center of Divvy‚Äôs business and customer journey. As the Head of Sales you'll be pivotal to the future success of Divvy Homes as you lead and grow our inbound sales team to achieve excellence and reach our ambitious business goals.  The team‚Äôs responsibility is to help our warm, inbound leads understand our program, shop for a home, and close their deals. You have a unique opportunity to re-imagine how Americans shop for homes and leave a lasting impact on thousands of customers' financial future.  We're looking for an inspiring and proven sales leader who can build up our sales org, drive sales process improvements that generate results, and coach and mentor a sales team all while maintaining a performance-driven culture. The right person for this role is a go-getter, curious, intelligent and deeply passionate about their craft. This is a fast-paced role that requires strong leadership, data-driven decision making and interpersonal skills.  You are excited about this role because you‚Äôll be... Responsible for Divvy‚Äôs pipeline to help families purchase their first home - you‚Äôll manage AEs, monitor performance, lead quality, conversions, key sales metrics Partnering with product & engineering to continually seek ways to automate your team‚Äôs job Collaborating with the agent teams to continually uplevel the home shopping process Growing and developing the sales team with ongoing coaching, feedback, and mentorship Building processes to help equip the sales team for success through improving their sales skills, product, and industry knowledge Gathering and disseminating customer feedback to help our product teams deliver a better home shopping experience Driving meaningful change into our customers‚Äô financial futures every day ‚Äì raise the economic floor Writing part of the Divvy story and contribute to this rapidly growing company Work Experience/Skills 9+ years sales experience, ideally at an early-stage company Track record of meeting and exceeding sales goals Exemplify a go-getter attitude and adaptability with a razor-focus on driving results Solutions oriented, with a track record of identifying and implementing creative solutions Strong sales intuition and excitement to build relationships with customers Highly organized, strong work ethic, able to coordinate fast-moving deals The real estate market never sleeps, so we‚Äôre looking for a willingness to work on occasional weekends. The team is in a pod structure with a schedule rotation. You'll be responsible for designing and managing that structure and may be required to supervise and step in on the weekends Energetic, driven, and collaborative teammate This position can be based in any US state. We are a remote company with offices in SF and Denver. Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion  We prioritize a commitment to diversity in our team building process. We enthusiastically encourage individuals from a variety of lived experiences to reach out.
industries: Construction, Real Estate, and Facilities Services

description: National Sales Director (Fully Remote) ‚Äì Growing Engineering and Manufacturing Services Company  Work for an exciting and growing Engineering and Manufacturing Services Company in Southern California. With a great leadership team, incredible employee appreciation and growth opportunities. Look what we have to offer you!  Ideally seeking candidates in the Midwest USA to run all sales nationally.  COMPANY PROFILE: Growing pneumatic conveying systems and solutions company located in Ontario, CA A place where employees can achieve personal and professional growth and satisfaction. Company‚Äôs products are revolutionizing the way a multitude of companies are moving dry bulk materials. Founded in 1969, the company has earned it's reputation as the best source for pneumatic conveying systems and solutions for a diverse range of dry material applications during more than four decades of serving global customers with well-known brands in a broad range of industries.   FEATURES AND BENEFITS: Competitive pay and commission rewards Group medical plan, generous 401K, paid vacation and paid holidays.   THE ROLE YOU WILL PLAY: Are you looking for a new role that you can lead the sales efforts for the organization with an emphasis on growth for the company and yourself?  If that is a yes, please read on!  We are seeking an experienced Sales Director that is familiar with dry bulk material conveying solutions in diverse markets such as food, grain, coffee, dairy, chemical, plastic, nutritional and pharmaceutical. In this critical role you will be main interface with internal engineering, purchasing, and production departments by participating in various after-sale support functions.  Position is home office based and must have a home office set up to effective work from.   Job Responsibilities Include: Support and represent corporate initiatives in specific markets, customers and applications. Build Market success by identifying, developing, and defining Programs and Prospects to meet the company‚Äôs sales and growth goals. Effectively represent the company to its customers, develop relationships with customers, aviation related associations and governmental agencies, support trade shows as required, and communicate with a range of management personnel including program influencers and decision-makers across all customer functional departments. Develop sales strategies and market and account plans and identify, build, and expand sales opportunities for the company's products building on our current market position. Develop and implement account strategies to identify, cultivate and capture medium to long-term sales opportunities in domestic markets. Effectively forecast customer orders and deliveries to support the company's manufacturing and financial planning. Have a complete understanding of the organization's sales and marketing strategies, contractual policies, and technical capabilities and can effectively represent these capabilities in the marketplace Develop sales strategies in diverse markets such as food, grain, coffee, dairy, chemical, plastic, nutritional and pharmaceutical. Reports directly to the CEO   BACKGROUND PROFILE: Expertise in sales field specifically with dry bulk material conveying industry. 10+ years of experience in evaluating, designing & executing a sales strategy within the food, grain, coffee, dairy, chemical, plastic, nutritional and pharmaceutical industries. Familiar with accurately forecasting and managing the sales for a national account focused organization. Experience leading nationwide sales team both internal and external/independent sales representatives. Proven track record of sales results while maintaining excellent internal and external customer relationships within similar industries. Able to travel up to 50%+ of the time. Possess relevant contacts and existing relationships within the dry materials handling industry Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in engineering, business or other related field.

Safetec is looking for an energetic, organized and customer-focused Director of Sales to join their fun, hardworking team of results-driven, creative, and collaborative people! We‚Äôre looking for the right person to lead our sales team - someone to continue developing our talented sales group, and identify new markets, new opportunities, and new sales approaches.  Responsibilities Plan, direct, and set the strategic direction of the sales program to maximize profit Work closely with sales team to achieve consistent sales growth in B2B market Set quarterly and annual sales goals and motivating the sales teams to achieve their goals Direct private label program and project management team Work with the marketing department to design promotional materials for the company's products and services Monitor the market and competitor products and activities and providing detailed sales forecasting Review customer activity, anticipating consumer needs, and improving customer satisfaction Create sales reports and providing feedback to the leadership team at company meetings Establish and maintain key customer relationships Manage employee‚Äôs performance to include reviews and employee discipline issues Interviewing of potential employees Attend trade shows as a representative of the company What You‚Äôll Bring 10+ years of experience in Sales, Sales Management, including planning and execution Bachelor‚Äôs in business, marketing, communications, or management preferred Demonstrated history of meeting and exceeding sales goals Strong analytical skills and great with numbers Demonstrable experience developing high-performing B2B sales team Exceptional communication, leadership, and presentation skills

description: Company Introduction  Eton Solutions is a hypergrowth fintech transforming the Family Office segment of the Wealth Management industry. Eton‚Äôs AtlasFive is a comprehensive enterprise management platform specifically designed to allow today‚Äôs modern Family Office meet the unique and varied challenges of Ultra High Net Worth families.  POSITION SUMMARY (Key tasks and outcomes):  A vice president of sales meets with prospects and manages the sales process from initial prospect inquiry to the signing of the contract and an effective handoff of client relationship to the implementation team. Most if not all of the leads will be provided to this position, so lead generation is not a major requirement.  Primary Tasks/Activities: Handles the sales process from initial prospect inquiry to signing of contract. Develops relationship with CEO, product development personnel, engineering team and implementation/client service teams so they can be used as appropriate in the sales process. Keeps sales management CRM up to date with on activity, including posting of notes from prospect interaction. Lead generation, while important when opportunity presents itself, is not a key aspect of this role Works to ensure that individual and team sales goals are met. Can develop strong relationship with key intermediaries Presents information regarding prospect and sales at weekly sales meetings. Assists, when asked, in designing marketing and promotional materials both in print and online. Fully understands the platform (AtlasFive) and can provide the initial demo without assistance Possesses knowledge of competitive products and markets. Demonstrates patience with reluctant or frustrated clients. description: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  Global Strategic Account Director ‚Äì Hospitality  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  The Global Account Director (GAD) is accountable for overall account ownership, developing executive relationships, leading extended account team and growing global account incremental revenue while ensuring highest levels of customer satisfaction. This leader will have responsibility for key global hotel and other hospitality customer accounts. The individual will lead and coordinate across all lines of business and board areas, orchestrating all the businesses around a single, clearly articulated medium- and long-term account plan.  The role is ultimately measured by growth in overall orders, revenue and customer satisfaction.  Key Areas Of Responsibility Overall account ownership Formulate robust strategy, develop and deliver comprehensive business plans to address customer and prospect priorities, orchestrates and owns the medium and long-term execution of the account strategy, incorporating product, software, services, support/maintenance, partners and channels Encourage innovation entrepreneurship spirit among the organization and constantly identify the new business winning opportunities and breakthrough initiatives; Becoming a strategic advisor on company's software, solution and digital transformations. Follow a disciplined and programmatic approach to generate demand, pipeline and opportunities. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve. Ensures the alignment of virtual/global account team to deliver strategic business outcomes to the customer; Leverage support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory. Work strategically to understand the customers business and provide them with new and different ways to push their thinking and provide with market differentiation Develop long term C-level relationships, creates and manages a strong customer governance model and ensures assigned executive sponsor is appropriately engaged Lead integrated account planning and ensures the HBT footprint is expanded with involvement of all relevant lines of business and strategic engagement with customers Drive revenue growth across all HBT lines of business and services Ensure operation excellence, set up rigorous and effective operating cadence, enable tools and performance management; develop and train sales, marketing or any other functions which could contribute to global account revenue growth. Act as Honeywell ambassador and build positive image in local environment and strengthen government relations where applicable with support from Corporate General Affairs YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 7 plus years of experience in combination of Enterprise Software Sales, Key Account management, and Business Development and consistent track record of exceptional software sales results with C-level clients 7 plus years of experience with a proven track record of GLOBAL Strategic Account success with enterprise software and experience managing global and regional software accounts 5 years or more selling into the hospitality industry WE VALUE Ideally B2B experience in technical diversified solution, manufacturing, mixed with digital experience is a plus; industrial/building industry domain expertise a plus Exceptional communication skills and relationship at C level within Global industrial/building technology business; Demonstrable business experience in Sales or Consulting with complex building technology/solutions Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Proven track record in negotiations Excellent leadership & communication skills MBA, Masters degree International experience Adaptable, tenacious and collaborative individuals Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environmen Incentive Eligible  Base Salary Range: $120,000 - $150,000  For benefits information please visit https://careers.honeywell.com/us/en/honeywell-benefits. Current employees may visit HR Direct.  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD137999 Category: Sales Location: 1099 Sneath Lane,San Bruno,California,94066,United States Exempt Sales (HBT)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Are you excited about solving difficult problems? Kizen is for people who want to accelerate their careers, while contributing to something greater than themselves.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We‚Äôve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before.    We are looking for an Account Executive to join our rapidly growing team. This person will be positioned to help clients achieve bigger goals in ways they never could previously. We are looking for sales pioneers who will pave the growth path for a technology company intent on disrupting the market amongst the biggest names out there.   Key Responsibilities. Harness your inner entrepreneur to take on large entrenched competitors with multi-decade brand recognition Tenaciously identify and pursue new business in a specific industry/geographic segment; unaffected by obstacles Excel in a fast paced environment where you are able to continuously learn and adapt in order to identify new customers Consistently reach key decision makers with ease to close deals quickly  Required Qualifications. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent required 3 years of experience in sales acquiring new customers Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems Passion for selling and drive to build and grow a new customer base  Preferred Qualifications. 5+ years of experience in sales acquiring new customers Experience selling CRM, Marketing Automation, Business Intelligence, or similar   At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life‚Äôs work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

Job Description Summary  As the Oncology Sales Leader - Gulf, you are responsible for leading Cerianna‚Äôs launch in the gulf region. You will be accountable to grow sales revenue, drive coherent product differentiation and commercial strategy for the Cerianna. You will drive commercial excellence in your regional market, as you build and lead an experienced Sales team to achieve the sales objectives of the region. You will be responsible for optimizing resources available to drive market potential by defining and executing a coherent commercial strategy.Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is the number one global supplier of contrast media and molecular imaging agents used to enhance medical imaging exams. Used throughout all major disease area diagnostic and treatment pathways, PDx products support three patients every second around the world. Oncology is a priority care area for us where we see significant growth potential for the use of Molecular Imaging to enable precision oncology. We have a foundation of established proprietary products and now plan to build on this significantly with the development and launch of a growing innovative pipeline of products that will enable better diagnostic decisions and clinical outcomes in oncology. We are also partnering with Pharma Companies and the research community to create companion diagnostic solutions that support patient selection and monitoring through the development of immuno-oncology therapies. These new roles will be critical to ensuring the successful implementation of our strategy, expanded portfolio and the added value offerings of GE Healthcare.PDx recently acquired Zionexa, a leading innovator of in-vivo oncology and neurology biomarkers that help enable more personalized healthcare. We aim to develop and bring to market Zionexa‚Äôs pipeline biomarkers, as well as the recently FDA-approved PET imaging agent, Cerianna‚Ñ¢ (fluoroestradiol F-18), used as an adjunct to biopsy for the detection of estrogen receptor (ER) positive lesions to help inform treatment selection for patients with recurrent or metastatic breast cancer. All Zionexa‚Äôs products are aimed at enabling more precise diagnosis, improved treatment decision-making and ultimately better clinical outcomes for patients.  Job DescriptionRoles and Responsibilities   Accountable to achieve the quarterly and yearly Operating Plan for relevant portfolio in the region (orders, sales, and Contribution Margin, Base Costs, Operating Margin and Cash where applicable), together with, customer satisfaction and retention In conjunction with relevant regional marketing, Modality and regional Sales Force Effectiveness resources, determine the market potential for the region and prioritize the portfolio opportunities; accountable for timely and accurate forecasting of pipeline and sales per the normal reporting cycles, as well as input into yearly business planning. Understand and analyze market dynamics and competition to develop business opportunities for your region. Develop and execute Go-to-market strategy in conjunction with the relevant Modality leaders in order to cover the prioritized potential within the geography; responsible to set appropriate Operating Plan targets based on the market potential, for the members of your team.  Provide business overviews to leadership assess progress to goals. Attract, retain, educate and develop world-class commercial talents to execute on Zone Go-to-market strategy; drive performance management within the team, providing a regular operating mechanism of feedback, coaching, and development; work with the team and drive employee engagement activities to ensure retention across the zone, recognizing success, sharing best practices, providing exposure to people within the team with senior leaders within the region, products and modalities. Role-model to team for utilizing GEHC resources and networks to create and manage opportunities; ensure compliance and execution of the regional sales process and rules of engagement within their teams in conjunction with the regional Account. Manage professional relations with key customers, academia, government & administrative bodies and nurture relationships with professional society stakeholders. Provide Voice of Customers and identify opportunities of continuous improvement. Responsible to communicate, execute and leverage the Variable Sales Incentive plans with their teams and ensure all team members utilize the required sales systems to create pipeline visibility and accurate forecasting.  Required Qualifications   Bachelor's degree  from an accredited university or college    5+ years of consultative sales experience including strategic selling and negotiation Previous experience in the Healthcare industry and/or commercial sales  Desired Characteristics   Master's degree  from an accredited university or college Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Demonstrated ability to lead programs / projects. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills. Healthcare experience, specialty in Oncology Direct and/or Indirect management experience; managing in a matrix organization  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: This position is posted for Houston, but it can also be based in New York or Washington DC.  Job purpose To be responsible for the delivery of Control Risks CORE and + Hyperion global sales and retention activities. This includes all aspects of customer acquisition, sales and account management. This role is responsible for the direct management of our global sales team which includes:  Sales Development Representatives (SDR's) New Business consultants, and Account management and retention  This role is responsible for design and implementation of sales team structure, resourcing and performance management. This will include developing a robust business plan for future resourcing needs to meet and exceed agreed growth targets. This role will be expected to work with Control Risks consulting business to identify new ways of distributing CORE + Hyperion through our consulting business as well as driving direct lead generation of referred business to our consulting service lines.  This role will also work directly with our strategic partners at Geospark Analytics and be responsible for the sales and retention strategy for CORE+Hyperion. Leveraging both companies' expertise and knowledge, the head of Global Sales will be expected to be able to work across both Control Risks and Geospark Analytics teams and senior leaders on a constant basis and form the joint go-to-market strategy.  This role will be responsible for the identification of, and expansion into, future relevant markets / adjacent spaces supporting the aggressive growth plans for CORE + Hyperion. To achieve this the successful candidate will be expected to constantly liaise with the product, development, consulting teams as well as our strategic partnerships.  The role acts as a business partner to all leaders within the product and partnerships organization and will play a key role to helping deliver the commercial strategy of CORE business.  Tasks and responsibilities Drive revenue and achieve growth targets - both new business and retention Ensure our sales teams are optimized to accelerate growth Set sales quotas and compensation structures in conjunction with Partner Online and the Finance Director Sales forecasting, pipeline management to senior management - to include identifying trends, adjustment of budgets to reflect market conditions where possible Responsible for the quality control of all sales team. Ensuring they are appropriately trained and resourced to deliver their specific objectives Work with the Partner Online to lead the wider commercial strategy - pricing / packaging / sales campaigns / positioning. Identify opportunities for growth / addressing regional / sector variances Setting sales methodology and process Direct line-manage regional and functional sales leads Personally manage an active book of business. Directly manage allocated strategic global accounts. Leading by example as an exemplary sales leader and account manager Develop a robust customer satisfaction program for CORE this includes our customer success structure, workflows and process, aligned to that of our partners at Geospark Analytics Represent the voice of the customer to product development Work with legal to maintain the best means of contracting, reducing conversion time and bring revenue forward  Knowledge and experience Deep understanding of Geopolitical or security risk monitoring platforms Deep understanding of SaaS sales to include AI driven intelligence platforms Proven track record as a SaaS sales leader within the security and intelligence market Proven ability to set and manage a high value P&L Proven ability of devising, communicating and implementing successful sales and retention strategies for SaaS products.. Proven experience of product sales management Experience of working closely with senior leaders, acting as a trusted source of advice and analysis Experience of working effectively in a matrix environment and across service lines, regions and independently Proven strong commercial acumen and experience both developing and implementing growth opportunities  Benefits: Control Risks offers a competitively positioned compensation and benefits package that is transparent and summarised in the full job offer. We operate a discretionary global bonus scheme that incentivises, and rewards individuals based on company and individual performance. Control Risks supports hybrid working arrangements, wherever possible, that emphasise the value of in-person time together - in the office and with our clients - while continuing to support flexible and remote working.  As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join us and are fully committed to equal treatment, free from discrimination, of all candidates throughout our recruitment process.
industries: Management Consulting and Security and Investigations

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.  That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.  Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  Honeywell Connected Enterprise is transforming Honeywell into a software industrial leader. This has never been done at this scale before. This is an existential mission for Honeywell and has the full support and backing of the Honeywell Board, CEO, and senior leadership team. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. To make this dream happen, we‚Äôre looking for someone with courage to aim high and with the humility to change as needed. We hope that's you!  Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE) has an excellent opportunity for a Strategic Partnerships Director, based in Atlanta, GA. The position is part of the HCE Strategy, Partnerships and M&A Organization, and reports to Sr Director, Partnerships and Business Development. We are seeking an outstanding leader with an entrepreneurial spirit, a strategic mindset, a passion for software technology, and leadership experience in driving new business development. We want a leader who can help us reach our potential. For those up to the challenge, the scope of this role will likely expand as we double the size of the business. In this role you will drive growth and value to our enterprise software business through strategic partnerships aimed at enriching our offerings, value proposition and scale while acting as a thought leader. This role will be identifying, evaluating, and driving engagements with key strategic partners to deliver long-term profitable growth across HCE businesses. The Director plans and develops strategy with partners that can help create positive customer experiences while increasing revenue. They act as the main point of contact for key external partners and will collaborate with internal stakeholders and partners to accomplish business goals. The Director will follow a defined process to identify strategic partners, assess their alignment with HCE strategy and product portfolio, drive the overall engagement, including creating the business case, outlining technical and GTM elements, negotiating the agreement, and supporting on-going partnership execution until transition to the business owners.  Key Responsibilities Independently drive the commercial process with key strategic partners focused on expanding the application of our technology and customer footprint Effectively manage and execute end-to-end process of sourcing, evaluating, negotiating, and executing those partnerships Able to think BIG and creatively about driving value through partnerships Skilled in value and vision selling to senior executives and technical audiences Develop and nurture senior level partner relationships Work collaboratively with the key internal stakeholders across our executive, strategy, product, engineering, marketing, sales, and other teams to ensure close alignment on partnerships before, during and after deal sign. Develop business models and financial arrangements that are accretive to Honeywell Connected Enterprise, its partners and customers Strong presentation, analytical and executive communication skills YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor‚Äôs degree 5 years of commercial process experience with Software as a Service (Saas) in B2B software offerings for the core HCE markets (Buildings, Industrial, Cyber, Analytics, Aerospace and Defense) 10 years of experience in business development, partnership, strategic account management or management consulting 3 years demonstrated experience assessing market opportunities, building business cases and financial models 2 years validated experience acquiring and selling to partners, pipeline management, negotiating contractual agreements WE VALUE A mix of start-up and larger company experiences An MBA from a top educational institution Strong project management skills Have extensive experience managing relationships and negotiating with a broad spectrum of technology stakeholders An extraordinary communicator with demonstrated writing, editing, and speaking skills A track record of introducing major technological innovations; you are committed to pushing big ideas forward and love questioning the conventional wisdom Passionate about technology that can solve customer problems 4+ years of senior-level experience at an innovative technology company, driving partnerships and collaborations Additional Information JOB ID: HRD138028 Category: Business Development Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Global (ALL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: The Head of Sales will work with upper management to build out sales and marketing strategies for digital user acquisition. This includes working with artists, galleries, and buyers across various geographies. Top candidates will have strong connections to the art markets including fairs, periodicals, conferences, and other venues where art lovers gather. Goals and targets will include increasing brand recognition, downloads, engagement, and user feedback to the technology team. Over time, the Head of Sales will be responsible to build out the international sales and service divisions.  The position can be virtual, but travel will be required, including participation in major art events and fairs across the world. The corporate office is located in Northeast Pennsylvania and occasional travel to that office will also be required.  The compensation package will include a competitive salary, stock options, benefits and bonuses.  Come join a team that has a track record of building and exiting successful companies.

description: The VP of Sales position is focused on developing sales strategy and implementing sales process to scale eHawk by increasing revenue by 100% in the next 18-24 months.  Responsibilities:  Creation and implementation of company sales strategy and process utilizing SalesForce and other tools Oversight of all sales activities Research the market to find criminal justice reform initiatives, press, available public funds, and contact information for elected and appointed officials Researching, developing, and mapping key accounts Recruit and develop sales team members Report progress and forecast revenue growth Pitch, present, and demonstrate the RePath platform Travel for important presentations, meetings, and events  Qualifications: 5 years SaaS sales leadership Startup experience Firm grasp on net new sales strategies, techniques, and execution A track record of exceeding sales goals for the team Experience accurately forecasting revenue Experience managing a pipeline through Inbound and Outbound prospecting Desire to make an impact on criminal justice and our growing company. We are rapidly growing so there is a tremendous opportunity for career growth.  Benefits and Compensation eHawk offers a competitive salary with a full range of comprehensive benefits to full-time employees, including medical, dental, life, long and short term disability, FSA, employer-matched retirement savings and performance-based bonuses.  About eHawk eHawk's RePath is an advanced monitoring platform that leverages the power of the internet and smartphone technology with our proprietary algorithm to create a completely new and efficient way to manage large pre-trial populations of individuals at an extremely affordable price to the local and state governments. We want to revolutionize the justice system and ensure that presumed innocent citizens continue their lives, while giving government officials an easy way to monitor compliance with the terms of their release.

Area Sales Director (Surgical Care, Southeastern US)  Job purpose For Next Science to be the market leader in the development and commercialization of pioneering, proprietary technologies to address the problem of biofilms. Display commitment to deliver these solutions and quality of life improvements to clinicians and their patients through education and consultation while maintaining the highest standards of professional integrity within the industry. ¬∑        Deliver annual target revenue goals for the company by various means ¬∑        Develop and establish the distributor sales team for wound care business within the US market ¬∑        Establish leadership in area to support KOLs, national accounts, and identifying new opportunities within wound care space ¬∑        Develop sales team business acumen and sales core competency  Duties and responsibilities The primary responsibilities of this position at Next Science will be the following: Manage sales activities of current distributor network- to include strategy meetings, travel, training, and key customer meetings Work with VP Sales to set Performance Metrics for all distributors and manage to these metrics Identify new distributors who can add value to the team Manage, develop, coach, motivate, if assigned, Area Sales Representatives to develop their skills to ensure that a high professional standard is achieved and monthly sales and performance metrics targets are met. Manage pricing for all accounts within area Establish necessary account coverage to gain growth throughout all specialties within account Manage relationships with KOL‚Äôs, key customers, health systems and IDN‚Äôs within area Identify opportunities for growth and support with local and regional society and industry meetings Act as Sales liaison for clinical studies within area Attend local and national trade shows as required Maintain consistent communication with corporate marketing and training 50% + Travel   Qualifications  Four-year BS degree required Extensive US sales experience in medical, biotech, and/or device Proven sales leadership with experience leading and/or building teams Track record of successfully delivering sales and demonstrating growth  Next Science is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Competitive swimmers and triathletes, Pam Weekes and Connie McDonald passed their grueling workouts by engaging in passionate conversations about starting their own company and baking, which ultimately inspired them to leave their respective careers in fashion and finance. They opened a small bread shop in 1995, which they named Levain Bakery.    One day, they created an ultimate chocolate chip walnut cookie to give them energy while training for a triathlon. They decided to sell a batch in their bakery, and they flew off the shelves. An icon was born. The cozy shop on West 74th Street quickly became a neighborhood favorite and a destination for epicurious travelers from around the world, hungry for the world-famous six-ounce cookies.   From the start they baked everything fresh on-site each day and donated the day‚Äôs leftovers to charity each night, actions that remain solidly in place almost 25 years later. Levain Bakery now has locations across the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic with more to come, plus ecommerce gift boxes, and delicious bites of cookie joy in grocery stores nationwide.  We‚ÄØstrive every‚ÄØday to embody our company‚Äôs five core values:‚ÄØCommunity, Fun, Integrity, Kindness,‚ÄØand‚ÄØHeart and are excited to welcome new team members to help bring a little piece of Levain cookie love to recipients in New York and beyond!   THE ROLE: DIRECTOR OF SALES CONVENTIONAL  A great candidate will have a deep knowledge of the grocery landscape nationwide, inclusive of broker management, new item sell-in, promotion management, data analysis, and general account upkeep, and ideally will bring with them existing relationships with frozen grocery buyers. This position will report into the VP of Sales, and can be based anywhere in the US.   What you‚Äôll do:  Work collaboratively with the VP of Sales to identify sales strategies designed to grow our MULO ACV, including development and execution of strategies to achieve annual revenue targets.  Optimize relationships with key retailers to promote best-in-category partnership opportunities - pricing and promotions, POS and in-store campaigns, SKU mix, shelf placement, etc.  In conjunction with the VP of Sales and Director of CPG, plan, organize, implement and manage promotional and trade spend initiatives.  Manage a national network of distributors, brokers and merchandisers to ensure delivery of ACV goals in accordance with Levain strategy, mission, culture and values.  Propose the development, adaptation and/or changes to the company‚Äôs current product line based on trade feedback and competitive analysis.   What we‚Äôre looking for:  Minimum of 5 years of experience in CPG grocery sales. Deep understanding of the conventional grocery landscape at every level (Retailer, Distributor, Broker, etc.).  Extensive experience developing and executing highly impactful selling strategies.  Adept at fostering strong partnerships with brokers and third-party merchandising teams while driving growth.  Fluent in Microsoft Office (especially Excel).  Ability to travel, if post-COVID-19 allows for and calls for it.   Demonstrates Levain Bakery‚Äôs values of fun, integrity, community, kindness, and heart.  Humble and service oriented ‚Äì we are all working together to make this happen, and everyone wears many hats.  Passion for what you do ‚Äì you enjoy the process of creating something from start to finish and are motivated to continuously hone your craft and technique.   Adaptability and flexibility ‚Äì you recognize that in the food industry, anything can ‚Äì and will ‚Äì happen and you‚Äôre able to calmly troubleshoot issues.  Eye for detail ‚Äì you‚Äôre meticulous about the items you create and understand the technique and patience it takes to create consistently high quality products.  Collaborative spirit and commitment to Levain‚Äôs core values ‚Äì you‚Äôre a team player and willing to lend a hand or elevate those around you. You add your own individuality to an already positive and uplifting work environment. A good sense of humor doesn‚Äôt hurt either!   Benefits:  Dynamic work environment with a warm and supportive team  Health, vision, dental insurance with employer-funded HRA   Additional supplemental benefits: transit benefits, dependent care account, pet insurance, etc.  Paid time off (after waiting period)  401K with company match (after waiting period)  Opportunity for career development    APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS  Email‚ÄØteam@levainbakery.com;‚ÄØplease write us a note telling us a bit about yourself that is not in your resume, why this position interests you, and your favorite thing to bake. Attach your resume and put ‚ÄúDirector of Sales Conventional" in your subject line.

Required Qualifications   Bachelor's degree  from an accredited university or college    5+ years of consultative sales experience including strategic selling and negotiation Previous experience in the Healthcare industry and/or commercial sales  Desired Characteristics   Master's degree  from an accredited university or college Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs. Established project management skills. Healthcare experience, specialty in Oncology Direct and/or Indirect management experience; managing in a matrix organization  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: (This is a REMOTE Role) First...WATCH THIS VIDEO! Are you a Sales Leader looking to join one of the fastest growing healthcare tech startups that is disrupting the broken healthcare system?  We‚Äôre looking for a Sales Leader who wants to take the next step in their career to own and develop our sales strategy and scale our team. Someone who‚Äôs excited by the challenge of scaling a market leader into new markets. This position is part of the leadership team and reports directly to the CEO.  Breakthrough is the leader in business growth for Physical Therapy private practices through marketing software and services. Our clients have an average annual practice growth rate of 33%. Every month, our system drives over 10,000 direct access patients into our member practices.  Some of Breakthrough‚Äôs recent achievements include: Named Fastest growing company in Physical Therapy space Top 15% Inc. 5000 list 35+ amazing employees (eNPS 97!)  Our people are the heart and soul of our success. We are passionate, dedicated, and driven. Our teammates have the grit to get things done in ambiguous environments, the teamwork drive to put the team ahead of self, and the desire to continue to learn and grow throughout their careers.  If you are passionate about helping people get back to health naturally, and you love to work for a driven company, we want to talk to you!  Responsibilities Build and lead a high-performing sales team that continually executes against a well-defined sales process Create a culture of winning and continuous improvement by attracting, recruiting, training, and mentoring sales talent Develop and implement a sales strategy to exceed revenue targets and expand our growing customer base Develop and implement a proven sales methodology. Collaborate with Product, Customer Success, and Marketing to identify actionable strategies and initiatives that enable accelerated revenue expansion Optimizing how to best work with Demand Gen and Marketing Maintain team accountability and define clear performance expectations through effective pipeline management, attentive people management, and accurate forecasting  Qualifications 5+ years of experience and in a sales leadership role or similar in a start-up environment for at least 2 organizations (preferred) Deep experience building and scaling sales teams, preferably within SaaS across large and small customers in a fast-paced environment Experience with managing all aspects of the sales lifecycle Experience selling a category creating product Enthusiastic and positive leader with a proven track record in building and motivating teams Experience with building high performance teams in a high-growth SaaS company Hands on experience in sales process design and iteration  Why Breakthrough You will be part of a transformative company. Our mission is to help people in pain get back to normal naturally (instead of overusing pharmaceuticals or getting unnecessary surgery).  Other Awesome Benefits About This Opportunity Completely virtual. We don‚Äôt have an office (and never have). We care about your results and impact on the business and want our team to live and work wherever they want. We have an amazing team of incredibly driven people who are constantly learning, growing, and encouraging one another. Amazing benefits, including healthcare, matching 401K, and shares in our employee stock ownership trust. Work life balance environment - we care that you are personally and professionally taken care of.  Our Values = Your Values: This is for you only if you align with our values: GRIT: You are passionate and purpose driven. You are relentless in your pursuits despite failure. Beginner‚Äôs Mind: While you come with an abundance of experience you lust for constructive feedback with our partner ecosystem and employees of all skill levels.  Elevate Others: You have empathy and understanding of other people. You appreciate others being real with you so you can grow

description: Director ‚Äì Strategic Accounts Position Description  Overview MaxOne, the leading digital coaching platform ("DCP") in amateur and youth sports is shifting its sales focus to target College Athletics‚Äô departments and specifically strength & conditioning coaching staff members.  We are specifically seeking candidates with previous strength & conditioning background and experience for consultative selling positions that will become available between September to December this year. NOTE: Academic background and experience as a strength & conditioning or performance coach (preferably at the college level) are sought after qualifications for this role.  The ideal candidate for this position will be someone with a passion for data science and performance improvement of college athletes and understand the critical juncture between retrieving an athlete‚Äôs bio-metric data, interpreting the data and providing customized training solutions so as to improve an athlete‚Äôs readiness to perform, but also improve one‚Äôs general health & wellness for their entire lives.  If you have a passion for sports technology, data science, performance enhancement and how participation in sports is meaningful in developing champions for life, then this may be a position for you. If you have these characteristics along with an enthusiastic drive to succeed we would love to talk to you about our Director ‚Äì Strategic Accounts position.  This position will be a remote work position and will report to the Company‚Äôs Sales Manager.  Each day, hundreds of thousands of coaches, directors, and managers positively impact the lives of millions of athletes through Sports. In addition to coaching skills & drills, these coaches mentor and inspire youth athletes to become young adults with the life skills to excel as they move beyond their time in youth sports.  At MaxOne, our mission is to make coaching available for all athletes EVERYWHERE and to make the lives of every coach volunteer easier by offering the youth sports industry‚Äôs best Digital Coaching Platform (‚ÄòDCP‚Äô) solution to help coaches build and distribute custom training, workouts and coaching directly to player phones, supplementing and enhancing in-person practice & play coaching activities. See more at MaxOne.ai We're looking for people who not only agree with our mission, but have a passion for excellence, building something meaningful and bringing their A-Game EVERYDAY. Become a pro and join a team like us!  Director ‚Äì Strategic Accounts Role and Responsibilities: The primary function of this role is to secure new business for the company working directly with College Athletics‚Äô departments, and specifically strength & conditioning coaches. Execute discovery calls with target personas guiding them to reveal problems and challenges they‚Äôre experiencing related to performance improvement, and applications for technology-enabled sophisticated coaching recommendations based on an athlete‚Äôs bio-metrics data. Execute demo presentations by keying in on customer problem(s) and showing those aspects of the product‚Äôs features and user experiences that address customer opportunities. Do so, in a manner that guides the customer to conclude that their ideal future state (after problem resolution) is achieved by selecting MaxOne‚Äôs DCP offerings. Throughout a thoughtful selling process guide potential new customers to self-define the ‚Äòimpact‚Äô on their organization for addressing and resolving the problems they have revealed and are committed to solving. Be a ‚ÄòProblem Solver‚Äô for the customer. Inspire trust and durable relationships, by proposing innovative solutions for the problems the customer has shared they‚Äôre experiencing. Understand and thoughtfully execute a sales process, leveraging sales automation tools and proven value messaging to achieve a high touch, high quality activity cadence resulting in 50+ customer interactions daily. Support customers directly via telephone, email and social platforms to efficiently secure new business for the company. Own your results. Unwavering personal daily effort standards such that managerial oversight and mentoring is focused on quantifiable daily and weekly goals, sales skills & career growth. Continue to gain advanced product and market knowledge to differentiate yourself and MaxOne as both a technical and business fit for each customer you interact with. Build trusting relationships with the company‚Äôs Business Development Representatives to develop seamless hand-offs and synergy to achieve optimal sales outcomes. Collaborate with the entire sales team to support and facilitate overall success of the sales team. Maintain an accurate daily record of sales activity using HubSpot CRM. Other duties as assigned.  Director ‚Äì Strategic Accounts Qualifications and Skills: College degree or equivalent (Strongly Preferred). Masters degree in Performance Science (Desired) Previous experience as a Strength & Conditioning coach and a desire to interact and support hundreds of strength, wellness, nutrition and performance coaches (Desired) Understand the utilization and importance of data application to the performance and development of athletes (Desired) Have worked and applied athlete development models in the past (Desired) Experience with HubSpot CRM or similar CRM (Strongly Preferred). Being a problem-centric seller (Note: Read Gap Selling by Keenan prior to interviewing with MaxOne). Ability to relate to and understand sport administrators' problems and desired outcomes. Ability to engage with customers and thrive while operating within a hyper-growth fast-paced start-up company environment where change happens at a torrid pace. Curiosity and enthusiasm. Professional integrity. Amazing multi-tasking abilities with consistent and timely follow-through. Growth mindset - view challenges as opportunities and approach every day as an opportunity to improve and grow. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Deliver compelling demos and proposals to effectively and efficiently win sales opportunities Continuously strive to improve and learn from your manager, peers, and colleagues  People Who Fit Our Culture Naturally curious, passionate and have a ‚Äúwhatever it takes‚Äù attitude Fast learners with the ability to grasp new concepts quickly Persuasive, amiable, self-motivated and goal-oriented Enjoy working in a team environment Ability to quickly adapt to changing priorities as required in a high-growth start-up environment Possesses a strong willingness to work hard and put in the extra effort to get the job done A desire to win!!  Why MaxOne? Total Rewards: Competitive salary, stock options and health benefits  Self-Managed Time Off: Awesome people need time off to maintain balance in their lives and to deliver exceptional results. You should take time as you need, when you need it. We offer unlimited time off to empower team members to take paid time off for a variety of reasons, such as, but not limited to vacation, personal, sick and bereavement.  Flexibility: We believe that giving team members a high degree of ownership creates a high performing culture. We trust you to do your work. We don‚Äôt have a set time for you to show up or leave. We have the technology and teamwork to allow you to do what‚Äôs needed, from wherever you need to do it.  Equal Employment Opportunity MaxOne is committed to equal employment and advancement opportunity for all employees and candidates for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religious creed, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, age or marital status in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  About MaxOne MaxOne‚Äôs Digital Coaching Platform (‚ÄòDCP‚Äô) empowers organizations, coaches, and athletes with a digital solution to train, connect and grow together, anywhere. With an increasing list of demands, directors and coaches need to be smarter in the development of their training programs and in the use of their time and resources. MaxOne‚Äôs DCP features cutting edge training tools, creating the most sophisticated and engaging on-demand digital training experience available.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Health insurance stipend Work from home  Schedule: Monday to Friday  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)  Work Location: Remote

About DataCamp  DataCamp is on a mission to enable data literacy at scale by building an interactive data education and personalised learning platform. Since our launch more than 7 million learners around the world have completed 100+ million DataCamp content items, and over 1,500 businesses and government entities worldwide use DataCamp to make their teams and organizations data fluent.  About the Role   As DataCamp‚Äôs VP of sales you will be building, expanding and coaching our team of account executives. You will be accountable for top-line ARR growth, sales playbooks and workflows, and building a team with high talent density. We are looking for someone who has strong integrity, a passion for the learning space, a reputation of building high performing teams and a great drive to succeed. You should have prior experience in scaling a sales team from product market fit - $100 M ARR. You are a data driven sales leader who is obsessed about growth. You have experience building relationships and presenting to C-Suite executives, key decision makers and have a history of closing deals and coaching others to do the same.  What does your life look like:  Lead from the front by assisting the team to win large deals and by continually taking an active role in winning strategic accounts  Drive efficiency in all areas of the sales process, including coaching and mentoring, reinforcing value selling methodology. Use CRM and BI tools to run a real-time business with data driven approach, and coach your team to do the same.  Drive new ARR generation from new targets and new teams across the full product portfolio  Exceed quota and drive a culture of never missing the plan Promote a platform point of view focused on solving strategic business problems for prospects and customers. Be focused on business outcomes. Develop sales enablement and on-boarding programs for a growing team of sales reps in EMEA and NA ( discovery, selling, negotiation and contracting playbooks) Establish the inbound lead requirements needed to meet your sales objectives Establish outbound prospecting motion within the sales team (25% of quota)  To Help Us accelerate, You'll Ideally Have:  Min 10+ years SaaS or technology sales experience with 8+ years experience selling into Enterprise-class accounts $1B in annual sales and bigger.  Hired and developed high performing sales teams You have experience of scaling ‚Äúland and expand‚Äù sales motion Track record of success in quota achievement and closing Fortune 1000 deals You have developed and implemented sales playbooks  Strategic, persistent with an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to be part of a fast-growth scale up environment Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles- demonstrated ownership of all aspects of your pipeline You have brought innovative/market defining products to market You are a data driven sales leader , who can sweat small advantages and scale up  What is in it for you?  A role at the center of a fast growing SaaS scale-up The opportunity to help build upon a brand new team A competitive salary including variable compensation and fringe benefits Professional development budget Stock options Flexible hours International company retreats

description: Renting a home is the world's oldest subscription service. People spend thousands of dollars every month for an experience that is outdated, inconvenient, analog, impersonal, and leaves a lot to be desired. Latch is working to make every building better, and while we've methodically executed this mission since our founding with great success, we're just getting started.  Leveraging our knowledge from companies like Apple, BCG, and IDEO, we‚Äôve rethought how people interact with space. Latch delivers a full-building operating system designed to help owners, residents, and third parties like guests, couriers, and service providers, seamlessly experience the modern building. We‚Äôve done this by combining software, devices, and services into a holistic platform that makes spaces more efficient, enjoyable, and profitable.  The next chapter of the Latch story will be our most exciting yet, and we‚Äôre looking for more talented team members to help fuel our growth.  Latch is seeking a Director of Sales Development to lead the company‚Äôs efforts to develop and expand B2B relationships with the largest national and global real estate enterprises. This management role is responsible for overseeing inbound and outbound sales development in an account-centric model. This leader will develop and coach talent in the sales development team to consistently exceed quota and grow their careers throughout the organization. Opportunities range from the SMB through complex enterprises.  Responsibilities: Hit or exceed team quota for qualified opportunities Cultivate a world-class team, including hiring and development Build strong internal relationships with all GTM teams and key partners throughout the organization Report clear, consistent metrics on full-funnel activities, campaigns, and opportunities Maintain up to date and accurate CRM activity Enthusiastic about traveling to support industry conferences and trade shows, develop new business opportunities, and maintain existing relationships Report to the VP of Growth Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required 10+ years sales development experience (including management) and 5+ year's experience leading enterprise sales or business development teams Strong communication and solution-selling skills, role model, and team leadership skills Strategic mindset, adaptable, energetic, self-motivated, accountable, and results-driven History of exceeding quota while building and scaling teams in a hyper growth environment Real Estate or Enterprise SaaS experience Preferred: Experience sourcing large and complex multi-million dollar deals Highly collaborative and capable of working as part of a team Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously Commands respect via intelligence, knowledge, humility Proven Leadership Experience -- a leader, a builder, a visionary Innovative. The ideal candidate is never satisfied with the status quo... always looking for the next best way to do it Founded in 2014, Latch now has 300+ team members working to make spaces better places to live, work, and visit. Over half of our team members work in product development roles, and our team leverages established expertise in over 55 professional disciplines.  We offer unlimited Paid Time Off, a comprehensive benefits package, mental health support, and an environment where employees are surrounded by creative, empowered, and dynamic peers.  In conjunction with our core values : Contagious Determination, Humility, Trust, Inclusion, Action with Intent, and Privacy, we approach our work with care and a sense of duty, to make the world a better space.  We embrace diversity and strive to create an inclusive and equitable environment for all.  Applicant Privacy Notice

description: Triple E Partners is a boutique professional and executive search firm that provides recruiting services to some of the most well known and emerging companies in the banking, manufacturing, healthcare and retail industries. We are currently searching for a high level executive to join our team.  National Sales Director ‚Äì New Growth  Are you an entrepreneur at heart? Do you have experience growing agency recruiting divisions from the ground up? Triple E Partners is looking for new member of their Executive Leadership Team to help grow a new division from inside out.     Full Job Description: The National Sales Director is a key member of the Leadership Team. They are responsible for growth in the new market/division, formulating plans for entering new markets, starting new client bases, and making their division an industry leader known for agency staffing and recruiting excellence.
