description: Your New Company We‚Äôre creating a home where all brands can thrive. A place where everyone (yep, everyone!) is a part of building beloved brands. Today, Frontify is empowering thousands of different-sized companies around the world, including Facebook, Lufthansa, Vodafone, and Allianz.  Frontify is a scaleup company with over 200 employees, headquartered in St. Gallen, Switzerland, and a growing team in the USA. Frontify is built on a collaborative culture of experimentation, trust, and transparency. We believe in being happy and fulfilled at work, and let our personalities shine through everything we do. Does this sound like the place for you? Then read on.  Your Team They‚Äôre international, motivated, ambitious, supportive, and on both sides of the Atlantic. More than that, they‚Äôre a community of collaborative thrivers who aim to conquer the branding world. Your team isn‚Äôt just driven by commission; it‚Äôs driven by a shared desire to have an impact and grow together.   Your Mission  You‚Äôll be responsible for helping Frontify‚Äôs US team achieve its ambitious sales targets by recruiting, coaching, and driving the US sales team to execute your Sales Strategy. Additionally, you‚Äôll be developing and employing repeatable, transactional processes to sell to SMB/mid-market companies.  You‚Äôll partner with our global outbound team to scale outbound sales, partner with Revenue Operations to ensure data integrity, and collaborate with the go-to-market team throughout. By proactively identifying challenges in the sales team and cross-functionally, you‚Äôll drive the vision of the US Sales team ‚Äì and Frontify‚Äôs US office as a whole.  Does conquering the US market with a best-in-class sales team for a high-growth, international company sound like the next step for you? We‚Äôre looking forward to meeting you.   Your Story You have 7+ years experience working in Global, high-growth, SaaS, scaleup companies ‚Äì bonus points if they were Martech ‚Äì that sell to the SMB and Mid-market communities as well as to large Enterprises.  You have over 3 years of experience successfully building and leading a world-class sales team in the North American market.  Your track record boasts of 100%+ quota achievement ‚Äì both as a manager and individual contributor.  You know a good plan is more than just planning; it‚Äôs execution ‚Äì a strength of yours.  You can work within a strong framework, but you‚Äôre comfortable adapting your playbook to new situations.  You have an analytical mind and experience making accurate forecasts through data. You have a passion for the SaaS Ecosystem and excitement for branding.   Goodies Frontify is more than a dynamic company with plenty of opportunities to build a collective future. It‚Äôs a vibrant, united community that‚Äôll support you as you strike out on your journey. Our office is pretty great (we can‚Äôt wait to show you), although, it‚Äôs our culture of innovation, learning, freedom, and happiness that we can‚Äôt wait to share with you. Our word only counts for so much ‚Äì start the conversation.  Next steps Send us your CV and some nice words: You‚Äôll hear back from us within a week. Virtual call with the Recruiter: You‚Äôll meet the Employee Success team (our fancy name for HR) to discuss Frontify, the role, and you ‚Äì your passions, your skills, you. Virtually meet the team: You‚Äôll meet your new team over a few calls. You‚Äôll discuss the role, showcase your skills through your answers or a case study (or both), and get a feel for the brand new journey that‚Äôs awaiting you. Join us: If all goes well, you‚Äôll join Frontify‚Äôs journey soon.

Join a rapidly growing sales team that has driven significant growth -preferably in the educational technology space.  About the Opportunity Driving new business and growing the company Our ideal candidate will be a proactive sales professional who has the proven ability to repeatedly exceed quota and grow new business in a multi-state region. Success in this role requires the capacity for critical, innovative thinking as well as the ability to build sound business cases and influence others. Key Responsibilities Drive growth by meeting and exceeding quotas and other financial targets and performance metrics. Leadership and Culture Support collaborative relationships with a reputation for high integrity, respect, humility, excellence, efficiency, and thought leadership Contribute to a culture of operating with transparency and collaborative teamwork that focuses on our values of Integrity, Humanity, Humility, and Courage, and a desirable and rewarding place to work  Honorlock Champion Consistently champion the Honorlock brand and values, as well as support community initiatives Continually support Honorlock‚Äôs mission by being a role model internally and externally   Transferable Skills perspectives to achieve an optimal investment outcome Analytical skills ‚Äì Creative and resourceful problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve information gaps, and conduct analytical work to support sound decision making Communication skills ‚Äì Excellent communication, influencing and interpersonal skills ‚Äì ability to work credibly with others and form strong personal relationships, both internally and externally ‚Äì ability to present findings verbally and in writing in a logical, crisp and well thought out manner Intellectually curious ‚Äì Strives to understand the essence of a situation, an industry or a business problem and is open to ongoing learning and development Highly motivated self-starter ‚Äì Desire to ‚Äúbe hands on‚Äù to get the job done ‚Äì well-organized with good project management skills and strong attention to detail ‚Äì anticipates potential future issues and determines the steps required to mitigate any challenges, and seeks help when appropriate Entrepreneurial spirit ‚Äì Passionate, innovative and demonstrates an ability to think ‚Äúoutside the box‚Äù and generate creative approaches  Requirements (skills, software, education) 5+ years of sales in an outbound sales environment with experience selling complex B2B solutions to the education market Proven ability to successfully close complex, multi-stakeholder sales.  Consistent record of exceeding sales quotas Ability to build rapport, uncover needs, identify options, prioritize stakeholder needs, and close sales  Must be able to effectively handle objections and communicate value over price Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word) and customer management tools like salesforce.com Strong collaborator, comfortable working among talented and ambitious peers Ability to get things done, working around system limitations and is resourceful   HonorSquad Benefits An amazing team of friendly and inclusive people who pull together and openly help each other Passionate team members who have fun, work productively and take pride in everything we do We‚Äôre curious to explore new ideas, find innovative solutions and we‚Äôre not afraid to learn as we grow We work remotely We recharge with unlimited PTO Our focus is on team member health and well-being ‚Äì we have a Health Day once a month We offer a comprehensive healthcare program  Honorlock embraces diversity, inclusion and belonging. We believe diverse perspectives are vital to our mission of aligning Humanity and Technology and we aim to make Honorlock a fair and supportive work culture for everyone where people can be their true selves, deliver their best work, and have lots of fun at the same time. We regularly check to make sure we live up to our mission and values. If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please click ‚ÄòApply for this Job‚Äô where you can submit an online application.

aSweatLife is seeking a sales professional who is a self-starter, with a passion for people and wellness who is comfortable setting and achieving big goals. The ideal candidate is excited to work in a start-up environment, is happy to work remotely, and they thrive under pressure. They‚Äôre also comfortable with a mix of autonomous work and team work.  What‚Äôs aSweatLife? Great question. aSweatLife is a media company that creates content and community based on the belief that wellness can be the catalyst to live a better life and achieve your goals.  But, what does aSweatLife stand for? aSweatLife stands for creating a more well-rounded future of wellness for women of all races, shapes and sizes with the power of a community behind them and trusted content to guide them. We are authentic about who we are, intentional about what we create and who we work with.  What is the job, exactly? It‚Äôs sales, it‚Äôs partnerships, it‚Äôs friendship. We look to the Director of Partnerships to carry out and help to plan a strategic vision to bring brands we love to the pages of aSweatLife. Here‚Äôs what you can expect on a day-to-day, week-to-week, quarter-to-quarter basis.  Make friends: We‚Äôre big believers in the aSweatLife-ism that everything is better with friends. A big part of this role is to identify and research potential clients ‚Äì you‚Äôll zoom, you‚Äôll chat, you‚Äôll get to know potential partners who could turn out to be paid relationships today or in the future.  Nurture relationships: We‚Äôre proud of the relationships we‚Äôve built over our time since launching in 2012. You‚Äôll check in on partners we have long-standing relationships with and build your own rapport with new partners as well. You‚Äôll also be tasked with keeping tabs on brands we love, but who weren‚Äôt ready to commit the first time you chatted (we get it ‚Äì commitment can be scary).   Play on a team: We‚Äôre a tight-knit team that communicates openly about what‚Äôs going right, what‚Äôs going wrong, and when we need space for whatever is unfolding in our personal lives. Because we‚Äôre a small team, you may have to put on a different hat to help out a team member. You‚Äôll also have the privilege of working with some of the best people we‚Äôve ever known (we‚Äôre biased) ‚Äì from our full-time team to writers and ambassadors ‚Äì so it‚Äôs pretty easy to chip in when everyone is so wonderful. Set big goals: We plan on an annual basis and we check in on the plan quarterly. You‚Äôll be involved in the planning process that directly impacts the trajectory of the business. You‚Äôll have a say in what you‚Äôre working on and the big goals you‚Äôre going after.  Keep the team on track: You keep projects moving forward. You‚Äôre organized, you create systems and processes ‚Äì but when you see a way to make things better, you speak up and propose a solution.  Speak aSweatLife: If you‚Äôre just meeting us, hi! If you‚Äôre familiar with aSweatLife, you already know that our version of wellness is a little bit different. We don‚Äôt think it should cost 15% of your salary to be well. We don‚Äôt subscribe to or talk about diets. We‚Äôre here to create happier, healthier, humans who know what they want and go after it ‚Äì whether that thing that they want is a book in a bathtub or a promotion. After a ramp-up period, you‚Äôll be fluent in aSweatLife and can independently pitch us and our value to partners and potential partners.  You‚Äôre a ‚ÄúYes, and‚Ä¶‚Äù kind of person: We believe in the power of a ‚Äúyes, and‚Äù and if we had to tell you why, it‚Äôs because we identify deeply with Tina Fey and Amy Poehler (and their long standing friendship). Because they met doing improv and improv is about listening as much as you talk. You‚Äôre here to build up the team ‚Äì you accept others‚Äô ideas and build on top of them.  Track your progress (and our partners‚Äô progress) to goal: We love a big goal, if you can‚Äôt tell by now. We look to our team to track their progress-to-goal and be able to see the success or failure as a constant opportunity to learn and grow.  Sound like something you‚Äôd like to do? Here are the skills we‚Äôre looking for. Remember, if you have most of these things, but not all of them, we probably still want to meet you. The St. James is the premier sports, wellness and active entertainment destination brand in the country, with a mission to maximize human potential by designing, developing and operating sports, wellness and entertainment destinations that engage, inspire and empower people to pursue their passions and be their best at play, at work and in life. Our flagship development in Springfield, Virginia features a premium health club, celebrity chef-inspired restaurant, premium medi-spa, 20,000 sq. ft. active entertainment center, as well as an indoor field house with FIFA-sized field, two NHL-regulation sized ice rinks, 52-meter Olympic competition pool and much, much more. About Roland Foods  Roland Foods, LLC, based in New York City, is an importer and distributor of high-quality specialty food products from more than 60 countries. Founded in Paris in 1934 and established in the U.S. in 1939, the Company provides customers with exceptional specialty foods, primarily offered under the Roland brand. The company has a national presence in the foodservice, retail, and industrial channels as well as international sales in the Caribbean, Central and South America, Asia, Africa, and the Middle East. Roland Foods‚Äô dedication to providing quality and consistency has made it a leader among food importers and suppliers. The Roland brand is synonymous with quality and authenticity for the consumer and chef alike.  Role Description  Roland Foods is excited and committed to growing our Foodservice sales team, and we are seeking an experienced and motived sales professional to lead our South region. The Regional Sales Director (RSD) is a quota carrying sales and leadership position. This is an individual quota-carrying revenue accountability role with mentorship responsibilities for the South team. The ideal candidate demonstrates significant foodservice sales experience, a results-driven mindset, and a desire to win. Expectations include leveraging the right talent, driving accountability, and maximizing regional growth while executing corporate sales strategies and initiatives.  The Roland Foods sales team is dedicated to working across multiple business segments; distributors, local, regional and nationally positioned end users, and industrial customers to maintain current business while driving growth through collaboration focused on solutions, ideas and products. You will work with a dynamic team dedicated to providing the highest quality of products while developing meaningful and strategic partnerships with our valued customers.  Primary Responsibilities  Lead the Roland Foods South Region (sales team/customers/revenue) by overseeing the creation and execution of customer plans with high integrity Oversee the selling process and sales team to deliver net sales expectations Focus on Tier 1 customer accounts through interactions with customer leadership teams, buyers, category managers, and other decision makers to drive growth Assist the regional team in developing individual sales plans to achieve overall regional growth targets Coordinate with local and regional distributors to effectively service operators while maintaining exceptional service levels Management of existing and new programs for customers (e.g. pricing, rebates, and sampling) Collaborate and partner with internal teams to help develop sales strategies and solutions (e.g. Strategy, Revenue Management, Strategic Sourcing, and Supply Chain) Participate in demand planning to monitor forecast versus plans Identify when plan adjustments are needed based on monthly and quarterly sales volumes Provide ad-hoc reports and presentations for sales leadership Review monthly and quarterly sales volumes versus plan for each market Build deep and strategic relationships with customers Cultivate and manage profitable relationships with customers Engage sales leadership as necessary (i.e., bring in VP Sales, VP Strategy, CEO, Marketing, Culinary Teams, etc) Develop a clear understanding of the customer‚Äôs organizational/ decision-making structure to maneuver effectively within organization Deliver customer business reviews and category performance presentations Participate in long-term planning and execution with customer leadership Build cross functional support by collaborating with front-line and senior levels in the organization Communicate with Executive Leadership, Strategy, Revenue Management, Strategic Sourcing, Supply Chain, and People and Culture to lead aligned execution of how Roland Foods goes to market Represent the South regional sales team by truly understanding the day-to-day details and customer interactions to help develop and influence strategic decisions that affect the company Strategically manage the sales team to maximize results Leverage team resources/talent to maximize effective business plan delivery across National Accounts, National/Regional distributors, and street business customers Actively look for business development opportunities and coordinate approach accordingly (e.g., private label, cross-business/channel) ‚Äì should have a hunting mindset Provide insights from the sales field back to the Strategy and Supply Chain teams Build and maintain strong culture within the team to boost morale across the organization Set and communicate clear objectives for the team and individual team members Manage team budgets for salaries, travel, and entertainment Team development and leadership Identify, recruit, and retain a balanced and diverse team based on member/candidate strengths and role fit supported by relevant knowledge, skills, and experience Provide the foundation for team effectiveness by creating and maintaining team processes Apply training and coaching effectively for individual and team development Complete performance evaluations for direct reports Key performance metrics Delivery of the business plans across customers to meet or exceed regional net sales targets Individual quota attainment for new opportunity wins Management capability (organizational health, attrition %) ‚Äì people development Quantifiable achievement of personal and team goals Minimum Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs Degree and/or Culinary Arts Degree required. Proven leadership capabilities required. 10+ years of sales experience required. 5+ years of experience in the food industry; particularly selling into foodservice Strong administrative and organizational skills with experience using a CRM program preferably Salesforce required. General understanding of a P&L and forecasting abilities required. Strong communication and presentation skills in front of groups of all sizes required. Organized, detail-oriented with strong technical writing skills required. Ability to create executive level presentations required. Ability to travel up to 60% required. Previous exposure/integration in the Industrial/Manufacturing segment a bonus. Founded by immigrants, Roland Foods knows that diversity is the spice of life. We believe in the power of food to open minds, spark adventure, and bring diverse people together. All are welcome at our table! We know the transformative value of food in individual lives and communities. Because of this, we insist on obtaining the highest-quality ingredients and talent!  Roland Foods is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Roland Foods considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Roland Foods is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at peopleandculture@rolandfoods.com.

description: Our Company Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win ‚Äì shoppers, retailers, society and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people and reward them for doing the right thing. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.  Founded five years ago in Sydney, Australia, Afterpay has millions of active customers globally and is offered at the world‚Äôs best retailers around the world including Anthropologie, Revolve, DSW, GOAT, Finish Line, Levi‚Äôs, Mac Cosmetics, Ray-Ban and many others. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins.  Afterpay is completely free for customers who pay on time ‚Äì helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees or extended debt. Afterpay empowers customers to access the things they want and need, while still allowing them to maintain financial wellness and control, by splitting payments in four, for both online and in-store purchases. Afterpay is deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers. We are focused on supporting our community of shoppers.  We trust in the next generation and share a vision of a more accessible and sustainable world in which people are rewarded for doing the right thing.  The Opportunity Afterpay is looking for a high-energy, dynamic sales and business development executive to forge and expand our relationships with top tier retailers and brands that will drive significant value for the company. As a leader on the sales team, you will be on the front-lines of a fast-growing payments business - talking commerce with business owners of highly coveted brands to leading executives of Fortune 500 companies.   The ideal candidate thrives in a challenging, fast-paced environment, has a passion for developing and expanding client relationships, and possesses the ability to create new opportunities and close them. As a member of the US team, you have a unique opportunity to make an immediate impact, and influence many aspects of the business.    We are much more than our job descriptions - we are our energy, our ideas, our everyday drive. Here‚Äôs where you will begin‚Ä¶ Source, negotiate and sign agreements with top tier retailers including but not limited to enterprise and mid-market brands and retailers In partnership with finance & retail operations, develop a sales target plan and strategic framework through which all deals will be evaluated, operated and measured  Make recommendations on deal terms and support per partner to accelerate close rate while maintaining margin  Build and nurture strong relationships at top retailers and brands; leverage existing relationships to get meetings with the key decision makers, drive engagement, solidify deals and revenue  Use competitive insights to inform selling strategy and strategic direction  Find creative ways to develop and grow a high-volume, ever expanding sales pipeline  Ability to source and target non traditional brands, keep on top of the market and trends in the industry to identify new up and coming players  Who are you? Like us, you‚Äôll be obsessed with our product. You‚Äôll get a kick out of seeing and feeling the impact of your work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.  You will have ‚Ä¶.  8+ years experience in a sales or business development role Demonstrated track record of managing complex sales processes with enterprise accounts, developing new business opportunities, exceeding sales targets, forecasting and closing sales Proven success selling to and working with executives at multi-million / billion dollar retailers and brands Highly developed interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships both internally and with C-level decision makers Collaborative team player, proactive, resourceful, efficient with a high level of energy and enthusiasm  Comfortable concurrently managing multiple accounts and closing deals quickly   Self-motivated individual with the ability to work fast & smart independently  Exceptional communication, organizational & time management skills Must be willing to travel (once we are back to traveling!)  How we reward you. We have a pay for performance culture so you can expect to be rewarded for high performance. We pride ourselves on fairness and offer a competitive total reward package made up of salary, incentives and benefits including the opportunity to enroll in our share matching plan. We have a strong focus on health and wellbeing at Afterpay as we aim to support you to succeed in both your career and personal lives, such as providing employees with a corporate membership to Headspace. We offer a wide range of insurance programs so you have the flexibility to choose what is best for you. Afterpay covers 100% of the employee cost and 75% of the cost of your dependents. We value diversity and a collaborative and inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong is important to us.  How to Apply We don‚Äôt know what the future holds. That‚Äôs the exciting part; we show up and make it happen. If you‚Äôre brave, if you‚Äôre committed to doing the right thing and excited by this opportunity, click apply now!  Afterpay is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new team members, in addition to current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

description: Company  Swyft is a software-enabled B2B marketplace that enables any sized merchant, brand or retailer with same and next-day delivery at rates comparable to 2+ day delivery. Our mission is to create magical delivery experiences for shoppers & help merchants grow sales with the most scalable and flexible same/next-day delivery service.  We aren‚Äôt just a shipping and logistics company, we are building the data and framework layer for how a trillion parcels will move within hundreds of cities. Swyft is air traffic control for parcels routed from your favourite store to your door, and you can help us realize this vision. Founded in April 2020, we are fueled by creating delightful customer and employee experience through an experimental and data driven approach. We‚Äôve recently raised over $20M and are backed by the world‚Äôs best investors including Inovia Capital, Forerunner Ventures, Golden Ventures, Trucks VC, and Shopify.  The Head of Enterprise Sales leads our go to market strategy and execution with Enterprise accounts. You manage a team of Enterprise Account Executives as they build account plans, work complex sales cycles, and activate the largest Retail, D2C and 3PL customers in the world.  Your Responsibilities Lead the team of senior enterprise account executives Own and exceed annual sales targets within the enterprise team Building and maintaining strong customer relationships Uncover key growth strategies for sales cycle acceleration Drive account expansion into new markets Collaborate with internal teams to protect and expand enterprise revenue Monitor and understand key customer trends Manage selling prices by monitoring costs, competition and supply & demand Recruit top tier talent Translate product and operations initiatives into growth opportunities Manage the enterprise team diligently in Salesforce.com Report on KPIs and other analytics related to the enterprise sales function About You Proven history of overachievement as IC and leader Ability to communicate, present and influence at all levels of the organization Proven ability to coach and lead a team of senior account executives Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills History selling into Retail, D2C brands and/or 3PLs Ideally knowledge of the logistics space Strong desire to exceed expectations Experience in a high growth technology startup Benefits And Perks Above market salary and equity One-time relocation bonus to our Santa Monica office (if needed) Opportunity for rapid promotions and growth Annual company off-site (pending COVID restrictions) Centrally located offices in downtown Toronto and Santa Monica (Los Angeles) Complete workspace setup (in-office or WFH): your choice of hardware (Mac or PC), chair, and tools Health, Dental, and Vision benefits: we offer competitive health benefits for you and your dependents A team invested in your professional development (monthly trainings, education allowance and more) Casual, fun, and creative atmosphere: our office is stocked with healthy snacks and amenities to keep you fueled throughout the day At Swyft, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. We provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let the recruiting team know.

Key Responsibilities Attainment of revenue and booking targets within assigned territory Directly responsible for closing sales with prospects (new logo acquisition) and existing customers Develop and execute on strategic sales and account plans related to pipeline opportunities and new account development within assigned territory Educate prospects and customers on SureClinical‚Äôs solutions and value propositions Identify key ‚ÄòClient Champions‚Äô and develop strong working relationships with them Partner with Sales Development Representatives in order to develop an effective strategy to penetrate white space within assigned territory/account base Build customer loyalty, provide an exceptional experience, achieve sales targets and goals Participate in regular pipeline forecasting and quarterly business reviews Represent SureClinical in a manner consistent with company principles and ethics Understand challenges clients are needing to eliminate, develop talk track around SureClinical products and services that can alleviate those challenges Partner with internal SureClinical key stakeholders to identify & implement effective go-to-market strategies for new account development Conduct daily outbound calling through established campaigns to prospective customers Maintain and update sales plans, account/opportunity data within company systems as directed (Salesforce, Outreach, etc.) Complete administrative work as required  Essential Qualifications Excellent verbal and written communication skills. You are not afraid to pick up the phone and call into and speak to prospects in an engaging manner to uncover qualified opportunity Established track record of exceeding sales targets and delivering on company expectations Driven individual who enjoys collaborating with internal/external key stakeholders Experienced with business planning and conducting professional account/opportunity reviews Excellent organizational, time management skills, ability to multi-task in fast-paced environment Self-motivated, able to assume responsibility and work in a professional team environment Ability to gain ‚ÄòC-Level‚Äô credibility, understand organizational dynamics and competitive market awareness A minimum of 5 years of successful sales experience selling complex SaaS and professional services solutions, preferably within the life sciences space  Preferred Previous technology, software sales experience, or life sciences technology experience Life Sciences industry experience in pharmaceuticals, biotech and/or medical device space Demonstrated success with process approached prospecting/selling (SPIN, MEDDIC, B.A.N.T) Demonstrated success with strategic, value-based selling Strong application software sales experience Demonstrated consistent tenacity and drive to achieve goals  Education/Experience Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in the Life Sciences, Business or Computer Science is preferred, or equivalent relevant experience Minimum of (5) years of successful sales experience, preferably in a SaaS/software environment  The Account Executive will work remotely supporting the East Coast territory.  Benefits SureClinical offers an excellent compensation package, bonuses, stock options, benefits, 401K plan and much more!

description: Are you a highly driven, goal-oriented sales professional who‚Äôs only interested in playing with the big dogs? When you walk in a room, does everyone know you, like you, and flock to you to say hello? Do you take a strategic, tactical approach to everything you do?  Final question: when faced with a challenge, do you get excited or run away?  If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, refuse to settle for ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù or ‚Äúalmost‚Äù hitting goals, and want to lead a team of relentless game changers, you might be the perfect fit for our Director of Sales role.  The Director of Sales will be responsible for recruiting, training, and managing the sales team. This position is mission-critical. You will have an opportunity to positively impact the lives of every sales rep and every client. No red tape to cut through here.  This is an opportunity to shape Crisp‚Äôs future and make a tangible impact on our elite team of sales professionals, as well as countless businesses across the country. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to build relationships and initiate new law firms into the Crisp community, the #1 law firm growth company in America ‚Äî and most importantly, to smash every goal.  ** IMPORTANT: TO APPLY ** You will be evaluated and vetted based on your ability to follow instructions Do not apply through the contact information on the website To Apply: Please call 404-905-3625 for step-by-step instructions  Key responsibilities include: Partnering with our Business Development & Marketing teams to CLOSE quality and qualified leads. They are working for you! Showcasing our value to law firms around the country. Leveraging our approach & strategies to build trust with potential clients and know when to CLOSE THE DEAL. Performing Strategy Sessions, which involve diagnosing each law firm prospect‚Äôs needs and challenges in a consultative format. Performing Partnership Calls, the second and final in our consultative sales process. In this step, we present solutions and provide recommendations that will impact the law firm in a major way. CLOSING DEALS (we love people who like to win and hate to lose). Recruiting, leading, and coaching BDRs and AEs who are responsible for identifying prospects, communicating the value of Crisp services, and closing deals. Developing a plan to implement a systematic training program for onboarding and up-skilling BDRs and AEs. Conducting bi-weekly 1-on-1 performance review meetings with each rep and advocate for their long-term career growth. Identifying opportunities, creating sales campaigns/strategies, and managing channels that will lead to an increase in pipeline and achievement of sales targets. Developing a formalized prospecting strategy for both inbound and outbound lead qualification. Working transparently alongside Marketing, Rev Ops, Leadership, and Project Management teams. Leading the rollout of major sales changes in pricing, packaging, and positioning. Identifying areas to improve the sales process and make recommendations to Revenue Operations. Conducting daily/weekly team meetings with the support of Revenue Operations and audit sales team activities to ensure processes are being followed. Ensuring all reps are logging all activity appropriately.  Perks A few benefits you‚Äôre sure to enjoy: 100% Crisp paid health, vision, and dental insurance for Crispers starting Day 1, option to add spouse and dependents 5 weeks of paid time off a year, completely off the grid, including 7 paid Holidays plus the entire week between Christmas Eve and New Year's Day 401(k) with up to 4% company match (aka, free money) Parental Leave: Additional weeks of PTO at 100% salary for new birth and adoptive parents plus Instacart membership Annual Company Profit Share Program in a profitable, fully bootstrapped company On-time direct deposit State-of-the-art headquarters Ergonomic Workstations (Electronic Sit/Stand Desks) Mother's room and relaxation room on-site Monthly Custom Crisp Swag for Crispers Opportunity to Win a Tesla (Crisper of the Year) If you are the right fit, but not in Atlanta already, don‚Äôt worry! We will pay to get you here! (relocation expenses covered!  About Crisp Crisp is an incredibly fast moving, high growth company (1470%+ growth in 3 years) with a laser focus on delivering the absolute best legal marketing, and business coaching services on the market today.  Check out what we are about here: https://www.crispvideo.com/careers/  We‚Äôre all about working hard and staying humble. In the spirit of humble bragging, here are some of our awards and accolades: Named to Inc. 5000 List of Fastest-Growing Private Companies 5-Years in a Row (2021, 2020, 2019, 2018, 2017) Atlanta‚Äôs Fastest-Growing Private Companies 6-Years in a Row (2021, 2020, 2019, 2018, 2017, 2016) Recognized as Atlanta‚Äôs Best Places to Work Creators and annual hosts of the Crisp Game Changers Summit, the largest and most ambitious law firm growth conference on Earth (www.crispsummit.com) Published the legal industry‚Äôs best-selling marketing book (www.gamechangingattorney.com) Host of the most listened to podcast in the legal industry (The Game Changing Attorney Podcast (The Game Changing Attorney Podcast) Featured in Forbes, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch, Yahoo, and The Huffington Post  Why You Should Work Here You will become part of an incredibly crafted and unified company culture with an attentive CEO and teammates who are truly dedicated to success You will work with people from all departments who are happy to help and teach as you work towards growth You will experience working for a company that is truly leading the industry and constantly innovating. Complacency is not part of our vocabulary You will be in an environment that is always ready to tackle a new initiative and put creative ideas into action You will grow personally and professionally. Every measure is taken to ensure our team members thrive. Our Continuing Crisp Education (CCE) program encourages and rewards classes, certifications, book clubs, and trainings  If you‚Äôre looking for a job that‚Äôs boring and easy, you won‚Äôt find that here. We put 110% into everything we do. Greatness is achieved through hard work, discipline, and sacrifice, and we‚Äôre determined to be great.  We‚Äôre not crazy; we just believe in what we do.  If you'd like to be part of a nationally recognized, collaborative, and downright badass team, then we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you.  ** IMPORTANT: TO APPLY ** You will be evaluated and vetted based on your ability to follow instructions Do not apply through the contact information on the website To Apply: Please call 404-905-3625 for step-by-step instructions  Our requirements are pretty straightforward. To qualify you must: Have over 5 years of experience in sales leadership Have served in a Director of Sales or VP of Sales role at a high-growth entrepreneurial organization ($20M-$60M+ in annual revenue) with experience selling high-value services that grew by at least 50% during your tenure Have hired, trained, managed a sales team of 10+ people Find comfort in a high-growth organization (it‚Äôs not for everyone to move at such a quick pace) Be energetic, charismatic leader who will stay on top of the team Possess experience with Salesforce and SalesLoft Have experience selling a high-value service

description: Job Summary  The W&S Sales Director will oversee all territory management responsibilities including supervision of sales consultants in their assigned territory.  Essential Functions Develops and effective marketing and sales strategic plan in order to maximize wine and spirits distribution within an established or growing customer base. Directly communicates with Wine & Spirits Brand Managers to identify opportunities in portfolio and market. Analyzes current markets identifying strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. Works in the market with sales consultants; provides suggestions and strategies to increase business. Analyze reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis to identify potential growth areas, capture market share, identify trends, monitor depletions, and make recommendations to sales consultants or the VP/GM. Ensures sales consultants are completing, adhering and referring to all necessary educational programs, materials, and other sales training. Conducts tastings, attends dinners and participates in trade shows as necessary. Works, when necessary, with the accounting department to resolve any billing issues within their designated territory. Responsible for staffing, staff planning, conducting performance appraisals on direct reports, budgeting, ensuring compliance with training requirements, developing direct reports and controlling expenditures. Arrives to work, meetings, appointments and other work-related functions on time and as scheduled. Meets agreed upon goals and objectives effectively and in a timely manner. Other Functions  Follows all safety policies and procedures; communicate hazards and/or suggest improvements to Manager.  Acts as a backup for sales consultants in their absence.  Other duties as assigned  Working Conditions: Field sales, significant travel by automobile. Travel by airplane/train and overnight stays will be required.  Minimum Requirements  Bachelor's degree preferably from a four-year college or university  Valid Drivers License and driving record that meets company requirements.  Five years of field sales/marketing experience in the fine wine and/or spirits industry.  Three years of territory management, including personnel supervision.  Must have proven, amiable, and active relationships with top customers throughout the local region.  Computer literacy with a focus on MS Office, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Demonstrated effective and efficient written and oral communication  Excellent people skills, and management skills  Needs excellent time management skills  Excellent interpersonal relationship skills  Superior follow through and the ability to handle multiple tasks with limited supervision.  Physical Requirements: Lifting up to 45lbs, bending, sitting, carrying, standing, manual dexterity, reaching, visual acuity, driving  Disclaimer  The list of requirements, duties and responsibilities is not exhaustive, but is merely the most accurate list for the current job. Management reserves the right to revise the job description and to require that other tasks be performed when circumstances of the job change (for example, emergencies, changes in personnel, workload, or technical development.  The Company provides the following compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that it in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position. The Company reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant's sex of other status protected by local, state, or federal law.  Pay Range  Compensation and Benefits Information:  $125,000-$150,000  Benefits Offered  Health, Dental, Vision, Basic AD&D Life Insurance, Voluntary Life Insurance, Spousal Life Insurance, Child Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, 401(k) with company match.

Job Description Summary Our GE purpose is ‚ÄúBuilding a World that Works.‚Äù At GE Digital, we have people who see data differently. We‚Äôre building a world that works by putting industrial data to work by making power-generating assets more efficient, the electrical grid more secure and resilient, making manufacturing smarter, and flight safer and more sustainable. Because a cleaner world isn't something that‚Äôs far in the future. It‚Äôs the world we‚Äôre building now. As part of GE, we have a unique opportunity to change the way industry works. Driven by people, process and proven technology, our teams collaborate closely with our customers to make complex things simple: turning vast amounts of data into tangible, lasting results - at unparalleled speed and scale. Since 2015, we‚Äôve been operating, analyzing and optimizing that data for customers all over the world. Today, GE Digital is a leading industrial software company transforming how our customers solve their toughest challenges by putting industrial data to work. By using emerging technologies like Industrial AI and Digital Twin, we translate our decades of domain and historical knowledge into leading industrial applications. We are problem solvers who use industrial data and deep expertise to accelerate value for our customers. Our software and services support more than 21,000 customers across key industries: Electric Utilities (Grid), Power Generation, Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, and Aviation.  Job Description  Job Overview The Vice President - Americas Sales leader is an executive level position that reports directly into the Chief Commercial Officer of Grid Software and is accountable for building and developing a high-performance commercial organization and driving sustainable growth and process. S/he will accelerate software and services sales and business development opportunities by working with the Grid Commercial organization targeted at our most strategic customers in collaboration with our solution architects, service, operations, customer support, and service organization. You will bring to this role the demonstrated ability and desire to drive transformational customer software solutions that allow customers to better manage and enhance the competitiveness and profitability of their business. You will have exceptional business acumen and outcome selling skills, and an understanding of the global energy markets and power generation business models. You will make the connection between the IT & OT organizations and through exceptional influencing skills help C-Suite decision makers transform their organizations to deliver significant outcomes and help them transform the way they run their businesses.  Responsibilities As our Vice President - Americas Sales, you will: Be recognized within the Energy/Utility market as a key thought leader in driving all levels of strategy, vision, and execution to deliver on the Commercial mission. Define, build, and implement a regional commercial strategy for Software (i.e. commercial models, pricing strategy, etc.) connected or separate from current offerings. Build, lead, and mentor a team of solutions sellers; attract and retain high-performing sales talent; create a culture of collaboration and customer-focus. Bring operational rigor in forecasting, sales process, driving continuous commercial improvement Lead customer engagement at the C-level to introduce our vision, link customer business objectives to KPI and align KPI to measurable outcomes and quantifiable value. Provide feedback and insights to shape and enhance the product and solution portfolio working alongside marketing, product management, support, and delivery. Develop the go to market strategy with the marketing team, via channels, consultants, partners or direct. Partner with Commercial teams to maximize revenue opportunities aligned with maximizing customer outcome value (i.e. outcome selling, subscription, HW/Services/SW upsell opportunities, etc.). Meet and exceed assigned quarterly and yearly sales and strategic account objectives in targeted customers. Leverage Commercial teams‚Äô deep knowledge of customer organizational dynamics (i.e. key decision-makers and influencers). Be a creative problem solver and generate ideas that will benefit the company; recognize opportunities within the market and quickly mobilize to take advantage of those opportunities by creating, articulating, and executing against the strategic plan. Educate, train, and develop current sales talent.  Qualifications Minimum 15 years‚Äô leadership experience in software sales, business development, sales strategy and/or related software services sales. Degree in business, engineering, computer science, marketing, or related discipline. Ability to travel 50%+. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.  Desired Characteristics Deep experience with grid utility products and services. Thought leadership, comfortable with market and technology trends, uncertainty, develop content and domain expertise; articulate with ability to tell a compelling story and vision. Demonstrated success as a software solutions consultant at the C-suite level; strong executive presence. Proven track record of sales success: achieving/over-achieving quotas, building out new markets, etc. MBA degree. Ability to build deep trust with internal teammates and end-customer executives. Strong desire to train and enable sales professionals to embrace and use solution selling approaches that compel end customers to adopt and implement software to solve more strategic, comprehensive, mission critical business problems. Technical acumen to interface with technologists, understand complex concepts and translate in a way that businesses or industry can understand. Strong demonstrated oral presentation and written communication skills. Can manage through ambiguity and a complex matrix environment.     Additional Information GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Job Summary  If you have previous experience in SaaS sales and are looking for a new position that will allow you to blend those skills with managerial duties, then we are offering you the position that you've been searching for. We are looking for a sales manager to help coordinate the efforts of our sales team in order to bring on new clients to contribute to the growth of our business. In this role, you'll be responsible for providing the support needed to ensure the success of our salespeople, whether through generating leads, providing background information, or assisting in the close of a transaction. You will also be able to work closely with our management team in monitoring our sales efforts.  Job Responsibilities Provide direction and support to our sales team members, along with the education and example needed in order to help guarantee their success. Generate sales leads by working closely with our marketing and advertising department and presenting information on our company at trade shows and conventions. Work with our management team as well as our salespeople in analyzing sales performance to develop ambitious yet attainable sales goals for the current fiscal year. Coordinate the distribution of leads to the members of our sales team according to each salesperson's designated geographic area, and then follow up on those leads to help ensure that they result in customer conversion. Educate yourself on our entire portfolio of products so as to become a resource of information for both our staff and our customers. Suggest product improvements to our research and development departments based upon client feedback. Present quarterly reports to our management team detailing the sales team's progression towards annual goals. Required Job Skills & Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a business-related field 5 years of experience in technical sales Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications as well as accounting and analytic programs Demonstrated leadership skills Preferred 4 year of managerial or supervisory experience or 8 years of experience in technical sales Prior experience in planning and/or data modeling

description: Kindbody is a new generation of health and fertility care. We provide fertility, gynecology, and wellness services in modern, tech-enabled clinics - delivering best-in-class clinical care, accessible pricing, and a seamless patient experience. We serve patients and employers in NY, San Francisco, Los Angeles, NJ and nationally online and through our network of partner clinics. Join our experienced team of rockstars from Stanford, Mt. Sinai, One Medical, Progyny, Mercer, Google, and Goldman Sachs. We are looking for an accomplished Sales Executive to join our team for the Northeast territory. You will be working in a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment where you will be relied on for your expertise, professionalism, and collaboration. You will prospect and pitch large/jumbo employers (> 40,000 employees) to meet covered lives quotas annually.  Responsibilities: Prospect, pitch, and oversee end-to-end employer sales process to meet annual quotas Develop prospect list of potential targets and actively call leads daily Identify and connect with CHRO / Benefits team members to establish pitch meeting Prepare all materials needed for pitch meeting tailored to employer and lead pitch meeting, pulling in team members as needed, and oversee meeting follow up and next steps Develop tailored proposals, and work with benefits teams to close deals directly with employers and with employer brokers as needed Act as an individual contributor implement all necessary processes and manage sales pipeline to reach sales quota Manage and close complicated sales processes Source, attend, manage, and actively participate at employer sales and benefits related conferences to broaden prospect pool, develop relationships with targeted benefits managers, and maintain brand awareness within the benefits offering space   You‚Äôd be a good fit if: Minimum 10 + years experience as an individual large/jumbo sales executive Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; master‚Äôs degree a plus Proven ability to manage large/jumbo employer sales cycle end-to-end Track record of successfully exceeding revenue targets Ability to negotiate, multi-year customer contracts Experience supporting and implementing healthcare benefits strategies for large employers Self-starter; ability to work independently in a lean, early stage, high-growth environment Outstanding communication skills; leverages a highly-collaborative approach to sales Willingness to travel to prospective client sites as needed  Perks + Benefits: Our total rewards package consists of base salary, equity, and benefits. Some of our benefits include: Comprehensive healthcare, retirement, and voluntary benefits. Think medical, dental, vision, savings accounts, 401k, and more. PTO and 11 Company Holidays Equity Options for Full time employees 12 weeks of paid parental leave after a year of employment, and prorated coverage from 6 months to 12 months of service.  Kindbody provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Magazine's 2019 Best Places to Work and SF Business Times' 2020 Best Places to Work and 2019 Bay Area Workplace Wellness and Builtin's 2021 SF Best Places to Work and 2021 SF Companies with the Best Benefits. description: Backed by top North American VCs, Owl.co is a well-funded, rapidly growing tech company. Owl is currently working with ten of the largest financial institutions in North America. We have a brand new, beautiful head office in Yaletown, Vancouver as well as offices in Toronto. They will gather customer feedback and requests while working with internal teams to help align our product roadmap. A strong understanding of the steps involved in a sales cycle and ability to leverage each stage to advance the sale is required Demonstrated ability to learn and apply proven sales methodologies Possess ability to prospect and manage a designated territory to maximize revenue growth Ability to gain access to and build trusting relationships with executive levels of an organization and interact with senior level corporate management Must be comfortable with the product value proposition and speaking to technical and non-technical executives alike Operate with a sense of urgency, be aggressive, competitive, and demonstrate a positive, winning attitude Superior time management skills and strong attention to detail Negotiate effectively balancing value and time to close High levels of business/financial acumen and emotional intelligence Possess the ability to understand complex client strategies and tactical requirements and to clearly articulate the company‚Äôs offerings to develop solutions that deliver value Possess understanding of current web and cloud technologies The ability to develop and sustain critical relationships across client and prospect base is essential Must have proven ability to expertly use common desktop office and business technologies Exceptional overall communication skills Bachelor‚Äôs Degree preferred  Benefits Remote work availability Health Benefits Paid Time Off (Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days) Competitive Salaries Professional Growth A generous Employee Referral Bonus Program

description: About The Team  Since 2015, Revolut has introduced over 10 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and stock trading, customers simply get more with Revolut.  We approach Sales at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to line manager coaching and development, our goal is to create a partnership with our teams that is people-centric and value adding.  Put simply, we come to work to create a world class sales framework and a fantastic experience that our people love and that starts from the very first point we connect with our new joiners.  About The Role  Due to the growth of the Sales department we are looking for a Head of Sales Training to build a world class sales playbook and coaching programme. This is a great opportunity to apply your skills and expertise in a fast growing organisation that is data driven.  What You'll Be Doing  Establish and execute the learning and development strategy for the sales department Ensure our sales playbooks enable Revoluters to continuously learn Manage the QA process for Sales Department  What You'll Need  Strong Sales Training Experience with a focus on SPIN, Challenger, Value, Solution, Conceptual and Insight led approached Experience building world class training programmes from scratch Experience building and administering quality assessment processes for high volume sales teams

description: About Collective:  Collective is on a mission to redefine the way businesses-of-one work. Collective's technology and team of trusted advisors enables our members to achieve financial independence by taking care of everything from business incorporation to accounting, bookkeeping, tax services and access to a thriving community, all in one integrated platform. We believe in empowering self-employed people to enjoy the same tax savings that big companies get.  Featured in Forbes, Business Insider, Yahoo, Bloomberg, Financial Times, Techcrunch and more. We're backed by General Catalyst, Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher and Guy Oseary), QED Investors, Google's Gradient Ventures, Expa and prominent investors who have financed and built iconic companies like YouTube, Substack, Twitch, Box, Hims, Instacart, Lyft and more.  About the Role:  As the Director of Sales, you will manage the New Business team and report to the Director of Member Operations, You will routinely partner with various other team leads across Marketing, Onboarding, Product, Tax and Accounting.  The New Business team conducts video interviews with prospective members to determine qualification and initiates an exceptional relationship-building experience with the ultimate goal of securing the prospect's commitment to join. The team provides value and guidance to prospective members based on their unique business attributes and personal financial needs.  Responsibilities: Coach, mentor and motivate a high performing team to meet or exceed all sales goals and other expectations set by the leadership team Attract and retain A-player reps through effective recruiting, selection and training, fostering an environment for promotion Own the New Business target and pipeline stage conversion metrics Develop repeatable sales process and sales plays that scale rapidly Operationalize sales motions to shorten time between qualified lead to first contact Analyze pipeline metrics to uncover levers that increase sales velocity and decrease time to close Manage productivity, funnel of opportunities and lead quality to ensure teams meet established goals and standards Partner with Marketing to define product ready and sales ready leads in order to optimize demand generation and win rate Enable sales by tracking, measuring and optimizing core sales activities at the desk level ensuring activity levels are commensurate with revenue expectations Coach reps with regular 1:1s and pipeline stand-ups, influencing behaviors that drive sales Evaluate the sales tech stack and make tooling recommendations that increase efficiency in reporting and funnel metrics Maintain professional and technical knowledge of Collective.com's solution Recommend sales dashboards and implement executive reporting infrastructure and cadence  What we want you to bring: 5+ years of leadership experience with a track record of excellence leading high performing organizations in a fast-growing technology company. Experience and excitement around attracting, recruiting, developing and retaining world-class talent early in their Sales and Management careers. Strategic mindset to build a team, but also be tactical enough to execute on a day-to-day basis. A reputation with cross-functional teams as being collaborative, innovative, accountable and reliable. An obsession with being data-driven, highly analytical, leading through influence, and being a structured thinker. Enthusiasm and demonstrated ability to learn the skills needed to sell financial services products Excellent verbal and written communication skills via phone, email and video conference.  Bonus Points if you have: (Optional) Tax Accounting Experience Industry Credential (Enrolled Agent, CPA, Attorney) Understand the ins & outs of being a small business owner  What we offer in return: A diverse and collaborative team with flexibility around where you work Competitive salary and stock options package Open vacation policy Employer-paid health, vision and dental insurance Team events, workshops and virtual gatherings  This role is remote, but Collective is a San Francisco based company. There will be opportunities to travel to San Francisco for team events, company offsites and professional development, once the pandemic is over.  Equal Employment Opportunity  At Collective, we don't just accept differences‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwe celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you're good at what you do, come as you are. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Collective is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

description: A unique opportunity to join a fast-growing disruptive technology vendor, who is looking to recruit a Head of Business Development Americas to help drive sales revenues with Broadcasters, Content Owners, TV Stations, and Sports Rights Holders across North and South America. Key responsibilities for the role: Work closely with Senior Management to implement and execute the sales strategy for the Americas. Identify, prospect, and win new business sales with Broadcasters, Content Owners, and Rights Holders in your region. Full responsibility for sales and profit contribution of all customers. Strong contact network, particularly within the Broadcast, Production, and Post-Production markets across North and South America. Knowledge of media production workflows, news workflows, storage, media asset management, cloud-based services, and or content distribution. Capable of building and managing a partner network. description: Permascand‚Äôs continued growth in North America has created an exciting opportunity for a Senior Sales Manager with a background in the electrochemical industry specifically in the Chlor/Alkali and Electrowinning industry. Are you ready to join a fast-growing company that has just been listed on their continued journey?  Company Permascand is a technology-driven manufacturer of world-leading electrochemical solutions ‚Äì based on proprietary catalytic coatings ‚Äì for clean tech applications. With a customer-centric focus, the recently listed company has supplied electrodes and aftermarket services for a variety of industries for nearly 50 years.  Permascand works with the major global players in this market space to serve customers all over the world. Their headquarters are situated in Ljungaverk, Sweden. More than 95 percent of the products are delivered to markets outside Sweden, mainly Europe, North and South America.   Role and Responsibilities As a Sales Manager you will be working in a small group in the USA or Canada with frequent travel to Permascand‚Äôs manufacturing facility in Ljungaverk, Sweden. You are responsible for exploration and cultivation of new customers, markets and businesses. You will develop strong customer relationship with both new- and existing customers. Furthermore, you are responsible for drawing up action plans for increased sales.  You will work independently but also be a part of a sales team spread across different geographical areas of the world. You will also stay connected with operations in Sweden in your daily work and will report directly to the Chief Commercial Officer in Sweden.  Qualifications and characteristics  MSc in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent commercial background Long experience in technical sales or long production experience in the process industry Experience from Chlor Alkali and Electrowinning industry is meritorious Fluent in English  To succeed in the role, we believe that you are used to working in a structured way and pursuing your own agenda. You have documented experience of and an interest in building strong customer relationships. Furthermore, we see that you are a solution-oriented, flexible professional.  We accept applicants residing in both the southern United States and Canada.  Employment Type: Full time Salary and benefits: Upon agreement Start date: Upon agreement

description: Overview: Elaborate is an early-stage, stealth startup moving a million miles a minute in our mission to redesign the lab testing experience. Started by an ex-Oscar exec and funded by some of the most iconic investors and entrepreneurs, we are building software that acts as an intermediary between doctors and their patients. We integrate with doctors‚Äô EMRs and analyze patient data with our proprietary clinical insights engine, providing a guided, innovative health experience unlike anything seen before in the market.   We are looking for a head of Sales to own our Company‚Äôs rapidly expanding growth engine. You will be a key executive leader responsible for delivering material outcomes for the business. You will have the opportunity to build a sales organization in your vision, and encouraged to innovate on tried and tested sales operations to deliver a hyper-scale growth engine.    The top qualities that we‚Äôre looking for:   **Get it done.** You are hungry to exceed your goals and continuously challenge yourself to redefine what is possible. You have a history of going outside of your job description / normal hours / skillset to close the deal and get the job done.   **Outcomes first.** You know how to manage against an outcome over deliverables. You have a no-excuses mentality. You are constantly asking yourself how you and your team can do things different to achieve the goals at hand more easily.  **Doctor-friendly.** You have sold to or partnered with doctors and know how to speak the lingo. You‚Äôre familiar with the day 2 day flow of a practice. You are completely unphased when coming across something new or unfamiliar.   **Leader.** You know how to break down a project and bring together a group of people to accomplish a goal. You have experience with best practices to keep a team on track. Others point to you as the person who knows what‚Äôs going on.   The type of work you‚Äôll do:  **Drive growth.** Chiefly responsible for achieving and exceeding quarterly and annual growth targets. Design and build the infrastructure to track, analyze, and forecast growth performance KPIs and convert the insights into action. Lead monthly discussion meetings with your peers on the leadership team to identify blockers and opportunities for improvement.    **Build and lead Sales team.** Architect and hire a team to support your sales targets. Own recruiting, objectives setting, coaching and performance monitoring for the Sales team. Design an incentive program that inspires your team to fuel the growth of the business.   **Spearhead company strategy**. Co-design an annual business strategy that expands our customer base and ensures a strong market presence. Provide an expert perspective on go-to-market, leading the definition of our market positioning and chief value propositions. Identify emerging markets and market shifts while keeping a pulse on new products and competitors.   **Innovate on sales and early customer retention strategy**: Innovate on growth strategies for acquisition, conversion, and activation of both healthcare clients and patient users. Liaise with Operations and Service teams to ensure seamless user onboarding experience post close.    **Own strategic community building**: Lead engagement with patient advocacy and professional organizations to create productive partnerships based on shared objectives. Nurture long-term relationships to convert high-value clients.  What you will get in return for being an awesome member of the team:   - We pay you competitively and commit to open conversations about the trajectory of your compensation on a semiannual basis.   - We give you a meaningful piece of the pie, and are transparent about how early employee equity works and is valued as we grow the Company.   - We invest in you as someone choosing to dedicate some of their best professional years with us. Expect lots of actionable feedback, connects with rockstars in our vast network (incl investors, advisors) and sponsorship for part-time continuing education opportunities.  - We prioritize flexibility, with work from home days and a whole MONTH remote during February so you escape the cold winter and realize your dream of being a snowbird a few years early. Plus, we‚Äôve got a generous time off policy.  - We commit to 10% of your time being spent on projects of your choosing to help us achieve our Company goals. Annually, this time culminates with a hackathon of epic proportions, with multiple days dedicated to team bonding and innovation (plus pizza).   - We give you a front-row seat, to building a business from the ground up, with the added benefit of having secured capital to invest in early product development and company infrastructure. There is no better way to get a crash course on how to start your own business, and we commit to supporting you wholly if you choose to pursue that path.   What you‚Äôve done before:   What we‚Äôve written above should give you a pretty good sense of whether this is the right fit for you. If you‚Äôre looking for a comfortable, 9-5, routine and predictable job, where you execute on orders from someone else, this is not the right fit.   To help those who are still on the fence, we‚Äôve included a couple of guidelines of what we think the best candidates will have done before. That said, we eagerly accept non-traditional candidates who are able to show us why they‚Äôll be amazing for this role.   Most likely, you have: - 6+ years experience in healthcare or software sales as a sales representative or sales manager, consistently meeting or exceeding targets  - 3+ years experience overseeing sales operations, with demonstrated successes in enhancing the predictability, reproducibility, and cost efficiency of a sales organization. Huge plus if you have previously held a sales executive role.  - Experience building relationships and managing partnerships with either 1) small to medium-sized clinical practices or 2) mid to large health systems, with a thorough understanding of health buyer procurement processes for technology and who the key influencers are - A record of success in deploying and scaling technology within the healthcare space  - Thorough understanding of the challenges of early integration and best practices for managing early client retention through robust onboarding  - Excellent stakeholder management skills - Outcomes-oriented decision-making processes.   By the way, let us more formally introduce ourselves:  Elaborate was founded by a health-tech executive with early / founding experience at both Oscar and Parsley Health, with teammates and investors from fast-growing, successful health and consumer businesses including Pillpack, GoodRx, Behance, Flatiron School, Advantia Health, and Greenhouse.

Sales Director Location: Remote  The legal industry is a big business ‚Äì around $700 billion big. It‚Äôs also gone a remarkably long time without any major disruption, and our client brings a long overdue update. They‚Äôre building a new category of tech-forward professional services, rewriting the story of who does the work in the legal industry and taking the business of law to a new standard.  Our client is the leading disruptor within the world‚Äôs second-largest business services industry, working with in-house legal teams at some of the most innovative companies in the world across various sectors ‚Äì financial services, life sciences, energy, technology, entertainment & media, consumer products and more ‚Äì to help solve their most pressing challenges.  Summary Our client is looking for evangelists ‚Äì salespeople who can envision a better future for clients, bring clients to see that vision and create lasting partnerships that exceed clients‚Äô greatest expectations. This role is well-suited for a highly consultative seller who‚Äôs accustomed to sitting at the table with executive-level decision-makers to devise solutions to their toughest problems. The sales director will be afforded a high degree of accountability and ownership over a portfolio of Fortune 500 and industry-leading clients focusing on account growth as well as new business generation.  Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities Responsible for bringing in new business, originating and selling to prospects, and making believers of fresh clients. Define the client experience by building durable relationships, inspiring trust, and proposing innovative solutions to their problems. Consult with C-level executives and savvy leaders of the world‚Äôs largest in-house legal teams Collaborated and partner daily with broader commercial team to close and support strategic opportunities. Offer thought leadership to clients as well as internally mentor and offer professional insights to junior team members.  Requirements Background in B2B client service and extensive experience in consultative sales roles. Proven track record of exceeding business goals on a monthly, quarterly, and/or annual basis. Comfortable working in a senior role as an individual contributor. Understand what goes into the sales process from prospecting to close. Able to manage multiple complex deals across multiple clients and stages. Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail and pattern recognition Manage time well and possess expert judgment and decision-making skills. High-impact communicator who knows how to present to executive-level stakeholders. Proficient in PowerPoint and Microsoft Office Suite. Proficient in Salesforce (or comparable CRM system) and understand the importance of leveraging data to make smart decisions about where to spend your time. Demonstrate a relentless service orientation, effortlessly form trusted-advisor relationships, are catalytic in desire to improve the status quo, and can operate effectively within a highly collaborative team environment. Legally eligible to work in the geography where the role is located.  At Mogul, we provide exclusive executive opportunities for top diverse talent at the VP, SVP, EVP, President, C-Suite, or Board of Directors level across the Fortune 500 and more. Our client is a global leader in SaaS-based solutions for the Procurement industry.
