description: Job Description  Health Data & Management Solutions, Inc. (HDMS), a subsidiary of CVS/Aetna, is a Software Development Company on the cutting edge of health IT data solutions. Offering data warehouse, management and analysis tools for the healthcare industry, HDMS strives to improve and enhance its product suite for health plans, employers and providers through constant innovation. HDMS' web-based products and services provide flexible, high-value reporting tools that empower users to maximize the value of their health care data and support benefit decisions.  The Sales Director Is Responsible Building pipeline and selling data analytics to large Employers and Brokers. Accountable for achieving a defined sales objective. Identifying and evaluating strategic sales opportunities in order to build high quality pipeline and close sales. Establishing, maintains and grows relationships with key strategic decision makers in consultant and prospect organizations in order to further build positive brand recognition and drive revenue growth. Developing and implementing complex strategic sales plan at a prospect specific level. Interfaces with all levels of management to negotiate and influence consensus. Coordinating the development of customized offerings with Product Development, Finance, IT, Clinical Operations, Legal and other internal Departments. Providing strategic direction and leadership to Proposal team and other departments in RFP responses. Actively participating and leading internal meetings and trainings. Growing and maintaining extensive industry knowledge and best practices through active involvement in national and international trade shows, competitive analyses participation and prospect identification and relationship management. Leading end to end RFP process management including creating and presenting cost proposals and pricing models and contract negotiation. Required Qualifications Up to 10+ years of experience in healthcare, health & benefits, or managed care industry. Up to 10+ years of experience with a large, complex sales process and advanced sales techniques in a long sales cycle. Experience with selling Employers and Brokers. Significant experience with new business development. SalesForce pipeline and revenue management skills. Extensive network of plan sponsor, payer, and/or provider contacts including C-Suite level for large employers and thought leaders for national consulting firms. Persuasive and proven negotiating skills with a professional executive presence and motivating public speaking experience. COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Master's Degree or equivalent work experience  Education  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

description: The Director of Business Development is a newly created position that will be responsible for managing key enterprise partnerships ‚Äì including vision, acquisition, management, and evolution ‚Äì that will drive the long-term growth of FreshDirect. The role will report to the Chief of Staff.   Responsibilities: Identify and recommend new opportunities to grow revenue via strategic partnerships, supported by data-driven business cases and financial models. Lead and coordinate end-to-end sales motion for enterprise prospects including incentive structure, education/marketing, pricing/quoting, and contract negotiation to close deals. Drive mutually beneficial partnerships that enhance key programs such as business development, co-marketing, and strategic initiatives. Expand the scope of FreshDirect applicability to encompass new opportunities, use cases, and markets as they emerge. Ensure operational alignment across teams to execute on commerce partnerships (pre and post sale). Define KPIs to analyze, track, and report on the commercial success of each program.  Education and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree. A top-tier MBA is preferred  7+ years of work experience in top-tier strategy consulting, business development, and/or strategic partnerships required.  Experience in a high-growth start-up strongly preferred  Ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective partners  Excellent negotiation, forecasting, and problem-solving skills  Ability to use data to build a compelling narrative to partners  Speed, resourcefulness, and a go-getter mentality. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with several moving parts  Entrepreneurial attitude and willingness to build, test, and operationalize new programs with ambiguity  Excellent communication, organizational, and relationship-building skills, high emotional intelligence  Must embody and demonstrate company values and culture   Who is FreshDirect: FreshDirect is the northeast's leading online fresh food grocer, delivering directly to customers throughout seven states, including the New York City, Philadelphia, and District of Columbia metropolitan areas. FreshDirect is committed to sourcing the freshest and best-tasting meat, fish, produce, and specialty items through direct relationships with suppliers, growers, and farmers. FreshDirect is proud to have joined the multi-national grocery and technology organization, Ahold Delhaize, at the beginning of 2021. This acquisition will fuel FreshDirect‚Äôs growth as a leading eCommerce grocer in the United States.  From the beginning, FreshDirect has set out to provide something different. We are a community partner with a mission to deliver the highest quality and service that customers can find. This is an environment in which associates can innovate, grow and have successful careers‚Äîmost of our leaders have come up through our ranks. And thanks to our team‚Äôs extraordinary efforts, we are a leading innovator in the e-commerce and grocery industries.   Why choose FreshDirect? We're a company that thrives on teamwork. Our evolution is driven by our passionate employees and investment in perfecting the technology that lets us deliver the highest-quality food. Our state-of-the-art facility creates an environment for innovation. We support our employees with on-the-job training for plant employees and drivers, team-building activities, workplace recognition opportunities, and by encouraging direct relationships with our suppliers in the field.   Great people deserve great perks. We offer comprehensive benefits, plus many workplace extras, including: A flexible and generous paid time off plan 20% off at freshdirect.com and significant markdowns at our employee market 24-hour access to the FreshDirect shuttle between our Bronx headquarters and the subway Regular events and barbecues for employees  Click to explore careers and life @ FreshDirect  Learn more @FreshDirect on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube!   Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the Team member(s) assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of individuals in this position. Position Descriptions may be subject to change as the needs of the organization change.  As an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER, FreshDirect does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of their race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, sexual orientation, age religion, creed, marital status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, familial status, or on any other basis prohibited by law. Furthermore, FreshDirect will not discriminate against any applicant or employee because they are disabled, a disabled veteran, or a veteran of the Vietnam era, provided they are qualified and meets the requirements established by FreshDirect for the job.

description: We are actively seeking a Regional Sales Director to join our rapidly growing sales team for the following regions, Pacific Northwest, Central, North East, South East, and South West. At One Drop, we‚Äôve developed the most innovative and effective digital chronic condition management program in the industry. By joining the sales team, you will fundamentally change how healthcare is delivered to the growing number of people struggling with managing chronic disease and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Your primary responsibilities include prospecting, identifying, and closing deals using consultative selling and relationship building at all levels of the organization. This role is your chance to bring One Drop‚Äôs game-changing program to self-insured employers and broker/consultant partners.  You'll Make An Impact By Identifying and securing qualified self-insured employer clients for One Drop‚Äôs multi-condition program Presenting to employer prospects via video calls, traveling to meet in person, and supporting One Drop at industry events Managing the volume and velocity of your sales funnel including signing new contracts and meeting or exceeding quota as measured by revenue/billings Establishing and building relationships with HR / Benefits decisions makers and working with regional broker/consultant partners as a way to open doors, generate qualified leads, and win business with new employer clients Collaborating with internal stakeholders to communicate customer needs and establish requirements to guide the program implementation process You'll bring: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business or related field 5+ years experience in direct sales with proven success selling HR/benefits SaaS or healthcare technology solutions to VP / Directors of HR and Employee Benefits Knowledge and understanding of health insurance, self-insured employers, chronic disease, healthcare systems, and employer benefits programs and processes Demonstrated experience and skills managing complex, multi-stakeholder deals Strong interpersonal, communication, account management, and relationship-building skills Proficiency with CRMs (Hubspot or Salesforce), Google Suite, and Microsoft Office Passion for helping people and the ability to energize and excite stakeholders at all levels within an organization  Bonus Points Experience selling digital chronic condition management solutions A personal connection to, or passion for diabetes care or related chronic conditions You'll get To deeply impact the lives of people with chronic conditions The opportunity to contribute at an early stage startup and help develop the future of healthcare Competitive salary and equity commensurate with experience and performance Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance and 401k plan Yearly Professional Development budget Unlimited vacation days Beautiful loft office space conveniently located in Downtown Austin Weekly catered lunches, company swag, company outings, and other surprises when you start One Drop is the future of healthcare. Our mission is to develop technology that ensures all people living with diabetes and other chronic conditions can thrive. We harness the power of data science and mobile computing to make healthcare more affordable, accessible, and effective.  Our clinically proven mobile platform combines AI-powered predictive insights, personalized health coaching, and FDA-approved connected devices to simplify self-care. And it works. People using the One Drop platform have seen significant improvements in their health in just a few weeks.  Today, the rate of people living with chronic conditions is increasing dramatically, and traditional approaches to healthcare cannot possibly scale to reach them all. We exist to serve those people and help them lead their best lives. www.onedrop.today  At One Drop, we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. One Drop provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. You will be responsible for identifying, qualifying, and closing sales either directly to customers or via established partners/resellers. Sales consist of medical hardware, software, and professional services. You, like us, are competitive yet collaborative and strive for excellence in your work. This is an ideal opportunity for a sales pro looking to be a role model and leader as we build a sales organization from the ground floor with unlimited upside potential. engagement and marketing strategies to generate and nurture leads Lead the creative design of marketing materials needed in the sales process Structure and negotiate SaaS licensing and professional services partnerships Confidently and credibly present healthcare data and licensing solutions by leading product presentations, demonstrations, conference calls, technical discussions/due diligence, executive discussions, web seminars and related activities Ability to translate software, technology, and data into a resonating value proposition from c-suite executives to end users  Proactive strategic partners Ability to understand the company‚Äôs unique selling points, and ensure these are communicated in a clear and concise manner in order to create new business opportunities  Preferred Qualifications:   5+ years of experience working in a sales or business development role with health technology, healthcare systems, medical groups, medical devices, and/or novel health monitoring devices (experience with SaaS sales a plus) Experience in regulated environments, and in managing and structuring alliances in the healthcare, wellness, medical device, pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or other related industries Ability to be persuasive, form relationships, tailor your message and deliver it to a variety of audiences Capacity to work in a dynamic, casual atmosphere where you will need to both work independently and seek out input from busy collaborators Ability to give honest and reasonable feedback as well as receive constructive critical input in a non-emotional manner Strong problem-solving, analysis, public speaking, and presentation skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, quickly changing startup environment Effective relationship-building and negotiation skills Excellent written and oral communication, and interpersonal skills Love meeting and talking to new people Willingness to travel (30-40%)  Benefits:  Our team is fully remote. Competitive compensation, including cash and equity compensation and health insurance reimbursement. Subsidized equipment and education. We are currently partnered with health centers, imaging centers, and clinics across the US and Asia offering our AI-driven DEXA scans, VO2max tests, RMR analysis, at-home lab tests, and disease detection tools.  We have just closed an early stage round of financing and onboarded several elite strategic advisors to help fuel our growth. If you are interested in joining us, please submit an application here.

Grammarly offers a remote-first hybrid working model . Team members can work primarily remotely. Starting in 2022, teams will meet in person every quarter in one of Grammarly‚Äôs hubs, currently in San Francisco, Vancouver, New York, and Kyiv. To ensure that teams are able to overlap in their working hours and to meet face-to-face when needed, all team members need to live within three time zones of their direct team.  Grammarly team members who will be collaborating at our San Francisco hub must be based in the United States.  The opportunity  Grammarly empowers people to thrive and connect, whenever and wherever they communicate. Every day, 30 million people and 30,000 teams around the world use our AI-powered writing assistant. All of this begins with our team collaborating in a values-driven and learning-oriented environment.  To achieve our ambitious goals, we‚Äôre looking for a Head of Sales Development to join our Sales organization. Grammarly Business has two existing teams of BDRs based in North America and Ukraine, and those teams currently report directly to the Head of Grammarly Business Sales. This role will report directly to the General Manager of Grammarly Business. The first global Head of Sales Development will formalize this function, integrate best-practice lead development motions with Marketing and Sales workflows, and scale up the teams to support our ambitious growth goals for 2022 and beyond.  Your impact  As the Head of Sales Development, your team and work will have high visibility. You will be a primary source of learning about the market for other teams and departments. You will manage ten people on day one, including the frontline manager of our Sales Development team in Kyiv. By the end of next year, you will manage upward of 30 HC.  You will be evaluated and compensated based on a mix of the BDR teams‚Äô performance, new deals closed, and role-modeling Grammarly‚Äôs EAGER values (Ethical, Adaptable, Gritty, Empathetic, and Remarkable). Compensation will evolve between year one and year two as BDR evolves into a best-practice motion, which you will define. This position will work closely with colleagues in Sales, including Chat, Self-Serve, Marketing (Demand Gen and Product Marketing), Growth, and Revenue Operations. Within your first 30 days, you will establish command over the product, first meeting doc, pitch, demo, and Command of the Message framework. You will understand core BDR metrics and drivers and develop hypotheses for improvement areas. By month three, you will establish operating cadence and reporting for day-to-day execution and implement initiatives targeting improvement in crucial drivers of BDR productivity. By month six and beyond, you will begin to capture repeatable gains in BDR productivity; establish core processes and playbooks, and start to hire new BDRs and scale the team. You will continue a trajectory of productivity improvement and prove professional-development pathways (e.g., Sr BDR, migration to Account Executive, etc.) We‚Äôre looking for someone who Embodies our EAGER values‚Äîis ethical, adaptable, gritty, empathetic, and remarkable. Has experience penetrating companies and capturing opportunities that are net new relationships for Sales. Has experience with VP+ prospects, in addition to middle management (director/manager), and demonstrates an ability to conceive of and execute outbound lead generation campaigns. Knowing how to sell on business value rather than a feature list. Uses systems (e.g., CRM) for pipeline management, lead routing, pipeline projection, and related. Can consider, play out, and weigh alternative scenarios based on strategic objectives. Relentlessly sets and pursues aggressive short- and long-term goals. Builds and deepens relationships with people, understanding their feelings, their goals, their fears, and their dreams. Support for you, professionally and personally Professional growth : We hire people we trust, and we give team members autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development with training, coaching, and regular feedback. A connected team : Grammarly builds a product that helps people connect, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative culture supported by our EAGER values. We also take time to celebrate our colleagues and accomplishments with global, local, and team-specific events and programs. Comprehensive benefits : Grammarly offers all team members competitive pay along with a benefits package that includes superior health care. We also offer support to set up a home office, ample and defined time off, gym and recreation stipends, admission discounts, and more. We encourage you to apply  At Grammarly, we value our differences, and we encourage all‚Äîespecially those whose identities are traditionally underrepresented in tech organizations‚Äîto apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Grammarly will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Grammarly is an equal opportunity employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program.  Please note that Grammarly‚Äôs COVID-19 vaccination policy requires that all team members in North America be vaccinated against COVID-19 to meet in person for Grammarly business or to work from a North America hub location. It is expected that this will be a requirement for this role. Qualified candidates in North America who cannot be vaccinated for medical reasons or because of a sincerely held religious belief may request a reasonable accommodation to this policy. For Ukraine, this policy requires team members to be vaccinated or produce a daily negative COVID-19 test administered at the Kyiv hub to work from the hub or attend in-person meetings.

description: *Drives the execution of sales strategies, relationship management, and best practices to effectively build a robust sales pipeline and meet/exceed annual sales quota. *Guides potential franchisees through the entire recruitment process from initial contact to disclosure, discovery day, and through agreement signing. *Ensures that all franchise sales activities are conducted within legal guidelines and with strict adherence to Franchise Disclosure Document (FDD) regulations. *Proactively seeks and pursues qualified candidates in target markets. Builds rapport and relationships with existing franchise partners and new prospects to promote brand growth. *Facilitates the receipt and completion of all required documentation necessary for prospect approval. *Guides potential franchise partners through research and education about the franchise opportunity. *Develops plans to achieve targeted growth and profitability within assigned territory. *Works to identify potential new market and business opportunities. *Confers with department staff, develops and reviews activity and forecast reports. *Participates in industry trade associations for networking, keeping abreast of current trends and promoting Company sales initiatives.

Overview  Topgolf is the ultimate venue for FUN! We have a high energy, high volume food and beverage and entertainment concept that is like nothing else you have seen. We are seeking a Director of Sales for our new location to recruit, coach, mentor and lead our local Sales team, build strong community partnerships, network and introduce the awesome Topgolf brand to a new market!  If you are a current B2C Sales Leader that lights up the room when you enter, capable of showing others the influence and finesse of sales, and love the opportunity and challenge that comes with introducing our Topgolf concept to a new part of the nation, we would love to hear from you!  Topgolf participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.  Responsibilities Include  Key Responsibilities Mentoring, coaching and motivating the Topgolf team to exceed the quarterly and annual team sales goals set for the Topgolf site Perform revenue forecasts and win/loss reports that illustrate your team‚Äôs overall performance against quotas Creates sales campaigns focused on communicating and nurturing relationships with guests and driving repeat sales Conduct market analysis and devise strategies for generating new business Work closely with the National Director of Sales and Events and our Corporate Marketing Team Provide leadership to the day-to-day operations of the sales team, while maintaining focus on the company strategic goals Establish performance goals for sales team and monitors performance on a continual basis Develop, or participate with Senior Staff in the development of the Strategic Marketing Plan Ability to communicate effectively with new guests, return guests, co-workers and management Strong computer skills, particularly with Excel, Word and CRM Applications Ability to excel and multitask in a fast-paced environment Knowledge of local area business and existing client database Friendly, positive, outgoing personality who relates well and gets along with people Requirements Include  Key Qualifications Minimum 7+ years current Sales experience, preferable in hospitality, restaurant or entertainment venue focused on event sales 3+ years current B2C sales team management experience to include entry and mid experience levels Bachelors Degree either in Business Administration or Marketing, preferred. Will also consider applicants with relevant work history Topgolf is a global sports and entertainment community and is committed to equal opportunity and is firmly committed to preventing discrimination and harassment, including sexual misconduct, based on legally protected diversity characteristics (such as race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family status, citizenship, genetic information and veteran status) in its application and hiring processes and in its employment decisions. As an affirmative action employer, Topgolf also takes steps to prevent retaliation and to create a respectful, equitable and inclusive environment for our Guests, Associates, business partners, vendors, and the communities we serve.

description: We are looking for a passionate, results & data-driven sales leader that will manage and lead all disciplines of the sales process, including prospecting, qualifying, and closing business to hit revenue targets. In this role, you will play an essential part in taking our business to the next level by driving accelerated revenue growth. The successful candidate will be pro-active, entrepreneurial in spirit and have a proven record of leading and developing a sales team to exceed revenue targets.  Main Duties & Responsibilities:  Strategic leadership  ¬∑         Identify and introduce DNA‚Äôs Sales KPIs, articulate why particular KPIs are used and how they tie to the overall business goals  ¬∑         Prospect and own a sustainable business pipeline, accurately forecasting revenue growth to achieve targets  ¬∑         Define the steps in the buying funnel, work closely with marketing and customer success teams to deeply integrate activities and performance metrics within the funnel  ¬∑         Build out Salesforce structure to match DNA‚Äôs business cycles  ¬∑         Work with business finance lead to develop sales org sizing strategies to maximize revenue opportunities  ¬∑         Work with Business Finance and HR to develop sales compensation plans that are oriented to DNA strategic goals and talent retention  ¬∑         Detail and present sales activity and results during senior and executive budget meetings  Revenue Generation   ¬∑         Work with Product, Strategy, and Finance teams to develop a pricing strategy for individual product lines and markets  ¬∑         Develop revenue generation sales budget & plans for each of DNA‚Äôs TAMs   ¬∑         Ensure that the agreed strategic value proposition is consistently communicated and developed to the customer base via the sales team  ¬∑         Actively participate in client interaction; assist in negotiation and closing significant deals when needed  Work with Small, Medium and Enterprise customers (SME) to create the correct product solution mix  People and Process   ¬∑         Create a high performing, energized, and driven sales team culture, emphasizing reward and recognition  ¬∑         Work closely with Operations to build out CRM user processes and define reporting requirements to meet KPIs tracking  ¬∑         Work with Operations to define requirements for all sales tools to enable business goals  ¬∑         Partner with the HR team to ensure the team has the required knowledge, skills, and development plans  ¬∑         Effectively coach, mentor, and evaluate staff, delivering timely feedback, discipline, counselling, and performance reviews  Market Orientation  ¬∑         Maintain a deep understanding of market competitors, knowledge, and trends, including evolving technologies, client needs, expectations, and opportunities, shifts in the competitive landscape, operational efficiencies, and opportunities  ¬∑         Deliver product feedback to DNA leaders to ensure the voice of the customer is recognized  ¬∑         Develop and build relationships with the key internal Informa stakeholders.  ¬∑         Regularly attend in-person events & conferences, globally, to meet with customers and other members of the Informa Markets teams  ¬∑         Other responsibilities as assigned.    Qualifications     Essential  ¬∑         Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant business / technology discipline, or equivalent experience  ¬∑         A proven track record of progressive international sales leadership experience building and managing high performing sales teams to meet and exceed revenue goals  ¬∑         Strong ability to interpret data to build strategy and deliver commercial results  ¬∑         Demonstrated ability to own forecast revenue model and proactive reporting  ¬∑         Experience leading agency, third-party or direct B2B/enterprise field sales and customer/client success teams  ¬∑         Robust understanding of emerging digital media platforms, data targeting, ad- serving technologies  ¬∑         Demonstrated strategic, consultative, and analytical sales approach with focus on building partnerships with advertisers and brand-owner  ¬∑         Awareness and understanding of the importance of maximizing enterprise technology and systems and an ability to feedback into their design  ¬∑         Excellent aptitude for scaling up and developing high-performance sales teams, including team building, coaching, motivating, strategic thinking, business acumen, leadership, and sales techniques  ¬∑         Strong strategic, interpersonal, communication, collaboration, organizational, and time-management skills, and ability to execute initiatives within the team, company and client relationships  ¬∑         Excellent presentation, negotiation and closing skills with proven outstanding client relationship skills  ¬∑         Pro-active, resourceful and responsive to change ‚Äì thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with a strong sense of urgency  ¬∑         Demonstrates high levels of energy, integrity, judgment, and emotional intelligence.    Additional Information  We offer:  Competitive Compensation Package Access to LinkedIn Learning and other development/training opportunities Health and Wellness Benefits (medical, dental, eye) 401K and Matching Employee Stock Purchase Program Generous PTO policy Work-life balance Additional discounts through various partnerships We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute a regional sales plan to identify, nurture, and grow sales opportunities; Promote and Sell Geneyx products to achieve territory sales goals Manage and maintain clinical account/contact details within Geneyx‚Äôs CRM database Leverage CRM and other tools/reports to grow sales from existing customer base and expand the customer base in assigned territory. description: General Function  At Merrell, we believe everyone deserves to experience the simple power of being outside. From mountain trails to parks and playgrounds, we all belong in the outdoors. No matter our shape, our size or our race. So we're proud to make durable and versatile products that help get more of us outside together.  The Director of Sales will develop and lead the execution of all brand sales and distribution strategies and programs within the assigned area in order to deliver planned revenue & profit goals. Manage team, service & promotion, & generates sales.  Primary Duties Lead the development of sales, distribution, and customer relations management strategies for the US wholesale business Drive revenue and profitability through in-depth wholesaler knowledge, account and margin analysis, detailed progress reviews and creative thinking. Lead the development of the brand‚Äôs annual sales budget and regional and key account sales plans Work with internal and external resources to develop and manage the brand‚Äôs go-to-market strategies, programs and assets. Communicates vision to all relevant customers Lead internal and external teams in the development of tools that support sales and distribution strategies and programs to meet or exceed established sales plans Delivers feedback to all members of the team on an ongoing basis to ensure clarity of performance against objectives throughout the year Collaborate with the brand‚Äôs marketing team to help develop and execute sales and marketing programs to drive the brand with targeted retailers & consumers Collaborate with the brand‚Äôs marketing team and key retailers to deliver a strong return on co-op dollars Communicates on an ongoing basis with the Product, Merchandising and Finance Teams, as to the realities of performance and opportunities compared to industry and competition Collaborate with the brand‚Äôs product creation team to develop global product assortment and comprehensive sales programs and materials to support the launch of each seasonal product line Lead the development and execution of a plan to consistently and objectively measure the effectiveness of the brand‚Äôs sales programs and investments Performs duties consistent with the company‚Äôs AAP/EEO goals and policies Performs other duties as required/assigned by manager Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required Bachelor‚Äôs degree in related field or equivalent work experience. 10+ years of sales experience in wholesale footwear. 3-5 years of management experience. Strong experience in working with retailers on a cooperative basis, beyond simply ‚Äúselling‚Äù product into the wholesale channel. Experience in the Outdoor or Sporting Goods channel, specifically Specialty Wholesale Footwear. Strong experience in recruiting, managing, and motivating sales reps and agents (both internal and independent). The ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships both internally and externally. Excellent oral and written communication skills, including a high comfort level with public speaking and presenting. The ability to multi-task, combining strategy and execution; and a willingness to step in to get the job done. Proficient in MS Office (word, excel, power point, etc.) A track record of effectively working to a budget and measuring results. WORKING CONDITIONS  Normal office & field environment. Extensive travel required.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills which may be required.  Committed to a diverse workforce, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled).

Reporting to the Senior Director, Global Sales, the Global Account Director is responsible for growing the groups and meetings segment through strategic partnerships with key Corporate, Association, Government and Leisure Accounts. They are responsible for developing account plans and market strategies, to maximize share of B2B business for Sonesta Hotels.  We are looking for a motivated sales-professional with a successful track record within a global sales organization or a regional sales capacity for a branded hotel company with demonstrated ability to build mutually beneficial complex customer relationships. The successful candidate will be extremely self-driven, possess excellent communication and customer-relations skills and have solid business acumen. The role is based is a remote position requiring frequent travel throughout the US.      Job Description  The job environment is fast paced and results oriented. The successful candidate will employ proactive measures to achieve the desired account and revenue objectives. The role is collaborative with on property sellers and leaders.  Principle Duties And Responsibilities (Essential Functions) Include Operational/Functional: Develop effective group presentations that articulate the value proposition of Sonesta Hotels. Manage the RFP Process for Groups and Meetings with respect to relevant accounts within a managed portfolio. Maintain timely and clear communication with internal and external customers. Grow relationships at the appropriate levels, both internally and externals (hotels and customers) to enable the development and advancement of sales results. Clearly articulate visions, goals and benefits of Sonesta Hotels. Liaise with Hotel leadership as appropriate to development mutually beneficial agreements that yield favorable returns. Utilizes a proactive approach to selling and meeting segment objectives. Properly track and log activities and leads in Delphi for accurate reporting and data capture. Exercises an effective turnover of group leads to Hotels once business is confirmed. Strategy and Planning: Function as the ‚Äúvoice of the customer‚Äù to represent customer insights to key corporate personnel and Sonesta senior leadership. Candidate has an understanding of Strategic Meetings Management Programs (SMMP) and the ability to propose solutions that are mutually beneficial. Ability to set up and lead customer business reviews working; collaborating with other GSO Directors as appropriate. Implement strategic account management: utilize all available sales resources to develop multiple contacts, research various divisions/departments within an organization for full account qualification. Identify research and develop an account development plan to expand existing base of key accounts to enhance global sales revenues by expanding Sonesta‚Äôs existing customer base within a specific geographic territory and the prospecting of new leads. Having a deep knowledge of customer procurement strategies, structure, businesses, and synergies in alignment with Sonesta. Develop strong working relationships with Sonesta International Hotel DOSMs and Business Travel Sellers to ensure collaborative management approach and seamless interactions with customers. Understand hotel positioning and strategies as relate to key accounts under global management. Ability to develop relationships at the Buyer and string influencer level. Customize and effectively socialize Sonesta‚Äôs value proposition to meet the needs of the Meeting Planners, their customers and end users. Ability to effectively track performance against success metrics and apply customized solutions to favorable outcomes. Apply a thoughtful approach to choosing the right events or Tradeshows to invest in. Financial Management: Manage and Optimize annual revenue goal and to achieve YOY key account revenue growth (room nights, ADR and revenue) Ability to work with Revenue Management to provide guidance on global pricing for customers under management and to share information related to customer feedback on future year expectations. Ability to negotiate a customized commission structure for favorable returns to Sonesta Hotels. Ability to track and effectively articulate ROI on Tradeshow and Meeting Planning investments. Interact with outside contacts: Oversee designated portfolio of managed groups and meetings accounts, establish strategic B2B relationships and represent Sonesta in key industry associations and events. Have existing strategic relationships at the Groups and Meetings Buyer level with several Corporate and Association Accounts with potential in Sonesta markets. Promote and reposition the Sonesta brand to decision makers by analyzing needs, mapping business opportunities, creating strategies and measuring growth realized at Sonesta. Promoting and repositioning the Sonesta brand to decision makers by analyzing needs, mapping business opportunities, creating strategies and measuring growth realized at Sonesta International relative to account level results. Present company value proposition to all level of decision makers, be comfortable with presenting at a minimum at a VP level but at the C-Level where opportunity arises. Ensuring client and hotel satisfaction by facilitating positive, long-term relationships with both customers and Sonesta Hotels International. Network at key industry events and trade shows. Accountability: Responsible for individual performance and incremental contribution to Sonesta hotels. Responsible for effectively managing time commitments Responsible for meeting and/or exceeding revenue and room night targets Candidate is expected to learn and understand roles, responsibilities and business of the clients with whom we partner with. Responsible for using the appropriate account management tools to effectively track activities, opportunities and follow up. Responsible for producing and reporting on ROI on segment investments. Leading with Passion Contribute positive energy within Sonesta Hotels. Demonstrate the ability to lead the sales efforts within the territory, with hotel participation, to increase overall revenue from all market segments. Seek input and opinions from all relevant parties and secure all facts prior to making decisions. Model proper selling techniques, effective development of others, and a commitment to the industry and to professional development. Interact on behalf of the Global Sales Team with the hotels throughout the portfolio to ensure a degree of visibility and leadership is demonstrated on behalf of the GSO. Function as the Voice of the Customer to represent customer insights to key corporate personnel and Sonesta senior leadership. . Lead by example and operate with integrity and respect. Work to achieve goals while overcoming competitive obstacles and planning alternate ways to win. Show strong passion and commitment about reaching targets. Supporting team efforts by participating in cross-functional projects as needed in a SME (subject matter expert role) Celebrate individual and team success Maintain a positive, ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude and a versatile approach to change     Benefits  Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Health Savings Account with Company Match 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match Paid Vacation and Sick Days Sonesta Hotel Discounts Educational Assistance Paid Parental Leave Company Paid Life Insurance Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance Various Employee Perks and Discounts Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.  #IND2  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: Fashion brands play a key role in shaping the consumers mindsets, setting the next trend, and to a large extent, impacting the earth‚Äôs ecosystem. As the leading global solutions provider of textile dyes and chemicals, we are the change agent too!  Here is a great opportunity to champion growth in our Brands Sales vertical, globally. If you‚Äôre passionate about leading teams, driving change, and get excited talking about Brands, this role would be for you.  Position can be based in US/Europe. Learn more about the role:  As The Global Brand Sales Director, You Will  Develop Brand and Retail (B&R) Sales Strategy as part of overall business strategy by creating concepts and delivery vehicles: Define focus B&Rs to be targeted Design programs with target products to be specified by B&R Determine B&R trends and translate into solutions that we can provide with existing products Set Annual Sales Target as a result of B&R specifications/recommendations B&R Develop ideas for innovation based on market needs and trends Define communication strategy targeting Ensure implementation of B&R Strategy via development of BAPs (Brand Account Plans): Work with Sales Team to budget and forecast converting BAPs into KAPs and handing over to Sales Follow up implementation of BAPs at mill level by communication and relentless follow through to successful completion of the program and further specified programs Map the value chain of focus international brands & retailers, understand decision making process, manage multi-level contacts / close working relationships to influence specification decision and channel it to HM‚Äôs direct mill customers and convert to sales at the mill level. Understands the decision-making process, product development cycles which influence specification, nomination, and recommendation of dyes & chemicals. Reliable, making realistic commitments and following up and maintaining a positive attitude even when outcome may not be positive. Ability to clearly demonstrate the link between own activities and product sales. Capability to develop Brand Profiles and Key Account Development Plans. Native in English. Spanish would be an asset as second language. Huntsman offers unsurpassed opportunities to build a successful future. Our diverse portfolio creates a range of career fields including manufacturing, research and development, technical services, sales and marketing, customer service ‚Äì and the list goes on.  Here, you can make an impact and make a difference. Come join us.  Huntsman is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation and/or expression or any other characteristic protected by law in every location in which we have facilities national or local.  Please refer to https://www.huntsman.com/privacy/online-privacy-notice for Company‚Äôs Data Privacy and Protection information.  All unsolicited resumes presented by recruitment agencies are treated as pro bono information or service.  Huntsman is aware of a scam involving fraudulent job offers. Huntsman does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview. Please be advised that emails from Huntsman always end in ‚Äú@huntsman.com‚Äù and that any job offer that requires payment or requires you to deposit a check is likely a scam. description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  Teva is searching for two Area Business Sales Directors (ABD) to lead our psychiatry sales team. The incumbents will be part of the newly created sales team focused on the psychiatry space and responsible for the performance of a yet-to-be-approved long-acting injectable therapy for schizophrenia. The ABDs will hire, onboard, and build out an entire sales team comprising of 14 (split between 2) Regional Sales Managers and 8-10 Sales Associates within each region. The ABD will be responsible for achieving and delivering area results in a compliant and ethical manner. The ABD will possess an understanding of organizational objectives and align resources appropriately to meet those objectives. While pursuing their goals, the ABD will uphold the culture and values of Teva in all interactions and business matters. These individuals will execute the hiring strategy, work closely with sales training to ensure proper training is executed, coach the RSM team on business planning, and lead the entire team from the front on performance, process, and people initiatives. Additionally, the ABDs will effectively and efficiently plan and complete all business activities via aligned objectives and analytics while maximizing available resources and partners. The ABDs will be working closely with all internal stake holders for TV46000 and be the point persons for all brand input, strategic insights, targeting, planning, and overall execution. The ABDs will possess impactful and influential communication and presentation skills and keep the objective in mind while moving the sales teams towards sales goals.  Essential Areas Of Responsibility  The following areas of responsibility are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any incumbent, with reasonable accommodation if necessary. Any nonessential functions are assumed to be included in other related duties or assignments. Identify, recruit, hire, coach, and retain top talent for the TV46000, Psychiatry Sales Team Develop expertise and lead leaders on regional business focus areas, including settings of care, payer, and pull-through opportunities, and flawless execution of the marketing and call plan strategy Develop effective business plans to meet and exceed national sales goals. Teach and coach the regional managers on effective business planning Coach/train RSMs on different settings of care to identify key business opportunities Lead all internal stakeholders of TV46000 across market access, sales operations, branding, and sales training Adhere to and ensure the sales team complies with all Teva guidelines and operates with integrity Review and create data reports to identify trends, address concerns, and capitalize on positive trends Develop and implement incentive plan at launch with close interaction with Sales Operations and Human Resources Coach team towards success from hire date onward, providing appropriate guidance, encouragement, and oversight to ensure effective execution of brand strategy Spend 4 days/month in the field, creating relationships with treating HCPs and supporting local RSMs and sales team Qualifications  Any equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience that fulfills the requirements of the position will be considered.  Education/Certification/Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree required Minimum of 10+ years in pharmaceutical industry including customer-facing positions required Minimum of 5+ years of regional sales management or similar type of people management required Record of achieving sales goals and building, coaching, and developing effective sales teams required Home office experience or field experience in market access/reimbursement strongly preferred Experience in psychiatric therapeutic areas preferred Experience successfully launching products in the psychiatric space across multiple settings of care preferred Buy-and-bill and specialty pharmacy experience preferred Skills/Knowledge/Abilities Understanding of reimbursement coverage and pull-through strategies as well as experience in all pertinent settings of business (CMHC, specialty pharmacy, private practice) Excellent written and verbal communication skills required Valid US driver‚Äôs license and acceptable driving record required The ideal candidate should live within 25 miles from a major hub airport or be located near the Parsippany home office, which is in the Eastern Time Zone. Meetings typical start at 8am/9am EST. Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless an accommodation is legally required) prior to the first day of Teva employment. As required by applicable law, however, Teva will consider requests for reasonable accommodations.  Additionally, U.S. new hires for customer facing roles will be required to complete all credentialing requirements for access to their customers‚Äô targets within 60 days of their start date. Such credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional vaccinations and medical testing. Any request for an exception to the credentialing requirements will need to be approved by the national sales leader within the first 60 days of employment.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS - Approximately 30% - 40% travel throughout the US, which may include weekend and overnight travel.  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Already Working @TEVA? You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. description: RLS LLC designed, engineered and developed the first press-to-connect fittings for the HVAC and refrigeration industries. Today, there are millions of RLS fittings installed worldwide, and the original, patented, proven RLS product line remains the only line of refrigerant press fittings in the world to be UL Listed to 700 psi.  RLS is part of Marmon Holdings, Inc., a Berkshire Hathaway company. Marmon is a global industrial organization with revenues exceeded $8.1 billion in 2019. High technical competence, customer-oriented thinking and sustainability determine their actions and have been the basis of the company's success since 1820.  Role Purpose This position is responsible for the overall sales performance/growth of the RLS accounts. Including communications, support, measurement and management of the accounts. This role will coordinate with others in the organization to ensure exceptional customer service for RLS accounts.  This role will be remote, but candidates must live in the Greater Chicago, IL area with ability to travel throughout the state of Illinois.  Core Responsibilities Responsible for the overall sales performance of RLS Accounts. Maintain a contact program with key accounts Perform market studies with the goal of producing sales and marketing plans that identify opportunities to develop new business within the plumbing wholesale industry Develop strategies to maximize market penetration. Assist in establishing sales budget along with expense budget that supports the business plan for plumbing wholesale markets. Responsible for meeting company‚Äôs annual sales budget. Review and analyze product penetration, gross margin, sales goal, new customers, and frequency of purchases. Provide input to marketing on regional competitive pricing, competitor intelligence and general market conditions. Proactively develop strategies to acquire new customers and identify opportunities to grow existing customer‚Äôs sales. Coordinate special pricing and rebate programs and insure that proper communications are made both internally and externally. Complete special projects and perform other duties as assigned. Responsible for providing monthly updates on territory performance and for developing ongoing forecasts for new and existing customers.  Competencies and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent of education and experience 7+ years‚Äô experience in sales, preferably in plumbing or HVAC fields. Experience in outside sales, preferably experience selling to plumbing wholesale accounts Experience managing day to day sales and account activity Proven track record of generating profitable and measured business growth in previous roles. Strong customer orientation Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Must display strong organizational and interpersonal skills and be able to effectively manage. Prior experience in a multi-faceted and fast-paced environment and prioritize and accomplish goals within specified time frames. Must be proficient with the use of databases, spreadsheets and related computer programs. Must be results oriented and self-motivated. Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Veteran  Working Conditions: 1. Remote office working environment. 2. Secondarily Air conditioned/heated manufacturing facility with possible exposure to noise; dust; fumes; physical, chemical, and biohazards; solvents, oils, and detergents. 3. Ability to travel up to 75%

description: We are looking for a competent, motivated, and ambitious Sales Director to join our dynamic team. If you love finding new business opportunities and managing relationships with customers, this job is for you.   The Sales Director will drive new business in Asia Pacific Region by developing direct and indirect sales channels and closing business directly with end-customers as a means to meet or exceed revenue goals. The individual will work with the VP of Sales to help define marketing and sales activities related mainly in the assigned geographic territory; follow up on sales leads; conduct presentations and demos of solutions; generate proposals; and manage contracts through deal closing.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: ‚Ä¢ Develop sales opportunities by researching the industry and identifying potential accounts. ‚Ä¢ Work with VP of Sales to develop and execute sales strategies; create a large pipeline of business within a short period of time; identify new opportunities to grow business, increase sales, and broaden brand and product recognition. ‚Ä¢ Own the sales cycle ‚Äì from lead generation to closure. ‚Ä¢ Understand, interpret and provide technical information and explanations. ‚Ä¢ Assess competitors by analyzing and summarizing competitor information and trends; identify sales opportunities. ‚Ä¢ Generate new and repeat sales leads and opportunities by providing product knowledge, technical information, and exceptional service to customers to win market share. ‚Ä¢ Create and develop customer sales proposals, pricing quotes, and bid support. ‚Ä¢ Keep updated on product and industry knowledge to communicate regularly with senior management with new business updates and related activities, including trends, competition, and sales initiatives. ‚Ä¢ Utilize CRM system to track, manage and analyze sales activities and trends. ‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve quality of sales by following standards and recommending improved policies and procedures. ‚Ä¢ Continually update job knowledge by studying new product descriptions and participating in educational opportunities. ‚Ä¢ Accomplish department and organizational goals by accepting ownership of role. Explore additional opportunities for adding value to the position. ‚Ä¢ Meet Sales Goals, build Client Base ‚Ä¢ Perform other related duties as assigned by management.  QUALIFICATIONS: ‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree (B.S.E.E. or B.S.C.E. ) from four-year college or university and five years of related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. ‚Ä¢ Ability to speak Korean is a plus. ‚Ä¢ Proven 3 years of with IOT sales. ‚Ä¢ Telecommunication experience is a plus. ‚Ä¢ Experience in Programming, FAE Technical support, and Product Management is a plus. ‚Ä¢ At least 5 years of Sales and Business Development selling technology enabling solutions to system integrators, M2M service providers, and OEM companies of all sorts. ‚Ä¢ Strong new business development, client relationship management, and sales forecasting experience. ‚Ä¢ Demonstrated achievement of high sales rankings and recognition in past sales positions. Track record of sales success in the OEM, Agriculture, Oil and Gas, or Vehicle Telematics. ‚Ä¢ Assertive team player, nimble and intelligent with the ability to identify and close business. ‚Ä¢ Comfortable discussing a wide array of products and technologies, and at ease interacting with highly trained technology professionals. ‚Ä¢ Great communication skills with superior listening skills. ‚Ä¢ Developed problem-solving and negotiation skills. ‚Ä¢ Solid knowledge of the entire sales cycle including tracking/updating accounts, forecasting sales activity, and reporting weekly/monthly to management. ‚Ä¢ Effectively and simultaneously manage multiple opportunities at various stages of the sales cycle. ‚Ä¢ Proficiency in prospecting new accounts and closing orders.

We are looking for a highly professional, experienced, high energy Sales and Marketing Executive who has excellent communication skills, is well networked and has a strong work ethic to help build our business and scale across the USA. The candidate must possess strong presentation skills in a client facing role, be a self-starter and comfortable in a C-Suite environment.  Your main tasks will be the following:  ¬∑ Prospect, identify and qualify new business opportunities relating to the company‚Äôs market, products, services, and sales goals in the US ¬∑ Work with senior executives and marketing to determine and execute sales plans to meet organizational needs in the US ¬∑ Build and manage current client relationships and set up and conduct exploratory meetings with potential new clients to gain insight on how Auxadi can meet customer‚Äôs needs. (accurately forecast on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis by account) ¬∑ Monitor the market and competitor products and activities and provide sales/market intelligence to Auxadi detailed sales forecasting. ¬∑ Follow-up on marketing qualified leads with the goal of turning them into new customers ¬∑ Work with the Marketing department to develop marketing initiatives, content as well as participate in events, seminars, webinars, conferences to build and develop brand awareness in the US Who do we think can fit? This position requires a bachelor‚Äôs degree. Master degree in business-related subjects (business administration, accounting, tax, finance, etc.) will be a plus. Candidates need extensive experience in business development or sales in a rapidly growing company. Ideally 5+ years and preferably in professional services firms‚Äô corporate services or outsourcing services and in a leadership position.  What should you expect?  Expect a very demanding environment, where processes and technology are key and where multiculturalism would be your day to day.  Do you fit? And while the heart of Calm is digital, we are growing and expanding offline with a variety of products and services to help deliver on our mission of health and happiness, the world over.  Calm is the world‚Äôs #1 brand for mental fitness and our B2B team is furthering our mission to make the world happier and healthier by bringing our offering into the employee benefits space. jumbo space Build relationships with key employer stakeholders to move deals through stages to close, including people ops and benefits leaders as well as senior executive leaders Work with sales wins while managing longer, complex sales cycles Collect market intelligence and competitive information Craft a phenomenal first impression to our prospects and customers by providing them with a best-in-class experience and pleasant encounter with customer service Achieve quotas of sourced qualified opportunities and closed business Co-sell some deals with account executives and sales leadership Prioritize opportunities and apply appropriate resources Collaborate in a fast-paced environment with multiple teams  Who You Are: 7+ years of enterprise sales experience 5+ years of sales description: Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Principal Account Executive to join an exciting and rapidly growing team responsible for bringing Amazon Care to new enterprise customers. The Principal Account Executive is responsible for prospecting directly into Large Enterprise benefit buyers and also building and growing relationships with consultants and brokers on a local, regional and national scope. This role works closely with product, marketing and clinicals teams to deliver ROI for our customers. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations and work backwards to deliver on their health and productivity goals. You should be a self-starter who is not afraid to ‚Äòget hands dirty‚Äô with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers‚Äô biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is re-imagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon‚Äôs virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon‚Äôs culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we‚Äôre building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities include Build sales opportunities with benefit buyers through inbound lead generation as well as self-generated outbound prospecting Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to deliver healthcare innovation Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography  Basic Qualifications 10+ years of professional experience in large enterprise business solution sales or business description: About The Brand  Clinique, a trailblazer with first-ever line of dermatologist-developed skin care, develops products that are safe for skin through efficacious formulas. Ensure strong visual presence in store, in local market and on retailer.com (e.g., outposts, out-of-home ads, merchandising) Work extremely closely with Trade Marketing, Consumer Engagement and Account & Sales Planning to ensure strong business decisions on marketing, assortment, stock levels, sampling, sets, exclusives and gifts tailored to retailers‚Äô customers Solicit input, buy-in and executional support from retailers Business Responsibilities Own key P&L items for account and determine spend to maximize ROI and sales; held to seasonal targets (retail sales, net sales, demo, co-op, freelance, promo, GWP, sets, capex). Shape execution of these items with the retailer With finance, reviews door P&Ls seasonally (prep‚Äôd by finance) to analyze outliers/ensure more profitable & productive doors Negotiates freelance investment with retailer and monitors productivity/effectiveness (e.g., hour utilization, open positions) monthly and communicates to field; sets total investment for field to allocate and execute by door Manage distribution expansion with the retailer; ensure changes are communicated to Field teams Support launch of new channels for the brand as needed Structure Organized by account/channel based on account priority Is strongly connected to both the Account and the NY office, requiring frequent travel Empowered to make decisions Trade Marketing dotted line to this role Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree required; MBA a plus. 10+ years relevant professional experience Strong relationship builder; strong business acumen and financial ability Extensive business experience and analytical skills (i.e., P&L management, main drivers of business, savvy with standard business analyses) Solid understanding of primary levers and components to a successful marketing campaign Strategic thinker and able to lay out a cohesive and clearly articulated strategy to drive the brand Clear and engaging presentation and communication skills Strong project management capabilities with extreme attention to detail Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office tools Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Domestic travel required within US Job Sales  Primary Location US-NY-New York  Job Type Standard  Schedule Full-time  Shift 1st (Day) Shift  Job Number 2113723  We are an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Director Of Sales And Business Development
description: StockFink is a Spanish Artificial Intelligence Start-up which has integrally designed an algorithm that scans and predicts the assets in each financial market on a daily basis in order to identify the best opportunities, and predict their variability range in the following 5 days.  Our goal is to democratize stock trading & investing through artificial intelligence based recommendations & financial education.  We have recently launched a commercial MVP in Spain, and after a successful proof-of-concept in the Ibex35, we are actively looking for partners to scale and professionalize the company. We are looking for a sales & business development director to help us launch our product in other markets and countries, as well as developing our B2B & affiliate programs.  Responsibilities: Lead the development of our B2C: ‚Ä¢ Finding local strategic partners to launch new international markets. ‚Ä¢ Expand to other financial instruments (crypto, derivatives) ‚Ä¢ Defining and developing affiliate programs with financial & also generic media institutions to gain exposure.  Lead the development of our B2B: ‚Ä¢ Defining and developing partnerships with brokers. ‚Ä¢ Defining and developing partnerships with banks (prediction service provided to their clients). ‚Ä¢ Work towards the creation of StockFink hedge fund (we have developed more sophisticated HFT algorithms intended for our own use).  We offer stock options based on achievements/performance.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?  Reporting to the Vice President of Defense and Space, Original Equipment Customer Business Team, the candidate will be a strong, dynamic and experienced leader responsible for driving growth, operational excellence and customer loyalty across all Raytheon, Bell and various US customer platforms and programs. You will lead and develop a direct team of Customer Business Managers and Development Program Mangers and provide cross-functional leadership to the extended Customer Core Team (PMO, C&PS, FSE, E&T, ISC, Contracts, Legal, Finance, Marketing, Technical Sales and Business Development).  You will be responsible for developing the customer strategy, achieving growth, increasing profitability, demonstrating flawless program execution, increasing customer satisfaction and direct responsibility for all components related to strategic account leadership for Raytheon and other key customer accounts as assigned. The successful candidate should have the proven ability to build strong teams and to consistently deliver on yearly AOP commitments.  This role has broad executive engagement across all customer lines of business and will also interface with Honeywell Aerospace executive management and all Aerospace GBE Product Line Leaders. Up to 50% travel is required.  Key Responsibilities  Your responsibilities will be in three key areas: Customer Strategy for Growth, Operational Execution and Team Leadership and Development.  Customer Strategy For Growth Identify and win new growth opportunities within all customer business segments Develop and execute broad strategies to secure short- and long-term business Deliver winning proposals and strong, customer specific, value propositions Establish and cultivate customer relationships with key stakeholders at all organization levels Validate and achieve 3-year and 5-year Strategic Plan (STRAP) Operational Execution Achieve business objectives and customer commitments impacting P/L financials Achieve development program milestones with expected SPI and CPI performance Improve delivery, quality, and the entire order to collection process for working capital Lead negotiations and conflict resolution for all business aspects with the strategic account Obtain a high OEM production forecast accuracy and ensure robust SIOP demand planning Team Leadership And Development Provide leadership and coaching to direct, and matrixed, reports. Identify, assess, acquire, and develop the critical skills and behaviors for the customer strategy Establish the right goals, metrics, rewards, and recognition aligned to a high performing organization Develop and maintain a robust succession plan Key Success Factors Growth (Pipeline Expansion, Wins and Orders) AOP Financials (Revenue, Margin) Development Program Performance (SPI, CPI, EAC, Milestone Fidelity) Working Capital (ARPD, WADC) SIOP Metrics (Firming, Forecast Accuracy) Customer Satisfaction (VOC) You Must Have Bachelor's degree required in Business or Engineering. Minimum 10 years of program / business management or engineering experience. Minimum 5 years of leadership experience with large, diverse teams. Active, or ability to obtain, Security Clearance Due to export control restrictions, must be a US Citizen We Value Master's degree or Advanced Degree preferred PMP certification desirable Strong analytical and financial skills Track record of exceeding financial targets Effectively getting results in a matrixed organization structure Clear communication and vision setting skills Executive presence and interfacing with customers at all levels of the organization Developing and fostering strong customer relationships Strategic mindset to scope tasks and achieve goals Passion for winning Timely decision making in the face of complexity and ambiguity Knowledge of DoD planning, programming, budgeting and execution. Ensuring customer satisfaction (delivery, quality, reliability) Effective coaching/mentoring skills Ability to develop personnel in direct and indirect reporting relationship Additional Information JOB ID: HRD133090 Category: Sales Location: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.
