description: SafeGraph is bringing on a sales leader to hire, onboard, develop, and manage a team of Account Executives. Our team runs a consultative sales process with sophisticated data science customers across many verticals including retail, real estate, financial services, and advertising. As we continue to scale our sales engine, strong leadership will be key to success.  This role will report to the SVP of Revenue.  Opportunity to: Partner across organization to continually improve resources and process enabling the AE team Track and manage sales pipeline, provide AE's with coaching on how to progress deals, and deliver weekly revenue forecasts to management Identify essential sales performance metrics and ensure AE's are performing in all key areas of sales process Work with top data science and machine learning teams Become an expert in SafeGraph's data products & value proposition  About you: 3+ years of experience as Sales Rep in closing role, exceeding quota 2+ years of experience directly managing team of closing sales reps Ability to manage a sales pipeline to hit or exceed team quotas Obsessed with finding creative solutions to problems Impeccable customer skills: communication, empathy, integrity At least 80% of the people you have worked with put you in the top 10% of people they have worked with Nice-to-have: Experience selling Data and/or to a technical buyer  About SafeGraph: Our goal is to be the dominant place to get any data on a physical Place. We sell our product - our datasets - to data scientists and machine learning engineers at companies of all sizes. At SafeGraph, we've taken a measured approach to building a long term company. We were profitable in 2019, have hired experienced leadership from the start and care deeply about democratizing access to data to everyone. We currently have about 90 employees and are growing quickly. We recently raised a $45 million Series B ($65 million raised to date), and the CEO was previously the founder and CEO of LiveRamp (NYSE:RAMP). While SafeGraph was started in San Francisco, we've been fully distributed across North America since 2019 ‚Äî 18 states, 3 countries, and counting! We encourage all employees to work in whatever environment enables them most, whether that be at home, a co-working space, or somewhere else. We get the entire company together in the same place as often as possible, and cannot wait to do this again soon! We offer our employees a robust set of benefits, including health, dental & vision insurance coverage, a 401k, work-from-home stipend, mental health benefits, and much more.  Some good reading on how we think: SafeGraph: about us, visions and values Open Information to Power Innovation Where Should Machines go to Learn Data-As-A-Service Bible: Everything You Wanted to Know About Running DaaS Companies  Don't fit this description perfectly but still think this is the role for you? Apply and let us know why!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Andata is hiring a Head of Sales. Are you an innovative, motivating sales leader passionate about creating successful customer outcomes that drive revenue growth? Do you thrive in an iterative growth environment with constant cross-team collaboration? Let‚Äôs talk about Andata‚Äôs opening for a Head of Sales. In this revenue-generating role, you will work with company leaders and across teams to solve customer problems, define our sales process, and take our revenue function to the next stage of growth. Andata is a seed-stage, growth-oriented, SaaS product company, trusted by some of the biggest brands in the world. We offer next generation digital advertising platform powered by AI that allows marketers to deliver higher ROI on their ad spend. Marketers can finally trust technology to allocate their budgets in the most effective ways.   We‚Äôre looking for a motivated Head of Sales with an entrepreneurial mindset to grow our mid-market and enterprise revenues.  In this role, you will... ‚óè      Work cross-functionally with product and marketing leaders to develop and iterate on go-to market solutions ‚óè      Collaborate with management to set sales goals and forecast subscription revenue growth on a quarterly and annual basis, and be responsible for meeting targets ‚óè      Understand the needs of prospects, perform personalized product demonstrations, and provide individualized pricing quotes to meet sales goals ‚óè      Recruit, train and retain a top-performing team of sales representatives to handle increasing inbound lead volume to meet overall ARR targets ‚óè      Define sales metrics and manage the sales team‚Äôs CRM to provide transparency into pipelines and opportunities and install repeatable sales processes ‚óè      Collaborate with the customer success team to ensure a great customer experience through the handoff  The right candidate will have... ‚óè      Demonstrated track record of achieving sales targets with mid-market and enterprise companies ‚óè      5+ years combined experience in Inside Sales functions (SDR/BDR/AE) ‚óè      2+ years experience managing sales representatives and developing sales team objectives ‚óè      An entrepreneurial mindset and drive to succeed ‚óè      Technological savvy and problem-solving chops ‚óè      Experience selling SaaS products in fast-growing companies preferred ‚óè      Experience working within the Marketing space a plus ‚óè      A Bachelor's degree or comparable experience  Benefits ‚óè      Unlimited PTO (Trust-based) ‚óè      Health Care Plan (Medical and Dental) ‚óè      Parental Leave (PPL), Family Medical Leave (FML) ‚óè      Stock options

jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales, Brands East
description: About Us:  SOCi is an award-winning all-in-one local marketing platform built specifically for "next-level" multi-location marketers. Our customers include top brands and influencers like Ace Hardware, Sport Clips, and Anytime Fitness as well as top multifamily property management companies like Greystar, Lincoln, and Pinnacle who have the impossible challenge of managing their digital presence across hundreds and thousands of locations. The SOCi platform empowers local management of the entire customer journey across multiple mediums including local business listings, social, reviews, listening, ads, bots, and more. As the central command for multi-location marketers, SOCi makes the impossible possible by enabling top brands and their locations to strengthen and scale their digital presence across limitless local search and social pages while protecting what matters most, their reputation.  Our accolades include:  Recently closed a Series D investment round of $80 million, led by JMI Equity Inc. 5000 honoree fourp years in a row for Fastest Growing Companies in America Entrepreneur magazine‚Äôs #1 Marketing Provider for Franchises, and top provider three years in a row Front Runner for Gartner‚Äôs SoftwareAdvice.com in Reputation Management & Brand Management Top 200 rank on Financial Times The Americas‚Äô Fastest Growing Companies two years in a row Forbes America‚Äôs Best Startup Employers  Position Summary:  SOCi is looking for a rockstar Regional Director of Sales for the Eastern USA Region to develop a dynamic team of driven Account Executives that will set out to solve the complex social media and reputation management challenges that are unique to enterprise multi-location brands and franchises and to make a killing doing it.  We are looking for a sales leader who understands and can articulate what it takes to lead a high-performance team in the challenging world of SaaS sales today, has a proven track record of success in leading high-performance sales teams, and believes that they can have a 10x impact on our rocket-ship startup.  Preferred Qualifications:  4-6 years of experience in B2B SaaS Enterprise Sales Leadership Ability to show consistent revenue achievement (not just that you achieved it, but how you achieved it would be even better) Creative entrepreneurial spirit (you won‚Äôt come here if you don‚Äôt have it) Refined and proven sales methodology (Can‚Äôt wait to see it) Creative strategist; develop new ways to drive ales and value to existing and prospective clients (Love that quality) Experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment (Clock Speed required) Creative problem solver with the ability to understand and resolve client challenges/objections Sell cutting-edge, disruptive technology to decision-makers at the enterprise level Willingness to travel (up to 50%, we have big territories and big customers) Strong execution, focus, and ability to develop solutions and strategies to further accelerate growth Provide thought leadership to develop a high performing sales organization and customer-centric culture Recruit, retain, and mentor a remote high-performance and highly engaged sales team Train, develop, and motivate the sales team in skills, sales methodologies and activities, product knowledge, teamwork, time and territory management, and competitive knowledge Executive-level interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to successfully influence and quickly build credibility to maximize organizational growth and profitability Ability to foresee, interpret and rapidly respond to market changes by adjusting strategies and realigning priorities accordingly Proven experience closing or assisting sales team members in closing large ticket deals Strong business and analytical acumen; strong problem-solving skills Manage account and contact information through the entire sales lifecycle process using Salesforce and ensure that the sales team maintains detailed account profiles and prepares sales and activity reports as required. Take ownership of the accuracy of the information in Salesforce   What's SOCi's culture like?  Led by a team of industry experts, SOCi is leading the pack in Social Media and Reputation Management. We offer flexible PTO, comprehensive health & benefits packages, and 401k (amongst many other perks). Every new team member is equipped with a MacBook laptop, tech accessories & SOCi swag. We are a fast-paced, agile environment where thought leadership and input is encouraged. If you are looking for a place where you can come and make a difference in the way enterprise organizations utilize social technology, then SOCi is for you.  SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law

description: Ascent Hospitality Management  Atlanta, GA  Ascent Hospitality has an extensive portfolio of hotels and a strong pipeline of new properties and acquisitions, but we're not about numbers...we're about people and that remains our foundation. Our culture expresses a memorable experience for all of our Team Members and guests alike. So we're constantly looking for individuals who work well together for a unified purpose. For our leadership, we're looking for accomplished individuals with a passion to serve others, strong communicators who clearly understand the needs of others and trendsetters who excel at challenges and change. If this is what you're all about, consider joining our Team.  We are currently looking for an seasoned individual for the position of Regional Director of Sales out of our corporate office in Atlanta, GA or remote location in Alabama to oversee properties in Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi.  The Regional Director of Sales will provide strategic sales and revenue direction to their assigned portfolio of hotels for the purpose of driving TOP LINE REVENUE and GROWING MARKET SHARE for Ascent Hospitality. This individual will work with other corporate team members to maximize revenue and maintain strong interpersonal relationships. This position is for a ROAD WARRIOR!!!! Someone who is ready to travel and be hands on with their portfolio of Hotels. If you're looking for a new adventure with great rewards, this position is for you!  Regional Director Of Sales Responsibilities The Regional Director of Sales position will develop and Implement sales strategies designed to attack specific market segments, key accounts or identified need time periods to achieve Hotel Budget and RevPar Growth. Participate in weekly Revenue Management meetings with thorough understanding of Star Report, accurately forecast revenues and ability to make recommendations with changes in rates, mins/maxs and LOS restrictions Become a brand sales expert for the company portfolio, adhering to and being knowledgeable to brand programs, resources, tools and initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will establish sales performance goals for your hotel sales team members Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce group and transient business for your hotels. Travel to assigned properties in the region conducting property visits, sales calls, with written documentation of the visits with attention to follow up. Mentor, coach, and assist as necessary, assigned sales teams, to ensure their success. Supervise sales initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will represent Ascent Hospitality at Trade Shows and sales blitzes as necessary. Serve as first point of contact for above property sales support to hotels in the region. Act as interim Director of Sales for any hotel in the company as directed by the VP of Sales & Marketing. Provide training assistance to hotel sales leaders and GMs to develop, coach and provided continuous training. Produce sales department reports on a timely basis Regional Director Of Sales Qualifications Three or more years of above property, multi-property, sales management experience is preferred Regional Director of Sales candidates should have major brand experience with Marriott, Hilton, IHG, Starwood is an absolute requirement Working knowledge on CI/TY, OneSource, OnQ, R&I, Delphi Must be able to travel at least 90% of time. This position is only for the "Road Warrior Strong leadership skills resulting in mentorship and development of sales managers to reaching goals. Regional Director of Sales candidates should have strong oral and written communication skills combined with computer, presentation and negotiation skills. Excellent time-management skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. Strong decision-making capabilities and strategizing skills. Demonstrates creativity in finding solutions to problems. Finds the win-win when resolving conflicts. Remains calm and acts appropriately when faced with hectic or tense situations. Strong mathematical skills with the ability to accurately interpret data to create forecasts and budgets. Understanding of various market conditions and influencers. Education And/or Experience Bachelor's degree or a combination of advanced education and equivalent work experience. Minimum of 5 years overall hotel experience to include 3+ years as an Area or Market Sales Leader with Full Service, Limited Service or Extended Stay Hotels. Management or senior supervisory experience in hotels or experience in the industry with transferable skills. Proven ability to sell. Must be able to conduct and manage meetings, as well as speak to large groups as needed. Must have an outgoing, sales minded personality with the ability to close. *Candidates with Marriott or Hilton Brand Certification will have top consideration** We are seeking a "game-changer" and proven sales leader who can communicate a vision and collaborate with a sales team to generate extraordinary growth.  If we've caught your attention, we encourage you to apply today!

Coaches sales staff, and manages sales forecasting, CRM updates and projections with timely reports. helps set pricing, product and service strategy for major ac¬≠counts, bids and projects through and with the VP of Sales and Marketing  Goals and Performance Manages selling expense and sales budget within company guidelines Helps set company and individual goals for sales volume, gross profit margin percent, new business sales, sales for core furniture lines, etc. Manages sales forecasting and projections; Provides timely and accurate sales reports to management Quickly addresses shortfalls by individual sales staff‚Äîcoaches personally, sets short term goals, oversees weekly activity, and makes necessary changes Oversees go-no-go policy  Competencies:  Technical skills including 20/20 CAP, Outlook, Microsoft Office Applications including Word, Excel and PowerPoint Strong negotiation skills‚Äîunderstands dealer, service and product economics, and drives profitable sales and margins for dealership; understands quality of sale (for efficient sales implementation Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills Effective listening skills Has ability to make an impact by developing high level relationships and connections with potential clients and client influencers (brokers, A&D firm executives, etc.)  Education & Experience:  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent with 7 years of senior-level sales experience (including leadership) within an office furniture dealership or related industry.

description: Who is Credible?  We believe life‚Äôs changes create financial needs for people and that the traditional financial system often puts up unnecessary obstacles. People celebrate major milestones like going to college, getting married, and buying a home. And most of the time, these milestones come with financial implications.  At Credible, we have built a company with the mission of bringing transparency, choice, simple processes and savings to accessing credit for life‚Äôs important moments. What you see is what you get. We are committed to being upfront, honest, and clear about your options. There are no mysteries, no hidden fees, and no secret clauses.  Credible is a fast-growing Fintech company that has world class management, has raised multiple rounds of funding, is generating significant revenue and is disrupting the lending market and helping people save money and get out of debt faster.  About The Role  Credible is looking for a self-motivated and analytical Partnerships & Business Development Director to join our growing team. In this role, this person will be working with our Head of Business Development to ideate, pitch, and win marketing partnerships to drive top-of-funnel traffic to Credible. Establishing relationships with marketing partners through sustained sales efforts, you will be committed to transforming Credible‚Äôs business and growing revenue. In addition to building relationships, you have the ability to manage the full lifecycle of a marketing partnership across prospecting, contracting and developing partner growth strategies.  The ideal candidate will be in tune with the key players of our industry and have a passion for the financial technology space. Through grit, humility, and persistence, you bring strong interpersonal skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment, along with the ability to think about what is -- and what could be.  Responsibilities Ideate, pitch, structure, negotiate and win marketing partnerships that promote Credible‚Äôs multi-lender marketplaces (student loan refi, student loan origination, personal loans, mortgages) Effectively and confidently pitch the Credible product and its benefits to prospective marketing partners Collaboratively work with Product, Engineering, Marketing and Legal & Compliance to establish, launch, and grow marketing partnerships Develop partner relationships, having a diplomatic approach to negotiation, and quantitatively evaluating results Establish internal buy-in on partnership opportunities through thoughtful and actionable recommendations Demonstrate a strong understanding of the competitive landscape in financial services, financial technology and financial online marketplaces Ideate, source, and secure conversations/meetings with prospective marketing partners through outbound efforts Education And Experience 5+ years of experience in a business development, partnerships or sales role Deep understanding of affiliate partnerships and how they are structured Bachelor's degree in a related field Demonstrable experience pitching and closing large strategic partnerships that drive significant revenue Excellent presentation skills - the ability to craft and present a Powerpoint pitch and narrative from scratch for unique partnership opportunities is essential High competency with Financial and Data Modeling to evaluate the merits of partnership opportunities Key interpersonal traits: motivation, creativity, adaptability, unquestionable ethics and integrity, and a willingness to take calculated risks Experience and existing relationships with large media publishers is a significant plus Experience in and knowledge of the student loans, personal loans, and mortgage markets is a significant plus Why work at Credible?  These Are Our Values  We are a fast moving, fun-loving, seriously smart group of people who really care about impacting the lives of our customers. We empower our employees to make decisions, take risks, drive our business and make changes when we don‚Äôt get it right. Exceed Customer Expectations: We provide an exceptional experience to each and every customer that compels them to share it with others. Take Ownership: We are trusted to make decisions that are in the best interests of our customers and our business. We think and act like owners. We care ‚Äì and that makes all the difference. Be Curious: We are curious, ask questions, seek to understand and try new things. Do the Right Thing: We earn trust by being transparent, respectful and honest with each person with whom we interact. Get Results: Results fuel our excitement and we know how our personal accomplishments tie to the success of the company. Be Bold: We are courageous and take risks that scare us. Our enthusiasm for experimenting is how we will find the next breakthrough. Our benefits: We offer competitive compensation, generous benefits, free food and a flexible vacation policy.  But mainly, you want to work at Credible because you believe in our mission and want to have a major role in delivering on it! We look forward to getting to know you.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Director of Business Development (Channel Sales)  BlackCloak‚Äôs mission is to protect high-profile individuals and corporate executives in their personal lives, mitigating risks to their families, companies, reputation, and wealth. We defend our clients‚Äô digital lives from hackers, privacy leaks, and identity theft. If you are passionate about cybersecurity & privacy, then keep reading. This may be your next great opportunity.  As the Director of Business Development for HNWI Channels, you‚Äôll be responsible for building and maintaining a world-class consumer channel sales program. Reporting directly to the VP of Revenue, you will contribute to top line revenue of the company taking into partner satisfaction, channel sales performance, profitability, and other corporate revenue objectives. Through your work to create and maintain relationships with partners, you will drive new business with clients that are high-profile or high-net-worth individuals (HNWI) who are at risk of being targeted by cyber criminals.  You will work closely with the VP of Revenue, Client Account team, and Client Success team in building and maintaining productive channel partnerships with organizations that also act as trusted advisors to high-profile or high-net-worth clients such as wealth management firms, talent agencies, and law firms. You will rely heavily on these channels to build a pipeline for the Client Account team.  You should be the type of person who enjoys building something from scratch, especially developing a partner program in a new product category. You will be a trusted advisor to your partners and be a thought leader in the community.  Your Responsibilities  Develop a strategy to build and maintain a world-class HNWI channel sales program. Meet monthly business development objectives designed to support your strategic plan. Meet and exceed revenue targets set for the channel by driving leads and providing coaching to the Client Account Executive team. Excel at prospecting, product demonstrations, pipeline management and closing abilities. Provide reporting to channel partners on lead flow, conversion, client satisfaction, and other key metrics. Coach and provide leadership to the Client Account team to ensure high lead to win conversion rates from channel referrals. Work collaboratively the Client Success team to ensure smooth onboardings of new clients as well as long-term satisfaction  Present thought leadership speeches at events. Other duties as assigned.  Your Qualifications  4 Year Bachelor of Arts or Science degree preferred 3+ years successful experience in wealth management including a wide network of contacts in wealth management firms and family offices Demonstrated ability to create and nurture productive partnerships Expertise in managing sales opportunities from prospect to closure Ability to provide live and web-based product presentations and demonstrations without sales engineer support (though support is available as needed) Excellent negotiation, presentation and communication skills Demonstrated ability to forecast and manage information using Salesforce Ability to manage multiple high-priority tasks to successful completion Ability to work in a fast paced, geographically dispersed organization Travel regularly (when safe) to visit channel partners or represent the company at events.  Why You Want to Join BlackCloak  BlackCloak is an extremely fast-growing company in an entirely new product category. We have amazing product fit validated by industry awards and our already impressive client base of Fortune 500 companies across all industries. This is an excellent opportunity for an accomplished account executive to enjoy rapid success.  BlackCloak offers a competitive salary, exceptional benefits, and a dynamic work environment.   BlackCloak is headquartered in Orlando, Florida and has a remote workforce throughout the U.S.    Learn More about Us  Website: https://blackcloak.io LinkedIn: /blackcloak Twitter: @BlackCloakCyber White Paper: https://bc.blackcloak.io/executive-cybersecurity-whitepaper

jobTitle: Head of Sales Development, North America
description: Founded in 2018 in Dublin by experienced security engineers, Tines makes enterprise automation simple. Security and operations teams are too often stuck doing manual, repetitive tasks, and we want to change that. Tines is an automation platform designed to allow anyone to automate any manual task, regardless of complexity. No apps, plugins, or custom code required. With 1,000+ template options for common security actions, Tines is power and simplicity through direct integration with your existing tools.  Now a well-funded, early-stage start-up, Tines is backed by some of the world‚Äôs most respected investors and trusted by the world's leading security teams to streamline security automation work. We‚Äôre scaling quickly and building our team for the journey. We guarantee lots of challenges, growth and learning as well as the opportunity to be part of a world class team.  We are looking for an experienced Head of Sales Development, to join our team!  As the Head of Sales Development, North America at Tines you will be responsible for hiring, managing and coaching the SDR and BDR teams to set qualified opportunities for the Account Executives as well as supporting operational strategies to enable our SDRs and BDRs to exceed their goals. As an early leader of our Sales team, you will have the opportunity to have an influential voice in shaping our team, our sales direction, our go to market strategy, and our culture.  Responsibilities Build a world class Sales and Business Development organisation focused on new lead generation, across inbound and outbound, by prospecting and qualifying opportunities for the Commercial and Enterprise Sales teams Hire, train, and manage team of Sales and Business Development Representatives Motivate the team to exceed objectives through coaching and support Work with Commercial Operations to establish and track the key KPIs for the team, developing dashboards to report on lead quality, quantity, success rates, etc Work closely with Sales Leadership to develop repeatable strategies for logo acquisition Work closely with Marketing and Commercial Operations to build and manage top of funnel prospect building Work closely with Commercial Operations to shape and improve or systems, processes and tools Create a tight feedback loop with the Account Executive teams to ensure insights feed into the sales process  Requirements 5+ years of sales experience, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment Previous experience building and leading successful sales teams, preferably Sales or Business Development Experience working and prospecting inbound and outbound leads Proven experience successfully managing people to exceed performance goals Successful track record in a high volume sales environment Outstanding communication, organisational and time management skills Excellent presentation and listening skills Must be able to thrive in a very fast paced environment Ability to hire and train new sales representatives Track record of motivating, mentoring and inspiring teams Coachability: open to feedback, learn from mistakes, eager to learn  Tines provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, colour, ethnic or social origin, genetic features, language, religion or belief, political or any other opinion, membership of a national minority, property, birth, disability, age or sexual orientation.

description: The Short & Sweet Summary  Knoetic has a massively ambitious vision to guide every people & HR decision a company will ever make.  We call our product a "knowledge engine." Half of it is a super powerful analytics/data platform (Knoetic). The other half is a social network of C-level executives (CPOHQ).  It seems crazy until you see the product in action. Here's just a small sample of innovative companies that use Knoetic: Amobee, Snyk, Figma, Calm, Curology, Ro, and more.  We're backed by Accel, the founders of public companies, thought leaders like NYT bestselling author Adam Grant, and dozens of leading Chief People Officers.  We're hiring a Head of Sales to build and lead an all-star team. Reporting to our CEO, you will refine and execute our sales strategy, lead a team of Account Executives in acquiring and developing clients, serve as a point of escalation, and help drive deal strategy.  Knoetic's ideal Head of Sales thrives in a start-up environment and has a proven track record of defining a robust sales strategy to scale revenue from $5M-$50M+. This is an opportunity to build a world-class sales organization and will be a transformational, career-defining choice for you (and for us!) as Knoetic grows.  What You'll Do  Within your first week, you will: Onboard and learn more about the company's mission, culture, and values. You'll write a user manual and a Professional Development Plan outlining exactly how you want to grow professionally over the next 2-3 years Meet your team members to build rapport and understand current ways of working Attend training sessions on the Knoetic platform and our upcoming product roadmap, and attend customer and sales calls to learn more about our users. Understand CPOHQ and Knoetic's GTM strategy and how we'll grow to our first 1000 customers.  Within your first month, you will: Define a long-term vision and strategy for your team, consulting with existing team members Evaluate existing strategies, processes, and tools, and identify improvement opportunities for immediate focus Implement measurement and reporting processes to manage team performance (Hopefully!) Close your first Knoetic client working alongside our Product, Engineering, and Customer Success.  At three months, you'll be fully ramped! You will: Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas, and accurately forecast on a weekly and monthly cadence Demonstrate effective leadership: encourage and develop discipline in process execution, contribute positively to sales interactions including closing your own clients, and foster an environment of collaboration and high-urgency. Use the forecast to begin identifying, scoping, and hiring for your open roles Drive continuous process improvements, leveraging your expertise to build and scale a top tier team Accelerate new product features needed to drive sales opportunities in close collaboration with the Engineering and Product teams Vigorously capture learnings from the market and engage with current Knoetic clients to stay at the cutting edge of HR tech  Who You Are You have 9+ years of sales/closing experience, a portion of which was spent at a B2B Saas startup You have 5+ years of experience managing large teams, and have hired for top talent You have a track record of quota obtainment both individually and as a manager You are a process machine with expertise in designing and executing sales methodologies and strategies You are an exceptional writer and communicator, and have clarity and concision of thought You want to work with the Chief People Officers at the top tech companies around the world  The key attributes we value in teammates: You like to win. You don't want a trophy for effort, you want it for first place. You're high IQ, intellectually curious, and intellectually humble. You're not afraid to say, "I don't know - but I'll figure it out, fast." You never say, "that's not my job" - you take full ownership and responsibility over outcomes. You're a force of nature that gets the job done no matter what it takes. You make everyone else on the team better. Your presence, positivity, and drive inspires others to step up their game. You put the company above your own wants. You're known for your work ethic. You pride yourself on being one of the hardest-working person most people know. You're constantly improving. You know there's no such thing as perfection, and you're always pushing yourself (and our company) to be better than you were yesterday. You're just good: You're honest, principled, smart, open to giving/receiving feedback, and focused on doing right for the company and doing right for the customer  Why Knoetic? You're incredibly ambitious and want to build the #1 company in this space, without exception. The standard stuff: competitive salary and benefits (including fun perks for lifelong learners, like a $2,500 learning budget!) Knoetic cultural values resonate deeply with you (see below)  Knoetic cultural values  Written by our founder in 2020.  Intellectual curiosity: I want to surround myself with people who are endlessly curious, who are always asking questions, who are fascinated with understanding others and the world around them. We're the kids who grew up always asking "Why?"  Intellectual humility: I want to work with people who embrace the scientific method, who go into conversations with an open mind and ear, who are looking for ways to sharpen their thinking, who are delighted to find out when they're wrong rather than invested in defending why they're right.  Relentless resourcefulness: Our company should be full of people who will run through walls to get to their goals, who will bring more solutions than problems to others, who will figure out a way to succeed no matter what.  Winning: People who thrive here will only settle for our company being #1. They can only live with themselves if we own the top spot. Second place is last place.  Positive impact on others: There are people, who by the very virtue of their presence, make everyone else around them a better person. It could be because they have unwaveringly high standards. Or are incredible givers that inspire generosity. Or are teachers of their peers. However they do it, they push others upwards. They are culture accretive; their very presence makes everyone else step up their game.  Positivity. You know it when you see it - can-do, optimistic. That doesn't mean everyone doesn't have down moments - it just means on balance, you walk away from your interactions with them energized and charged up to do more with your life.  Continuous improvement: We're always making ourselves better. Stasis is the enemy‚Ä¶ if you're not going forwards, you're going backwards. Everything is a work-in-progress in perpetuity - yourself included.

description: Primary.Health is the engine behind your COVID-19 testing and vaccination programs. Our web-based platform provides government agencies, schools, healthcare facilities, and community based organizations the ability to quickly register participants, schedule appointments, arrange for easy onsite check-in and check-out, and exchange data between labs and state databases, easing the reporting process.   JOB TITLE: Sales Director, Corporate Sales REPORTING TO: COO JOB TYPE: Full-time LOCATION: Remote  JOB SCOPE: At Primary, we are blazing new strategies to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic head on and meet clients where they are. We believe in tackling hard problems together as a team, with strong values around collaboration, accountability, and transparency. As the Director of Corporate Sales, you are often the first point of contact a potential client has with Primary and are therefore an ambassador for our brand and reputation. You are knowledgeable of our products and services and will work closely with marketing, product, operations, and finance to develop corporate benefit offerings, respond to requests for proposals from private sector clients, develop sales pitches, and manage inbound/outbound business development strategies.  MAJOR JOB DUTIES: Researching and responding to private sector needs in an ever-evolving landscape. Contacting potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings. Contributing to and helping implement new B2B marketing initiatives. Researching organizations and individuals to find new opportunities. Increasing the value of current customers while attracting new ones. Finding and developing new markets and improving sales. Attending conferences, meetings, and industry events (virtually) to build a network of contacts and expand Primary‚Äôs relationships. Developing quotes and proposals for clients. Developing goals and benchmarks and ensuring they are met.  MINIMUM EDUCATION:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, marketing or related field.  QUALIFICATIONS: 5-8 years‚Äô experience in a B2B or B2G environment, preferably in health care technology, health insurance, large employer benefits, or related field. 5 years‚Äô experience responding to client inquiries, building relationships with strategic partners, and demonstrated sales growth. Experience collaborating in a cross-functional team of internal staff and external consultants. Strong communication skills and IT fluency. Familiarity with software/product sales. Ability to manage complex projects with competing deadlines. Excellent organizational skills. Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty. Familiarity with HIPAA and other PHI/consumer privacy laws and regulations preferred.  Primary embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Our client is the number one Operating System for restaurants. The food delivery market is set to explode and our client aims to become the backbone of the restaurants that feed America. Delivery should no longer be an ancillary business line for kitchen operators but rather a focus food establishments need to adapt to, to succeed in the digital world. With their recent seed round of funding, they are looking to capitalize on our momentum by bringing in their first Sales Manager  About You: You are a business athlete who wants to join a championship team of high-caliber talent, focused and diligent people who are determined to win. You have grit, empathy, and a never-stop attitude. You care deeply about the success of customers and your teammates. You are passionate and/or knowledgeable about the restaurant industry and helping restaurants increase their revenue.  This is a tremendous opportunity to join the team as a Sales Manager, and help build a data-driven, automated and scalable sales function. You‚Äôll have the autonomy to own this function and have a lasting impact on the success of our client's business.  As the Sales Manager, your responsibilities will include:  Develop a data-driven, automated, and scalable sales strategy to help lead your team and the company to success Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales targets while expanding and leading a team of Account Executives Work on the configuration of our systems (CRM etc.) and chose additional software solutions to optimize the sales motion Work collaboratively across teams - including Engineering, Product and Marketing and Customer Success - to help drive success  Monitor sales activity, revenue forecasting, sales goals. Track and keep a pulse on where they're at and adjust what‚Äôs needed accordingly  Experience and Expertise  At least 5+ years of experience hiring, leading, building, and managing an inside and outside sales organization Proven track record of success - quota hitting as an individual as well as as a team Experience selling directly into the restaurant industry  Experience with Close.io is a plus  Strong leadership and team-building skills Highly motivated, entrepreneurial, energetic, and willing to do whatever it takes to succeed in a high growth organization You are a PHD: positive, hungry, determined!  This is a fully remote position.

description: Senior Director, Sales & Business Development Are you interested in leading the transformation of cancer care through software that puts world-leading scientific knowledge in the hands of patients and their doctors? If so, join our growing team at VieCure, the company that is revolutionizing cancer care by putting A.I. driven technology tools and an unparalleled knowledge base into the hands of physicians.  We are seeking an experienced full time and highly driven Senior Director, Sales & Business Development.  Reporting directly to the Chief Business Development Officer, you will spearhead U.S. and Canada sales and business development initiatives in pursuit of VieCure‚Äôs overall corporate and business strategy, by leading and developing our client solutions team to identify, prioritize, target and close new business opportunities within the cancer treatment marketplace. Our chosen candidate will have experience of leading, engaging and motivating highly successful US healthcare sales teams and extensive, demonstratable, experience of building a pipeline and directly selling SaaS solutions. They will have an advanced understanding of best practice sales processes and advanced sales analytics, and demonstrate experience of successfully implementing these within an organization.   Responsibilities Be accountable for a direct annual sales target plus the sales targets of the employees within your team and assigned to your supervision, by identifying and targeting clients, prospects and key decision-makers within your targeted accounts. Utilize a consultative sales approach to close opportunities with senior level executives, supporting the team, and leading as needed, any complex or strategic clients. Identify, recommend, implement and assure best practices are effectively utilized and executed within the team, therefore driving a highly efficient sales process. Prepare and present unsolicited proposals and respond to RFPs when appropriate. Ensure comprehensive customer sales plans are developed. Represent VieCure and the product portfolio with integrity and professionalism. Ensure all sales process and related documentation have managed in accordance with VieCure‚Äôs Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system. Define long-term objectives and standards of performance for the team. Drive quality, agility, velocity, and predictability and foster a culture of sales excellence, accountability, collaboration, and individual empowerment.  Participate in, and contribute to, senior leadership strategy sessions and to collaborate with peers across the organization with a view towards building a more highly integrated structure.  Lead, motivate, engage, empower and ultimately elevate a remote sales team into a high-functioning, high-performance team and center of excellence. Ensure the sales talent are effectively supported, developed, coached and mentored to grow individual and team excellence.  Qualifications, Experience and Competencies Bachelors level education 10+ years of experience in a sales or business development role within the medtech space, with a strong preference of selling healthcare SaaS. 8+ years of experience leading successful healthcare sales teams. Proven experience in oncology sales and a solid understanding of cancer care treatment and its development. A proven track record of building a pipeline, converting leads into new business and consistently meeting sales targets / annual sales quotas. Strong pipeline and CRM management. Experience and evidence of managing data and interpreting/understanding data to drive revenue growth is vital and your skills with data will form part of the interview process. Evidence of ability to quickly understand clients‚Äô needs to identify and understand how our product and data can be utilized. A strong and strategic leader able to set a course of action and take ownership. A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage, empower and ultimately elevate a remote sales team into a high-functioning, high-performance team and center of excellence. High degrees of initiative, self-motivation and personal integrity. Resilient, able to work under pressure, remaining professional and calm. The ability to juggle a multitude of competing priorities and to keep current on the progress and pain-points of multiple activities simultaneously, while continuing to advance each towards successful completion. Highly collaborative, with a proven ability to effectively navigate, coordinate, and work cross-functionally with a multitude of internal and external stakeholders. A strong communicator (written, oral, presentation) who excels at fostering strong relationships and can effectively negotiate and network, communicating highly technical issues to a variety of internal and external audiences, at varying levels of complexity and detail. A demonstrated commitment to staying current on commercial and technical developments and advancements in relevant areas of the medical technology sector ‚Äì particularly as they relate to oncology.  A current understanding of new and competing healthcare technologies, software trends, architectural directions, etc. and their applications to healthcare, coupled with an ability to effectively communicate these and to contribute to these discussions at the strategic level. Strong strategic and critical thinking capabilities, as well as the ability to synthesize/summarize technical progress and relate it to overall business objectives and overarching business strategies. An outstanding ability to understand people - their motivations, goals, abilities and shortcomings ‚Äì and how to maximize human resources to achieve planned results within a culture of enthusiasm, accountability, respect, positive employee relations, and team building with an ‚Äúownership‚Äù mindset. Thrives in a fast-paced environment of change and ambiguity.  Location This position will be based remotely from a home office. The position requires travel to customer and prospect sites. The company will reimburse for reasonable travel and living expenses while on the road, consistent with our travel and expenses policy.  If you share our passion for revolutionizing the way cancer care is delivered, and in enabling better outcomes for patients, come join our team and help us shift the power balance in cancer care!

description: Founded in 2008, WD Lab Grown Diamonds is the leading U.S. manufacturer of laboratory grown diamonds, available through an international network of partners. The first to be certified under SCS Global Services‚Äô Sustainability Rated Diamond Standard, WD is the only company worldwide offering third-party Certified Sustainability Rated and Certified Climate Neutral diamonds. The company is now launching a consumer-facing brand at latitudediamonds.com, and evolving into its next phase of hyper-growth as the demand for sustainably-minded laboratory created diamonds continues its exponential rise.  At this exciting inflection point, we‚Äôre looking for sales leader that will build on the successful sales process already established to futher enhance growth.  The Director of Sales is responsible for aligning on existing sales and distribution strategy for all brands, while identifying opportunity for continuous revenue growth and channel expansion within the industry.  Working with the key business leaders, this role will drive the annual planning and budgeting process for the sales function, lead a team of key account managers/account executives, and drive accountability for performance and high-level of customer service.   Responsibilities:   Planning & Strategy Works collaboratively with the Executive team to develop and refine sales strategy and objectives Develops annual revenue targets, evaluates growth opportunities, enables sales improvements, product mix development, and oversees performance against targets Participates in budget planning, management and reporting Conducts regular and consistent research on the latest market best practices and trends to drive innovation in the sales organization   Team Leadership & Development Leads the sales team to execute sales strategy and achieve objectives Seeks continuous improvement in staff capabilities and provides ongoing coaching and development for sales managers and relationship managers   Sales Process Intelligence Builds a data driven sales culture and champions the use of technology to foster improved sales performance and forecasting / reporting Establishes clear sales metrics and benchmarks for measuring progress and providing feedback on performance Builds and maintains strong cross-functional working relationships   Additional Manages key relationships on behalf of the business by building strong ties with external partners Upholds a ‚Äòone-team‚Äô culture to ensure that sales and customer service teams work as a cohesive unit Works closely with the Marketing team to define priorities and annual marketing calendar of activities Acts as a role model in the areas of leadership, sales ability, personal character, commitment, organization and work habits to inspire others to achieve positive results   Required Qualifications, Skills and Competencies Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business or 10 years work related experience Minimum of 10 years in a sales leadership role in luxury jewelry or diamond industry Strong communicator with a consultative sales style, strong negotiation skills, exceptional problem- solving skills, and a keen customer needs assessment aptitude

JOIN US! Symphony RetailAI is global leader in AI-enabled decision platforms, solutions and insights for driving profitable revenue growth for retailers and CPG manufacturers ‚Äì from customer intelligence to merchandising, personalized marketing to supply chain. Our organization rapidly innovates to drive faster, more profitable decisions through AI, machine learning and voice technologies. To help high volume retailers and CPG manufacturers move beyond the hype of AI and toward the actual realization of benefits, we‚Äôve launched a three-pronged approach to delivering profitable revenue growth ‚Äì ‚ÄúIdentify, Activate, Realize (IAR).‚Äù We identity growth opportunities through AI recommendations; activate plans and execute intelligent actions; realize the goal by measuring improvement in revenue and profit. We put IAR to work each day in achieving our customer promise: To show profitable growth in one year for our customers Be the easiest to do business with Have the best quality and service for customer success To champion breakthrough AI-enabled innovation  THE OPPORTUNITY This is a new role for SRAI however one that has been part of the offerings and approach the company has deployed with customers. Given the market transformation toward digital enablement across every aspect of our client base, we have decided to hire an executive who can lead the effort in this regard. This role is responsible for leading the company‚Äôs retail & CPG digital transformation thought leadership, sales enablement, and customer collaboration.  The role will work closely with the product team, the executive team, the sales organization, and the development team to share SRAI‚Äôs vision and capabilities to help retailers transform digitally in the new retail age. In addition, this role will both educate prospects and customers on the role of digital assets, data driven enablement, and market trends affecting their business, and also represent the customer and their needs, ensuring work delivered is aligned with the company‚Äôs strategic objectives and have a clear understanding of how to create value for our customers in a manner Symphony RetailAI can commercialize.   KEY ACTIVITIES ¬∑        Business development and bookings responsibility for our CINDE/CCR insights platform and solutions with Top 30 target retailers in NA and EMEA ¬∑        Leading our major CINDE/CCR deals (> $ 1M acv) sales campaigns and proposals to closing; working w our Sales AE‚Äôs as ‚Äúlead finders‚Äù and pre-sales for demos and support, keeping them engaged in sales cycles ¬∑        Evangelizing our CINDE/CCR platform as a digital transformation platform for merchandising, with top retailers and key SI partners such as Accenture ¬∑        Evidence of being a thought leader and providing retail clients value driven, consultative direction tailored for their digital transformation.  ¬∑        Demonstrable experience of leading digital transformation projects, creating vision, framework models, roadmaps and value propositions. ¬∑        Experience in product marketing relating to digital transformation; marketecture, internal and external positioning etc. ¬∑        Work closely across products and sales teams to train and enable CCR solution into the market. ¬∑        The position will initially require 30-50% travel.   KEY CRITERIA ¬∑        Minimum of Bachelors in related field plus a minimum of 10 years of experience in similar role. MBA preferred. ¬∑        Very customer-centric, has been successful in business development and bookings at scale. Currently, may be a principal (one level below partner) at a consulting firm. ¬∑        Has led or been part of digital transformation programs in grocery merchandising, working for consulting firms (eg BCG, Bain, AT Kearney) or sw/solutions firms w CCR solutions (eg dunnhumby) ¬∑        Deep knowledge of grocery retail and CPG merchandising, category management processes ¬∑        Very familiar with technology and solutions used in CCR  ¬∑        Experience in digital transformation delivered as a consultant. Consulting experience with clients an important skill and experience. ¬∑        Strategic critical thinking skills, with the ability to think on your feet, strong client facing presence, and credible approach to customer value delivery. ¬∑        Able to diagnose a business situation, methodically tailor and apply solutions that best meet customer needs and make recommendations in credible, fact based methods. ¬∑        Must be able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, prioritise workload effectively, and thrive in a complex environment. ¬∑        Experience in sales and client service in a supportive or direct capacity ¬∑        Good communication and stakeholder management ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audience ¬∑        Experience working in an entrepreneurial environment where your judgement and thinking were key to success ¬∑        Relevant technical qualifications/skills at an advanced level ¬∑        Logical and analytical approach to problem solving. ¬∑        Must understand the principles, methods, techniques and tools for the chosen field within which you will operate ¬∑        Verbal communication ‚Äì ability to convey thoughts and approaches clearly and concisely ¬∑        Rigorous attention to detail and quality control ¬∑        Location: ideally US, backup London  OUR VALUES Our values are more than just words. We ask all of our employees to commit to certain behaviours to drive forward the culture we want to create and one that will make us successful, together. So check out our values e-book here and see for yourself what an exciting environment you‚Äôll be joining. ¬∑        We build trusted relationships ¬∑        We openly connect & communicate ¬∑        We are serious about quality ¬∑        We are always innovating ¬∑        We will win together ¬∑        We are enthusiastic

description: Summary  The Regional Sales Director is responsible for the profit/loss of a sales team located in a specific priority market metropolitan area. This role is responsible for hunting new customers and coordinating and supporting the ‚Äúhunting‚Äù and ‚Äúfarming‚Äù efforts of local market sales team members. The Market Leader is focused on building relationships with customers and real-estate influencers, and also mentoring Sales Executives (SEs).  You  WHO YOU ARE Raise the bar by taking the initiative to achieve results and make excellence your goal. Create lifelong fans by making customer experience your top priority. We promote a company culture that encourages diversity, creativity, innovation, and inclusion. Vari has become one of the most innovative, forward-thinking companies in the world. We‚Äôre growing quickly, so our company is fast-paced and exciting, but also friendly and supportive. Our employee benefits package includes medical, dental, and 401k, but also profit sharing, education reimbursement, and wellness perks, like an onsite gym.  WHY Vari?  We‚Äôre Award Winners Work at a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù ‚Äì FORTUNE Magazine Grow with the ‚ÄúNational Entrepreneur of the Year‚Äù ‚Äì EY Be part of the ‚ÄúFastest Growing Company in DFW‚Äù ‚Äì SMU Learn from award-winning leadership ‚Äì Most Admired CEO (Dallas Business Journal), CMO of the Year (American Marketing Association), Outstanding CFO ‚Äì Large Private Company (DCEO) We Want You To Be Happier And Healthier Your own Active Workspace On-site gym with Peloton cycles and a spa-like locker room Group fitness classes ‚Äì from bootcamps to yoga Meditation and chair massage pods Subsidized healthy food from Fresh Caf√© Outstanding overall total rewards package Wellness program and insurance premium discounts Nicotine-free facility We Value Our Employees Community Team that cares Enhanced paternity / maternity programs 401k and profit-sharing plan Paid personal time off Paid volunteer time off Team building events on and off site Mentoring and career development Gourmet coffee bar Education reimbursement Short-term and long-term disability premiums covered at 100% by Vari Vari provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

assist in negotiation and closing significant deals when needed  Work with Small, Medium and Enterprise customers (SME) to create the correct product solution mix  People and Process   ¬∑         Create a high performing, energized, and driven sales team culture, emphasizing reward and recognition  ¬∑         Work closely with Operations to build out CRM user processes and define reporting requirements to meet KPIs tracking  ¬∑         Work with Operations to define requirements for all sales tools to enable business goals  ¬∑         Partner with the HR team to ensure the team has the required knowledge, skills, and development plans  ¬∑         Effectively coach, mentor, and evaluate staff, delivering timely feedback, discipline, counselling, and performance reviews  Market Orientation  ¬∑         Maintain a deep understanding of market competitors, knowledge, and trends, including evolving technologies, client needs, expectations, and opportunities, shifts in the competitive landscape, operational efficiencies, and opportunities  ¬∑         Deliver product feedback to DNA leaders to ensure the voice of the customer is recognized  ¬∑         Develop and build relationships with the key internal Informa stakeholders.  ¬∑         Regularly attend in-person events & conferences, globally, to meet with customers and other members of the Informa Markets teams  ¬∑         Other responsibilities as assigned.    Qualifications     Essential  ¬∑         Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant business / technology discipline, or equivalent experience  ¬∑         A proven track record of progressive international sales leadership experience building and managing high performing sales teams to meet and exceed revenue goals  ¬∑         Strong ability to interpret data to build strategy and deliver commercial results  ¬∑         Demonstrated ability to own forecast revenue model and proactive reporting  ¬∑         Experience leading agency, third-party or direct B2B/enterprise field sales and customer/client success teams  ¬∑         Robust understanding of emerging digital media platforms, data targeting, ad- serving technologies  ¬∑         Demonstrated strategic, consultative, and analytical sales approach with focus on building partnerships with advertisers and brand-owner  ¬∑         Awareness and understanding of the importance of maximizing enterprise technology and systems and an ability to feedback into their design  ¬∑         Excellent aptitude for scaling up and developing high-performance sales teams, including team building, coaching, motivating, strategic thinking, business acumen, leadership, and sales techniques  ¬∑         Strong strategic, interpersonal, communication, collaboration, organizational, and time-management skills, and ability to execute initiatives within the team, company and client relationships  ¬∑         Excellent presentation, negotiation and closing skills with proven outstanding client relationship skills  ¬∑         Pro-active, resourceful and responsive to change ‚Äì thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with a strong sense of urgency  ¬∑         Demonstrates high levels of energy, integrity, judgment, and emotional intelligence. jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales- Southern California
description: Regional Director of Sales- Southern California  Objective Flying Embers is seeking a Director of Sales who is hardworking and a highly motivated individual to manage day to day sales and distribution across wholesalers and retailers in Southern California. The ideal candidate will have significant experience in the alcohol beverage industry with a focus on wholesaler relationships, retail execution, customer service, and leading a field sales team to continue building Flying Embers as the leader in the better-for-you alcohol space. The Director of Sales will report up to the VP of Sales and will be the main point of contact for their assigned wholesalers and sales team and will be ultimately responsible for their execution and KPI‚Äôs. They will also be responsible for managing and developing the FE sales team in their region.  Core Responsibilities (Wholesaler Execution) Manages all wholesalers in the region with existing sales team with the goal of increasing share of mind and retail execution Develop, deliver, execute, and participate in monthly, trimester and/or annual planning meetings for assigned wholesalers Respond and resolve wholesaler issues and concerns in a solution-oriented manner. Builds, maintains, and updates wholesaler business profiles. Provide top level brand direction including priorities, brand performance objectives or category, segment insights Daily wholesaler interactions with management and sales team to execute defined ABP goals. Manage pricing, forecasting, orders, and inventory. Lead/Execute the ABP process with your assigned wholesalers. Manage wholesaler‚Äôs execution, KPIs, and budgets. Manage and execute wholesaler incentives and focus periods. Lead/Execute Sales Trainings/Tastings/Kickoffs Manage and execute Flying Embers national programming, chain mandates/authorizations, and display programs through wholesaler network and sales team. Operate effectively within the brewery and budgetary guidelines. Utilize sales tools (VIP, KARMA, Nielsen, IRI, etc) effectively and efficiently. Ensure sales team effectively recaps Weekly KARMA accomplishments and follow up needed to wholesaler(s) Coordinate with wholesaler(s) and sales team on Commitment Closure opportunities.  Core Responsibilities (Team Development) Manage, lead, motivate and develop employees including hiring, performance management, training and development opportunities, and employee relations. Schedule and conduct Coaching Days and team sells. Effectively communicate both verbally and in writing the recaps of said Coaching Days to their employees with an emphasis on business objectives and skill selling objective results. Execute team‚Äôs development and utilization around selling skills to drive key sales objectives. Implement and monitor Key Performance Indicators as it relates to the sales and execution goals Use KARMA as a tool to monitor team‚Äôs performance, share best practices and lead them to key areas to drive our business forward Coordinates and executes trainings on how to execute within the various wholesalers and retail channels. Set clear goals and direction as they relate to company mission, vision, and strategies that optimizes productivity and results. Manages the regional retail business with the goal of gaining new distribution and promotional activity through direct interaction with the regional sales team, national account team and key buyers and wholesalers  Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Mastery of the 3-tier system and it‚Äôs complexities. Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint, Office Customer service oriented. Strong verbal/written/presentation and computer skills, detail oriented Strong judgement, professional maturity, and responsible decision making. Team player with a strong work ethic and self-starting attitude Ability to demonstrate reliability and work in a fast-paced setting, ability to multitask.  Education and Work Experience Minimum of 7 years of business-to-business sales experience required. Previous experience in the alcohol business required. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business or Marketing required  Flying embers offers highly competitive wages that will be determined by experience and other factors. Position is eligible for company equity and relocation in addition to exceptional Medical, Dental and Vision coverage.  Position Snap Shot Employment Type: Full-Time Job Type: Non-Exempt Pay Type: Salary Supervisor: Regional Director of Sales Location: Southern California Minimum Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required Minimum Experience: 7 Years Age Requirement: 21 years or older Tools & Equipment Used: Standard Office Equipment  Physical & Mental Requirements Required to lift up to 55 pounds and maneuver 170 pounds routinely and repeatedly. Expected to stand, sit, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, bend, talk, hear, taste, smell, see, and operate objects, tools, and controls. Regularly exposed to damp, wet environment with hot liquids, airborne particles, chemicals and moving machinery. Must have the physical and mental strength and endurance to be able to perform duties, in at times extreme environments, as well as the ability to handle stressors of the position. Must be able to travel via car, airplane, or train.  Equal Opportunity: We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.  The employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position because of evolving business needs.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent 5 years of experience in Sales acquiring new customers 2 years experience leading teams Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and teams Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems  Preferred Qualifications. 10+ years exemplary track record in Sales acquiring new customers 5+ years experience leading teams Experience selling CRM, Marketing Automation, Business Intelligence, Project Management, or similar  At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life‚Äôs work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

Fischer Paper Products is poised for significant organic growth and is on track to double our sales in the next three years. Our unique market position in the take-out and delivery space coupled with our expertise in sustainability are fueling incredible opportunity. We seek a Sales & Marketing Director to lead the charge and raise the level of awareness of the Fischer brand in the foodservice marketplace.   This position is based out of our headquarters in Antioch, IL, where 50% of work time will be spent, with travel and home office time comprising the other 50%.  Who You Are You are a seasoned sales and marketing leader with expertise in custom solution selling in the foodservice industry. You have been successful at building and developing sales and marketing teams for sustainable business growth, integrating people, processes, and technology. You desire a dynamic position and a transformative career experience with a growing and innovative foodservice company. You are passionate about being part of a customer-first, service-based organization.  Who We Are Fischer Paper Products is a family-owned company with three generations of experience in manufacturing and supplying high-quality, food-safe paper products. We continually invest in people, technology, and process improvements in order to deliver sustainable, customized food packaging solutions to a diverse customer base in our Chain Restaurant, Convenience Store, and Foodservice Distribution target markets.  What We Offer Strong potential for career growth A friendly, business-casual work environment Family-owned business atmosphere Comprehensive benefits and total compensation package  Position Overview As a key member of the leadership team, this position is responsible for leading the Inside and Outside Sales Representatives, Manufacturer‚Äôs Representatives, Sales Support, Product Management, and Marketing team members. This role will lead our innovation efforts, develop and implement our go-to-market strategy, and track the success of our sales initiatives and marketing communication efforts. And also plays a key role in annual and multi-year strategic planning, with effectiveness measured against revenue, profitability targets, and customer retention. Fischer Paper‚Äôs successful Sales & Marketing Director will find the necessary balance of strategy and day-to-day business activity.  Key Objectives Build an integrated Sales & Marketing team with specialization in both national accounts and distribution sales, respectively Assist in the creation and building of a product management team Enhance the new business development process to support rapid and profitable growth while holding to our high standards for service levels and an outstanding customer experience  Role Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, marketing, or comparable discipline; MBA a plus Foodservice industry experience; paper packaging industry experience preferred Expertise in the collaborative building of supply chain solutions Broad sales and marketing experience (5+ years), preferably in a manufacturing environment Progressive business experience (10+ years) including leadership experience in sales, marketing and product management and experience managing a team (5+ years) Experience building and developing an integrated Sales & Marketing team for growth at small-to-medium-sized organizations Marketplace expertise and acumen, both about the industry and Fischer Paper‚Äôs capabilities A proven track record for developing and managing high-performing teams Effective communication to sales staff of what is expected and needed to execute the sales and marketing plans Experience training and coaching sales staff to improve their results Able to bring your expertise and techniques with you while adapting to Fischer‚Äôs culture, markets, people and business processes Ability to leverage the network, markets and prospects you have already developed Demonstrable expertise in formal sales techniques: prospecting, cold calling, overcoming objections, up-selling and cross-selling, and closing Ability to plan and manage at both strategic and operational levels, with a proven track record of developing and implementing marketing and sales activities that have consistently met or exceeded planned objectives Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Proficiency with Salesforce Experience with ERP systems ‚Äì Syspro, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, etc.
