description: We are assembling a sales team that is focused on achieving a billion dollars a year in annual sales. We are looking for the perfect fit to be our Sales Director to help accomplish this mission. The successful candidate will share our vision in recruiting and training real estate agents, and then future Sales Managers to work under the Sales Director as we expand our team to include over 200 agents.  The Sales Director‚Äôs role is to oversee, support and train the agents within the company on the buy and sell sides, as well as in the day-to-day behaviors that lead to success. You will be responsible for interacting with the agents on a daily basis while helping them build their sales skills, increase conversion rates and keep accountable to their goals (both team and personal goals). You will be actively recruiting experienced agents and new agents on an on-going basis. Weekly & monthly reporting on conversion rates, profitability, and agent KPI‚Äôs will be required.  In addition to working directly with the agents and sales staff, you will interact with both the owner and the operations manager to ensure that we‚Äôre hitting sales and profitability goals. You will play a critical role in creating & updating policies and procedures as needed. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to adapt to the needs of each individual agent are necessary. Effective oral and written communication skills, understanding of budgets, and strong time management skills are also required.  Most importantly we are looking for someone who can continue to build on our already strong team culture of positivity, personal development, being a team player, becoming better every day and encouraging others. Having a great sense of humor for our fun working environment with the ability to inspire others to be better than they ever thought possible are qualities we are looking for. We are looking for the leader that is looking for an opportunity to help co-create something great from the foundation up. This is the final missing piece in the executive leadership staff driven to become the #1 team in Nashville and one of the top teams in the country.  This is an at-will position as an employee. Compensation is salary plus commission, based upon meeting and exceeding goals, in the expected income range of $60,000 - $100,000 for the first year. We expect compensation for this position to be in the range of $500,000/year and upwards as our team grows.  This position works remotely and is based in the Nashville, TN, area.

At Karbach, our beer is Crafted for Fun, and we think where you work should be too. We don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously, but you can be damn sure we take our beer seriously. And like our beer, we strive for our workplace to bring all kinds of people together. Whether our folks are brewing beer, operating behind the scenes, or serving in our pub, it‚Äôs their passion, grit, and attitude that make it all happen. We make quality beer and hire quality people. Come join our Karbach team!  Job Summary The Sales Director oversees the complex function of company sales as it relates to various states, distributors, retailers, etc. This position manages Area Sales Managers and the Key Account Managers to ensure that territory sales are consistent with goals and projections. This position largely oversees the program and system of sales as a whole, to include managing how: Karbach partners with distributors, maintaining market competition, pursuing on and off premise accounts, enters new territories, tracks and manages targets/progress, and any other facet of company sales. This position also requires significant analytical skills for market analysis, and for developing annual/quarterly adjustments contributing to the production schedules.  Job Responsibilities Work directly with wholesalers to develop strategies and to educate them on quarterly and annual goals and projections and execution plans. Derive data and sales reports, as well as other sources of analysis to support future growth plans Manage chain sales, including contract work and wholesaler communication Work with Marketing Director to ensure appropriate marketing strategies occur Use research and analysis to develop quarterly and annual goals and analysis and sales trends to support budget recommendations Oversees sponsorship budget Develop and maintain cohesion between territorial employees and managers Work with the Marketing Director to ensure territory cohesion between sales and marketing employees Maintain Sales Department budget on an on-going basis Troubleshoot problems between wholesalers and warehouse delivery/availability Orchestrate and conduct regular meetings with sales management team to maintain consistent communication Draft reports and prepare for wholesalers and company leadership   Job Qualifications 10+ years of Sales or Business Development experience Experience in the craft beer industry preferred Demonstrated success in consistently meeting sales objectives Proven track record of establishing and maintaining long-term relationships with executive level clients/counterparts at the decision-maker level Ability to understand and articulate strategic and financial value propositions and concepts Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, as well as the confidence and polish to represent the company in both formal and informal settings  As a leading brewer, we are committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: At the Insiders, we help our clients to win at the Digital Shelving. Through our expansive global network, we connect hundreds of brands with their consumer. We help our clients to collect valuable User Generated Content. This content achieves global reach by the syndication network of our partners. Founded in 2009, The Insiders is a headquartered in The Netherlands with offices in Europe, North America, South America and Asia. We are looking for winners with experience in e-commerce, specifically in electronics, to join our growing business development team. We employ a team-based approach to sales and client development and wake up every day excited to disrupt legacy. To be successful in this role, you will have adept skills in leading the business development process, from initial prospecting to leading in-person discussions and developing and delivering presentations with CPG sales, shopper marketing teams.  Main Responsibilities Include:  Confident in selling our value proposition and demonstrating bottom line results in a conversational way, develop an effective pipeline to drive new clients Meet/exceed annual revenue targets through the development, advancement, and closure of client partnerships. Identify and build relationships with key prospects: such brand executives, shopper marketers, and agencies through cold calling, networking, and referrals. Develop and deliver sales presentations that educate prospective clients on the Insiders‚Äô value proposition, roadmap, and partnership opportunities. Manage high volume of accounts, with ability to execute strategically.   What does it take to be successful in this role? 3-5+ years of progressive sales experience Prior experience working in an entrepreneurial, high paced, evolving environment Willingness to check ego at the door Experience selling disruptive digital, shopper marketing, mobile, or marketing service solutions into Walmart CPG vendors and agencies Polished communication skills, both written and verbal, are a must (candidates will be asked to complete a mock pitch as part of the hiring process) Willingness to achieve excellence across the entire sales spectrum (i.e. email outreach, cold calls, in-person presentations, etc.) Strong pipeline management and organizational skills Proven ability to identify and close $100K+ deals, $2MM+ annually Ability to work independently in a fast moving environment while building collaborative relationships to identify, share and implement best practices Passion for CPG, Walmart, Sam‚Äôs Club and shopper marketing   Why Work with Us?  We are the leading disrupters of status quo marketing connected to sales impact: The Insiders has set the industry standard with the most cutting-edge solutions using shopper to shopper Word of Mouth Marketing to drive incremental sales from switching, a disruptive model to drive sales and seeding online reviews. We‚Äôre giving brands the ability to switch users from a competitor‚Äôs brand and measure it against incremental sales lift. The best brands: We work with some of the most disruptive, progressive and beloved brands in CPG, electronics, beauty and retail in 40+ countries. Our clients include Samsung, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, L‚ÄôOr√©al and P&G. The best people: We think globally, and act locally. Every Insiders employee is part of a dynamic and cutting-edge organization. We are client-centric, deploy innovation, and act with an everlasting humble demeanour.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?  Reporting to the Vice President of Defense and Space, Original Equipment Customer Business Team, the candidate will be a strong, dynamic and experienced leader responsible for driving growth, operational excellence and customer loyalty across all Raytheon, Bell and various US customer platforms and programs. You will lead and develop a direct team of Customer Business Managers and Development Program Mangers and provide cross-functional leadership to the extended Customer Core Team (PMO, C&PS, FSE, E&T, ISC, Contracts, Legal, Finance, Marketing, Technical Sales and Business Development).  You will be responsible for developing the customer strategy, achieving growth, increasing profitability, demonstrating flawless program execution, increasing customer satisfaction and direct responsibility for all components related to strategic account leadership for Raytheon and other key customer accounts as assigned. The successful candidate should have the proven ability to build strong teams and to consistently deliver on yearly AOP commitments.  This role has broad executive engagement across all customer lines of business and will also interface with Honeywell Aerospace executive management and all Aerospace GBE Product Line Leaders. Up to 50% travel is required.  Key Responsibilities  Your responsibilities will be in three key areas: Customer Strategy for Growth, Operational Execution and Team Leadership and Development. description: Grayscale Investments is the world's largest digital currency asset manager. Through its family of investment products, Grayscale provides access and exposure to the digital currency asset class in the form of a traditional security without the challenges of buying, storing, and safekeeping digital currencies directly. With a proven track record and unrivaled experience, Grayscale's products operate within existing regulatory frameworks, creating secure and compliant exposure for investors.  Grayscale Investments is seeking a Head of Sales to lead our rapidly growing team. The Head of Sales will be a true business partner, an effective communicator, and possess strong influencing skills. The Head of Sales will be responsible for all sales efforts, including its sales professionals, to grow the firm's client base with qualified HNW, family office, accredited and institutional investors.  Responsibilities: Direct new client acquisition to raise assets into Grayscale's family of investment products. Hire, lead, train, and mentor a team of sales professionals to develop and execute a business plan to maximize sales. Continuously engage in and monitor sales efforts to prospect, engage, and close new potential investors. Effectively pitch the Grayscale products to accredited investors. Become a specialist in Grayscale's investment products and stay apprised of industry trends. Work closely with the operations, marketing, product, research, and compliance teams. Attend meetings, industry events, and conferences to meet with potential investors and to represent the firm. Proactively communicate insights and key metrics for measuring impact of sales tactics and quality of message on a continuous basis. Provide transparency into the sales pipeline and accounts through detailed and timely use of a Salesforce database.  Prior Experience/Requirements: 10+ years of success track record as a wholesaler of ETF, closed-end or mutual fund products as well as strong skills and experience in the development of sales messaging and product value propositions. Experience selling investment products to HNW, family office and RIA channel, and pre-existing relationships with this investor base. Previous sales talent management and mentoring experience required; skilled in training and developing personnel to create high-performance sales teams Strong interest in digital currencies, blockchain technology, and related concepts. Deep market knowledge of the global asset management industry (alternative investments preferred) and deep understanding of various client segments as well as products, key regulatory, and industry trends. Strong business acumen and strategic orientation; proven experience in driving organic growth and creating scalability. Self-starter with enthusiasm, grit and a passion for raising capital. Ability to work effectively to lead a team ‚Äì someone who is collaborative, flexible and adaptable, reliable with a strong 'can do attitude'. Ability to think creatively and prioritize prospective sales opportunities. Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment. Prior experience with Salesforce to track and monitor sales efforts. FINRA Series 7, 63 required.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobTitle: Director Business Operations and Sales Support
description: About Us  OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world‚Äôs mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. More than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, and Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and protect their reputation, finances, employees and relationships from cyber-driven disruption.   The Position  The Director of Business Operations and Sales Support will support the Sr. Director of Revenue Operations in the OPSWAT Sales organization. The Director will lead a team with a range of responsibilities that will ensure an effective structure for decision making and execution for the CRO organization. This candidate will play a key role on the leadership team and navigate a broad range of complex business and management challenges, collaborating across a variety of business partners.  What You Will Be Doing  Designs, implements, and manages sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes. Establishes high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in planning, forecasting, and budgeting approaches used by the sales channel organizations. Ensures planning, forecasting, and budgeting efforts are appropriately integrated with other planning processes employed within the company. Responsible for equitably assigning sales channel quotas and ensuring OPSWATs financial objectives are optimally allocated to all sales channels and resources through the quota program. Accountable for the timely assignment of all sales organization objectives. Responsible for recommending the optimal deployment of sales personnel (direct sales), as well as for the optimal deployment of alternate sales channels. Makes recommendations for changing sales roles, coverage models, or team configurations to maximize sales productivity (direct) and makes recommendations for changing channel mix and coverage models to maximize sales productivity (alternate). Ensures sales reports and other internal intelligence is provided to the sales organization. Develops new reporting tools as needed. Coordinates with sales leadership and other stakeholders to lead efficient and accurate sales force reporting initiatives. Working with Human Resources, Finance, and Sales leadership designs sales incentive compensation programs that provide market-competitive pay and commission structures, reinforce sales organization strategy, and align with business and sales organization objectives. Oversees sales compensation plan administration. Establish sales compensation program rules, policies, and procedures. Provide deal governance to ensure transactions comply with revenue recognition and business operational policies. Ability to support large and complex standard and non-standard software deals with a strong business insight regarding deal shaping, pricing, licensing, product knowledge, and revenue recognition rules. Directs and supports the consistent implementation of company initiatives.  What We Need From You  Bachelor‚Äôs degree or four or more years of work experience; Master's in Business Administration (MBA) or equivalent an asset. Ten or more years of relevant work experience in sales operations, business planning, or sales support management role. Ability to partner with sales to understand customer requirements. Knowledge that the OPSWAT products are solutions and with your expertise you will be working with customers to prove that our solution can address technical and or business problems that they may be looking to solve and/or perhaps some they are not aware of yet. Experience leading and championing projects. Managed multiple projects and deals under tight timelines. Cultivated strong trusting customer relationships at executive levels. Experience successfully managing analytically rigorous corporate initiatives. Prior large ‚Äúdeal shaping‚Äù, deals desk, sales operations, strategic sales, and/or financial management experience. Experience in developing pricing strategy, margin analysis, and competitive & customer willingness to pay analyses. Ability to engage and negotiate with the customers, when required, in support of closing strategic opportunities. Expert level Excel and financial modeling skills.   OPSWAT is an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.

description: Cloud Range is the recognized leader in live attack simulation training for cybersecurity teams and has pioneered subscription-based Cyber Range access for commercial enterprise customers. Our customers experience all of the benefits of a cyber range as a service, thus removing the burden of a substantial CAPEX purchase and management of infrastructure. We provide our customers an outcome, not just a product!  Today, most cybersecurity experts experience their first attack on the job. Cloud Range enables cybersecurity teams to be fully prepared and ‚ÄúBattle Ready‚Äù for the attack by experiencing simulated cyberattacks in a realistic, high-fidelity, virtual SOC environment and using real-world security tools.  Our Enterprise customers use Cloud Range to train and upskill their teams by immersing them in simulated attacks, while our Government and Education customers use Cloud Range to upskill SOC teams and enable innovative degree and workforce development programs.   We are seeking an Enterprise-focused Regional Director to manage sales activities and business development within an assigned geographic region.   Responsibilities  Manage prospecting and sales activities in an assigned territory with a focus on pipeline growth. Develop close plans for targeted opportunities and drive opportunities to closure. Develop opportunities and relationships with end users/customers (direct sales) and drive them to closure. Develop opportunities and relationships with Channel Partners within the assigned region and manage end-user opportunities to closure through the channel (Channel Sales). Develop relationships with key partners for growth of our products within their markets. Develop a targeted partner plan that maps partner strengths (customer relationship, contracts) to accounts and target opportunities. Focus on account mapping with partner reps, forming an integrated account plan and ultimately optimizing revenue in accounts and exceeding the forecast. Lead sales presentations at end-user locations. Update and manage pipeline and prepare revenue forecasts. Coordinate sales activities with other field sales reps and managers. Perform other duties and projects as assigned.  Requirements  Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent work experience. Performance-based work experience in technology sales (Networking, Security, Software) Existing CISO, CIO relationships Consistent history of exceeding performance metrics/quota  Benefits Medical Vision Dental Significant Equity compensation

We are pursuing highly motivated individuals who display strong achievement orientation, intellectual curiosity, openness, resilience, diligence, and the ability to effectively marshal resources. The Business Development Director will work closely with prospects in the Community Bank and Credit Union community to grow new customer business and MasterCard revenues while meeting strategic objectives. This team focuses on the delivery of customized payment solutions and comprehensive consulting support, while leveraging Mastercard‚Äôs strong brand, technology, operations and risk platforms to deliver bottom line results to Mastercard‚Äôs Partners. This includes optimizing existing volume and growing net new volume through selling Value Added Services to Mastercard‚Äôs clients.  Role  Implement sales plan designs to include business development, marketing and product management activities with prospects and internal Mastercard contacts to identify new business opportunities and product ideas. Develop and execute an individual territory plans for large region that demonstrates the ability to grow business Provide consultative industry and Mastercard insights in alignment with segment specialty for assigned territory Develop financial modeling and business cases for identified opportunities, as well as coordinate contract development. Negotiate, execute and manage the customer contract agreement process, ensuring global linkage of resources and information sharing. Work closely with a large diverse team to achieve revenue targets and increase market share within a defined territory.  All About You Motivated self-starter, ability to work independently, able to identify and direct activities to achieve objectives Bachelor‚Äôs degree required with emphasis in business management or sales. Business experience with related sales and management experience in the payments industry Demonstrated track record of planning, managing and closing complex, competitive sales effort and project management Excellent strategic thinking and analysis skills and a proven track record of creating solutions that increase revenue Ability to manage and grow internal and external cross functional relationships and partnerships  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We‚Äôve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we‚Äôre all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. But there‚Äôs so much more to us than our top-notch portfolio of beers, seltzers, and more. We believe our people are our greatest asset, and we‚Äôre looking for people like you to join our shared dream of bringing people together for a better world. Are you up for the Challenge?  The Beyond Beer Director is responsible for achieving key sales objectives through the managing of multiple distributors, aggressively growing new accounts, facilitating the growth and development of the Beyond Beer product mix and brand value in a defined market area. Manages portfolio encompassing three rapidly growing segments within AB, known as Beyond Beer ‚Äì Flavored Malt Beverage (FMB) & Hard Seltzer, Wine & Spirits, and Non-Alcoholics 80% of duties focus on strategic planning and regional brand management, 20% in trade working directly with beer distributor partners Executes quarterly and annual strategic business plan for achieving budgeted sales figures for defined region area Collaborates with national brand teams to develop localized retail, media, and sampling programs to accelerate brand growth Creates, presents, and tracks sales incentive programs to wholesalers Monitors sales volume goals for wholesalers within defined market Recommends and implements the Beyond Beer sales strategies for improvement based on market research and competitor analyses Presents new brands and marketing strategies to wholesalers Acts as the direct contact from the brewery to accounts, and wholesalers within market territory Acts as direct point of contact for all AB/BB Region employees in the Regions for the Beyond Beer Portfolio Implements pricing strategies to bring competitive advantage to products on shelf - bring forward any competitive disadvantages or profitable opportunities to the company Organizes and executes effective Market Blitz‚Äôs w/ Brewery Sales force Creates solutions-oriented plans to address in-market opportunities or disadvantages based on data analysis and feedback Job Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required; MBA preferred 5-7 years of sales and marketing experience, ideally in Wine or Spirits industry Must have experience supporting initiatives across multiple states In-depth knowledge of Total US marketing and sales organization General knowledge of business financials and experience managing budgets Strong communication skills both external and internal, required Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and internal system tools, required Must possess an in-depth knowledge of beverage / consumer goods industry Job Function Commercial  Primary Location United States-Illinois-Chicago  Schedule Full-time  Job Type Permanent  Posting Date Sep 22, 2021  Anheuser-Busch is here for the times that matter. The moments where we celebrate, defy challenges, dream of the brighter future we are building today‚Äì and all the moments in between. As the leading global brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev is committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity, and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: Who we are:  ChartHop delivers a fresh take on People Analytics, bringing disparate sources of people data together in a dynamic platform that's visual and actionable. Unlike legacy People Analytics solutions, ChartHop is designed to be used by the whole organization. This helps companies improve organizational health, drive alignment and accountability, and save time and money.  ChartHop plays well with dozens of platforms through robust integrations across the HR tech stack, and serves companies like BetterCloud, Lightspeed, Starburst and InVision. ChartHop was founded in 2019 by Ian White and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz.  We're looking for skilled and motivated people to join our team! Do you want to help companies unleash the power of their people data to plan effectively and with intention? Do you have what it takes to envision the future of work, and then to take us there? Join us!  Director of Sales  Develop, manage, and grow a team of star Account Executives  We're looking for our first Director of Sales to manage a rapidly growing team of Account Executives to sell our ChartHop platform to People/HR leaders. You'll be instrumental in setting strategy, coaching reps, and co-selling deals as ChartHop continues to deliver it's best in class people analytics solution to a broader audience!  We will measure your success through Pipeline growth and bookings.  As a Director of Sales you will: Provide support and guidance to AEs at all points of the sales cycles Join reps during meetings to drive bookings Recruit, interview, train and hire a world class team Coach and develop reps with varying levels of experience Deliver accurate forecasts based on pipeline and rep activity Design, implement, and iterate on various sales strategies Ensure activity is appropriately logged and tracked in Salesforce Engage and build relationships with People/HR executives Bring on the ground feedback to the product team to influence the product roadmap  Requirements: 5+ years of sales management experience 3+ years of Saas sales management experience Proven track record of building teams that meet and exceed quota A strong desire to sell Comfort in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment Familiarity with Salesforce  Unsure if you meet the qualifications? We encourage SaaS sales professionals who are passionate about this work to apply!  Our Core Values:  We're building ChartHop to be the best People Software on the planet and that starts with hiring the best people globally. We're building an inclusive culture we're looking for people who embrace our core values: Fast: Move with intentional speed. Inclusive: Welcome our differences. Transparent: Trust, collaborate, share. Optimistic: Dream big, think practically.  Perks and Benefits: Health/benefits coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life insurance, Long term and Short term disability, many more) MacBook Pro Work from home supplies stipend Professional development stipend Vacation days 401K Parental leave Pet insurance Mental Health benefits Many more  Salary range - $250K- $300K OTE uncapped plus equity  ChartHop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  The Sales Director will be responsible for managing strategic and existing relationships (Costco) whilst building new relationships to achieve and exceed sales goals. entrepreneurial ‚Ä¢ Resourceful and capable of excelling with limited funds in a highly competitive environment. ‚Ä¢ Balanced entrepreneurial, opportunistic thinking with good discipline. ‚Ä¢ Must have a critical eye to identifying opportunities and risks ‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze data and big picture opportunities in the marketplace ‚Ä¢ Must have the ability to see a great idea, no matter where COMPETENCES & BEHAVIOURS  ‚Ä¢ Communication ‚Ä¢ Results Driven ‚Ä¢ Initiative ‚Ä¢ Customer/Client Focus ‚Ä¢ Technical Capacity ‚Ä¢ Performance Management ‚Ä¢ Leadership ‚Ä¢ Problem Solving/Analysis ‚Ä¢ Organizational Skills ‚Ä¢ Teamwork Orientation ‚Ä¢ Business Acumen

description: Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Principal Account Executive to join an exciting and rapidly growing team responsible for bringing Amazon Care to new enterprise customers. The Principal Account Executive is responsible for prospecting directly into Large Enterprise benefit buyers and also building and growing relationships with consultants and brokers on a local, regional and national scope. This role works closely with product, marketing and clinicals teams to deliver ROI for our customers. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations and work backwards to deliver on their health and productivity goals. You should be a self-starter who is not afraid to ‚Äòget hands dirty‚Äô with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers‚Äô biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is re-imagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon‚Äôs virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon‚Äôs culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we‚Äôre building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities include Build sales opportunities with benefit buyers through inbound lead generation as well as self-generated outbound prospecting Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to deliver healthcare innovation Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography  Basic Qualifications 10+ years of professional experience in large enterprise business solution sales or business development, selling : 1/ healthcare services directly to employee benefit buyers or through broker-consultants in any industry or 2/ selling b2b services to enterprise clients within the Healthcare sector 7+ years experience with prospecting, identifying, pursuing, and closing new opportunities BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Completed MBA or advanced Business Degree Experience working in healthcare sales including point solution organizations Thrives in early-stage, start-up environments Energized by being an industry pioneer and innovator Proven success in building relationships using a consultative, solutions-focused approach Passion for prospecting, qualifying and negotiating net-new opportunities System and analytics skills include: 1/ Microsoft Excel for business cases analyses 2/ SFDC for customer opportunity management and account planning and 3/ Collaboration hardware and software for virtual customer-facing meetings Strong business writing and verbal presentation skills including story telling in both formats Familiar with Healthcare economics, total cost of care, value-based care, and reimbursement methodologies Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-task driven environment Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent business judgment Mentors sales team members Sets the bar for high team standards Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution Drives innovation for their team and broader organization Thinks big and has convictions Is action and results-oriented and self-reliant Is analytical and structured For Colorado-based jobs: The pay range for this position in Colorado is $233k to $306k/yr; however, base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. For more information regarding Amazon benefits, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/benefits. Applicants should apply via Amazon‚Äôs internal or external careers site.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. description: Role: We are seeking an experienced, motivated, high-energy, Sales Director for transformative strength & fitness platforms and software subscriptions. OxeFit will not sponsor employment visa. Why Join Us You‚Äôll get a chance to put your skills to work and be a key part of a $1bn company that already has a great track record in Europe and is now launching in the US. description: As we continue to build out and expand our retail business within the US, we are excited to bring on a new Account Director to build launch plans and strategies inside points of distribution in Key Accounts in North America, including Ulta. This role will be responsible for successfully managing and partnering with these key points of distribution to build brand passion and awareness while driving retail sales growth and net shipments.  We are looking for someone who is excited to be a part of building a rapidly growing brand, and helping to lead our channel strategy through to day to day execution. This role is on the Sales Team, reporting directly to the VP of Sales. TULA headquarters are based in Nomad in New York City (but we are working remotely / hybrid for now!). This role can also be based remotely.  Key Responsibilities Channel Management: Integral in continuing to build momentum in strong retail development and expansion strategy, including negotiating and planning with VP of Sales, how best to partner, optimize key levers, and competitive trade offs within channels Own omni-channel retailer specific market plans, developing and executing innovative and best in class retail strategy, equipped to drive strong comp revenue and profitability to fuel rapid growth, achieving aggressive sales goals while expanding market share Sales and budget planning/ forecasting and promotional strategy Space and location strategy and execution including merchandising, retail marketing, and assortment planning Channel specific retail activations including EDU and Event initiatives Successfully manage retail partnerships, fostering excellent working relationships with all members of merchant teams Responsible for channel marketing calendars and market decks in collaboration with the VP of Sales and Brand/ Trade Marketing Oversee channel product assortments maximizing productivity, mix, and merchandising presentation, including partnering with Retail Marketing on merchandising and planogram strategy, budget and execution for temporary displays and long term selling space in accordance with brand ethos and standards Responsible for driving innovation focused on optimizing current programs, and building/ testing new programs and opportunities Facilitate strong cross-functional collaboration across Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Education Ability to travel as needed (~20%)  Qualifications 10+ years of industry experience and 5+ years of Account Management sales experience in beauty within Ulta and/ or Sephora required Growth mindset that translates into a passion for the retail experience in a fun, fresh way Impeccable project management, communication and presentation skills Analytical capabilities and Excel skills Passion for beauty, skincare, health & wellness!  About TULA Skincare  TULA, meaning "balance" in Sanskrit, is a leading skincare & wellness brand built on the power of probiotic extracts & superfoods. We believe that the same ingredients which are good for your body are also great for your skin. We focus on being healthy, not perfect & feeling confident in your skin. We are committed to bringing clean, clinically proven & effective skincare to the market. We are proudly cruelty-free. Alongside TULA.com we retail with ULTA Beauty, Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus, Dermstore, QVC, & Amazon. We raised a Series A led by L Catterton, the largest consumer-focused private equity group in the world. Our team has experience in some of the top consumer startups & beauty companies. TULA headquarters are based in New York City.
industries: Internet, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Company Overview: Vital Proteins is a dynamic organization consisting of a team of passionate individuals who believe whole-food-based nutrition is essential for overall health, fitness and wellbeing. Our team is comprised of intelligent and innovative talent who work collaboratively to ensure creativity, success, and global growth. At Vital Proteins, our mission is to empower our company, team, customers and consumers to live a full, vibrant life. We seek to hire, develop and support individuals, who continually ask questions and seek out ways to improve strategies and tactics involving our brands, sales, operations, innovation and other go-to market activities.  Role: We are looking for a Senior National Account Manager to lead Target's relationship.  This role will be based in Minneapolis, MN reporting to the Director of Sales Mass. The individual will be instrumental to the growth and scale of Vital Proteins. responsible for sell into strategies, strategic account management, collaborating with sales leadership on overall strategy, project management, analyzing the business and developing skills on data driven selling and managing the performance of the channel. This individual will contribute to the overall topline sales strategy and will work collaboratively with all aspects of sales ‚Äì including leadership, Trade Marketing, Education, Customer Supply Chain, Sales Operations, and other cross functional leaders and will work closely with sales analysts on go to market strategy, performance, and category optimization.  What you will be responsible for: Strategic account management of Target, including sell into, strategic account business planning, creating field-based execution strategies and ROI analytics Develop a comprehensive strategic business plan for Target. Develop and execute sales plan to ensure delivery of revenue target Partner with field sales teams to ensure day to day execution and support of key account initiatives Develop top line strategies to present to leadership for sign off Research and actively seek new business in alignment with targeted sales goals. Increasing revenue, engagement, and brand awareness in defined territory. Working closely with sales and trade marketing team on trade spend and setting appropriate expectations with accounts. Actively participate in trade shows and major sales events.  Who you are: A bachelor‚Äôs degree in business and equivalent experience in account management. Have 7+ years of previous key account selling experience, preferably in a startup and/or CPG. Have established business cadence and relationships within Target‚Äôs vertical. Prior experience using Partners Online (POL) for pulling and reviewing data required. Motivated, adaptable, a team player and a self-starter. Comfortable in a fast-paced, growing company with the ability to adapt to change quickly. Takes initiative and proactively looks for and suggests process improvements. Active listener with strong negotiating / problem solving skills with a dose of humility. Highly Proficient with Microsoft Excel. Proven and successful sales management track record. Leadership skills and competencies for advancement within the company. Willing to spend a significant amount of time working with sales departments and leadership teams. Ability to travel for trade shows, field-based execution, sales calls, and meetings - approximately 30%-40% of time.

description: About Us  At Sensyne Health we combine technology and ethically sourced patient data to help people everywhere get better care. To do this, we have created unique partnerships with health systems that fairly compensate them for the analysis of EHR data to support life sciences research. We also deliver clinical AI solutions to health systems and payers to improve patient care.  We have trusted relationships with dozens of UK and US health systems, plus commercial partnerships with leading biopharma companies. We are rapidly growing in order to scale up our early success in both the life sciences and healthcare markets.  VP North American Sales - SaaS  Sensyne Health is seeking an influential, accomplished, and collaborative leader to help shape and promote our mission to accelerate medical research and improve patient care, driving strategic and commercial partnerships with life sciences business and healthcare systems around our AI data platform - Sensight. Your ability to identify, assess, negotiate, and finalize platform business opportunities will help us scale our trusted data community between patients, clinicians, healthcare providers, and life science companies.  Reporting directly to our Chief Business Development Officer you will play a key role in securing commercial pipelines and delivering partnership wins. You‚Äôll be a key early hire in the US, playing a leading role in commercial strategy as we grow North American operations.  This is a rare an exciting opportunity to lead in some fascinating market spaces. We‚Äôre a high potential organization delivering on the promise of digital health. Some highlights: We work in areas of healthcare undergoing massive change and transformation. We bring a strong track record of success with UK hospital trusts and global life sciences companies like Bayer, Roche, and Alexion. We are making an immediate splash in the US market thanks to a strategic partnership with Phesi and early partnerships with CCPM, St. Luke's University Health Network, and Sentara Healthcare. Our real-world data analytics platform ‚Äì Sensight ‚Äì enables analysis of fully de-identified from a combined clinical research, clinical trial, and real world dataset of over 60 million patients.  How You‚Äôll Help  We‚Äôre an entrepreneurial company on a high growth trajectory working in a dynamic and evolving market sector. We‚Äôre very much mission led, with a patient-centered worldview and an ethical approach to delivering on the promise of healthcare data via the creation of a trusted data community between patients, clinicians, healthcare providers, and life science companies.  Leading negotiations with major life science and health system partners, providing thought leadership and BD execution capabilities for Sensight, scaling and leading a SaaS team, and other new business initiatives, you will take responsibility for commercial partnership evaluation and business wins. We are looking for someone who is intensely collaborative and passionately focused on the patient. Your work will help us find ways to improve the quality, availability, precision, and cost of care.  Responsibilities: Lead, advise and build out the market space for Sensight in North America. Develop our commercial portfolio through prospecting, qualifying, negotiating, and closing deals with pharma, biotech and health systems for RWD analytics subscriptions. Assist with developing business models and creative deal terms to align priorities Build, nurture, and grow trust-filled relationships with clients to scale adoption and position Sensyne for ongoing commercial success Create, plan, lead and scale a team of SaaS specialists  Requirements Extensive business development and commercial experience: You know how to design and close deals, specifically within SaaS in Life Sciences. Clear understanding of the opportunities afforded through AI and its clinical applications. You understand the value in our work Demonstrable expertise in building partnerships around products and data with healthcare or life sciences with a view to delivering patient benefit. You understand the marketplace Demonstrable track record of creating and supporting partnerships between healthcare systems, pharmaceuticals businesses and product, digital or SaaS businesses: You have an impressive background in high-quality work and the sector thinks highly of your contribution. Broad network of senior level contacts across the industry: You know the right people to speak with at provider and (optionally) payer organizations. Deep understanding of strategies and negotiation of partnerships across several geographical territories: You understand the complexity and know the hurdles. Expertise in account management processes and ability to support complex strategic partnerships: You prize successful customers as highly as new customers Ability to analyze market opportunities and to link to opportunities across the company‚Äôs clinical AI expertise: You can think ahead Strong negotiating skills and ability to structure partnerships: You know how to move from enquiry to customer Highly motivated self-starter with ability to work to deadlines Excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills Proven history of working well in teams, and across boundaries within organisations Ability to select, manage and deliver across a broad portfolio of projects involving multiple disciplines and stakeholders

description: Welcome to Jetty, the financial services platform on a mission to make renting a home more affordable and flexible. We've built multiple financial products that benefit both renters and property managers - and we're just getting started.  As a Regional Sales Director, your mission will be making Jetty the first choice for institutional apartment owners and managers looking for innovative insurance and financial solutions. You will contribute to the scaling of Jetty's Real Estate Sales function and be instrumental in Jetty's overall go-to-market strategy. Using your deep sales background and strong experience of selling to executive decision makers, you will make a meaningful mark on the business. You report directly to our National Director of Sales.  This position focuses on Jetty's Northeast sales territory (NY, NJ, MA, CT, etc), and thus we highly prefer a candidate who currently resides in the region.  Role & Responsibilities Analyze territory market potential and execute prospecting strategies to build a pipeline of qualified potential Jetty Partners Present, promote and sell Jetty's platform of integrated products to multifamily real estate owners and managers Organize and maintain all sales activities and opportunities in Salesforce to track progress against quarterly and annual sales goals Design and execute contracting packages for long-term Jetty partnerships Collaborate with Partner Success and Partner Solutions teams to maximize revenue Contribute to cross-functional projects with other internal Jetty teams (including Marketing, Product, Finance, and Engineering) Represent Jetty at virtual, national and regional industry events and conferences ~40% travel expected (once COVID restrictions are lifted)  Experience & Qualifications Minimum 7 years of enterprise sales experience selling to executive level Minimum 3 years of multifamily or commercial real estate sales experience Proven success with long, complex sales cycles (a.k.a. you hit your goals/quotas) Excel at selling multiple products across various stakeholders within large institutions Ability to develop and execute regional sales strategy aligned to company growth goals Effective communicator, who can give a clear, concise pitch to any audience Focus on empathy in your sales approach; responsive to each Partner's requirements Multifamily real estate sales experience and/or industry knowledge a big plus Comfortable with shifting legal and compliance environments Scrappy self-starter who drives projects to completion  About Jetty  Jetty's integrated suite of products help property managers increase lease conversions, improve resident retention, reduce bad debt, and boost NOI. For renters, Jetty decreases the financial burden of moving into a new home and offers greater flexibility with how and when to pay rent.  Jetty has raised more than $70M from investors including Khosla Ventures, Ribbit Capital, Citi and Valar, and has a highly collaborative team working remotely around the country. To learn more about Jetty, visit jetty.com.  Jetty is firmly committed to building a team as diverse as our Members. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, ancestry, citizenship, sex, gender identity or expression, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, or veteran status.  Benefits & Perks Health, dental, and vision insurance through Aetna & MetLife 401(k) through Betterment Optional life and disability coverage, HSA & FSA 20 days of PTO + 12 holidays, "Jetty Winter Break," and unlimited sick days Generous parental leave policy Flexible work schedules to accommodate remote work Stipends to cover WFH set-up, monthly childcare, and monthly phone/internet bill
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects at the same time with limited supervision; excellent planning, time management and decision-making skills. Excellent work history, attendance, initiative, and drive to succeed. Maintain excellent communication and relationships with others; be a team player; maintain a positive attitude. PAY And BENEFITS Truck Hero offers competitive pay and commission structure Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision health insurance A matched 401k savings program to plan and save for your retirement Paid vacation and time off to ensure time with your family and a work/life balance Educational assistance to continue college or pursue other skills and further your career Discounts on great Truck Hero products for you, your family, and friends WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? jobTitle: Director of Sales, Europe / Middle East / Africa (EMEA)
description: General Summary  Description  This Director of Sales, Europe/Middle East/Africa (EMEA) is responsible for aircraft sales in Europe, Middle East & Africa regions of a global network.  Duties And Responsibilities Traveling to attend regional and national marketing events, visit dealer locations, and meet with prospective customers within the EMEA region. Manage network of dealers and sales representatives and assist them in sales process. Following up on direct sales opportunities as required. Provide response to sales inquiries and new dealer inquiries Developing market forecasts for the region and presenting metrics to senior management. Creating thorough market analysis and proposals to review with senior management. Analyzing EMEA market and researching potential dealer and authorized sales representative candidates. Managing new dealer orientation, integration and training for selected dealer associates. Qualifications  Education, Work Experience, Certification And/or Licensure Bachelor's required; MBA or equivalent preferred. 5-10 years of experience in business development or sales involvement in international region is required; Previous experience with an emphasis on business aircraft preferred. Previous dealer channel management experience preferred; Dealer channel management within the EMEA region preferred. Previous aircraft sales experience preferred. Successful record of managing sales support functions (e.g. - Aircraft or Heavy Equipment Demos, Marketing and Sales Campaigns, Direct Sales and Events) required. Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Detailed knowledge of warranties, service plans, aircraft performance, aircraft tax implications, import and export requirements, international sales, tax implications, financial analysis, aircraft maintenance and other facets related to the sales and servicing of aircraft is required. Strong knowledge and background experience with CRM systems including tracking lead development, sales campaigns and establishing metrics is preferred. Thorough understanding of the aircraft and/or heavy equipment sales cycle. Strong program management, analytical and assessment skills are required. Strong presentation building and spreadsheet skills are required. Demonstrated leadership and strong negotiation skills are required. Proficiency in MS Office products (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) and Lotus Notes. Ability to communicate effectively and develop relationships internally and externally. Ability to speak, read and write in English is required. Ability to speak, read and write in a foreign language is preferred. Physical Requirements Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors. Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties. Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.). Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties. Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions. Effectively communicate in Business English language. Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties. Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided ‚Äúreach assistance technology‚Äù or ‚Äúmovement assist technology‚Äù (fork-lifts, pallet jacks, pulleys, dolly‚Äôs, robotics reach equipment, people movers etc.), as required by job duties. description: About Boardable Boardable is a fast-growing company with a mission to increase board member engagement and effectiveness for mission-driven organizations by becoming the global go-to brand for board management software. Celebrated for our mission, purpose, and values, Boardable was recently selected as one of Business Intelligence Group's Best Places to Work. We are always on the lookout for talented people who demonstrate drive, integrity, respect, teamwork, and empathy.  About the Role We are searching for a hungry and curious Account Representative to join exceptional sales team. The account representative will follow up on leads, converting them into demos, trials, and paid accounts to establish new relationships, grow our business, and drive revenue. Account Representatives at Boardable own a sales quotas and are expected to reach revenue targets. We are looking for an experienced SaaS sales superstar who is deeply invested in helping mission-driven organizations succeed. Experience working in SaaS sales is required, and experience serving at or working for a nonprofit is a plus.  Duties/Responsibilities Presenting and demonstrating the value of Boardable to prospective buyers through engaging and customized demos Conduct discovery calls to manage all discover customer needs and requests Ownership of the full sales cycle from lead to close for prospective customers Target and establish new relationships to develop pipeline through outbound efforts Manage all aspects of a pipeline from qualified leads to close using Hubspot (CRM) Exceed sales goals and expectations for quotas Provide excellent follow-up, communicating and organizating escalation of issues appropriately Collaborate closely with Customer Success, SDRs, Marketing, and leadership to build strategic plans for customers and prospects to achieve success Utilize consultative selling methods to consult with prospects to determine the best solutions for their specific needs Draft, edit, and finalize proposals, reference lists, and other materials used in the sales process Track and report monthly sales metrics (e.g., leads, demos, trials, MRR) through Hubspot Identify and attend sponsored events/tradeshows as needed to serve as Boardable ambassador (when it is safe to do so again), meeting with prospective customers, surveying competitive offerings, and learning market trends Work with customer success team to achieve smooth handoff of new customers for training and ongoing support needs Coach and Mentor new Account Representatives  Experience/Education/Skills At least 2 years experience in SaaS sales Proven track record of meeting and exceeding quota on a consistent basis Proven success in closing SaaS opportunities with multiple stakeholders Strong presentation skills and ability to facilitate an engaging demo Naturally curious Strong collaboration skills Technology skills; Google, Word, Excel, CRMs, virtually meeting software Exceptional communication skills Thrive in a fast-paced environment, excel at handling multiple concurrent projects and have a relentless obsession for excellence Self-motivated, organized, disciplined and able to work on your own and as part of a team A creative planner and doer with the ability to lead and influence peers Detail-oriented with strong attention to follow-through

jobTitle: Leader of Sales and Business Development
description: Company Description: When clients need help with logistics and supply chain management, they turn to Gaea Global Technologies. We offer a comprehensive set of supply chain, warehouse management, and logistics solutions.  We sell and support Supply Chain Management as a cloud-based SaaS solution that gives organizations the freedom and flexibility to easily manage the supply chain lifecycle.  Position Description:  Gaea Global Technology is currently looking for a charismatic and energetic Leader, Sales and Business Development professional to take up the challenging role of building a market for our cloud-based platforms in the Supply Chain and Warehouse Management market.  The Leader, Sales, and Business Development is responsible for crafting go-to-market strategies, product & brand penetration strategies, and focusing on revenue growth for Oracle EBS and Cloud Label Service platform. The role should also focus on growing a diverse customer base of new and existing clients. This is a "roll up your sleeves and get the job done" position for an individual contributor.  Responsibilities: Own and manage all aspects of growth, including but not limited to sales, content marketing, advertisement, and analytics. Promote product growth by defining, developing, and implementing product strategies, roadmaps, and features. Maintain sales pipeline and close new business. Optimize growth funnels through data analysis and client research. Conduct comprehensive market research to identify growth opportunities for our solutions. Develop and execute initiatives to reach new prospects and companies. Provide clear direction for team members by setting targets, prioritizing tasks, assigning responsibility, and monitoring workflow. Optimize business analytics and streamline business development processes. Collaborate with other departments to design and develop opportunities to increase engagement and identify qualified prospects. Use business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling campaigns, and develop accounts on a continual basis. Work with the CEO and COO to ensure all customer touchpoints are consistent with the brand. Effectively articulate the solution capabilities with impactful storytelling. Outstanding verbal and written communication in English. Excellent interpersonal skills. Creative thinking and proactive problem-solving. Open to frequent travel within North America and Internationally. This individual will be an experienced and efficient leader with excellent people skills, business acumen, and an exemplary work ethic. Will build and lead a winning sales team and organization through hiring and inspiring team members. Ideal candidates will know and have worked within the Oracle SaaS sales world.  Requirements: 5+ years of sales experience and have consistently exceeded their target sales quota with a minimum of USD $1M+ in revenue. Minimum of 5+ years sales of Enterprise Warehouse Software Systems or Logistics software or hardware products that are reliant on labeling and accurate tracking. Experience in a Sales Executive role and have exhibited proven sales leadership to develop and implement revenue-driving strategies, which create long-term customer and business value. Demonstrated experience in selling enterprise supply chain management (hardware/software/devices) or related cloud software solutions to Manufacturing, Healthcare, CPG or other related industries required. PLEASE NOTE: You must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident Green Card holder to be considered. No sponsorships are available at this time.  Why consider the opportunity? This is the only salesperson in the US, and you will have an open territory without any competition. Full-time salaried position with commission milestones and benefits. Opportunity to work closely with the marketing team. Remote position with some travel as needed around North America and possibly Internationally. Over the last two decades, Gaea‚Äôs founders have deployed enterprise applications for more than 2000 customers.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain and Computer Software

description: This role is a remote home office position ideally in close proximity to the client in the northeast or with access to a major metropolitan airport for frequent travel to the client site. This senior role is an essential member of the SPX FLOW leadership team and responsible for positively impacting end market results and the overall success of the business with Pfizer. This role provides strategic direction, leadership, and accountability for key account growth globally.  The Global Key Account Director will create and lead with a culture of strong leadership, innovation and disciplined practices and processes. This leader will also develop and maintain a sustained and long-term continuous improvement and efficient approach to key account management, leveraging best practices and external support where appropriate .  Principal Duties And Responsibilities  Reporting to the VP - Business Development & Key Accounts, the Global Key Account Director is responsible for managing the Pfizer account, increasing wallet share, growing revenue and enhancing profitability by: Serving as the lead point of contact for all Pfizer account management matters and developing trusted advisor relationships Maintaining and enhancing existing customer relationships to ensure high customer satisfaction, monitor operational performance, improve debtor days, identify new opportunities, ensure continued partnership with customers Evaluating market trends, align portfolio, engineering & sales activities to maximize growth Calculating key customer needs (Voice of Customer), associated investment plans and expansion opportunities Developing new business to increase volume, revenue growth and wallet share Negotiating contracts/framework agreements to maximize profits with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors Ensuring the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Clearly communicating the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Forecasting and tracking key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) and preparing reports on account status Collaborating with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within existing and new territories Assisting with challenging client requests or issue escalations as required Developing, updating, and understanding the Key Account Plan for each customer so the company can map out its customers history and help determine their future and so that both the company and its customers can grow. Role Requirements Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Manager, or relevant role supporting the pharmaceutical industry, specifically Pfizer Experience selling into the Pharmaceutical industry specific to process, equipment, and technology. Customer & market focused, future oriented leader with relevant experience, developing & leading growth strategies within an equipment organization Strong business and organizational acumen, executive disposition & a strong bias for results. Effective relationship building skills Proven ability to juggle multiple key accounts at a time, while maintaining attention to detail Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level Good experience with CRM software; MS Dynamics, Cloud 4 Customer (C4C), Salesforce etc., and MS Office (particularly MS Excel) Fluent spoken and written English language Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills Experienced working in an International environment with matrix organization Travel (including occasional international) up to 50%-75% of the time 5+ years relevant experience Prefer bachelors‚Äô/masters‚Äô degree in engineering or related discipline WORKING CONDITIONS  The Global Key Account Director will work within a regular office or home office environment dependent on the physical location of the successful candidate, with the expectation you will visit customers extensively. You will be expected to travel to global customer locations on a regular basis (up to 50% of your time)  SPX FLOW VALUES  SPX Flow employees are expected to behave in accordance with our company values as outlined below: THINK CUSTOMER, ALL OF THE TIME EMBRACE TEAMWORK WITH NO BORDERS BE OBSESSED WITH BEING THE BEST OWN YOUR ACTIONS ASK THE HARD QUESTION DO THE RIGHT THING, ALWAYS! APPRECIATE THE MOMENT Equal Opportunity Employer  SPX Flow is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by law.  Based in Charlotte, North Carolina, SPX FLOW, Inc. (NYSE: FLOW) innovates with customers to help feed and enhance the world by designing, delivering and servicing high value solutions at the heart of growing and sustaining our diverse communities. The company's product offering is concentrated in rotating, actuating and hydraulic technologies, as well as automated process systems, into food and beverage, industrial and power and energy markets. SPX FLOW has approximately $2 billion in annual revenues with operations in more than 30 countries and sales in more than 150 countries.

description: The US Head of Sales is responsible for overseeing the sales department for a fun event oriented, food and beverage US expansion into New York. Responsible for sales strategy implementation and tactical implementation to achieve or exceed the sales targets for the NYC business.  Ensuring that the group sales products meet customer demand and are well placed against competitor products. description: We're looking for the crazy ones that are going to change the world.  Newchip is a global startup focused software suite that provides world changing early-stage startups with the tools, skills, mentorship, and network necessary to successfully raise, build, and scale their businesses to exit. We're a veteran founding team with decades of experience, numerous acquisitions under our belts, and we're looking for the next member of our team.  We've helped fund over $150M into companies and are looking for team members that want to truly help startups by connecting them to our services and product suite. If you're looking to make a difference in the world while also generating personal success, this role will provide you with the mentorship, leadership, and long-term growth potential to make that dream a reality.  Mission Statement: We deliver results and set the standard for entrepreneurs and investors everywhere. That being said, we're a 100% personal meritocracy so before we move forward do you fit our core company values? Personal Integrity - We take ownership for our responsibilities and do what we say we will do no matter what. Humble & Coachable - We have respect for authority and experience, but also a hunger for constant feedback. Self Motivation - We strive to learn, grow, and constantly improve ourselves so that we can contribute to the team. Gritty Resolve - We face down all adversity, we take all criticism, and we get knocked down, but we always get back up. Passionately Ambitious - We put everything into our work because accomplishing the team goal, equals personal success.  About You‚Ä¶ You have experience with startups, SaaS, and technology products You have a passion for entrepreneurship, startups. You can connect with, lead, and influence executive decision-makers You have the ability to hire, build, and retain high performance sales teams  Requirements Seasoned startup and SaaS veteran who can innovate and drive strategic market penetration, account success, and top line revenue growth with (5+ years) as a builder and/or leader of high performing biz-dev/sales teams Proven track record of initiating and driving early commercial success, working across multiple platforms and products, and ‚Äòblitzscaling‚Äô biz-dev/sales teams for hyper-growth Advanced skills in talent acquisition and retention strategy including recruiting high performing team members, building team structure, and assessing future organizational skills for career success Ability to create the roadmap for the next 3-5 years, including defining annual revenue and expansion goals, annual recurring revenue goals, customer success measures, and aligning the product roadmap to topline growth strategy. Communication, presentation, and influencing skills, with familiarity and fluency in technical concepts and associated language A demonstrated ability to think strategically about issues, forming recommendations and actionable plans over to implement Data-driven decision maker with strong analytical reasoning power and ability to A/B test and iterate to process success. Proactively support Sales Teams to win business and to align on-the-ground tactics with top-level growth strategy. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in related field. Advanced degrees are a plus, but not required. Have led a sales organization of 20+ team members and $15MM+ in annual revenue  Benefits Be a part of a global team with a hybrid in-office and remote culture with a headquarters in East Austin, Texas. Compensation packages include competitive rates, performance incentives, equity, and company stock options. Covered benefits that include medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances. plus we offer a 401k program. Up to 30 days of vacation allotted per year including PTO, Holidays, Sick Days and Election Day. Build culture and engage startup community with frequently planned outings and team events. Access to all of our certified accelerator programs if you launch a startup during your career here (valued at $250k+). Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a revolutionary space working with thousands of startups around the globe!
