description: OSARO is poised to grow rapidly this year and we are recruiting a Sales Director to help accelerate this growth.  As Director of Sales for North America, you will be selling our robotic automation solutions to the top global retailers, system integrators, 3PLs, and robot manufacturers. You will be selling truly unique solutions, and many large customers will be waiting to talk with you.  We value candidates who are naturally curious, passionate about their work, and love being challenged. You are a caring listener, communicate directly, and believe in doing what you say.  Our management team will be extremely supportive in your pursuit to help capture the market in North America. We will learn about how you work best and provide you with the tools needed to achieve your biggest goals.  What You'll Be Doing Driving sales of complex solutions, selling ideas Closing deals independently Directly owning key customer relationships Traveling regularly, roughly 50% of the time Thoughtfully listening to customers Being and instrumental and senior member of a rapidly expanding company Skills You'll Need 6+ years of enterprise sales experience 2+ years experience selling solutions specifically for logistics and distribution centers Proficiency with spreadsheets and ROI calculations Adaptability, innate commitment to persevere Drive to be constantly self-teaching (like our software) Bonus if You Have Knowledge of machine learning, robotics, or other advanced technologies More About OSARO  OSARO offers robotic solutions powered by machine learning, specifically for picking and placing tasks in distribution centers and factories. The company is known for having the most powerful machine vision technology for robotic piece-picking, which has been verified by the world‚Äôs top retailers, system integrators, robot manufacturers, and 3PLs.  OSARO has validated its solutions with the most sophisticated robotic piece-picking deployments in the market, including for grocery distribution and cosmetics use cases, where key challenges include a) high SKU inventories, b) varying, complex packaging types, and c) fragile items requiring delicate handling. The company is the only full-stack robotics company to also offer a vision-only solution.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Industrial Automation, and Computer Software

description: About Bevy: 100% Remote Organization  Bevy is an early stage Startup with a mission to help brands build, grow and scale their virtual and in-person communities. Founded in April 2017 by the core team behind Startup Grind, Bevy is an Enterprise-grade SaaS platform used by companies that include Adobe, Amazon, Asana, Atlassian, Ebay, Epic Games, IDEO, Intuit, MongoDB, Red Bull, Roblox, Salesforce, SAP, Slack and many more. In April 2019, Bevy acquired CMX which is the world's largest network of community professionals. CMX offers world-class training, events and research for the community industry. In March 2021, we raised a $40M series C investment. For this funding round, we've built a coalition of investors that reflect the communities that we live in every day.  Job Summary:  Reporting to the SVP of Sales, the Regional Sales Director, you will play a key role in driving strategic, enterprise-wide sales initiatives, and lead a highly visible and motivated team that generates revenue that is tasked with achieving individual, team and organizational quotas. This  role will be a valuable contributor to the Bevy Sales organization, with responsibilities that align with growing our sales teams, supporting new business efforts, and expanding our existing business.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Play a key role on the Sales team that will be achieving against aggressive goals in agressive year over year growth Recruit, build, and manage an efficient and productive Enterprise Account Executive team Lead compassionately and focus on coaching and developing team members by providing regular constructive feedback Target and build relationships with senior executives helping them tackle mission-critical problems within their business Map and embed our product within strategic priorities for prospective customers Maintain C-Level customer, agency and industry relationships Collaborate closely with team across all functions at Bevy; working closely with team leads to continue building our network, presence and brand Manage a pipeline of opportunities in Salesforce Interface and negotiate with prospective customers at C-suite levels Partner closely within the team and across teams to ensure regular sharing of best practices, vertical expertise, customer insights, research and other related strategies Act as a role model of Bevy's culture and values by fostering an environment of diversity, inclusion and belonging, inspiring the team to do their best work, and to win  Knowledge, Skill and Experience: 10+ years in enterprise level sales, business development, or similar experience Successful SaaS sales experience Ability to reach and develop relationships with C-level executives Proven success in carrying quota; closing deals A track record of success in selling business applications and complex solutions Experience managing and closing a complex sales-cycles Demonstrated experience working collaboratively across teams Strong organizational, problem solving, and presentation skills Demonstrated ability building and managing a team of high performing AccountExecutives Ability to measure and analyze key performance indicators  We welcome candidates from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply. We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users and the communities we serve.  Our Team  We are a small but powerful team, dedicated to achieving our mission to bring more community to the world through virtual events. Many of us have worked in community positions before and understand the struggles and peaks that come with the role. Our team communicates candidly, giving feedback early and often. We set ambitious goals, and do what it takes to achieve them, while making sure that we take care of our own personal health and mental wellbeing. We'll want you to be ready to take on a lot of responsibility with guidance and mentorship along the way. We work to create a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our team and a better product for our customers and the communities we serve.  Still Looking? Learn More About Our Other Departments Here

description: Zumper is on a mission to make renting an apartment as easy as booking a hotel. With 70 million users (1 in 3 US adults) and 150 million visits, we are empowering people to rent smarter. Our success has generated support from top-tier investors for a total of $140m in funding (Series D). We realize that changing the way the world rents requires passion, bold ideas, and bright minds. Join us and build the future of renting, Today.  About This Opportunity The Regional Sales Director will lead a team of Regional Account Executives to ensure that the assigned field/region consistently reaches revenue targets. This leader must inspire, coach, and challenge their sellers to up-level performance in a high-growth, dynamic sales environment.  What You Will Do Provide hands-on mentorship and guidance to each Regional Account Executive on effective sales methodologies from discovery, qualification of leads, assessment of buyer profiles, deal closure, and contract renewals Coach sellers to achieve assigned metrics of cold calls, sales presentations, pipeline creation, and quota attainment Recruit, hire, train, develop, and retain sellers by using creative incentives and a team-focused approach Roll up your sleeves and jump into the trenches as needed utilizing daily huddles, paired cold-calling and sales demonstrations, and attendance at industry conferences to bolster your team's performance Work with peers in sales management and departments like sales ops, sales enablement, or customer success to build best practices and process efficiencies Provide upward feedback to the Chief Sales Officer and VP of Regional Sales based on field takeaways  Who You Are A bachelor‚Äôs degree graduate with a proven track record leading a successful sales team for 4+ years Adept at hiring, managing, and developing sales professionals Strong in communication - written, verbal, and interpersonal Experienced in outside B2B sales; Multifamily industry sales is preferred Proficient in Salesforce and/or other CRM Able to work remotely and lead a remote team (especially during the pandemic)  What We Offer 401k plan + 3% company match Stock options Great Medical, dental, vision insurance options with 90-100% premium coverage FSA, HSA, Life insurance, and Long-term Disability insurance Up to 12-weeks of paid parental leave Flexible vacation policy - work hard and take time off when you need it Health & wellness credits and hosted meditation sessions Home office set-up and internet reimbursements Group training and individual professional development support Team activities, game nights, and happy hours Weekly insight into company metrics Employee Resource Groups (Black Lives Matter at Zumper, Out at Zumper, and zWomxn) that create safe spaces for candid conversations  Life at Zumper Zumper HQ is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, next door to the iconic Transamerica Building. With offices in Chicago, New York, Providence, and Scottsdale, we are lucky to have 200+ team members across the US.  We care deeply about diversity and inclusivity. We are fostering an environment that celebrates individuality and enables you to be your best self. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome all applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, or race. We are committed to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the hiring process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive equitable employee benefits. (Please contact us to request accommodations).  We are proud to have been awarded Inc. Magazine's 2019 Best Places to Work and SF Business Times' 2020 Best Places to Work and 2019 Bay Area Workplace Wellness and Builtin's 2021 SF Best Places to Work and 2021 SF Companies with the Best Benefits.  Please note Zumper does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing vendors, including recruitment agencies and/or search firms. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zumper employees, or any other company location. Any submittals without a prior signed agreement will become property of Zumper. #bi-remote

description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. description: Ascent Hospitality Management  Atlanta, GA  Please note that this position is based in Atlanta, GA. Candidates must be willing to relocate and relocation assistance will be provided.  Ascent Hospitality has an extensive portfolio of hotels and a strong pipeline of new properties and acquisitions, but we're not about numbers...we're about people and that remains our foundation. Our culture expresses a memorable experience for all of our Team Members and guests alike. So we're constantly looking for individuals who work well together for a unified purpose. For our leadership, we're looking for accomplished individuals with a passion to serve others, strong communicators who clearly understand the needs of others and trendsetters who excel at challenges and change. If this is what you're all about, consider joining our Team.  We are currently looking for an seasoned individual for the position of Regional Director of Sales out of our corporate office in Atlanta, GA or remote location in Alabama to oversee properties in Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi.  The Regional Director of Sales will provide strategic sales and revenue direction to their assigned portfolio of hotels for the purpose of driving TOP LINE REVENUE and GROWING MARKET SHARE for Ascent Hospitality. This individual will work with other corporate team members to maximize revenue and maintain strong interpersonal relationships. This position is for a ROAD WARRIOR!!!! Someone who is ready to travel and be hands on with their portfolio of Hotels. If you're looking for a new adventure with great rewards, this position is for you!  Regional Director Of Sales Responsibilities The Regional Director of Sales position will develop and Implement sales strategies designed to attack specific market segments, key accounts or identified need time periods to achieve Hotel Budget and RevPar Growth. Participate in weekly Revenue Management meetings with thorough understanding of Star Report, accurately forecast revenues and ability to make recommendations with changes in rates, mins/maxs and LOS restrictions Become a brand sales expert for the company portfolio, adhering to and being knowledgeable to brand programs, resources, tools and initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will establish sales performance goals for your hotel sales team members Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce group and transient business for your hotels. Travel to assigned properties in the region conducting property visits, sales calls, with written documentation of the visits with attention to follow up. Mentor, coach, and assist as necessary, assigned sales teams, to ensure their success. Supervise sales initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will represent Ascent Hospitality at Trade Shows and sales blitzes as necessary. Serve as first point of contact for above property sales support to hotels in the region. Act as interim Director of Sales for any hotel in the company as directed by the VP of Sales & Marketing. Provide training assistance to hotel sales leaders and GMs to develop, coach and provided continuous training. Produce sales department reports on a timely basis Regional Director Of Sales Qualifications Three or more years of above property, multi-property, sales management experience is preferred Regional Director of Sales candidates should have major brand experience with Marriott, Hilton, IHG, Starwood is an absolute requirement Working knowledge on CI/TY, OneSource, OnQ, R&I, Delphi Must be able to travel at least 90% of time. This position is only for the "Road Warrior Strong leadership skills resulting in mentorship and development of sales managers to reaching goals. Regional Director of Sales candidates should have strong oral and written communication skills combined with computer, presentation and negotiation skills. Excellent time-management skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. Strong decision-making capabilities and strategizing skills. Demonstrates creativity in finding solutions to problems. Finds the win-win when resolving conflicts. Remains calm and acts appropriately when faced with hectic or tense situations. Strong mathematical skills with the ability to accurately interpret data to create forecasts and budgets. Understanding of various market conditions and influencers. Education And/or Experience Bachelor's degree or a combination of advanced education and equivalent work experience. Minimum of 5 years overall hotel experience to include 3+ years as an Area or Market Sales Leader with Full Service, Limited Service or Extended Stay Hotels. Management or senior supervisory experience in hotels or experience in the industry with transferable skills. Proven ability to sell. Must be able to conduct and manage meetings, as well as speak to large groups as needed. Must have an outgoing, sales minded personality with the ability to close. *Candidates with Marriott or Hilton Brand Certification will have top consideration** We are seeking a "game-changer" and proven sales leader who can communicate a vision and collaborate with a sales team to generate extraordinary growth.  If we've caught your attention, we encourage you to apply today!
industries: Hospitality

description: Who We Are  Enel is a globally recognized leader in sustainable energy and is consistently named one of Fortune Magazine‚Äôs ‚ÄúCompanies that are Changing the World.‚Äù It is also one of the largest and most trusted energy companies in the world, serving around 70 million customers in more than 30 countries across 5 continents. The Enel Group vision is about Open Power. Open Power means opening energy access to more people; opening the world of energy to new technologies; opening new ways for people to manage energy; opening new uses of energy; and opening more partnerships. These are ambitious goals and we are pursuing them with the passion of more than 65,000 people whose brilliant work is based on our values of Responsibility, Innovation, Trust and Proactivity. At Enel North America, our businesses are leading the energy transition, creating the sustainable energy solutions of the future to help individuals, businesses and communities change energy into lasting value.  The Opportunity  The Head of Business to Business Sales will define go-to-market strategy and commercial plan, define sales targets, and monitor related performance. He/she will lead teams focused on acquiring and retaining customers and accomplishing the defined business strategy and revenue growth targets. The ideal candidate is an ambitious and driven sales leader who thrives in a high-energy environment and is excited by the opportunity to join a global leader enabling the transformation of energy.  What You'll Do At Enel  Executive Leadership Set and effectively evangelize the vision for department; lead and motivate a large and distributed team Communicate strategy and progress to executives and employees Actively influence the broader organization to align priorities, adopt best practices, and continually improve Collaborate with global colleagues on product line strategies, reporting, and shared resource allocations Manage, mentor, and develop leadership team. Motivate leadership team to continuously increase expertise in their field and become strong advocates for their employees and customers Promote a culture of high-quality customer engagement and continuous improvement Functional Leadership Lead world class sales team on the front lines of the energy transition Develop, build, and execute GTM strategy across full product suite leading sales, account management, sales ops and solutions engineering functions Manage pipelines, disciplined sales process to exceed aggressive targets across new sales and renewals Data driven decision making, draw insights from data to make recommendations and make decisions to improve customer experience, and commercial effectiveness and efficiency Lead, engage, and collaborate with Global, cross-region, and cross functional stakeholders and P&L leaders to support sales, customers, and GTM initiatives Hire, train and develop a world class sales team Build and define sales plans, incentives, and comp structures with appropriate stakeholders Implement tools and scalable processes to drive the commercial process, track, and report progress and KPIs, and accurately forecast sales results Who You Are Leader capable of influencing others to accept practices and approaches, and able to communicate and influence executive leadership Calm and effective in high stress situations Self-motivated and thrives in a fast paced, forward moving environment Positive, mission-driven, and results-oriented Willing to travel up to 50% with the possibility of up to 1-2 international trip a year. What You've Accomplished Bachelor‚Äôs degree; master‚Äôs degree preferred Proven success in leadership in similar fields (sales, GTM, energy, technology) 15+ years of experience in energy industry in an GTM role 10+ years of management experience Deep experience in utility energy efficiency programs, demand response, and distributed energy resources What Enel Offers You A rapidly growing yet well-established business, Ability to work with employees from many different cultures and backgrounds., Benefits and rewards that support the life and well-being of you and your family., One of the world‚Äôs most recognizable and respected brands in the energy industry that believes by working together we can create a new energy era in which the world can become more sustainable., Opportunity to grow and develop your career with the support and mentorship of senior leaders., Various forms of flexibility to help you integrate your life with your professional commitments. Notice to Recruiters & Staffing Agencies  Enel North America has an internal talent acquisition department and designated career site for individuals looking to join our team. Enel North America will not accept unsolicited resumes from any external recruiters, staffing firms, search agencies or any fee-based referrals. Any unsolicited resumes sent to directly to Enel North America, in any capacity will be considered property of Enel North America. This policy is applicable to all Enel North America locations and will be the responsibility of third parties and vendors to understand this policy. Enel North America will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.  EEO Statement  Enel North America is dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information. We will not discriminate, in any employment decision, against any individual or group on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, or veterans/national guard/military reserve status. This shall be done in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws in every location in which Enel North America has facilities. Accessibility ‚Äì If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact EnelApplication@enel.com.

description: Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.  Foursquare‚Äôs platform includes Attribution, Audience, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry‚Äôs first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions ‚Äî those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone‚Äôs-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.  About The Role  As a Sales Director you will be in a player-coach role responsible for both working directly with Agencies and Brands as well as managing a sales team. The position requires a strategic thinker and sales leader who will be deeply involved in creating location-based advertising solutions. You‚Äôll manage a dynamic sales team creating deep ongoing relationships and demand for Foursquare‚Äôs products and services for Marketers including market-leading Targeting and Attribution solutions.  Responsibilities Of The Role Manage day-to-day sellers across assigned territories and accounts in order to meet/exceed assigned regional revenue goal You will spend time meeting with agencies and brand direct clients, evangelizing Foursquare and location-powered advertising. You will be responsible for building positive relationships with client/agency counterparts, maintaining ongoing communications and ensuring that client needs are met. Along with the Business Development, Product, and Data teams you will craft custom opportunities to address marketer‚Äôs goals. You will take complex, and at times technical, sets of capabilities and translate that into a compelling story for the marketplace. Territory planning, goal setting, and identify and manage the team to focus on key growth areas Continue to build a team of highly motivated sales professionals to prospect and sell Foursquare‚Äôs suite of ad products to ad agencies and brands Lead your sales team as they develop sales strategies with top brand partners and agencies to drive large revenue programs and growth across top clients Assist your team as they create proactive proposals and respond to Requests for Proposals (RFP‚Äôs) Inspire team growth through individual development plans to promote an environment of accountability through performance management Build and maintain a solid revenue pipeline Meet quarterly revenue targets as set by sales management Qualifications 8+ years of experience with digital advertising across sales management, sales, account management, or at an agency An entrepreneurial approach to business Experience working closely with the major holding companies including IPG, Dentsu, and OMG Demonstrated success in a goal oriented, highly accountable sales environment. Strong work ethic with excellent organizational, project/time management, and analytical skills Experience structuring, negotiating and closing large partnership deals Excellent communication, presentation, prioritization, and organizational skills, and a strong commitment to detail BS/BA degree Perks And Benefits Learning and development programs from ICs to managers Individual, professional coaching for all full-time employees Flexible time off - rest and recharge when you need it! Comprehensive and competitive health, vision, dental, life insurance 401(k) with company match Home office setup: you get all necessary hardware and internet reimbursement Family planning programs via Carrot and Maven Employee Resource Groups to help you stay connected And much more! Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.  Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Territory Sales Director ‚Äì Pacific North West
description: Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in the wine country on California‚Äôs Central Coast. Now a regional craft brewery, our singular purpose remains ‚Äì to craft the world‚Äôs best beers. Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer‚Ä¶ and never satisfied.  Job Summary  As the PNW Sales Director, your role is ultimately charged with increasing the sales of the best tasting ales on the planet. You will be in charge of the PNW sales team with management, development and training. Top Management of all distributors in the PNW network and growth of FW brands within each wholesaler will be key to your success. This position also includes direct account responsibility for key on and off- premise accounts, securing new distribution in existing and new top accounts, and working closely with the distributor network in the assigned territory to maintain/develop all accounts.  Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities  Specifically, the responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following activities: Achieve Distributor Goals set forth in Distributor Sales plan each year Daily management of Territory Sales and Marketing Weekly work-withs in the market with Market Managers, distributor sales managers and account reps Overall Distributor Daily Management in territory Distributor programming Development of key accounts in collaboration with National Accounts team Manage chain execution with National Accounts Manager for Territory Key contact person representing FW to all distributor key personnel Training of distributor sales teams and any new FW salespeople for your market (if applicable) Trimester evaluation of each distributor in your territory (performed at trimester review) Management of all Territory Budgets and Spending in territory Develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with account staff and distributor sales personnel Travel to company sales meetings; participate in market focus days in other territories and work with other members of the FW team to execute/achieve the sales plan Maintain all sales goals and personal budgets outlined to you and your territory Achieve FW‚Äôs market plan and sales goals through distributor in given territories Follow and maintain yearly, quarterly, and monthly distribution and volume goals for distributor Achieve and/or maintain FW market and quality standards in all territories Develop key relationships with all key accounts by handling all reasonable brand support needs in account territories Conduct distributor sales meetings monthly with agenda Challenge the status quo with distributors and retailers Identify and prioritize opportunities for incremental volume at local and region level Other duties as assigned Required Qualifications Minimum bachelor‚Äôs college degree or equivalent experience 3 years of beverage/consumer goods selling experience (preferred) and prior management experience Must understand IRI, Nielsen, VIP and other data sources to evaluate business and make recommendations to retailers and distributors Strong oral communication skills: Ability to talk to others to convey information effectively; strong written communication skills Strong persuasion skills: Ability to influence others decision making or persuading others to change their minds or behavior through superior skill and knowledge of all our beers and the craft beer community Active listening - This is the key to all sales presentation, understanding your retailer can only be achieved by listening to their needs and filling those needs Excellent time management skills; ability to be proactive and take initiative Excellent organization and coordination skills - detail oriented & able to manage priorities and routine functions effectively and efficiently Social Perceptiveness - Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do Negotiation - Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences Proficiency with personal computers / laptops and associated programs (Windows, Microsoft office suite of programs) Decision making skills - Collect, assess and interpret relevant information and make sound judgment Valid Driver License with a good driving record, a reliable, registered and insured vehicle, and ability to drive to and from accounts continuously Cicerone, or other Beer certification strongly preferred Must be available to work nights and weekends and work more than 40 hours per week; and lift and or move up to 50 pounds MUST CURRENTLY RESIDE IN THE DESIGNATED TERRITORY (OREGON OR WASHINGTON) MUST HAVE RELEVANT BEER/WINE/SPIRITS EXPERIENCE PREFERABLY IN THE BEER DISTRIBUTOR NETWORK What Firestone Walker Offers Competitive compensation package for an experienced individual with the right skills. An excellent benefits package including: 100% paid premiums for employee including medical, dental, vision, & life insurance Accrued PTO (rate of 13 days per year) Accrued Sick Leave (1 hour for every 30 hours worked) 24 hours max usage per year 401(k) retirement plan including company paid profit sharing & matching 8 paid holidays per year Please submit your cover letter and resume with your work experience when applying.  Firestone Walker is an Equal Opportunity Employer

description: Our client, publicly traded Global IT Services Company is seeking a seasoned sales professional. They are looking for sales professional with extensive expertise in engaging clients across the US market. Looking for someone with expertise in New Business Development (Hunting) across any industry, expertise in selling IT services is required. Would you be interested in learning more about the job and the organization? If yes, please revert with your copy of updated resume and availability for a quick call. I am available between 9am EST ‚Äì 7pm EST at (908) 628 4180 or Shivamg@vantedgesearch.com for a detailed discussion. Looking forward to hearing from you!

SALES DIRECTOR -   Digital Media, Advertising Sales  Location: Remote U.S.  WHO ARE WE Wild Sky Media is building the next generation of Parenting brands for the most diverse, digitally native group of women ever to become mothers in the US.   WHO ARE YOU You are a rising digital sales executive, with a record of supporting $3M+ in revenue goals via display media, branded content, video, and programmatic offerings. You have a great network of agencies and brands who know you and trust your partnership. You have a passion for digital media and a desire to help us build relationships between this new generation of parents and the brands that they trust.  THE POSITION We‚Äôre seeking a highly motivated, experienced Associate Sales Director responsible for generating new business through the sale of display media, branded content, video and programmatic opportunities to agencies and brands. This individual will have previous sales experience in digital media, possess persuasive talent, be relationship-oriented, aggressive in exceeding sales goals, have a competitive streak and desire to win. The position will work remotely and (eventually) will involve travel to client locations and occasional trade shows or events. You will be supported by a smart and collaborative team all over the country who specializes in sales marketing and account management and are motivated to help you succeed.  ESSENTIALS ‚Ä¢ Prospect, Hunt, Sell -- Drive new business through prospecting, relationship building, and partnering our digital media products and solutions with clients and their agencies ‚Ä¢ Develop comprehensive knowledge of all products, pricing, RFP process, sales marketing tools ‚Ä¢ Execute sales tactics from prospects to pipeline to close: through entire sales cycle including follow-up for incremental revenue and repeat, recurring business ‚Ä¢ Support outreach and marketing efforts of senior sales directors ‚Ä¢ Track client and prospect activity and revenue projections and forecasts ‚Ä¢ Consistently meet or exceed all activity and revenue goals  SKILLS/EXPERIENCE ‚Ä¢ A proven track record as a competitive hunter and closer ‚Ä¢ Expertise in building relationships and are well respected in the industry ‚Ä¢ A minimum of 3+ years of demonstrated success with sales goal/quota-carrying capacity in digital media ‚Ä¢ An orientation toward forming team unity, possess high energy, and are building a career with passion and heart ‚Ä¢ Superior persuasion skills and the ability to handle objections skillfully ‚Ä¢ Excellent perception & problem-solving skills and an ability to quickly recognize opportunities ‚Ä¢ A strong motivation to make money ‚Ä¢ A desire to provide feedback on new product ideas and enhancements BENEFITS Medical Dental Vision Life, Disability 401(k) Flexible PTO Remote Work  MORE ABOUT US Wild Sky Media is the largest portfolio of owned and operated Parenting and Family sites in the US. We publish premier websites such as Mom.com, Cafemom, LittleThings, MamasLatinas, and Revelist, reaching over 34M monthly uniques with over 70M social followers. We are headquartered in NYC with team members all over the United States and have a robust creative services team in Bangkok   Wild Sky Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will be considered without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran status or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision.

About Lefty Lefty is a fast-growing software company on a path to revolutionize the $15 billion influencer market. We are a leading analytics SaaS platform that helps brands measure the impact of their influencer marketing program and optimize their talent management workflow. Lefty delivers results for the world‚Äôs biggest lifestyle brands, including Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Swatch, Adidas, Clarins, Tommy Hilfiger, or Asos. In April 2021, Lefty joined The Independents, the largest global marketing and communications group for luxury brands, with the ambition to expand our geographical foothold from our Paris base, starting with the USA, the world's largest market. We are currently looking for fast, growth-minded individuals who want to help revolutionize the logistics industry and play an integral role in a thriving startup environment. We are on the hunt for a Sales Executive to be based in our newly established New York office. The Sales Executive is responsible for building customer relationships to identify, develop and close recurrent revenue deals. They will be working closely with the Product and Executive Team and the USA VP of Sales and execute plans for the development of new business opportunities.  You: 8+ years of enterprise SaaS solutions sales or business development experience and a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales target Experience selling digital technology and service solutions (bonus points for Influencer Marketing, MarTech, or AdTech SaaS vendors!) Strong executive presence - very comfortable with C-level, especially CTOs, CDOs, CIOs, etc. Ability to negotiate and close multi-stakeholder SaaS deals for large and complex organizations Possess a strong analytical mindset and can speak to some technical jargon (API, SaaS, KPIs, etc.) Bachelor's degree is preferred Ability to thrive and learn at a startup; self-motivated Data-driven and organized You gotta love closing!   What you will do: Responsible for hunting and closing enterprise SaaS opportunities to exceed revenue targets for SaaS offerings Understand the influencer marketing space and develop expert-level knowledge of our SaaS offerings Analyze customers' needs and use consultative selling skills to solve complex business problems while driving the adoption of software solutions Grow revenue using a value-selling methodology which focuses on speaking with the right people at the right companies Meet Quarterly & Annual Revenue Targets Engage new sales opportunities through existing leads database, inbound lead follow-up & outbound communication, and prospecting activities Conduct one-on-one and group sales presentations with strong ability to close over the phone Learn & articulate our value propositions to the target markets Actively score every prospect in the software platform, oversee and actively participate in the creation of a business case for every opportunity and manage your sales pipeline by devoting energy to each stage of the selling cycle Maintain all sales activities & communication in a CRM system Understand commercial roofing contractor's needs and pain points  Gain an expert knowledge of our SaaS product set Work closely with our customer success team to ensure clients achieve the business case

jobTitle: Director of Sales and New Business Development
description: Director of Sales and New Business Development  Come join our Celeb Luxury team.   Celeb Luxury is one of the fastest growing luxury professional hair color care product company globally with unique brands that are first to market and category leaders.  Our culture is everything to us and we are looking for an incredibly talented, detail oriented, self-motivated, edgy, up-and-coming Director of Sales and New Business Development that has a background in Beauty/Fashion brands and experience with web design, videos, marketing, print and digital media.    As part of a growing team, we are looking for a highly organized, self- starter and business-minded individuals with a passionate and collaborative spirit.  The Director of Sales & New Business Development is responsible for achieving sales targets and agreed profitability in all existing accounts as well as all new sales doors. We have aggressive sales growth targets and are looking for someone to help us achieve our sales objectives and goals.   The ideal candidate is a true collaborator at heart and has a real love and appreciation for haircare, clean beauty, and is passionate about sales and customer service.  Responsibilities Sales and New Business Development Identify new markets and new opportunities online and offline. This includes traditional retail, lifestyle stores, fashion retail, amenities, and hospitality opportunities. Drive sales for the region and guarantee on-brand execution at all times, across select doors and channels. Establish sales objectives by forecasting annual sales goals for regions (for new and existing doors), monitor monthly achievements, identifies risk and opportunities to deliver latest estimates. Communicate day to day business needs with select retailers. Develop profitable sales plans and increase market share by achieving sales objectives and implementing education and marketing strategies. Strategically partner with leadership teams of key retailers to drive business and maximize market share. Work closely with the VP of Marketing to create tailored and compelling partnership presentations for potential new retail partners. Develop brand sales and marketing presentations for seasonal launches and new business pitches. Works closely with Marketing, Creative, Planning, Logistics, Ops, Sales, Regulatory, Product Development, Purchasing and Legal Teams to ensure day to day business needs are met. Manages execution of sampling and marketing initiatives with internal and external team partners. Manages product tasks that support vendor inventory management, vendor set up, brand partnerships, and marketing initiatives. Maintains and manages master calendars for product launches, marketing initiatives and sales events. Works closely with operational teams to ensure shipments are delivered on time. Manage the set up new store locations including international accounts and effectively onboard new retailers. Make recommendations for point of sale marketing to support each customer. Manage day-to-day detailed progress of retail marketing programs. Monitor and track planning and execution of marketing strategy through the Celeb Luxury/No Fade Fresh Marketing Calendar and each individual retailer‚Äôs marketing calendars. Ensure that POs are placed against planned activities. Create a strategic plan for new door openings: assortment, hiring, and education. Lead the implementation of the brand‚Äôs opening strategy plan in all new doors (training, in-store partnership, sampling), oversees execution, monitor performances of opening strategy and lead team to redirect efforts as needed Propose product promotional ideas to VP of Marketing by conducting market analyses, identifying strength and weaknesses in branding and using creative and analytical thinking. Partner closely with operational planner on new launches forecast. Analyze sales weekly, monthly, Monitor and understand KPI, coach ambassadors on redirecting efforts to achieve monthly targets. Create and communicate monthly and bi-monthly business updates to HQ. Work to constantly update and perfect selling tools, including but not limited to Brand Book, Wholesale Order Sheets, Training Sheets, Brochures, Trend Profile. Manage 3rd party representatives/partners. Responsible for the voice of the brand and cultivating relationships at all levels: Buyers, Sales Associates, Influencers and Consumers. Develop and write training materials & presentations with the help of creative marketing team. Along with 3rd party representatives visit store locations to ensure stores are properly educated and the brand is in the best possible space and location and represented to our visual standards. Serve as key partner in education to train and coach in-store staff teams in all retailer locations. Develop compelling events and in store experiences by location, ensure all details are set up and be the liaison between the retail team and Celeb Luxury/No Fade Fresh. Maintain ongoing coaching, training, and motivation of retailer personnel. Oversees recruitment and onboarding of Celeb Luxury brand ambassadors in key markets and for specific retail accounts. Qualifications Minimum 8-10 years of relevant sales & education experience. Action oriented, out of the box, forward thinker with an entrepreneurial spirit. Highly motivated with the ability to thrive and multi-task in a fast-paced and demanding environment. Ability to travel. Loves to be in store and executing events. Have a customer service mindset. Excellent public speaking and presentation skills. In-depth knowledge of beauty industry. Willingness to travel. Must be a strong collaborator who can work effectively with key internal and external partners. Great analytical and communication skills. Strong computer skills ‚Äì Excel, Word, Powerpoint.

jobTitle: Director Of Sales And Business Development, West Coast
description: Director of Sales, West Coast RESTORE-Skills is a fast-growing technology company, changing the way therapy and skill-building are delivered today. We gamify therapy and skill-building to empower therapy teams and motivate patients to play more, achieve more, and reach for more. Joining our growing team of mission-driven professionals is an amazing opportunity to work with the leadership team to drive growth in the West Coast Nursing Homes market. We are looking for a result-oriented team player to maximize our sales potential within the Midwest area by cultivating strong relationships with existing customers, and leading the relationship across the sales funnel, from identifying to closing the deal. Responsibilities: Secure new business to meet company growth objectives Grow and maximize regional revenue Maintain and grow channels and routes to market Develop and implement sales strategies Experience: 2+ years of sales or customer service experience in the Skilled Nursing market is required. Please do not apply if you do not have the relevant experience.  The Basics: College Degree or job experience equivalent required. Excellent sales skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills, including skills to develop and deliver presentations and create, compose, and edit written materials. Ideally, you are based in the Midwest - the location is flexible as we support remote working practices. Job Type: Full-time position. Work Location: This position is remote from your West Coast location.

description: Are you a hunter, a go-getter? Do you love the chase? BRAINBOX Immersive Marketing (BBIM) is seeking a highly motivated individual with a passion for sales and business development in a dynamic company that is on the move. If you are that person and you have that desire, we have the opportunity for your success. This position will be responsible for implementing sales strategies to acquire new corporate clients and expand existing relationships for BBIM. description: Interested candidates should email a resume (PDF) and a short cover letter as to why you are qualified for this position to careers @ sageadvisory.com  Reports to: Principal, National Sales Director  Firm Overview: Sage is a well-established asset management firm that offers fixed income, asset/liability management, and tactical asset allocation strategies for institutions and private clients. The firm is employee owned with a significant capacity for growth that attracts independent, creative thinkers who desire success through a collaborative process that best serves the client. Job purpose: The focus of this role is to proactively represent the Sage investment solutions to financial advisors in the Southeast region. This will involve the day-to-day management of the defined territory while actively working with financial advisors across the wire house, regional, and independent broker dealer channels. Regional Director will live in the territory and be expected to meet travel and activity expectations. The territory consists of : FL, GA, SC and NC. This independent, results-oriented individual must demonstrate strong presentation skills, a sound working knowledge of financial products, and effective territory management.  Position Requirements: ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of outside sales experience with an investment management firm in the Southeast Region. ‚Ä¢ Develop and manage business relationships with financial advisors and centers of influence across all business channels ‚Ä¢ Apply a consultative sales approach across multiple financial advisory channels, using knowledge of the firm‚Äôs investment disciplines and process to develop and maximize advisor relationships ‚Ä¢ Must have strong group presentation skills and the ability to communicate effectively, in verbal and written form, the firm's value proposition, professional capabilities, and product/service strengths ‚Ä¢ Exhibit excellent time management skills to identify prospective clients, prepare presentations, and follow up on territory activity ‚Ä¢ Show a demonstrated knowledge of the capital markets and investment strategies, particularly in regard to fixed income, asset/liability management, and tactical asset allocation applications ‚Ä¢ Must be a self-starter and have the ability to prioritize and manage regional business development opportunities within the territory  Preferred Education and Experience: ‚Ä¢ Bachelors Degree in marketing, economics or finance. ‚Ä¢ Series 65/66 ‚Ä¢ Minimum of 5 years of outside sales experience within the territory ‚Ä¢ Advanced understanding of fixed income and ETF asset management ‚Ä¢ Proficiency with CRM and related territory management tools  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required.  Interested candidates should email a resume (PDF) and a short cover letter as to why you are qualified for this position to careers@sageadvisory.com

description: COMPANY PROFILE  Founded in 2000 and headquartered in Irvine, California, Netlist is a leading provider of high-performance modular memory subsystems to the world‚Äôs premier OEMs. Netlist specializes in hybrid memory ‚Äì the merging of DRAM and NAND flash raw materials to create memory solutions. The Company‚Äôs patented memory technologies provide superior performance, and high density in a cost-efficient solution. From database to enterprise applications, Netlist serves diverse industries that require superior memory performance to empower critical business decisions in today‚Äôs data-driven environment.   At Netlist, we cultivate a motivating environment where semiconductor and modular design professionals can advance their careers and build industry-leading skills and expertise. Our employees are committed to quality and integrity, and we form long-term partnerships with our clients.   POSITION DESCRIPTION SUMMARY  The Regional Sales Manager/Director of Sales will have the overall responsibility to establish and develop enduring partnerships with leaders and decision makers at key customers. The goal is to increase our partnership, value proposition, product qualification opportunities, design wins, and product revenue. These efforts are intended to drive Netlist memory product volumes and have a significant impact on business growth and overall sales and product margin. In addition to developing and maintaining this business partnership, the Regional Sales Manager/Director of Sales will conduct business reviews and make recommendations to Netlist management to ensure product positioning and customer engagements are aligned with corporate goals.  This person will report to the Vice President of Sales and will work at all levels of the company beginning at the earliest stages of design where working relationships will be formed with both engineering, marketing and operation to close design wins at key customers. Having existing senior customer relationships and being able to navigate the entire partnership process through all phases of design, delivery and beyond are critical attributes for this role. The Regional Sales Manager/Director of Sales will be responsible for ensuring the customer‚Äôs current and future needs are met and for growing, sustaining and renewing client contracts. This person will act in a critical role as the ‚Äúvoice of the customer‚Äù to Netlist management.  The Regional Sales Manager/Director of Sales must possess the ability to work independently to achieve goals and be experienced in reporting to and working with senior management. Relevant and current relationships in the territory are mandatory as well as significant experience with OEM customers. Proven success and knowledge in working with and managing a Manufacturer‚Äôs Rep network is also a critical aspect to this role. Strong capability in managing component or subsystems products through the design, qualification and sales process. Also, the Regional Sales Manager/Director of Sales will take ownership of problems and lead resolution to the challenges of the customer. In addition, it is essential in this position to bring a strategic and consultative approach in understanding the customer‚Äôs business needs, issues and priorities to deliver a value-add business solution.   QUALIFICATIONS AND ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:  ¬∑       Prepare a sales/business plan to expand market share in existing and new markets for achieving sales objectives on a Regional level ¬∑       Develop and execute strategies for coverage of key accounts ¬∑       Deliver strategy and programs for new customer initiatives ¬∑       Ability to self-generate leads and cultivate strategic customer relationships ¬∑       Provide direction to sales/marketing/engineering in attaining revenue and profit goals ¬∑       Provide direction to and manage Manufacturers‚Äô Sales Reps ¬∑       Create and maintain new business opportunities with key customers ¬∑       Manage the flow of information and communication between Netlist and customers with the objective of maintaining strong customer relations ¬∑       Possess decision making skills driven by ‚Äúwhat is the right thing to do?‚Äù ¬∑       A strong work ethic centered on a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù and ‚Äúwill to win‚Äù attitude ¬∑       A sense of urgency, self-motivation and commitment to do what it takes to get the job done ¬∑       Ability to demonstrate good judgment and original thinking in order to address the demands of the business ¬∑       Able to clearly establish expectations and manage progress effectively ¬∑       Good organization skills and ability to multi-task, establish timelines and manage priorities ¬∑       An outstanding ability to overcome obstacles to solve problems   EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION  ¬∑       BSEE degree or related field and/or equivalent experience ¬∑       Minimum of seven (7) years of sales experience required in the computer hardware OEMs, storage or memory technology field. ¬∑       Proven track record of success in opening and systematically penetrating new accounts ¬∑       Knowledge of customer service, sales principles and concepts along with key-account sales methods and practices ¬∑       Track record of personal involvement in understanding customer needs and utilizing resources to meet and/or exceed these customer needs ¬∑       A proven ability to recognize opportunities for business expansion within key-accounts and the ability to sell the opportunity throughout the key account organization and within your company ¬∑       A sales leader with strong tactical and analytical abilities ¬∑       Proven self-starter with the ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment ¬∑       Proven ability to be a team player as well as an individual contributor driving tangible results while maintaining a vision for growth ¬∑       Must have excellent Who we are: ChartHop delivers a fresh take on People Analytics, bringing disparate sources of people data together in a dynamic platform that‚Äôs visual and actionable. Unlike legacy People Analytics solutions, ChartHop is designed to be used by the whole organization. This helps companies improve organizational health, drive alignment and accountability, and save time and money.  ChartHop plays well with dozens of platforms through robust integrations across the HR tech stack, and serves companies like BetterCloud, Lightspeed, Starburst and InVision. ChartHop was founded in 2019 by Ian White and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz.  We‚Äôre looking for skilled and motivated people to join our team! Do you want to help companies unleash the power of their people data to plan effectively and with intention? Do you have what it takes to envision the future of work, and then to take us there? Join us!  Director of Sales Develop, manage, and grow a team of star Account Executives We‚Äôre looking for our first Director of Sales to manage a rapidly growing team of Account Executives to sell our ChartHop platform to People/HR leaders. You‚Äôll be instrumental in setting strategy, coaching reps, and co-selling deals as ChartHop continues to deliver it‚Äôs best in class people analytics solution to a broader audience!  We will measure your success through Pipeline growth and bookings.  As a Director of Sales you will: Provide support and guidance to AEs at all points of the sales cycles Join reps during meetings to drive bookings Recruit, interview, train and hire a world class team Coach and develop reps with varying levels of experience Deliver accurate forecasts based on pipeline and rep activity Design, implement, and iterate on various sales strategies Ensure activity is appropriately logged and tracked in Salesforce Engage and build relationships with People/HR executives Bring on the ground feedback to the product team to influence the product roadmap  Requirements: 5+ years of sales management experience 3+ years of SaaS sales management experience Proven track record of building teams that meet and exceed quota A strong desire to sell Comfort in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment Familiarity with Salesforce  Unsure if you meet the qualifications? We encourage SaaS sales professionals who are passionate about this work to apply!  Our Core Values: We're building ChartHop to be the best People Software on the planet and that starts with hiring the best people globally. We‚Äôre building an inclusive culture we‚Äôre looking for people who embrace our core values:  Fast: Move with intentional speed. Inclusive: Welcome our differences. Transparent: Trust, collaborate, share. Optimistic: Dream big, think practically.  Perks and Benefits: Health/benefits coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life insurance, Long term and Short term disability, many more)  MacBook Pro Work from home supplies stipend Professional development stipend Vacation days  401K Parental leave Pet insurance Mental Health benefits  Many more   Salary range - $250K- $300K OTE uncapped plus equity  ChartHop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

About Consensys  ConsenSys is the leading Ethereum software company. We enable developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web.  Our product suite, composed of Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, Truffle and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets.  Ethereum is the largest programmable blockchain in the world, leading in business adoption, developer community, and DeFi activity. On this trusted, open source foundation, we are building the digital economy of tomorrow. To explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.  About The Role  As Head of Strategic Sales, Americas, you lead the team of Sales Managers in the Americas and you establish and grow the Key Accounts driving a large part of revenue growth at ConsenSys.  The role is uniquely exciting and impactful in the tech industry because the Americas Key Accounts list includes both Fortune 500 companies (many of which in the financial services sector) and crypto-native companies (DeFi, NFT, fintech, funds) who are pushing the boundaries of blockchain-enabled business models.  As Head of Strategic Sales, Americas, you define the Key Account sales strategy and plan and you identify and direct the resources needed to ensure that ConsenSys products and services are enabling future winners of the blockchain ecosystem. You creatively leverage ConsenSys' extensive network of shareholders, strategic partners, and ecosystem relationships in order to identify win-win opportunities for value creation.  You build and grow a team that will reach up to 10 Sales Managers, each with a $2M annual quota on average, working together with dozens of Product and Professional Services team members who participate in the opportunity teams that you oversee.  On a daily basis, you support and coach the Sales Managers, prioritize the opportunities that are likely to make a difference in our revenue trajectory, and work closely with Marketing, Products, Professional Services and Customer Success in order to refine go-to-market tactics and operate feedback loops between customers and offerings.  Job Requirements  You have 10+ years of experience in sales roles including a successful experience at a software company, with an impeccable track record of delivering your sales quotas of $10M+ in challenging and often ambiguous environments.  You are a proven leader, able to identify win-win arrangements with many stakeholders internally and externally and rally them to your worldview. You have proven that you can be deeply committed to your team, setting clear expectations, leading by example, and mentoring your direct reports in order to raise the bar.  You understand blockchain technology and DeFi (decentralized finance), and ideally have an existing personal network in both traditional financial services and blockchain / crypto-native ecosystem. You have sold emerging technologies before, and have demonstrated that you can come up with inspiring views with respect to how to get them to market.  Your colleagues see you as a deal maker, someone who is able to communicate clearly and concisely about deal expectations and has the quantitative skills and attention to detail required in order to negotiate complex deals over many years.  WHY JOIN CONSENSYS?  Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys One of the most recognized tech companies in the blockchain ecosystem globally. A work experience at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your future career. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies. The forefront of a revolution. We fundamentally believe blockchain is a next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. You can be a part of building the digital economy of tomorrow and radically transforming our society for the better. A dynamic startup environment with deep roots. We are one of the earliest blockchain companies and a leader in the space. You‚Äôll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. Deep technical challenges. Blockchain technology is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. We are building the tools, infrastructure and applications l that are pushing the technology forward. Continuous learning and improvements. You‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas and frameworks from your peers and as you work on different projects ‚Äî challenging you to stay at the top of your game.  ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect themselves which can be found here.

description: Verily, an Alphabet company, lives at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world‚Äôs health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives.  Our team combines expertise in healthcare, data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solutions span three primary areas: research, care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes connected tools, lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. We‚Äôre also actively working to combat the spread of COVID-19 through new programs like Healthy at Work.  Description  As the Business Development Manager for the Behavioral Team, you will launch OneFifteen and Behavioral Health solutions to the market and develop business strategies, commercial relationships, manage external meetings, and work cross functionally within Verily. You will be responsible for developing the business model and go-to-market strategies, creating compelling content and messaging, standing up support services to enable customer-facing teams, and working directly with customers to drive revenue. In addition to driving near-term commercial objectives, you will provide commercial input to the product team on new product offerings to ensure scalable, profitable, and competitively differentiated solutions.  Responsibilities Drive cross-functional strategy and execution of the commercial strategy, including delivering tools and materials to drive commercial activities with new and existing partners. Partner with the Commercial Finance team to define strategic business models. Partner closely with Marketing to develop and execute effective campaigns to drive awareness and differentiation of our products. Work closely with Product Managers to ensure that commercial requirements are incorporated into the product roadmap. Serve as the external product expert for presenting to partners to drive sales growth. Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs degree required preferably in engineering or science. 5+ years of experience in product marketing, business development, strategic partnerships, or sales. 5+ years of experience working in healthcare preferably in digital health and/or behavioral health. Demonstrated modeling, communication, and presentation skills. Willingness to travel. Preferred Qualifications MBA preferred. Proven ability to work with complex, technical product offerings and processes involving multiple stakeholders. Proven problem-solving and analytical skills, ability to handle ambiguity, and good business judgment. Proven ability to establish solid relationships with customers. Strong interpersonal skills with sensitivities to changing personalities and priorities. Ability to improvise, work efficiently and respond quickly to changes and a dynamic work-flow. A positive attitude, open mind, and a desire to collaborate and learn.

description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  Our Neuromodulation business is an area of expertise for Abbott. This business includes implantable devices compatible with mobile technology to help people who suffer from chronic pain and movement disorders. Our Solutions include Proclaim (TM) XR SCS System, the #1 Spinal cord stimulator on the market, Proclaim (TM) DRG Neurostimulator, the only FDA approved DRG therapy and a market leader in radiofrequency ablation therapy, Abbott RFA. These non-opioid therapies allow us to provide interventional pain therapy to patients throughout the pain continuum. Our deep brain stimulation technology for progressive diseases help people manage their Parkinson‚Äôs disease and essential tremor symptoms, steering away from side effects.  Our location in Austin, TX currently has an opportunity for a Director of Sales Operations. The Director of Sales Operations will be responsible for leading a cross functional team supporting Pricing & Contracting, Patient Therapy Access, and Sales Operations. Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, this role will drive a vision of Operational Excellence in the US CPT and DBS businesses through 1) leading the analysis and insights to support the sales & marketing organization, 2) Pricing & Contracting Analytics to ensure value added decisions are made along with the proper controls and price floors, 3) working in conjunction with the marketing team and Sales AVP‚Äôs on development of field sales product launches and tactical plans to leverage insights and best practices from the field, 4) leading the Patient Therapy Access team along with the implementation of SFE.com for additional data and analytical insights, and 5) lead the sales support functions ensuring alignment with the US Commercial organization and that all process and controls are in place.  What You‚Äôll Do Lead and develop pricing & contracting analyses that support >$850MM business by leveraging insights to develop strategy and field execution plans for >600 person sales organization. Develop and lead pricing and contracting team to complete complex analyses on the following: Problem formulation Design of experiment / measurement plan Collect, query, integrate, and transform data Synthesize findings, craft deliverable documentation Archive knowledge and build plan for next steps Present recommendations to senior leaders Lead Pricing and Contracting and Patient Therapy Access teams (~65+ employees) to support across two sales organizations (US CPT and DBS along with worldwide pricing governance) Development and execution of PTA process improvements Monthly Pricing analysis and reporting and organization-wide communication of results Identification, integration and dissemination of best practices into marketing strategy and field implementation Lead development of salesforce.com to enable analytical rigor and flawless execution Education And Experience You‚Äôll Bring BS or BA degree, MS/MBA is preferred. More than 10 years‚Äô experience and 3-5 years of director level or equivalent experience in leading cross functional teams Strong ability to work with cross functional partners to drive engagement and achieve results Proven success at leading team to deliver insight. Must have demonstrated ability to lead analyses to completion and present and communicate complex data in non-technical way to guide organizational thinking, strategy development and execution. Demonstrated strong presentation and communication skills. Proven success in presenting complex data to executive senior leaders in an organization and interacting and conducting strategic discussions with multi-divisional leaders. Strong work ethic, passion for the business and driving results. Proven success in ability to recruit, coach and develop organizational talent. What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  As a Strategic Partnership, Regional Director, you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you!  What You'll Do Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of named accounts by cold-calling and professional networking Build productive long lasting relationships that continue to pay dividends through trusted references in your market Be relentless about meeting personal and team sales targets Research accounts and follow through on sales leads while developing a strategic territory business plan Working with Side leadership to sell at the most strategic level and implementing a definitive strategy to showcase our value proposition to independent brokerages, large teams and unique real estate business models Keep an up-to-date understanding of a dynamic real estate industry and local market WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE? 8-10+ years of full-cycle sales experience (commercial or enterprise) Real estate industry knowledge and domain expertise is a plus A proven hunter and closer Strong top of the funnel engagement skills Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Creative sale techniques and pipeline management A passionate influential sales style Success positioning and selling on benefits instead of feature/function Strong communication, collaboration, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, highly confident, and driven Compensation/Perks Competitive salary plus bonus opportunity Equity options Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental) Flexible PTO $1,000/year for learning and development Pet friendly environment Side is dedicated to working with the highest skilled people from the most inclusive talent pool feasible. We maintain that diversity in all aspects leads to positive change, solutions and innovation for our customers and career fulfillment for our employees. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
