jobTitle: Global Sales Planning and Process Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving complex problems with limited resources. We are looking for someone to enable the Revenue organization to grow and operate more effectively through planning and globally consistent standards and processes. You will manage resource allocation and project investment to optimize ROI and partner cross-functionally to identify the needs to support, scale, and measure our business.  You Will Lead the quarterly target setting and annual planning process across Rev Ops, Marketing, and Sales and recommend and guide where we invest in resources and projects to enable growth and productivity Align Global GTM team priorities Design and refresh processes to enable scale; work ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù with other central operations partners on standard processes to support delivery of targets, segmentation, territory management, reporting, etc. Interlock and streamline Rev Ops/GTM initiatives and operating structures, driving synergy Proactively review and identify opportunities for how we can grow our business or operate more efficiently through innovation and automation Develop strong working relationships with Stripes across levels and functions Leverage internal and external insights to make data-driven recommendations We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of experience in planning, strategy, business operations, management consulting, investment banking, or a related discipline A strong track record of delivering major, complex projects in ambiguous environments An ability to simplify, structure, and diagnose problems Experience implementing solutions, not just setting strategy A high degree of comfort working quickly in a high growth, fast-paced environment An ability to seamlessly transition from the high level to very detailed, and willingness to ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù Experience working in a sales and marketing organization Prior experience with payments You Should Include These In Your Application LinkedIn profile and resume
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

description: Flipboard is a content discovery platform designed to inform and inspire the world. Available on web, iOS, and Android, Flipboard offers the world important and influential articles, videos, podcasts and products shared by the greatest publishers and our vibrant Flipboard community to advance conversation, keep people informed, and inspire them to engage, learn, and lead.  Flipboard is seeking an experienced, strategic, and innovative Head of Sales & Revenue Strategy to lead our business with advertisers and their agencies, via a full-time position based in the New York region. You will lead a team that works with the world's top advertisers to develop strategic and creative marketing solutions that help connect these brands to their most valued audiences on the platform. Managing a team of sellers across both direct and programmatic, this role is relied on to drive the business to meet the objectives of marketers, helping them innovate in new and exciting ways.  Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the company is working 100% remotely. We are open to the Head of Sales position being 100% remote during and post-pandemic with a preference for New York City when we return to offices.  Primary Responsibilities: Grow advertising revenue for Flipboard through leadership of a team of 5-10 direct sellers across the U.S. Highly collaborative role, partnering closely with Head of Revenue Operations (whose teams include Sales Planning, Account Management, Ad Ops, P&Y) and Head of Programmatic Develop and execute Sales strategy across the team Drive Global/International opportunity for key accounts Educate clients and their agencies on the mobile consumer experience and advertising/marketing opportunities that Flipboard offers Penetrate, influence, and persuade key account decision makers across client and agency organizations in a variety of roles, including digital media, strategy, mobile, social and content marketing Oversee Programmatic "subject matter expert" group, and drive its partnership with Sales Manage pipeline, revenue forecasts, sales activity via Boostr Establish a visible and influential presence in the media and advertising communities Maintain high levels of communication and transparency with management, other functional teams, and business partners This is a leadership role in the organization, ideally working in New York City (some regional flexibility, given the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic)  Skills & Experience: 10+ years experience in digital media sales management roles, working directly with Fortune 500 companies, advertising agencies, and DTC brands Strategic leader, with a track record of penetrating markets and driving new business Established relationships with senior marketing and media leadership at companies and agencies A deep understanding of the platform media landscape, and associated opportunity for marketers Outstanding leadership skills, with the ability to initiate change and motivate a team to produce innovative and creative results Ability to perform at a high level when faced with unexpected change; creative problem solver in dealing with difficult or unexpected challenges Deep understanding of Programmatic sales Previous experience with mobile applications and mobile advertising Experience working with the Financial Services, Tech/Telecom, Travel, and Auto industries a plus Understanding of email monetization also a value add Excellent communication and presentation skills Outstanding organizational and multitasking abilities Ability to thrive in fast-paced, start-up environment A passion for Flipboard and our mission Strong attention to detail, with proficiencies in GSuite, Keynote, Microsoft Office and CRM tools BA/BS degree  Benefits & Perks Our benefits include vision, dental, life, and health insurance, plus 401K with a company match Flexible hours and generous 'out of office time' for holidays, vacations, sick leave, relaxation & wellness, personal and family needs Subsidized commuter programs (post-pandemic) Team celebrations: company anniversaries, birthdays, Thanksgiving, weddings/babies ‚Äì‚Äì you name it, we celebrate it!  Why Join Flipboard? Our vision: At a time when society could really benefit from being more informed and inspired, we are enabling great stories to reach the right communities around the world. Our team: Led by experienced CEO, Mike McCue, the Flipboard team is a positive, respectful, and diverse group of bright and highly capable people who work collaboratively with strong purpose and vision. The Flipboard team is headquartered in the beautiful SF Bay Area. Although our roots lie in the Silicon Valley, our team extends around the world: New York City, Chicago, Los Angeles, Seattle, Vancouver, and London. Our culture: We value an environment and culture that encourages people's voices and perspectives to be heard. We believe that leveraging our team will lead us to create better products and services for all our users and partners. We value diversity and inclusion at Flipboard and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Our value: We are fully funded and making steady, meaningful progress on a premium, high margin business within a $600B, highly strategic market. Our business model is tightly aligned with our values, our partners and our user experience which makes our company both valuable and unique. Our product: Millions of people truly love Flipboard and rely on it regularly. Flipboard is a standard bearer for great mobile design, innovation, and we deeply value craftsmanship. Our platform: Our platform selects the best content from thousands of publishers around the world, organizes it into highly personalized feeds, and presents it for further curation by the community. We are driven by hard technical challenges and we value pioneering new technology to continually increase the power, efficiency and scale of our platform.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Are you excited about solving difficult problems? Kizen is for people who want to accelerate their careers, while contributing to something greater than themselves.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We‚Äôve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before.    We are looking for an Account Executive to join our rapidly growing team. This person will be positioned to help clients achieve bigger goals in ways they never could previously. We are looking for sales pioneers who will pave the growth path for a technology company intent on disrupting the market amongst the biggest names out there.   Key Responsibilities. Harness your inner entrepreneur to take on large entrenched competitors with multi-decade brand recognition Tenaciously identify and pursue new business in a specific industry/geographic segment; unaffected by obstacles Excel in a fast paced environment where you are able to continuously learn and adapt in order to identify new customers Consistently reach key decision makers with ease to close deals quickly  Required Qualifications. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent required 3 years of experience in sales acquiring new customers Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems Passion for selling and drive to build and grow a new customer base  Preferred Qualifications. 5+ years of experience in sales acquiring new customers Experience selling CRM, Marketing Automation, Business Intelligence, or similar

RTM are partnered with a disruptive FinTech company that provides cash back rewards via it's mobile payment platform. They need a VP Sales to build the sales strategy for all go to market channels and projects, tracking and reporting progress to the Board. Their growth has been impressive in the first 18 months and they are ambitious to continue this.  One channel they are looking to develop is their membership/Sales Leadership channel, converting users to sales leaders and rewarding them for this. This is an opportunity to build that program and a team to support you. The unusual thing about this membership sales program is there is no cost of admission to the members, only the opportunity to build incremental wealth.  The VP Sales will build the strategy, engagement, communication, event and incentive programs that encourage members to become Sales Leaders.  To do this you will need experience from a network marketing/MLM company and a demonstrated track record of growing this channel.  In return there is unlimited earning potential from a base, bonus and a significant equity opportunity.  The role can be fully remote.

description: Job Description Summary The Offshore Wind Key Account Manager (KAM) is responsible for leading all Grid Solutions sales activities related to Offshore Wind . In this role, you will manage the overall account relationships / strategy and deliver upon growth and other business objectives for all Developers, Consultants that engage in OFW. Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities Account leadership role responsible for leading the Grid Solutions account strategy in all aspects of growth and profitability including customer growth and spending analysis, integrated account planning, opportunity identification, cash & receivables, and value communication. Develop and execute commercial strategy for sales of Grid Solutions product lines such as AC Solutions, HVDC, Circuit Breakers, High Voltage IT, Sensing Systems; Grid Automation, Services, Power Equipment and additional product lines within GE. Lead the sales team to develop and execute account growth strategies and Account Planning. Own the accurate forecasting of orders, convertible orders, margins, and sales for customer(s). Develop and execute an overall growth strategy with integrated plays for Grid Solutions for assigned account(s). Develop and own strategic customer relationships with key decision makers in support of sales teams account strategies. Drive identification, prospecting and creation of new sales opportunities. Drive Growth Initiatives and new product introductions within assigned account(s). Help develop written strategies for pursuing opportunities at strategic customer accounts Provide feedback regarding market trends, pricing and competition to product line marketing Help sales team grow installed base and develop new customer contacts, document installed base and gaps. Manage travel and living expense budget Develop synergy opportunities with other GE businesses. Conduct Operating Plan and Account reviews with region leadership . Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Engineering Minimum of 10 years of direct sales, account or team leadership experience Minimum of 5 years of experience in electrical / utility industry sales or product business team role Eligibility Requirement Ability and willingness to travel approximately 25%. Desired Characteristics Professional and technical competency with Automation and Power Equipment products / services (Transmission / Distribution or Power Generation). Strong situational fluency with executive levels of customer management Demonstrated strong communication, and presentation skills with all levels of management, executive, engineering and operations Familiarity with economic and executive-incentive drivers for executive-level procurement decisions in the energy market. Strong interpersonal skills with emphasis on relationship / team building Customer oriented Proactive work style, creativity, energy, self starter Growth and Change management mindset Effective team contributor and member Excellent negotiating & closing skills; willing/able to travel MBA Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Phillips Distilling Company is currently inviting candidates to apply for a full-time Senior Director of Sales position. This position will support the Johnson Brothers Division.  Since 1912, Phillips Distilling Company (PDC) has been producing high-quality spirits brands. As one of America's oldest family-owned spirits companies, we pride ourselves on our independent spirit and our commitment to innovation, quality, partnerships, community and consumers. Our passion is evident in our diverse portfolio of premium and ultra-premium brands.  The candidate selected for this role will enjoy competitive compensation, annual bonus potential, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package! This position is based in Minnesota and requires 75% of time in the ‚Äúfield‚Äù.  The Sr Director, Johnson Brothers Division will manage assigned division including training, mentoring and managing staff in a multi-state division to meet or exceed the company‚Äôs business objectives. The role directs the planning, development and execution of market and customer sales plans, strategies, objectives, systems and procedures to maximize volume and profit growth. The role also ensures effective relationships at a high level with key customers, distributors, and key stakeholders.   The Sr Director will manage a team of sales managers.    Essential Duties Define and articulate the Operations/Product Supply Operating Plan in line with overall strategic plan and financial goals. Meet or exceed divisional EBITDA goal and all annual case objectives. Hire, train, mentor and manage staff within the Division. Communication with each direct report must occur on a weekly basis, at a minimum. Conduct assessments with all staff at least bi-annually, and hold them accountable for all items on their job descriptions. Work with Chief Revenue Officer to develop pricing, promotional, merchandising and distributor incentive strategies for each region and ensure that they are implemented and effectively managed by the appropriate Manager. Develop a comprehensive understanding of the company‚Äôs brands, organizational structure, culture, cost components and strategies and a thorough understanding of the US distilled spirits industry. Establish and maintain strong professional and personal relationships with key distributor and trade personnel in all markets. Meet at least annually with all ‚ÄúA‚Äù and ‚ÄúB‚Äù market distributor principals/owners/Presidents and review financial, qualitative and quantitative performance. Attend Managers‚Äô bi-annual business review/planning meetings with each distributor (preferably in Feb & July) and annual survey with senior management of distributor and Phillips. Continually investigate and identify both opportunities for the company and ways in which it can improve. Ensure a culture of legal compliance. Be a positive ambassador for the company and its sales organization. Lead with an entrepreneurial spirit.  Minimum Job Requirements A four-year college degree is required with 8+ years‚Äô sales management experience in the distilled spirits industry, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant sales leadership experience in distributor relationship management ideally in both large and small supplier-side companies Be highly energetic, creative, and self-motivated. Able to operate in a fast-paced environment with finesse and passion Must have the ability to develop relationships with distributors and manage pricing and profitability while holding them accountable to key objectives. Requires excellent communication skills; proficient computer skills including electronic mail, spreadsheet, internet, etc. Relevant experience effectively preparing and managing a budget; and ability to prioritize, organize and delegate assignments. Experience with pricing, use of data, and knowledge of POS Sales management experience and ability to effectively manage, coach, and develop a remote staff.  Reports To: Chief Revenue Officer  Candidates offered employment will be required to submit to a background check and drug test. Phillips Distilling Company is an E-Verify participating employer.  Phillips Distilling is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. If a disability prevents you from applying for a job online, contact us via e-mail or in writing.
industries: Food & Beverages

description: Business Development Director ‚Äì Commercial Our client is a Global chemical company who is seeking to hire a Commercial Business Development Director with US and potentially Global responsibilities. Ideally, this person will reside in the Northeast and preferably in New England.  Essence of the Position The focus of this role will be to develop the strategy and lead our client‚Äôs sales and market growth in key business segments while taking on a substantial leadership role in the strategy and growth of the company.  The successful candidate‚Äôs area of expertise will be in polymers, the compounding of polymers, and experience across a number of the key polymer markets ‚Äì medical, wire & cable, automotive, tooling, etc.  Candidate Profile Commercial chemical experience; especially in the polymer/compound industry. A BS in chemistry, chemical engineering, or material science. Advanced degrees are a big plus. Having held technical positions earlier in your career is a big plus. Proven leadership in commercial sales and marketing. Proven experience developing and executing a sales and marketing strategy on a national and/or international basis. Highly driven, motivated leader and self-starter. Ability to lead and coach individuals and teams. Willingness to travel domestically and internationally Our client offers a fast growing, technically advance, professionally supportive environment. There is significant room for career growth in this multinational organization.

Sorbet is a first-of-its-kind Fintech solution using technology to reimagine Paid Time Off. We‚Äôre creating a future where employees are empowered to choose how to spend their time to improve their financial health and well being, while helping employers reduce the $272 Billion in balance sheet liabilities due to unused vacation days (Paid Time Off). Founded by a seasoned team of Finance and Tech professionals and backed by top tier investors including Viola Ventures, Global Founders Capital and Meron Capital, Sorbet has offices in Tel Aviv, New York City, and Kiev. We welcome people from all backgrounds. If you‚Äôre curious, passionate, collaborative, and want to create real impact in people's lives, come work with us!  We are looking for energetic and dynamic Head of Sales Development to join and grow our sales development team. You will be tasked with identifying and generating sales opportunities through both inbound and outbound calling activities. The right candidate will be target driven, one who works well under pressure and thinks out-of-the-box. You will be responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities in Target Accounts, become a trusted resource and develop relationships with prospects, acting as the initial point of contact. This role will be primarily focused on researching the Target Accounts and performing outreach through emails, calls, and social media. This role is the first touchpoint for prospects and an opportunity to set the tone of the sales cycle following.  Main Responsibilities Work on a targeted list of accounts Working closely with our Head of Sales Respond, engage and qualify inbound leads and inquiries Take ownership of our lead qualification sales pipeline and funnel Book demos with our sales team when an inbound/outbound lead reaches a qualified stage Act as a subject matter expert on Sorbet‚Äôs product offerings Generate and follow-up on leads and ensure success of the sales cycle Find creative ways to bring more leads in, create prospects lists and reach out to potential customers via phone, email and social media   Requirements 1-2 years of sales/sales development experience with a great understanding of the sales cycle  Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written Super social (online, phone, face-to-face) Detail-oriented with an ability to see the bigger picture Ability to work in a fast-paced environment independently and as part of a global team Experience working in the Fintech industry (strong advantage)

As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day,, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world‚Äôs leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that‚Äôs through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilizing your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  What‚Äôs the role?  We are looking for an experienced Regional VP of Sales to join our sales leadership team to execute our Americas sales plan and help scale the commercial team across the Americas. Given the senior level of this role you will also be responsible for representing Elliptic to a wide range of stakeholders both internally and externally.  The behaviors we will be looking for include: Coaching and Emotional Intelligence. The ability to connect with people and understand what makes them tick. You must inspire the team to learn and give positive feedback that motivates. Attract Top Talent to the team. Those who fit this description are typically leaders with a focus on the success of the team and the business first, not on their own personal success. Resourcefulness and Network. The ability to build an extensive internal and external network. The latter is preferably within the financial sector. Strategic and Tactical. The ability to balance sales plan execution with a longer term vision/strategy. Proven Playbook. This comes down to having a point of view around the sales process, how hiring is done, how performance is managed, sales enablement, event management, and more.  Your team will be responsible for helping prospective customers navigate cryptocurrency compliance and regulatory environments, clearly communicating Elliptic‚Äôs AML/KYC and Forensics Platform features and benefits. You come from a technology background, selling SaaS solutions to enterprise companies and you‚Äôve managed high performing teams who continually exceed targets!  As a VP of Sales Americas, you must: Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota Lead, motivate and develop the Americas sales team. Create a culture of success and ongoing business and goal achievement. Ensure that team and individual report‚Äôs targets are achieved Forecast accurately Take the lead on recruitment of additional resources as we grow the sales presence in the Americas in the future. Develop plans and strategies for developing business and achieving the company‚Äôs sales goals Manage the use of budgets Define and coordinate sales training programs that enable staff to achieve their potential and support company sales objectives Manage customer expectations and contribute to a high level of customer satisfaction Define sales processes that drive desired sales outcomes and identify improvements where and when required Put in place infrastructure and systems to support the success of the sales function. Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company functions Work closely with the marketing function to establish successful support, channel and partner programs Manage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunities Represent Elliptic in senior meetings with C-Level executives at large global financial institutions  Requirements Extensive experience managing sales teams executing business with $50-250K ACV‚Äôs Extensive experience in full sales cycle experience selling Enterprise SaaS solutions Ability to manage business strategy and pipeline with both high velocity short sales cycle mid-market business as well as complex long sales cycle high dollar enterprise business. Strong outbound prospecting skills, with a track record of generating net new business, and coaching team members in techniques to do the same. Demonstrated track record of individual & team success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer - personal achievement of sales campaigns/deals of $1,000,000 or more. A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset. You‚Äôre comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient  Bonus Points for: Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Borderline obsession with emerging technolog  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 25 days + 8 National Holidays + additional day for your birthday Private Health Insurance 401k - Elliptic will match your elective contributions up to a maximum of 4% Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Coffee + sodas + beer + unlimited snacks in the office Home office allowance Enhanced parental leave; we provide eligible employees, regardless of gender or whether they become a parent by birth or adoption, 16 weeks fully-paid leave and job-protected leave Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it‚Äôs important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don‚Äôt all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Summary  The Regional Sales Director is responsible for the profit/loss of a sales team located in a specific priority market metropolitan area. This role is responsible for hunting new customers and coordinating and supporting the ‚Äúhunting‚Äù and ‚Äúfarming‚Äù efforts of local market sales team members. The Market Leader is focused on building relationships with customers and real-estate influencers, and also mentoring Sales Executives (SEs).  You  WHO YOU ARE Raise the bar by taking the initiative to achieve results and make excellence your goal. Create lifelong fans by making customer experience your top priority. Are authentic and say what you mean, share how you feel, and are your true self. Are a team player and foster a sense of community by recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of our team. Believe it‚Äôs possible and look at challenges optimistically ‚Äì seeing opportunities to bring solutions to the table. Embrace change and recognize the industry and the company is evolving. What You‚Äôll Do Responsible for profit/loss for a market and growing market share Lead, motivate, and develop high performing sales teams in major metropolitan area Recruit, develop, and retain top sales talent Demonstrate strategic leadership and help teams focus on highest value opportunities Accurately forecast sales revenue and delivers business results Identify strategic accounts by actively networking and building relationships Sell the full suite of Vari¬Æ products including desktop and Full Office products through solution-selling techniques. Additionally, actively discuss ‚Äútract homes‚Äù and VariSpace Collaborate with HQ-based leadership, marketing, and other teams How You‚Äôll Get There 10-15+ years leading sales teams and working in a relevant sales, business development, account management, and/or sales executive role (or equivalent) Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build strong relationships Proven track record of consistently meeting sales quotas and helping teams meet their quotas Ability to empathize and understand the customer needs and pain points Robust negotiation skillset and know-how Strong strategic perspective to establish and guide short-term and long-term sales goals Ability to effectively communicate through all mediums (verbal, listening, written) COMPANY DESCRIPTION  We started by developing the world‚Äôs leading sit-stand desk converter to help a coworker with back pain, but now we‚Äôre so much more than a desk. We are flexible workspace solutions made simple and installed fast.  From a collection of office furniture to workspaces offering space-as-a-service, we provide everything high-growth businesses need to unlock the potential of their workforce. Today, we have over 3 million fans worldwide. We‚Äôve shipped products to more than 120 countries, and our solutions are in 98% of Fortune 500 companies.  We promote a company culture that encourages diversity, creativity, innovation, and inclusion. Vari has become one of the most innovative, forward-thinking companies in the world. We‚Äôre growing quickly, so our company is fast-paced and exciting, but also friendly and supportive. Our employee benefits package includes medical, dental, and 401k, but also profit sharing, education reimbursement, and wellness perks, like an onsite gym.  WHY Vari?  We‚Äôre Award Winners Work at a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù ‚Äì FORTUNE Magazine Grow with the ‚ÄúNational Entrepreneur of the Year‚Äù ‚Äì EY Be part of the ‚ÄúFastest Growing Company in DFW‚Äù ‚Äì SMU Learn from award-winning leadership ‚Äì Most Admired CEO (Dallas Business Journal), CMO of the Year (American Marketing Association), Outstanding CFO ‚Äì Large Private Company (DCEO) We Want You To Be Happier And Healthier Your own Active Workspace On-site gym with Peloton cycles and a spa-like locker room Group fitness classes ‚Äì from bootcamps to yoga Meditation and chair massage pods Subsidized healthy food from Fresh Caf√© Outstanding overall total rewards package Wellness program and insurance premium discounts Nicotine-free facility We Value Our Employees Community Team that cares Enhanced paternity / maternity programs 401k and profit-sharing plan Paid personal time off Paid volunteer time off Team building events on and off site Mentoring and career development Gourmet coffee bar Education reimbursement Short-term and long-term disability premiums covered at 100% by Vari Vari provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

description: Our health system is broken, and it‚Äôs a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.  We are looking for an experienced, hard-working sales enablement professional to join our team. You will have the opportunity to create and implement the sales enablement function here at Sana to empower our team with the knowledge and skills necessary to be successful. This includes everything from onboarding, continuing education, driving adoption and cross functional alignment. We are growing fast - you‚Äôll get to help build an operation from the ground up under the guidance of people who have done it before. It will be hard work, but it will also be a lot of fun!  What you will do Ownership of sales training and enablement throughout the organization in the interest of yielding higher productivity within the existing revenue organization Provide the sales teams with the resources needed to close more deals, including content, tools, knowledge, and information to effectively sell to customers Drive adoption and enablement of sales tools and processes Collaborate cross-functionally to drive strong relationships and alignment between Sales and all go-to-market functions Define and drive impactful projects to deliver rapid growth while introducing innovative ideas into the business Be responsible for communications and alignment of the revenue team both internally and cross-departmentally Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales processes, procedures and policies Participate in and manage sales territory planning and distribution Serve as liaison between Marketing, Product,Operations and Sales Facilitate and audit deal review, approval procedures and policy compliance Work with Sales Operations to design and plan annual performance management initiatives, inclusive of compensation plans and incentives, performance reviews, and quota assignment based on best-practices and leading indicators in the market  About you 5+ years of professional experience in sales enablement/training, operations or leadership roles 4 year degree from an accredited college or university You have done this before at an emerging company and have a working playbook.  Excellent communication skills Entrepreneurial. Self-directed. Excited to build something from scratch Passionate. You care about making our healthcare system work better for people and business owners. Grit. You aren‚Äôt worried about getting your hands dirty and working hard when you need to. Comfortable with change. We are a startup and need people who are ok doing things outside of their traditional job description Comfortable with modern web applications. We are building all of our software in-house and you will be a key constituent in its development. Experience in health insurance or in a startup environment is a plus  About Sana Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out!

description: Onbe, a fast-growing fintech, bringing innovation to an expanding global marketplace, stands for ‚Äúon behalf.‚Äù Because that‚Äôs exactly how we work: on behalf of your company, as your comprehensive payments partner. Trust us to transform the way you imagine payments‚Äîas an opportunity for innovation, a source of insight into your customer, and a way to connect with stakeholders around the globe. Together, we‚Äôll co-create digital payment solutions that offer a seamless experience for your recipients ‚Äì delivering value beyond currency.   Summary: Onbe is looking for a high-performing Sales Director who will sell Onbe‚Äôs innovative payments and disbursement solutions to new enterprise-level direct clients, marketplaces and channel partners. Through our global reach and proprietary technology, the Sales Director will help businesses turn what is traditionally a cost center into a profit center. The solutions focus on payments to consumers, workforces and service providers. These payments are often in the form of refunds, rewards and payroll solutions delivered both digitally and physically.   Reporting directly to Vice President of Sales & Partnerships, this individual contributor will play a visible role within Onbe, helping shape the strategy of the company.   Responsibilities Develop new relationships with both large enterprise businesses and channel partners, leveraging our unique solutions to drive mutually-beneficial outcomes. Prospect into multiple buying centers, tailoring the solution to each buying persona with clear ties to the prospect‚Äôs business objectives. Build upon Onbe‚Äôs existing lead generation and book of business to identify new prospects and verticals. Nurture and grow a network of referral sources. Deliver impactful ROIs as part of proposals, focusing on the value creation for our prospects. Incorporate a growing book of solutions into custom value propositions, cross selling multiple products in multiple buying centers. Collaborate tirelessly, making those to the right and the left of them better through leading by example and coaching others. Develop interdepartmental relationships, partnering with product, marketing and account management to develop new products and strategies. Ensure a seamless transition of customer responsibility to the account management team following a successful contracting and implementation. Maintain accurate and timely customer, pipeline and forecast data.  Qualifications 10+ years in a consultative B2B sales role with experience selling to Fortune 1000 companies. Experience in payments and disbursements preferred. Familiarity with the refunds, incentive or rewards spaces is a plus. Demonstrated ability to sell to multiple C-level personas, including finance, marketing and digital engagement personas. Must display excellent verbal and written presentation, interpersonal and communication skills. Experience working with a CRM such as Microsoft Dynamics or Salesforce  Up to 20% domestic travel may be required, post pandemic recovery.  What We Value A team player who understands that collaboration is the key to success A caring professional who puts customers and colleagues first Always striving for excellence in everything you do Highly focused on results, finding a way when others only see the challenges A passionate person who can influence others into getting behind the mission  This position can be fully remote in a EST or CST location.  Onbe is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek out ways to create a mindful workforce which embraces diversity and celebrates a culture of inclusion. We do not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or family status, religion, age, disability, genetic information or military service. Our equal opportunity policy applies to all decisions of employment including hiring, placement, promotion or advancement, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, compensation, training and leaves of absence.  Onbe complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act and ensures equal employment opportunities in all areas of employment to qualified job applicants and employees with a disability. Onbe will make a reasonable accommodation for an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless doing so will present an undue hardship on the operation of the business.

description: Head of Business Development Job Opportunity   Banyan Infrastructure combines financial and technological innovation to accelerate the deployment of solar, wind and other critical infrastructure around the globe. This trillion-dollar market needs to grow rapidly to solve key issues like climate change, and provide basic services to communities, such as clean electricity, water, and transportation. Unfortunately, sustainable infrastructure capital flows move slowly, lacking basic fintech tools to efficiently execute complex multi-party transactions. Banyan's SaaS platform enables banks and funds to highlight key insights and automate repetitive workflows, increasing transparency and efficiency while decreasing risk. This enables streamlined origination, servicing, and securitization of infrastructure funding at higher volume and lower cost.  What You'll Work On We are seeking an exceptional, driven candidate to lead our new and growing Business Development team. You will generate and grow key partnerships and relationships with banks, funds, and other organizations, build out our business development organization, and drive sales. You will be an early member of the Banyan team, reporting directly to the Co-Founder and COO in San Francisco, and will also get to contribute to the overall growth and culture of the company.   Responsibilities Lead our deployment against Banyan‚Äôs rapidly growing pipeline and drive the go-to-market engine to achieve revenue targets  Source, structure, negotiate, execute, and implement new customer relations Partner with the product and operations to drive successful long-term customer outcomes Work with executive team to optimize pricing, channel, and messaging strategies  Manage a growing sales and business development team, including key input in new hire decisions, ongoing management of direct reports, and establishing scalable processes Cultivate deep relationships and expertise in the structured finance and renewable energy ecosystems to help drive future partnerships and sales opportunities  Ideal Qualifications  Minimum four years of experience finding and closing partnerships in sales and/or business development and/or structured finance Experience with enterprise SaaS solutions  Low ego with a demonstrated track record for working effectively across internal and external organizations Ability to thrive in a startup environment and take initiative while prioritizing, and dealing with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment Intellectual curiosity and high ambition Passion for impact and working on global problems  Bonus nice to haves:  Structured finance experience Expertise in renewable energy Experience in a high-growth technology startup  Work authorization is necessary.   Why Banyan Our team is made up of bright, mission-driven individuals. We are passionate about using technology to solve problems that impact us in the real world ‚Äî and the market loves us, so we are growing quickly.  Our benefits package is designed to allow our team members to be their best selves, both in and out of the workplace. In addition to top tier health plans, generous at work meal offerings, and fitness benefits, we prioritize your well-being and growth through professional development, parental leave, a flexible time off policy, and a flexible office policy.   We believe diverse perspectives and backgrounds are critical to building great technology, and our goal is to cultivate an environment where people feel equally valued and respected. Banyan is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, or veteran status.  Compensation Competitive compensation with a blend of base salary, bonus, and generous stock offering Range and title are dependent upon experience

About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Role  LatAM is an important region for Cloudflare. We are looking for our Head of LatAM Sales to help us invest and grow and will be responsible for driving Cloudflare's revenue in the region.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive regional sales growth through successful leadership, organizational planning, customer service, and outstanding execution of all regional go-to-market programs (enterprise sales, customer success, solutions engineering, business development, support, and field marketing). Grow and build the LatAM team and drive the local hiring needs for LatAM by working with America's functional leadership and recruiting resources, ensuring we have proper leadership development-succession planning in place across all teams. Build and internally evangelize a plan for local hiring in-region to drive better adoption of our platform through enterprise accounts. Drive greater adoption of our platform through key strategic partners like IBM and Systems Integrators in the region, as well as reseller partners. Design, build and execute strategies for the LatAM market in collaboration with regional and global functional leaders. Interject as the single point of contact for all LatAM operational concerns, ensuring proper and timely escalation and resolution. Ensure that corporate policy and regulatory initiatives are consistently applied and followed by LatAM team members Inspire interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and affect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù Drive business cadence for forecast calls, functional review meetings, deal review, customer account reviews, weekly team meetings and periodic company-wide kick-offs Represent Cloudflare as appropriate at external conferences, media and PR events. Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Sales growth-oriented leader who drives rapid change and growth and possesses 10+ years of relevant, regional or country leadership in SaaS/Cloud software platforms Deep experience and relationships with the SaaS/Cloud community in LatAM, able to establish, build and grow strong relationships. Enterprise/corporate market rich experience including having a well-regarded reputation in the LatAM market and strong connections/relationships with large enterprise customers. Exceptional collaboration, relationship-building, and interpersonal skills ‚Äì with the ability to develop working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside Cloudflare. Ability to define, develop and lead go-to-market programs in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Curious, empathetic, fast learner who thrives in a high-growth, continuous change environment. Bilingual required with trilingual preferred - English, Spanish and Portuguese What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

description: Job description: The Director, Business Development is responsible for revenue generation and account management. The Director, Business Development identifies opportunities for and closes on design and micro manufacturing services to medical device and diagnostics (aka life sciences) companies consistent with company objectives. This role will require close coordination and communication with the VP, Sales, Director of Marketing and Account Management, Account Managers, Lightspeed ADL Application Engineers and Managers, Finance, and various technical and operations managers in the company. The Director, Business Development will represent the company at trade shows, symposia, medical congresses, and other networking events. ¬∑ Identify and convert new business with medical device and diagnostics companies who will use Resonetics design and micromanufacturing services. ¬∑ Effectively target and screen new opportunities to engage Resonetics‚Äô Lightspeed ADL, a best-in-class prototyping and process development business unit, with operations in NH, OH, MN, CA, Switzerland and Israel. ¬∑ Establish ‚Äúproduction wins‚Äù by converting Lightspeed ADL projects to volume production and gaining dual sourcing production work straight from target accounts. Negotiate favorable pricing and terms and build true win-win relationships. ¬∑ Support existing life sciences accounts, providing outstanding relationship management to retain business and secure next generation work and other projects. ¬∑ Leverage the success from one account division to gain entry to another division and penetrate that business to identify new growth opportunities. ¬∑ Utilize planning tools and market intelligence to develop strategies and tactics to achieve sales objectives in a consistent fashion. ¬∑ Analyze bookings and backlog and participate fully in monthly and annual forecasting exercises to provide good visibility for capacity and financial planning. ¬∑ Establish pricing by working with relevant company personnel to establish price points that address specific customer's needs while satisfying company objectives. ¬∑ Communicate with customers and a highly technical support staff to interact effectively in a technology-rich environment. ¬∑ Take a self-directed leadership role in the support and resolution of technical and business customer-related issues. ¬∑ Keep appropriate documentation (trip reports, expense reports, various sales reports) current at all times. ¬∑ Represent the company professionally in all interactions and present capabilities and proposals in a knowledgeable and effective manner to earn the trust and respect of all stakeholders. ¬∑ Maintain current knowledge of relevant product/service offerings to offer technically accurate solutions to customers. ¬∑ Participate in selected conferences and exhibitions, network effectively to build brand awareness with targeted accounts and individuals. Work effectively as a team member and colleague to assist other employees in achieving success in their projects and responsibilities. Required Qualifications: ¬∑ 10 + years‚Äô experience selling products & components to medical device and/or diagnostics companies (OEMs) and/or 8+ years as a customer-facing applications engineer with a strong sales aptitude. ¬∑ Proven track record converting prospects into revenue generating accounts. ¬∑ B. S. degree favoring engineering, science or business management. ¬∑ Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Comfortable interacting with staff at all levels within the customer organization. ¬∑ A proactive mindset, outgoing personality and bias for action is required. ¬∑ Excellent negotiation and interpersonal skills; must deal with internal and external customers ethically and honestly. ¬∑ Familiarity with medical manufacturing, ISO and FDA quality system requirements. ¬∑ Ability to read engineering drawings and solid models and be credible in front of customers is required. ¬∑ Must be thorough and persistent with a strong work ethic, willing to work extra hours to meet customer needs and company objectives. ¬∑ Adept at being a strong customer advocate and building long-term relationships, while also keeping company‚Äôs needs front of mind. ¬∑ Willing to travel in and outside the territory as needed, including to Resonetics‚Äô facilities outside the U.S. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with laser processing in the medical device environment. Relationships with key customers and prospects in the territory. Quick thinking individual with a demonstrated capacity and comfort multi-tasking. Physical Demands: Valid U.S. driving license and frequent travel via automobile and commercial flights.

description: Are You? Great at building market success with your passion for selling cutting-edge technology that helps to reduce emissions Excited about being part of a company that‚Äîevery day‚Äîtakes big sustainability steps to keep people safe and the environment clean Thrilled about working for a very cool Finnish company with operations in 80 countries.  Our client, Gasmet Technologies, is seeking a savvy and marketing-minded Sales Director ‚Äì Americas to help grow its business in North and South America. The ideal candidate will get a thrill from being part of a truly innovative and fast-growing technology company that‚Äôs leading the way globally in designing and manufacturing world-class gas analysis systems and emission monitoring solutions for industrial processes, natural gas sources, and work environments. Gasmet takes great pride in contributing to keeping people safe and the environment clean by investing heavily in R&D and providing the finest, most reliable, and accurate cutting-edge measurement technology. You‚Äôll be joining a company that embraces an honest culture of friendliness, openness, professionalism, and teamwork‚Äîdelivering the most optimal solutions to its customers. Gasmet, founded in 1990, consists of the parent company and five subsidiaries located in strategic locations around the world. Its headquarters and factory are in Vantaa, Finland. Gasmet operates in more than 80 countries, on all continents. This remotely based position reports directly to the CEO and CSO at the HQ in Finland. For more information and inspiration watch this video and visit www.gasmet.com.  About the Role As Sales Director you will have full responsibility for Gasmet‚Äôs sales operations in the Americas and the acquisition and development of new customers‚Äîboth via direct sales and via channel partners and distributors. 90% of Gasmet‚Äôs clients are located in North America, some are in Latin America. You‚Äôll be driving Gasmet‚Äôs continued growth and expansion by selling analysis systems and emission monitoring solutions for industrial processes, natural gas sources, and work environments. The candidate we are seeking will have a sound commercial background, a successful track record in B2B technical sales, a contemporary leadership style, and the ability to motivate and develop a sales team. We expect you to understand market opportunities and translate them into actionable business plans. Your ‚ÄòCan-Do‚Äô approach and ability to create long-term customer success will be keys to your success. We expect you to be comfortable in an entrepreneurial and international environment where you will pro-actively participate in other business functions and operations of the company as needed. Travel of up to 50% of the time is expected, mostly in North America, occasionally to Mexico and Central- and South America.  Main Tasks & Responsibilities Manage and lead the day-to-day activities and operations of the North American team of five located in Canada (sales/engineering/service/admin), and ensure timely and accurate delivery of quotations, processing of orders, etc. Prepare and manage annual sales plan & sales budget Execute Gasmet‚Äôs strategy for Americas to grow profitable sales by mobilizing a variety of channels to market Analyze, develop, grow, and strengthen the network of distributors and channel partners Meet or exceed sales targets based on approved sales plans Create market demand among customer segments Produce monthly and annual forecasting reports as well as sales activity reports. Stay up to date on industry and customer news, trends, and requirements and acquire knowledge of regulations & policies, products, services, competitors, relevant information about legacy, existing, and emerging technologies, and the latest product-line developments. Collaborate closely with Gasmet Finland on marketing and outreach activities for Americas Travel up to 50% to customers and prospects in North America and occasionally in Mexico/Central America/South America  Qualifications Your Work Experience & Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering or related technical discipline. Master‚Äôs degree is preferred 10+ years of experience in B2B technical product selling, delivering profitable growth Solid experience in developing and supporting channel partners and distributors Prior experience with similar products for industrial customers such as gas analyzers, emissions monitoring, and/or measurement instrumentation. Excellent commercial acumen and experience working inter-and cross-culturally between the US, Canada, and Latin America in an international company Experience in managing and inspiring high-performing sales teams communicating vision and setting goals Experience negotiating and understanding typical sales and delivery contracts in B2B product business. Proficient in MS Suite and CRM systems  Your Skills, Traits & Style: Leadership style: super-engaging, dynamic, driven, enthusiastic, articulate, and personable with an affinity for coaching team members to realize their full potential High integrity, accuracy, and efficiency in business development tasks resulting in the best possible performance Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written; ability to interface and gain trust cross-functionally Analytical and systematic with an affinity for problem-solving, negotiating, and time management. High energy, drive, and self-motivation Pragmatic‚Äîyou get things done Hands-on, Can-do, Can-try approach  What We Offer is More than Just a Job An excellent team-focused work environment with great visibility and appreciation for your efforts An opportunity to be a part of a truly innovative and growing international technology company. A competitive salary plus performance-based bonus Excellent benefits including PTO, health care insurance, 401K, disability, and life insurance  Gasmet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants for employment are to be considered for employment based on the individual applicant‚Äôs qualifications and without regard to race, color, creed, gender, age, disability, national origin, religion, veteran status, uniform service member status, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, genetic information, or on account of membership in any protected category under federal, state, and local laws.

description: Description  Thought Machine are solving one of the biggest problems in banking. Since launching in 2014, our mission has been to liberate banks from outdated, legacy technology which stifles their ability to innovate. Thought Machine's core product, Vault, is a cloud native, core banking engine built to run any type of bank - from established Tier 1 banks all the way to new challenger banks  To move closer to achieving our mission, we are looking for highly talented individuals to join the fast growing team. With a founding team drawn from Google, we have a deep culture of engineering excellence and we believe it is this which delivers a solution compelling enough to engender a seismic shift in the banking industry.  Thought Machine was ranked as the most desirable London fintech to work at by Sifted when comparing employee reviews on Glassdoor and named in Fintech 50 (2020). We pride ourselves on having an excellent internal culture, where we take cultural fit as important as technical fit when we make new hires. At Thought Machine, we strive hard to create a fast-paced, supportive and fun working environment to enable the team to produce the best technical work in the industry.  This is an exciting opportunity to be one of the first Sales Directors in the region as we expand Thought Machine into Eastern America. The Sales Director will be responsible for the region and will own the full sales cycle for Eastern America. This will involve building and forecasting the pipeline, qualifying leads generated by yourself, the marketing team and our partner organisations, through to managing large scale contracts to close. You will need to be technically and commercially literate, but in addition you will have the full support of the sales engineering and marketing teams. This role will suit a candidate who relishes the opportunity to build a regional footprint from scratch, is able to work autonomously and is able to collaborate strongly across teams in the business.  DUTIES Develop and deliver proposals that address customer and prospect critical needs. Build and develop relationships at multiple levels ‚Äì executive sponsors, influencers and decision makers across the Region to stimulate interest and feed into the pipeline. Exceed annual Regional targets for software licencing and professional services contracts. Partner with our Sales Engineers, Client Services and Marketing teams to build targeted sales campaigns. Manage your time between progressing the ‚Äúgood fit‚Äù leads that have a high chance / near term win and stimulating opportunities that will progress in the longer term. Understand the issues facing potential and existing customers and interacting with our in-house product and engineering teams.Building and delivering on the regional sales plan. Essential  Requirements Minimum 10+ years of exceeding enterprise software sales targets in a region in the US - during this time you will have built a reputation as an adviser and partner with your clients, building solutions that lead to real value creation Experience in consultative sales roles within the retail banking sector (specifically core banking or payments) Knowledge and experience of Banking procurement practices and processes and overall typical sales lifecycle for selling enterprise platforms into banks. Excellent understanding of the issues facing retail banks ranging from technological, regulatory and commercial pressures. Proven ability to generate leads and show high conversion rate to completion Able to quickly understand prospective clients needs, to converse competently regarding both the technical and commercial aspects of the proposition. Confident in challenging the status quo and you engage customers in new ways of thinking. Able to manage and influence key decision makers, particularly at C-suite level in organisations through your ability to build credible, trusted and lasting relationships. Experience in fast moving start-ups and or enterprise software sales in more established businesses. Able to demonstrate consistently hitting and exceeding sales targets Bring energy, gravitas and enthusiasm to the conversation Desirable Knowledge and experience with cloud infrastructure technology Experience having worked in a global scale-up/ being an early stage employee in a new market Benefits Highly competitive salary Healthcare, vision and dental 20 days holiday 10 days sick pay 401K matching (up to 7%) Share options All the latest tech you need A talented & experienced team as your colleagues An environment where we encourage learning and progress Thought Machine are committed to making a measurable positive impact on people's everyday lives. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We actively hire for cultural growth. We welcome people of all ages, backgrounds and value people who take a journey unique to them. We provide everyone with equal access to professional development. You are encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.

description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, well-organized individual who has a strong experience and deep understanding of prospecting and developing strong relationships with retailers, wholesalers, and distributors in the Salty Snacks CPG category.  The ideal candidate will have successfully called on nationwide and regional convenience stores (7-11, Love's, Pilot, etc.) and distributors (McLane, Coremark, etc.). The ideal candidate will have also successfully called on one or all of the Salty Snack Category Desk of the major Club, Mass Merchandise and/or Value retailers in North America, including: Wal-Mart, Target, Sam's Club, BJ's Wholesale, Dollar Tree, Dollar General and Family Dollar.  Responsibilities Develop and execute strategies to drive business in new and existing markets Mentor sales team to help them achieve individual & team objectives Strong analytical skills in Salty Snacks category (proactively engaged in category expansion through the execution of shopper marketing initiatives and innovation) Work with our distributor partners to ensure product placement on all authorized accounts and adequate inventory levels of all authorized products Prospect and establish new retail, wholesale and corporate accounts Ensure the successful execution of promotional activity at retail level by communicating and coordinating promotional programs with our retailers and distributors Constantly visit the market to identify opportunities for growth and improvement of our product sales and retail execution Work closely as a team with all sales and administrative associates  Qualifications At least 6 years of progressive Salty Sancks sales experience Supervisory experience required Excellent communication and customer retention skills Able to execute and follow through on sales initiatives and plans Hands-on individual, self-starter, driven and willing to work hard to achieve goals  Benefits Competitive salary Medical Insurance Paid Vacation Growing, fast paced, demanding environment.

Brief Description  The Director of Sales, Multi - Family will be positioned as the expert and leader in driving success in the segment, defining as well as executing on the strategic plan. The primary responsibility of this position is driving new sales with a focused target list of developer/owners, where the candidate will have a robust book of relationships in the segment to cultivate. In addition, establishing strong relationships with influential industry professionals to further develop and position Cambria in the construction of the Multi - Family industry segment. Cross-functional collaboration throughout the organization will be a must to develop appropriate messaging and deliverables that will resonate with the industry.  This role will collaborate with field sales, Corporate Sales, and support Corporate Sales Account Representatives to identify and cultivate direct business opportunities. The Director of Sales, Multi - Family will work with, influence, and educate other Cambria commercial representatives to help drive specifications and further penetrate the category. This position may reside anywhere in the United States and will work out of a home office. Roles & Responsibilities Demonstrate an in-depth understanding of the industry including but not limited to market size, sub-segments, selling process, competition, trends, appropriate certifications, regulatory forces and issues Work with Corporate Sales and VP, Corporate Partnership to refine national strategy and plan Drive sales growth and achieve specification and sales activity goals Be the subject matter expert in strategic account cultivation; collaborate, guide, and support Corporate Sales & Corporate Partnership teams to enable sales growth within the segment Research and profile key prospect lists and cultivate professional selling relationships including but limited to: Multi - Family organizations and facility managers, OEM‚Äôs, and provide support to commercial Market Representatives to cultivate the architectural and design community that support the segment and occasionally general contractors, millwork/casework companies Build effective relationships with C-suite business partners and effectively develop and negotiate contracts Provide excellent sales support to both internal and external parties and maintain accurate, thorough records of sales activities within CRM system Advise, train, guide, and collaborate with Cambria marketing teams, inside sales (Nerve Center,) business and product development, channel partners, market representatives and district managers through efforts in this segment Identify the needs of the segment and how to support the channel players appropriately to drive success. Become actively involved in industry associations and identify/participate in national Multi - Family design trade shows to increasing brand awareness and networking Requirements Strong business knowledge and financial acumen Excellent critical thinking, organizational and timely follow up skills that reflects in calendar management and CRM updates Strong sales skills with a proven track record of being customer-focused Ability to build strong professional relationships with internal and external parties Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Influential skills to gain support and inspire others Entrepreneurial, self-motivated with the ability to work independently from home office Demonstrates professionalism, integrity, and fiscal responsibility Ability to work extended and varying hours as needed Minimum Requirements  Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree Required  Experience: 7+ years‚Äô experience in Multi - Family industry sales required, previous leadership experience or sales management preferred  Systems: Google Suites, Microsoft Suites and Salesforce  Additional Requirements  Travel Requirements: This position will require 40-60% travel and is dictated by several factors including relationship book, ability to effectively build relationships and sell via zoom/in person.  Physical Requirements: Have the ability to lift up to 50 pounds, set up and tear down marketing materials.  Cambria offers a competitive benefits package that encompasses Health and Dental Insurance, Paid Time Off, 401(k) plus matching, Discretionary Profit Sharing, Flexible Spending Account, Life, Supplemental Life, and Disability Insurance, Referral Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Employee Discount and Professional Development Assistance.  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  For Additional Company Information, Please Visit Www.CambriaUSA.com  We are an equal opportunity employer.  M/W/VET/DISABLED The salary range associated with this job posting has not been provided by Cambria.
