description: We're Hiring!  Sales Director Position  SharkByte Tech specializes in visibility and security solutions and services that encompass the Network, Applications, Infrastructure, and especially the cloud. We act as trusted advisors to a global ecosystem of 200+ service providers and over 300 expert engineers. We can bring you new technologies & services that are disrupting the industry with a combination of capabilities that no one company can offer on their own.  Every environment is different, we take an agnostic approach to help you compare the best of breed solutions in each of our areas of focus.  Our mission: To lower the technical, operational, and financial barriers for companies needing to manage risk, protect critical data, and demonstrate compliance while improving their visibility into applications and networks. Headquartered in San Jose, California, USA  We are looking for experience IT solution sales professionals who have a great network of contacts and have proven sales history in your market. We want people who can be quickly trained in our system to be a trusted advisor and utilize the presales technical resources we have assembled and hit the ground running. Competitive compensation and benefits package based on experience.  Responsibilities  Sales Directors are responsible for coordinating resources and managing the sales campaign across the entire opportunity pipeline.  ‚Ä¢ Managing a complex, long term solution sale from prospecting through closing. ‚Ä¢ Understand the buyer‚Äôs purchase requirements and align sales tools and resources to that journey and timeline. ‚Ä¢ Develop Budgetary/ROI quotes and final proposals for delivery to customers and prospects. ‚Ä¢ Interface with ecosystem partners in support of new business development. ‚Ä¢ Develop RFP responses for delivery to customers and prospects. ‚Ä¢ Enter customer and prospect information, sales process updates and forecast information into Salesforce. ‚Ä¢ Understand all levels of pipeline management metrics with a focus on forecast accuracy. ‚Ä¢ Attend regional and national industry events as required. ‚Ä¢ Coordinate with sales support, operations, finance and administration personnel to execute responsibilities. ‚Ä¢ Manage all aspects of the company‚Äôs sales efforts within the territory Qualifications ‚Ä¢ 5+ years in direct IT solutions selling experience ‚Ä¢ Bring a great network of local contacts ‚Ä¢ Experience in managing all aspects of the sales process ‚Ä¢ Ability to effectively interface with C level executives ‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‚Ä¢ Experience with CRM systems ‚Ä¢ Excellent objection handling and negotiating abilities ‚Ä¢ Strong collaboration skills and ability to work alongside multiple team members ‚Ä¢ Proven record of meeting/exceeding established goals ‚Ä¢ Ability to multi-task and manage multiple streams of work simultaneously ‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate and present to SharkByte Tech management as required  Please email info@sharkbytetech.com if interested.

Funko Overview   Welcome to the Funko-verse, a world built on pure imagination, a land governed by the philosophy that stories matter, a universe comprised of characters from countless fandoms, a galaxy of once upon a times and happily ever afters.   But what does Funko do?   Funko is a purveyor of pop culture, making and selling license-focused collectibles. We‚Äôre based in Everett, WA where we have a store that delights kids of all ages (kids at heart included). We currently hold hundreds of licenses for franchises ranging from Marvel to Harry Potter, giving us the rights to create tens of thousands of characters‚Äîone of the largest portfolios in the pop culture and collectibles industry. We take your favorite characters and turn them into adorable, or sometimes scary, collectible figures. Our most famous line, Pop! Vinyl, has millions of fans around the world.   The Director, LATAM Sales will manage a team of individual sellers to grow and expand our International Market for Latin America. This position is based in Miami, FL reporting to the Sr. Director, International Sales and will oversee operational distribution for key retail partners, coordinate marketing efforts, product launches and sales promotions with assigned retail partners to achieve sales and profit objectives. Our environment is very fast-paced, and requires someone who is highly enthusiastic, flexible, detail-oriented, analytical, and comfortable working with multiple teams in a very ambiguous area.  What You‚Äôll Do  Own the regional selling strategies; in collaboration with Territory Sales Managers to develop a strategy, plan, and follow-up to execute region-specific activity to grow sales and orders to outpace the market growth rate. Travels with direct reports for skills assessment, mentoring, personal development, and training; and to remain current on customer issues. This position will be expected to grow revenue in all accounts annually by ensuring that all opportunities are being explored and sales staff are regularly educating clients on upcoming product releases Builds Retail Strategies/Programs with clients - builds in store programs, works with Product Development on exclusives and new product lines Create and gives presentations to customers on business reviews and updated product lines Understands Planning process to drive customer focused sales and build healthy product mix Manages customer profitability to align with KPIs Analyzes POS and industry trends to suggest products to client What You‚Äôll Bring  8 years‚Äô experience in a sales role successfully meeting and beating goals, preferably in the consumer products industry 3 years managing a sales staff, involving setting expectations, communicating expectations, training and motivating staff to meet their greatest potential Proven experience expanding International Markets Bilingual in Spanish or Portuguese A breadth of knowledge of collectible, toy and hardline products and trends Out of the box thinker; creative and strategic mindset Proven experience in leading and facilitating strategic conversations at C-level Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while maintaining attention to details Excellent presentation and communication skills Highly organized and efficient time management skills Ability to travel up to 40% and able to travel without much notice Experience with ERP or CRM systems preferred (Oracle) Proficiency with MS Office Suite Work Environment  Work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment. Moderate physical activity required. This position will routinely have to move, and lift up to 10 pounds and on an occasional basis lift up to 25 pounds.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

description: Why work at TRAFFIX?   You must work at TRAFFIX to enjoy our:  Culture of Respect, Expertise, Collaboration and Entrepreneurship  Get involved with our Book Club, join one of our Steering Committees, or sign up for one of our employee events such as Game Night, Cooking Classes, and more!  Work with a team that Supports and Respects each other at a company where Diversity & Inclusion is a Celebrated!  Flexible work environment that will allow you to work remotely part of the time! If you have ideas that you wish someone would listen to - tell us! We love the Entrepreneurial spirit, and we strive for Continuous Improvement!  Get involved with your community through our partnership with Big Brothers Big Sisters  Enjoy Self Improvement opportunities through our Learning Management System and TRAFFIX Academy; or take advantage of our Tuition Reimbursement Program  And of course - get paid fairly for your Experience with included Benefits!   Sound good? Keep reading and APPLY TODAY!   What is a Director of Sales?  As Director of Sales at TRAFFIX Chicago you will play a vital role in the achievement of branch targets. Using the player/coach leadership model, you will assess each salesperson‚Äôs strengths and areas for improvement to design a strategy that sets them up for success.  You will be the motivating force that drives your team to win.    What does a day in the life of a Director of Sales look like?   A day in the life of a TRAFFIX Director of Sales could include some or all of the following:  Building and maintaining customer relationships  Identifying further business opportunities to expand TRAFFIX business with the branch‚Äôs clients  Monitoring trends and changes in customer purchase behavior and following up to determine the root cause  Proactively identifying potential problems and resolving them before they escalate   Accompanying members of the sales team on discovery calls and in-person meetings  Assist your team with generating pricing strategies that fit the client‚Äôs budget while supporting the success of the branch  Monitor trends in the sales team‚Äôs performance  Recruit and onboard new sales staff as needed while always keeping your pipeline of top talent warm  Develop and promote monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets for each member of the sales team  Using TRAFFIX business intelligence software, you will generate reports, develop sales strategies and targets to present to the Branch Director(s)   Who are you?   After at least five years working in a Director of Sales role, you have become an expert multi-tasker, active listener, and excellent communicator with a friendly and confident personality. You love getting to know people and building lasting relationships. You display empathy when dealing with client challenges and use emotional intelligence to guide your interactions.  You are a compassionate leader that trusts your team to work hard without being micromanaged; however, you are ready to step in when one of your reports is struggling.   Strategy is your passion! You love the challenge of getting to know the players on your team and leveraging their strengths to win! Collaborating with your sales reps, you devise plans that knock down obstacles, win RFPs, and close business.   When a problem comes your way ‚Äì you face it head on. You look for creative ways to solve the problem and understand that mistakes should be considered opportunities to learn and grow.  You love sales! Hunting for new business and delighting customers is your team‚Äôs top priority and you will go above and beyond to support them in those efforts.    Does all this sound good?   APPLY TODAY to start your new career with TRAFFIX! Set up roots with a team you can depend on and have fun working with!   www.traffix.com/careers

description: Sr. Director Sales Excellence Leader, Atlanta, GA  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who  make the things that make the future.  That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even  making it possible to breathe on Mars.  Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  The Sr. Director Sales Excellence Leader is responsible for driving the continuous improvement of the Fire & Security team selling capabilities with focus on optimizing processes, tools, training, compensation and talent management that collectively drive sustainable organic growth.  Working cross-functionally with the business unit leaders, the Sr. Director Sales Excellence Leader will leverage their expertise to ensure the strategic growth initiatives are translated into actionable sales plans and quotas backed with best in class sales operations. This commercial leader has a passion for leveraging analytics and technology to drive actionable insights to increase seller productivity and measurably improve on sellers‚Äô performance.  Ensures sales teams are armed with value propositions and tools to sell value. This includes partnering with other members of the Sales Excellence leadership team to develop comprehensive and automated sales performance management, training, onboarding, and incentive programs to increase lead conversations, successfully launch new products, penetrate new markets and increase growth in core markets.  Key Responsibilities  Develop and implement a rigorous sales operating cadence and playbook on all the critical sales processes, including strategy deployment, performance management, recruitment, onboarding, training, coaching and technology enablers.  Routine assessment of the salesforce‚Äôs capabilities, coverage, pipeline and maturity gap analysis.  Leverage and provide inputs to evolve the analytical dashboards and business insights that inform leadership at multiple levels on how to drive sales performance, gain new accounts and expand existing customer pocket share.  Ensure the sales incentive plan (SIP) and quota setting program are executed in the Fire & Security business.  Talent development and performance management review for the Electrical Products global sales force.  Pipeline and lead-to-revenue management to drive faster sales velocity and higher win rates.  Leverage a progressive roadmap of sales enablement technologies including CRM (NEX) to deliver actionable customer insights and seller productivity benefits.  Routinely inspect, validate and coach on the impact and effectiveness of the sales leadership to manage their teams, achieve their plans and develop future leadership talent.  YOU MUST HAVE  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, marketing, or other related field.  10+ years combined experience in business or Sales/Commercial, Sales Operations and/or Marketing Leadership roles with increasing responsibility within a B2B environment.  WE VALUE  Master‚Äôs degree preferred.  Experience leading global projects in a matrixed environment.  Sales Leadership, Sales Operations And/or Marketing Leadership Experience, Preferred.  Knowledge of Lean Processes or Six Sigma preferred.  Track record of success with cross functional teams, driving change and implementing new processes that significantly improve sales effectiveness.  Effective written & oral communication skills.  Experience in working in a matrix environment, as well as managing multiple priorities.  Success in managing multiple, complex projects and changing priorities, making sound decisions and working effectively in matrix environment.  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD139371 Category: Sales Support Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: About Us  At Zip, previously Quadpay, we provide fair and seamless solutions that simplify how people pay with our leading Buy Now, Pay Later platform.  Focused on product innovation that puts people at the centre, we‚Äôre here to do things differently. We are a responsible, digital alternative to the broken credit card model, providing consumers with a better way to manage their finances. We also help merchants and businesses to grow by offering them best‚Äìin‚Äìclass products that improve conversion, increase basket sizes and delight their customers.  We‚Äôre a high-growth team with endless opportunities as we scale. Come and join the ZipFam!  As VP, Business Development/Enterprise Sales at Zip, you will drive the growth of the company by evangelizing our payment alternative to the biggest of the big. Think Apple, Amazon, etc. You are a born hunter of strategic, complex deals, passionate about joining a growing team. You have experience building relationships and presenting to C-Suite executives, key decision makers and have a history of closing game-changing deals with Global Brands!  We are looking for individuals who thrive in a competitive environment, enjoy taking on new challenges, and are excited to drive new business in the fast-growing Buy Now, Pay Later space!  What does your day look like? As a key part of our Enterprise Sales team, you will lead the development and implementation of the growth and sales strategy of Global 500 Brands Manage full-cycle business opportunities from lead generation through to closing the deal Research and document industry insights across key verticals in order to share what you know with the team Develop and manage strong relationships with the Zip Enterprise and Strategic Account market segment by looking for and gathering opportunities to add value for our merchant partners and our customers Forecast sales activity and revenue achievements, as well as researching relevant targets to develop lead lists and identify new sales opportunities Approach challenges with creativity and a positive attitude Contribute fully to help develop and sustain our thriving company culture, own it, and help us change the game Constantly find ways to raise the bar in everything we do To Help Us Level Up, You'll Ideally Have Min 10+ years digital, payments or technology sales experience with 8+ years experience selling into Enterprise-level accounts $1B in annual sales and bigger. Highly networked across retail and e-commerce enterprise customers in the US at an executive level Track record of success in quota achievement and closing Fortune 500 deals Strategic, persistent with an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to be part of a fast-growth start-up environment Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles- demonstrated ownership of all aspects of your pipeline You are or have brought innovative/market defining products to market Experience of working within a start-up / scale-up, ideally in Fintech or Payments or similar emerging-category business will be a huge advantage We‚Äôre proud to be a values-led business. Our values form our Mamba mentality - how we‚Äôre better today than yesterday, and are used to create game-changing experiences for our customers and fellow Zipsters.  If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay. We value a diverse range of backgrounds and ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.  We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, or anything else.  What‚Äôs in it for you?  We offer a variety of perks and benefits to support you at both work and home. Here‚Äôs a taste of what you can expect! Flexible working culture Share incentive programs 20 days PTO every year Generous paid parental leave Leading family support policies 100% employer covered insurance Beautiful Midtown office with a casual dress code Learning and wellness subscription stipend Company-sponsored 401k match Remote working allowance Join us on our mission to be the first payment choice, everywhere and every day.

description: About Prove  Prove is the modern platform for continuous identity authentication and is used by over 1,000 enterprises and 500 financial institutions including 9 of the top 10 U.S. banks. Prove's cloud solutions and mobile intelligence -driven APIs can be easily orchestrated to increase Approve Rates to over 90%, enabling companies to authenticate customer identities accurately, effortlessly, and privately, while mitigating fraud. Prove's solutions are available in 195 countries. For the latest updates from Prove, follow us on LinkedIn.  As we continue to scale our company, we are looking for people who know how to make an impact. We're talking self-starting professionals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, process information quickly and make intelligent decisions. The work is challenging and requires not only smarts, but natural curiosity and tenacity. Teamwork is also important to us ‚Äì we work together and play together.  Prove has big plans; we're excited and optimistic about the future. If this sounds like a career for you ‚Äì come check us out.  Are you a motivated hunter who enjoys winning the sale through relationship building and creative solution development? Prove is looking for senior enterprise sellers with a proven track record of consultative sales in the US/LATAM, the ability to negotiate multi-year,multi-milion dollar ACV's and a customer first attitude. We are building out a world class team focused on an industry leading culture, obsessed customer experience and being the global leader in Identity.  What You Are Accountable For Become a trusted partner selling Prove strategic solutions in the US/LATAM that meet/exceed the business needs of the client/prospect Executes GTM strategy in the US and partners in GTM strategy and execution selling Prove solutions in LATAM Routinely meet or exceed sales quotas: ACV bookings and in year revenue Build and maintain relationships with enterprises level clients, understanding the organization's strategic initiatives in digital identity and authentication Develop a deep knowledge of how Prove solutions meet the client/prospect's use case Independently build and manage your direct sales pipeline in assigned accounts and/or a geographic region Develop a deep knowledge of the prospect's organizational structure and buying process Conduct discovery sessions to clearly understand the prospect's business needs, priorities, budget, timing and key KPIs Prepare prospect proposals, negotiate business terms and manage the overall contractual process Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and set realistic external expectations Utilize internal resources efficiently and effectively to drive the sales process with clear thought leadership Promote, maintain and enhance our cultural values of humility, passion, inclusion and leadership Assist in achieving our corporate objectives on brand NPS, customer pass-rates and NPS, platform resilience, data privacy and platform and data security Keep the company informed on market intelligence regarding the global identity verification and authentication markets Strong passion for learning our products and markets through in-house and external training  What We Require 5+ years of quota-carrying experience selling complex SaaS based solutions with a strong track record of closing enterprise-level deals over $250k in ACV/ARR in the US/LATAM Fluent in English, Spanish and Portuguese Sales hunter mentality and an entrepreneurial spirit Strong history of quota attainment description: Job Description Summary  In your role as the Strategic Development Leader, X-ray, you will be responsible for driving growth in our largest and most strategic accounts, such as GPO partnerships, government accounts, national accounts and channel partners.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities    Originating sales by positioning GE technology and identifying the best technical and commercial solution. Promote the business value proposition of GE technology. Works in close cooperation with regional sales, account sales and commercial proposal staff. Primary technical role involved in DTI (demand to inquiry): aim at increasing market penetration through technical support during pre-ITO. Developing specialized knowledge of latest commercial developments in own area and communication skills to influence others. Has working knowledge of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses judgment to make decisions or solve moderately complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Takes new perspective on existing solutions. Uses technical experience and expertise for data analysis to support recommendations. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.  Required Qualifications    Master's degree from an accredited university or college OR High school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience. Must be able to travel up to 75% of the time.  Desired Characteristics    Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to lead programs / projects. Established project management skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: This is an individual contributor role. This is a pure hunting role.  Key Responsibilities ‚ñ∫    Serve as a respected business development leader, able to open doors, influence and manage complex client relationships at scale. ‚ñ∫    Orchestrate and manage strong sales discipline, be on top of pipeline management and be rigorous and disciplined around the forecasting process. ‚ñ∫    Be perceived as a strong ‚Äúplayer-coach‚Äù for Astreya‚Äôs capability and solutioning teams, partnering with them on developing relevant, bespoke and strategic solutions and delivery capabilities with their clients. ‚ñ∫    Be a strong external-facing client-services leader, oriented towards ‚Äúmaking the news and not just reporting the news‚Äù. ‚ñ∫    As relevant, build and expand relationships with Industry Advisors, Industry Analysts and other similar influencers in helping communicate Astreya‚Äôs value propositions and differentiations targeted to the technology services market. ‚ñ∫    Be part of the broader leadership team in attract and retaining top talent ‚Äì be a ‚Äútalent-magnet‚Äù into Astreya as a whole. ‚ñ∫    Be an enabler and a supporter of other business units; and be vested in the success of other teams, besides their own ‚Äì for the broader benefit of Astreya.  Pivotal Experience and Expertise ‚ñ∫    Domain Knowledge: Ideally a deep vertical / domain focus on the High-Tech, Financial Services and Healthcare/LifeSciences  space. The individual will demonstrate and understanding of their client‚Äôs target industry dynamics. This is critical since digital transformation is a major theme across these industry segments and the leader‚Äôs domain credibility and knowledge will be a critical aspect of the individual‚Äôs ability to open doors and build the relationships that Astreya desires. ‚ñ∫    Relationship Builder: History of leading customer relationships and the ability to foster new client relationships. Seen as a credible partner to senior leaders around; and demonstrated abilities to build key internal relationships to advance cross- selling, upselling efforts in a collaborative and inclusive way. The individual will bring a well assessed capability of influencing without authority. ‚ñ∫    People Management: Proven ability to attract high quality talent (strong followership). Experience mentoring and managing individuals towards a positive high-performance culture. Thoughtful when it comes to resource management and decisive with necessary workforce initiatives to achieve efficiency and growth objectives.  Personal and Leadership Attributes ‚ñ∫    The successful candidate must be a high-energy, intellectually curious, assertive, and hands-on leader who is able to motivate with a vision for success and a dedication to customer satisfaction. S/he must have a passion for, and focus on, innovation and an exceptionally unwavering focus on achieving client delight. This executive will know how to leverage core competencies, drive efficiencies, and develop strategic relationships to achieve stated objectives. Furthermore, s/he will possess strong team skills and the highest integrity and be smart, low maintenance, non-political, and detail-oriented.

description: Month2Month is seeking a Business Development leader to develop partnerships with scalable sources of tenant demand, including relocation specialists and insurance companies. Partnerships are a key source of demand and they require constant nurturing to maximize efficacy.   Responsibilities (not limited to) Develop and manage relationships with key demand drive partners, including relocation specialists and insurance companies Negotiate partner contracts Nurture lead generation from partners Partner with Head of Marketing to ensure a smooth process of lead generation to the tenant sales team Explore new demand drive partnerships, including local and regional ones  Job Requirements 3-7 years of business development and/or sales experience  8 years of corporate housing/hotel/vacation rental industry experience is preferred Undergrad degree required with preference for candidates with relevant graduate degree Startup experience a big plus Real estate tech or experience at a world-class hospitality company is a big plus Experience at a high growth company and a role helping the company scale is a big plus  Remuneration Package Annual Salary: $75,000-$110,000 Equity: 0.25%-0.3% vesting over 4 years  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative, but not exclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

ABOUT ITEMIZE  Itemize is a leading AI company that transforms financial documents into valuable and efficient information sets for business systems. We harness AI to transform unstructured and semi-structured data in purchase documents, such as invoices and receipts, into structured data for accounts payable and accounting systems. Our intelligent document processing technology empowers financial teams to focus on higher-value activities by liberating them from laborious and costly data entry and reconciliation tasks, which remain manual processes. Itemize operations are cloud-based, with a fully remote team distributed nationwide. The company runs on an East Coast schedule. We welcome people who enjoy the challenge of a fast-paced high-growth environment on the leading edge of B2B enterprise technology.   ABOUT THE ROLE Itemize is looking for an exceptional and tenacious Sales Executive with a track record of success in the B2B enterprise software space. In this role, you will be on the front lines of a growing FinTech business. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a passion for developing and expanding client relationships, and possess the ability to create new opportunities and close them. As a member of our growing team, you will have a unique opportunity to make an immediate impact, closing deals that drive the business forward.  The Sales Executive will be responsible to:  Own the entire sales cycle: lead gen to contract signing and beyond Drive sales, aggressively expand the sales funnel and generate new revenue  Contact potential prospects from personally generated research to build a robust sales pipeline  Engage with prospects to understand their unique and specific pain points and produce compelling business cases to meet their needs  Lead client presentations to C-level executives, including information discovery sessions, product demonstrations, and proposals  Build and maintain strong relationships with executives at Enterprise and Mid-market businesses Represent Itemize while engaging prospects to understand needs and challenges while generating new feature functionality ideas for Itemize products  Collaborate with marketing, product, and service delivery teams to ensure that client voices are heard, creating an eco-system of solutions to enable rapid client success  REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  7+ years‚Äô experience independently negotiating and closing deals in B2B enterprise technology Strong familiarity with enterprise technology sales and data platforms Ability to understand complex technical requirements and sell solutions across multiple products Industry knowledge of FinTech and B2B accounting/AP systems Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to speak fluently to senior executives, salespeople, and product managers Motivated team player who consistently strives to exceed goals and push revenue expectations Excited about the opportunity to participate in a high-growth FinTech  WHAT WE OFFER High energy atmosphere of an AI-driven FinTech scaleup that has great traction towards global success and already serves clients across four continents, including Fortune 500 companies. And we are just getting started! We value education and professional development and offer opportunities for our employees to grow and learn in their roles and within the industry Enjoyable working environment: A diverse international team of techies, dog lovers, globetrotters, and musicians. We offer flexible PTO and a generous benefits package, and highly value independence. Our team enjoys spending time together with fun virtual activities and we look forward to re-establishing face-to-face events soon!  Itemize is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Itemize does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by applicable law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
industries: Computer Software

description: Director of Healthcare Sales - Enterprise (Job ID# 22578) Consensus' Director of Healthcare Sales will manage a team of Healthcare Business Executives that sell exclusively into the Healthcare vertical (pharma, payer, provider, manufacturer, etc.). Your team will sell the entire Consensus portfolio, including Consensus Clarity, Harmony, Signal, JSign, eFax and our suite of Universal APIs,; as well as any and all additional products and solutions (Salesforce connector, Epic integration, etc.) relevant to this customer and market segment. This position reports to the Chief Revenue Officer, Enterprise.    Key Attributes: We are looking for a proven sales leader with great energy and initiative to drive team performance and sales for our Enterprise team. You will formulate and execute a strategy to maximize business growth. This role works in partnership with Sales, Marketing, Pre-Sales, Partner Alliances and Channel. Cross company engagement and orchestration is essential. The candidate will be a high impact individual capable of driving outstanding business results and first-class employee development. The Sales Leader is fully responsible for developing and managing the team to generate revenue and achieve individual team and organizational quotas. Aligning to the sales strategy, the Sales Leader defines and implements plans for the assigned accounts to achieve sales objectives and for the team to consistently maintain a strong and viable pipeline of new prospects and opportunities. It is a plus if the candidate has experience in document workflow, EHRs and intelligent data extraction and other services tied to improving patient care and outcomes.  Job Duties: ¬∑        Create and execute a multi-year business development strategy and build a high performance team by hiring, developing and retaining strong talent. ¬∑        Share in client, practice and performance management including project team management and the development of our team. ¬∑        Assist in developing new accounts, manage your team's pipeline. ¬∑        Provide support for the Enterprise business planning process and training by working closely with all units and all levels of management. ¬∑        Assist in providing strategic direction based on market requirements as well as compliance and regulatory conditions that govern our clients and specific verticals. ¬∑        Develop strong business relationships with both senior management and day-to-day contacts at established and newly developed vendors, customers and prospects.  The team you lead at Consensus Cloud Solutions will directly impact the growth of our overall organization. You will be masterful in client engagement and impact how your customers do business in an ever-changing environment. You will coach your team to develop in their careers, and inspire your team to do the best work of their life by: ¬∑        Providing support and guidance to direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings or engaging other corporate resources as required. ¬∑        Developing a winning team, including recruiting, hiring and training. ¬∑        Coaching direct reports on strategies to drive sales wins. ¬∑        Accurately reporting on sales activity and forecasting to senior Sales management. ¬∑        Consistently monitoring the sales activity of the team, and tracking of results. ¬∑        Actively leading and monitoring demand generation activities. ¬∑        Leading initiatives to drive customer awareness and engagement. ¬∑        Developing and executing successful sales campaigns. ¬∑        Engaging at C level in enterprise customer organizations. ¬∑        Successfully managing significant client escalations and issues. ¬∑        Developing required Corporate relationships and Executive engagement to support success.  Job Requirements and Experience: The years of experience and skill set needed to be successful will vary from 5+ yrs of sales leadership experience managing a team of six or more quota carrying sales people in the field of Healthcare sales. In addition, a bachelor's degree is preferred. ¬∑         Proven successful experience in leading a team of Enterprise Account Executives in the field of Healthcare / Healthcare IT. ¬∑         Proven ability to create high performing teams and lead them to success. ¬∑         Excellent presentation, negotiation and executive engagement skills. ¬∑        Resourceful with a strong drive for results. ¬∑        Consultative selling experience. ¬∑        Strong business acumen. ¬∑        A self-starter that can thrive in a fast paced environment. ¬∑        Extremely well-versed in the modern healthcare challenges and technology landscape. ¬∑        Experience with EMR/EHR, ERP and CRM systems preferred. ¬∑        Able to travel up to 50% of the time.

description: Serves customers by selling products and meeting customer needs.  Services existing accounts, obtains orders, and establishes new accounts by planning and organizing daily work schedule to call on existing or potential sales outlets and other trade factors.  Adjusts content of sales presentations by studying the type of sales outlet or trade factor.  Focuses sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume of dealers.  Submits orders by referring to price lists and product literature.  Keeps management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analyses.  Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, and merchandising techniques.  Recommends changes in products, service, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments.  Resolves customer complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports, and making recommendations to management.  Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies. Provides historical records by maintaining records on area and customer sales.  Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

assigned appliance customers are being met Researches and evaluates innovative techniques and client feedback to push the company to new heights What Is Expected Of You 10+ years of successful manufacturer Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence effectively at all levels of an organization Strong business sense and willingness to be an industry expert Innovative thinker description: Role  AppraisalTek is a fast-growing nationwide appraisal management company, committed to the needs of our clients and team members. Our vision focuses on our team members, we want their family members and friends wanting to work with AppraisalTek. To support this, we are looking for an excellent leader to assist our growth in innovation and other products at a National level.  Essential Functions & Responsibilities  Prospect and qualify new sales leads  Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospect  Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects and customers  Meet and/or exceed quotas  Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort  Understand the competitive landscape and market trends.  Understand and effectively communicate the company's value prop, tech, process and current partnerships.  Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies; analyzing trends and results.  Establish sales objectives by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for regions and territories; projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products.  Maintain sales volume, product mix and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors.  Desire to own projects and exceed expectations, with ability to find solutions and deliver results within a rapidly changing, entrepreneurial, technology-driven culture.  Ability to identify and solve client issues strategically.  Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with management and cross-functional teams, for both technical and non-technical audiences. Must be able to read, examine, and organize documents.  May require the ability to, stand, and walk around for extended periods of time.  May also require the ability to lift up to 25 pounds.  Location  Remote or Chandler, AZ Location.  Time Type  Full time- salary plus commission  Benefit Package Includes Health Care Insurance (HSA Plan) (PPO Plan) Disability Insurance Life Insurance- employer paid $25,000 life insurance coverage Retirement 401(k) Paid Time Off (0-35 mo= 60hours), (36-71 mo=100 hours), (72+ mo=140 hours) Paid Sick Time (Full time 40 hours year) Holiday Pay (11 days) Paid Volunteer Time (Full time 30 hours year) Our appraisal management company provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and to administer all aspects and conditions of employment without regard to the following: Race, National Origin, Color, Disability, Age, Sex, Gender, Religion, Pregnancy, Genetic information, including family medical history, Physical or mental disability, any other protected class, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. description: About Sensei Ag  Sensei Ag is a market-changing AgTech company aiming to solve global gaps and inconsistencies in nutrition, food safety, and food security through the transformative power of data. Guided by the capabilities and insights of our founders, technology entrepreneur Larry Ellison and Dr. David Agus, we design, develop and deploy cutting-edge agricultural technologies to build a better, more stable food supply that is capable of feeding our entire world nutritionally-relevant, delicious, affordable meals.  Everything we do is evidence-led, radically transparent, always enriching.  Learn more from our website or by following us on LinkedIn. If you'd like to see what we are doing with our consumer-facing brand Sensei Farms, please check our Instagram!  Position Description  We are looking for a Director of Sales, East‚ÄØ to develop and manage Sensei Farms products in the Eastern US and Canada. This senior sales executive‚ÄØ is responsible for sales of all Sensei produce in the eastern halves of Canada and US. This role will support the cultivation of new and long-term valued business relationships with customers. The Director of Sales, East ‚ÄØwill have a proven history of success in the retail grocery, convenience store, restaurant/food service and wholesale produce business. The Director owns the entire sales process and represents Sensei to the customer and advocates for the customer inside Sensei. They will train, develop, direct and set accountabilities for all members of the sales team and maintain positive business relationships with the production team  Responsibilities Responsible for managing all sales of Sensei Farms products in the eastern US and Canada Meet or exceed revenue expectations and objectives Manage sales account managers Collaborate with Farm Operations and Marketing to create an effective and smooth go-to-market-strategy Collaborate and take the lead on trade marketing promotions, including advertising, temporary price promotions, and retail-driven consumer promotions. Work with the farm team in Leamington, ON, to develop a crop plan to meet the needs of the markets and ensure that all produce is sold Train, set goals and accountabilities with Account Managers ‚Äì Give them all the tools they need to succeed Develop a plan with a list of target accounts and identify decision-makers Gain engagement and business from the key accounts and ensure that the Account Manager is working their assigned accounts Be Entrepreneurial in solving problems by acting outside the regular routine when the situation arises Make calls jointly with the Account Manager to assist in the sale and use as training Maintain and develop business plans for new customer outreach Cultivate and nurture existing clients to ensure satisfaction and initiate deeper engagement Identify, qualify, pursue and close new opportunities for self and Account Manager Make decisions, negotiate, and close sales ‚Äì at all levels of the retail spectrum Develop proposals, quotes, and customer contracts Hire, direct and supervise sales administration personnel Follow up with internal support team and management promptly Establishes and maintains clear and consistent lines of communication with internal departments relative to customer successes, customer opportunities, new customer development, and company needs  Requirements Located in Eastern United States or Canada Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated success in outside sales/business development in the produce or related business Sales Management experience with remote sales team member Proven sales experience and history of substantial growth in a fast-paced environment Familiarity with grocery, convenience store, restaurant/foodservice, and wholesale channels Produce sales experienced a plus Understands and contributes to advancing Sensei goals, including a cultural fit Working knowledge of business office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Working knowledge of CRM (Salesforce, Hub Spot)  Traits We Value Appreciation for transforming health and the future of food Smart, not arrogant Humble and hardworking Entrepreneurial, not risk averse Kind and genuine Grit and lots of it  Compensation & Benefits Competitive salary Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance 401k and FSA plans Cell phone bill reimbursement Flexible PTO, vacation days and paid holidays As a condition of employment with Sensei Ag, we require all US-based employees be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. The only exception would be if a valid medical or sincerely held religious belief accommodation is approved.

description: Who We Are  We believe a workplace food program is something employees should love and look forward to every day. Powered by technology and a network of over 1,000 restaurants, Fooda feeds hungry people at work through our ongoing food programs located within companies and office buildings. Every day, each Fooda location is served by different restaurants that come onsite and serve fresh lunch from their chef‚Äôs unique menus. Fooda operates in seventeen major US cities and plans for continued expansion.  Location:  Based in our Chicago headquarters, Fooda is looking for a Director of Sales to support our growing national presence and lead the sales and operations for one of our largest markets.  Position Overview  As the Director of Sales for Fooda Chicago, you will oversee the corporate sales, restaurant sales and account management functions by managing one of Fooda‚Äôs largest teams of sales and operations employees in our company headquarters as well as manage any new account implementations within the Chicago market.  Serving as one of the leaders of the Fooda Chicago Market, your core responsibility in this role is focused on generating and promoting a culture that is focused on continued growth for the Chicago market across all of Fooda‚Äôs products and service offerings.  What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For Work with the senior management team to implement Fooda‚Äôs messaging and sales processes in your market Be accountable for achieving ‚ÄúChicago‚Äù market gross profit and presenting a corporate sales rep budget for approval Take ownership and work in collaboration with your direct reports for large sales opportunities from initial meeting to closing, including the ability to present and negotiate contracts Recruit, train, manage and motivate sales and operations employees to ensure needed results are being met Adapt and implement Fooda‚Äôs current lead generation process and training program Collaborate with all levels and departments in a positive and successful manner Who You Are Previous experience in a sales leadership position with at least four years of experience managing a staff of ten or more Proven track record of meeting both a team and individual quota Previous experience as a Business Development/Sales Representative Successful track record of managing a P&L Start-up environment experience a plus. Effective written and verbal communication skills to interact with internal and external team members What We'll Hook You Up With Competitive market salary, bonus based on market performance, and stock options based on experience Comprehensive health, dental and vision plans Company Issued Laptop Parental Leave Options Unlimited PTO policy Flexible spending accounts 401k matching Free food and beverages in the office A fulfilling, challenging adventure of a work experience Fooda provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Fooda complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

description: SoFi Stadium, the new home of the Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers, is located at Hollywood Park, a 298-acre sports and entertainment destination being developed by Los Angeles Rams Owner/Chairman E. Stanley Kroenke in Inglewood, California. The 3.1 million square-foot SoFi Stadium is the largest stadium in the NFL, as well as the Ô¨Årst indoor outdoor stadium. It seats approximately 70,000, expandable up to 100,000, with more than 260 luxury suites and more than 13,000 premium seats. SoFi Stadium has already secured Super Bowl LVI in 2022, the College Football National Championship Game in 2023, and the Opening and Closing Ceremonies of the Olympic Games in 2028.  SUMMARY:  Hollywood Park & SoFi Stadium is seeking a Director of Global Partnership Development to support the Vice President, Global Partnerships while collaborating with all key stakeholders across the organization.  The Director will be primarily focused on executing significant new business partnerships on behalf of Hollywood Park, SoFi Stadium, YouTube Theater, Jimmy Kimmel LA Bowl, & additional opportunities as assigned. They will connect directly with brand decision makers on a regular basis to increase sales activity and investment opportunities across Hollywood Park's portfolio of properties. The Director is responsible for generating leads, driving revenue, leading contract negotiations, communicating with Los Angeles Rams & Los Angeles Chargers team leaders, and key internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate possesses a strong passion for partnership sales development, personal career growth, and has a positive team-first attitude.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop innovative partnerships that pioneer new categories, inventory, campaigns/platforms, and/or partner integrations Ability to prospect by performing extensive company and executive research for strategic engagement efforts Construct a prospect pipeline and creative outreach plan (via targeting and qualifying leads through cold calls and referrals) for potential partnership opportunities with regional, national, and international companies Communicate with external executive staff and stakeholders to coordinate meetings and other touchpoints throughout the sales process Collaborate with internal and external staff to plan, ideate, and develop strategic marketing platforms to present to new prospects Coordinate with Hollywood Park teammates to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of sales process Serve as an expert for the group on industry best practices, emerging categories, industry trends, and integrate learnings into the sales process Participate in industry-related events or associations that will enhance Hollywood Park's reputation and potential for success Attend major conferences and special events, building new relationships with agencies, brands, and sports and entertainment properties Other duties and projects as assigned  QUALIFICATIONS:  To perform this job successfully, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty above at the highest levels. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and experience (MBA Preferred) Minimum 7+ years of experience in sports, event, and/or entertainment sponsorship sales Proven track record in pitching, negotiating, and closing long-term, seven figure integrated marketing partnerships Creativity to develop strategic marketing platforms Knowledge of the broader sports sponsorship and partnership programs in the industry Strong understanding of utilizing different databases to do business research and prospect effectively Outstanding written and verbal communication skills to develop strong working relationships with partners, teammates, and other stakeholders Capacity to meet challenging sales objectives in a high profile, competitive marketplace Ability to manage a high level of detail across multiple projects and to prioritize efficiently Expertise in identifying opportunities, developing strategies, and negotiating creative solutions Experience in building out innovative presentation decks in Keynote or PowerPoint Familiarity with social media marketing and social media platforms Proficiency in Google Suite of Services with a focus on Sheets, Docs, Slides, & Drive Possess an optimistic team attitude and competitive desire to be the best Self-motivated with entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently Ability to work flexible hours as projects exist across multiple time zones Willingness to travel as needed for various projects  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a complete listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time.  EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY:  Hollywood Park and SoFi Stadium strongly support equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

This is your chance to work for the world-famous Durham Bulls Baseball Club located in one of the fastest growing areas in the country. We are looking for an up-and-coming superstar or a seasoned vet who can help shape our ticket sales department as sports return to large capacities. The position is directly responsible for overseeing all new business initiatives, upselling and renewals focused on Durham Bulls Season Tickets, Partial Plans, and Group Ticket Sales.  Essential Functions/Responsibilities Develops the business strategy for all new and renewal business efforts surrounding Full Season Tickets, Partial Season Tickets, and Group Tickets. Oversees all executable action items related to this plan and the managers and employees in the Ticket Package sales, Group Sales, and Inside Sales Departments. Execute, track, and adjust new and renewal sales strategies in FSE, group ticket and inside sales departments to ensure yearly ticket sales and revenue goals are met. Develop the full season ticket and partial plan sales strategy and timeline. Set revenue and daily/weekly activity goals for all new business ticket sales employees and managing progress and efforts toward achieving these goals. Coach and guide Ticket Sales and Inside Sales teams to create a strong sales culture and environment focused on hard work and accountability, achieving budget goals, and delivery of a positive client experience. Assist sales staff in their effort to generate new sales in all ticket product lines. This may include attending meetings, visiting prospects at events, and calling potential clients. Regularly develop and implement sales training related to all ticket sales product lines. Establish and develop long-term client relationships. Responsible for hiring, promoting, training, and measuring performance of department staff.  Performance Requirements/Skills Ideal candidate has a proven track record of selling corporate clientele. Ideal candidate has experience in selling group tickets and managing group events. History of managing a sales team and exceeding organizational sales goals. Strong computer skills and experience related to CRM and ticketing software. Ability to work a varied schedule to include evenings, weekends, and holidays.  Education/Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree required Minimum 2+ years professional experience within management field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a sales capacity  A pre-employment drug screening is required. EOE, M/F. All Capitol Broadcasting Company properties are tobacco free. Capitol Broadcasting Company participates in E-Verify.

description: The Role  Cedar is improving the healthcare financial experience. Our technology improves the overall experience of patient billing and engagement, enabling providers to thrive in a rapidly changing environment while helping patients understand the cost of their care.  As the Director of Partnerships (Sales), you will lead and manage the aggregate sales process with prospective, enterprise level clients. Given the complexity of our clients, candidates must have experience navigating relationships with multiple stakeholders of large enterprises, as well as the ability to successfully execute a consultative sales style. Our target clients include health systems, physician groups, and laboratory companies.  Successful candidates are strategic, quick thinkers and problem solvers. The ideal candidate has a track record of closing deals, generating leads, pitching to new clients, and selling in a consultative manner. This candidate is a great collaborator, internally and externally, and is also an effective relationship manager. Candidates should also be ready to play a role in all aspects of the commercial business including build-out of internal company processes, recruiting, and interfacing with Cedar‚Äôs product & engineering teams.  Responsibilities Build and maintain relationships with prospective client partners Act as a strategic thought partner for leaders of client organizations throughout the sales engagement process Create compelling business cases for clients and shape key company materials such as pitch decks and case studies Navigate clients from the sales engagement through the on-boarding process including contracting Help shape Cedar‚Äôs commercial strategy in existing and new business areas Help build out internal processes for the Partnerships team Identify market needs and engage with Cedar‚Äôs product and engineering teams to evaluate Required Skills & Experience 5+ years in business development, consulting, or sales Prior healthcare experience required Track record of managing relationships with clients Gravitas and communication skills to engage senior executives of large enterprises Comfortable working on a small team and a dynamic environment Collaborative team player excited to work on big problems What do we offer to the ideal candidate? An opportunity to work on a platform that is scaling very rapidly, engaging with millions of patients per year and growing at a rate of 360% YoY as of January 2021! A chance to join a high-growth company at an early stage The ability to impact the growth of our company, we value all comments and suggestions Transparency across teams and interaction with multiple departments Competitive pay, employer-paid healthcare, stock options Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Cedar will not hire any applicants for the Director Partnerships (Sales) role who are present in the United States on an F-1 visa. Cedar is not an E-Verify employer and cannot employ individuals on a STEM OPT extension.

description: Brouwerij West/THINGS...For Your Head is looking for an outstanding, passionate leader to join our team and grow our Sales & Distribution! Our Director of Sales & Distribution is accountable for all aspects of sales and distribution of Brouwerij West beer and THINGS...For Your Head hard seltzer products in the wholesale market. The Director is responsible for raising our company's revenues by increasing our sales within our existing customer network and developing and expanding our customer base. The Director reports to our senior management, oversees all sales professionals, and works with other members of our team to grow our brand. Our Sales Director must meet or exceed specific sales and revenue targets. The role requires someone with excellent interpersonal and direct marketing skills, who can work autonomously, take initiative, stay extremely organized, and oversee and lead a small team.  Key Responsibilities  Oversee and manage the wholesale division of our company, working with each of our distributors to maximize our sales. Manage, lead, motivate and develop our team of sales professionals, including setting and monitoring goals and sales directives to drive revenue in representatives‚Äô designated territories and hire new staff as needed. Manage and execute Brouwerij West and Things...For your Head chain business, including chain mandates, authorizations, new item presentations, and display programs. Provide top-level brand direction and insight, including brand performance objectives, category and segment insights, and other analyses as requested by management. Manage pricing, forecasting, distributor orders, and inventory. Identify key markets for expansion. Research, interview and make recommendations for new wholesale partners to expand the reach of our brands.  Work closely with our CEO, CFO, and production team to develop and execute an effective sales and distribution plan that will maximize revenue and increase our margin as our brewhouse capacity and production continue to expand.   Understand and embrace the Brouwerij West and THINGS...For Your Head brands and styles. Develop and maintain a detailed knowledge of the similarities, differences, and competitive edges of our products, methods, and brands over other craft and mass-market breweries and the broader alcohol market. Develop new customer relationships across all of our distribution geographies, particularly in chain placements. Design a sales staff process that maintains and nurtures robust, long-term customer relationships. Direct and manage our sales team to act as a communication channel for customer feedback regarding product quality and popularity, brand perception, competitor pricing, and overall satisfaction with our products. Respond to and resolve all wholesaler issues and concerns. Forecast seasonal sales, brand execution, and wholesale revenues for Brouwerij West and THINGS...For Your Head with reasonable accuracy. Lead weekly sales meetings to review sales data and update the team about new beer releases, inventory, events, and other sales-related matters. Monitor sales performance and metrics with distributors, especially in our local market, using VIP/Karma/iDig and other platforms to maintain thorough awareness of sales by each distributor. Keep abreast of current market conditions, trends, and quantity and quality of sales performance. Communicate information and recommendations to management that will help develop our brand, grow sales, and increase distribution effectiveness. Coordinate with production and brewing teams to determine the available beer supply for sales and distribution. Manage California ABC price postings, ensuring accurate and timely posting of new items and changes as required by law. Oversee our keg fleet by tracking picked-up kegs and scheduling keg pick-ups. Taste beer and seltzer throughout processes to ensure familiarity with all company products. Work with and support company management on special projects as needed, including attendance at industry events and conferences.  Necessary Qualifications  Minimum 3 years experience in craft beer and/or hard seltzer sales (management experience preferred). Expertise of the 3-tier system and its complexities. Keen interest in the beer and hard seltzer brewing process, beer styles, beer culture, and the scientific principles governing fermentation. Must stay abreast of trends in craft beer and hard seltzer, including style trends, competitor product launches, competitor pricing behavior, and industry marketing techniques. A flexible schedule that permits travel to visit new prospects and existing clients. Ability to multi-task while out of the office so as to avoid operational interruptions. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills and the wherewithal to independently build customer and employee rapport. Ability to write professional email correspondence and to design and deliver an engaging and convincing oral presentation of our beer products and brand. Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail. Order accuracy and recordkeeping must be maintained without supervision. Ability to plan and manage distribution territories to ensure efficient distribution of our product in our various markets. Superior problem-solving skills and mathematical accuracy.  Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, and MailChimp.  Ability to learn and teach Orchestrated Beer. Advanced knowledge of VIP, iDig, Karma. Must be able to periodically lift and move objects such as kegs, cases of beer, and glassware cases. A professional work style that is always polite, punctual, reliable, and collaborative.   This is a full-time, salaried position, with health benefits and paid time off.  Brouwerij West/THINGS...For Your Head is an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to workforce diversity.  Qualified candidates will be required to interview in person in Los Angeles, CA if selected.  Please e-mail your resume and cover letter PDF to jobs@brouwerijwest.com.  We look forward to hearing from you!  Company Description  Brouwerij West is a unique craft brewery and venue located in the San Pedro neighborhood of Los Angeles. Brouwerij West was founded in 2010 and we opened our San Pedro brewery in February 2016 in a former Port Warehouse initially built by the U.S. Navy during World War II. Brouwerij West‚Äôs operation encompasses 26,000 sq. ft. of the Crafted at the Port of Los Angeles facility, including 8,000 sq. ft. devoted to visitor use for our Tasting Room and events, as well as a 17,000-sq. ft. outdoor courtyard/beer garden. We brew our beers using traditional ingredients and methods mixed with creative inspiration to produce our take on classic Belgian-style and farmhouse ales, IPAs, lagers, mixed-fermentation beers, and more. We are now distributed throughout California and several other states. We launched Things ‚Ä¶ For Your Head Hard Seltzer in May 2020 as a new product line. We are committed to doing our part to protect our planet‚Äôs environment: our new facility is covered with solar panels and generates more electricity than it uses, and our mash filter-based brewhouse uses 30% less water than traditional breweries.

Enterprise Sales at Terzo  We‚Äôre a lean, fast-growing team of passionate individuals with diverse experiences and backgrounds, having worked at companies like Microsoft, Samsung, Amazon, Freshworks and  more. We‚Äôre building the VRM platform to drive innovation and digital transformation at some of the largest enterprises in the world.    As a member of the Sales team, you will drive revenue through top and mid-funnel to closing motions, supported by cross-functional teams. You will be an important player in the revenue cycle of the company, including closing new deals and fostering relationships for renewal and upsell opportunities.  Terzo is a fast growing company with a hot product in an exciting new product category that is gaining market traction within the Fortune 1000.  This is an outstanding opportunity for the ambitious Enterprise Sales Representative that wants to go after a very rewarding market space.   Job Responsibilities  Strategic Account Director will manage existing enterprise customers and execute enterprise selling motions to move opportunities from mid-funnel to closed/won. (Fortune 500 companies) Drive revenue and results by managing pipeline and activities towards closing deals Leverage CRM and other tools to understand your enterprise account targets and work to gain acceptance and influence over target personas, influencers and decision makers Team with cross functional professionals in BRD, Customer Success and Marketing to drive cohesion of message and selling results  Requirements  8+  years in enterprise SaaS sales showing a progression in responsibilities Proven track record of enterprise sales success, client development and account development Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills along with ability to work effectively with business and technology leaders Ability to develop selling stories through written communication, slide decks and use of company marketing collateral to gain influence and close accounts Growth mindset, ambitious, results driven

BodyHealth is a rapidly growing Nutritional Supplement company based in Dunedin Florida.  We are growing to such a degree that we have landed ourselves on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing businesses in the USA for three years running! We have been able to do this because of our amazing team and we are looking to add to our leadership team in our sales area.  We are looking for someone with a strong background in the nutritional space, and experience growing a brand along numerous channels including Grocers, Practitioners, Mass Retail and so-on. In addition to establishing and running the sales department, you would use your skills to bring in significant new B2B customers. You will grow out of the Hunter role as you establish the division and have your team of Hunters and Farmers.  Optimizing Health and Vitality  With a focus on quality and purity of ingredients, BODYHEALTH¬Æ products are crafted to help you achieve and maintain optimum health and vitality in today‚Äôs increasingly toxic world. The BODYHEALTH¬Æ objective is to educate others on how to improve and maintain the body‚Äôs condition, and to provide them with the products needed to do that. You can trust us to be your partner as you travel the path of a healthy and vibrant life.  Our Story  BODYHEALTH¬Æ products were discovered by Dr. David Minkoff, M.D., who founded BODYHEALTH¬Æ in 2000. In his practice, Dr. Minkoff concentrates on alternative and complementary approaches, with a focus on detoxification and dietary/nutrition changes. He believes that to achieve optimum health, patients must firstly, reduce the number of toxins and pollutants entering the body; secondly, increase the number of toxins and pollutants leaving the body and thirdly, improve the quality of nutrition so the body can rebuild and heal. Dr. Minkoff developed the range of products which BODYHEALTH¬Æ manufacturers and distributes. These cutting-edge solutions are available to practitioners and the public, providing them with the opportunity to have access to unique dietary supplements and education.  Reports to  This position would report directly to the CEO.  What you will be responsible for Leading the BodyHealth Sales personnel in all channels to achieve their individual and group goals. Overall company revenue and strategies for establishing customer/buyer relationships. Increasing revenue, engagement, and brand awareness nationally. Planning and spearheading growth in all sales channels including practitioners, grocers, gyms, health and fitness clubs and other specialty retailers. Establish education and sales training programs for customers to better understand our line of products. Working with the corporate resources to drive growth through in store demos, education, and field-based support. Working closely with the Sales and Marketing teams on trade spend and setting appropriate expectations with accounts. Evaluating sales promotions/trade spend and effectively tracking ROI. Planning for, participating in, and supporting trade shows, trade events and other major sales events (when applicable).  Who you are You have 2-5+ years of previous selling experience in the Nutritional space. Have established business relationships with regional accounts, and familiarity with market trends. Have a demonstrated record of success and overachievement. Motivated, adaptable and able to work with little direction. Comfortable in a fast-paced, growing company, able to adapt to change quickly. Takes initiative and proactively looks for and suggests improvements. Have great listening, negotiating, and problem-solving skills. You are a student of selling who finds personal satisfaction and joy in closing and building a business. Celebrate your success, and the successes of your team even more. Willing to travel up to 30%. Have an entrepreneurial spirit and drive that you use to tackle challenges.  Salary and benefits Salary begins at 100k-150k. Commission and/or overrides for rise in sales over all channels. Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance. PTO and Sick Days after 60 days. Discounts on entire line of BodyHealth Supplements. In office Yoga.

Company Profile  Koupon provides c-store retailers and brands with the easiest way to connect and engage with shoppers to grow sales. Koupon works with brands to easily deploy personalized, channel-wide promotions, and helps retailers to secure additional brand trade spending and grow shopper engagement. Members of the Koupon Network - the leading c-store collaborative with 30 of the top 50 c-store retailers and over 70 brands ‚Äì realize the benefit from Koupon‚Äôs unmatched channel reach, proprietary technology and data, and campaign management services. Since its founding in 2011, Koupon has delivered over 4 billion offers. To learn more, please visit www.koupon.com   The Opportunity Due to our tremendous growth, and substantial marketplace opportunity, Koupon is expanding its Retail Partnerships (Sales) Team. The individual that fills this role will be responsible for enhancing Koupon‚Äôs standing with existing and prospective retail clients. Retail partnerships will be built and enhanced by driving tremendous results for our clients via Koupon‚Äôs dynamic suite of solutions including, but not limited to: Koupon Platform, Koupon Network, Koupon Insights and Koupon Services.  Position Description Position Title: National Director, Retail Partnerships Location: Addison, TX (or remote) Reports to: Head of Sales  Position Charter The National Director, Retail Partnerships will have responsibility for selling Koupon‚Äôs solutions to Retailers, with a focus on the small-format market segment.  Specific responsibilities include: Growing the retail network- sign-up small format retailers to participate as members of the Koupon Offer Network. Grow business with existing clients- Convert outstanding results into expanded client partnerships based on their needs and opportunities. Retailer Purchase Data / Integrations- Establish deep connections with small format retailers in order to secure consistent purchase data in order to build stronger and more effective offer campaigns. Revenue generation- Create and drive the entire small format retailer SaaS sales cycle from needs analysis, presentation, sale, and renewal. Pipeline management- Continually fill the pipeline with qualified opportunities and execute winning sales campaigns to meet growth expectations. Key relationships- Maintain key client relationships and develop / implement strategies for expanding the products used. Experience/Skills Desired The ideal candidate will have retail technology sales experience, preferably in the small format vertical.
