description: Have you ever launched a first-in-class drug with no existing competitor? Are you a builder of teams who thrives in the fast-paced oncology space? Do you pride yourself in being able to access hard-to-see customers? In your role with us, you will have the opportunity to change the way some patients experience chemotherapy. You will directly impact the paradigm shift in the way health care providers support patients with Extensive-Stage Small Cell Lung Cancer.    G1 Therapeutics is committed to our mission of improving the lives of people impacted by cancer by developing and commercializing innovative therapies for a variety of tumor types. We know how a cancer diagnosis affects a person and their family, and we are driven every day to do everything we can to improve outcomes in people who have received the diagnosis. In addition to driving adoption of our first FDA-approved breakthrough drug for appropriate patients with extensive-stage small cell lung cancer, we are also developing a robust, late-stage clinical pipeline assessing the potential for our medicine in a variety of additional cancers. Our strategy leverages the experience and drive of the G1 team and our deep experience in inventive and responsible drug development and commercialization. G1 provides a professional, diverse, inclusive, and creative working environment where individuals can thrive. We offer an opportunity to bring your best to the team every day, and in doing so, help to save and improve the lives of people living with cancer and their families. We are driven to succeed by the patient communities we seek to help. Patients are waiting.  The Opportunity:  G1 Therapeutics is currently recruiting a Sr. National Sales Director to join our team. In this role you will be reporting directly to the Chief Commercial Officer and will be a key member of the Commercial Leadership Team, collaborating across the internal stakeholder matrix to ensure seamless execution. You are an experienced sales leader that understands the pace and urgency of the oncology space and possess the ability to inspire and motivate a sales organization to deliver strong results. You will oversee sales leadership and professionals, providing strategic vision and direction, and will lead all aspects of the sales function, including hiring, sales execution, and resource management.   Travel is 25-60%, depending on where you will reside.  Responsibilities:  Create the vision, strategy, and direction for the Sales Organization and Sales Leadership, fostering a culture of personal accountability and teamwork. Develop a high performing and diverse team by attracting, selecting, and retaining talented individuals who are aligned to the G1mission and company goals. Have expert knowledge of the oncology market and as well as key customer accounts. Drive a customer-facing strategy targeting key accounts to increase product uptake and revenue growth. Provide leadership in development and implementation of KPIs and sales metrics to build an effective selling process that aligns to the brand strategic objectives. Develop and execute effective national level sales plans in collaboration with commercial stakeholder teams to provide optimal financial returns and a coordinated customer experience. Partner effectively with all internal and external stakeholder groups to optimize sales opportunities. Possess a deep understanding of business analytics to accurately assess and diagnose national sales trends and develop measurable tactics to support selling objectives. Develop and implement KPIs and sales metrics to build sales efficiency and effectiveness. Coach and develop sales leaders. Lead by example. Ensure sales organization executes in a compliant and ethical manner, adhering to all company policies, legal, regulatory and compliance guidelines.  Requirements:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent and 12+ years of successful experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry. At least 5 years of senior sales leadership experience in the oncology space. Prior experience as a leader of leaders is highly desirable. Successful buy and bill product launch experience. Proven track record building and developing a high performing sales organization. Ability to create a positive and inclusive culture. Significant cross-functional experience working with both home office and field-facing stakeholder groups, including operations, analytics, compliance, marketing and market access. Experience in developing executive level business plans and managing P&L. Excellent executive communication and presentations skills.  As this position requires operation of a vehicle, offers of employment are contingent upon the candidate meeting the requirements of ‚ÄúQualified Driver,‚Äù as determined by the Company in its sole discretion, including but not limited to the following: (1) at least 21 years of age; (2) a driver‚Äôs license in good standing issued by your state of residence; and (3) a driving risk level deemed acceptable by the Company. Further, in accordance with G1 policy, employees who are not fully vaccinated against COVID-19, are prohibited from traveling on the company‚Äôs behalf.  Why Join Us? We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. All employees are issued laptops, and our office staff all have height-adjustable desks, access to a stocked kitchen, and multiple employee events throughout the year. We also offer a competitive benefits package, including generous PTO, to support the health and happiness of our staff.  An Equal Opportunity Employer G1 Therapeutics is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at G1 Therapeutics are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

description: Green Light, an innovative healthcare technology company located in Scottsdale, AZ, is searching for a highly motivated and experienced Director of Sales to lead our ongoing sales efforts in the healthcare payer market. Qualifications: ‚Ä¢Demonstrated track record of successful management of all aspects of strategic business development and sales operations. ‚Ä¢Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent. ‚Ä¢5+ years Professional Sales Management experience. ‚Ä¢Demonstrated success in developing relationships with C-level decision makers and ability to successfully negotiate and close complex engagements. ‚Ä¢Familiarity with Healthcare Insurance Operations, Healthcare Data Analytics, or Health Plan Benefits Administration. ‚Ä¢Excellent written and verbal communication skills. ‚Ä¢Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. ‚Ä¢Ability to uphold confidentiality and exercise good judgement and integrity in day-to-day decisions.  Benefits: ‚Ä¢Health Insurance (Employer pays 100% of the premium for all employees) ‚Ä¢Dental Insurance ‚Ä¢401(k) Employer Match ‚Ä¢Paid Time Off ‚Ä¢Company Paid Holidays  Equal Opportunity: Green Light is an equal opportunity employer where diversity and inclusiveness are part of the culture and a critical part of who we are. We believe that diversity breeds better products, better decisions, and a better work environment. Everyone here is committed to making Green Light representative of the world we want to live in. Title: Senior Sales Executive, Trade Finance Location: Remote or New York Metro Job Function: Sales of Bespoke Working Capital Programs Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business, Economics, MBA, or relevant job experience Employee Status: Full-time   Raistone Capital, recently featured on CNBC, MSNBC and CNN, is a leading provider of working capital finance, headquartered in New York City. Raistone offers receivables finance, trade finance, and related services on a global scale, serving small to medium sized enterprises, up through large corporates.  We combine the best qualities of an investment bank, a fintech and a start-up. We are a diverse mix of talented, energetic people, who do amazing work. Raistone staff possess decades of experience and expertise in structured trade finance and technology, working for leading global financial institutions and FinTechs. This combination of industry experience and technology innovation is a core strength for Raistone Capital. We are hiring builders, collaborators, and innovators and seek bright, motivated, reliable talent to join our nimble team. Raistone leadership is committed to the long-term personal and professional growth of each individual in the organization.  The Senior Sales Executive is a key member of the Raistone origination team. This position reports to the Chief Commercial Officer.  Key Responsibilities  We are looking for a Senior Sales Executive to work within our sales organization to help us to scale to the next level.  The ideal candidate will be results-driven, possess outstanding structuring and origination skills in the working capital space and impeccable work ethic.  The candidate will have a strong team orientation and excellent communications skills.    Source opportunities to create a pipeline of new leads with the goal to drive revenue generation with focused on medium-sized corporations‚Äô need for bespoke working capital improvements and liquidity. Work collaboratively with Legal, Risk, Operations and Product Management to convert leads to revenue-generating programs. Work with the firm‚Äôs Distribution desk to facilitate profitable distribution of assets to Participants. Maintain sales progress in CRM ‚Äì Salesforce. Develop a robust outreach and opportunity plan for assigned sales responsibilities. Develop effective sales strategies based on solution-based selling aligned with the firm‚Äôs product offerings. Manage sales communications to advance business objectives and increase engagement. Work to minimize opportunity risk while maximizing client satisfaction and returns to the firm.  Work cooperatively with the firm‚Äôs resources to promote a best-in-class client experience. Understand industry trends as well as customer needs and requirements. Continually learn about our product and our industry. Manage relevant sales metrics and reporting, data research, and data review. Assist in the development of the sales plan. Prepare forecasts and KPI reporting for sales leadership and senior management team for use in organizational planning, financial forecasting, budget setting and strategic planning. Provide full visibility into the sales pipeline at every stage of development.  Qualifications  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business, Economics, MBA, or relevant job experience. Five to ten years of experience in structuring and selling complex working capital, traditional corporate finance, trade finance, or factoring solutions. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Comfortable in front of C-Suite audience. Proven sales, relationship building and business development skills. Strong understanding of the credit and the legal documentation process. Desire and ability to take initiative and excel in a fast-paced start-up style work environment. Organized, efficient, ability to prioritize and multi-task based on urgency of business needs. Self-motivated, positive, energetic, collaborative, willing to help others. Results driven, persistent, tenacious, determined. Customer focused. Empathy and a genuine concern for others, listening skills. Attention to detail and accuracy. Highly proficient in Microsoft Office.  Raistone Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

The Role The Head of US Sales is an integral member of our Commercial business development team. In this role you will identify and build relationships with key decision makers, both internally and externally; engage with potential customers to illustrate Sonablate‚Äôs competitive advantage; work closely with our Marketing and Product teams to capture and incorporate client feedback into our offerings; and build out a sales strategy and team for the US. We strive to offer the highest quality and service to our clients and as the Head of US Sales you will ensure that mission is carried out through the sales process. To succeed in this role, you will need experience with capital device sales at a price point of $300K-$500K, an understanding of regulatory compliance, a player-coach approach to management, and (ideally) an existing network within the urology market. Responsibilities Utilize strong verbal and written communication skills in collaborating with prospective clients and internal stakeholders to drive growth Develop a creative sales strategy for the US that results in a pipeline of current and new clients with accurately forecasted conversion rates and dates Collaborate with Marketing team on market research, competitor‚Äôs strategies, and client feedback to strengthen commercial approach and product positioning Take a data-driven approach to developing sales strategy and forecasting Control budget and allocate resources accordingly Build and lead US Sales team to deliver success with conversions, strong mentorship, and career progression strategies This job does require frequent travel and presence in healthcare facilities. The Head of US Sales will be expected to comply with the vendor credentialing requirements of various facilities to carry out the job function. Contribute to the strategic goals of Sonablate by completing all other duties, as assigned Qualifications 7+ years of professional work experience in sales and business development Strong grasp of medical device industry with experience closing capital equipment sales at a price point of $300K - $500K Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Science, Engineering, or Business field Position may require significant travel during normal operations. Amount of travel will vary depending on candidate‚Äôs location and may include some international travel Exceptional communication and presentation skills Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence outcomes as they relate to strategic initiatives Strong business acumen with the ability to analyze data and problem solve effectively Preferred Qualifications Experience in urologic med device sales Experience working in ISO certified or regulated industry Proficiency with Salesforce Membership in an industry-related organization  Welcome to an established company, with a proven product, and a start-up feel. Sonablate Corp. was created following an acquisition of SonaCare Medical, LLC in 2021. We have designed, developed, manufactured, sold, and serviced the Sonablate HIFU ablation device for over two decades, receiving 510K de novo clearance with the FDA in 2015. The Sonablate device is cleared in more than 50 countries, including a CE Marking in the European Union and approval from the National Medical Products Administration in China. Sonablate Corp. has two offices: one in Charlotte, NC and the other in Indianapolis, IN as well as remote employees spread out across the country. We stay focused by having monthly town hall meetings, tracking our progress toward annual goals, and passing all new projects through a rigorous vetting by our prioritization committee. We strive for transparency and clear communication throughout the company and look for candidates that want to dive in, effect change, and challenge us to become the best version of ourselves. Our employees enjoy competitive salaries, bonus plans, and an employee stock option plan. Additionally, the company pays for 90% of the employee‚Äôs healthcare benefits, which are effective the first of the month following your first day on the job. We offer flexible working schedules for our hourly employees and a work-from-home policy for our salaried ones. We believe in giving our employees autonomy, mastery, and purpose and enjoy low turnover due to that philosophy. Sonablate provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

The global email encryption market, estimated at $4.68 billion in 2020, is expected to reach $15 Billion in 2026. Our space is fast-paced, competitive and growing at a CAGR of around 21.4% - but so are the vulnerabilities threatening it and regulations governing it. This is why our team is moving at breakneck speed ‚Äì to protect the privacy of people and businesses throughout the world by making email data protection easier.  We are on a mission to prove to that it pays to be secure and we need your help!  As a recognized and established SaaS developer, Echoworx provides customizable encryption solutions to a growing list of multinational organizations hailing from a wide range of high-regulated sectors ‚Äì including government, financial services, healthcare, legal and manufacturing, among others.  We are seeking a proven Senior Sales Executive, U.S. to sell our industry leading encrypted messaging cloud software platform within the American market. This position will appeal to someone looking for a senior business development / software sales role in the security and messaging arena. The ideal candidate will have existing customer relationships within the industry verticals mentioned above and a track record of success in the cybersecurity space. This role will be reporting into the VP, Sales. Compensation is competitive, and the bonus structure generous.    Responsibilities:  Develop a plan to penetrate the agreed U.S. nominated targeted accounts, leveraging the company‚Äôs current success Build opportunity plans for each large target account including competitive tactics to displace legacy platforms Develop strategic relationships and deliver sales execution plans to get meetings and demos booked on a monthly basis Work closely with Senior Management, Engineering, Development and Marketing to demonstrate breadth and depth of our solution Using your extensive network of contacts, establish meetings / demo‚Äôs for specific target accounts Effectively communicate the business value of the technology solution    Drive discipline sales execution process; leverage existing relationships and developing new Build and maintain an accurate and robust sales pipeline Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate multi-year contracts  Desired Skills and Experience:  5-10 years of senior software sales experience (cybersecurity market) Experience successfully selling solutions or services at the executive level Track record of exceeding individual objectives Hard-working, persuasive, persistent, self-motivated, and productive Strong time management skills Excellent communication, relationship, and analytical skills Must be comfortable speaking to technical and business executives alike Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment  What‚Äôs in it for you?  We offer: ‚Ä¢ Ability to make an immediate and lasting impact ‚Ä¢ Work in a safe, secure, and positive work environment ‚Ä¢ Work with a talented team of innovative and creative players  About Echoworx  Echoworx brings simplicity and scalability to encryption. OneWorld, our flagship solution, is the first encryption platform that makes secure messaging easy and cost effective ‚Äì designed to adapt to any environment and all forms of encryption. Our passionate encryption experts transform chaos into order for world leading enterprises and OEM providers who understand the requirement for secure communication is of the upmost importance. We are proud to have clients in 30 countries using the Echoworx encryption platform, and to have more than 5,000 enterprise-level business, public sector and institutional clients serviced through our offices in Canada, the U.S., and the U.K. For more information, please visit echoworx.com.   Echoworx is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  *Please include your cover letter and resume with your application

Headquartered in Chicago, we operate service centers in cities across the United States and Canada. working knowledge of carbon steel and value-added service offerings Strong desire to pursue tenaciously new business opportunities Requires willingness to work a flexible schedule Willingness to travel a minimum of 60% We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, and pregnancy), age, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran, or any other federal, state or local protected class or artificial barrier.

description: This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join a founding team aiming to create a solution to disrupt philanthropy and create world-wide impact. Tired of working at companies that are adding to society's ills instead of solving them? Come contribute to our vision, a future where every solution is funded, and every problem is solved.  Groundswell is a new type of financial service that uses powerful technology for better giving. Our product allows companies to create personal foundations for its employees and match employee contributions straight from payroll, like a 401K for giving. Groundswell then provides users with access to all of the tools available to ultra-rich philanthropists: tax-free investments to grow your impact, matching to the best non-profits for the causes you care about, frictionless donations, a unified picture of your impact over time, and a single tax receipt at the end of the year. It puts employees in the driver's seat of corporate philanthropy and empowers them to create world-wide impact.  So if you're the type of person that's foolish enough to think they can change the world and smart enough to have a chance, then we might have a spot for you.  Do you eat sales quotas for breakfast? Did you write your daughter a sales script when she went door to door to sell Girl Scout Cookies? The last time you bought a car, did you pull a Jedi mind trick on the salesperson trying to sell you? If you answered yes to any of these, you might be the sales leader we're looking for.  Interested in leveraging your awesome sales skills for world good? Join us!  Role & Responsibilities Build the foundation for a killer B2B sales organization In partnership with company's founding team, develop the strategies and tactics necessary to achieve Groundswell's revenue goals Establish Groundswell's repeatable process and sales methodology Identify, implement, and optimize the necessary sales tech stack Create sales playbook of best practices to ensure rapid onboarding and execution Recruit, train, and lead a team of sales professionals spanning from enterprise to SMB to SDRs; develop an impactful sales culture that values individual initiative while encouraging mutual support Partner with the product and engineering teams to incorporate customer feedback and optimize product roadmap Develop and manage the sales department budget, targets, quotas, and commissions Utilize a data-driven approach to optimize forecasting Close deals. All. Damn. Day.  Requirements Minimum of ten years of experience as a sales leader at a B2B SaaS company Marketing and partnerships experience a bonus Experience at an early-stage, high-growth company is preferred Proficiency with leading sales software platforms Strong verbal and written communications skills Team player. We don't need any 'whats-in-it-for-me' hired guns Self-driven, mission aligned, and coachable  What We Value On our team things like integrity, trust, and respect are table stakes. If you're not a good human, don't apply. We value diversity not for its own sake but because we staunchly believe different experiences and perspectives will make us better. Oh, and we think diverse workplaces are simply more fun and interesting. Your pedigree isn't what will earn you respect around here; your competence and humility will. It doesn't matter to us whether you're coming from the School of Hard Knocks or an Ivy League. Also don't brag about your SAT score. Nobody cares. Check your ego at the door. If you don't have an unabashed belief that you can make the world a better place, then you should go work at Amazon and help ship cat food faster. You must enjoy the hustle and grind. Don't expect rest and vest joy ride. Having fun. We want teammates that we are eager to see on Monday morning because they make our lives richer. We seek and give feedback, not for agreement or consensus, but to get to the best idea. Groupthink leads to Groupsink.

description: Opportunity Overview  The Sales Director will focus on creating, developing, and closing New Business opportunities within our top Prospects and Customers. This is a combination of primarily net new prospects, and upsell/cross-sell to existing accounts, working closely with the partner community to effectively manage customer relationships and business outcomes on the East Coast region.  The successful candidate will be strongly self-motivated and outcome-driven, with a proven track record of managing and closing a pipeline of opportunities and forecasting accurately. Excellent qualification, prioritization, organization and focus are essential in this role. You‚Äôll own the full sales process from developing an SQL (Sales Qualified Lead) to closing the deal.  You will be extremely effective at building rapport over the phone and in-person with a range of senior decision-makers. You will be relentless in understanding the needs, pain points and desired outcomes of our prospects and customers. You must be technically proficient and able to present to both technical and business leaders and will be a competent public speaker.  Can you do this consistently? Responsible for new account development through B2B sales of SCADAfence software licensing to accounts across North America Drive sales opportunities within targeted verticals and regional commercial accounts that result in revenue Meet or exceed your quota by identifying, qualifying and closing new business opportunities at enterprise and mid-market opportunities Develop and execute lead generation and sales strategies directly to the customer, while leveraging your network of channel and industry peers to generate pipeline Accurately enter, update, and maintain daily activity, forecast and opportunity information in HubSpot Cultivate a lasting relationship with customers Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition creating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects Do you have the required skills and abilities? Extensive enterprise cybersecurity sales experience - selling security software and/or network technologies C-Level relationship management and new business sales experience A proven sales background of consistent achievement against quota Excellent presentation and written and verbal communication skills, including demonstrating the software and its architecture Security background a must ICS experience a major plus Start-up experience is a must A technical background is a bonus You‚Äôll be the type of person who thrives in a fast paste startup environment. Do you want to love where you work? Amazing Products: SCADAfence has 3 amazing products, creating a paradigm shift in the OT security industry. Bragging Rights: Rated the #1 OT security company on Gartner‚Äôs Peer Insights platform and with the most awards in the industry. Awesome Culture: SCADAfence is a family ‚Äì most describe our team as a group of close-knit, incredibly talented, and highly caffeinated people. Behind SCADAfence‚Äôs numerous accolades lies a vibrant ecosystem where team members have fun and are rewarded for continual innovation, disruption, and taking ownership in their work. Get Things Done: Innovation is woven into the fabric of our organization. Every aspect of our operations is purposeful; enabling us to research, develop and innovate faster than the The position addresses both men and women.  About SCADAfence  SCADAfence is the global technology leader in OT & IoT cybersecurity. SCADAfence offers a full suite of industrial cybersecurity products that provides full coverage of large-scale networks, offering best-in-class network monitoring, asset discovery, governance, remote access, and IoT device security. A Gartner ‚ÄúCool Vendor‚Äù in 2020, SCADAfence delivers proactive security and visibility to some of the world's most complex OT networks, including the largest manufacturing facility in Europe. SCADAfence enables organizations in critical infrastructure, manufacturing, and building management industries to operate securely, reliably, and efficiently. To learn more, visit our website, check out our blog, or follow us on LinkedIn.

description: About Us Total Beverage Solution (TBS) is a fast growing supplier with a selective portfolio of iconic international and domestic wine, spirits, and beer brands. We strive to be the most fun, entrepreneurial, professional, and well-funded U.S. partner for large import brands. Notable portfolio brands include Edradour & Signatory single malt scotches, Tohu & Kono wines from New Zealand, Lapis Luna, Weihenstephaner, Saison Dupont, Greene King, Rekorderlig, and others. TBS is proud to be navigating the difficult COVID-19 environment while continuing to grow and strengthen our brands.  The Role TBS has three national sales regions (East, Central, West), and each is led by a Region Director (RD). Each RD has P&L responsibility for $20 - 40 million in revenue. Purview includes the full beer, wine and spirits portfolio, and management of a 5-10 person sales team. The West RD reports to the SVP of Sales & Marketing. This is a leadership role in TBS with promotion potential for a high performer. TBS is a high growth business, on pace for 30%+ revenue growth in 2021.  We are looking for the right candidate located in a major market either in or west of Denver, CO.  Essential Functions Achieve sales and profitability goals for a regional P&L including ~15 states Recruit and develop bar-raising talent into the sales organization Optimize the effectiveness of your team, navigating between competing objectives across 30+ brands and 70+ distributors Effectively deploy millions of dollars in trade funds through basic and creative methods Develop high trust, results-yielding relationships with key personnel at distributors and strategic accounts Provide critical support in supplier management, including closing new supplier opportunities and communicating at a high level with key TBS suppliers Work closely with Marketing to provide feedback and recommendations on a regular basis. Collaborate with TBS senior leadership team to define overall sales strategy Make TBS a better place to work for its employees  Competencies Record of exceeding sales goals within established budgets Experience leading a sales team in the wine, spirits, and beer industry Demonstrated ability to develop grocery chain business for brands that are not ‚Äúhousehold names‚Äù Candidates should have multi-state experience working with many distributors, unless coming directly from a distributor role Excellent communication skills. Ability to take complex topics and provide fact-based recommendations clearly and succinctly High level of financial and business acumen; budgeting, forecasting, pricing and deal structures.  Characteristics Self-starter: Takes the initiative to deliver solutions with modest amount of day-to-day direction Positive presence: Brings a contagious positive energy and leaves a positive impression on others Determined: Manages and overcomes obstacles as a regular course of business Results oriented: Owns and is fully accountable for achieving agreed upon results Committed to learning and development: Seeks to learn, grow and develop continuously Self-aware: Understands individual impact on others Integrity: Makes every effort to deliver on commitments, is truthful and honest, and treats others with respect Team player: Helps sell TBS products outside of designated responsibility and is concerned with more than just dedicated area Confidence to disagree with peers and superiors when there are honest differences of opinions   Supervisory Responsibility This position manages employees in the region and is responsible for the performance management and hiring of the employees within those teams.  Work Environment This position is based in a home office environment in the region and also in a multi-site location, including, on-premise visits with suppliers and retailers and other meetings and events.  Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position that requires schedule flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed.  Travel This position requires up to 60% travel.  Required Education and Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing or related field 10+ years in direct beer, wine and spirits sales or fast-moving consumer goods 6+ years managing direct reports, suppliers and distributors  Preferred Education and Experience Master‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing or related field Certified Cicerone Certified Specialist of Wine Certified Specialist of Spirits  Additional Eligibility Qualifications Valid driver‚Äôs license with acceptable driving record  Benefits and Perks At Total Beverage Solution, we ask a lot of our employees, which is why we give so much in return. In addition to your competitive salary and bonus, additional benefits and perks include: Health: We cover the majority of the cost of medical premiums for you and your dependents. Continuing Education: Our tuition reimbursement and professional develop programs help you to continue to grow and learn. Volunteer Days: In addition to excellent vacation and holidays, we provide two paid days off for you to volunteer at any non-profit organization of your choice. Financial Protection: We provide $50,000 of basic life insurance, short- and long-term disability at no cost to you. Transportation: We provide a monthly car allowance, in addition to reimbursing you for your monthly fuel costs.  Total Beverage Solution is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  APPLY NOW for this incredible career opportunity!

Job Description Summary  In your role as the Strategic Development Leader, X-ray, you will be responsible for driving growth in our largest and most strategic accounts, such as GPO partnerships, government accounts, national accounts and channel partners.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities    Originating sales by positioning GE technology and identifying the best technical and commercial solution. Promote the business value proposition of GE technology. Works in close cooperation with regional sales, account sales and commercial proposal staff. Primary technical role involved in DTI (demand to inquiry): aim at increasing market penetration through technical support during pre-ITO. Developing specialized knowledge of latest commercial developments in own area and communication skills to influence others. Has working knowledge of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses judgment to make decisions or solve moderately complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Takes new perspective on existing solutions. Uses technical experience and expertise for data analysis to support recommendations. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.  Required Qualifications    Master's degree from an accredited university or college OR High school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience. Must be able to travel up to 75% of the time.  Desired Characteristics    Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to lead programs / projects. Established project management skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: **THIS IS NOT A JOB WITH FORCEBRANDS** **Must be located in Chicago or surrounding areas**  Summary of the Role: The Director of Sales reports to the Vice President of US Sales and is accountable for developing the sales and building the brand of the client in the Mid-western part of the US. The territory is focused on Illinois with tertiary markets of Indiana, Wisconsin, Missouri, Kansas, Nebraska, Iowa, South Dakota, and North Dakota and some Control State support. The Director will be responsible for the overall development and execution of the sales plan in the region leveraging the local distributor(s) and the client's sales team. The position also implies building and managing the relationship with the Top On & Off premise customers and be the face of the company in key consumer and trade events.  The right candidate is a seasoned hands-on spirits & wine Industry leader who has strong trade relationship and experience in developing both the On and Off Premise channels.   Complexity of Role: The client is a small company with high potential. All employees contribute when, where and how needed. Flexibility, intuition, intelligence, pace and interpersonal skills are required to be successful. Core capabilities include identifying opportunities, proposing solutions and executing toward the right outcome with a high degree of autonomy.          Main accountabilities:  Business growth:  Ensure that the region is achieving its quarterly and annual depletion goals Planning & Budget Lead the development and execution of the annual sales plan (at market, channel and key customers level) for the region to grow the sales across channels of distribution with the help of the client's team. The annual sales plan will include clear annual volume and distribution targets, trade marketing plan and distributors engagement plan.  Budget: Develop and manage within limits the Trade Marketing and T&E budgets for the region and ensure spending is on track with plan. Look to constantly improve efficiency and ROI.  Execution & Performance:  Review and track the annual sales plan implementation and performance during the year and work with team to make necessary adjustment to ensure annual goals are met.  Share Insightful Monthly Business Reports, market and competition insights as well as updated sales forecast ensuring clear communication of needs and performance with the rest of the client's team. Leverage internal and external sales, market and consumer data & insights to improve the strategy and focus of the resources (people and investment) and provide feedback to the client's central team.  Distributor Management: Build solid relationship with the distributor at all level of the hierarchy to ensure the client gains an unfair share of mind and time as a small trending brand in a large portfolio. Establish mutually agreed annual plan with distributor management and drive quarterly business review to evaluate progress against goal, gain marketplace insights and adjust plan if needed. Ensure special orders and inventories are maintained at appropriate levels. Define and implement regional pricing strategy and programming (combos and distributor incentive plans) with the local distributors. Review performance regularly to improve efficiency.  Key customers management  Build a strong and direct relationship and ensure that the client develops true partnership with the top Off & On premise accounts in the region to drive business growth (see list attached) Collaborate with the local Sales team and customers to find new opportunities to further develop the business at the account level, including the leverage of customer and social/digital platforms (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, website, newsletters‚Ä¶) and in store promotion (consumer tasting, calligrapher events, cross promotions, floor displays‚Ä¶).  Brand Building: Must build strong relationship and work closely with internal and external PR and Marketing partners to help develop the brand equity at the customer level. Be an active member of the sales leadership team and represent the client in key trade and consumer events.  People Management:  Position will hire and coach a team member within the region  Feedback and coaching on a regular basis are required to make sure the team can be successful as well as an annual performance review, with quarterly updates, with each individual.  Job Requirements: Minimum of 5 years industry experience (distributor sales and/or management, retail or on premise) Able to maintain a high level of professionalism in social environments Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Self-directed, resourceful, adaptable, and highly motivated Superior organizational skills, detail oriented, must be able to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines Ability to work independently and in a dynamic, high energy, team-oriented atmosphere High level of proficiency with Microsoft office At times the position will require non-traditional hours (nights/weekends) Ability to lift up to 50 pounds Driver‚Äôs license, insurance and safe driving record

description: Job Title: Regional Sales Director Manager: President Compensation: Base Salary, Bonuses, Commissions, Profit Sharing Benefits: Car Allowance, Reimbursed Tolls, Full Medical, Vision, Dental, STD, LTD, Life, 4 Weeks PTO, Parental Leave, Holiday Pay, & Birthday PTO Day Location: Corporate Office (Stafford, TX)  Overview: Radley Staffing is a temp., temp-to-hire, contract, and direct hire company that is searching for a motivated leader to join our team as the Regional Sales Director. This is an experienced individual who can build, lead, inspire and train their sales teams across the Texas region. The RSD will lead by example while coming in with high energy and innovative ideas on how to build upon our current successes while also creating new opportunities to grow Radley into new verticals.  Responsibilities: Establish and execute a strategic sales plan for the business development teams in the Greater Houston, DFW, and Austin markets Develop internal and external relationships with business executives, customers‚Äô C-suite, and their team members Assist with new customer solicitations and negotiations Identify and secure new accounts who fit Radley‚Äôs service offerings Inspire a sales driven culture with an emphasis on growth, diversification, and customer acquisition/retention Foster an environment of success through coaching, mentoring, and training Recruit, develop and retain top sales talent Ensure business strategies are understood and goals are met Complete understanding of our products and services to provide our customers‚Äô the greatest benefit Identify new opportunities within the staffing industry to expand our business offerings Attend conferences, meetings, networking events and social outings Meet regularly with the sales team to review sales activity and performance compared to goals Responsible for sales goals, quarterly & annual forecasting, and budgeting Some travel will be required: 15% - 20%  Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree Minimum 10 years of sales experience Minimum 3 years of successfully managing sales teams Experience in temp., temp-to-hire, contract, & direct hire industries is a plus Experience developing and implementing sales strategies and business plans Outstanding communicator and team leader    Radley Staffing is an equal opportunity employer

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn‚Äôt just about developing cool things. That‚Äôs why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?  Reporting to the Vice President of Defense and Space, Original Equipment Customer Business Team, the candidate will be a strong, dynamic and experienced leader responsible for driving growth, operational excellence and customer loyalty across all Raytheon, Bell and various US customer platforms and programs. You will lead and develop a direct team of Customer Business Managers and Development Program Mangers and provide cross-functional leadership to the extended Customer Core Team (PMO, C&PS, FSE, E&T, ISC, Contracts, Legal, Finance, Marketing, Technical Sales and Business Development).  You will be responsible for developing the customer strategy, achieving growth, increasing profitability, demonstrating flawless program execution, increasing customer satisfaction and direct responsibility for all components related to strategic account leadership for Raytheon and other key customer accounts as assigned. The successful candidate should have the proven ability to build strong teams and to consistently deliver on yearly AOP commitments.  This role has broad executive engagement across all customer lines of business and will also interface with Honeywell Aerospace executive management and all Aerospace GBE Product Line Leaders. Up to 50% travel is required.  Key Responsibilities  Your responsibilities will be in three key areas: Customer Strategy for Growth, Operational Execution and Team Leadership and Development.  Customer Strategy For Growth Identify and win new growth opportunities within all customer business segments Develop and execute broad strategies to secure short- and long-term business Deliver winning proposals and strong, customer specific, value propositions Establish and cultivate customer relationships with key stakeholders at all organization levels Validate and achieve 3-year and 5-year Strategic Plan (STRAP) Operational Execution Achieve business objectives and customer commitments impacting P/L financials Achieve development program milestones with expected SPI and CPI performance Improve delivery, quality, and the entire order to collection process for working capital Lead negotiations and conflict resolution for all business aspects with the strategic account Obtain a high OEM production forecast accuracy and ensure robust SIOP demand planning Team Leadership And Development Provide leadership and coaching to direct, and matrixed, reports. Identify, assess, acquire, and develop the critical skills and behaviors for the customer strategy Establish the right goals, metrics, rewards, and recognition aligned to a high performing organization Develop and maintain a robust succession plan Key Success Factors Growth (Pipeline Expansion, Wins and Orders) AOP Financials (Revenue, Margin) Development Program Performance (SPI, CPI, EAC, Milestone Fidelity) Working Capital (ARPD, WADC) SIOP Metrics (Firming, Forecast Accuracy) Customer Satisfaction (VOC) You Must Have Bachelor's degree required in Business or Engineering. Minimum 10 years of program / business management or engineering experience. Minimum 5 years of leadership experience with large, diverse teams. Active, or ability to obtain, Security Clearance Due to export control restrictions, must be a US Citizen We Value Master's degree or Advanced Degree preferred PMP certification desirable Strong analytical and financial skills Track record of exceeding financial targets Effectively getting results in a matrixed organization structure Clear communication and vision setting skills Executive presence and interfacing with customers at all levels of the organization Developing and fostering strong customer relationships Strategic mindset to scope tasks and achieve goals Passion for winning Timely decision making in the face of complexity and ambiguity Knowledge of DoD planning, programming, budgeting and execution. Ensuring customer satisfaction (delivery, quality, reliability) Effective coaching/mentoring skills Ability to develop personnel in direct and indirect reporting relationship Additional Information JOB ID: HRD133090 Category: Sales Location: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Global (ALL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Vice President of Sales & Marketing - Aerospace / Aviation
description: Summary The VP of Sales & Marketing will provide overall leadership for a multi-functional Sales and Marketing team. This person will be responsible for organizing, planning, staffing, and leading the company‚Äôs sales and marketing activities as well as driving Business Unit value creation.    They are responsible for developing and implementing business development, marketing, and sales strategies of the company. He or She will facilitate product planning through the Business Unit Managers by informing Operations, Engineering, Quality, and Finance personnel of current and future customer product needs. They may act as a high-level negotiator and sales engineer in key business situations. Direct responsibility to deliver on defined sales targets.  Responsibilities Manage, Develop and Lead Sales Team (Inside Sales Account Managers, Sales Managers, Business Development, Sales Reps, and Distributors) to achieve defined sales targets Develop Business Unit Managers and Business Unit Teams to grow EBITDA through value creation Develop clear and effective performance metrics for the marketing organization, as well as individuals, measuring the effectiveness; using metric trends and data to drive the business and decisions therein Facilitate the growth strategy and product development strategy of the company while building a dynamic, highly creative, and competitive organization by setting the standard through example as a leader, coach, and mentor Oversee the management and execution of the business development pipeline and associated sales development process ensuring high quality and quantity conversion rates Meet with existing and potential key customers to build relationships and evaluate or promote business opportunities Prepare definitive business segment plans based on market research and competitive analyses to identify potential markets and new products Leverage new technology into new platforms, customers, and opportunities Ensure coordinated, responsive, and efficient service problem resolution Participate in sales presentations and negotiations as appropriate to ensure maximum impact Build upon the brand legacy of Aerosonic with high-quality proposals and marketing materials Work with engineering and operations on the development and support of new business proposals, new product roadmaps, and the development of technology strategies Challenge the status quo, evolving the culture and practices within the marketing team in support of the performance objectives of the company Provide people leadership focused upon personal and collective accountability while fostering an environment that enhances personal growth and career development through mentoring and training; performance management and challenging the organization to strive for higher performance levels Build a reputation for the sales/marketing organization of high integrity, competitive leadership, and sustained performance Act as a key member of the senior management team by facilitating an understanding of market and technology realities and possibilities, therefore helping the company to meet and exceed its near and long-term objectives Travel requirements will be approximately 25-50%  Education/ Experience Aerospace or Industrial experience required At least 15 years professional experience in total; 5 or more of which should be in managing sales teams in a functional management role. 4-year college degree (engineering or business degree preferred) MBA Preferred Experience required in the development and support of technical proposals and/or business solutions as well as contract negotiations and contract management. Experience with increasing responsibilities Broad business knowledge preferred: technical sales, engineering, business finance, financial modeling, and operations

description: Founded in 1919 and headquartered in Lebanon, IN, D-A Lubricant manufactures commercial and consumer products ranging from engine oils and transmission fluids to extreme-pressure gear lubricants, greases and hydraulic fluids. We currently have a great opportunity for a full-time Regional Sales Director for our west coast sales team.  This position is responsible for managing and overseeing the sales operations in the assigned territory. Duties include directing the Territory Business Managers to develop and implement sales plans to increase the company‚Äôs profitability and motivating the team to hit the established sales goals.   Essential Functions: Manage Territory Business Managers in assigned territory by leading, motivating, evaluating, and promoting individual development of employees. Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales targets. Create and communicate sales goals and ensure executives are informed on the progress of those goals. Build and maintain long-lasting, strong relationships with customers while partnering with them to better understand their business objectives and needs. Assist the team with building sales through acquiring new customers, managing existing sales and growing/developing the distributor network. Develop and propose customer solutions utilizing D-A Lubricant‚Äôs vast product and service offerings. Keep abreast of products, market conditions and competitive activities, as well as maintaining up to date understanding of industry trends that affect target markets. Share strong business intelligence with appropriate D-A Lubricant professionals to further support our market growth in years to come. Ensure all sales actions comply with all regulations, policies, and processes. Ability to travel within the assigned territory extensively. Other duties as assigned.  Qualifications: Bachelor's degree preferred in business or a technical discipline. 7+ years of sales experience in director-level position, preferably in the lubricant or related industry. Strong supervisory and leadership skills. Proven ability to drive the sales process from start to finish. Must be able to gain penetration in assigned markets through the development and implementation of proactive sales strategies. Ability to develop rapport with clients, maintain strong working relationships and successfully manage customer expectations. Strong customer-orientation; prompt issue resolution/follow-through. ¬∑        Capable negotiator and exceptional closing skills a must. Ability to explain product features and benefits and familiarity with competitors' products. Must have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills as well as strong computer skills.

This is an opportunity to build a sales organization from the ground up. AIEDU‚Äôs Head of Sales leads the organization‚Äôs efforts to drive recurring revenue through the provision of our curriculum to K-12 school districts, extracurricular programs, and post-secondary institutions, especially community colleges. You will lead the Sales function, reporting directly to the CEO, and be responsible for cultivating and closing key relationships with our pipeline ‚Äî in addition to helping to generate new leads and ensure we are maintaining a robust pipeline of opportunities. This is a remote position, however we anticipate a significant amount of travel to attend conferences and events (pending the safe resumption of in-person travel).  Responsibilities Become fluent in AIEDU‚Äôs product and curriculum offering, and learn to convey the organization‚Äôs mission-driven focus on untapped communities and the Future of Work. Manage the sales cycle from the cold-call to the close; note: we anticipate working with a third party agency to facilitate cold-calls and expect this role to be focused primarily on the close. Build and own the lead generation function Initiate and cultivate relationships with academic decision makers Develop a keen understanding of customer needs and convey those to our Product team Deliver effective sales presentations and product demonstrations over Zoom, Google Meet, and phone calls‚Äîin addition to in-person meetings once they resume Create and update sales collateral, conference activations, product marketing documents, and other content to be used in closing deals with customers Identify key customer segments and refine targeting and prioritization of potential buyers based on research and feedback from meetings Keep our CRM up-to-date to allow for real-time monitoring of sales activities and our current pipeline Oversee AIEDU‚Äôs growth marketing function, occasionally writing blog posts and creating social media content, in addition to managing external vendors and freelancers to support the function. Build and maintain timely and accurate reporting of sales forecasts, active accounts, and growth activities. About You  You are an experienced sales professional with 3-5 years of experience (or more) in direct sales roles in education contexts with a proven track record. You should have an interest in education, technology, and the Future of Work, and also be mission-driven. Exceptional communication, presentation, and relationship building skills are a must. You should be able to tell a good story. You should itch to drive new leads and yearn for the close. Note: a specific background in artificial intelligence is not required for this role, but having familiarity with the technology and its impact on everyday Americans will help you tell our story.  About Us  AIEDU is a 501(c)(3) tech nonprofit working to center equity and accessibility in AI education. AIEDU educates students‚Äîespecially those who are disproportionately impacted by AI systems‚Äîwith the conceptual knowledge and skills they need to thrive as workers, creators, consumers, and citizens. The organization quietly launched with pilots in Ohio and Florida this Spring, and has since scaled to reach more than 20,000 students across 7 states. AIEDU is funded by companies including Google, NVIDIA, Intel, GitHub, American Tower, The J.M. Smucker Co., Akamai, Macy's, Postmates, and Booz Allen Hamilton; our advisory board includes senior leaders from Carnegie Mellon (AI4K12), Stanford, Disney, Nike, Microsoft, and the U.S. Air Force. AIEDU is a two-time semifinalist in the University of Pennsylvania's Education Business Plan Competition; and was selected to participate in the prestigious FastForward Tech Nonprofit Accelerator, and AT&T‚Äôs 2021 Aspire Accelerator.  Equal Employment Opportunity  The AI Education Project is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that building and empowering a diverse team is a strategic imperative in our work, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law. This policy applies with regard to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, compensation, eligibility for benefits and termination. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

description: Full-Time  Overview  We‚Äôre SmileDirectClub, and we believe everyone deserves a smile they‚Äôll love. We also believe that you deserve a job you‚Äôll love. Good thing you found us, and we found you. At SmileDirectClub, we‚Äôre all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. So we‚Äôre spreading smiles and positivity all over the country.  It‚Äôs no small task. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre looking for energetic, passionate, and confident team members who can help turn frowns, into life-changing grins. Are you up for it?  We are looking for a National Sales Training Director to join the SDC Partner Network team . The Sales Training Director is responsible for building and delivering high quality training and development experiences while continually evaluating the effectiveness of the programs. You will plan, direct, lead, manage, and execute the development, design, and delivery of selling skills, clinical knowledge, product skills, competitive knowledge, and management skills programs. Develop programs that lead to increased ability to achieve field sales objectives.  Responsibilities  Identify, design, and implement training programs that will provide the sales organization with the information, content, and tools to help them sell more effectively Ensure the education and preparation of our team members around standardized sales process, internal technologies, procedural workflows, and product knowledge. Work with senior management to align training curriculum with strategic objectives. Work closely with sales management in each market to identify key training objectives and opportunities. Create and manage all sales training programs to include: onboarding new sales representatives, core competency programs and product trainings Create quarterly sales messaging strategies to drive overall business Manage and measure the effectiveness of various training styles such as classroom, web-based module format, workshops, and field based programs to provide recommendations on when and what style should be used based on the needs of the equipment and sales groups Assist marketing and sales in the development of tools, sales aids, sales models and processes designed to prepare and support new and existing sales people in performing job functions. Collaborate with the Professional Education team in the creation and facilitation sales training programs Partner with subject matter experts across the organization for training content. Assess training needs for selling skills, product knowledge, and competitive knowledge. Work in the field, as required, to assess needs and evaluate training effectiveness. Establish standards for new hire training as well as for incumbent sales and management staff. Develop assessment tools to validate and document learning and proficiency. Identify areas for further development and continuous improvement. Develop and implement a knowledge certification program. Develop regional trainers to assist in the delivery of classroom training programs, and provide local expertise. Develop training workshops for sales meetings Strong leadership skills with hands-on experience as an individual contributor, and ideally with building and leading teams. Qualifications  7-10 years successful sales, sales management, and training experience. Must have good facilitation skills to foster a high level of interaction and participation in training sessions Should be a change agent and strong advocate for organization initiatives ‚Äì must possess and portray a positive ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude. Proven effective verbal, computer, written and presentation/communication skills Ability to quickly adapt and respond to job, environmental, and industry changes Demonstrated ability of critical and agile thinking Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM Proficiency in using virtual tools such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams to execute account training and management. Benefits Of Joining The Club  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance 401K with match PTO Aligner and Whitening Benefit Collaborative work environment and positive culture Company Profile  SmileDirectClub was founded on a simple belief: everyone deserves a smile they love. The Company is the first digital brand for straightening your smile, created after the realization that recent trends in 3D printing and telehealth could bring about disruptive change to the invisible aligner market by matching licensed professionals, a quality clear-aligner product, and customers together. By leveraging proprietary, cutting-edge technology, SmileDirectClub, LLC-affiliated dentists are providing greater access of care to consumers who couldn't otherwise afford orthodontic treatment to get a better smile. description: Intoo is seeking a dynamic, talented, and ambitious DIRECTOR, SALES DEVELOPMENT to join our team! This is a key role as we continue to build the Intoo USA team, expand our global footprint and support a rapidly growing team and customer base. We are a 100% virtual organization.   The primary focus of this role will be to serve as a front-line manager to our Sales Development Representative (SDR) team and provide guidance, training with a deep understanding of the entire process for lead generation. This role will report to the EVP of Sales but will inherently collaborate with the marketing team as we scale our top-of-the-funnel growth strategy.   IDEAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES INCLUDE:   Manage ongoing hiring, mentoring, and development of SDRs Develop the sales, product, and industry skills of each team member Motivate team members through creative incentives and developing proposals Own various key performance indicators (KPIs) relating to demand generation and new revenue acquisition and present your team‚Äôs progress periodically with key internal stakeholders Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency, and productivity Partner with senior sales management, marketing, and other business partners to develop a successful pipeline generation strategy Refine and evolve a scalable, measurable, sustainable, and repeatable process for running and growing a team Assist with building and responsible for managing company sales pipeline to deliver accurate forecasting to the EVP of Sales Exceptional ability to collaborate across the full go to market team  A track record of empowering a team to effectively communicate with prospects, including C-level executives Support the sales team by demonstrating how to best generate qualified leads that convert to the sales pipeline Hone and effectively communicate our product pitch within the narrative set by our marketing team Nurture client inquiries and identify opportunities that meet a minimum qualification criterion for sales Understand where prospects are in the buying cycle Guide SDR team on account research to understand the need, enable effective follow-up and generate interest  IDEAL CANDIDATES WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING MINIMUM/PROVEN EXPERIENCE:   A track record of building SDR teams and scaling top of funnel demand, preferably in a startup environment   Proficiency with Salesforce required + ability to support with CRM administration if needed  5 years of experience directly leading a team and strategy responsible for lead generation Motivating and influential service-focused leader  Experience understanding and driving scale in a b2b technology environment preferred Motivated and driven to exceed expectations in a team environment A team player that can work with employees from all departments ‚Äì across multiple time zones  Experience with project management, including the ability to prioritize and manage several projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal skills with high attention to detail A self-starter that thrives in a remote/work-from-home environment   WHAT WE OFFER:  Medical, Vision, Dental and 401(k) Telemedicine and Well-Being Resources   Generous Time Off Policy Work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment  ABOUT US:   Intoo USA is the career development and outplacement flagship for Gi Group, a global leader in HR and talent solutions with 20+ years of experience in delivering high-touch, people-focused programs to more than 20,000 companies around the world. Our focus on personalized, one-on-one coaching and technology innovation enables organizations of all sizes to protect their employer brand throughout the employee lifecycle, with flexible solutions to enhance the candidate experience, career mobility, and workforce transition. Learn more by visiting www.intoo.com and follow us on social media.   Intoo is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

THE OPPORTUNITY  We want to take the Company to the next level and this is where you come in. As a Regional Director, Sales (Nor Cal) on our Sales team, you know how to motivate and run a solid sales team while keeping strong customer partnerships. You know what it means to go above and beyond by driving business results and delivering superior customer service. You‚Äôll provide leadership to our Account Managers in the Northern California region as well as being responsible for business planning and our go-to-market strategy. The role straddles strategy and operations and will serve as a key member of our sales leadership team.  You are a self-starter, organized, adaptable and take the time to understand every aspect of our business. You embrace continuous customer engagement and opportunities to grow your accounts. As a team player, you build strong relationships with accounts to support the growth your team and the business. You have a passion for the cannabis industry and have a good understanding of all our products and offerings. You are proactive and excel at driving sales to enable the business to achieve the next level of growth.  We are looking for someone that has a proven commitment to the cannabis industry by keeping up to date with industry trends and laws. This position will work collaboratively with company leadership, industry partners, sales representatives, operations, and marketing to accelerate revenue growth.  What You Will Be Doing  Account and Relationship Management Develop a strategic and comprehensive business sales plan for the NorCal territory and manage all sales activities. Help your team build strong partnerships with Mothership Agency accounts, fostering growth and long-term relationships. Manage your team's account relationships, evaluating needs with a focus on growing these existing accounts and upselling. Build and protect the quality of Mothership Agency‚Äôs products, sharing extensive product knowledge with your accounts and ensuring products meet the established standards from distribution to the customer.  New Business Development Work with our other sales leaders to devise and implement innovative strategies to attract and engage new accounts within your region. Maintain a pulse on trends across the ever-changing cannabis landscape, evaluate competitor activities, economic indicators, and overall market trends. Create a Go-To-Market plan for product launches Develop leads into opportunities by nurturing relationships, understanding client problems, involving the correct decision-makers, and helping clients understand the Mothership Agency brand offering  Building Business Success Hold regularly scheduled reviews with the sales team to discuss account reports, new opportunities, customer issues, competition, industry updates, new product information Meet established key performance indicators (KPI‚Äòs) for assigned region and track metrics on sales, pricing, accounts and merchandising for your team Collaborate with Marketing, Production, Operations and other key areas to develop lead sources, expand the customer base, and ensure that product availability meets customer demand. Lead, motivate and mentor your territory sales members to drive company goals  We are a start-up, rolling up our sleeves to build something bigger than ourselves. This means that other duties may arise, and we support one another in accomplishing what‚Äôs needed.  The Company  Mothership Agency (Formerly Ember Valley) is a leading cannabis product company in California. We provide branded products throughout the state across multiple product formats ‚Äì jarred flower, pre-rolls, and extracts. Our ethos is and always will be ‚Äúcraft cannabis at scale.‚Äù We launched our brand in April 2019 and in that short time, we have consistently been ranked a top 10 brand in our product categories. We target the connoisseur market ‚Äì our products are all premium priced. We are a product first company ‚Äì for Mothership Agency, quality is everything.  We currently operate two indoor cultivation facilities that represent over 110,000 square feet. Additionally, we are constructing a purpose-built 40,000 square foot manufacturing facility, where we will centralize processing, packaging, distribution, and manufacturing.  Who You Are  Requirements Strong negotiation skills and a large book of business A passion for the cannabis industry and delivering value to the customer Ability to work seamlessly with multiple internal and external partners Born leader with a passion for creating and managing a successful high-performing sales team Minimum 7 years experience with at least 3 years experience in a management position. Experience in liquor and beverage, consumer products, or cannabis is a huge plus. Strong use of CRM and Microsoft office. Organized and prioritize your work to meet deadlines, adapting to unexpected priorities. Excellent communication, time management and people skills Able to excel in an unstructured, start-up environment, and bring an element of precision and organization. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration or a related field.  Benefits Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays) Training & Development Work From Home
