description: Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Principal Account Executive to join an exciting and rapidly growing team responsible for bringing Amazon Care to new enterprise customers. The Principal Account Executive is responsible for prospecting directly into Large Enterprise benefit buyers and also building and growing relationships with consultants and brokers on a local, regional and national scope. This role works closely with product, marketing and clinicals teams to deliver ROI for our customers. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations and work backwards to deliver on their health and productivity goals. You should be a self-starter who is not afraid to ‚Äòget hands dirty‚Äô with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers‚Äô biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is re-imagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon‚Äôs virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon‚Äôs culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we‚Äôre building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities include Build sales opportunities with benefit buyers through inbound lead generation as well as self-generated outbound prospecting Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to deliver healthcare innovation Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography  Basic Qualifications 10+ years of professional experience in large enterprise business solution sales or business development, selling : 1/ healthcare services directly to employee benefit buyers or through broker-consultants in any industry or 2/ selling b2b services to enterprise clients within the Healthcare sector 7+ years experience with prospecting, identifying, pursuing, and closing new opportunities BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Completed MBA or advanced Business Degree Experience working in healthcare sales including point solution organizations Thrives in early-stage, start-up environments Energized by being an industry pioneer and innovator Proven success in building relationships using a consultative, solutions-focused approach Passion for prospecting, qualifying and negotiating net-new opportunities System and analytics skills include: 1/ Microsoft Excel for business cases analyses 2/ SFDC for customer opportunity management and account planning and 3/ Collaboration hardware and software for virtual customer-facing meetings Strong business writing and verbal presentation skills including story telling in both formats Familiar with Healthcare economics, total cost of care, value-based care, and reimbursement methodologies Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-task driven environment Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent business judgment Mentors sales team members Sets the bar for high team standards Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution Drives innovation for their team and broader organization Thinks big and has convictions Is action and results-oriented and self-reliant Is analytical and structured For Colorado-based jobs: The pay range for this position in Colorado is $233k to $306k/yr; however, base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. For more information regarding Amazon benefits, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/benefits. Applicants should apply via Amazon‚Äôs internal or external careers site.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1748344

description: Director, Sales  This position is in the Chicago, Atlanta, or Dallas areas.  The Director of Sales position reports to the President. He/she will be responsible for driving direct sales revenue, supporting selected partner-driven opportunities, and working closely with the Customer Success team to ensure successful customer adoption and expansion. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in supply chain planning or network design software sales in the Manufacturing, CPG, Life Sciences and/or Natural Resources industries.  Responsibilities  Prospect, build pipeline, and drive software revenues working directly with target accounts. Develop an Account Plan and penetration model for Targets, then drive the execution of that plan to success. Support selected partner sales cycles, where River Logic takes the lead Collaborate and support the Customer Success team to drive customer adoption of the software, and subsequent expansion, including information through and after the sales cycle Work closely with Sales Engineering and Marketing to fine-tune the targeting, messaging, positioning, and customer engagement approach Log opportunities and information in the CRM system in a timely, complete, and accurate manner Forecasting accurately (benchmark +/- 10%) Provide feedback to Management on product/solution roadmap priorities, pricing and any ideas that would improve efficiency and outcomes  Required Skills & Experience:  5+ years of experience selling network design, supply chain planning, manufacturing footprint, or related applications into Manufacturing, CPG, Life Sciences and/or Natural Resources industries Strong executive presence Successful track record delivering revenues at or above quota Prior experience in Sales Engineering or Consulting a plus Excellent client management and communication skills Undergraduate in engineering and MBA degrees a strong plus Familiarity with optimization (linear programming) a plus  Compensation  The compensation for this position will be market-based and incentive/merit-based driven. The total package will include base salary, health insurance benefits, and cash bonuses and/or stock options for achieving mutually agreed-upon objectives.  Applications  To apply for this position, please submit a cover letter and your updated CV, including target salary and compensation requirements, to careers@riverlogic.com.

Job Description Summary  In your role as the Strategic Development Leader, X-ray, you will be responsible for driving growth in our largest and most strategic accounts, such as GPO partnerships, government accounts, national accounts and channel partners.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world. Promote the business value proposition of GE technology. Works in close cooperation with regional sales, account sales and commercial proposal staff. Primary technical role involved in DTI (demand to inquiry): aim at increasing market penetration through technical support during pre-ITO. Developing specialized knowledge of latest commercial developments in own area and communication skills to influence others. Has working knowledge of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses judgment to make decisions or solve moderately complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Takes new perspective on existing solutions. Uses technical experience and expertise for data analysis to support recommendations. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: The Opportunity  Join the $4.3B workforce management industry with an established platform that is poised for significant growth. Unifocus is a best in class dynamic workforce management platform serving the hotel, restaurant, retail and healthcare industries. With innovation at its core, Unifocus is rapidly expanding through new product development and entry into new, lucrative markets. We are looking for an energetic leader that can help scale an established company with a solid foundation to $100M in the next 3 years.  Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the National Sales Director will join a strong team that values collaboration, communication and transparency. This role is accountable for driving profitable growth by developing geographically identified account prospects into customers using market development sales activities. The National Sales Director will develop and lead a dynamic, results-oriented go-to-market strategy in tune with the complexities of growing revenue by identifying, targeting, designing and selling the top named prospects and customers that can find value in UniFocus products and services.  Focused on accelerating customer acquisition, increasing expansion in key customers and maintain customer retention, the National Sales Director will develop a measurable, scalable, high-velocity, and proactive sales approach supported by a savvy market development and demand generation strategy. He/she will be responsible for covering the territory and developing the necessary resources to attain aggressive growth targets. This individual will spearhead UNIFOCUS‚Äôs response to RFP opportunities in their assigned region.  Strategic Value  Generate revenue for UniFocus through new customer acquisition and expansion within existing customers. The job of a UniFocus Sales Director is to cross sell, upsell and expand our customer base in an assigned territory.  Job Description Prospect new accounts based on an internal fit for UniFocus Engage in marketing initiatives for outbound activity such as email campaigns, social media, and trade shows when applicable to your territory. Meet with new prospects: live meetings, online meetings, conference calls, events, webinars and other initiatives to educate prospects on the value proposition of UniFocus. Convert new accounts to grow revenue. Expand product solutions with existing customers to improve wallet share. Consult with key customers to expand UniFocus revenues in the assigned territory. Properly account for all opportunities with documentation in UniFocus CRM. The Role  Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the National Sales Director will join a strong Sales Team that values collaboration, communication and transparency. The National Sales Director is accountable for driving profitable growth by developing geographically identified account prospects into customers using the UniFocus Opportunity Management (OM) process and market development sales activities. The National Sales Director develops and leads a dynamic, results-oriented go-to-market strategy in tune with the complexities of growing revenue by identifying, targeting, designing and selling the top named prospects and customers that can find value in UniFocus products and services.  Qualifications & Education Requirements Possess high energy and activity levels Strong attention to deadlines and detail Capable of handling multiple tasks simultaneously and performing with minimal supervision Ability to articulate complex scenarios, simplifying them as needed Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to communicate with high level executives Robust oral and written communication and presentation skills, including preparing proposals Possess a ‚ÄúHunter‚Äù versus a ‚ÄúFarmer‚Äù mentality (selling to new logos versus account management) Proven experience selling SaaS to companies with greater than 5,000 employees Minimum 5 years of experience selling enterprise applications to C-Level executives, including, but not limited to, Workforce Management, Human Capital Management, Supply Chain Management, and/or ERP solutions Significant use of Salesforce Sales Cloud or other enterprise CRM solution College degree in sales, business, marketing, hospitality, or related field with commensurate experience also considered. About UniFocus  Company Overview  UniFocus provides significant competitive advantages to owners and operators of labor-intensive, service-oriented businesses, with a particular focus on full-service hospitality, restaurants, and other similar verticals. Our offering helps them quickly increase asset value by reducing labor costs while improving operational effectiveness, team engagement, customer loyalty, and guest satisfaction. The unique combination of better software - dynamic labor scheduling, time and attendance, and real-time performance evaluations - along with outstanding consulting services and a performance guarantee make it the most effective and reliable integrated solution for optimizing workforce performance.  Learn more here: https://www.UniFocus.com/  About The Riverside Company  UniFocus is now backed by The Riverside Company, a global private equity firm focused on acquiring growing businesses. Since its founding in 1988, Riverside has invested in more than 750 companies, and currently includes more than 120 companies within its portfolio with over $10 billion in assets under management. The Riverside Company is notable among private equity firms for its collaborative approach, extensive infrastructure, committed resources to help companies achieve operational excellence; and is proud of its record of helping businesses grow rapidly in a principled, ethical manner.  Learn more here: https://www.riversidecompany.com/

description: VETCBD is on the hunt for a talented and experienced Head of Sales to lead our sales department. We need a self-motivated professional with proven managerial experience and an outstanding track record in sales. In this position, you will be responsible for meeting our annual sales targets within assigned regions and accounts.  Your duties will include coaching and developing our sales team, designing strategic sales plans, seeing them through execution, and assessing costs and competition. In addition to being an excellent communicator, our ideal candidate will also demonstrate exceptional negotiation and leadership skills.  This position is remote although candidates must live in California.   Cannabis industry and/or CPG experience is preferred for this role.  Responsibilities:  Lead, motivate and develop the sales team. Design and implement strategic plans to reach sales targets. Cultivate lasting relationships with customers to grow customer loyalty. Develop and promote weekly, monthly and quarterly sales objectives. Draft detailed and accurate sales reports. Work with customers to better understand their business needs and goals. Assess costs, competition, and supply and demand to identify selling prices. Estimate sales volume and profit for current and new products. Establish a sales training program to train new employees.   Requirements:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, business administration or a relevant field. A minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role. Experience with Quickbase (CRM) is a plus  In-depth knowledge of marketing techniques and best practices. Capacity to manage various projects and work to tight deadlines. Excellent negotiation and leadership skills. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

DocMatter is an ambitious, growth-stage company that is changing the face of collaboration for the medical community and is hiring exceptional individuals that want to contribute to that mission. We are fast becoming a household name among clinicians worldwide who consistently rely on the DocMatter platform to connect with their peers, learn from experts, gain insights, and stay up to date with the latest clinical data, best practices, and therapeutic innovations in medicine. Our goal is to bring our innovative platform to every clinician in the world.  As the Director of Sales, you will be managing the team responsible for selling the DocMatter platform to both medical device/pharmaceutical companies and medical associations. The current team consists of three mid-market account executives and one SDR. While you will be managing and growing a team of individual contributors, you will be expected to co-lead key client and prospect meetings as well as provide ongoing coaching and training to each salesperson to ensure quota attainment and professional development.  All stakeholders in medicine benefit from improved collaboration. To be successful in this role, you must be able to effectively communicate the complex but extremely compelling value proposition of the DocMatter platform.  Hear what our doctors are saying: Clinician Testimonial Video  Responsibilities Own and continue evolving sales team plan and goals Oversee day-to-day sales team activities and objectives as well as identify individual employee performance goals and measures Work with internal Operations to identify, recruit, and hire world-class enterprise sales team Provide strategic guidance to Account Executives on complex sales cycles in mid-market and enterprise accounts Co-lead client and prospect meetings and presentations Oversee ongoing maintenance of sales pipeline and provide accurate monthly sales forecasts As part of the DocMatter leadership team, you will present department metrics and outputs to executive leadership and during company-wide meetings Embody the DocMatter values  Requirements 2+ years managing sales teams 5+ years of direct sales experience selling enterprise solutions - selling into markets such as Healthcare, Pharmaceutical, and Medical Devices is a plus! Bachelor‚Äôs degree and/or equivalent work experience Consistent quota attainment in mid-market and/or enterprise sales as both an individual contributor and manager Management training Passion for and experience coaching and developing sales talent Excellent interpersonal, presentation, written and communication skills Strong organizational skills with software systems, processes, forecasting and cross-functional collaboration Ability to travel domestically up to 25% of time  Benefits  DocMatter provides a peer-to-peer collaboration platform that facilitates knowledge transfer across a global network of highly engaged healthcare professionals to provide life-changing patient outcomes. We are well on our way, but new hires are early enough that you will still be able to play a pivotal role in advancing our mission.  We are currently sheltering in place, and working remotely, but we are normally based out of our San Francisco headquarters a few blocks from the Ferry Building. Most employees work out of the same office, providing you an opportunity to learn, collaborate, and bond with extremely talented, intelligent, and mission-driven colleagues.  All full-time roles include series A equity with significant upside and health, dental and vision, long-term disability, and life insurance.  Our employees are passionate about elevating the practice of medicine and our seasoned leadership team has a breadth of experience across industry and research. Come and join some of the smartest minds in San Francisco tackling one of the great opportunities to advance the global medical field!  DocMatter Values  Mission-Driven Our singular focus is improving patient outcomes through scalable collaboration We provide personalized support to clinicians, empowering them with our technology We accelerate the adoption of best practices by enabling continuous knowledge-sharing across medicine We believe deeply in our work supporting a global Community of clinicians  People-First We treat each other with respect, kindness, and empathy no matter what We always assume best intent when disagreeing, or working through challenges We care about our people, and consistently recognize good work We are inclusive, and foster an environment of belonging  Operational Excellence We believe in process, measurement, and continuous improvement We set ambitious goals and embody grit, determination, and perseverance in achieving them We share resources and work together to solve problems We are responsive, punctual, and prepared  Collaboration We are clear, concise, and professional in speech and writing to colleagues and customers We ask for help when we need it, and prioritize helping each other We are proactive, honest, and constructive in our communication internally and externally We maintain composure in stressful situations  Accountability We do our best work, and hold each other to high standards We are transparent and question actions inconsistent with our values We regularly collect and share feedback We focus on measurable results
industries: Medical Devices, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Description  Nikola is looking for an experienced Director, Business Development to manage key accounts for Nikola‚Äôs zero emission electric vehicles, including the onboarding of new customers. Someone with a proven track record of success in heavy duty or freight operations, and/or a commercial vehicle OEM Sales or BD.  The ideal candidate will have a passion for cultivating mutually beneficial relationships with customers, clean transportation, and building programs at scale that can transform industries. You will be familiar with a typical start-up environment complimented by experience working within larger companies as it relates to process and planning.  The Job And Its Requirements  You‚Äôll be responsible for building and maintaining strong, long-lasting customer relationships with decision makers and influencers within customers organizations to assist them with transitioning to zero emission vehicles. This will include end-to-end accountability from customers‚Äô testing of the vehicles through integration into their operation, as well as management of ongoing sales opportunities.  You Will Identify potential customers in the target market and complete appropriate research on the prospective customer‚Äôs business and equipment needs Develop and maintain relationships with customers Negotiate contract terms with customers Collaborate with design, engineering and service teams to ensure product is delivered on time and on spec Become a subject matter expert on our business products and operations, as well as industry developments to ensure a match between product offering and customer expectations Provide strong customer service and analyze performance metrics to achieve customer and business objectives Identify, analyze, prioritize, and successfully resolve fleet customer problems giving a high priority to customer satisfaction Develop relationships and strategies to successfully achieve new sales Keeps up with current and possible future policies, practices, trends in the organization, with competition, and in the marketplace  You Have University degree in business, engineering or related field, plus 10+ years of demonstrated applicable work experience Proven work experience in fleet environment, preferable heavy duty or freight/delivery operation, and/or a commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturer (OEM) Demonstrated ability to establish effective, ethical working relationships with fleet customers Exceptional communication skills both verbal and written, including the ability to plan, organize and deliver professional formal presentations Strong financial acumen to understand key financial indicators and broad finance instruments including terms, types and usage as they pertain to customers Proven track record of excellent customer service skills and management capacity for large complex projects Experience in sustainability, alternative fuels and/or vehicles are assets Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to identify and develop new ideas and initiatives, able to turn ideas into practical working systems and procedures, creative and hands-on mentality Proven ability to work in a fast paced, highly matrixed and dynamic environment Candidates must have current U.S. work authorization or be TN eligible from Mexico or Canada. description: Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Principal Account Executive to join an exciting and rapidly growing team responsible for bringing Amazon Care to new enterprise customers. The Principal Account Executive is responsible for prospecting directly into Large Enterprise benefit buyers and also building and growing relationships with consultants and brokers on a local, regional and national scope. This role works closely with product, marketing and clinicals teams to deliver ROI for our customers. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations and work backwards to deliver on their health and productivity goals. You should be a self-starter who is not afraid to ‚Äòget hands dirty‚Äô with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers‚Äô biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is re-imagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon‚Äôs virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon‚Äôs culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we‚Äôre building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities include  Build sales opportunities with benefit buyers through inbound lead generation as well as self-generated outbound prospecting  Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to deliver healthcare innovation  Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs  Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography   Basic Qualifications 10+ years of professional experience in large enterprise business solution sales or business development, selling : 1) healthcare services employee to benefit buyers or broker-consultants in any industry or 2) selling b2b services to enterprise clients within the Healthcare sector 5+ years experience with prospecting, identifying, pursuing, and closing new opportunities BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Completed MBA or advanced Business Degree Experience working in healthcare sales including point solution organizations Thrives in early-stage, start-up environments Energized by being an industry pioneer and innovator Proven success in building relationships using a consultative, solutions-focused approach Passion for prospecting, qualifying and negotiating net-new opportunities System and analytics skills including: 1/ Microsoft Excel for business cases analyses 2/ SFDC for customer opportunity management and 3/ Collaboration hardware and software for virtual customer-facing meetings Strong business writing and verbal presentation skills including story telling in both formats Familiar with Healthcare economics, total cost of care, value-based care, and reimbursement methodologies Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-task driven environment Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent business judgment Has high standards Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution Expects and requires innovation of their team Thinks big and has convictions Is action and results-oriented and self-reliant Is analytical and structured Works backwards from customer KPIs and outcomes Has the innate ability to inspire passion in others Location: San Francisco  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1740354

jobTitle: Global Sales Planning and Process Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving complex problems with limited resources. We are looking for someone to enable the Revenue organization to grow and operate more effectively through planning and globally consistent standards and processes. You will manage resource allocation and project investment to optimize ROI and partner cross-functionally to identify the needs to support, scale, and measure our business.  You Will Lead the quarterly target setting and annual planning process across Rev Ops, Marketing, and Sales and recommend and guide where we invest in resources and projects to enable growth and productivity Align Global GTM team priorities Design and refresh processes to enable scale; work ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù with other central operations partners on standard processes to support delivery of targets, segmentation, territory management, reporting, etc. Interlock and streamline Rev Ops/GTM initiatives and operating structures, driving synergy Proactively review and identify opportunities for how we can grow our business or operate more efficiently through innovation and automation Develop strong working relationships with Stripes across levels and functions Leverage internal and external insights to make data-driven recommendations We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of experience in planning, strategy, business operations, management consulting, investment banking, or a related discipline A strong track record of delivering major, complex projects in ambiguous environments An ability to simplify, structure, and diagnose problems Experience implementing solutions, not just setting strategy A high degree of comfort working quickly in a high growth, fast-paced environment An ability to seamlessly transition from the high level to very detailed, and willingness to ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù Experience working in a sales and marketing organization Prior experience with payments You Should Include These In Your Application LinkedIn profile and resume

description: Description  Responsibilities  Business & Sales Acumen & Management Geography-based; a Regional Sales Director is assigned to each Partner Channel Region. Assessment of BRM activities within the Region. Coaching where appropriate. Overall management of Partners & Agencies, in coordination with BRM's in the Director's downline. Communication of strategic direction to BRM, AE attached to the Agency or Partner. Manage resources available to achieve sales/growth results as well as operational goals (including Clinical engagement, bid planning, retention, Provider engagement and Humana Pharmacy utilization). Develop external market and national engagement and sales strategy in coordination with BRMs, career markets, telesales managers, operations director and national sales strategy director. description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Role  LatAM is an important region for Cloudflare. We are looking for our Head of LatAM Sales to help us invest and grow and will be responsible for driving Cloudflare's revenue in the region.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive regional sales growth through successful leadership, organizational planning, customer service, and outstanding execution of all regional go-to-market programs (enterprise sales, customer success, solutions engineering, business development, support, and field marketing). Grow and build the LatAM team and drive the local hiring needs for LatAM by working with America's functional leadership and recruiting resources, ensuring we have proper leadership development-succession planning in place across all teams. Build and internally evangelize a plan for local hiring in-region to drive better adoption of our platform through enterprise accounts. Drive greater adoption of our platform through key strategic partners like IBM and Systems Integrators in the region, as well as reseller partners. Design, build and execute strategies for the LatAM market in collaboration with regional and global functional leaders. Interject as the single point of contact for all LatAM operational concerns, ensuring proper and timely escalation and resolution. Ensure that corporate policy and regulatory initiatives are consistently applied and followed by LatAM team members Inspire interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and affect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù Drive business cadence for forecast calls, functional review meetings, deal review, customer account reviews, weekly team meetings and periodic company-wide kick-offs Represent Cloudflare as appropriate at external conferences, media and PR events. Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Sales growth-oriented leader who drives rapid change and growth and possesses 10+ years of relevant, regional or country leadership in SaaS/Cloud software platforms Deep experience and relationships with the SaaS/Cloud community in LatAM, able to establish, build and grow strong relationships. Enterprise/corporate market rich experience including having a well-regarded reputation in the LatAM market and strong connections/relationships with large enterprise customers. Exceptional collaboration, relationship-building, and interpersonal skills ‚Äì with the ability to develop working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside Cloudflare. Ability to define, develop and lead go-to-market programs in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Curious, empathetic, fast learner who thrives in a high-growth, continuous change environment. Bilingual required with trilingual preferred - English, Spanish and Portuguese What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

description: Director of Sales, Americas Electronics and Chemicals, Morris Plains, NJ  The DOS Americas mission is to drive Revenue and OI growth through functional excellence throughout HEM/RC/FEC in the America‚Äôs by aligning the customer facing organizations with the processes, training, tools and information to achieve top performance in their respective roles and differentiate Advanced Materials/E&C products & services in customer segments served. This eventual promotional advancement based on performance in role will require a move to Morris Plains NJ to take on one of the Global Head of Sales Roles. Candidate must be willing to relocate at some future date for the promotion as this position is designed as a Senior Management feeder role.  Key Responsibilities  Develop and coordinate alignment on a set of common tools and the best practice application for Sales recruitment, on boarding, training, ongoing sales skills development, talent pipeline management, Sales Leadership coaching, and recognition of Sales performance to reward and recognize consistent levels of achievement across the Sales community  Develop and maintain a common scorecard & KPIs regarding the salesforce‚Äôs capability and drive the training & resource actions required to attain next step maturity improvements  Lead the E&C Americas SalesForce.com CRM strategy and drive lead management from customer acquisition to closure ‚Äì track and implement actions to improve win / loss ratio  Lead the E&C Salesforce.com PRM channel portal for RC Americas  Matrix manage and help design the E&C technical support team/ function.Implementing KPIs and scorecards to track performance against the customer experience  Develop and deploy common cross- E&C learning management modules and planning tools that cover all capabilities regarding professional sales operations, account planning, salesforce deployment and sales management skills  Perform competency assessment of sales staff to enable tailoring of training to meet their needs  Provide necessary information and best practices to the sales force to drive for top performance, growing faster than the industry  Identify ongoing additional areas to improve sales growth, release more customer time for the Salesforce and simplify steps that reduce the overall selling cost to serve; champion and implement cross-functional initiatives to baseline and implement smart investments in common processes and capabilities  Track Sales force productivity and drive productivity goals  Personally, involve self in key customer account pursuits, where material to E&C and support is necessary. Manage the Customer Experience ‚Äì NPS (Net Promoter Score Survey Process  Key Success Factors (Key Metrics / KPIs / Deliverables)  Implementing global AM Sales KPIs, executing on pipeline management to meet business financial targets  Evaluating, developing, and retaining top sales talent across E&C  Testing and improvement of account plans and territory plans  Planning and facilitating Sales training and development plans  Strong NPS/ Customer Experience metrics and tech support scores  Hit Revenue and OI targets for the Americas  Decision Making Authority  Works at the senior leadership level making decisions on behalf of the Global Head of Sales for E&C  Responsible for execution of programs at the LOB level  Must Haves  Qualifications  BS in Business or Engineering  Nice To Haves  10-15 years‚Äô experience in customer facing roles (Marketing, Sales, General Management)  Business leadership experience (P&L management understanding)  Good understanding of the organization and importance of collaboration  Understanding of industry goals, objectives, strategies, and competitive situation  Expert in the common sales processes  Knowledge of change management tools and practices  Knowledge of sales training techniques in the market  Distribution Experience  Direct Customer Experience  Professional Skills/Knowledge  Ability to establish and maintain influential relationships at all levels in the business  Cultural awareness, working effectively across broad geographies  Achieves engagement with influence skills ‚Ä¶ get things done without direct reporting lines  Owns the assigned projects  Ability to translate sales related needs into a solution  Excellent communication and presentation skills  Good at managing projects and task prioritization  Ability to assess common processes and needs and recommend changes were needed  Create, adapt and drive change  Process mind set oriented  Ability to be a leader and a team player  Ability to motivate and excite the sales force  Behavior Competencies  Sales Process Management  Ability to acquire and apply knowledge of Honeywell‚Äôs sales processes, tools, and techniques  Ability to manage sales activity, budgeting, and forecasting  Communication / Presentation Skills  Ability to communicate effectively with customers and the salesforce; this includes preparing and delivering presentations and written communications as well as displaying active listening skills  Account Management  Ability to manage key accounts and proactively seek opportunities to extend products and services to customers  Customer Relationships  Ability to interact with customers, manage their expectations and build long-term partnerships  Solutions / Service Knowledge  Ability to apply knowledge of Honeywell‚Äôs services and products to develop solutions that meet customer requirements  Business Understanding & Market Knowledge  Ability to build an understanding of the customer‚Äôs business, industry, and commercial environment to then identify viable opportunities  PMT102021  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD137998 Category: Sales Location: 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Company Description  Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that‚Äôs built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID¬Æ, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon‚Äôs award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world‚Äôs top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg.  Job Description  About CitrusAd  Launched in 2016, CitrusAd was purposely built with a retailer-first focus creating incremental revenue opportunities through a best-in-class technology platform and a services division to create and develop leading Publisher Monetization programs. This winning combination of tech and highly experienced services allow us to unleash the potential of online shelf space, where CitrusAd effectively turns retailer websites into highly targeted and effective marketing platforms - changing the way in which retailers, advertisers and customers manage and experience e-commerce.  Just 12 months after its product launch, the CitrusAd platform was adopted by more than 36 global retailers in 22 countries reaching more than 300 million customers through 30 billion website page views.  CitrusAd is globally headquartered out of Brisbane, Australia. Our North American headquarters is in St. Petersburg, Florida. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and many of our team members work remotely in many areas of the world. In North America, a large majority of our team is located in Florida with many others in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York, Atlanta, Pennsylvania, Toronto-CA, Vermont and more.  At CitrusAd we run on collaboration and teamwork. We‚Äôre committed to fueling our team members‚Äô passion for creativity, community involvement and work/life balance. After all, it‚Äôs our people that take us from great to incredible. If you thrive in a creative, fun, teamwork atmosphere, this job may be for you!  Characteristics We Look For An eager, go-getter with a roll up your sleeves ‚Äúget it done‚Äù approach A desire to learn, grow and develop within your role and the organization Genuine interest in digital and the power of effective marketing Your Role and Impact to Success  Purpose  The Senior Director or Director of Sales role will be positioned as a part of our growing retail media team specifically within our newest retailer team, Lowe‚Äôs. This team member will drive sales and manage client relationships in the Home Improvement, CPG and / or Electronics categories across our Sponsored Product and Display Ad technology media platform. The ideal candidate should have a proven history of exceeding sales goals and existing in-roads with media contacts in these categories and agencies. Past experience in ecommerce media and sponsored search are a plus.  Duties And Responsibilities Generate revenue and strive to exceed target quota Utilize networks & tools to identify & contact prospective supplier contacts Offer smart client research, trends & ideas (i.e. valid business reasons) to drive interest & cultivate relationships Dissect each brand organization to uncover different rivers of funding (shopper marketing, brand, ecommerce, national media agency) with the intent to simultaneously unlock and elevate each relationship Own a room (even virtually) ‚Äì present dynamically and instill confidence to challenge our clients in a kind, smart and creative way to ensure we are doing what is best for both businesses long-term Analyze campaign performance statistics and recommend performance enhancements Collaborate with internal teams (account management, ad operations, creative, analytics, development) to ensure a seamless experience for both the retailer & suppliers Communicate with retailer teams regarding ‚ÄúVIP‚Äù account outreach, pipeline, messaging + SKU prioritization, URL confirmation, etc. Track outreach & sales activity pipeline using HubSpot ‚Äì participate in a weekly pipeline call with the retailer Qualifications  Strengths  With a focus on sales strategy and operational excellence, this role will require: Working knowledge of retail, eCommerce and digital monetization programs Proficient knowledge in digital ad monetization & sales Strong leadership qualities ‚Äì trust, loyalty, empathy, forward thinking, self-starter Clear, concise and proactive communication skills + prompt response times Strong organization skills ‚Äì proving the ability to prioritize to ensure deadlines are met Ability to problem solve focused on being solution oriented Qualifications 5+ years‚Äô experience in advertising, media sales and/or business development Comfortable with DSP, DMP, PMP terminology & discussion BA/BS degree in marketing, business or related field Post COVID travel to Lowe‚Äôs HQ and/or Supplier/Agency offices Additional Information  Great People, Deserve Great Benefits  We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon‚Äôs policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.  Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.  For San Francisco Bay and Los Angeles Areas: Epsilon will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles‚Äô Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901-4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.  REF122290R

description: We heard you might be looking for a new opportunity! sunday might be the perfect stop for you. Just in case you haven't heard, sunday is an exciting and thriving FinTech (or FunTech) startup that's changing the way payments are made in restaurants across the world. We are saving millions of people minutes at the end of their meal with the simple scan of a tiny 4x4cm QR code. The coolest thing is we are growing quickly and possibly have the perfect position for you.  Head of Partnerships  at sunday (View all jobs)  We are happy that you are considering applying!  Tip: As the first step is just about submitting your resume, we advise you to carefully review the requirements below, and update your resume to best reflect how your profile fits the role.  Good luck!  The position  As Head of Partnerships, you will have one of the most strategic roles at sunday: establishing and developing sunday's relationships with Point of Sale solutions (e.g. Micros, NCR, Toast, Lightspeed etc‚Ä¶) and building strategic alliances with major partners in the food and beverage industry (e.g. Sysco, Coca-Cola, Diageo etc‚Ä¶). Your role is to accelerate business for sunday and find new expansion opportunities to either increase sunday's restaurant base or increase adoption of our payment solution for end users.  You will be a senior spokesperson and representative of sunday towards other brands.  You will be reporting to the CEO US of Sunday.  Job tasks: Be responsible for driving sunday's exponential growth through identifying, engaging and closing enterprise-level commercial partnerships with Point of Sale solutions and major players in the hospitality, food and beverage industry Be sunday's key partnership strategist, ideating the most creative ways to formulate and negotiate strategic growth partnerships Build senior relationships and leverage your existing network for the benefit of sunday Drive cross-functional projects including Product, Sales, Legal, Global and Local Marketing teams  Who we look for: 10+ years of experience in a similar role in partnerships or business development in the FoodTech or FinTech space (experience with Point of Sale solutions in a plus) Passionate about building strategic relationships and finds motivation when working with partners to grow the business together A strong global network, experienced in C-level engagement Strong commercial and legal negotiation skills Creative mindset who can imagine new business models and think outside the box Strong management skills: Be able to independently build, own and lead a team Analytical ability combined with operational rigor Ability to work closely with internal teams, notably Sales and Operations to solve Restaurant Partner's problems Native English speaker with additional languages a plus  What We Offer Competitive salary and stock options Position with flexibility: partial remote or in office (including internationally) 100% health coverage for you and equal parental leave policy  Steps in our recruiting process: Share your story: Application with resume and questions Amaze your future colleagues with a case study Meet with people from other departments and understand our culture Let's get to know each other through an in-depth interview with hiring manager Offer: we want you!  Thank you for taking the time to apply, and looking forward to get to know you!  sunday is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

description: We are looking for a Director of Sales to join our rapidly growing team. This person will be given the budget to build a team and will need to meet and exceed sales objectives quickly and efficiently. Kizen is a new company competing in one of the largest markets in the world with unlimited upward growth potential. For the right person, this is the opportunity of a lifetime.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We‚Äôve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before.    Key Responsibilities. Harness your inner entrepreneur to take on large entrenched competitors with multi-decade brand recognition Tenaciously identify and pursue new business in a specific industry/geographic segment; unaffected by obstacles Grow your customer segment and exceed sales targets Manage and grow a team of 6+ sales team members, including professional development and career advancement Attract, hire, motivate, and retain top-tier sales professionals for your team Relentlessly strive for continuous improvement that positively impacts the world  Required Qualifications. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent 5 years of experience in Sales acquiring new customers 2 years experience leading teams Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and teams Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems  Preferred Qualifications. 10+ years exemplary track record in Sales acquiring new customers 5+ years experience leading teams Experience selling CRM, Marketing Automation, Business Intelligence, Project Management, or similar  At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life‚Äôs work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

We‚Äôre looking for a dynamic, strategic leader to take our Sales Ops team to new heights!  About Gusto  Gusto is a modern, online people platform that helps small businesses take care of their teams. On top of full-service payroll, Gusto offers health insurance, 401(k)s, expert HR, and team management tools. Today, Gusto offices in Denver, San Francisco, and New York serve more than 100,000 businesses nationwide.  Our mission is to create a world where work empowers a better life, and it starts right here at Gusto. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to building a collaborative and inclusive workplace, both physically and virtually. Learn more about our Total Rewards philosophy.  Our Sales Operations team focuses on driving acquisition through end-to-end funnel insights and optimization, enablement, pricing and analytics. As a leader on this team, you will play a critical role in developing the strategy, capabilities and operational rigor for our high growth sales team. Equal parts strategy and execution - you flex naturally to both modes of thinking, and empower a team of like-minded, high potential sales ops business partners to power a disciplined yet creative SalesOps team. Candidates should align with our company values, be highly self-motivated to drive results, and have an insatiable desire to learn and grow to solve the business problems they face.  Here‚Äôs What You‚Äôll Do Day To Day Strategic advisor to Sales and RevOps leadership: Support and volley decisions about go-to-market needs, programs, and operational needs with leadership. Live and breathe acquisition: Represent sales in xf projects with marketing, product and business technology teams to outsell all of our competitors Obsess about speed to lead and conversion: Diagnose process and tool improvements that lead to better outcomes: higher conversion rates, sales efficiency, better Gustie user experience and better customer experience Enable sales to hit the numbers: Advise on comp design and implement best-in-class incentives to motivate our reps to overachieve sales targets. Deliver tools and projects that enable us to WIN: Inform pipeline management best practices, and metrics / analytics to enable sales productivity. Translate pain points into comprehensive business requirements and projects Deeply understand our business drivers: Partner with our other RevOps team members, Finance team, and Marketing team to develop sales metrics and forecasts. Here‚Äôs What We‚Äôre Looking For 10+ years of strategy, ops, or analytical experience; ideally 5+ in sales or business operations. Experience at a fast-paced technology company preferred. You‚Äôre passionate about Sales Ops and GTM strategy - you‚Äôve done it right to help high potential, high velocity sales orgs scale, and you know how to avoid the pitfalls Persuasive communicator - you‚Äôre a natural storyteller, using data to back up your recommendations Adaptable; you flex naturally between influencing leadership, inspiring those you empower to think big, and rolling up your sleeves to get things done True passion for sales: you creatively find ways to make sales teams more productive. Hyper-organized with strong attention to detail; effective stakeholder and project management is the bare minimum and is part of your secret sauce You enjoy working with high octane growth companies, where things move fast, people are smart, and processes are quick to evolve - in fact, you‚Äôre often the one who moves them It‚Äôs exciting to empower a smart crew of like-minded, sales ops professionals - you‚Äôll challenge the team to greater than the sum of its parts Our cash compensation amount for this role is targeted at $129,000-$164,000/yr in Denver & most remote locations, and $152,000-$192,000/yr for San Francisco & New York. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above.  Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.  Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@gusto.com.

jobTitle: Vice President of Sales and Business Development -- Entrepreneurial Leadership Required!
description: I will make this job description very simple: Build and lead Starboard's sales and marketing effort.  Minimum requirements are very simple also: Proven record in selling supply chain solutions at an enterprise level--extra credit for specializing in Supply Chain Design.  If You Are Still Interested, Read On  Do you want to join a new and growing supply chain software company that is going to be the leader in its category? Are you willing to take risk in order to gain a huge reward? Check out Starboard and let us know if you want to join us.  Job role: Find, sell and close large deals with mid-sized and large industrial companies. Work directly with the president to build a sales and marketing team to grow with revenue and investment income.  Product: The newest technology for supply chain design. Starboard's flagship product, Navigator, is used by companies to answer "what if" questions about the future of their supply chain. It is sold to any company that makes, moves, or sells physical products. It is a huge market.  Responsibilities Leadership! To identify business opportunities. Experience in supply chain software. Proven experience as a sales executive or sales relevant role. Language proficiency. Presentation Skills. Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques. Self-motivated with a results-driven approach. Compensation: We are a young and aggressive company, compensation will be heavily weighted on a generous commission on top of a competitive base salary.

jobTitle: National Account Manager / Business Analyst, Costco
description: Making the future is everyday life at Samsung.  We‚Äôre seeking innovators who are called to not just change the world, but build a better one. We enable the best technology hardware on the planet, but our best is always a prototype for something better and our people thrive with a driven mindset ‚Äì better builds on better. We believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves.  Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.  Role and Responsibilities This is an opportunity to work with one of Samsung‚Äôs largest global customers.  The importance of the Costco account gives this role the opportunity to influence national strategy and go to market approach. Working in a fun, fast paced, high-growth environment, the National Account Manager will be a cross-functional team leader (Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance and Operations), able to build relationships with key stakeholders (internal and with the customer) at multiple levels.  The National Account Manager role leads all aspects of Samsung‚Äôs business, including business plan alignment, sales & profit delivery, cross-function team leadership, and strategic joint business planning.  This Costco account role will have direct responsibility of the Sound Bar, Monitor and Memory categories, along with Sales Analytics responsibilities. Key responsibilities include:  Responsible for revenue generation and profitability of the Sound Bar and Monitor Categories. Collaborating with the Product Marketing Teams and Customer to successfully implement strategic growth plans to achieve the annual management plans. Create Samsung Brand awareness by helping increase Sound Bar Attach rates with TV purchase with TV Account Manager and PM Teams and scheduling to leverage promotions, field training initiatives and working with Costco regions to set a new opportunities for Costco and Samsung promote bundle purchases. As a business analyst, this role is responsible for conducting an analysis of data and other information, compiling business-oriented recommendations and driving consensus across the Sales and Product Management Teams for TV, Sound Bar, Monitors and Memory. Collaborate with internal business teams and customer to successfully define, align and implement strategic growth plans to achieve growth targets. Lead business analysis capability to uncover new insights and champion new recommendations to build the business. Lead forecasting, forecast process improvement to improve business operations and minimize out of stocks. Lead white-space expansion into new categories where Samsung may create unique member value. Own the ecommerce and omni-channel strategies, focused on both near-term and long-term, sustainable growth Create new opportunities by leveraging Samsung‚Äôs portfolio to drive cross-category sales.  Skills and Qualifications Bachelor's Degree with 6+ years of sales experience with a national retail account.  Strong business acumen. Strong business analysis skills, including strong MS Excel knowledge. Persistent; able to rebound quickly after setbacks. Ability to analyze and react to market trends, competitive pressures and implications of these changes. Ability to plan, organize and prioritize multiple business development programs and simultaneous performance objectives. Team leadership experience. Ability to build and maintain relationships, with both customer and internally, at all levels. Demonstrated ability to interact at the executive and all levels within customers' organizations and within the SEA organization.  This role is currently a remote/WFH role as a result of COVID. There is expectation that, in the future, this will be a hybrid office based/remote role.  * Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here.  * Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and  provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
