description: About Mitchell Lewis & Staver:  At Mitchell Lewis & Staver, we deeply value our people, our customers, and doing things right. We are a leader in innovative solutions that help our customers manage, control and conserve energy and liquid resources. We do this through application-specific pumping systems, electronic controls, and packaged systems. Working at MLS means you will be a part of a growing team of knowledge leaders, creating value for our customers through our technical expertise and solution-driven focus.  Our Culture:  Mitchell Lewis & Staver fosters a proactive culture of teamwork, transparent communication, entrepreneurship, integrity, and accountability. We also like to have fun, promoting lightheartedness and work-life balance. We offer competitive compensation, an excellent benefits package, and a generous PTO policy. If you are looking for a great team environment where your skills and talents are valued, join the team at Mitchell Lewis & Staver!  Position Summary:  This is a lead role for our organization. The Account Management Director is a unique talent who is disciplined and effective in helping companies drive existing customer sales growth strategies.  The Account Management Director is specifically designed to continuously improve the account management process at Mitchell Lewis & Staver. The role will require attention to detail, precision and focus into specific account needs and will help to build process to address customer sales and service requirements.  The Account Management Director will work directly with our senior leadership team and members of our sales and branch management teams to develop and implement agreed upon strategies which will enhance our customers‚Äô experience.  Position Objective:  The objective for the Account Management Director is simple ‚Äì to improve loyalty with customers.  This role will provide instrumental leadership in the development and implementation of thoughtful and effective strategies in Account Management. The goal will be to grow into a role where we are attentive to the timely recrafting needs of our Account Management process, resulting in continuous improvement in account share of wallet, revenue attainment and margin performance.  Essential Functions:  Develop an overarching sales philosophy and vision for our Account Management group. This will include culture development, key success measures, relationship building techniques and share of wallet expansion methods, all aimed at improving MLS market share through the achievement of unique plan objectives. Lead the implementation and execution of defined Account Management policies, processes and procedures migrating MLS from transactional selling to true partner and relationship selling. Enhance and develop creative compensation strategies that provide accountability and reward performance. Be an expert in gaining market intelligence at a local level, including macro and micro data, competitive analysis, brand preferences and general industry trends through Voice of Customer, Voice of Employee and Voice of Supplier. Drive market conditions into the organization through short term sales forecasting, annual sales planning and defining multi-year sales plans. Partnering with Marketing, develop a robust customer program including incentives, co-op marketing, and other 4P considerations to drive customers into higher dealer tiers. Drive in depth customer segmentation analysis as a baseline for targeted marketing initiatives and opportunity and risk assessments by segment. Drive in depth product sell through analysis to provide discreet market and customer trends. Develop and execute training initiatives aimed at diversifying product mix sell through, sales techniques and Account Management practices. Provide regular pipeline analytics including win/loss rates, leads, opportunities, quotes and order backlog analysis, and the management of activities that drive pipeline performance. Proactively assist in the management of MLS‚Äô working capital, including accounts receivable and physical inventory. Provide superior management of a department including organizational development, talent acquisition, performance management and monitoring, budget management, revenue and margin planning. Be the emotional leader that instills confidence, urgency and empathy into the team. Be the motivational engine for the Account Management team Be the champion for the team to other functions within MLS, understanding the concept of ownership and influence, and the connectivity and accountabilities that exist in the sales function.  Experience, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Education Required:  Relevant experience managing an Account Management sales team within a similar business model (distribution or manufacturing) and core or adjacent industry required (5+ years). Experience building a sales team and defining foundational elements for scalable growth for the Account Management function. Proven ability to develop strong, meaningful and lasting relationships with customers and other external stakeholders. Proven ability to grow, mentor and develop individuals. Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed revenue and profitability targets through proactive sales management. Clear understanding of relationship selling, including the ability to develop short and long term strategic plans with customers, engage cross functional teams to develop creative account based plans, foster and nurture account relationships, and provide consistent and recurring revenue streams through MLS Key Accounts. Ability to understand important measures of success within the sales function including KPI‚Äôs in the areas of pipeline health, forecast accuracy, sales activity management, and market performance. Experience developing incentive programs aimed at rewarding exceptional performance. Experience partnering with a robust marketing organization to achieved desired revenue outcomes, including sales enablement, product management, marketing communications and demand generation. Deep understanding of working capital and financial management principals, including budget preparation and management, inventory management and proactive accounts receivable management techniques. Experience managing a disparate or remote team with examples of maintaining group accountability and focus on defined objectives. Expert at customer and product data analytics to drive decision making and sales behaviors. Expert skills utilizing CRM as a management and sales tool. Expert communicator, both internally and with external stakeholders. Expert presentation skills at all levels of the organization with executive level skills preferred. BS/BA in business or related field required. MBA preferred.  Key Leadership Competencies:   Passion and enthusiasm for our people, our customers and our industry High degree of self, team and organizational accountability Collaborative and team oriented Curious and creative in problem solving and root cause analysis Proactive versus reactive mentality Amazing intuition and gut instincts balanced by data and analytics capabilities Strategic thinker and vision setter but also a master of execution Situationally aware, emotionally intelligent A+ people manager, balanced approach to team dynamics and cultural development High achiever, showing growth at each step of the career journey Understands how to navigate change in a potentially change resistant environment Relishes being on a winning team Is a great human being who values integrity, transparency and authenticity  Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.

About Faire  Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future of retail is local. There are over 1M independent retailers in the U.S. and Canada doing more than twice the revenue of Walmart and Amazon combined. At Faire, we're using the power of technology and data to connect a growing community of over 150,000 brands and independent retailers around the world. Picture your favorite boutique in town ‚Äî we help them discover the best products to sell in their stores. By empowering entrepreneurs with the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses can compete with big box and e-commerce giants. We‚Äôre looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.  About This Role  Faire's quality, depth and breadth of Brands is its strongest value to Retailers. Our Brand Partnerships Team is at the forefront of our success, ensuring that the best and most relevant Brands are on our platform. In this role, you are directly contributing to the company‚Äôs success by managing our North American Sales Development team (across Atlanta and SF) tasked with growing our expanding universe of brands.  We are a growing team and are in need of a Head of Sales Development who can ramp quickly, motivate the team to achieve their goals, and evolve our processes. You are comfortable wearing multiple hats and working cross functionally. You communicate candidly - to executives, peers, and direct reports. You are a pro at prioritizing. You lead with empathy and care about your team‚Äôs personal growth. You are looking around corners and for the next big idea. Above all, you will be critical during this foundational stage of the company, and instrumental in making Faire the de-facto platform for Brands to distribute their products and for independent Retailers to source amazing products for their stores.  This job is located in San Francisco. While we are currently remote due to Covid-19, we are seeking candidates who are based in the San Francisco area OR who are willing to relocate upon our eventual return to the office (timing to be determined).  What You‚Äôll Do Manage the goals, roles and responsibilities, operational cadence, and professional development for the North American Sales Development team leads and SDRs across our San Francisco and Atlanta offices Attract, hire, and develop an organization of best-in-class SDRs and SDR team leads Partner closely with our marketing organization to optimize our end-to-end brand lifecycle Partner closely with sales operations to build and maintain best-in-class tech stack and reporting Support SDR team leads to overachieve their team goals by providing coaching, feedback, and development Support SDRs by shadowing/reviewing cold calls and providing feedback on how to improve efficiency and effectiveness of calls and email cadences Track, analyze, and communicate key sales development metrics and trends (sales qualified leads, sales accepted leads, demos set, etc), tracking the results and reporting to senior management Identify and make recommendations to improve SDR processes and productivity Qualifications You have 6+ years of experience in tech sales/account management/business development/consulting, including 2+ years of management You have a proven track record of managing and scaling teams of SDR‚Äôs/BDR‚Äôs You enjoy managing teams and are invested in individuals‚Äô growth You enjoy sales and are comfortable operating in a quota-based role You care about our customers and making them successful You are analytical and data driven -- you can define critical metrics and measure progress/success for your initiatives You are excited to join and can operate in a fast-growth, high-potential environment Why you‚Äôll love working at Faire We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is an owner of the business and taking part in the founding process. We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 200,000 small business owners. We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy. We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality. Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We‚Äôre backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Salt Lake City, Atlanta, Toronto, London and Sao Paulo. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.  Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

As Josef‚Äôs Head of Sales (North America), you will bring your experience building high performing sales teams to drive rapid expansion in the region. This is a transformative opportunity to play a leading role in the growth of one of the world‚Äôs fastest growing legal tech startups.  Josef is VC-backed, and we‚Äôve been growing rapidly since our launch three years ago. Our customers range from top global law firms and in-house legal teams at major corporations, to the world‚Äôs best law schools and legal aid organisations that help society‚Äôs most vulnerable people.  We‚Äôre hiring our first Head of Sales (North America), and you will work closely with our CEO to develop Josef‚Äôs presence in the region. You will play a key role in the development, implementation and execution of Josef‚Äôs ambitious growth strategy. Building and then leading a team, you will drive customer acquisition and revenue growth.  This role is ideally based in the US or Canada, East Coast or West!  What you‚Äôll do:  Play a key role in developing and implementing the company‚Äôs North American growth strategy Run and close high value deals, supported by Josef‚Äôs growing sales team Generate new business by developing sales campaigns, from ideation to execution Hire and manage junior sales team members, mentoring and coaching to help them grow Lead by example, applying your process driven approach to sales to ensure that our pipeline is healthy and that our CRM is squeaky clean Leverage your outstanding people skills to represent Josef at events and conferences, and build strong relationships with prospects, partners and referrers  To be successful in this role, you will need to have a keen understanding of how to drive revenue growth at a B2B SaaS company. An understanding of the legal industry, legaltech and product-led growth is a bonus.  About you:  Our ideal Head of Sales has: 5+ years experience in a tech sales role, ideally in a B2B software company A track record of success in building and managing a sales team The ability to think strategically while also handling the day-to-day of running and closing deals Experience working with data to understand what‚Äôs in the sales pipeline and what we need to do to hit our targets Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills with strong verbal and written communication skills A hunger for knowledge and a keen appetite to learn A passion and talent for building rapport and strong, long-lasting relationships Proven ability to meet multiple deadlines at any one time, while maintaining excellent attention to detail  Nice to have: A legal qualification, or similar experience that demonstrates your understanding of the legal industry and the legal market A passion for the transformative role that legal tech is already playing in the industry! A deep network that gives you the ability to open doors in the legal industry  Start-up experience in a high growth company  What we do:  The majority of people who face a legal problem do not get help from a lawyer. And, for those who do, many find the experience expensive, uncertain and confusing. Josef‚Äôs mission is at once simple and ambitious: to transform the way legal services are delivered, making them more accessible.  To do that, we‚Äôve created a no-code automation platform that empowers lawyers to easily launch legal bots to automate parts of their day-to-day work. Our customers include some of the biggest law firms in the world, small suburban firms, in-house lawyers at multinational corporations, and legal aid and community organisations.  What to expect: Competitive base salary, with the right incentives Meaningful, purpose-driven work A supportive and inclusive environment Flexible and remote work environment and options Top-end hardware to ensure you perform at your best Investment in your career growth and development   Regular reviews with the CEO to ensure we‚Äôre both kicking goals and meeting mutual expectations Company events, like team offsites, Lunch & Learns and social outings The ability to help us determine the future direction of the company

About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in the Netherlands (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within Dutch merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Dutch language will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager (National Accounts) - Professional & Home Services
description: Job Description Mspark is adding to our National Sales Team - could it, be you? If you have a track record of successfully selling on a national or enterprise sales team and you enjoy the challenge of hunting for new business, this may be your next opportunity. As a Business Development Manager - Professional & Home Services, you‚Äôll report to one or our Sales VPs and have the opportunity to qualify, source, and close new national clients. As a key member of our Business Development team, you will get the chance to be intimately involved in developing and implementing highly targeted and digitally integrated marketing campaigns completely unique to each of your clients in every one of their particular markets. What is more, you'll be armed with the data and analytics you need to recommend and forecast solutions and results that best meet their needs. Our Headquarters is in Helena, Alabama (a suburb of Birmingham) but this is a remote position Experience And Skills To be successful in this role, you will need to: Identify, open, and close new business by delivering qualified leads into the sales pipeline and converting qualified leads into closed sales. Demonstrate the ability to successfully influence senior level management, executives, and key clients. Possess and maintain an excellent first-hand knowledge of the US market and its key retailers, demonstrating a proven track record of selling. Identify, nurture, and develop mutually beneficial relationships within our verticals, their team(s) and their customers all over North America. A high level of attention to detail and always be customer focused, with an ability to analyze a growing amount of data to drive insights to facilitate decisions. Ability to generate ideas, identify opportunities and always apply a proactive approach to the Mspark‚Äôs growth. An understanding of and interest in advertising, social media, online marketing, data analytics and communication. Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team and maintain effective communication and consistent delivery while on the road/working remotely. Why Mspark? We drive cost-effective, measurable advertising results for our clients through national reach, precision targeting, and integrated campaigns Founded in 1988, we‚Äôve been growing and expanding our national reach ever since ( https://mspark.com/about-mspark/ ) Birmingham‚Äôs best places to work 2 years in a row As the industry leader, we value PEOPLE, PROCESS and PASSION Outstanding supportive and sales centric culture Our Hiring Commitment We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable - and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications. We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. At Mspark we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring, and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Mspark is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment, and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Mspark offers competitive compensation and benefits and team-oriented work environment. EOE

description: Fortify is a dynamic venture-backed 3D printing startup with a passionate team of engineers and business professionals who are at the forefront of bringing new technologies to market. Founded in 2016 and located in Boston, Fortify's team is transforming the 3D printing industry with its patented DCM (Digital Composite Manufacturing) platform, enabling new material properties and components which can't be made using other additive or traditional manufacturing processes. Fortify was recently recognized as one of the BostonInno companies on Fire by Boston Business Journal and featured in Forbes. To learn more about Fortify visit, www.3DFortify.com.  Summary Of Position  We are looking for our first Director of Sales Development. This role is critical in supporting our applications focused go to market. You will be responsible for building, managing and motivating a team of SDRs. You will work with sales, marketing and product to build a winning strategy, set goals, and measure performance against weekly, monthly and quarterly objectives.  What You'll Be Doing Ongoing hiring, mentoring and development of SDR's which includes recruiting, hiring, and training new members Develop the sales, product and industry skills of each team member Motivate team members through creative incentives Provide daily, weekly and monthly reporting on volume statistics, lead pipeline, conversation of sales accepted opportunities and playbook effectiveness Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency and productivity Partner with sales, marketing and other business partners to develop a successful GTM strategy and messaging Refine and evolve a scalable, measurable, and predictable process for running and growing the team  We'd love to talk to you if you have 5+ years of sales/SDR team leadership experience Direct experience scaling and managing a team of SDR's/BDR's Consistent track record of quota achievement as an SDR Manager Experience hiring and working in a rapidly growing, fast paced environment High levels of self motivation, ownership, and adaptability, with the ability to handle multiple responsibilities Experience with an applications focused sales approach A willingness to take a hands on approach to building our SDR function  Benefits Of Working At Fortify Competitive Salary and Stock Options Employer Paid Premium Medical and Dental FSA and Commuter Benefits available Paid Parental Leave Flexible PTO/WFH Policies Monthly Wellness/ Lunch Stipend  Covid Procedures are currently in place and include mandatory masking and social distancing in office, staggered scheduling and contact tracing, regular cleaning, and flexible wfh.  Our offices are located in the heart of Charlestown within Hood Park and directly next to the Hood milk stack. The park is currently undergoing a major transformation to include retail, dining, and green space (check out the plans https://hoodpark.com/).  Think you have what it takes, but don't check every box? Please apply anyway! Let's chat‚Äî you could bring just the perspective we needed. Please note this role is based in our Charlestown, MA location. It is not remote. While there is some flexibility to work from home, most responsibilities of this position will require you to be onsite.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

description: STAG Partners is looking for a highly motivated, innovative, business development professional to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of building relationships in multi-family construction with a proven track record. The Business Development Manager is responsible for developing new business opportunities and managing relationships with clients, project managers, designers, brokers, and owners/managers within the multi-family industry.  Responsibilities Identify and develop relationships with industry professionals to generate new business opportunities. Create and expand STAG‚Äôs footprint and build positive brand awareness. Manage and build on STAGS existing Key, Target, and Opportunity relationship Attend industry events, trade shows and other meetings to stay abreast of market conditions, competition, and establish relationships with existing clients and prospects. Provide ongoing progress updates on new business development activities and other key indicators to the STAG management team. Coordinate and assist in the proposal process with STAG‚Äôs marketing and project management teams. Coordinate online marketing efforts including social media, email campaigns, and other advertisements. Responsible for maintaining and ordering collateral and marketing materials. Excellent telephone manner for making initial contact and for ongoing communication with customers and business associates. Interpersonal skills for building and developing relationships with clients. Written and verbal communication skills - needed for communicating and negotiating with a range of people, both internally and externally, as well as presentation skills Proficient in MS Office including but not limited to Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Word Technologically inclined Self-starter with a collaborative approach to work Strong planning and decision-making skills The ability to multitask and prioritize your workload. Project management and organizational skills The ability to think strategically. description: Job Description Are you a dedicated, driven sales leader ready to take a rapidly growing digital mental health company in the Higher Education space to its next stage of growth? Mantra Health is the fastest growing digital mental health provider that focuses exclusively on Higher Education. Their program adapts to a school‚Äôs specific needs, and their care model and integrated software are designed by leading minds in university mental health. They are looking to add an experienced Vice-President of Sales to join their ambitious go-to-market group as a key member of the Executive Team. The ideal candidate will be both a strategist and an executor - reporting directly to the CEO - who will guide and develop an expanding team of sales professionals to enable universities across the country to transform the way they provide mental health services. Major Responsibilities Partner with the Executive Team to develop, align and execute the company‚Äôs high growth strategic roadmap Define and execute a sales plan that establishes a benchmark direct sales direction and delivers rapid and sustainable revenue increases Lead sales planning and business development, and provide quarterly updates, revisions, and modifications Streamline sales processes while structuring and resourcing the sales team for growth Review and scope improvements to internal business models to accelerate sales cycles and increase volume of sales qualified leads Mentor and coach internal team members to improve sales capabilities and outcomes while building new lead conversion/generation strategies Actively leverage current networks and establish new relationships to build sales pipeline Review and revise end-to-end customer engagement process Develop and share professional and market knowledge Collaborate as an essential member of the Executive Team Preferred Qualifications Extensive experience growing fast-paced start-up companies in the education sector Several years‚Äô experience leading and motivating high performing sales teams within a complex, strategic sales environment Demonstrated ability to continuously increase effectiveness of team, recognizing opportunities for creating new systems, structures, and processes Ability to set and monitor accurate revenue targets and operational KPIs while collaborating with the management team to inform commercial OKRs Demonstrated ability to deliver an outreach strategy Affinity for the mental health field and solving an important societal issue Travel as needed Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher preferred Mantra Health is a digital mental health clinic on a mission to improve access to evidence-based mental healthcare for young adults. Through augmenting high quality clinical services with software and design, they're on a mission to improve the mental health of over 20 million university and college students through partnerships with higher education institutions and health insurance plans. jobTitle: Global Sales Strategy and Technical Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving problems with limited oversight. The ideal candidate will demonstrate that they have or can partner closely with cross-functional teams, project manage complex initiatives, and make data-driven decisions. Our ideal candidates will demonstrate owning project management and building scalable processes that outsource from sales critical selling tasks like lead enrichment, pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, and customer risk management. Experience in areas like these will help to ensure we are meeting the needs of the organization by building priority mechanisms that scale selling activities.  You Will Implement Stripe‚Äôs Sales Support Desk global strategy, in alignment with Stripe‚Äôs Sales business strategy Build and own standardized processes or tools to migrate non-customer facing sales tasks into the Sales Support Desk in partnership with Sales, Sales Operations, Data Science, and other Stripe teams Project manage building repeatable and scalable processes that outsource from sales essential tasks such as pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, account optimizations, supportability, and risk management Cultivate a team culture that includes high ownership, customer-first focus, fast pace, high integrity, and an optimistic and positive environment Report out on a regular weekly, monthly, and quarterly cadence to all key stakeholders, with a strong analytical approach and crisp communication style We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 5+ years of delivering sales/user support or sales operations in a high growth technology environment Proven track record in successfully building and owning sales project programs and developing close cross functional partnerships Strong technical skills and sales tooling experience Sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results Experience working within a high-growth, technology company with the ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization Highly organized, multi-tasking skills, taking ownership, and being efficient in ambiguous situations Bachelor‚Äôs Degree Nice To Haves MBA or other advanced degree Lean Six Sigma certification, or proven experience employing the methodology Experience working in the financial services/payments industry

description: About R-Zero  R-Zero is the first biosafety technology company dedicated to making the indoor spaces we share, safer and clinically clean. Through mission-driven innovation, we are transforming the infection prevention industry, with an intelligent, IoT-connected biosafety platform that puts the most effective and sustainable safety-enabling technologies within reach of every organization for the first time. At R-Zero, we believe in creating a healthier humanity by virtue of safer spaces. Today, our smart, software-enabled disinfection technologies are enabling safety for hundreds of thousands of people across the country. We are a fast-growing startup, backed by leading venture capital firms, and thought-leaders across health, hospitality, sports, commercial real estate and impact sectors. We are growing our team, and looking for candidates who possess passion and conviction for helping us usher in a new era of public health and safety, via accessible technology.  Summary/Objective  Competitive self-starter with healthcare sales experience, managing processes, contractual selling, and working with complex mid to large enterprise networks. Implement sales strategies and build relationships with influential clinical, administrative, and economic decision-makers within targeted customer segments. You will be responsible for collaborating across all R-Zero divisions to collaborate and implement a plan to maximize revenue and address the needs of the customers including optimizing efficiencies, enhancing the customer experience, improving clinical outcomes, and helping to improve their financial health. Serve as the interface between the company, the customer, and internal support including marketing, contract compliance, training and other activities.  Essential Functions  What You‚Äôll Do Understand, position, and clearly articulate the value/benefits of R-Zero‚Äôs solutions to all levels within customer organizations. Provide advanced consulting regarding projects to address internal and external business issues, such as: workflow, management, product mix, promotion, shipping, inventory management, etc. Provide accurate sales forecasts and proactively identify forecast risks and mitigation strategies. Communicate with the marketing team on the development and execution of new product launches to ensure the distributor‚Äôs sales team is properly prepared upon completion. Facilitate communication between the Distributor and Regulatory regarding product registration. This will promote a timely registration process and ensure that appropriate action is taken when necessary. Write monthly management reports to communicate franchise results, issues, solutions, competitive landscape and recruiting activity. Identify and create new qualified sales opportunities. Run effective outbound prospecting campaigns using Outreach IO consisting of cold-calls, cold emails, and social touches. Provide in-depth market information to internal teams. Research and evaluate target markets and customers. Responsible for developing multiple accounts focused on IDN‚Äôs, GPO‚Äôs and additional healthcare Enterprise Account targets. Develop direct and distribution partners to support revenue goals within local and regional targets. Facilitation of contract negotiations involving all company products Develop and execute clear Enterprise sales strategies Build collaborative executive level customer relationships Develop and execute both short- and long-range sales plans and programs to ensure revenue, gross profit, and sales process objectives are achieved. Market analyses to determine customer needs, volume potential, price schedules, discount rates, and develops sales strategies to accommodate the goals of the company Execute R-Zero‚Äôs customer strategy by directing activities across call points and divisions Help define negotiation parameters for tough economically constrained customer situations Maintain knowledge of the industry and the competition continually seeking information from suppliers, HMO, and others to challenge, modify and prioritize country strategy  Requirements  Education and Experience  What We‚Äôre Looking For Minimum 5 years of documented success in healthcare Sales and Business Development experience. A proven track record of consistently hitting provided quarterly and annual sales targets. A good listener with a high degree of personal accountability in communicating cross-functionally. Leverages best practices, fresh perspectives, breakthrough ideas, and new paradigms to create value in the market Ability to express complex ideas and concepts at all levels of the organization Must think strategically, have strong key account management and negotiations skills Previous Corporate/Strategic Accounts sales experience within the medical device industry Excellent organizational, time-management, and prioritization skills. Customer empathy and genuine curiosity for prospects and their needs.  Benefits  Why R-Zero? Make an immediate impact with a fast growing disruptive company - insert whatever your own unicorn image is here Work in our new stylish office in the booming city of Salt Lake City, Utah...or not. We are a remote first culture, although we have an attractive relocation bonus if you choose to move to beautiful Utah Earn a competitive base salary, startup equity + incentives Take advantage of rich healthcare benefits that are 100% paid to employees, including health, dental, vision, and life coverage. But wait, it gets better - active enrollment eligibility and coverage on your first day! Invest in your future with our 401K program and enrollment eligibility on your first day with no waiting period Leave the suit and tie clich√© at home; our dress code is casual, unless you really like to be fancy, that‚Äôs accepted too Work out Wednesdays with ‚ÄúR-Zero strong‚Äù live instructor via zoom! No judgement zone No internal meetings on Wednesdays, so you can focus where you need to Friday happy hour World class renowned investors who only pick the best of the best that are on a rocket ship to impact and revolutionize

jobTitle: Business Development Director - Telecommute in Charlotte, NC
description: Great sales are the result of strong purpose, conviction and pride - pride in your ability and your product. UnitedHealth Group offers a portfolio of products that are greatly improving the life of others. Bring along your passion and do your life's best work.(sm)  The Director of Business Development is responsible for selling the IE/ISNP value proposition to potential business partners in an assigned geography. The role is assigned business targets and penetration goals for Institutional Special Needs Plans (ISNP) and Institutional Equivalent Special Needs Plans (IE-SNP).  If you are located in Charlotte, NC, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Analyze assigned geography to identify, segment and prioritize all skilled nursing facilities (SNFs) and/or assisted living facilities (ALs) Conduct traditional business development activities to engage customers, to illustrate the value proposition and benefits of participation with Optum/UnitedHealthcare, and to collaborate with Optum stakeholders to execute contracts which lead to successful implementation Provide a monthly pipeline forecast by stage, utilizing the CCM Business Development Model, including risks and opportunities relative to budget and/or assigned production goals Partner with network and sales leaders to ensure strategies are aligned, and drive incremental growth Serve as the executive contact for client groups, including the development and management of C level and C level equivalent positions in the SNFs/ALFs You‚Äôll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent work experience 3+ years of sales, business development, or negotiation experience Experience meeting targets/metrics/goals year over year Experience driving the entire new business development process and immediately identify and correct any barriers preventing the closing of the sale Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) Leadership skills to ensure all deliverables are completed timely and as required to facilitate the closing of the sale and execution of the contract Able to travel up to 60% Preferred Qualifications Master‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration or Healthcare Administration 3+ years of experience working with a skilled nursing facility Experience in healthcare sales Experience working with the executive and market leadership in the development of the budget and setting goals and expectations for the market Experience using a CRM (salesforce.com, Siebel, or a similar product) Contract negotiation experience Experience in a high energy position, requiring significant client contact, entertainment and engagement Ability to work a heavily matrixed environment Self-motivated and goal oriented individual UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare‚Äôs support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group‚Äôs Telecommuter Policy. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment  Job Keywords: Sales, Business Development, Long Term Care, Cold Calling, Prospecting, Nursing Homes, Assisted Living, Medical Supplies, Medical Device, Infusion, Home Health, DME, Laboratory, MD, Maryland, VA, Virginia, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote
industries: Information Technology and Services, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Description  ABOUT US:  BAK, a Truck Hero company, has led the truck accessories industry with new and innovative truck bed cover concepts that emphasize style, quality, durability, and functionality for our customers. We remain committed to providing the highest quality engineered products, shortest lead times, world-class customer service, and best warranties in the industry!  In response to our continued growth, BAK, is continually pursuing talented individuals with similar ambitions to join our team. We seek people who desire to work in a positive, team-based environment, who can commit to creating top-quality products and are internally driven to be the best. If this sounds like you, then Truck Hero would love to start a conversation about our great career opportunities!  If you would like to see what we do, check out our product lineup video:  Truck Hero - Accessories for Trucks. For Jeeps. For Life.  Position Summary  The Director of Sales will maintain and grow product sales through all channels and accounts and seek new accounts that will contribute to growth plans. This role will cover the east region/territory for the BAK sales team.  Core Functions Develop and execute business plan and sales strategy that ensures attainment of corporate sales goals and profitability. Achieve targeted sales goals for all sales channels and brands including, but not limited to aftermarket warehouse distributers, dealer sales, Internet/E-Commerce. Maintain all customer programs, policies, pricing, and promotional activities throughout all sales channels. Forecast, in collaboration with the National Sales Manager, in the annual budgeting process including projected monthly sales. Attend to customer expectations in order to maintain their satisfaction. Develop new customer relationships and grow sales, while servicing and cultivating existing accounts. Responsible for executing all new product launches throughout customer base. Develop and maintain trade show schedule to ensure proper staffing and proper presentation. Manage territory sales team and support employees in collaboration with the National Sales Manager. Develop and refine regional salespeople consisting of sales, budgeting, and customer relationships. Log all jobber / WD calls in company CRM software within 5 business days. Maintain dealer contact info (names, e-mail, phone, address, website, etc.) in company CRM software for use in our direct mailing, e-blasts, connection to our dealer locator, etc. Maintain your planned activities on the shared calendar 30 days in advance (due by the end of the prior month) and keep the National Sales Manager informed of travel plans when changes occur. Seek new accounts that will contribute to growth plan and mix well with the existing distribution. Be aware of market conditions at all times ‚Äì WD and retail pricing, competitive actions, opportunities, and threats and bring to the attention of the sales team, as applicable. Req Number SAL-21-00050  Position Requirements  Qualifications & Requirements Associate‚Äôs degree in a business related field; OR Four or more years of sales experience Software experience: Microsoft Office Suite, CRM Software, ERP Software Project a professional and positive company image through phone and personal interaction. Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects at the same time with limited supervision; excellent planning, time management and decision-making skills. Possess strong verbal and written communication skills. Function efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Strong motivation, level disposition, work ethic and organizational skills. Excellent work history, attendance, initiative, and drive to succeed. Maintain excellent communication and relationships with others; be a team player; maintain a positive attitude. Occasional lifting of 25 pounds or more. TRAVEL Required to travel roughly 75%. PAY And BENEFITS Truck Hero offers competitive pay and commission structure Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision health insurance A matched 401k savings program to plan and save for your retirement Paid vacation and time off to ensure time with your family and a work/life balance Educational assistance to continue college or pursue other skills and further your career Discounts on great Truck Hero products for you, your family, and friends WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? description: The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

description: About Us  At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world‚Äôs largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine‚Äôs Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.  We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!  About The Role  LatAM is an important region for Cloudflare. We are looking for our Head of LatAM Sales to help us invest and grow and will be responsible for driving Cloudflare's revenue in the region.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive regional sales growth through successful leadership, organizational planning, customer service, and outstanding execution of all regional go-to-market programs (enterprise sales, customer success, solutions engineering, business development, support, and field marketing). Grow and build the LatAM team and drive the local hiring needs for LatAM by working with America's functional leadership and recruiting resources, ensuring we have proper leadership development-succession planning in place across all teams. Build and internally evangelize a plan for local hiring in-region to drive better adoption of our platform through enterprise accounts. Drive greater adoption of our platform through key strategic partners like IBM and Systems Integrators in the region, as well as reseller partners. Design, build and execute strategies for the LatAM market in collaboration with regional and global functional leaders. Interject as the single point of contact for all LatAM operational concerns, ensuring proper and timely escalation and resolution. Ensure that corporate policy and regulatory initiatives are consistently applied and followed by LatAM team members Inspire interpersonal effectiveness to lead teams, develop talent and affect change. Willing and able to be a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù and ‚Äúinfluencer‚Äù Drive business cadence for forecast calls, functional review meetings, deal review, customer account reviews, weekly team meetings and periodic company-wide kick-offs Represent Cloudflare as appropriate at external conferences, media and PR events. Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Sales growth-oriented leader who drives rapid change and growth and possesses 10+ years of relevant, regional or country leadership in SaaS/Cloud software platforms Deep experience and relationships with the SaaS/Cloud community in LatAM, able to establish, build and grow strong relationships. Enterprise/corporate market rich experience including having a well-regarded reputation in the LatAM market and strong connections/relationships with large enterprise customers. Exceptional collaboration, relationship-building, and interpersonal skills ‚Äì with the ability to develop working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside Cloudflare. Ability to define, develop and lead go-to-market programs in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Curious, empathetic, fast learner who thrives in a high-growth, continuous change environment. Bilingual required with trilingual preferred - English, Spanish and Portuguese What Makes Cloudflare Special?  We‚Äôre not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We‚Äôre a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.  Project Galileo : We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare‚Äôs enterprise customers--at no cost.  Athenian Project : We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  Path Forward Partnership : Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 : We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here‚Äôs the deal - we don‚Äôt store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  Sound like something you‚Äôd like to be a part of? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!  This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.  Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.  Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

description: We‚Äôre on the lookout for ambitious, tenacious and passionate people who want to join the next generation of innovators and disrupt the hospitality industry with us. Sound good so far? If you‚Äôre a Sales Director keep reading and tumble down the Mews rabbit hole... üêá  First things first: you want to know what you‚Äôre actually applying for. It‚Äôs impossible to capture every nuance of a role ‚Äì especially at a rapidly growing company like Mews ‚Äì but if we had to distil it down to a job description (which we do, because this is a job description), it would be this: We‚Äôre looking for an high potential Sales Director ready to take on the challenge of managing our North America business and who will manage all aspects of the day-to-day business and ultimately setting the team up for success in order to meet and exceed budgeted targets. The role will collaborate closely with the Sales Enablement team and other Sales team leaders, to ensure successful execution of these strategies and build and maintain strong, long lasting customer relationships.  ‚úÖ Your mission, should you choose to accept it: Effectively implement net new business acquisition sales strategies and tactics to maximize efforts to penetrate new accounts and achieve quota objectives Interface with highly diverse set of functions and buyers at all levels within customer/prospect organizations, and channel, including C-level Executives Develop an understanding of client‚Äôs business, products, services, customer profile and business objectives, competitors and sales. Manage individual sales pipeline to maximize individual sales revenue while providing accurate and timely forecasts Drive ambitious sales growth to meet or exceed annual targets Work with Customer Success and Marketing teams to ensure consistent and qualified lead generation Solve customers‚Äô challenges by applying a combination of technology, business and professional experience  ü§ùÔ∏è You‚Äôll be a great fit if you bring a few of the below with you: ‚Ä¢ Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related field and/or experience  ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of B2B SaaS senior sales position experience, preferably as part of a "land-and-expand" sales model ‚Ä¢ Hospitality industry experience is preferred but not required  ‚Ä¢ A competent and motivational leader who displays a tenacious work ethic and ongoing will to succeed ‚Ä¢ Pragmatic and action-oriented attitude, ability to translate business needs and opportunities into solutions  ‚Ä¢ Driven to attain revenue/performance growth goals by staying customer-focused with the ability to work under pressure, think quickly and demonstrate initiative in solving problems ‚Ä¢ Able to work efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced and changing environment. Acts without being told what to do and brings new ideas to the company. ‚Ä¢ Strong interpersonal skills capable of networking both internally and externally fostering long-lasting relationships for the business  ü§∑üèª Who is Mews? We want to get to know you, so it‚Äôs only fair we tell you a little bit about ourselves first. We were founded in 2012 by a team of former hoteliers, and since then we‚Äôve been transforming hospitality for both hotel staff and guests. Essentially, Mews is a powerful software platform that acts as a central nervous system for hotels, hostels, apartments and more. We use smart tech and automation to make day-to-day operations easier for hoteliers, so they can focus on the thing that really matters: providing remarkable guest experiences. More than 2,000 properties across 60+ countries are powered by Mews, with more joining every week. Bookings, payments, operations, guest management ‚Äì everything a hotel needs to operate can be done through our solution. We work with some amazing hotels, including Sage Hospitality Group, Machefert Group, The Student Hotel, and Tsogo Sun Hotels.

Regional Sales Director  The Opportunity  We are searching for an experienced enterprise Regional Sales Director to help grow our team. Reporting to the Regional VP of Sales, you'll be responsible for working with your team of 5+ Enterprise Account Executives, providing feedback, coaching and training to ensure quota attainment and overall account development. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Moveworks platform. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Moveworks sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.  Who We Are  Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees ‚Äì with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advance conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR to policy information. Our platform allows customers such as Docusign, Broadcom, Nutanix and Western Digital to move forward on what matters. We‚Äôve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for the 3 consecutive years while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Empower Account Executives through strategic planning sessions, accountability and execution Be a product expert and a customer facing asset feel assisting your team in closing deals and exceeding quota Accurately assess the capabilities, motivators, and career goals of each team member and provide ongoing coaching to improve their performance and support their career path Develop and implement sales strategies and incentives that drive monthly, quarterly and yearly growth against company targets Perform regular pipeline reviews and accurately forecast sales pipeline Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and client care What You Bring To The Table A sales leader with 3-5 years of 1st line management combined with 5+ years of hands-on closing complex software deals (mix of field selling within mid-market and enterprise) Driven and have met/exceeded direct sales goals of $5-10M+ and leading teams consistently closing average deal sizes of $150-500K while continuing to close $MM deals You are a constant Recruiter! Moveworks hires ‚Äúcompany builders‚Äù and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred) selling ‚Äòunbudgeted‚Äô software without a big brand name. Familiarity with the challenger sale or MEDDIC approach President‚Äôs Club, top rep, top percentile performer, consistent YoY overachievement Systematic approach to encouraging Pipeline Generation that ensures both consistent pipeline growth week over week and strong messaging contained in actual emails/calls. description: Quantela is the first of its kind Outcomes-as-a-Service (OaaS) company and the leader in the space of urban infrastructure digitization that makes cities more inhabitable, operationally efficient, resilient, and environmentally sustainable for its citizens.  We do so by helping city administrators with our citizen centric AI-powered products delivering quantifiable outcomes with social, economic, and environmental impact. Along with technology, we will also be using our unique financing model that is Outcomes-based to help city governments in financing priority projects through cost savings and improved revenues from urban infrastructure digitization.  As conveyed by part of our logo, "Technologies for societies", Quantela as a brand stands for technologies with a human touch and focuses on enhancing the lives of citizens in societies  The role:  The Sales Executive works under SVP -Global Sales, and with the sales team to develop, drive, and grow a revenue stream‚ÄØwith Cities within North America. She/he understands the core value of Quantela and can assist leads to realize the economic, and social outcomes that each of Quantela‚Äôs products offer. Each member of Quantela acts as its spokesperson and represents the company in a way that keeps its reputation, and distinct identity in the industry.  Responsibilities:   Achieve Quarterly and Yearly sales targets   Articulate and position Quantela products, solutions, and outcomes to key decision-makers, and city officials to sell Quantela Products Produce and present sales proposals (with the business department) to city officials demonstrating Quantela‚Äôs s ability to fund the priority projects based on its Outcome-based Financing model. Manage the entire sales cycle, and coordinate all the steps across accounts; include other departments to meetings, schedule demo sessions, follow up with quote request, and more as needed Nurtures the business accounts by distinguishing, building, and maintaining relationships with clients  Keep apprised of changes in technology, and up to date with the latest trends, and solutions, and follow the governments, and smart cities publications to identify new approaches and potential leads Active presence in the smart city communities by attending educational workshops, benchmark state-of-the-art practices, and establish personal networks   Qualifications & Skills :   10+ years of overall experience in selling solutions to the local government market  Expert in sales activities: appointments, demonstrations, proposals, cold calls, dials, and database updates Prior experience in Lighting control space will be preferable  Outstanding communication, presentation, and negotiation skills both verbal and written Analytical set mind, and prospecting skills to determine business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating the needs of the city/municipality  Professional network of contacts‚ÄØacross‚ÄØthe‚ÄØgovernment, and Smart city market  Experience with SalesForce, and be able to log all activity in CRM and ensure sales pipeline is accurate Knowledge of the industry, solutions, and technologies in the smart city markets; IOT, digital transformation, digital tween, blockchain, SaaS, and more  Self-starter, and agility to build new and existing accounts across multiple functions Team player; Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results  Self-motivated and focused.

jobTitle: Global Sales Planning and Process Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving complex problems with limited resources. We are looking for someone to enable the Revenue organization to grow and operate more effectively through planning and globally consistent standards and processes. You will manage resource allocation and project investment to optimize ROI and partner cross-functionally to identify the needs to support, scale, and measure our business.  You Will Lead the quarterly target setting and annual planning process across Rev Ops, Marketing, and Sales and recommend and guide where we invest in resources and projects to enable growth and productivity Align Global GTM team priorities Design and refresh processes to enable scale; work ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù with other central operations partners on standard processes to support delivery of targets, segmentation, territory management, reporting, etc. Interlock and streamline Rev Ops/GTM initiatives and operating structures, driving synergy Proactively review and identify opportunities for how we can grow our business or operate more efficiently through innovation and automation Develop strong working relationships with Stripes across levels and functions Leverage internal and external insights to make data-driven recommendations We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of experience in planning, strategy, business operations, management consulting, investment banking, or a related discipline A strong track record of delivering major, complex projects in ambiguous environments An ability to simplify, structure, and diagnose problems Experience implementing solutions, not just setting strategy A high degree of comfort working quickly in a high growth, fast-paced environment An ability to seamlessly transition from the high level to very detailed, and willingness to ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù Experience working in a sales and marketing organization Prior experience with payments You Should Include These In Your Application LinkedIn profile and resume
