description: Job Description Mspark is adding to our National Sales Team - could it, be you? If you have a track record of successfully selling on a national or enterprise sales team and you enjoy the challenge of hunting for new business, this may be your next opportunity. As a Business Development Manager - Restaurants, you‚Äôll report to one or our Sales VPs and have the opportunity to qualify, source, and close new national clients. As a key member of our Business Development team, you will get the chance to be intimately involved in developing and implementing highly targeted and digitally integrated marketing campaigns completely unique to each of your clients in every one of their particular markets. What is more, you'll be armed with the data and analytics you need to recommend and forecast solutions and results that best meet their needs. Our Headquarters is in Helena, Alabama (a suburb of Birmingham) but this is a remote position. Experience And Skills To be successful in this role, you will need to: Identify, open, and close new business by delivering qualified leads into the sales pipeline and converting qualified leads into closed sales. Demonstrate the ability to successfully influence senior level management, executives, and key clients. Possess and maintain an excellent first-hand knowledge of the US market and its key retailers, demonstrating a proven track record of selling. Identify, nurture, and develop mutually beneficial relationships within our verticals, their team(s) and their customers all over North America. A high level of attention to detail and always be customer focused, with an ability to analyze a growing amount of data to drive insights to facilitate decisions. Ability to generate ideas, identify opportunities and always apply a proactive approach to the Mspark‚Äôs growth. An understanding of and interest in advertising, social media, online marketing, data analytics and communication. Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team and maintain effective communication and consistent delivery while on the road/working remotely. Why Mspark? We drive cost-effective, measurable advertising results for our clients through national reach, precision targeting, and integrated campaigns Founded in 1988, we‚Äôve been growing and expanding our national reach ever since ( https://mspark.com/about-mspark/ ) Birmingham‚Äôs best places to work 2 years in a row As the industry leader, we value PEOPLE, PROCESS and PASSION Outstanding supportive and sales centric culture Our Hiring Commitment We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable ‚Äì and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications. We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. At Mspark we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring, and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Mspark is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment, and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Mspark offers competitive compensation and benefits and team-oriented work environment. EOE www.Mspark.com

description: Are you passionate about helping nonprofits do more good in the world by providing them with the tools to make a greater impact? Do you have deep connections within the nonprofit community and a knack for problem-solving? Do you want to work with a really awesome team of people? If so, we‚Äôd love to talk to you about joining EveryAction.  EveryAction is looking for a highly motivated self-starter to join our team as a Director of Sales.  The EveryAction platform is built by some of the leading experts in the Nonprofit technology space and provides an integrated communication and fundraising platform to nonprofits or all sizes.   Day to Day:  As a Director of Sales, you will be based in our DC or Pittsburgh offices and report to EveryAction's Managing Director of Mid-Market Sales. In this role, you will oversee a team of Account Executives and be responsible for leading them to achieve quota. You will oversee the training programs for new hires, ensuring their ability to meet milestones in a timely manner.  Requirements:  A strong understanding of the SaaS (software as a service) industry, and more specifically in becoming an expert in the EveryAction Platform A strong interest or understanding of the nonprofit market and how nonprofits work internally Driven to create new relationships outside of our current client network Client focused and highly organized Comfortable using sales platforms such as Salesforce, SalesLoft, and Gong to track and manage all account and opportunity activity Well-developed oral and written communication skills; particularly the ability to craft effective prospecting messaging, proposals and deliver engaging presentations Proven track record of achieving quota as an individual contributor, with preference given to successfully leading a team of salespeople to achieve quota Keen attention to detail and ability to meet individual goals while supporting and guiding team members to success Collaborative nature that works with colleagues to solve problems and advance the salesteam goals on a larger scale What Sets You Apart:  Bonus points if you've held a sales or sales management role at a company with technology products Experience working with nonprofits, with demonstrated interest in development and fundraising A passion for problem solving, project management, logistics, best practices, and data-driven decision-making Ability to work independently, follow precise team protocols and pay extreme attention to detail Willing to be flexible and adapt within a growing company and changing environment Previous experience using CRMs such as NGP, Votebuilder, Salesforce, Raiser‚Äôs Edge, Convio, Salsa, is a big plus Compensation and Benefits:  At EveryAction, you will enjoy a progressive and open-minded workplace where we have:  A fun and relaxed company culture, including enjoying periodic company retreats to warm places with beach Casual Friday every day An unusually generous set of benefits, including up to 12 weeks paid parental leave, profit sharing, 100% premium-paid health/dental, and an ongoing education allowance    About Us  EveryAction is a technology company whose team members do exciting and meaningful work that has a significant impact on promoting civil rights, social justice, and environmental responsibility.  Employees enjoy an unusually generous set of benefits, including 12 weeks paid parental leave, profit sharing, 100% premium-paid health/dental, and an ongoing education allowance.  EveryAction is one of only a handful of companies to be recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in America by Inc. Magazine for 10 years. Inc. Magazine also recognized us as one of the 50 Best Places to Work in 2016 and 2017.  We were named to the 2018 "Companies Changing the World" List by Fortune Magazine . We've also been named one of the top 50 fastest growing companies in the DC area by the Washington Business Journal and SmartCEO. We have also won the AAPC award for Best Use of New Technology, and the Campaigns & Elections Award for Most Innovative Product.  Join our team and work alongside over 300 smart, passionate, and innovative co-workers, many of whom are industry recognized as experts in their fields.  EveryAction believes a diverse, inclusive staff makes us a stronger company and better partner for our clients. We‚Äôre committed to hiring people of all races, ethnicities, ages, sex, genders, sexual orientation or gender identities, marital status, religions, and disabilities.  Women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, and members of other minority or marginalized groups are encouraged to apply.

Work with HR and VP of Sales & Marketing to define and execute new hire training for equipment sales reps and the Product Support Manager Make sales calls and visits with all members of the sales team and provide structured coaching to help sales team develop capabilities  Customer engagement Serve as the integrator, bringing together all equipment sales, rental, and product support efforts to ensure customers receive coordinated attention, with all functions supporting one another Lead sales meetings with customers, particularly on key accounts, and serve as the face of The Bailey Company  Marketing Actively participate in guiding marketing efforts and creating content for marketing campaigns Ensure sales reps are fully utilizing marketing plans and sales incentives  CRM & Sales Ops Participate in improving the CRM to make sales efforts more efficient and productive Research and recommend tools that can make sales efforts more efficient or effective  Commissions/Admin Approve and process commissions for sales reps and ensure all other required paperwork is properly completed by the sales team Ship-Ins: Review all ship ins with sales team A/R: Work with A/R Manager to make sure all past due accounts are handled properly by the sales team  Requirements The individual in this position should be personable, a problem solver, reliable, ethical, intelligent, highly motivated, a skilled manager, and able to adapt to the forces around him/her‚Äîcustomers, suppliers, department employees, and co-workers. A successful candidate should embrace and exhibit our Guiding Values: We are a family business. Our family includes our employees, our customers, and our communities. We take care of our family. We focus on our customers‚Äô success. Our purpose is to help our customers succeed and to improve their performance. We operate as a team. We believe in a team-oriented approach. We do not pass the buck; we make things happen. We do the right thing. Even if it‚Äôs the hard thing. We look to the future. We always look for a better way to do things. We evolve and embrace change. Technology is our friend, and we strive to be the most forward-thinking, tech savvy company in our industry. We invest heavily in the future. We believe in growth and self-development. We believe in the importance, and in the power, of diversity. We embrace the diversity of humanity and believe in its power to inspire innovation, creative thinking, and positive culture. We are stewards of the environment. We recognize the impact of our actions on our environment, and we strive to minimize our impact.   Education/Training/Experience: College degree 5+ years of sales experience (preferred) and 1+ year of sales management, sales strategy, or other sales leadership position  SKILLS AND ABILITIES Great written and verbal communication skills (position requires significant face to face time with both customers and fellow employees) Excellent interpersonal and customer relations skills Proficient at CRM, Skype/Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.; willing and able to learn new technology Excellent equipment and parts knowledge Proficient in all knowledge required for management  LICENSES REQUIRED: Driver's license

description: American Express is a leading global payments, network, and travel company, backed by one of the world's most recognized brands. We offer the broadest array of charge, credit, prepaid and co brand cards for consumers, small businesses, midsize companies, large corporations and many of the biggest companies in the world. The American Express Global Commercial Services (GCS) business unit is the global leader in providing payments solutions for Small, Medium and Large businesses. GCS partners with corporate clients to help them manage travel expenses and make purchases through proprietary payment solutions and expense management tools.  If you are ready for more than just a job, are not afraid of embracing challenges and setting and exceeding big goals, American Express invites you to share your resume to be considered for future opportunities on our newly created Global Business Development Team.  The Director New Business Development will be responsible on acquiring new-to-franchise T&E and supplier payment business across our large and most strategic customers in US markets within our Global Commercial Services (GCS) division.  Key Responsibilities Include Drive New Sales from prospective clients with annual revenue of +$1B in primary and secondary markets of the Central Region. Lead strategic selling in alignment with compliance and internal partner business requirements. Develop and execute a growth strategy, adapting plans and priorities to address resource/operational requirements. description: Company: Admin Awards Position Location:   Boston or Philadelphia, Remote Compensation: Base + Commission Category: Sponsorship Sales & Client Relations Job Type:  Full Time, 20% Travel Position: Sponsorship Sales Director, Philadelphia & Boston Markets Company HQ: Dallas, TX  The Admin Awards is the first and only awards program of its kind to publicly recognize the invaluable contributions of Administrative Professionals and provides executives with a unique opportunity for showing their appreciation through what is considered the Administrative Profession's highest honor and nationally known as the 'Academy Awards for Admins'. Additionally, The Admin Awards presents a unique marketing platform that reaches the C-suite audience and their Administrative counterparts while also providing a one-of-a kind recognition platform. We work with the country's top brands who trust the Admin Awards to deliver an exceptional recognition and marketing platform.  The Admin Awards Sponsorship Sales Director position is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-paced entrepreneurial organization and is responsible for generating sponsorship revenue in two markets, Boston & Philadelphia.  The Admin Awards offers an incredibly positive work environment with little ‚Äúred tape‚Äù and the autonomy to make great things happen if you are a self-motived, driven person. There is tremendous fulfillment in the Sponsorship Sales Director‚Äôs job role as the impact this program has on the lives of Administrative Professionals and their coworkers is significant. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly skilled salesperson comfortable selling our products with an average deal size of $15k. This position reports to the CEO.  Please send your cover letter, compensation requirements and resume to sunny.nunan@adminawards.com.  Key Objectives of The Admin Awards Sponsorship Sales Director Position Are:  Utilize creative and traditional outreach to drive sponsorship revenue growth Must be comfortable presenting our product in an effective, organized and persuasive way that inspires the prospect to act Research and develop a list of potential sponsors, understanding our buyer personas and why companies work with us with the ability to deliver strategic recommendations based on those personas Track all sales activities, opportunities and deals in our CRM You must be confident you can meet or exceed sponsorship revenue goals by targeting local, regional, and national business decision-makers that desire a C-level audience and/or their administrative counterparts Maintain deep relationships with existing and potential sponsors and strategic partners Maintain extremely high levels of service toward all sponsors, program participants, and strategic partners Manage contract process with sponsors Ensure that all sponsor deliverables are being met proactively and conduct ongoing communications about the level of satisfaction in the program Support the establishment of the local advisory board, board of judges, and other key participants of The Admin Awards program Presentation of The Admin Awards to trade and business organizations to both large and small audiences Organization and co-facilitation of monthly advisory board meetings Collaborate with headquarters staff including the Marketing & Events Program Manager and Coordinator supporting the local market  Qualifications: Bachelors You are a proven salesperson who excels in an entrepreneurial environment with the autonomy to make things happen You are passionate and driven to achieve results Proven track record of 5 + years of experience in business to business sales preferably selling sponsorships, advertising, or marketing products or services Ability to persuasively sell intangibles, concepts, and opportunities to influence potential sponsors, partners, and program participants  Committed to exceptional client service  Advanced tech skills in MS Office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Must be very comfortable on a Mac. This position requires about 20% travel including travel to the Philadelphia and Boston markets and all 10 markets as we fly our team to program cities for event execution. A flexible schedule is required to support meetings and events which may occur outside normal business hours such as nights and weekends for scheduled events

About Sayari Labs: Sayari is a venture-backed and founder-led global corporate data provider and commercial intelligence platform, serving financial institutions, legal & advisory service providers, multinationals, journalists, and governments. We are building world-class SaaS products that help our clients glean insights from vast datasets that we collect, extract, enrich, match and analyze using a highly scalable streaming data pipeline. From financial intelligence to anti-counterfeiting, and from free trade zones to war zones, Sayari powers cross-border and cross-lingual insight into customers, counterparties, and competitors. Thousands of analysts and investigators in over 30 countries rely on our products to safely conduct cross-border trade, research front-page news stories, confidently enter new markets, and prevent financial crimes such as corruption and money laundering.  Our company culture is defined by a dedication to our mission of using open data to prevent illicit commercial and financial activity, a passion for finding novel approaches to complex problems, and an understanding that diverse perspectives create optimal outcomes. We embrace cross-team collaboration, encourage training and learning opportunities, and reward initiative and innovation. If you enjoy working with supportive, high-performing, and curious teams, Sayari is the place for you.   Position Description:  We are seeking a highly motivated, goal-driven, and high-energy Account Executive to focus on large, complex sales to Corporate and Financial Services clients. We are looking to augment our team with passionate people who are excited about joining an established ‚Äúscale-up‚Äù to help shape and drive our future.   What You‚Äôll Be Doing: The role requires a solid background driving a complex sales process, competitive positioning, and experience selling into global financial institutions and money services businesses. You will actively participate in meetings with Sayari management to set and improve our strategy and tactics as well as working directly with marketing and customer success teams to align and drive growth. You will deliver regular sales forecasts and customer feedback on trends, opportunities, and challenges in order to benchmark and forecast your business.  What You Need: 5+ years of experience in enterprise SaaS sales Experience selling to global financial institutions and corporates Proven track record executing complex sales process and growth strategies Demonstrated success hitting or exceeding quota (consistent top 20% performer) Experience with data, analytics, business intelligence product offerings Ability to cater messaging to different audiences - You know what to say and how to say it Experience using Salesforce   What We Would Like:  Ability to be creative and think outside the box Effective communication & presentation skills  Strong relationship building skills  Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with people of diverse background  What We Offer:  Limitless growth and learning opportunities  A collaborative and positive culture - your team will be as smart and driven as you A strong commitment to diversity, equity & inclusion  Exceedingly generous vacation leave, parental leave, floating holidays, flexible schedule, & other remarkable benefits  Outstanding competitive compensation & commission package  Comprehensive family-friendly health benefits, including full healthcare coverage plans, commuter benefits, & 401K matching  Sayari is an equal opportunity employer and strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply. We believe diversity and inclusion mean our team members should reflect the diversity of the United States. No employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on race, color, ethnicity, religion, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability status, veteran status, genetics, or political affiliation. We strongly encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.  APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS The application package should contain a cover letter and resume. We will only consider complete applications. Please direct all applications and inquiries to hr@sayarianalytics.com, including the position name in the subject of your email.

jobTitle: Director Of Sales And Business Development
description: Are you a seasoned sales pro looking to put down roots in a rapidly growing agency environment?  Are you a resilient team leader who thrives in the driver's seat and wants to make a difference for teammates and clients alike?  Are you looking for a position that values you and your time with both stellar compensation and profit sharing?  If you're emphatically nodding your head to all that then you might be inSegment's next Sales Director.  Who We Are Now in our 14th year, inSegment is a Boston-based full service digital marketing agency that covers every base for our clients. From lead generation to SEO, PPC to ABM strategies, web development to content and much much more, our team is a creative and collaborative powerhouse. We bridge the gap between pristine data-driven strategy and brilliant invention in an industry too often bogged down by incomplete, imbalanced approaches. As we continue to expand, we're looking for a biz dev titan who can effortlessly translate theory into practice and help us excel in both new markets and client bases.  Who You Are Let's face it, sales and development can be unforgiving. Building and maintaining a quality pipeline is hard work and takes a very particular personality to execute well. But for those treasured few, we're offering a singular opportunity to invest time and effort in a process that can produce genuinely staggering results.  Here's what we're looking for: - 5+ years sales experience focusing on SEO, PPC, Social Media, and Web Development - Recent Digital Marketing Agency experience - Proven ability to be an empathetic team player and a tireless sales hunter simultaneously - Passionate attention to detail and strong listening skills - Demonstrated written and spoken communication skills that shine in the spotlight - Strongly methodological approach to sales prospecting and lead generation  Your responsibilities will include: - Generating and qualifying new sales opportunities - Overseeing direct/B2B sales - Promoting inSegment with the express goal of expanding our market and clientele - Establishing and nurturing client relationships while ceaselessly tracking down new opportunities - Directing strategic marketing efforts and developing winning proposals and presentations - Building a robust and accurate revenue pipeline and forecasting sustainable growth - Executing well-honed sales cycles from plan to close

Description  ABOUT US:  BAK, a Truck Hero company, has led the truck accessories industry with new and innovative truck bed cover concepts that emphasize style, quality, durability, and functionality for our customers. We remain committed to providing the highest quality engineered products, shortest lead times, world-class customer service, and best warranties in the industry!  In response to our continued growth, BAK, is continually pursuing talented individuals with similar ambitions to join our team. We seek people who desire to work in a positive, team-based environment, who can commit to creating top-quality products and are internally driven to be the best. If this sounds like you, then Truck Hero would love to start a conversation about our great career opportunities!  If you would like to see what we do, check out our product lineup video:  Truck Hero - Accessories for Trucks. For Jeeps. For Life.  Position Summary  The Director of Sales will maintain and grow product sales through all channels and accounts and seek new accounts that will contribute to growth plans. This role will cover the east region/territory for the BAK sales team.  Core Functions Develop and execute business plan and sales strategy that ensures attainment of corporate sales goals and profitability. Achieve targeted sales goals for all sales channels and brands including, but not limited to aftermarket warehouse distributers, dealer sales, Internet/E-Commerce. Maintain all customer programs, policies, pricing, and promotional activities throughout all sales channels. Forecast, in collaboration with the National Sales Manager, in the annual budgeting process including projected monthly sales. Attend to customer expectations in order to maintain their satisfaction. Develop new customer relationships and grow sales, while servicing and cultivating existing accounts. Responsible for executing all new product launches throughout customer base. Develop and maintain trade show schedule to ensure proper staffing and proper presentation. Manage territory sales team and support employees in collaboration with the National Sales Manager. Develop and refine regional salespeople consisting of sales, budgeting, and customer relationships. Log all jobber / WD calls in company CRM software within 5 business days. Maintain dealer contact info (names, e-mail, phone, address, website, etc.) in company CRM software for use in our direct mailing, e-blasts, connection to our dealer locator, etc. Maintain your planned activities on the shared calendar 30 days in advance (due by the end of the prior month) and keep the National Sales Manager informed of travel plans when changes occur. Seek new accounts that will contribute to growth plan and mix well with the existing distribution. Be aware of market conditions at all times ‚Äì WD and retail pricing, competitive actions, opportunities, and threats and bring to the attention of the sales team, as applicable. Req Number SAL-21-00048  Position Requirements  Qualifications & Requirements Associate‚Äôs degree in a business related field; OR Four or more years of sales experience Software experience: Microsoft Office Suite, CRM Software, ERP Software Project a professional and positive company image through phone and personal interaction. Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects at the same time with limited supervision; excellent planning, time management and decision-making skills. Possess strong verbal and written communication skills. Function efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Strong motivation, level disposition, work ethic and organizational skills. Excellent work history, attendance, initiative, and drive to succeed. Maintain excellent communication and relationships with others; be a team player; maintain a positive attitude. Occasional lifting of 25 pounds or more. TRAVEL Required to travel roughly 75%. PAY And BENEFITS Truck Hero offers competitive pay and commission structure Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision health insurance A matched 401k savings program to plan and save for your retirement Paid vacation and time off to ensure time with your family and a work/life balance Educational assistance to continue college or pursue other skills and further your career Discounts on great Truck Hero products for you, your family, and friends WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? jobTitle: Account Executive, Specialty Cardiology/Neurology - Houston, TX
description: JOB OVERVIEW:  As a successful Account Executive, you will increase diagnostic sales revenue through market penetration and promotion of Ambry's portfolio of genetic diagnostic testing services. You will advocate the clinical and financial benefits of our products to all levels and call points in the hospital, specialty clinic, and physician's office including MD's, nurses, genetic counselors, and staff. The successful Account Executive will need a level of sophistication to handle customer relationships with industry thought leaders, manage the dynamics in multiple call points, and be able to drive complex sales to closure.   Link to apply: https://recruiting.ultipro.com/AMB1001AMGEN/JobBoard/bcdd10b1-192e-e264-1203-f18eb6dd40c1/Opportunity/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=5c26966e-ecfc-43c8-806c-4b858134a647  Territory: Houston  Specialty areas- Cardiology & Neurology  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage a sales territory Live in the designated territory Manage and grow business in existing Ambry accounts Expand menu utilization in existing accounts Sell genetic diagnostic testing services to new customers Negotiate and manage contracts Introduce new testing products Develop demand for and adoption of new assays Develop and implement customer -specific action plans Develop and deliver presentations Host and assist with Trade shows Manage customer data in the company database Achieve sales goals  JOB REQUIREMENTS:  3+ years‚Äô industry experience selling laboratory services to clinicians and hospitals or medical device sales Cardiology and/or Neurology background highly preferred Bachelor's Degree is highly preferred Skilled in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint applications Skilled using a CRM applications such as com or Microsoft CRM Strong track record of sales success selling a broad portfolio of products and services to different medical specialties Ability to sell technically complex products Expertise with demand creation in a large geography Experience with customer base within territory is a plus Strengths in networking and relationship development Strong oral and written communications skills Some formal sales training experience such as SPIN Selling or PSS Strong time and territory management skills  About Us:  Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.  At Ambry, everyone is welcome. A career at Ambry Genetics is a chance to be part of a dynamic company that aims to improve health by understanding the relationships between genetics and human disease. We earned our reputation as industry leaders by responsibly introducing cutting-edge genetic testing solutions and continually sharing what we learn with the global scientific community.  At Ambry you will be learning, challenging yourself, and having fun while collaborating with teammates through the open exchange of ideas. We also offer access to gym memberships, onsite food trucks, ‚ÄúLunch and Learns,‚Äù and more. Our outstanding benefits program includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, FSA, and generous paid time off (PTO) program. Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and we maintain a drug-free work environment. Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race (and traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to hair texture and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression (including transgender status), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.  Ambry does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters, third party recruiting agencies, outside recruiters or firms without an executed contract in place. We are not responsible for any fees related to resumes that are unsolicited or are received by Ambry. Such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Ambry and will be processed accordingly.

description: Our Opportunity  Chewy‚Äôs mission is to be the most trusted and convenient online destination for pet parents and partners everywhere. We view pets (and pet parents) as family, and we are obsessed with meeting their needs and exceeding customer expectations through every interaction. Within Chewy, the Chewy Health team is focused on redefining how veterinarians and pet parents care for their pets. We are on a multi-year journey to build a set of new pet parent and veterinarian facing services that make it easier to keep pets of all shapes and sizes leading healthy, happy lives.  As part of this mission, Chewy Health is hiring a Director, Clinic Sales & Vet Success (Practice Hub) to lead our enrollment & clinic engagement teams in Bellevue, WA. The Director, Clinic Sales & Vet Success will own driving and managing acquisition, adoption, engagement, and customer success for our vet-facing healthcare service offerings across all segments of veterinary practices. Working closely with Chewy Health leadership, this leader will be responsible for defining and refining the business models and go-to-market strategies for our vet-facing healthcare services portfolio, defining and managing pricing strategies for our services, identifying new growth opportunities for the business and translating them into actionable operating plans, and managing the P&L for the business. Additionally, this leader will own developing strategies and capabilities to enable vet acquisition & engagement at scale, and working closely with technology and operations partners to continuously drive innovation for the organization. The Director of Clinic Sales & Vet Success will be a team leader and mentor in a high-pace environment demanding clear and effective leadership.  What You'll Do Develop and implement strategies and tactics for building the user base of our veterinarian facing (B2B) services, including the targeting, sales & onboarding, and pricing strategies for large, multi-clinic groups down to independently owned and operated clinics Develop capabilities (people, process & technology) to enable account management management, engagement & performance management, and cross selling of new solutions for practices of all sizes Develop a vision and roadmap for tools and automation to scale sales and support capabilities in the organization Collaborate with cross-functional partners across businesses to implement and execute these strategies effectively. Hire and develop a world-class team of customer-focused sales & account management professionals to launch and scale our services business in 2021 and beyond Work in conjunction with the VP, Healthcare Services and Chewy Health leadership to develop short term and long term goals of the B2B Healthcare services Own the P&L for our vet-facing B2B services and manage the key inputs to the business to ensure we are delivering on our plans Negotiate high stakes and complex partnerships across key accounts, such as: Veterinary Corporate Groups, Buying Groups & Large hospitals. Think big and innovate new service concepts to increase sales and adoption Interject new insights and ideas for improving customer experience and improving financials while holding true to Chewy fundamentals What You'll Need 10+ years in technology services/SaaS, eCommerce marketplace or related industries (B2B or B2C) with experience in, but not limited to: sales/account management, product management, project management, financial analysis and marketing. 5+ years leading sales, customer success or related functions in a SaaS-based business Demonstrated ability to build high performing sales and account management teams, including hiring and developing both managers and individuals, and developing effective incentive structures to motivate the teams Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales and revenue goals in a high-growth, fast paced environment Demonstrated success in managing full-lifecycle, complex sales with large organizations Broad knowledge of sales/CRM technologies and best practices (Salesforce, etc.) Ability to synthesize large quantities of and complex data into usable/actionable information Track record of taking ownership and driving results in a data-driven, fast-paced environment Experience with financial analysis and modeling Entrepreneurial mindset Position requires some travel Bonus History of selling into large and small veterinary OR medical practices in the US Experience with launching new technology products/services to veterinary clinics OR medical practices Strong understanding of the overall pet care industry and recent trends In depth experience and understanding of the veterinary profession in the US; DVM degree is a strong plus #practicehub  Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.  If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact HR at chewy dot com  To access Chewy‚Äôs Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here: https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy).

description: The Opportunity  Help build the DataDog of AI from the ground up.  AI is rapidly changing the world from self-driving cars to automated credit decisions -- many aspects of our daily lives are touched by machine learning systems in some way.  Arize is the leading Machine Learning (ML) observability platform designed to help teams discover issues, diagnose problems, and improve the results of machine learning models. In short: we are here to build world class software that helps make AI work better.  The Team  Arize is comprised of industry veterans that have brought to market deep learning infrastructure, autonomous drones, ridesharing marketplaces, ad tech and much more. As we continue to innovate and develop our products, we need a top-notch marketing team to drive awareness and adoption of our offerings.  We are searching for an experienced sales leader that is a player/coach, with a real passion for technology, and can deliver on goals in a high-growth, fast moving environment.  The Role  What You'll Do Build and lead a team of BDR's, Mid-Market Account Executives, Enterprise Account Executives and Sales Engineering to become a market leader in a fast growing market Productize the sales process through building out the sales playbooks, sales operations, technology, and KPIs Player and coach - work hands on with individuals to grow and manage accounts Tenaciously hit and exceed goals Work closely with our Marketing team to provide lead feedback & help drive more qualified leads Provide daily and weekly reports to management  What We're Looking For 10-15 years SaaS sales experience Previous experience in a startup environment Experience selling SaaS to technical teams and enterprises Proven track record of building and managing high-performing sales organizations Stellar negotiating and closing ability Previous AI selling experience a plus Are able to quickly become knowledgeable in SaaS concepts, and the technical details of our products Are outgoing, positive, have an energetic personality, and a highly proactive approach Are passionate about Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence ‚Äì one of the fastest growing industries on earth!  More About Arize  Arize's mission is to make the world's AI work and work for the people. Our founders came together through a common frustration: investments in AI are growing rapidly across businesses and organizations of all types, yet it is incredibly difficult to understand why a machine learning model behaves the way it does after it is deployed into the real world.  Learn more about Arize in an interview with our founders: https://www.forbes.com/sites/frederickdaso/2020/09/01/arize-ai-helps-us-understand-how-ai-works/#322488d7753c  Diversity & Inclusion @ Arize  Our company's mission is to make AI work and make AI work for the people, we hope to make an impact in bias industry-wide and that's a big motivator for people who work here. We actively hope that individuals contribute to a good culture Regularly have chats with industry experts, researchers, and ethicists across the ecosystem to advance the use of responsible AI Culturally conscious events such as LGBTQ trivia during pride month We have an active Lady Arizers subgroup

description: Here at Forecast we‚Äôre building and delivering an AI-native platform for profitable Project & Resource Management that represents the most advanced technology ever applied to managing projects, resources and finances. Our platform automates busywork, surfaces best practices, predicts outcomes, guides projects to success, and most importantly empowers every team member to do their best work.  With our recent $19M Series A funding round led by Balderton Capital (who have backed hugely successful businesses including Revolut, Peakon, Citymapper, Voi, Vivino and Yoox Net A Porter), we‚Äôre rapidly scaling our teams across the US and Europe to bring our AI powered technology to customers across the globe. After more than tripling revenue over the past year, we have huge ambition and growth plans for 2021 and beyond. It‚Äôs an incredibly exciting time to join us on our journey!  Are you our new US Sales Leader?  After a phenomenal past year of growth during which Forecast grew almost 400% and raised a $19m Series A, we‚Äôre now expanding our commercial team to the US. With a significant amount of our revenue already being generated in North America, the seeds are there for the right leader to come in and exponentially grow the business. This is a significant opportunity for a seasoned sales leader to establish a commercial organization with a huge total addressable market.  This is a critical role to the business as we move to invest very heavily into North America. You will work hard, but we are going to have an incredible time doing it. You will be leading the NA GTM strategy and have vast potential for development in the role - your growth mindset and sales expertise will help set the direction for our commercial efforts. You‚Äôll be hiring a ton too, building a team of passionate and humble go getters who‚Äôll help shape the face of Forecast‚Äôs success.  We‚Äôre at a massively pivotal moment in our commercial journey, and you‚Äôll be right in the front seat!  What you'll do In collaboration with our CRO, develop and execute on our US sales strategy across varying segments and industries. You‚Äôll be accountable for US new business growth, and be leading our efforts to expand and entrench the Forecast footprint Build your own team from scratch, managing and mentoring - you‚Äôll be responsible for leading lead generation and closing teams, and ultimately building your own commercial leadership team beneath you You‚Äôll need to be comfortable being hands on with driving performance as we scale out the teams Partner closely and actively with reps on large and strategic opportunities, leveraging your executive presence Closely align with Marketing, Product and Engineering and other cross functional teams to constantly reflect back how to best win in the US market Develop a winning and development focussed culture around continuous improvement and a drive to succeed What you'll have Demonstrated success and overperformance in a senior SaaS sales management role, leading both outbound and closing teams. You‚Äôll have managed successful teams of teams before, meeting and beating quota Deep understanding of SaaS businesses, knowing the kinds of roles and scope required to effectively engage customers Mentoring and coaching attitude, with the ability to empathize and motivate your team to achieve and exceed their goals. Growth and development of our Forecasters is really important to us, so you need to have a passion for this too! Experience and ability to build structure in a fast growing business - building and future proofing your team to be able to prepare for our aggressive scaling is essential Capability to drive and own your own performance and time. We‚Äôre all hands on deck at Forecast, so you‚Äôll have the opportunity to drive your own part of the business A self starter attitude - as the first leader in a new territory, you‚Äôll need to be able to operate autonomously

description: Regional Sales Director, PathAI Diagnostics  PathAI's mission is to improve patient outcomes with AI-powered pathology. Our platform promises substantial improvements to the accuracy of diagnosis and the efficacy of treatment of diseases like cancer, leveraging modern approaches in machine learning. Rigorous science and careful analysis are critical to the success of everything we aspire to do. Our team, comprised of diverse employees with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, is passionate about solving challenging problems and making a huge impact  As a Regional Sales Director you will report to the Vice President of Sales. You‚Äôll cover a specific territory generating and closing new accounts and managing an existing client base for PathAI Diagnostics. You‚Äôll be traveling to client sites and focusing on building relationships with a focus on meeting with physicians, providers and decision makers within the practice to discuss quality, service, and new products and services.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive sales by providing unparalleled service to our prospects and clients. Exceed sales goals for new & base business ‚Äì must be able to show documented sales success (Past President's Club winners, etc.) and is committed to over achievement, must have a "never quit" attitude to exceed all targets despite any adversity that may be faced. Generate new business through prospecting, consultative selling, presentations, networking, and referrals. Manage and grow an existing book of business through on-going customer service, client visits and problem solving. Meet with physicians, providers and decision makers within the practice to discuss quality, service, and new products and services. Challenge decision makers to think differently ‚Äì disrupting status quo with new product launches. Prepare sales forecasts via CRM for territory and manage all sales expenses, logistical costs, and service levels to maximize profitability. Operate in compliance with all regulatory requirements and company policies. What You‚Äôll Need A Bachelor‚Äôs degree 3-5 years of experience in B2B or medical sales experience Outstanding work ethic. Notable interpersonal skills along with great written and verbal communication. Excitement to problem solve and network with clients Excellent organizational and follow up skills. Passion and enthusiasm for driving sales and providing unparalleled service to our prospects and clients. Benefits  For the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. We have a strong benefits package, including heavily-subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you in peak shape. It's rounded out by: Healthcare, vision, and dental healthcare plans, with add-ons for life and disability insurance 401(k) retirement plan Three weeks of PTO per year, plus six paid holidays Uncapped Commissions ‚Äì top reps making over $200k $600/mo. car allowance + mileage reimbursement Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll enjoy spending the day with.  PathAI is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications ‚Äî that's all. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, health, personal beliefs, age, family or parental status, or any other status. We don't tolerate any kind of discrimination or bias, and we are looking for teammates who feel the same way.

description: Our mission is to create authentic belonging experiences for those who own much-loved homes, and those longing for that feeling.  Belong is changing what it means to rent a home by putting people first. It‚Äôs where hospitality meets consumer real estate‚Äîand it‚Äôs about to redefine an entire industry. We‚Äôre backed by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), GGV Capital, and Battery Ventures, just to name a few of our all-star investors.  As the Director of Sales for the Homeowner Growth Team, you are a critical piece of Belong‚Äôs growth and success in every Belong market. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the sales pipeline, driving the sales teams to deliver on expectations and regularly crush sales records. You will be responsible for key growth KPIs, driving performance initiatives, and developing and executing sales playbooks.  We‚Äôre looking for someone who is self-motivated, can see the bigger picture, is able to execute and coordinate cross functional partners, and has exceptional interpersonal and relationship-building skills. You will be deeply experienced in managing and maintaining a high-performing sales pipeline, delivering consistently excellent results. You‚Äôll be an innovator who will promote growth and help us evolve to meet the challenges of pioneering a marketplace.  Who You Are Wise from experience A proven sales manager, with significant full life-cycle sales experience, from lead to post-sales support experience. You are likely a startup vet, having grown your career and helped an early stage startup get off the ground. A hands-on contributor who believes the $4.5 trillion rental market can be significantly improved for both homeowners and renters. Empathetic: An advocate for the customer who is focused and detail-oriented. Relentless: You have a bias towards action, an ownership mentality and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment Naturally curious ‚Äì You always look for ways to innovate and improve and want to share the vision and direction of the company Problem solver ‚Äì You can independently translate high-level goals into actionable plans What You Will Do Strategize ‚Äì Devise and execute initiatives against the overall sales org strategy Experiment ‚Äì Use data-driven decision-making and sound business judgment to run sales tests and lead market intelligence efforts Optimize ‚Äì Drive process improvements and automations to promote efficiency and scalability Analyze ‚Äì Build models to evaluate the economics, value, and opportunity costs of strategic initiatives Listen: Champion customer needs and concerns, respond with empathy, and educate prospects on the significant benefits of joining the Belong community. Enjoy: Have fun on the journey of a lifetime - to build the next great startup. Required Skills 7+ years of sales experience at a notable technology firm, with a track record of driving revenue growth Sales management experience leading teams of sales professionals to record revenue attainment Proven ability to drive inside B2C sales, particularly in the SMB market, including pipeline development,management, and reporting, and lead generation Excellent communication skills. Experience in real estate is a big plus. Success with consultative selling strategy is a plus.

About the role: The Sales Operations team at ClassPass supports our global Partnerships and Corporate Sales organizations and helps guide strategy with the intent of consistently increasing efficiency and effectiveness. As the Director of Sales Operations, you will define the vision for the Sales Operations team and help them execute against it. You‚Äôll work closely with leadership across our sales, onboarding, and account management teams as well as with other cross-functional stakeholders to optimize processes, set strategy, and leverage analysis to drive action and tangible outcomes. The ideal candidate is an established people-leader with technical expertise (Salesforce, etc.) and a proven record of building and managing high-performing revenue or sales operations teams.  Key Responsibilities: Lead and develop the Sales Operations team in order to enable their operational success and professional development  Serve on cross-functional committees that impact the Partnerships and Corporate organizations in both the driver and contributor capacity Define the roadmap and OKRs for Sales Operations, track progress, and provide updates to leadership. Support and work with the team to execute against these goals. Contribute to decide/debate/commit scenarios around strategic decisions that impact the business as a whole Prepare relevant analysis and presentations for the leadership team and communicate progress updates on related initiatives Own top-level cross-functional relationships with department heads in Product, Engineering, Customer Experience, Marketing, and Pricing & Inventory. Establish communication cadences and standard operating procedures for working on projects that require collaboration Own, manage and assess all third party systems and tools used or required by the Partnerships organization Provide strategic guidance and own administration on territory design, account prioritization, and compensation planning  Skills & Experience: 7-10 years of relevant  revenue/sales operations work experience; preferably in a high-growth, dynamic environment 3-5 years of people management experience Proven track record as a Salesforce administrator (5+ years; Admin certifications a plus); able to roll up your sleeves and perform admin/configuration work Experience with vendor management and full-cycle ownership (evaluation, implementation, ongoing administration) of entire tech-stack Excellent organizational and prioritization skills; able to assess prioritization by gauging business impact in consideration of competing priorities Strong business acumen, communication, critical thinking skills, and analysis capabilities Very proficient with analysis in Excel; preferably has experience with SQL and data visualization tools like Tableau as well  Comfortable presenting and making recommendations to executive level and C-suite  Benefits:  Complimentary ClassPass credit plan Employer paid comprehensive health plan for Employees Employer supplemented (70%) health plans for eligible dependents Pre-tax savings elections, FSA, Dependent Care and Commuter plans 401k planning Generous paid parental leave plans for live birth and adoption after 90 days of employment Annual accrual of 20 days of PTO, accrual and ability to utilize begins on day one of employment 12 paid observed Holidays and 1 floating holiday  Work from home flexibility and stipend  Virtual events and team building activities    Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world‚Äôs best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world‚Äôs leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we‚Äôre just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we‚Äôre all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass‚Äô success is its people.  ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

description: Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (Neuroscience), a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a National Sales Director, to be based in Titusville, New Jersey.  Janssen Pharmaceutical, Inc. (Neuroscience) is a company driven by dedication to product innovation, customer focus and employee and organizational excellence.  Our goal is to build on our leadership position in major existing therapeutic categories, while pioneering and taking the lead in new categories. We actively identify and pursue innovative business opportunities. We create partnerships that contribute to mutual success. People are our strength and the source of our growth. We are committed to providing a diverse, dynamic and challenging work environment where associates and their ideas can develop and thrive. Our focus on customers, partners, people and innovation creates sustainable, profitable growth and shareholder value. Our business practices reflect the responsibilities expressed in the Johnson & Johnson Credo.  The National Sales Director (NSD) is a pivotal position for Neuroscience. Highly effective leadership is vital to our success in achieving our vision and executing our mission. We are focused on launch excellence and superior business results across our broad portfolio of products. The role of the NSD is crucial to helping our sales force deploy and continually develop such capabilities as customer engagement expertise, business insight collection, integration of digital technologies and solution-oriented collaboration -- all of which help position us as a trusted and valued partner to our customers, ensuring that we outperform the competition and deliver our business goals. The NSD must embody the trust and respect that serves as the foundation for our brave culture of engagement and belonging.  The National Sales Director, Neuroscience (NSD) is a critical member of the Neuroscience Management Board and reports to the Neuroscience President or Vice President. This NSD role is responsible for leading a large, diverse, and highly experienced field sales organization that is adept at driving demand, managing key account relationships, and working collaboratively with a coalition of specialists, medical affairs partners, and cross Janssen strategic customer group resources. This role will partner closely with other NSD‚Äôs, Marketing leaders, Commercial Excellence, Learning and Development, etc. to ensure that our field organization is equipped and capable of meeting our customer and business expectations of today and in the future. This leader must be adept in working in direct leadership and effective influencing in a matrixed/shared management environment.  Key responsibilities include: - Strategic Planning and Delivery of Business Results. - Establishing and executing a comprehensive business plan for the Business Unit which aligns Franchise and Brand Strategy with current market conditions that include in-person, virtual, and hybrid engagements to drive optimal business results. - Identifying, and coordinating resources, monitoring operating expenses/business metrics, and maintaining key relationships essential to achieving growth and profitability targets, regardless of market conditions. - Proactively leading the team in achieving and exceeding goals. - Partnering with Talent Acquisition, Learning and Development, Sales Operations, Commercial excellence and Talent Management on optimization and integration of sales plans, development plans, coaching, incentive compensation. - Elevating the sales team to be a high performance, outcomes-focused, organization where diversity and inclusion are valued, and where the team's skills, knowledge, and abilities continually evolve to meet current and future needs. - Consistently striving to achieve performance excellence in a compliant and ethical manner. - Developing and applying next generation analytics, knowledge of the marketplace, clinical insights, and customer engagement expertise to achieve superior results.

description: Sales Director, Auto OEMs  Join us in building the new electric mobility future!  Greenlots is a leader in delivering the new electric mobility future through innovative software, infrastructure and professional services that empowers utilities, cities, fleets, transit agencies and automakers to deploy EV charging infrastructure at scale. Our technology is connecting EV infrastructure solutions with public and private charging needs in a safer, cleaner, and smarter way. Headquartered in Los Angeles, CA, the company‚Äôs global footprint spans across three continents with deployments in 13 different countries.  At Greenlots, we are looking for candidates who want to be a part of something bigger than themselves ‚Äì passionate, purpose-driven individuals who believe having a career means making a meaningful impact on our business and the world. We believe in creating and doing ‚Äòthe right thing‚Äô through responsible and sustainable EV deployment. We are looking for the innovative, driven to find a solution in a complex and dynamically evolving marketplace and look at ‚Äúno‚Äù as just a challenge to find the next ‚Äúyes‚Äù.  Greenlots‚Äô is seeking a SALES DIRECTOR, Auto OEMs  As automaker electrification efforts increase, Greenlots seeks to add a Sales Director to our team to ensure that we continue to grow our presence in this market. This individual will leverage the work Greenlots has already done in the automotive OEMs space with several large customers ‚Äì as well as the significant technology and operational investments that Greenlots is making that specifically focus on this segment.  The individual will specifically focus on selling Greenlots solutions to the Auto OEM market. These solutions include software that allows auto OEMs to engage more with the EV drivers; charging station deployments that allow OEMs to provide charging to their drivers and dealers networks; and fleet solutions that allow OEMs to provide a seamless electric vehicle charging experience to their commercial customers.  The role will be responsible for acquiring new accounts and managing a base client book of business. The ideal candidate has a strong history of working across functional teams to deliver solutions to larger customers. Because Greenlots is owned by Shell, the role may require coordination and collaboration with different Shell businesses to build-off of and enhance Shell‚Äôs existing fleet relationships.  The Specific Responsibilities Will Include Consistently achieve sales and revenue targets throughout the year and annually Understand the overall automotive OEM landscape and develop implement plans to generate sales Manage the entire sales cycle from finding a client to securing a deal Update weekly and keep CRM current Unearth new sales opportunities through networking and turn them into long term partnerships Learn the Greenlots solution and value proposition, prepare sales presentations and present to prospective clients Provide professional after-sales support to enhance the customers‚Äô dedication Remain in frequent contact with the clients to understand their needs Respond to complaints and resolve issues aiming to customer contentment and the preservation of the company‚Äôs reputation Negotiate agreements and keep records of sales and data What We‚Äôre Looking For BS or BA ‚Äì but the successful candidate could have a wide range of potential academic focus areas Proven experience in a sales role Ability to work with a team ‚Äì or work solo in some cases ‚Äì to create a work product (presentation, quote, document that explains a product) to help advance the sales process Successful track record selling into automotive OEMs and/or large companies with complicated sales cycles Experience dealing with various types of customers, defusing difficult situations, and managing through potentially challenging customer environments Understands how to work with large customers and internal functional and legal resources to finalize a contract Outstanding knowledge of MS Office; knowledge of CRM software is a plus Excellent communication/presentation skills and ability to build relationships Organizational and time-management skills Business acumen and proven ability to speak in economic terms (e.g. ROI for customer, economic return of our solutions, etc.) Enthusiastic and passion for environmental issues and renewable energy. What We Offer A work environment that allows you to work with and learn from some of the best and brightest in this emerging industry The ability to make a difference in a world that needs our technology to help reduce carbon emissions and enable a more sustainable energy future through the use of electric vehicle charging software, services and infrastructure The freedom to learn, suggest, and implement innovative new ideas applied to our systems, processes, programs and technologies Daily ownership of your role in a challenging, high-growth environment. A casual work environment and culture that support work life ‚Äòfit‚Äô, enabling you to fit life into your work and work into your life, i.e. flexible scheduling, virtualization options, and a generous holiday package Well-being programs that enable you to thrive, e.g. investment in ergonomics, healthy snacks in the workplace, completely subsidized onsite gym program Competitive pay and benefits programs designed to enable you to thrive inside and outside of work Participation in Greenlots' performance and rewards bonus program Best in class, medical benefits that offer 100% health-care coverage for employees (medical, dental, vision) and a 401K program, supporting financial well-being Innovative Paid Time Off Program 9/80 Flex Work schedule A collaborative, progressive headquarter location at the ROW Downtown Los Angeles with fully subsidized onsite parking and access to unique food and beverage experiences

Ethicon US LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, commercializes a broad range of innovative surgical products, solutions and technologies used to treat some of today‚Äôs most prevalent medical issues, such as: colorectal and thoracic conditions, women‚Äôs health conditions, hernias, cancer and obesity. description: Our Opportunity  Chewy‚Äôs mission is to be the most trusted and convenient online destination for pet parents and partners everywhere. We view pets (and pet parents) as family, and we are obsessed with meeting their needs and exceeding customer expectations through every interaction. Within Chewy, the Chewy Health team is focused on redefining how veterinarians and pet parents care for their pets. We are on a multi-year journey to build a set of new pet parent and veterinarian facing services that make it easier to keep pets of all shapes and sizes leading healthy, happy lives.  As part of this mission, Chewy Health is hiring a Director, Clinic Sales & Vet Success (Practice Hub) to lead our enrollment & clinic engagement teams in Dania Beach, Florida. The Director, Clinic Sales & Vet Success will own driving and managing acquisition, adoption, engagement, and customer success for our vet-facing healthcare service offerings across all segments of veterinary practices. Working closely with Chewy Health leadership, this leader will be responsible for defining and refining the business models and go-to-market strategies for our vet-facing healthcare services portfolio, defining and managing pricing strategies for our services, identifying new growth opportunities for the business and translating them into actionable operating plans, and managing the P&L for the business. Additionally, this leader will own developing strategies and capabilities to enable vet acquisition & engagement at scale, and working closely with technology and operations partners to continuously drive innovation for the organization. The Director of Clinic Sales & Vet Success will be a team leader and mentor in a high-pace environment demanding clear and effective leadership.  What You'll Do Develop and implement strategies and tactics for building the user base of our veterinarian facing (B2B) services, including the targeting, sales & onboarding, and pricing strategies for large, multi-clinic groups down to independently owned and operated clinics Develop capabilities (people, process & technology) to enable account management management, engagement & performance management, and cross selling of new solutions for practices of all sizes Develop a vision and roadmap for tools and automation to scale sales and support capabilities in the organization Collaborate with cross-functional partners across businesses to implement and execute these strategies effectively. Hire and develop a world-class team of customer-focused sales & account management professionals to launch and scale our services business in 2021 and beyond Work in conjunction with the VP, Healthcare Services and Chewy Health leadership to develop short term and long term goals of the B2B Healthcare services Own the P&L for our vet-facing B2B services and manage the key inputs to the business to ensure we are delivering on our plans Negotiate high stakes and complex partnerships across key accounts, such as: Veterinary Corporate Groups, Buying Groups & Large hospitals. Think big and innovate new service concepts to increase sales and adoption Interject new insights and ideas for improving customer experience and improving financials while holding true to Chewy fundamentals What You'll Need 10+ years in technology services/SaaS, eCommerce marketplace or related industries (B2B or B2C) with experience in, but not limited to: sales/account management, product management, project management, financial analysis and marketing. 5+ years leading sales, customer success or related functions in a SaaS-based business Demonstrated ability to build high performing sales and account management teams, including hiring and developing both managers and individuals, and developing effective incentive structures to motivate the teams Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales and revenue goals in a high-growth, fast paced environment Demonstrated success in managing full-lifecycle, complex sales with large organizations Broad knowledge of sales/CRM technologies and best practices (Salesforce, etc.) Ability to synthesize large quantities of and complex data into usable/actionable information Track record of taking ownership and driving results in a data-driven, fast-paced environment Experience with financial analysis and modeling Entrepreneurial mindset Position requires some travel Bonus History of selling into large and small veterinary OR medical practices in the US Experience with launching new technology products/services to veterinary clinics OR medical practices Strong understanding of the overall pet care industry and recent trends In depth experience and understanding of the veterinary profession in the US; DVM degree is a strong plus #practicehub  Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. description: Overview  The Oasis at Death Valley is nestled in a lush oasis surrounded by the vast and arid desert of Death Valley National Park, California - just 120 miles northwest of Las Vegas and 275 miles northeast of Los Angeles. The resort offers two hotels - the historic upscale, four diamond, 88-room Inn and the family-oriented, 224-room Ranch. The resort also encompasses an 18-hole course (world‚Äôs lowest course at 214 feet below sea level), four restaurants & lounges, retail outlets, museum, spring-fed swimming pools, tennis courts, service station, and conference & banquet facilities for 10-120 guests. In 2019, the resort completed a multi-million dollar revitalization that included a full renovation of the Inn, including the addition of 22 casitas, as well as, new retail and restaurants at the Ranch. 80 new cottages are currently under construction and will be completed by January 2022.  The Oasis at Death Valley is owned by Xanterra Travel Collection, a diverse global travel and hospitality company, and the nation‚Äôs largest concessioner of national parks, operating hotels, restaurants, tours and stores. Xanterra‚Äôs operations encompass some of the most spectacular and iconic places on Earth. Xanterra takes pride in combining these dramatic settings, landmark buildings, and global travel experiences with truly exceptional service. We seek leaders with a passion for hospitality and who exemplify our twelve values: leadership, respect, candor, guest service, attitude, teamwork, environment, community, innovation, honesty & integrity, profitability.  Must live in greater Los Angeles, CA or Las Vegas, NV area  Responsibilities Responsible for ensuring maximum revenue is generated in room, banquet, and retail departments by all sales staff in all market segments consistent with Xanterra Travel Collection interests, objectives and standards of quality and profitability. Work with corporate revenue management and corporate Director of Sales to continually monitor and modify rate, pricing strategies and packaging in accordance with demand and promotion opportunities for groups. Actively pursue and deliver room nights and revenues from tour operators, Weddings, Golf, Corporate/Incentive & SMERFE market segments and monitor bookings from these market segments. Ensure adherence to group pricing and requirements with Rooms Director, Reservations Manager, Corporate Revenue Management and Corporate Sales & Marketing departments. Generate programs designed to develop new business including building profitable relationships with local CVBs and DMCs. Meet or exceed Sales Plan goals in room nights, revenues, and average rate in all market segments. Develop and maintain relationships with key third-party vendors to build and maintain group business with specific industries to include (but not limited to): Tour Operators, Golf, Automotive Industry, Wedding Planners, Visit California tourism, Historic Hotels of America, Corporate Meetings and Incentives, National Park Service, Convention and Visitors Bureau, Chamber of Commerce, affiliate groups i.e. Church, alumni, motorcycle clubs, etc., and TV/Movie Production companies. Nurture the relationship with the Concessions/Special Use Manager at the National Park Service, since this person is very important in securing movie and TV film projects in the park and Xanterra‚Äô s relationship with NPS in Death Valley. Monitor all group bookings to ensure correct room rates, arrival/departure patterns and overall accuracy of information. Counsel Sales Managers regarding parameters for booking specific groups. Cross-sell turned-down group business to other Xanterra locations as appropriate. Prepare and submit Sales Plan including budget and revenue by segment each year according to schedule established by corporate office. Regularly review property website to ensure accuracy of group sales message, product information and overall freshness and appeal of the site from a sales perspective. Maintain contact with Director of Digital Marketing to ensure effectiveness of site. Regularly review content on Booking.com and Expedia.com to ensure information is up-to-date. Investigate booking discrepancies as they arise. Creation of promotions across both partner extranets. Create and sell packages designed to help increase group business. Conduct client site inspections and familiarization tours as appropriate. Entertain potential and current clients for the purpose of securing business. Attendance at trade and consumer shows that target potential business for desired segments. Ensure sales team is adhering to standard operating procedures in Sales & Catering system (Delphi.fdc) Participate in the weekly Rooms Strategy Meeting, Executive Committee Meeting, and Managers‚Äô Meeting to review sales strategies and activities with team members. Participate in bi-weekly revenue management, sales and marketing meeting. Maintain close working relationships with all other hotel departments to ensure clients‚Äô requests/requirements are met. Coordinate all details of groups personally booked and produce Banquet Event Orders and interdepartmental communications related to the bookings. Perform any assignments or tasks as directed by General Manager or Corporate Director of Sales, Xanterra Travel Collection. Qualifications Minimum of 8 years senior management experience in hospitality sales. BS/BA degree in sales, marketing or hospitality management. Must live in greater Los Angeles, CA or Las Vegas, NV area Minimum 8 years‚Äô experience in hospitality sales with proven track record of growth Self starter, high performer, with vision and the ability to deliver planned revenue Strong analytical skills required to build the sales plan, identify new and repeat opportunities, managing the day to day business and reporting Ability to work under pressure, multi-task and meet deadlines Ability to lead, motivate and develop staff as well as work with cross functional property teams and corporate sales, marketing and revenue management teams Willing and able to travel to resort on a weekly basis Willing and able to travel to domestic and international trade shows Ability to act with little supervision in guiding the general policies that shape the department Effective computer skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and PowerPoint Experience with Opera reservation system a plus Experience in Delphi.fdc/SalesForce.com software applications a plus
