Job Purpose  We are searching for a high-energy Sr. Director of Sales who can recognize opportunities and turn leads into long lasting partnerships. Serve as a primary point of contact for business negotiations, lead on partner roadmap planning and successfully close deals. With extensive product knowledge in iGaming, sports betting and understanding of industry trends, the Sr. Sales Director will communicate directly with clients and prospects, understand their needs, and recommend new products and services that will help them grow their operations. The ability to work cross-functionally is paramount, as you will work with our marketing, development, legal, finance and product groups.  Description Of Job Responsibilities Generate new sales leads and pipeline opportunities Drive revenue targets within assigned accounts and/or territories through effective leadership, consultative support, and relationship building to contribute to the attainment of the company‚Äôs sales goals Engage the marketing and product teams to develop marketing and product support where new business opportunities exist Maintain a solid understanding of GANs Content and Services offering as well as expertise knowledge of the iGaming and sports betting industry Create commercial and pricing structure and close commercial deals Leverage business intelligence, industry research, and market analysis to drive commercial strategy and growth opportunities Travel to customers and industry events as needed Requirements Demonstrated track record of planning, managing and closing complex, competitive partnership efforts and managing overall deal life cycles from negotiation through closing and delivery Have the energy and drive to influence decisions internally and with partners Must possess good interpersonal and communication skills and strong negotiation abilities 7+ years of experience in sales, account management and business development. Strong industry and product knowledge (iGaming, Sports betting, SaaS Platform) Bachelor‚Äôs degree required Strong emotional IQ (EQ) and demonstrated ability to create relationships with new people quickly and easily and manage those relationships effectively over time Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Self-motivated and solution-oriented Highly organized with strong attention to detail and follow-through Confident, strategic thinker Strong presentations skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Travel Requirements  This role requires extensive US-based travel. description: The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing leadership and direction to the sales and catering team at the Hyatt Regency Valencia. You will be responsible for leading the teams' strategies for success. The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

description: The Director of Inside Sales will partner effectively with senior management, the executive team, as well as internal and external personnel to successfully execute on our common goals. They are responsible for the overall productivity, efficiency and development of the Inside Sales department which includes setting goals and analyzing metrics, planning, reporting, optimizing sales process, hiring, training and driving the professional development of the manager team. The Director of Inside Sales will report to the Senior Vice President of Sales.  What You Get To Do Every Day Develop and execute robust sales strategy to achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual goals Proactively identify key opportunities and winning tactics to optimize the inside sales process Propose and implement enabling technologies needed to obtain and maintain a high-velocity sales model Hire, manage and develop a quota-driven, highly motivated inside sales team Set goals, analyze performance and support the professional development of manager team Ensure smooth operations and efficient workflows of the team Partner with training and development on building/improving outbound sales cadence Deliver accurate and on-time forecast reporting for measuring productivity and effectiveness, and develop new reporting tools as needed Work closely with internal stakeholders to ensure sales pipelines are full Support the equitable assignment of sales quotas and ensure team goals and objectives are assigned/communicated in a timely fashion Provide input to senior leadership in the development and administration of sales incentive compensation programs Work closely with sales management to successfully implement needed change as the business scales What You Bring To The Role Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in business, marketing and sales or related field of study preferred 5+ years Inside Sales experience 2+ years of sales management experience in high-velocity sales environment Strong ability to make data-driven decisions /demonstrated proficiency managing in metric-driven organization Experienced managing and coaching sales managers Ability to use technological tools with ease G-Suite, SalesForce, CRM Comfortable working in dynamic, fast-paced startup environment Effective communicator and inspiring leader that is motivated by your team‚Äôs success The RealReal is the world‚Äôs largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 20 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories‚Äîincluding women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home‚Äîin support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our eight shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations.  The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements. GHR3968

description: About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  As a Strategic Partnership, Regional Director you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you!  What You'll Do Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of named accounts by cold-calling and professional networking Build productive long lasting relationships that continue to pay dividends through trusted references in your market Be relentless about meeting personal and team sales targets Research accounts and follow through on sales leads while developing a strategic territory business plan Working with Side leadership to sell at the most strategic level and implementing a definitive strategy to showcase our value proposition to independent brokerages, large teams and unique real estate business models Keep an up-to-date understanding of a dynamic real estate industry and local market WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE? 8-10+ years of full-cycle sales experience (commercial or enterprise) Real estate industry knowledge and domain expertise is a plus A proven hunter and closer Strong top of the funnel engagement skills Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Creative sale techniques and pipeline management A passionate influential sales style Success positioning and selling on benefits instead of feature/function Strong communication, collaboration, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, highly confident, and driven Compensation/Perks Competitive salary plus bonus opportunity Equity options Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental) Flexible PTO $1,000/year for learning and development Pet friendly environment Side is dedicated to working with the highest skilled people from the most inclusive talent pool feasible. We maintain that diversity in all aspects leads to positive change, solutions and innovation for our customers and career fulfillment for our employees. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Who we are Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code, not just ~0.1% of the population. We help developers and companies with billions of lines of code create the software you use every day. In enabling more people to code, we believe we will create economic opportunity across the world and will drive progress that benefits everyone.  It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Sourcegraph. Our company is growing rapidly: we‚Äôve experienced 4x year-over-year revenue growth and our $125M Series D from Andreessen Horowitz and $50M Series C from Sequoia have given us the opportunity to make big ambitious bets on our future. We have a huge market (every company that builds software) and massive opportunity (most developers haven't even heard of code search yet, but once you've used it, you can't live without it--just like Google web search). By continuing to hire exceptional people, we have the opportunity to make Sourcegraph one of the biggest technology companies in the world.   To achieve our mission, we're looking for a Regional Sales Director to help grow our values-driven, all-remote team. Reporting to the VP, Sales West, you'll be responsible for working with your team of Enterprise Account Executives, providing feedback, coaching and training to ensure quota attainment and overall account development. Your responsibilities include regional forecast management, customer engagement, and contributing to new customer acquisition efforts.  Sound like a match? We want to hear from you!    Why this job is exciting As a Regional Sales Director, you will have more responsibility, upside, and growth potential than anywhere else otherwise comparable. We strive to make Sourcegraph the best company where exceptionally talented people can thrive. If you join us, we know you‚Äôll make a big impact! Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre thinking:  Within one month, you will‚Ä¶  Begin 1:1‚Äôs with your Account Executives, understand your 30-60-90 plan, and meet & shadow current members of the Sourcegraph team. Work directly with your manager and peers on new initiatives and ways to improve day to day operations; build the best Sales Executive team in the industry. Set your OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) with your manager and develop an action plan to achieve them. Meet key partners in Account Management, Finance, Marketing, Executives etc. - they will be key relationships for you throughout your SE‚Äôs deal cycle. Understand the Sourcegraph customer base, ICP, product and value proposition Begin to hire, develop, coach and manage a strong team of Account Executives to meet and exceed sales objectives  Within three months, you will‚Ä¶ Define and execute a regional sales plan to meet and exceed sales goals in new and existing accounts. Empower Account Executives through strategic planning sessions, accountability and execution. Be a product expert and feel comfortable assisting your team in closing deals Accurately assess the capabilities, motivators, and career goals of each team member and provide ongoing coaching to improve their performance and support their career path Develop and implement sales strategies that drive monthly, quarterly and yearly growth against company targets Perform regular pipeline reviews and accurately forecast sales pipeline  Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and client care Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of Sourcegraph‚Äôs product, value, competitors, and unified communications and collaboration industry trends Consistently help your team achieve their activity goals  Within six months, you will‚Ä¶ Consistently help your team meet or exceed quota Continue to focus on your OKRs  Within one year, you will‚Ä¶ Be considered a top-performing team leader by consistently exceeding team goals Cultivate a team of Account Executives that see consistent month-over-month success Serve as a mentor, leader, or coach to other new peers of the team  About you  We are seeking a results-oriented, motivated, and strategic leader who is laser-focused on recruiting and developing a team that is responsible for hunting net new business with enterprise customers. On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for overseeing our Account Executives and helping them educate the market about the power of Sourcegraph and generating opportunities with new customers.  Your skill-set: 3+ years of enterprise sales leadership experience.  Expert knowledge and experience in building and motivating sales teams, growing pipeline, and hitting revenue targets. Consistent achievement of sales goals with high seller participation. You are a Recruiter! Sourcegraph hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world.  Interview process You apply. [30 min] Recruiter screen.  [30 min] Hiring Manager intro call with VP Sales West, Greg Bastis. [1 hour] In depth interview with VP Sales West & VP Talent. [1 hour] Presentation to Enterprise Account Executives & VP Sales West (leadership style, methodology, customers, pipeline generation plan & deal review). [30 minutes] Interview with Customer Engineering Leader.  [30 minutes] Interview with SDR Leader.  [45 minutes] Final interview with Gregg Stone, VP Sales Worldwide.  Any other informal conversations with people who you would be working closely with but didn‚Äôt get to meet during the interview process. We check references & make an offer.  Not sure if this is you? We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you‚Äôre not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application, and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.  Learn more about us To create a product that serves the needs of all developers, we are building a diverse all-remote team that is distributed across the world. Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all backgrounds and communities.   We provide competitive compensation and practical benefits to keep you happy and healthy so that you can do your best work.    Learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading our handbook. We want to ensure Sourcegraph is an environment that suits your working style and empowers you to do your best work, so we are eager to answer any questions that you have about us at any point in the interview process.  Go back to the careers page for all open positions.

description: Company Description  Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant‚Äôs approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills‚ÄØconfidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats. You will lead, develop and grow an experienced team of Enterprise sales professionals. Ideally within the Computer Networking and Security industry.  Additional Qualifications: Proven record of sales success in a similar enterprise technology sales role Excellent presentation and listening skills Must be able to thrive in a very fast paced environment Ability to hire and train new enterprise sales representatives  Additional Information  At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. description: The VP of Business Development (VPBD) works with the Sales and Marketing and Operations teams to develop and implement comprehensive strategies, systems, tactics, metrics, budgets, resource requirements and action plans to grow and support revenue targets and, future growth targets in support of GMT‚Äôs overall strategic objectives. They help establish and maintain the sales pipeline and support activities and helps resolve complex customer requests or issues as needed. The VPBD oversees workflow of all business processing for their assigned territory including preparation of reports, charts, and other statistics to support the sales role. They also manage cooperation with cross-functional teams to introduce new products or services as needed. The VPBD manages and implements promotional events and interacts with external partners and vendors to increase sales volume. They also keep accurate records of receipts and invoices as needed. So, What's the GMT Culture?  GMT was founded by a group of entrepreneurs committed to creating substantial financial outcomes for clients, transforming audits through technology and hiring the most talented, dedicated employees. We love to innovate and put ideas into action quickly. We live our values every day - they are the foundation of who we are. If integrity, excellence and doing the right thing describe you, you‚Äôre the right type of person for the job.  What Will You Be Doing?  Directing and managing assigned territory to meet / exceed sales and marketing goals and objectives. Collaborating with Sales & Marketing Directors and Operations to develop and implement comprehensive strategies, systems, tactics, metrics, budgets, resource requirements, and action plans, to grow and meet / exceed sales revenue targets and future growth targets within their territory. Maintaining up-to-date assigned territory information within the Sales Organization Customer Relationship Management (CRM) System as directed by sales leadership. Analyzing business processes and collaborating with Senior Account Managers, Sales & Marketing Directors, and Operations to identify opportunities, streamline processes, and improve results. Developing Sales Support metrics and track and report on performance and productivity of the sales team. Ensuring the organization has the adequate skill sets and resources to provide exceptional customer support to meet and / exceed revenue and strategic growth goals and objectives. Developing and communicating sales support strategies to the management team. Building and maintaining a collaborative environment by emphasizing teamwork.  What Skills Do You Need?  While we hire a lot of parcel and logistics talent, our team comes from a variety of backgrounds, and we are eager to find people that are passionate about using data, IT tools and cutting-edge processes to bring value to our clients. We are looking for:  Qualifications:  University Degree in Business or related field preferred Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience in sales support or sales operations Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience managing major accounts Proven ability to effectively interact with Senior Executives Exceptional written/oral communication skills Advanced computer application skills such as Microsoft Word, Excel, etc. Full command of the English language Able to effectively manage a cross-functional team Experience developing sales strategies, tactics, and performance metrics Entrepreneurial spirit, leadership ability, and team player at all levels Solid business acumen, and ability to learn entire business model Strong presentation and training skills Ability to travel 30%  Next Steps? description: Position Description  The North American (NA) Sales Director is responsible for driving the overall regional sales growth and profitability. Key responsibilities include leading, developing and managing functions of NA sales team, Inside sales team, Application Engineering Team, Internal operations, and service within the North American Region to achieve revenue targets, growth strategy, maximize profits, increase market share, and maintain customer loyalty in the local market. The Regional Sales Director is also responsible for maintaining a positive work environment for our employees and adherence to all company and legal policies. Cross global communications with other Regional sales directors in other parts of the world is also a critical element to this position. This position can be based out of the Ingersoll Rand Thomas‚Äô Sheboygan facility but will be primarily homebased.  Responsibilities Achieves or exceeds annual financial targets including revenue, bookings, profitability, and market share. Uses data analysis to strategize risk, growth opportunity, market focus, customer segmentation, potential acquisitions, and competitive targets. Cultivates relationships with customers to foster a collaborative climate yielding the highest levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty. Ownership of the NA region and market strategy within the region. Able to recognize where growth, resources are needed and build an effective business case to support the growth strategy. Prepares and presents results and reports to senior management, including forecasts, market conditions, strategic selling strategies, and competitive landscape. Actively seeks opportunities to increase external awareness. Participates in specific sales initiatives and major account activities as needed, but always maintaining touch with customer base. Drive the philosophy of ‚ÄúStrategic Account Management‚Äù excellence throughout the region and mentor/train the commercial team in this regard. Interact and work closely with the Marketing organization to support various campaigns, webinars and other lead generation activities. Effectively coach, counsel, train and develop all team members within the NA region and enable them to provide the same for their teams where applicable. To communicate clear expectations and drive continuous improvement through company performance management and personal development processes. To show strong engagement results and improvement over time with the teams the role is responsible for. Responsible for environmental, health and safety compliance. Support measurement and control systems to monitor and improve safety performance. Ensure a culture of safety that is acknowledged by all employees to maintain a safe and productive work environment for both shop and office areas.  Critical Competencies / Skills/ Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required - Engineering, Technical, Marketing or Business; MBA preferred. Proven experience in our industry with strong strategic and sales management methodologies is acceptable in lieu of a degree. A strategic customer/business mindset is important. Long term views and plans are required for success. Business analytical skills are needed to determine which priorities have the greatest ROI for the business. Requires ability to understand markets, customers and ongoing trends affecting the business. Profit & Loss experience is critical. Individual must have had 10 years (minimum prior experience) in managing field sales teams and office staff, processes, and budgets. Consultative selling experience in an OEM/component environment is critical. The ability to develop and sustain customer relationships must be demonstrated. Strong organizational, interpersonal, and leadership skills are critical. Individual must be able to manage effectively with both leadership levels above the position and individual contributors actively doing the work, and be able to relate to all in an equally effective manner. PC proficiency in MS Office and proven ability to utilize other applications such as SalesForce CRM, AX or similar ERP, etc. Travel 30-40%  Ingersoll Rand is committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request and a member of our team will contact you.

description: INTEGRUM ~ A MARKETING AGENCY COLLECTIVE Integrum taps into the collective imagination of our extensive network of thinkers, makers and doers to seamlessly deliver innovative solutions with results that are as meaningful as they are memorable. We are a growing agency in search of a highly motivated Director Sales & Business Development to join our expanding team. This role will focus on prospecting for new business opportunities and cultivating a pipeline of new prospects to convert into new clients. This position will report to the SVP of Growth. The ideal candidate is equal parts entrepreneur, creative problem solver and has a naturally inquisitive nature. The landscape of digital marketing is in constant change and you will represent the agency helping, to develop new growth opportunities for brands. Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Research, identify and generate new outbound opportunities ‚Ä¢ Qualify, build and manage an accurate sales pipeline ‚Ä¢ Work with the Integrum team to produce presentations, proposals and contracts ‚Ä¢ Manage all aspects of the sales process from initial outreach though contract execution ‚Ä¢ Lead conversations with mid-level to senior executives in prospect organizations ‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain an active knowledge of Integrum‚Äôs offerings ‚Ä¢ Evangelize Integrum and the services and solutions we provide ‚Ä¢ Create partnerships with synergistic agencies and MarTech companies for new business referrals Qualifications ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of full-time digital agency sales ‚Äúhunter‚Äù experience ‚Ä¢ Current knowledge of the digital marketing landscape and ability to speak confidently about common industry trends ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with branding and experiential marketing ‚Ä¢ Proven track record of success prospecting for new business ‚Ä¢ Ability to understand prospect needs and exceed those needs with the right offerings ‚Ä¢ Excellent written/verbal communication skills ‚Ä¢ Strong problem solving skills ‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a fast paced team environment ‚Ä¢ Ability to multi-task, take initiative, prioritize and manage time effectively ‚Ä¢ Thrive on change while remaining highly organized, optimistic and coachable ‚Ä¢ High level of self-motivation and internal "Can Do Attitude" ‚Ä¢ Experience navigating the intricacies of the sales journey in a virtual world ‚Ä¢ Highly organized and detail oriented ‚Ä¢ Ability to walk away from a bad deal ‚Ä¢ Desire to make an impact ‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree, preferably in marketing or a related field

Ernest Packaging Solutions, a full-service designer and distributor of quality corrugated packaging, packaging supplies and janitorial products is hiring for an experienced Director of Sales. We are looking for talented individuals with a proven ability to motivate, manage, and develop and grow an outside sales force.  Director of Sales  The Director of Sales acts at the company‚Äôs consummate resource in achieving the long-term loyalty of our customers and managing all sales activities. This is accomplished through a combination of taking ownership of key account relationships and providing leadership, motivation and direction to our sales force. Ultimately, this position is the focal point in our company‚Äôs long-term strategy to develop incremental GTM growth through in-depth selling with existing customers and through the acquisition of new customers. Manage and oversee the company‚Äôs sales direction and functions, including development of sales techniques, approaches and measurement standards. Strive to exceed the company‚Äôs sales objectives as to GTM production, GTM%, sales performance and customer loyalty. Manage, support and cultivate the development and growth of the sales force. Nurture the close working relationships with our valued supplier partners as it pertains to our core purpose. Maximize account penetration via in-depth selling. Ensure that the company‚Äôs sales force alerts senior management to any possible customer problems by immediately communicating complete and accurate information to all parties involved within the company. Respond swiftly, thoroughly and effectively to customer crises to assure satisfactory resolution. Conduct regularly scheduled reviews with the company‚Äôs sales force to discuss in-depth account reports, new opportunities, customer problems, competition, industry swings, new product information and introduction and organizational relationships. Act as the point-person for all departments when sales-related issues arise. Establish selling prices and approve deviations within company policy. Support and assist in the implementation of all company policies including credit and collections policies. Implement sales promotions, campaigns and sales contests. Lead monthly sales meetings. Operational Responsibilities Include Develop and maintain a yearly business plan that includes programs for improving the profitability of the company. Contributes to building a positive team spirit. Inspires and motivates employees to perform at a high level. Make recommendations to the company for better results, which should include better methods, systems and procedures. Select, hire and train sales team. Company Overview  For more than 65 years, Ernest Packaging Solutions has been a responsive, trusted partner providing complete packaging products and systems, as well as value-added process cost savings consulting.

description: Dolead is an International scale-up founded in 2007 in Paris, operating in Europe and North America (12 active countries to date). We help ambitious businesses (ADT, AT&T, Kohler etc.) connect with high volumes of future customers. We run paid-marketing campaigns and deliver unique data-driven insights to generate sales-ready leads, at a fixed Cost Per Lead. Our industry-based approach and continuous innovation ensure long-term growth for our clients.  Dolead is expanding its sales leadership and customer success capabilities in the US to accelerate its growth and extend its leadership position in the lead generation industry in North America. In this context, we are looking for a VP Sales North America with a strong focus on customer success and upsell, to join our team within our US Headquarters, in Cambridge, MA - remote possible.  Dolead‚Äôs Mission:   Dolead operates in the performance marketing space, generating leads as a service for large B2C and B2B customers. We partner with our enterprise clients to help them grow by delivering the best possible lead flow to feed their sales. We track results live with our proprietary technology, to capture and qualify leads based on each client's Ideal Customer Profile. We are highly tech, data and customer driven.   Your Mission: Our expectations for this strategic role:  1. General Management (20% of the job) ‚óã Hiring, training and managing talents: motivate individuals and teams to exceed objectives through coaching  ‚óã Business planning: set objectives and make strategic decisions and recommendations based on data and market trends  ‚óã Managing North America‚Äôs Sales P&L - Revenue & Direct Costs (Budget, Reforecast & Reporting) ‚óã Engaging cross functional teams and stakeholders from the board of directors to delivery to finance.  2. Sales Management (30% of the job) ‚óã Organizing and leading new client acquisition efforts (Mid-market to Enterprise) coaching local Sales Reps and Business Development Representatives. ‚óã Demonstrating a strong product knowledge by becoming able to fully demo and successfully discuss our solution ‚óã Working hand in hand with our Marketing team to help generate awareness and demand  ‚óã Attending networking events and conferences to generate business   3. Customer Success Management (50% of the Job) ‚óã Ensuring a high level of satisfaction of our customers to ensure client engagement  ‚óã Demonstrating a strong ability to look into data and produce their own analysis on campaigns performance.  ‚óã Nurturing and expanding existing relationships (upselling) ‚óã Mitigating Customer Churn ‚óã Working hand in hand with the Customer Delivery / Operations teams to deliver performance and repeatable Customer Success Processes   What we‚Äôre looking for:   ‚óè Proven Leader: 8+ years of experience in Sales Management.  ‚óè Customer Advocate: Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills. Partnership oriented. A demonstrated ability and passion to establish and foster relationships. Proven successful track record with ‚Äúland & expand‚Äù strategies.  ‚óè Data Geek: Analytically capable and Metrics Driven - makes data-driven decisions with an understanding of the data and its sources. You enjoy working with Excel / Google Spreadsheets.  ‚óè Juggling artist: Enjoy working within a rapidly changing, fast-moving organization with ‚Äústartup‚Äù energy. In 3 words: adaptability, expertise, and fun!  ‚óè Sharing Dolead‚Äôs corporate values: Data wins argument; Work Hard / Play Hard; POC and Scale; Your Success is my Success. You have a relentlessly positive attitude, a strong sense of humor, and the ability to have fun at work!   Bonus points:  ‚óè You have experience in the Digital Advertising space, and even better in the Lead Generation Industry. ‚óè You have experience with Hubspot CRM and SalesNavigator  ‚óè You speak French, or at least you enjoy trying, and you are willing to take the 1 week training trip in Paris.   Why join Dolead?  You'll experience the following perks as a full-time employee, with a clear path & milestones along your journey with us:  ‚óè Competitive package + stocks options  ‚óè Full benefits, including medical, dental, and vision  ‚óè Unlimited PTO  ‚óè Flexible remote policy  ‚óè Work with an amazing product in an exciting scale-up environment  ‚óè Local team event and opportunity to travel to Paris HQ or to Europe for management seminars or with global teams   Dolead is above all an international and dynamic team of hard-working & hard-playing people. We have a strong start-up culture and team values.   Onboarding ‚óè Trip to Paris to meet the team and complete your training ‚óè 1-month Training with our Global Sales & Customer Success Team  Process :  ‚óè First call for fit on both sides ‚óè Interview with CEO to understand our shared mission ‚óè Case study to test Customer Success and Analytical Skills ‚óè Meeting with key C-Level and Directors for collaboration and chemistry

jobTitle: Global Sales Planning and Process Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving complex problems with limited resources. We are looking for someone to enable the Revenue organization to grow and operate more effectively through planning and globally consistent standards and processes. You will manage resource allocation and project investment to optimize ROI and partner cross-functionally to identify the needs to support, scale, and measure our business.  You Will Lead the quarterly target setting and annual planning process across Rev Ops, Marketing, and Sales and recommend and guide where we invest in resources and projects to enable growth and productivity Align Global GTM team priorities Design and refresh processes to enable scale; work ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù with other central operations partners on standard processes to support delivery of targets, segmentation, territory management, reporting, etc. Interlock and streamline Rev Ops/GTM initiatives and operating structures, driving synergy Proactively review and identify opportunities for how we can grow our business or operate more efficiently through innovation and automation Develop strong working relationships with Stripes across levels and functions Leverage internal and external insights to make data-driven recommendations We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 10+ years of experience in planning, strategy, business operations, management consulting, investment banking, or a related discipline A strong track record of delivering major, complex projects in ambiguous environments An ability to simplify, structure, and diagnose problems Experience implementing solutions, not just setting strategy A high degree of comfort working quickly in a high growth, fast-paced environment An ability to seamlessly transition from the high level to very detailed, and willingness to ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù Experience working in a sales and marketing organization Prior experience with payments You Should Include These In Your Application LinkedIn profile and resume

jobTitle: Senior Brand Sales Director (Remote, East Region)
description: Please note that while this role will operate remotely, it is required that the candidate resides in the East Region and within 50 miles of a major airport. States included in Yelp's defined East Region include: Pennsylvania, New York, Vermont, New Hampshire, Maine, Massachusetts, Connecticut, Rhode Island, New Jersey, Virginia, Delaware, Maryland, West Virginia, Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Louisiana, Arkansas, Alabama, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Florida. Yelp‚Äôs mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp‚Äôs Enterprise team partners with National businesses to provide industry leading digital advertising solutions. Yelp‚Äôs premium native search advertising products deliver strong ROI by helping clients connect with potential customers at the bottom of the purchase funnel. Yelp has become an essential part in client‚Äôs Local advertising mix and the Enterprise team is growing fast.  We are looking for an entrepreneurial, sales driven leader to generate revenue with our search re-targeting product, primarily through Agencies. You will develop and work a territory and drive new business from prospecting to close. As Yelp‚Äôs Brand Sales Director, you will drive revenue and growth of Yelp‚Äôs search re-targeting products through our audience platform.  To succeed in this role, you will need to have relevant digital or advertising sales experience and a demonstrated track record of exceeding goals. The Brand Sales Director role is key to Yelp‚Äôs success and offers significant career growth opportunities within Yelp‚Äôs Enterprise Sales team!  Where You Come In You will work across a territory of strategic accounts while prospecting for new accounts that are a strong fit for Yelp‚Äôs advertising solutions You will own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close You will map client organizations and build relationships with multiple contacts focusing on decision-makers You will understand client‚Äôs business objectives and challenges and align Yelp‚Äôs search re-targeting solutions to accomplish their goals You will partner with clients & agencies to develop a strategy utilizing Yelp‚Äôs Audience Platform product You will identify budgets within the client‚Äôs organization tied to driving in-store, e-commerce & brand sales to fund new Yelp campaigns You will collaborate with Yelp‚Äôs Account Management and the Customer Success teams to ensure strong client experiences and program performance post-sale Lead ad hoc projects focused on the strategic revenue growth opportunities What It Takes To Succeed 12+ years relevant experience across Sales, Digital, Advertising and Agency roles. Proven track record of exceeding multi-million dollar Sales Targets 8+ years of direct sales experience Experienced communicator with proven track record of Executive outreach You are motivated and tenacious with an unwillingness to settle for anything less than your best! You are hungry to grow your career and tackle new challenges with a clear desire to have a big impact on Yelp‚Äôs revenue and client set! You have a strong track record of exceeding revenue targets and comfortable closing $150,000+ deals Entrepreneurial with history of building partnerships from scratch Ready and willing to roll up your sleeves and build something big at Yelp Easy-going, cool headed, with a track record of collaboration and working well internally Bought in to Yelp‚Äôs mission and naturally puts the company and team first Able to Travel 15-20% of the time What You'll Get Available your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (Employee-only plans available at no cost to the employee) 15 days PTO per year for first 2 years of employment (accrual begins on date of hire); number of PTO days increases after 2 years of tenure, 5 paid wellness days, 12 paid holidays, 1 floating holiday Up to 14 weeks of parental leave Monthly wellness reimbursement Health Savings, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care accounts 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match Employee stock purchase plan At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education ‚Äî and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include ‚ÄúPlaying Well With Others‚Äù and ‚ÄúAuthenticity.‚Äù  We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.  We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.  Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description: Join the BenQ Team It's an exciting time to work at BenQ! BenQ North America is a growing company focused in the consumer electronics and professional AV markets. We are looking for a Director of Sales US with the passion and drive to succeed in the highly competitive display industry, while delivering on the promise of Bringing Enjoyment n' Quality to the lives of our loyal customers.  Reporting to the Director of Sales North America, the Director of Sales US will be responsible for providing strategic guidance and managing the US C&DP sales team. A successful candidate will also be responsible for growing revenue at existing customers, developing new customer relationships, and expanding our BenQ monitor and projector product lines at key partners. There is a strong focus on team building, bringing in new business, strengthening existing customer relationships, and building long term customer relationships.   Duties & Responsibilities: Lead and manage the Consumer & Data Products US Sales team Ensure sales team is well versed and trained on products they will be selling Work with the management team to set quotas and revenue targets for sales team members Coach and develop team members Maximize revenue growth, achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets with retail and DMR key partners Develop and implement sales plans specific to customers and channels, where needed Build relationships with key decision makers Effectively communicate and demonstrate BenQ products and key benefits Be the "voice of the customer" to the organization Provide weekly sales updates, monthly forecasts, and present monthly business status updates to the management team Work closely with LOB product teams to ensure proper products and programs for each customer Collaborate with LOB teams on marketing, messaging, and collateral for customers as needed Initiate and coordinate development of action plans to penetrate new markets Maintain knowledge of competition and current market trends Recommend corporate strategy where applicable  Required Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 10-15 years industry experience Strong experience in managing, coaching, and building a strong sales team in the US market Deep relationships and experience in managing consumer retail and online channels; must demonstrate existing strong relationships with key customers in this field Willing to make decisions quickly and take responsibility Flexible and able to shift priorities as needed Proven track record of achieving strong results Highly motivated, innovative, and results driven Top achiever who is flexible, adaptable, creative, and able to set strategy for key accounts and the sales team Excellent at problem resolution and creating solutions Excellent time management and organizational skills; attention to detail Independent contributor who meets deadlines Strong team member  Education:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred  Compensation:  Based on experience; we offer a highly competitive base salary plus bonus  Position Type:  Full-Time, home office based Local and regional travel, as needed  About BenQ America Corp. The BenQ digital lifestyle brand stands for ‚ÄúBringing Enjoyment ‚ÄòN‚Äô Quality to Life,‚Äù fusing lifestyle with technology, enjoyment with productivity, and aesthetic design with purpose-built engineering. It is this mantra that has made BenQ the #1-selling projector brand powered by TI DLP¬Æ technology in The Americas. BenQ is a leading provider of competitive eSports Monitors and gear, LCD gaming, entertainment, photography, and business monitors and award-winning home theater projectors. We also offer an extensive line of visual display and presentation solutions including laser and 4K projectors, interactive flat panels and other large-format displays for education, corporate and enterprise environments. More information is available at www.BenQ.com.

description: FanFood is looking for a talented and competitive Director of Sales that thrives in a quick sales cycle environment with a growing sales team ‚Äì providing credible leadership in a dynamic and fluid environment.  The Director of Sales will be delivering solutions across a wide variety of market segments ‚Äì inclusive of sports, entertainment, restaurants, education and many more. They will be required to navigate the product positioning throughout a wide variety of opportunities ‚Äì implementing a tailored sales approach to fit the audience with our growing sales team.  A Director of Sales will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You must be comfortable managing a growing team of category sales leads as well as working with the executive team to set sales targets, manage the pipeline and drive marketing initiatives. The approach will consist of inside sales and outbound sales strategies.  This role will ideally be located in the Chicagoland area.  Duties And Responsibilities  Managing & Coaching Manage all aspects of the sales effort including prospecting, opportunity qualification, contract negotiation and handoff to customer success Build and lead a high performing sales team via strategic guidance, industry insights, and sales training; while focusing on quantitative results Ensure the attainment of assigned sales quotas by leading the sales process, providing direction and recommendations to improve sales close ratios Coach and mentor a growing sales team by delegating responsibility, empowering decision making, and fostering collaborative communications Sales Strategy & Operations Build a scalable, repeatable, and predictable revenue engine Deliver a comprehensive on-boarding and sales training process Develop the organizations go-to-market strategy. Lead the Sales organization in the acquisition of new customers and the retention of existing customers Establish performance metrics and utilize reporting tools to monitor the results of direct reports, while providing concise forecasting and reporting Develop annual business plans for key accounts across all sales channels, including pricing, comprehensive account plans, and forecasts Maintain high level of pipeline, funnel and CRM discipline (Hubspot experience a plus) by including accurate forecasting around revenue; i.e. ensuring entire team records meeting activity, opportunity value and close/won dates, etc. Drive annual planning process across the sales organization, including business modeling, white space analysis, territory planning, compensation design, in close partnership with cross-functional leadership team. Work with team to discover and manage distribution partnerships to increase reach Help drive marketing strategy by working with the CEO and category leaders. Sales Development Prospecting and developing a pipeline and closing sales in emerging verticals (new sports and new categories) Being a spokesperson for FanFood and its brand initiatives as needed in local and national presentations of the technology and its assets Attend tradeshows and key events to drive new business and market awareness Requirements 5+ years of sales leadership experience in a fast-paced, high-growth SaaS startup, experience establishing a successful and scalable Enterprise Sales team Strong understanding of B2B SaaS or subscription business model Strong track record of achieving and exceeding revenue goals Possesses a strategic vision and an ability to execute Showcases entrepreneurial spirit with strong relationship management and negotiation skills Passion for developing and mentoring sales talent Natural results-oriented leader with inherent personal drive; ability to navigate ambiguity, operate effectively in a hyper-growth, start-up environment, and motivate a team of high performing individuals. Exceptional communication and presentation skills with the ability to clearly articulate compelling value propositions of our products

description: CBS Television Stations consists of 28 CBS-owned stations in 17 major U.S. markets, as well as the stations‚Äô digital properties. The portfolio of stations includes 15 that are part of the CBS Television Network, eight affiliates of The CW Network, three independent stations and two MyNetworkTV affiliates.  The station group‚Äôs properties also include CBSN Local, a joint initiative with CBS Interactive that features direct-to-consumer streaming news services in the markets where the Company has local news organizations. CBS Television Stations‚Äô premium local content is also distributed to consumers by the group‚Äôs websites and mobile applications.  Summary: WWJ-TV CBS 62 / WKBD-TV CW50 Detroit, the ViacomCBS Owned & Operated Duopoly in the Detroit Market, is seeking a VP Director of Sales to drive our total station sales effort. In this position, the VP/DOS will work directly with the station‚Äôs Vice President/General Manager and the Division Sales Team to establish and implement strategies to meet Multi-Media (Linear and Non-Linear) sales objective goals.  Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To The Following Responsible for day-to-day sales operations and achieving revenue goals of both broadcast and digital assets, including home and out-of-market sales. Provide accurate forecasting and develop fiscal year revenue budgets reflective of overall station goals. Price, manage and control broadcast commercial and digital inventory to ensure revenue budgets are achieved. Maintain constant awareness of market conditions, competitive changes, emerging categories, and revenue opportunities and adjust operational plans as needed. Prepare and present weekly and quarterly department summaries delivering insightful analytics and directional guidance. Educate sales department in local and national trends and provide them with new selling ideas and techniques. Recruit, hire, train and evaluate sales managers and account executives to achieve positive, inclusive culture delivering on maximum results and job satisfaction. Develop and maintain positive relationships with key decision makers with both advertising agencies and direct clients. Oversee stations compliance to FCC requirements regarding political advertising and political file uploading. Conduct regular sales meetings and travel as needed. Maintain highest-level business integrity and leadership representative of station and company outlined goals. Other duties as assigned. Preferred Experience/Qualifications Minimum 5 years prior broadcast television sales management experience at a major market television station. Position requires excellent organizational/time management skills and leadership ability. Proficient in the use of MS Office applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc. Knowledge of Nielsen, ComScore, Wide Orbit, Strata and Salesforce preferred. Must be self-motivated, self-disciplined, have a positive attitude and be an effective communicator. ViacomCBS is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) including disability/vet.  At ViacomCBS, the spirit of inclusion feeds into everything that we do, on-screen and off. From the programming and movies we create to employee benefits/programs and social impact outreach initiatives, we believe that opportunity, access, resources and rewards should be available to and for the benefit of all. ViacomCBS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. description: Organizational Overview The Philadelphia Eagles, Super Bowl LII Champions, are known as one of the more progressive organizations in professional sports and have come to be considered one of the most storied sports franchises in history. As an organization the Philadelphia Eagles is both an exciting and demanding place to work fueled by passion, dedication, and a commitment on and off the field. We take our responsibility to the community seriously; the Eagles aim to make an impact in the Greater Philadelphia area. To give back to the community, the Eagles have developed programs that provide support to those whose need it most through Eagles Autism Foundation (EAF) and Eagles in the Community. In addition, we are an environmental leader with our Go Green Program. The executive offices are in the NovaCare Complex. This spectacular 108,000-square-foot-facility offers the very best in terms of space, amenities, care, and effort put forth for the players, coaches, and staff. Lincoln Financial Field is one of the premier sports and entertainment facilities in the United States. In addition to being the home of the Philadelphia Eagles, the stadium plays host to numerous other events, providing an unmatched spectator experience for over 65,000 fans. Lincoln Financial Field is maintained and managed by professionals working together to provide the highest quality sports and entertainment experience in a safe, clean, and friendly environment.  Position Summary The Director, Corporate Partnerships is an integral member of the Corporate Partnerships Team, who is responsible for identifying and creating new revenue opportunities that result in significant new innovative partnerships for the Philadelphia Eagles. The role requires a strong passion for sales development and positive enthusiasm for collaboration with the Partnership Activation team and other key internal stakeholders.  Reporting Relationships The Director, Corporate Partnerships reports to the Vice President of Corporate Partnerships.  Position Responsibilities Identify, prospect, establish and research leads to develop new, long-term corporate relationships. Move quickly to establish a prospect pipeline, create outreach plan, qualify prospects, and determine partnership viability with regional, national and international companies. Analyze open and emerging partner categories and develop strategy to engage prospective brands Be a leader on industry best practices, emerging categories, industry trends, best practices and integrate leanings into the sales process Maximize revenue for existing corporate sales inventory and creatively work with the team to create new assets and programs to drive new revenue. Utilize creativity to build customized partnership proposals with a focus on B2C and B2B strategies for prospective clients, that meet their marketing and partnership objectives. Develop promotional extensions to further the brand marketing objectives of our partners and the Eagles organization. Work closely with the Eagles Entertainment Team (content/digital/social media) to strategize and leverage relevant solutions for prospective and current partners. Collaborate with other departments including, Marketing, social and Digital, Community Relations, communications, Premium, Ticket operations, Finance and Stadium Operations to identify and maximize partnership selling opportunities. Coordinate corporate partner presentations and all related responsibilities, including collateral and audio/visual resources. Manage and lead corporate account renewal process for assigned accounts. Collaborate and communicate with the Corporate Activation team regarding partner programs and contractual commitments. Meet/exceed sales and renewal goals as defined by VP of Corporate Partnerships. Attend and participate in weekly Departmental Corporate Partnerships team meetings and sales meetings, and other weekly meetings as required. Able to interface with colleagues, senior executives and clients effectively and personably, recognizing the need to adjust communication style accordingly to the audience. Ability to work collaboratively with a group of highly motivated team members. Exhibit good judgement and decision-making skills. Handle other duties as assigned by the Vice President, Corporate Partnerships, or other Executives Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree required. 8 + years previous professional sports related sales and/or media sales experience preferred. A proven track record of success with experience in prospecting and negotiating deals worth $500,000 or more annually. A strong passion for new sales development. Demonstrated knowledge of practices and principals of sales and marketing required. Demonstrated knowledge of digital and social media. Demonstrated ability to develop relationships with potential corporate clients required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Ability to demonstrate full use of PowerPoint and other presentation / proposal formats. Creativity ‚Äì a track record of unique concepts, campaigns or promotional extensions which can be attributed to you. Strong presentation, public speaking and storytelling skills Proficient in Microsoft Office, Outlook, Excel, Word, CRM and other related computer skills as needed. Flexible to work weekends and holidays depending on the unique NFL and Event schedule at Lincoln Financial Field This position currently is subject to a COVID-19 vaccination requirement, subject to applicable law.  Desired Competencies Personal Accountability - Not afraid to make tough decisions, gains input from others and moves decisions forward in the organization; accountable for actions. Integrity & Values - Can be trusted to act in a manner that is truthful and values direct, honest communication at all levels of the organization. Interpersonal Confidence - Strong interpersonal skills; can effectively communicate and relate to all levels within and outside the organization; creates and builds positive and productive relationships. Results Oriented - Drives the team and the organization for results to improve bottom line performance; able to make timely or planned decisions appropriate to the circumstances or situation. Adaptability - Responds quickly and effectively to changing trends and circumstances; embraces change and welcomes fresh perspectives; learns from past mistakes and adjusts accordingly. Managing Processes - Ability to manage appropriate steps to get projects completed; has strong abilities to organize people and processes; can create a plan for resourceful workflow. Organizational Ability - Can manage people and resources to get projects completed; has a strong ability to multi-task and keep order.

description: Who We Are StreamLabs, a subsidiary of Chubb INA Holdings, offers leading IoT app-enabled water monitoring, leak detection and water shut-off products and software services. StreamLabs is made up of a diverse team of entrepreneurially spirited individuals from consumer products, industrial, engineering, insurance, and insure-tech backgrounds. As part of Chubbs Internet of Things (IoT) Center of Excellence, SteamLabs has offices and a Product Innovation Lab in Atlanta, and works directly with team members in Whitehouse Station, New Jersey. Chubb‚Äôs Internet of Things (IoT) Center of Excellence leverages connected device technologies to reduce loss due to water damage and other causes in the enterprise, consumer, and connected home space. StreamLabs‚Äô Control and Monitor product use patented and proprietary ultrasonic technology to monitor waterflow and alert property owners to potential water damage. This directly benefits property owners, and advances Chubb‚Äôs strategy to offer best-in-class ‚Äúpredict and prevent‚Äù risk engineering services. Who You Are As a connected device manufacturer in the emerging field of insure-tech IoT, we are looking for individuals with a can-do attitude to be part of a collaborative team focused on curating new products and solutions, and on providing exceptional experience for our customers. - You are a driving force behind the success of every project; open-minded, data-driven, analytical, and pay high attention to details. - You are not uncomfortable in ambiguous or rapidly evolving situations. - You are not bogged down by how things have been done before. - You relate well with people, possessing diplomatic and constructive skills, but are also not afraid to challenge. You respect others. You can follow and lead. - You are highly competent, creative, and self-motivated and you have an eagerness to learn and excel in a fast-paced environment. What You Will Do - Develop sales strategies and playbooks to support business objectives - Work with marketing and management teams to develop digital strategies and campaigns by channel - Drive sales growth through all channels; B2B ‚Äì wholesale plumbers, re/insurance carriers and agencies and affiliates; B2C ‚Äì eCommerce and online retail - Coordinate sales campaigns with Chubb IoT team and other Chubb business units - Actively engage in the marketplace to drive awareness of our IoT solutions with targeted clients-tradeshows, thought leadership and client workshops - Identify new opportunities through effective pipeline development, territory analysis and management - Effectively communicate value propositions through presentations and proposals - Accountable to achieve top line sales goal of $5M during the first year of hire What We Are Looking For - 10+ years of experience with at least 5+ years of sales and business development in the consumer and commercial space - Experience working with remote highly distributed teams - Experience developing and presenting proposals, value propositions and business cases - Experience selling & delivering digital, Internet of Things, &/or Connected solutions to multi-channel partners - Ability to understand market and customer needs and work with product teams to help position our offerings - Understanding of software technical lingo, MS Office skills About Chubb Chubb is the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 31,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com.

description: Ideal candidate will reside in Jacksonville, Orlando, Tampa, Palm Beach, Tallahassee, or Georgia and have independent agent and commercial lines experience.  75% travel required.  This position is responsible for directing efforts to achieve territorial growth goals while maintaining profitability within an assigned territory. Typically manages 5 - 7 BDE or BME‚Äôs within their assigned territory. Requires strong knowledge of the territory and the region including agency and competitor demographics and economic trends. Responsible for managing the expansion of distribution outlets for MSA products by identifying business opportunities in conjunction with the overall regional and corporate strategy. Also maintains territorial sales responsibility, including agency management and aggressive new business development driving assigned agents to meet their business plan.  ‚Ä¢  Bachelor‚Äôs degree; Master's in Business Administration preferred ‚Ä¢  A minimum of 15 years progressive experience in area of focus preferred ‚Ä¢  Progressive experience in the Property & Casualty insurance field ‚Ä¢  Ability to analyze and understand financial and performance metrics ‚Ä¢  Self-motivated with goal-oriented attitude ‚Ä¢  Experience in recruiting, training, managing, and motivating a high performance sales team ‚Ä¢  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including superior customer service skills ‚Ä¢  Ability to work both independently and as part of a team ‚Ä¢  Microsoft Office proficiency ‚Ä¢  Must possess a high level of organization skills and the ability to multi-task ‚Ä¢  Ability to travel; overnight travel as needed
