description: Ascent Hospitality Management  Atlanta, GA  Please note that this position is based in Atlanta, GA. Candidates must be willing to relocate and relocation assistance will be provided.  Ascent Hospitality has an extensive portfolio of hotels and a strong pipeline of new properties and acquisitions, but we're not about numbers...we're about people and that remains our foundation. Our culture expresses a memorable experience for all of our Team Members and guests alike. So we're constantly looking for individuals who work well together for a unified purpose. For our leadership, we're looking for accomplished individuals with a passion to serve others, strong communicators who clearly understand the needs of others and trendsetters who excel at challenges and change. If this is what you're all about, consider joining our Team.  We are currently looking for an seasoned individual for the position of Regional Director of Sales out of our corporate office in Atlanta, GA or remote location in Alabama to oversee properties in Georgia, Alabama and Mississippi.  The Regional Director of Sales will provide strategic sales and revenue direction to their assigned portfolio of hotels for the purpose of driving TOP LINE REVENUE and GROWING MARKET SHARE for Ascent Hospitality. This individual will work with other corporate team members to maximize revenue and maintain strong interpersonal relationships. This position is for a ROAD WARRIOR!!!! Someone who is ready to travel and be hands on with their portfolio of Hotels. If you're looking for a new adventure with great rewards, this position is for you!  Regional Director Of Sales Responsibilities The Regional Director of Sales position will develop and Implement sales strategies designed to attack specific market segments, key accounts or identified need time periods to achieve Hotel Budget and RevPar Growth. Participate in weekly Revenue Management meetings with thorough understanding of Star Report, accurately forecast revenues and ability to make recommendations with changes in rates, mins/maxs and LOS restrictions Become a brand sales expert for the company portfolio, adhering to and being knowledgeable to brand programs, resources, tools and initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will establish sales performance goals for your hotel sales team members Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce group and transient business for your hotels. Travel to assigned properties in the region conducting property visits, sales calls, with written documentation of the visits with attention to follow up. Mentor, coach, and assist as necessary, assigned sales teams, to ensure their success. Supervise sales initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales position will represent Ascent Hospitality at Trade Shows and sales blitzes as necessary. Serve as first point of contact for above property sales support to hotels in the region. Act as interim Director of Sales for any hotel in the company as directed by the VP of Sales & Marketing. Provide training assistance to hotel sales leaders and GMs to develop, coach and provided continuous training. Produce sales department reports on a timely basis Regional Director Of Sales Qualifications Three or more years of above property, multi-property, sales management experience is preferred Regional Director of Sales candidates should have major brand experience with Marriott, Hilton, IHG, Starwood is an absolute requirement Working knowledge on CI/TY, OneSource, OnQ, R&I, Delphi Must be able to travel at least 90% of time. This position is only for the "Road Warrior Strong leadership skills resulting in mentorship and development of sales managers to reaching goals. Regional Director of Sales candidates should have strong oral and written communication skills combined with computer, presentation and negotiation skills. Excellent time-management skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. Strong decision-making capabilities and strategizing skills. Demonstrates creativity in finding solutions to problems. Finds the win-win when resolving conflicts. Remains calm and acts appropriately when faced with hectic or tense situations. Strong mathematical skills with the ability to accurately interpret data to create forecasts and budgets. Understanding of various market conditions and influencers. Education And/or Experience Bachelor's degree or a combination of advanced education and equivalent work experience. Minimum of 5 years overall hotel experience to include 3+ years as an Area or Market Sales Leader with Full Service, Limited Service or Extended Stay Hotels. Management or senior supervisory experience in hotels or experience in the industry with transferable skills. Proven ability to sell. Must be able to conduct and manage meetings, as well as speak to large groups as needed. Must have an outgoing, sales minded personality with the ability to close. *Candidates with Marriott or Hilton Brand Certification will have top consideration** We are seeking a "game-changer" and proven sales leader who can communicate a vision and collaborate with a sales team to generate extraordinary growth.  If we've caught your attention, we encourage you to apply today!

description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving problems with limited oversight. The ideal candidate will demonstrate that they have or can partner closely with cross-functional teams, project manage complex initiatives, and make data-driven decisions. Our ideal candidates will demonstrate owning project management and building scalable processes that outsource from sales critical selling tasks like lead enrichment, pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, and customer risk management. Experience in areas like these will help to ensure we are meeting the needs of the organization by building priority mechanisms that scale selling activities.  You Will Implement Stripe‚Äôs Sales Support Desk global strategy, in alignment with Stripe‚Äôs Sales business strategy Build and own standardized processes or tools to migrate non-customer facing sales tasks into the Sales Support Desk in partnership with Sales, Sales Operations, Data Science, and other Stripe teams Project manage building repeatable and scalable processes that outsource from sales essential tasks such as pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, account optimizations, supportability, and risk management Cultivate a team culture that includes high ownership, customer-first focus, fast pace, high integrity, and an optimistic and positive environment Report out on a regular weekly, monthly, and quarterly cadence to all key stakeholders, with a strong analytical approach and crisp communication style We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 5+ years of delivering sales/user support or sales operations in a high growth technology environment Proven track record in successfully building and owning sales project programs and developing close cross functional partnerships Strong technical skills and sales tooling experience Sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results Experience working within a high-growth, technology company with the ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization Highly organized, multi-tasking skills, taking ownership, and being efficient in ambiguous situations Bachelor‚Äôs Degree Nice To Haves MBA or other advanced degree Lean Six Sigma certification, or proven experience employing the methodology Experience working in the financial services/payments industry

description: Thought Industries - RVP Sales   Thought Industries is looking for an ambitious, metrics-driven sales leader who is seeking to develop a sales organization and drive revenue in a startup environment. As the Director of Sales, you will advocate for your team while working to support our broader mission. You should use your creativity and knowledge of sales processes to provide innovative ideas for business growth. You will own all aspects of revenue generation processes, go to market strategies and execution. You have a proven track record of success with defining the sales playbook, sales execution, recruiting, management and operations while exceeding growth expectations year over year. You will be responsible for creating excitement, trust, and driving revenue for our unique learning platform.  Leadership & Coaching Challenges: Build and lead a high performing sales team via strategic guidance, industry insights, and sales training; while focusing on quantitative results Oversee a team of Enterprise Account Executives, accountable for developing their functional skills and career paths Ensure the attainment of assigned sales quotas by leading the sales process, providing direction and recommendations to improve sales close ratios, conduct pipeline reviews and provide weekly call coaching Coach and mentor a growing sales team by delegating responsibility, empowering decision making, and fostering collaborative communications Drive team to manage their pipeline with diligence and timeliness to support accurate reporting and forecasting for current & future quarters Support the sales team in negotiating contract terms, manage deals to a successful closing, and ensure a smooth transition to the implementation and customer success teams Sales Operations & Execution Challenges:  Accountable for forecasting accuracy, and achievement of sales, profit, and strategic objectives Establish performance metrics and utilize reporting tools to monitor the results of direct reports, while providing concise forecasting and reporting Maintain a high level of pipeline, funnel and CRM discipline by including accurate forecasting around revenue; i.e. ensuring entire team records meeting activity, opportunity value and close/won dates, etc. Equitably assign salesforce quotas and territories while ensuring the firm's financial objectives are optimally allocated to all sales channels and resources through the quota program. Accountable for the timely assignment of all sales organization objectives. Work closely with our product team to develop a deep understanding of our product, competitive positioning and how it integrates with our clients' needs Engage with internal stakeholders to collaborate on opportunities, resolve customer issues, share best practices and partner with cross-functional teams. Proven ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with executive-level decision makers and champions. Partner with Marketing and SDR teams to strategically target accounts. Actively listen to and synthesize feedback from prospects and team members to adjust sales strategy accordingly. Educate customers about complex ideas, insights or solutions in an elegant, articulate and meaningful way.  We are searching for: 10+ years of sales experience with 5-8 years in sales leadership, ideally in the SaaS environment. Proven year of year quota attainment Drive to mentor/coach team to win. Focused on sales excellence and team productivity Possess a passion for learning Strong proficiency in using Salesforce Have a strong hustle mentality with desire to work in a dynamic startup environment where your input can help shape our offerings

description: Why DelRicht? Would you love to be a part of the cutting edge of healthcare and science innovation? Do you want to be an influential part of a rapidly growing team? Are you looking for a position that has sustainable opportunity for professional growth? If the answer is yes, then DelRicht Research might be the right opportunity for you! We are a clinical research company dedicated to providing an excellent customer experience to all patients that participate in our clinical trials. Our clinical trials provide new treatment options for our patients and, ultimately, our goal is to get new medications and medical devices FDA approved!  Our rapidly expanding organization is currently searching for a Director of Business Development to join our team. In this position, the successful candidate will be responsible for securing and retaining business through outreach activities directed at decision-makers at existing and new pharmaceutical and CRO clients. The Director of Business Development will oversee all lead generation, new client outreach, client relationship development and maintenance, and ensure that the organization‚Äôs pipeline supports both short & long term goals. If you have a strong background in the Clinical Research arena and thrive in a competitive environment, we want to hear from you.  Who We Are DelRicht Research is a network of clinical research sites in Louisiana, Oklahoma, Texas, Georgia and Mississippi aimed at bringing cutting edge therapies to the communities we serve. Currently, we provide our communities clinical trial opportunities in: Dermatology General Medicine Urology Rheumatology  Neurology   Director of Business Development‚Äôs Main Objective: Overall, the Director of Business Development will be responsible for building and managing the organization‚Äôs clinical trial pipeline while fostering relationships with new and existing clients.  Job Description: The Director of Business Development will oversee and manage all of the business development operations of our company including but not limited to:  Preparing and executing a comprehensive outreach plan for generating new business Successfully prospecting and selling our services to both pharmaceutical and CRO clients Generating weekly pipeline and potential client activity reports Managing the feasibility process with potential clients Coordinating with leaders across the organization to ensure tactical and strategic company goals are achieved Developing strategies for approaching clients in numerous therapeutic areas and preparing client presentations  Analyzing potential study opportunities and developing a sales plan for each target client  Cultivating strong, long-term relationships with key decision-makers within client organizations and develop in-depth knowledge of the client organization Maintaining general knowledge of all DelRicht Research services and sites Recording and organizing all customer contacts, interactions & opportunities  Generating quarterly and annual sales goals and monitoring all actions and results against plans Handling follow-up related to upcoming trial opportunities with clients and drive completion of new study start up at our clinical sites Maintaining high visibility within client organization and monitoring client satisfaction by communicating regularly with client Tracking trends within the market to ensure the company‚Äôs therapeutic diversity supports future growth  The company culture you will be part of: DelRicht Research‚Äôs Core Values: Production, Humility, Consistency  Production: We deliver on our promises We have a bias towards action: we value independent problem solving We proactively over deliver: we can act without being told what to do and we always have new ideas that will be heard and will improve the company   Humility: We support each other relentlessly We always have enthusiasm: we exhibit passion and excitement about our work which leads to everyone having a ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude  We embrace change: we are excited to always be growing and moving the organization forward which means change is the norm for us Coachable: we all love to learn, we are willing to be taught and will adapt quickly   Consistency:  We always are able to execute: we get it right the first time and promote ‚Äòtouch it once‚Äô accuracy   We have persistence: we demonstrate the tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done  We are calm under pressure: we can maintain stable performance when under heavy pressure or stress   Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in biological sciences or related field (Master‚Äôs preferred) 5+ years of experience in the the pharmaceutical, biotech and/or life sciences industries Demonstrated customer access and knowledge of the clinical research market Prior sales leadership / management experience preferred Coffee drinkers preferred. Tea drinkers accepted.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Research, and Biotechnology

description: Canary Technologies is a fast-growing enterprise hospitality technology company that provides hotels with innovative solutions to drive efficiency and enhance the guest experience. Our core solutions get rid of antiquated technology in hotels. With backing from some of the top investors in Silicon Valley, including Y Combinator, Canary Technologies is trusted by thousands worldwide and serves some of the world‚Äôs largest and most iconic hotel brands.  This opportunity will provide close interaction with senior leaders and founders. Our founders are alums of the Cornell Hotel School, Columbia University, and The University of Pennsylvania- Wharton. They have previously built software companies and have worked at firms such as Bain & Company and Starwood Hotels & Resorts.  We are an organization that strongly believes in meritocracy and performance. There is significant opportunity for advancement and growth in this role, both of which are based on performance and talent.  About This Role  Canary Technologies has a proven track record of success with Sales Development Representatives at scale, and are now seeking a Sales Development leader to help us take the team to the next stage of growth.  We are scaling our SDR team globally and need a Head of Sales Development who can build/manage the team, evolve our processes, and motivate the team to achieve their goals. You are comfortable working cross functionally to drive SDR strategy and enablement. You embody the Canary value of open, honest, direct communication - to executives, peers, and direct reports. You lead with empathy and care about your team‚Äôs personal and professional growth. You love to experiment with ways to drive stronger conversion. You are data-oriented in your approach to coaching and identifying areas of improvement. Above all, you will be critical during this foundational stage of the company, and instrumental in growing Canary‚Äôs presence worldwide.  This job will be based out of San Francisco or New York. While we are currently remote due to Covid-19, we are seeking candidates who are based in the San Francisco/New York area OR who are willing to relocate upon our eventual return to the office (timing to be determined).  What You'll Do Lead and manage our growing team of SDRs and Team Leads Create and manage goals, responsibilities, and professional development metrics Work with our recruiting team to hire top SDRs and Team Leads to join Work closely with our marketing team to facilitate SDR campaigns Provide sales feedback and coaching to SDRs and Team Leads Review cold calling and emailing techniques and provide feedback to SDRs Own sales metrics for the team including trends of leads, meetings set, etc. Report metrics to our VP of Sales and make recommendations to improve efficiency of SDR team Qualifications You have 5-8+ years of experience in B2B SaaS sales You have 2-3+ years in a management/leadership role You have a proven track record of managing and growing a team of SDRs Ability to energize a team and lead them toward action and results Demonstrated background of data-driven sales leadership Proficient with G-Suite, Excel, Salesforce, and Salesloft (or other Sales Automation Platforms) Strong recruiting skills with a track record of hiring successful SDRs and Team Leads Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to be self directed in a fast-paced environment BA/BS degree
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Position: The Director of Sales and Marketing is a key leadership position that will drive the continued growth of our InMotion Hosting product lines. You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and achieving all revenue objectives delivered through the Marketing, Sales, and Business Development departments.  This is a high profile leadership position.  This is your chance to be a driving force to our future success as we develop innovative software solutions in the PaaS, Cloud, On-Demand Bare Metal, and Managed Servers markets. You must have demonstrated success building and developing strategic, analytical, and creative teams with a strong focus on optimizing revenue growth through on-line marketing techniques.   Location: We are open to filling this role remotely (within the United States) or from our Denver, CO or Virginia Beach, VA offices.   Who Will Excel: Someone passionate about growing new opportunities. We're looking for an experienced risk taker who has proven their success with growing revenue in hosting space and open source software/technology environments. Leaders who believe that all team members deserve a chance to rise to the occasion. Our mantra for the last 20 years is to have an honest desire to see people succeed. We seek leaders that are aligned with this philosophy and have proven ability and the willingness to invest their time to professionally develop team members.  Someone with deep online marketing experience with proven success in applying strategies and techniques that result in substantial revenue growth for new and existing product lines.  Leaders who have directed revenue growth for a variety of subscription based products.through their efforts and can adapt processes and strategies for long term, sustainable growth.  Producers who enjoy building and managing new processes, systems, and structures through a data driven approach.  What You‚Äôll Do: Oversee, drive and scale revenue across all marketing and sales funnels across product lines to $100 million book of business.  Maintain autonomy and accept total responsibility for the establishment and achievement of  revenue goals.   Develop and implement successful Go To Market strategies.  Lead high functioning, cross-departmental teams in the areas of Marketing, Sales, and Business Development.  Actively identify opportunities for revenue growth through sales and marketing activities. Create strategic processes for large scale inbound and outbound marketing initiatives. Assess performance across teams for efficiency and effectiveness of campaigns. Actively identify opportunities to influence the creation of new products and enhancements to existing product lines.  About You: Proven experience directing revenue growth for a technical company.  Experience within the open source application software industry.   Ability to lead a team to achieve both personal development and company goals. Experience marketing and selling  subscription services at the consumer level.  Track record of product road map creation.  Have a passion for growth and a self-driven nature. Proven ability in managing sales cycles from start to finish with a track record of successful revenue attainment.  Company:  We are currently seeking an experienced, strategic, and inspiring Director of Sales and Marketing to join our team either onsite in one of our offices or remotely. These are exciting times at InMotion as we expand our brands to service the next generation of customer needs.  This is a chance to be a driving force to our future success as we continue to develop innovative software solutions in the industry.   Founded in 2001, InMotion Hosting is a privately held provider of traditional web hosting and ultramodern XaaS solutions. Golden State Warriors is an equal opportunity employer. description: The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

description: The Director of Sales is responsible for establishing the sales targets for the sales executives to meet the company objectives. Responsible for developing strategic partnerships to help meet the designed sales plans based on the company goals, as well as to promote sales growth and exemplary customer satisfaction.  Essential Functions Develop or support annual sales plan in support of the organization‚Äôs strategy and objectives. Directs the execution of the sales policies and practices. Make sure communications are well coordinated and supports the sales plan objectives. Develop and build a sales team capable of carrying out the needed sales and service initiatives. Help manage and develop distribution strategies. Recommend sales strategies based on market research and analysis of the competition. Assists with complex sales negotiations, attends sales presentations and helps close sales deals. Directly manages very large, high-profile customer accounts, as appropriate. Helps develop sales proposals and responses to request for proposals. Ensures sales employees are equipped with the product, system and selling-skills training that they require to be successful. Partners with marketing to develop lead generation and revenue generation programs, and to create high performing sales collateral. Core Competencies  Analysis Skills: Identifies significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems in depth. Relates and compares data from different sources. Sorts the "wheat from the chaff," determining root causes and subtle relationships among data from various sources. Exhibits a probing mind. Achieves penetrating insights.  Inspiring "Followership‚Äù: Through whatever combination of competencies, inspires people to follow the lead. Minimizes intimidation and threat. Takes charge. Motivates by pushing appropriate "hot buttons" for individuals.  Judgment/Decision Making: Demonstrates consistent logic, rationality, and objectivity in decision making Achieves balance between quick decisiveness and slower, more thorough approaches, i.e., is neither indecisive nor a hip shooter. Shows common sense. Anticipates consequences of decisions.  Integrity: "Ironclad." Does not cut corners, ethically. Remains consistent in terms of what one says and does and in terms of behavior towards others. Earns trust of co-workers. Maintains confidences. Puts organization's interests above self Does what is right, not what is politically expedient. ‚ÄúFights fair." Intellectually honest; does not "play games" with facts to win a point.  Organization/Planning: Plans, organizes schedules, and budgets in an efficient, productive manner. Focuses on key priorities, effectively juggles multiple projects. Anticipates reasonable contingencies. Pays appropriate attention to detail. Manages personal time well.  Persuasion: Exhibits persuasiveness in change efforts, selling a "vision." "Charisma" desirable, though soft sell and quiet credibility are acceptable alternatives.  Supervisory Responsibility  This position manages the Sales Team and Relationship Management. This position‚Äôs responsibilities include: interviewing, hiring and training employees; planning, assigning and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.  Work Environment and Physical Demands  This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and scanners. Frequently required to stand Frequently required to walk Continually required to sit Continually required to utilize hand and finger dexterity Occasionally required to climb, balance, bend, stoop, kneel or crawl Continually required to talk or hear Continually utilize visual acuity to operate equipment, read technical information, and/or use a keyboard Frequently required to lift/push/carry items up to 50 pounds Occasionally loud/moderate noise Selling  The Director of Sales assists with complex sales negotiations, attends sales presentations and helps close sales deals. They directly manages very large, high-profile customer accounts, as appropriate. They help develop sales proposals and responses to request for proposals. The Director of Sales ensures sales employees are equipped with the product, system and selling-skills training that they require to be successful. They partner with marketing to develop lead generation and revenue generation programs, and to create high performing sales collateral.  Position Type and Work Schedule  This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. This position regularly requires some long hours, extensive travel, and may require occasional weekend work.  Travel  This position requires up to 25% travel. Frequent travel is outside the local area to trade shows and client visits and will require overnight stays.  Education and Experience Undergraduate Degree 5 to 10 years in the electronic payment processing industry Minimum of 3 years of management experience Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Powered by JazzHR  eeZPleKFh7

description: About this role  As an advisor, you will bring Gartner's research, best practices, and tools to life across a broad range of world class clients. It's the job of an advisor to increase client engagement and ensure each client is applying Gartner's resources to their work. An advisor will ask insightful questions to diagnose the causes of client challenges and recommend the best course of action. The advisor might also suggest a different approach or talk the client through a best practice from a different industry that could work within their business context. The Director, Advisor interfaces with senior Sales executives to support achievement of their most critical priorities. In addition to applying and packaging Gartner resources to meet client challenges, an advisor senses patterns among client needs to guide the research agenda and event calendar. As an advisor, you will also support revenue partners in commercial engagements.  What you‚Äôll do  Apply expansive knowledge of Gartner research to help resolve high-value business problems for clients through 1:1 interaction, workshops, small group forums, and large stage presentations Engage senior-level executives by diagnosing needs, establishing credibility, conducting substantive content discussions, building relationships, , solving problems, and identifying relevant resources Actively shape the direction of ongoing research and product creation projects; participate in and provides feedback on research deliverables Partner with sales and service delivery partners to increase account growth, retention, and engagement Continuously learn and develop yourself  What you‚Äôll need  Bachelor's degree 10+ years of experience in related field or industry Subject matter expertise in sales strategy, commercial effectiveness, sales enablement and/or sales operations Willingness and ability to travel up to 20%  Who you are  Enjoy helping clients accomplish their mission-critical priorities Excellent collaborator with the ability to quickly build rapport and gain client trust Intellectually curious to learn and apply new ideas and approaches Confident presenter and a high level of executive presence Able to distill large volumes of data into key findings and organize ideas in a logical pattern using clear communication to convey those ideas Analytical thinker with the ability to process information quickly and make actionable recommendations  What we offer  Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, Medical, Dental & Vision Plans, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), 401K matching and more! Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

description: POSITION OVERVIEW: GoldSky Cyber Security is proud to be one of the fastest growing cybersecurity advisory firms dedicated exclusively to helping small and midsize businesses (SMBs) build and maintain formal cybersecurity, privacy and compliance programs. We are rapidly expanding and seeking a proven sales leader to recruit, manage and lead the company‚Äôs US Regional Sales Teams. The National Sales Director will be responsible for all direct sales and top line revenue production. Qualified individuals must show a proven track record of success in building winning sales teams from startup to fully staffed. Experience in the IT Governance, Risk and Compliance (IT-GRC) professional services industry is highly preferred.  Success in this position requires a person who never compromises their integrity, is loyal to GoldSky‚Äôs core purpose, is always accountable and possesses a dynamic image on behalf of the company. This person leads from the front and is highly skilled in consultative selling to identify needs and provide IT security, privacy and compliance solutions to small-midsize businesses. Qualified candidates must demonstrate possession of essential strategies & competencies to manage, motivate and lead a national sales team.  GoldSky has developed a performance-driven culture that values personal accountability and takes responsibility for delivering results that meet and/or exceed expectations.  PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: ‚Ä¢ Recruit, motivate and lead regional sales teams to meet and/or exceed individual and department level goals and key performance indicators; ‚Ä¢ Work closely with executive management on creating and enhancing effective sales strategies; ‚Ä¢ Utilize Traction EOS to develop key metrics and drive the performance of the sales team. Provide accurate forecasts on a weekly/monthly/quarterly basis. Provide mentoring, coaching and sales strategy support throughout the sales cycle; ‚Ä¢ Develop and execute on strategic/tactical targeted prospect plans focused on new logo acquisition; ‚Ä¢ Work on the front lines with sales team to harvest new relationships through a variety of methods including leveraging existing networks, reference prospecting, traditional phone calls, email and social media activity, trade show attendance and subject matter speaking engagements; ‚Ä¢ Communicate closely with marketing and service delivery teams to create new service offerings and drive sales. Manage the collaboration of internal cross-departmental resources and partners to ensure a successful sales cycle and onboarding process for new clients; ‚Ä¢ Perform client presentations (via video and face to face) about cybersecurity, privacy and compliance solutions designed to mitigate the risk of cyber threats and help create competitive advantages for small-midsize businesses; ‚Ä¢ Develop a deep understanding of the SMB market, competition and emerging cybersecurity, privacy and compliance trends within the industry; ‚Ä¢ Provide client feedback and insight to executive management in order to assist in driving for new/improved cybersecurity, privacy and compliance solutions for small and midsize businesses.  EXPERIENCE & SKILLS: ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of successful IT Governance, Risk and Compliance sales experience (or successfully selling professional services to small-midsize businesses); ‚Ä¢ 3+ years in a sales management role with strong interpersonal and mentoring skills; ‚Ä¢ A proven track record of growing sales and developing new business in a dynamic and high-growth environment; ‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years in a quota-carrying direct sales position (Ideally in the IT-GRC industry); ‚Ä¢ Documented track record of success in quota attainment and over achievement; ‚Ä¢ Collaborative Team player & Consultative Selling Skills; ‚Ä¢ Experience working within Traction EOS (preferred); ‚Ä¢ Technical proficiency to learn and present our client‚Äôs offerings at a reasonable depth; ‚Ä¢ Proficiency in MS O365 and CRM systems (HubSpot) preferred; ‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills, and proven business aptitude; ‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of value added ROI business process sales engagements; ‚Ä¢ Ability to travel as required. Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, the Director of Sales and Marketing will be responsible for the direction, control, and administration of NewAge Industries‚Äô sales and marketing processes. This position will assist in developing strategic solutions and marketing strategies, motivating others to excel and building a high-performance team focused on solution selling and relationship building. As a member of the NewAge Leadership team, you will guide the company in achieving its mission and continue the strong focus on NewAge‚Äôs growth potential.  Key Job Responsibilities Develop and manage key sales infrastructure, including implementing efficient processes, sales forecasting/strategies, and staff training to drive pipeline build, opportunity qualification, close rate, and support revenue growth. Lead the marketing strategy for NewAge which includes the establishment of successful channel and partner programs. Inspire, coach, train, and teach sales team and others. Build strong relationships with customers/vendors, peers, and team members/leaders. Provide input to all other departments as to requirements of sales to meet company sales objectives. Develop department budgetary requirements. Provide sales forecast as required for the ESOP 5-year planning process - and update/communicate the forecast on a quarterly basis Recommend sales strategies for improvement based on market research and competitor analyses. Partner with Product Management, Product Engineering and R&D to expand current products and develop new products and services for current and future markets. Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company departments Partner with the Director of Manufacturing Development to grow NewAge‚Äôs ‚Äúclose to the customer‚Äù strategy Compile information and data related to customer and prospect interactions. Manage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunities. Work collaboratively with all team leaders and their respective departments in particular Manufacturing and Supply Chain ______________________________________________________________________  Education, Skills And Experience Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs degree (B.S.) from four-year college or university in Business Administration, Sales and Marketing or related field preferred. Minimum 10+ years of senior sales management experience, preferably within a manufacturing environment. Experience working with distributors from various countries and cultures. Experience managing a domestic and international distribution network. Experience with the Sandler sales system a plus Demonstrated ability to sell solutions, identify and solve complex customer solutions. Knowledge of marketing processes, systems, and tactics Interact and build relationships with Team Leaders and other NewAge departments. Work, support and share with others to succeed as a team. Set self-ambitious and demanding targets while enjoying the thrill of successfully overcoming difficult challenges. Possess the ability to understand and analyze complex issues and problems and come up with solutions. Technical understanding and ability to understand drawings and expectations. Strong project management skills (managing projects and teams from start to finish). In business since 1954, NewAge Industries is a manufacturer and fabricator of thermoplastic and thermoset tubing and hose, and a supplier of fittings and clamps. The company offers one of the broadest product lines of tubing, hose, and fittings in the U.S., and its custom extrusion and fabrication services are unrivaled. The company is a family and employee owned business, with its corporate offices and state-of-the-art manufacturing center located in Warrington, PA.

You will go beyond relationship management Able to manage the entire sales cycle from demand generation, qualification, presentation, and closing. Excellent documentation and communication skills Must be flexible, extremely well organized, detail oriented and able to juggle multiple priorities Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful Demonstrated experience as a team-building leader, capable of rallying support from both direct and indirect staff to drive shared positive results  Our diversity is our strength! Reibus is committed to creating a culture that allows great people to do awesome things. We learn from each other, and our individual experiences and differences power that learning. We welcome the contributions you can bring from your unique perspective. We want great people who are looking to grow and develop‚Äîpersonally and professionally‚Äîas we build something truly extraordinary together.  We learn from each other, and our individual differences power that learning. We welcome people with differing experiences and opinions. Your identity, preferences, background, experience, beliefs and abilities are what make you who you are as an individual. We are an equal opportunity employer because what makes you different makes us better.   Come be a part of the diverse Reibus family!   To learn more about becoming part of the Reibus family by emailing us at careers@reibus.com.   https://www.reibus.com/careers

Strong analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated success in using data and analytics to understand and improve performance.

Who You Are Experienced and passionate hunter who‚Äôs looking for a high growth opportunity in a fast-paced startup environment Has a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude and is willing to take on ad-hoc tasks and challenges when needed A collaborative spirit and team leader with excellent interpersonal skills, both written and verbal Ability to manage and drive business discussions with influence Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. description: Regional Director  Manufacturer's Edge (ME) is a private-non-profit consulting company serving small and medium-sized manufacturers in Colorado. For the past twenty-five years, ME has housed the National Institute for Standards and Technology‚Äôs (NIST) Manufacturing Extension Partnership (MEP) program for Colorado.  Our staff and work are guided by our mission: ‚Äúto grow and strengthen the Colorado manufacturing community.  We are a progressive consulting company with a close-knit team of professionals working together to leverage resources from across Colorado and the national network of 50 other MEP Centers across the country to ensure we are the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù resource for Colorado manufacturers.  ME is looking to add to its team of client and project managers to increase the number of manufacturers we serve across the state. We are looking for a creative, high-performing individual based in Colorado to join the Revenue Growth team as a Regional Director (RD). Regional Directors are responsible for developing client relationships, managing clients and projects, generating revenue, and measuring impacts.  Regional Director ‚Äì The Ideal Candidate The ideal Regional Director candidate will engage with Colorado manufacturers to understand their business challenges and opportunities for growth and work with the Client Services and Program Operations teams to connect resources to need through Manufacturers Edge consulting services. The candidate will have ‚Äúheads down‚Äù sales experience, and the ability to engage with C-Level, VP, and Director level personnel. Familiarity with manufacturing practices and trends is a plus. We are looking for someone who has achieved demonstrated success in business development, sales, and client relationship management.  At ME we firmly believe that finding the right people is the key to building a great business for ourselves and our clients. We are deliberate about recruiting talented and professional people. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees and community to flourish.  ME is an equal opportunity workplace and we are committed to our Core Values: ¬∑     We are Mission Driven ¬∑     We are Trustworthy ¬∑     We are Respectful ¬∑     We are Stronger Together ¬∑     We are Proactive  Responsibilities and Accountabilities As part of our strategic plan for growth and innovation, we are expanding our team and our services with the goal of increasing market penetration and doubling our revenues over the next two years. The ideal candidate for the Regional Director is goal-oriented and can juggle long-term client engagement with aggressive prospecting and capture of new business. Key accountabilities of this job: 1)   Meeting and exceeding revenue targets and individual and team KPIs. 2)   Personal accountability for hitting performance targets, following processes, and collaborating with other Regional Directors, other teams, and departments in the company. 3)   Improving results while adhering to the culture of ME. 4)   Prospecting new clients and accounts that will help generate revenue through long terms engagements.  Requirements and Experience From a skills perspective, the Regional Director should have experience and skills to behave in a way that supports company goals and company culture, including: ¬∑     Understanding and using a long-term client relationship model for sales rather than a point-solution product-sales model. ¬∑     Establishing and maintaining long-term client relationships. ¬∑     Selling complex service offerings to a wide range of customer types and cultures. ¬∑     Adopting a culture of trust and community and respectfully working with their team and the broader company team in a spirit of collaboration and partnership. ¬∑     Understanding that sales is one component of a larger enterprise, not the driving component. ¬∑     Working with other department teams in a collaborative and supportive way  Compensation & Benefits ME offers competitive salaries and access to a full suite of benefits including, but not limited to: ¬∑     Health/dental/vision/life/disability insurance for employees and dependents ¬∑     Flexible spending and dependent care accounts, savings accounts, ¬∑     A flexible work schedule, ¬∑     Generous paid time-off including vacation and sick leave, and holidays Salary Range: $85,000-$95,000  About Manufacturer‚Äôs Edge As the NIST MEP Center for Colorado, ME delivers comprehensive, proven solutions to Colorado manufacturers through coaching, training, and consulting services that meet critical needs from process improvement and workforce development to specialized business practices including supply chain integration, innovation, and technology transfer. The MEP National Network consists of 51 MEP Centers, one in every state and Puerto Rico, and over 1,400 trusted advisors in over 385 MEP service locations. ME works with MEP partners across the country to provide clients with access to resources and consistent quality services and programs wherever are located.  Interested and Qualified candidates should submit resume, cover letter, and at least two professional references electronically with the subject line: Regional Director to jobs@manufacturersedge.com

**This is a remote role**  Summary The VP, Sales will lead Loyal‚Äôs enterprise sales team by providing leadership, direction, and resource stewardship to Loyal‚Äôs sales function. The VP, Sales will be accountable for the profitable achievement of sales organization goals and aligning sales objectives with Loyal‚Äôs business strategy. Our sales team is a small group of experienced sales professionals dedicated to sharing our message with heath systems and growing our business. Loyal‚Äôs sales process is very complex and relationship-oriented. The VP, Sales will play an integral role as the leader of this team, motivating each individual to achieve personal and team quotas.  Responsibilities Responsible for helping with the design and implementation of a comprehensive sales strategy. Align the team on key value drivers and ensure all members of the team understand and can communicate those differentiators. Establish and enhance metrics for measuring the performance of various groups within the team as well as the performance of the team as a whole, including leading indicators such as activities, pipeline generation (with lead source), pipeline velocity, and close rate. Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience. Responsible for the budget process, including managing team expenditures and remaining within budget guidelines. Hire, coach, and manage a team of enterprise sales representatives and sales development representatives.  Analyze performance data to drive improvements through methods, procedures, and training Align the sales team objectives with Loyal‚Äôs business strategy through active participation in corporate strategic planning, sales strategy development, forecasting, sales resource planning, and budgeting.  Manage all stages of the sales process and pipeline.  Build and manage sales documentation (presentations, proposals, memos, implementation plans, etc.). Manage contract negotiations and legal review.  Lead learning and development initiatives impacting the sales team and provide stewardship of sales and sales management talent.  Build plans for territory assignment and quota attainment. Hit quarterly and yearly revenue goals.  Motivate sales representatives through creative incentives.  Establish a regular cadence for reporting on team and individual results.  Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency, and productivity.   Qualifications 10 + years in enterprise software sales as a sales representative. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, or a related field.  5 + years in managing enterprise sales teams for software companies with a proven track record in implementing processes and systems to hit revenue goals. Experience with building and scaling a sales organization, preferably in a start-up or high growth environment. Experience with Salesforce CRM and sales engagement technologies preferred.  Experience in the healthcare industry is preferred.  Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred. Experience working within an ambiguous environment, with proven experience to be adaptable preferred.  #LI-REMOTE

description: Are you a seeker, an ever-curious learner? Are you singularly obsessed with helping clients define their roadmap to a successful future? Our mission at Capgemini is none less than to ‚ÄúUnleash human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future.‚Äù  Capgemini is a 270,000 diverse minds-strong, global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients‚Äô opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Founded in 1967 in Grenoble, France, today, we are in almost 50 countries. With Altran, we reported 2019 combined revenues of ‚Ç¨17billion. Learn more at www.capgemini.com.  Job title ‚Äì Director ‚Äì Sales (Healthcare) Job location ‚Äì Chicago / NJ / NY Job type ‚Äì Full-time, permanent  We are seeking a top-performing sales executive to pursue new business opportunities within Capgemini Financial Services Business Unit. The candidate must have an entrepreneurial spirit, relevant industry experience and demonstrated selling attributes / techniques.   Job Description: ‚Ä¢ Will be responsible for bringing in new business in the region assigned within Healthcare space (Payer and Provider) ‚Ä¢ Will carry individual bookings target ‚Ä¢ Will be responsible for driving new account wins and new business with the clients in the region ‚Ä¢ Define a compelling proposition and vision for each sales opportunity ‚Ä¢ Leading the sales process ‚Ä¢ Should provide insight to the business on market trends affecting clients ‚Ä¢ Build and nurture relationships within the new accounts  Desired Candidate Profile: ‚Ä¢ An ideal candidate will have overall IT industry experience in the range of 15+ years of which 5-6 years must be in generating new business in direct sales roles ‚Ä¢ Must have prior experience in sourcing leads, selling technology services, developing new logos and be a self-starter ‚Ä¢ Must have prior work experience in IT services for healthcare organizations ‚Ä¢ Must have experience working in global delivery model ‚Ä¢ Must have prior experience working in a bookings target driven role ‚Ä¢ Must have demonstrated experience of consultative selling ‚Ä¢ Should have broad understanding of IT Services / Technologies ‚Ä¢ Should have demonstrated experience of developing and selling in to C-level contacts in the industry ‚Ä¢ Overall experience in Sales, Contract negotiation, effective presentations and a solution provider mindset is essential   What we offer: Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.  We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients. With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.  Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.  Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.  Disclaimer:  Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. description: Stop settling for the good and go for the great!  About The Role  CoachHub is striving for a talented and entrepreneurial individual who helps building our Sales Development function and guiding it to success in addition to remaining hands-on in the role. The Sales Development Manager will be the team lead of the other SDRs on the team. the South US market, including planning, hiring, coaching and performance management Create an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture Set clear team goals Manage the performance of the Sales Development Representatives and delivery on KPIs Discover training needs and provide coaching and support for career development Build a sales development framework that follows reps, Sales Management, external lead-gen agencies and marketing among others) What we offer Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance Further ancillary insurances like life and short- & long term disability Unlimited paid time off (PTO) with a fair use policy Paid CoachHub4Good days to give back 401(k) plan including a CoachHub employer-paid add-on A flexible spending account A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub! CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

Job Description  Job Description Director, Business Development  Position Description  CGI is looking for a Director of Business Development to play a key role on the leadership team in our Nashville, TN office. This person will be driving new business through building and fostering new client relationships with business and technical executives in the Nashville marketplace. Come and join one of Tennessee‚Äôs Top Workplaces and be an integral part of one of CGI's fastest growing offices in the booming Nashville marketplace!  Your future duties and responsibilities Represent CGI in the Nashville Technology community through active participation and leadership in local technology organizations. Lead local marketing efforts including organizing CGI participation in local conferences and technology community events Work with internal stakeholders and marketing staff to develop new solutions and marketing initiatives Prospect for new potential clients, develop relationships, and present CGI capabilities through calls, email, social media, networking, and in-person contact Identify new opportunities, actively market and sell CGI service solutions, develop proposals, and negotiate contracts within new and growing accounts Maintain a pipeline of sales opportunities Participate in developing and maintaining Account Plans to include general account and organization information, decision makers, technologies, and penetration strategy Communicate with clients regarding pricing, scheduling, invoice payments, and other issues and include other CGI staff as appropriate Maintain up-to-date prospect and client information in appropriate CGI systems Remain current on CGI services and products, as well as general methodologies and practices, and suggest new products/services gathered from sales activities It is expected that within 6 months of the Director start date, there would be a demonstrated positive trend in relationship building, opportunities won, and new client growth Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role 5+ years of experience in new account acquisition and executive management relationship building with a demonstrated track record of success in the technology professional services space Ability to build key relationships with client executives (VPs, SVPs, CxOs, etc.) and within CGI Ability to build, execute and maintain new client penetration and development strategies and plans Strong oral and written communication skills. This role will need to be able to communicate appropriately with key stakeholders and multiple teams Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Marketing, MIS, or related field required, M.B.A. desirable Excellent presentation skills High attention to detail and ability to learn and understand technical concepts Professional consulting experience is a plus Good problem solving and reading comprehension skill Strong organizational skills Knowledge of IT development processes Industry knowledge in one or more of the following: Manufacturing, Banking and Financial Services, Retail and Consumer Services, and/or Healthcare Providers Travel is limited to the Nashville metro area Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change‚Äîsupporting our clients‚Äô digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com .  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI‚Äôs legal duty to furnish information. description: Description  About the Role  As the Sales Director, you will generate new business and maintain current clients. You will research industry needs and contribute to a sales team while developing great relationships with customers. You will make an impact by expanding and maintaining a leading role in providing information security and compliance consulting services to the Healthcare industry.  The Ideal Candidate  This role will be working with clients and potential clients and will need to provide excellent organizational, networking, communication, and negotiating skills with every person. Someone who can identify, qualify, and convert qualified leads and opportunities in the target region while developing, meeting, and exceeding region-specific account plans, quotas, and targets. Develop and foster relationships to build trust to secure future business with Executive/Leadership in each target account. Provide intelligence on industry competitors/trends to educate operations staff. Partner with Marketing and actively participate in various online and in-person security groups (i.e. roundtables, conferences, social media, and other security networks) and provide input for product development and services. This person will utilize Salesforce and log detailed records in the system to provide ongoing client communication.  Minimum Qualifications High school Diploma with 10+ years' field sales experience; Bachelor‚Äôs Degree preferred PC savvy and proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Must have the ability to drive and rent a car for travel Prior experience in cybersecurity/solutions and healthcare sales Working knowledge of various compliance frameworks, standards, and best practices (e.g. HIPAA, COBIT, NIST, HITRUST) Must be available for regular travel up to 50-60% (outside of COVID) About CynergisTek  CynergisTek is a top-ranked cybersecurity and information management consulting firm dedicated to serving the healthcare industry. CynergisTek offers specialized services and solutions to help organizations achieve privacy, security, compliance, and document output goals. Since 2004, the company has served as a partner to hundreds of healthcare organizations and is dedicated to supporting and educating the industry by contributing to relevant industry associations. description: ALEKO (www.aleko.com) is a family-owned e-commerce company based in Kent, WA, specializing in residential outdoor furniture and equipment. Since our foundation in 2005, we have grown our Kent operation significantly and become a pillar of the local retail community. We opened a Jacksonville, FL warehouse in 2019, and we have expanded our presence across a range of online sales channels. Our growth will continue!  To achieve this success, we have assembled a great team of employees. From forklift drivers to customer service agents, our people are focused on delivering a positive customer experience. At the same time, we are committed to treating our employees well. We have a respectful, light-hearted work, fast-paced environment, competitive wages, insurance and 401(k) benefits, several other perks, and promotion opportunities for top performers.  We are seeking talented retail and e-Commerce professionals who are eager to apply their skills and experience in an entrepreneurial environment dedicated to winning as a team. ALEKO is your jam if: Being Customer-Obsessed means more to you than an overused corporate mantra, You're tired of the corporate grind and want to be a bigger fish in a smaller pond, You get excited about solving interesting problems that make an instant meaningful impact, You're all about seeing strategy come to life, and You want to continue your professional growth while building something great!  Core Responsibilities: Build and drive sales and marketing strategy based on company strategy and business objectives Lead Digital Marketing and traffic driving programs from paid media to CRM Direct all aspects of Digital Merchandising, including site management, design, and product placement Oversee 3rd party product management and development, directing the prioritization of conversion rate optimization and UX enhancements Manage all strategic and operational aspects of our selling channels (website, FBA, wholesale, etc.) Analyze / compile channel and marketing performance analytics & reporting and provide recommendations for more effective ways to reach customers and increase revenue Optimize across channels to drive company KPI's (revenue, gross margin, profitability) Define/refine our target customer segments and drive actionable insights related to these segments Create and codify best practices  You own this if you have‚Ä¶ 7+ years of prior related work experience Bachelor's degree MBA preferred Managed a team of 5 or greater Passion for building and coaching a high-performing team Strong negotiations skills Demonstrated understanding of e-commerce channels and digital marketing Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills with attention to detail Proficiency in MS Office suite

Pollen is looking for a Brand Partnerships sales expert to bring in Brand Partners for our Experiences. You will come with an extensive history of selling Brand Partnerships for artists and/or music based experiences. You will have a deep understanding of what it takes to drive a brand to purchase.  We are gearing up to produce 50 experiences in 2021 and anticipate at least tripling that volume next year. We need someone who has a long list of existing brand relationships across a multitude of categories. This role is meant for someone who is passionate about creating meaningful partnerships between experiences and brands, providing a better experience for our consumers.  In The First 12 Months You Will Leverage your professional and extended network to open doors and exponentially grow our brand partnerships revenue stream. Identify potential partners and opportunities through proactively prospecting, pitching and generating new business opportunities. B uild strong relationships with brands, communicating Pollen‚Äôs strategic vision and closing sizeable revenue generating deals to lay the foundations to our brand partnerships offering. Raise the market awareness of Pollen‚Äôs value proposition through facilitating & securing brand partnerships through innovative marketing programs. Help to establish Pollen as the vehicle through which brands can gain access to the Gen-Z & Millennial demographics. Build strong internal relationships with key stakeholders, identifying opportunities and assets and presenting them in ways that are valuable to brands.  About Our Culture We are results focused so you can choose your own hours & take as much vacation as you need to drive results and perform at your best. Watch our CEO talk about our innovative culture . Read our CEO‚Äôs open letter about our focus on Belonging , and about the mission of our women‚Äôs programme Illuminate . Everyone is an equity owner in the company. About Pollen  Pollen builds, curates, and delivers the best travel experiences using technology, a network of global partners, and a data-driven customer-led mindset ‚Äì pairing world class entertainment with the world‚Äôs most exciting destinations.  Pollen brings you all the best experiences on pollen.co . We have two offerings: Pollen Presents and Pollen+. Pollen Presents curates experiences around your tastes and preferences you can‚Äôt find anywhere else. These experiences bring together music, sports, wellness and beyond to enable you and your friends to connect around one-of-a-kind itineraries in exciting destinations. Pollen+ always gets you more at music festivals and events when you book through us. Pollen+ partners with the biggest promoter brands and music festivals, including We Are FSTVL, Austin City Limits, Bonnaroo, C3, Electric Zoo, Live Nation and more.  Pollen was founded in 2014 by brothers Callum & Liam Negus-Fancey. Pollen is backed by prominent investors including Kindred, Northzone, Sienna Capital, Backed and Draper Spirit. Pollen has raised over $100 million in VC funding.  GDPR Statement  When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Streetteam Software Limited t/a Pollen (‚ÄúController‚Äù), which is located at 3 Loughborough Street, Vauxhall, London, SE11 5RB and can be contacted by emailing people@pollen.co . Controller‚Äôs privacy officer is Stephanie Ng-Fragner, who can be contacted at stephanie.ng-fragner@pollen.co. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Controller‚Äôs recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.  Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Controller‚Äôs behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to appropriate additional safeguards under either the standard contractual clauses or the Privacy Shield. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual clauses by contacting us at legal@pollen.co .  Your personal data will be retained by Controller as long as Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. In the event that you are unsuccessful during the recruitment process, your personal data will still be retained by Controller for up to a year for the purposes of assessing your application for future vacancies. Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. You also have the right to data portability. Please notify us if you would like your personal data erased. In addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority, including the Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office, the UK regulator for data protection issues (www.ico.org.uk).
