description: At Krispy Kreme Doughnut Corporation, we love our people, and they love our culture and the opportunities that come with being a part of Krispy Kreme. Our values are at the core of who we are, what we believe, and what brings us together as one united team. Come explore the endless opportunities in an environment where we support you and your professional success. As we grow together, we win together. Our success has always been driven by the skills and ideas of our talented and diverse team members. We value work/life balance, diversity and inclusion! Everyone at Krispy Kreme is an Original. Now is the time to achieve more and take your career further with Krispy Kreme.  This position reports to the General Manager of the Branded Sweet Treats Line (Consumer Packaged Good line). Achieve sales and profitability objectives through the development of new customers across multiple sales channels and through increasing sales in existing accounts. Develop customer strategy and engage customer leadership at the highest levels to facilitate the gaining distribution at those accounts at a price and trade plan that assures Krispy Kreme revenue and profit expectations are met. In this role you will be building your network and expertise in a thriving environment of professional development and teamwork. Moreover, our Branded Sweet Treats line is still new and the Sales Director will play a pivotal role in creating explosive growth in this area of Krispy Kreme‚Äôs business. description: THE ROLE: Strategic management of the business with national retail accounts with the goal of establishing KITSCH as the market leader in sales and service. This person will lead the identification, development, and execution of strategies to deliver key volume drivers. The ideal candidate will be expected to create the strategic vision and manage the tactical implementation, in all facets, with regards to the products managed. Joint Business Planning, Line Reviews, Promotional Execution, Financial Management, Business Analysis, Forecasting, Trade Spend Management and Strategic Relationship Building.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES ‚Ä¢ Development and execution of all presentations at with major national retailers ‚Ä¢ Leading the strategy, tactics, and execution in all promotions ‚Ä¢ Management of short-term and long-term business results, including innovative changes aimed at broad financial impact. ‚Ä¢ Delivering upon volume, share and ROI targets ‚Ä¢ Driving distribution, shelving, pricing, and promotion support to optimize spend. ‚Ä¢ Identification and activation of fact-based sales opportunities. ‚Ä¢ Accurately forecast the business. ‚Ä¢ Managing promotional funds to effectively drive the business. ‚Ä¢ P&L management. ‚Ä¢ Merchandising Strategy process tactical planning & execution ‚Ä¢ Nielsen/IRI analytics & insights-based selling  YOUR PROFILE The ideal candidate is someone who wants to manage their business, take risks and think outside of the box. The successful candidate will have a minimum of 3-5 years supporting a national account ‚Äì Target, Walmart, Ulta or Drug chains with direct experience preferred.  Key Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Driver type of personality: creative, outgoing, and resilient ‚Ä¢ Passionate about what you do and self-motivated ‚Ä¢ Highly developed communication and presentation skills. ‚Ä¢ High level of analytical capability ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of or experience working with Syndicated data, Household and Panel data, plan-o-gram analysis, and marketing concepts ‚Ä¢ Strong leadership and team oriented skills ‚Ä¢ Have potential to grow into larger roles within the company ‚Ä¢ 5+ years of commercial experience, highly desired experience with Fast Moving Consumer Goods Companies.  ABOUT KITSCH LLC  KITSCH is proud to be recognized as a self-financed, female-owned global accessory brand built on positivity and pure hard work. Established in 2010, with a business plan no longer than a paragraph, Kitsch has grown from door to door sales to selling products in over 27 countries across 20,000 retail locations worldwide.  KITSCH is committed to creating high quality products that are effortless, elevated and easy to use. From fashionable shower caps to minimal metal hair clips, KITSCH is evolving your everyday essentials.  We believe that everyone should feel confident when purchasing our products no matter your hair type, style, or budget.  EEO OPPORTUNITIES We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Kitsch complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us at: careers@mykitsch.com.  We strongly believe that cultivating a diverse workplace gives a company strength. The combination of unique skills, abilities, experiences and backgrounds creates an environment that produces extraordinary results. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

description: Collective[i] is a pioneer in digital sales transformation providing companies with critical intelligence that is essential for sales teams to compete and succeed in the modern age. Our mission is to fuel global prosperity by enabling companies around the world to forecast, optimize and grow revenue.  As the Head of Channel Sales, you will direct and oversee all aspects of Collective[i]‚Äôs channel business, from strategy to execution. Under your leadership, Collective[i]‚Äôs channel strategy will empower partners to amplify and accelerate our sales process. This role is central to the success of our company and you will report directly to Collective[i]‚Äôs Executive Team.  Responsibilities Build and scale Collective[i]‚Äôs channel strategy Negotiate, implement and nurture strategic partnerships with private equity firms, venture capital firms, consulting companies and Fortune 500 enterprise companies Develop and drive Collective[i]‚Äôs existing partner relationships Develop and nurture strong relationships with key decision makers at partner companies and own all channel relationships at the executive level Orchestrate and execute enterprise sales of Collective[i]‚Äôs unique product offering in close collaboration with partners Proactively lead a joint partner planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones Manage channel opportunities throughout the entire sales cycle, from partner-sourced leads to close Build out a Channel Sales Group dedicated to business development, pre-sales and sales functions  Skills Required Demonstrated track record of success in developing and implementing a comprehensive channel sales strategy, preferably in the revenue optimization space Proven record of working with executives to translate product and strategic roadmaps into actionable programs Deep understanding of and familiarity with partners' business, strategy, operations, technology, and goals Ability to manage internal and external resources to deliver results that exceed expectations Well-versed in major sales methodologies Demonstrated record of delivering quality results with supporting metrics Superior presentation and communication skills Strong leadership and influencing skills Expertise in change management practices 10+ years experience in comparable role Background in sales technology strongly preferred Background in artificial technology a plus Experience working in a fast-paced, startup environment a plus Who you are working for - About Collective[i]:  Collective[i] is a remote-first company on a mission to fuel global prosperity, helping companies around the world forecast, optimize and grow revenue. Our applications and network support highly productive, enlightened teams with everything they need to work smarter and win more.  We are a global team of committed scientists, developers, sales, finance, client success and marketing professionals who passionately believe that Collective[i]'s network and applications are dramatically transforming enterprises and improving the working lives of the people and companies we support.  We are recruiting for exceptional talent looking to join our team of A-players all committed to building a company that makes a difference. Our core values help shape our culture: We are curious. We are direct. We deliver. We succeed together. We strive for the extraordinary. If you enjoy a challenge, thrive in a fast paced environment and welcome the opportunity to work with amazing humans operating on the bleeding edge of innovation, Collective[i] is the place for you.  More about Collective[i]:  Collective[i] is passionate about using ML, RPA and other AI technologies along with a network to automate the myriad of tasks that distract sales professionals from selling and provide timely intelligence that helps to grow revenue. Our revenue optimization engine is one of the most transformative technologies to hit the enterprise since CRM. Founded and managed by the early teams behind LinkShare (purchased for $425m) and Overstock (NASDAQ:OSTK), Collective[i] is headquartered in NYC with offices in Silicon Valley and Montreal, Canada.  Recent Press  Wall Street Journal, Here‚Äôs What‚Äôs New in Enterprise Tech  Wall Street Journal, Smart Sales Tools Seek Better Data  Wall Street Journal, The Morning Download: Artificial Intelligence Transforms the Sales Process  Wall Street Journal, New Fund Firm Cuts Pay If Managers Don‚Äôt Beat the Market  Information About The Founders  Tad Martin  Stephen Messer  Heidi Messer

description: Company Background  Playfly Sports is the full-service, leading sports marketing and media company that enables brands to engage with sports fans on a local, regional, and national level through scaled linear, digital, and experiential assets. Playfly Sports drives outcome-based solutions into 90-million households via more than 7,800 live U.S. broadcasts of MLB, NBA, and NHL games; and influences sports fans of all ages through the management of college and high school multimedia rights, uniform branding, and high-profile sports sponsorship platforms. The company introduces high school and college students to career development opportunities in esports through CSL Esports, operators of North America‚Äôs largest college esports league. Playfly Sports has the unique ability to partner, innovate, and advance the aspirations of athletes, brands, academic institutions, and sports fans across the U.S. Playfly Sports is Powered by Partnership. Visit Playfly Sports online at playfly.com and follow Playfly Sports on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook: @PlayflySports.  Impression Sports & Entertainment (Impression), a division of the Playfly Sports, is a sports marketing company that specializes in full-service sponsorship sales representation for premier projects and sponsorship consulting. Established in January of 2011, Impression has brokered hundreds of millions of dollars in sponsorship agreements on behalf of our clients.  Why You Should Join Playfly  Playfly is a brand-new player in the sports and esports space and we are looking to expand our team! At Playfly you will work with a highly engaged and collaborative team. Join a company with a leadership team that values ideas, innovation and different perspectives. At Playfly, we recognize we are only as good as the people we have working here! We provide excellent benefits including a generous time off package, health and dental insurance, paid parental leave and a 401k plan just to name a few. We also provide you with an environment where you can demonstrate your strengths and gain knowledge to propel your career and continue growing.  Position Summary  Reporting directly to the Executive Vice President and serving as a key member of the Impression Sports & Entertainment sales staff, the Director of Sales will be responsible for generating revenue for the company and its clients by prospecting and selling fully integrated sponsorship platforms. Impression Sports & Entertainment represents numerous types of sponsorship properties including major professional sports teams primary assets, collegiate properties, stadiums/arenas, event management groups, media outlets, and various properties across the sports & entertainment landscape, among others.  This position reports to the Impression EVP, and works closely with the Director of Client Services, Sales team, and valuation team.  Other Duties  Coordinate with other Playfly Sports/Home Team Sports employees/departments on various assignments that touch other parts of the organization.  Qualification Requirements  To perform this job successfully, an individual must have strong prospecting capabilities, business development mindset, and proficient in creating strong relationships with top-tier clients and brand partners.  Education / Experience  College Degree, 8+ years of sports/entertainment sponsorship sales. Documented success of selling large sponsorship assets. Must have strong corporate client relationships. Skill set specializes in executing national sales campaigns for high-profile sponsorship assets including venue naming rights, title sponsorships, jersey/kits deals and other major sponsorship assets.  Language / Communication  Strong phone, video and email communication skills.  Computer Skills  Microsoft Office required. Adobe Creative Cloud suite (InDesign, Photoshop, etc.), KORE experience a plus.  Other Skills & Abilities Required  Exceptional attention to detail a must. Ability to make high quantity of outbound sales calls. Entrepreneurial background a plus. Some travel required.

description: OUR STORY  Electriq Power‚Äôs organic growth began in a San Leandro, CA garage in late 2014. After purchasing a totaled Nissan Leaf and stripping the battery and computers for parts, the Electriq team went to work attempting to build their first home battery prototype. After four months of building, testing, rebuilding, and retesting, Electriq‚Äôs first energy storage prototype was complete.Over the next few years, the team grew, investors emerged, and Electriq‚Äôs original prototype evolved into its first consumer-ready smart home battery, the IQ System. And even though the energy storage market was still in its infancy, consumers recognized the dire need for home energy storage.  OUR MISSION  We passionately believe in distributed energy storage solutions to shape our world‚Äôs environmental and economic future that are prudent, panoramic, and serve all demographics with parity.  ELECTRIQ POWER TODAY  Fast forward to present day, we now occupy over 5000 sq. ft. at our San Leandro, CA location and have our corporate office in downtown West Palm Beach, FL. Our home battery systems can be found in customers‚Äô homes and small businesses all over the world. Electriq Power has even donated systems to hurricane-stricken areas like Puerto Rico and Haiti to help them become more resilient during dangerous weather conditions.  We look forward to improving our suite of products and continuing our mission of replacing the production of carbon-based emissions with sustainable solutions.  SENIOR NATIONAL ACCOUNT MANAGER (JD 26)  The Senior National Account Manager supports the growth and retention of national customer accounts through general sales, marketing, and proactive response to customer questions and or concerns in keeping with established procedures. This position will be based in the West Palm Beach, FL office and reports directly to the EVP of Sales.  Responsibilities: Builds and maintains business relationships with clients by providing prompt and accurate service to promote customer loyalty. Forecasts and executes bookings and revenue goals. Ensures assigned accounts meet & exceed quality and delivery metrics. Creates product quotes as necessary and/or appropriate. Researches and responds to commercial and technical customer issues. In cooperation with account executives, develops strategies and tactics necessary to achieve sales and marketing goals for assigned accounts. Performs other duties as assigned or required. Work Experience: 7 + years proven account management experience. 3+ years experience in the residential energy storage/renewable energy industry preferred. Knowledge & Skills: Basic office skills with Google Suite Jira Excellent written and verbal communication Problem-solving and issue resolution ability. Achieves excellent customer service through responsiveness, communication, and coordination with both external and internal customers. Effective client relationship building skills. Solid business acumen including financial analysis. Understands correlations between business growth initiatives and service model opportunities. Excellent presentation and facilitation skills. Ability to adapt to a fast paced constantly evolving business and work environment while handling multiple priorities. 50% travel required. Education: Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or Engineering Master's degree preferred Powered by JazzHR  SKsaszsq2a

description: Director, Business Development Employment Type: Permanent, Full-time  JOB SUMMARY Applied Companies based in Valencia, CA is seeking a Director of Business Development to lead our team based in our Huntsville, AL location. Applied Companies is a market leading provider of environmental control systems for military and commercial applications. Applied sells products and services directly to the Department of Defense as well as Tier I system providers. This role shall set the growth strategy for the business and establish & execute implementation plans to achieve Applied Companies‚Äô business objectives. The Director of Business Development will build a high-performance team of sales professionals, manage channel partner relationships and lead commercial negotiations. As a small business, Applied Companies relies on the capabilities and good judgement of its people. We unleash the talent of our employees rather than controlling it with hierarchy or excessive bureaucracy.  Consequently, the person in this role will be a trusted decision maker, empowered to act in the best interest of Applied and its customers. We provide a pleasant, professional, and dynamic entrepreneurial work environment where creativity is encouraged. Every person at Applied is expected to help when and where needed. In addition to business development-related responsibilities, the person in this role will be asked to contribute in various ways throughout the company, in his/her area of expertise or elsewhere.   SPECIFIC JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES Lead and manage a team of business development and marketing professionals providing development opportunities and aligning the team to focus on providing superior value to our customers Provide vision and leadership to execute business strategies to meet company growth objectives Develop and execute market strategies/plans to pursue and win contracts with U.S. Armed Forces, commercial and international customers. Lead business capture activities including: Opportunity identification Capture planning Proposal development Contract negotiation & closure Post award transition Lead the sales management elements of the annual budgeting process Lead the communications function of the business including web presence, social media, trade shows, branding and media coverage Anticipate and fulfill customer needs to ensure satisfaction, continued business and fulfillment of company contract commitments. Providing timely and accurate bookings and customer demand expectations for use in the monthly financial forecasting process  KEY RELATIONSHIPS The Director of Business Development is involved in all areas of business development and capture efforts, with specific focus on developing new markets and customers not currently served. This position must also closely communicate/coordinate with the Manufacturing, Engineering, Program Management, Contracts, and Purchasing departments.  REQUIREMENTS ¬∑     A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering or Business is required with a minimum of 5 years direct technical sales experience in US or international security or defense industries is required. Additional experience in a technical role is desired. ¬∑     Demonstrated skills in teaching/training others in a technical field. ¬∑     Proven general capabilities in facilitating change, planning and organizing, customer focus and building successful teams. ¬∑     Proven specific capabilities in the technical and professional skill of Proposal Management & Project Management Process Facilitation.  ¬∑     As this position will support business pursuits of new markets, new customers and new sales channels, a strong level of demonstrated prospecting skills are required to help leadership identify, prioritize and pursue new growth areas. ¬∑     US citizen or permanent resident (Green Card holders) due to Government ITAR regulations.  DESIRABLE Knowledge of business development within the Federal Acquisition cycle. Possess a thorough understanding of the complex Military Services, DoD sales, and the relationships of DoD/Services to Prime Contractors and Sub-Tier suppliers. Experience working in a military environment (prior military experience in the supply chain is ideal)  TRAVEL:  As required   ABOUT APPLIED COMPANIES Applied Companies, Inc. is a Southern California manufacturer of ruggedized Environmental Control Units (ECU‚Äôs) and Pressure Vessels for tactical military systems. We have been in business since 1958 and offer a competitive salary and benefits package that includes medical, dental, and vision, along with a generous 401K match and profit-sharing program. Veteran-Founded | Woman-Owned.

description: About Jumpstart  Jumpstart envisions the day when every child in America enters kindergarten prepared to succeed. A national early education organization with operations in 15 states plus Washington, DC, Jumpstart drives outcomes for young children in three critical ways. Jumpstart provides language, literacy, and social-emotional direct service programming utilizing an evidence-backed curriculum for preschool children from underserved communities, workforce programming to expand the pipeline of qualified, diverse talent pursuing careers in early education, and policy advocacy to support the early childhood field and promote high-quality early learning for all. By leveraging over 25 years of experience serving over 133,000 children with the support of more than 58,000 college students and community volunteers, Jumpstart executes these three objectives to improve the quality of the early education workforce and increase opportunity for young children to succeed across America. Learn more at www.jstart.org and join us in transforming the lives of young children!  Position Overview  The Director of District Sales and Partnerships is an exciting new role designed to lead the creation and stewardship of relationships with school districts, higher education partners, and district funders that wish to bring Jumpstart programming to their communities. This role is a critical addition to fulfil the vision of Jumpstart‚Äôs new strategic plan and to reach more children by growing program offerings that respond to market needs and strengthen financial sustainability. Utilizing an entrepreneurial mindset, the Director of District Sales and Partnerships will create Jumpstart‚Äôs sales function to leverage district relationships to drive earned revenue to the organization that will be invested in growing Jumpstart‚Äôs program footprint.  This position reports to the Vice President of Marketing, Communications and Brand.  Specific Responsibilities Through the lens of an entrepreneurial mindset, develop and execute new growth strategies for district partnerships. Perform as a seasoned relationship manager committed to annual revenue and new partnership goals. Personally establish strong relationships with three key stakeholder groups: 1) large potential district partners, 2) existing district partners, and 3) local district funders. Work with organizational leadership and Marketing, Communications & Brand team members to develop effective promotional materials to clearly distinguish Jumpstart‚Äôs unique niche and potential for impact. Drive all district engagement initiatives ranging from prospecting to initial point of contact, to development of partnership agreement and implementation plan. Collaborate with district leaders in developing a comprehensive district-level implementation plan, including timeline and action plans aligned with district‚Äôs strategic goals for kindergarten readiness, early literacy, and social-emotional learning. Provide regular progress reports to Jumpstart leadership. Capture learning from district partners and work with the Marketing, Communications & Brand team to develop marketing materials for prospective districts. Qualifications  Required Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent relevant professional experience Ten or more years of progressive, successful experience in sales leadership, including meaningful experience working with large K-12 public school districts Experience driving revenue creation through partners and relationships, in addition to direct sales Demonstrated experience building, leading and developing direct partnerships that have driven rapid revenue growth Demonstrated ability to exceed sales goals and meet deadlines Technology literate and proficient with Microsoft Office, accomplished user of Salesforce, and other data management and planning tools Passion for and demonstrated commitment to early learners and public education Excellent leadership, communication, organizational and presentation skills Excellent time management and problem-solving skills A history of building relationships with satisfied partners/clients Innovator with a creative mindset toward new partnership development Understanding of how to implement tactical plans to execute on emerging strategies and how to engage new partners along the way Strong collaborator and ability to work cross functionally to accomplish organizational objectives A learning mindset of assessing and analyzing results, and using performance indicators to regularly refine and improve approaches Commitment to Jumpstart‚Äôs core values: learning, social justice, community, joy, and inclusive leadership Ability and willingness to travel to various locations as necessary in order to fulfill duties of the position Experience and comfort working with individuals from diverse backgrounds and communities Preferred Or Ideal Prior experience/interest in social justice or diversity, equity, and inclusion work Master of Business Administration (MBA) or related business-focused graduate degree TRAVEL 50 - 75 % local, regional and national travel Plus biannual travel for team retreat and national institute START DATE  December 2021 ( desired start date, yet position open until filled)  LOCATION Flexible location from one of Jumpstart‚Äôs Offices in Atlanta, GA; Boston, MA; Chicago, IL; Los Angeles, CA; New York, NY, San Francisco, CA; or Washington DC Applicants must be able to work from one of these locations on a full-time basis Salary & Benefits  Salary - $85,000 - $100,000 commensurate with education and experience; along with excellent benefits and a great mission-driven work environment  TO APPLY  Please complete an online application at https://www.jstart.org/about/careers/ . Both a cover letter and resume are required to complete your application. Applications without a cover letter may not be considered. Candidates will be reviewed on an on-going basis. Please upload/attach your resume to your applicant profile as well as your cover letter.  Jumpstart for Young Children, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital or parental status, amnesty, political affiliation, veteran status, military service, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws with respect to employment opportunities.  Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act, applicants may request accommodations needed to participate in the application process. description: Title: Brand Sales Director  Who We Are: SpokenLayer is the leader in short-form digital audio production. Each month, we produce thousands of 3 - 6 minute audio pieces for media companies such as Cond√© Nast, Time, Tribune, and Hearst, as well as brands and advertisers like General Mills, State Farm, and Audible. Our unique audio content is distributed anywhere consumers can listen - via smart speakers, podcasting and streaming platforms, and the web. Our creative work recently won ‚ÄúBest Audio Campaign‚Äù by Digiday at their 2020 awards and we know how to engage listeners with our product.  Love spoken-word audio and want to work with a team who is incredibly passionate about it? Keep reading!   The Opportunity: We are searching for a dynamic sales executive to prospect, consult, and close large-scale brand partnerships with advertisers, helping them find and develop their voice in the fast-growing voice ecosystem. You will be responsible for generating revenue via short-form audio advertising and custom branded content, working closely with SpokenLayer‚Äôs creative, production, and client services teams to deliver audio advertising campaigns that delight clients and listeners alike. The individual in this role should ideally have the ability to simplify complex topics, build relationships and trust with brands and agencies, and lead internal collaborative projects.   Responsibilities: Own the pre-sales process with brand and agency clients from the first meeting through campaign confirmation, ensuring that recommendations are smart and grounded in creative insight Build pitch decks and media plans that effectively communicate the SpokenLayer value proposition  Together with the Creative team, develop innovative advertising and branded content campaigns that drive value for the client Partner with client services team to provide smooth handoff for best-in-class post-sale execution   Develop the strategy for implementing partnership opportunities and work closely with other SpokenLayer teams to operationalize, manage, and troubleshoot partnerships Serve as an ambassador for SpokenLayer and evangelize short-form audio to prospects and clients Keep tuned in to key trends and market conditions across the audio content industry, advising on various potential opportunities for SpokenLayer  Required Skills: Expert level understanding of the media and advertising business, particularly how advertisers partner with emerging platforms/mediums   Experience working with agency holding companies and their media business units. Strong interpersonal skills, excellent written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to quickly build strong relationships  Experience generating pipeline outside of marketing efforts, such as leveraging existing agency/brand relationships  Proven track record of success selling across multiple stakeholders and complex sales processes in a number of verticals  A strong interest in audio content.  Experience in audio - streaming/podcasting/radio preferred.  Required Experience: Bachelor degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business Equivalent experience accepted 5 years+ (Director) or 2-5 years (Account Executive) of full-time quota-carrying sales experience   Hiring Process To be considered for employment in this role, please submit your resume and a cover letter. Should you have the qualifications and experience that we are looking for, you will be contacted to schedule a meeting with SpokenLayer staff.  For any questions, please email careers@spokenlayer.com and we will respond accordingly.  Start Date: Immediately Reports to: VP of Brand Partnerships Position Type: Full-Time Location: Currently Remote, New York Metropolitan Area preferred  SpokenLayer is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We encourage and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation, veteran status or genetic information.

Ripple is expanding and we're looking to hire a U.S. Sales Director based in New York. This is a sales quota-carrying position that is responsible for revenue generation through the direct sale of Ripple products and services to financial institutions.  What You'll Do Have strong working knowledge of the Ripple products and services and be able to present the value of said solutions to the appropriate audiences Responsible for attaining assigned booking targets in the form of sales quota Generate leads and drive sales bookings for Ripple products and services to financial institutions within designated territory and or accounts Formulate the strategies, tactics and account plans, under the direction of management, necessary to develop the leads and relationships within assigned territory/accounts Travel to client sites, present sales materials and conduct product demonstrations to potential clients Manage the effective and rapid movement of leads through sales process, including qualification of prospects; assessment of potential client needs; presentment of Ripple solutions; and expeditious closing of business Responsible for the daily maintenance of prompt and accurate sales pipeline forecasting What We're Looking For Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred Minimum of 5 years experience in the financial services industry 10+ years experience in a consultative sales role at (preferably) a major enterprise software vendor Must have a proven track record of successful sales to transaction banking, treasury or cash management groups of financial institutions Ability and desire to manage a territory independently Strong knowledge of correspondent banking, cross-border payments, transaction banking, treasury operations and SWIFT Working knowledge of regulations surrounding the financial services industry Positive attitude and unsurpassed client relationship management skills Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and in a timely manner Results-oriented What We Offer The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact Competitive salary and equity 100% paid medical and dental and 95% paid vision insurance for employees starting on your first day 401k (with match), fully paid parental leave, commuter benefits Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite programs Flexible vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it Employee giving match Fully-stocked kitchen with organic snacks, beverages, and coffee drinks Weekly company meeting - ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team Who We Are  Ripple is doing for value what the internet did for information: enabling its instant and seamless flow around the world. We call this the Internet of Value (IoV). Using blockchain and cryptocurrency technology, Ripple is dedicated to creating powerful gains in financial efficiency, equity and inclusion. In addition, Ripple is developing and enabling the future use cases that will catalyze the new digital economy for governments, businesses and consumers.  Ripple has offices in San Francisco (HQ), New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, S√£o Paulo, Reykjav√≠k, Washington D.C. and Dubai.  Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance. description: We're looking for an experienced Sales Director to focus on expansion within one of our key accounts. You're highly competitive, motivated, and results driven, and you enjoy working in a team environment. If you join us, you'll be responsible for selling the market-leading programmatic recruitment advertising platform to various business lines within Amazon. This is a fully remote, individual contributor role.  If you thrive in a fast-paced, hard-working environment and are comfortable demonstrating solutions to large employers, then we're interested in talking to you.  Responsibilities: Prospect, pitch, and close new opportunities. Orchestrate discussions with senior Talent Acquisition executives within Amazon around their business, needs, ecosystems, and people. Work closely with the sales development reps and marketing team to qualify and pursue inbound leads. Demonstrate the unique value proposition of our offering while clearly communicating how it solves the prospect's expressed needs. Use both traditional and social tools to contact and engage prospects. Achieve sales targets on a monthly and quarterly basis. Accurately log all sales activity in a CRM (Salesforce). Use natural curiosity, communication skills, and drive to improve your sales performance. Develop relationships that lead to client referrals. Build and maintain a robust accurate sales pipeline of opportunities. Connect with real humans and help to drive change for some of today's most influential and successful companies.  Requirements: 3-5 years' experience and successful track record of hitting quota in enterprise sales with a primary focus in Enterprise Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). Hunter mentality to find opportunities and competitive nature to win deals. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Experience selling software related to Big Data, NLP, Machine Learning, AI, and Algorithmic based software solutions, An in-depth understanding of technology solutions, software, and analytics (data-driven), as well as the ability to apply recruitment domain expertise on behalf of large B2B corporate clients Detail-oriented with a strong desire to get things done accurately, efficiently, and in a timely manner Ability to conduct engaging online product demonstrations Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Self-motivated, driven and has a 'go-getter' attitude Ability to travel, when that time comes Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Bachelor's Degree preferred  Why PandoLogic?  PandoLogic delivers Hire Intelligence to Talent Acquisition organizations by sourcing quality applicants faster and more efficiently through the use of big data, artificial intelligence, and proprietary campaign algorithms that fully-automate and optimize the job advertising and decision-making process.  We bet you'll love our awesome company culture, great benefits, and crew of collaborative, bold, resilient, innovative, and caring people. We love it here, and we think you will too.  Anything else you should know?  PandoLogic is being acquired by Veritone Inc. (NASDAQ: VERI), a provider of an operating system for artificial intelligence, later this year.  We were sought out by Veritone for our AI ‚Äì our belief in it and our commitment to it ‚Äì by a company that is focused on using AI for good. To build a safer, more vibrant, transparent, and empowered society.  Veritone is supporting our destiny, keeping our team intact, and honoring our roadmap ‚Äì this is an incredible growth opportunity.  As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Veritone, there are no material changes expected for employees and customers.  Integration with their platform will reinforce our tech backbone and allow us to bring trillions of data points ‚Äì from all sorts of agnostic sources ‚Äì together to create insights that will power the workforce of the future.  To learn more visit http://www.pandologic.com.  PandoLogic is committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are flexible. We are kind. We are PandoLogic.

jobTitle: 3M HIS Sr. Sales Director, Healthcare Solutions Executives & Training
description: Job Description  Senior Sales Director  Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World  Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it‚Äôs equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.  The Senior Sales Director, Healthcare Solutions Executives, Senior Director of Sales Training and Demonstration Content will be responsible to provide leadership, training, demonstration content and oversight in a matrix management role to the Regional Healthcare Solutions Executives as well as the Sales Training team and Demonstration Content team. The role requires a passion to guide a team of solutions sales professionals to embrace industry knowledge, articulate 3M HIS solution vision, workflow and design and expand subject matter expertise.  ‚ÄúAt 3M, we want to make sure that everyone, from all walks of life, know they can share their opinions, they‚Äôre heard, and change is made based on their input.‚Äù ‚Äì Ann Anaya, chief diversity officer at 3M‚Äù  This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.  The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role  Here, You Will Make An Impact By  As a Senior Sales Director of Healthcare Solutions Executives for the Health Information Systems Division, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.  Oversight of the Sales Training team and education initiatives delivered to the Healthcare Solution Executives as well as the sales organization at large. Oversight of the Demonstration and Content team relative to software releases, testing, and preparation to tradeshows. This role would also work collaboratively in driving strategic direction with the Technology team to ensure regression testing and the demonstration system is functional on a daily basis. Provide team leadership, coaching, cross training on all solution sets to ensure consistent and high-quality customer and prospect solution discovery, assessment and presentations and demonstrations Personally invested, through direct travel, to support, mentor, and coach Healthcare Solutions Executives to achieve 3M HIS annual quotas, growth and retention targets. Demonstrate strong client relationship development skills with a track record of creating and maintaining strong senior executive relationships in healthcare; specifically, within the IP, OP, & Professional revenue cycle and clinical provider areas (e.g. CFO, CMO, CMIO, CIO, CEO) Recruit, retain and develop team members for Healthcare Solutions Executives ensuring the best team is in place to achieve all targets. Provide input and guidance to the sales management team relative to internal process improvements, external market factors and trends and identification of key strategic selling issues and solutions. Develop and implement training programs and participate in cross functional teams, as needed, to incorporate the best practice demonstration of workflow and content to consistently improve 3M HIS solutions and message with current and future deliverables. Additionally, work closely with product design and development teams to ensure future success of 3M HIS in the minds of our clients and prospects. Provides direct supervision to assigned employees through leadership, coaching, training and development, allocating work assignments, review of progress in achieving objectives, managing employee compensation, performance appraisals, diversity, disability, all relevant employee data, etc. Understands and enforces corporate/location policies and procedures. Takes appropriate action to address policy violations.  Skills And Expertise  To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from an accredited university (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution  OR  High School Diploma/GED (completed and verified prior to start) and a minimum of fourteen (14) years of experience in sales Seven (7) years of combine Healthcare Sales experience AND/OR Client Success Management experience Five (5) years of experience in selling 3M Health Information Systems solutions AND/OR M*Modal solutions in the field Three (3) years of experience in management or supervisory role  Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:  Interpersonal skills to promote cross department cooperation and processes to meet sales objectives and convey to internal business stakeholders Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and training skills Ability to assess a client or prospects environment and correlate to the pertinent 3M HIS solutions Ability to direct and influence others  Sales Territory: National USA  Location: Field based located near a major airport - USA Based  Travel: May include up 75% domestic travel  Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).  Supporting Your Well-being  3M offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.  Resources for You  For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.  Learn more about 3M‚Äôs creative solutions to the world‚Äôs problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.  Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M‚Äôs business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.  Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/  3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

jobTitle: Regional Director Of Sales And Marketing

description: Company Summary  Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That‚Äôs the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.  Target Openings  1  Job Description Summary  Reports to Regional Vice President with direction from the Home Office Business Development Vice President. Individual partners with the regional management team to ensure effective marketing, planning, and execution resulting in the retention, growth and profitability of the Middle Market book of business. Additionally, individual acts as a liaison with other regional marketing directors, the Regional Director (RD), and home office management to share best practices.  Travelers offers a hybrid work location model that is designed to support flexibility.  Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities Distribution Development assists in driving a regions strategic and tactical efforts in the development and promotion of productive distributor relationships by creating a thorough understanding of our products, services and value proposition as well as developing and store housing our local knowledge of the various distributor organizations, their key staff, controlled business and business priorities. Key Activities Include Distributor profiling with our RVP, ROOs, Managing Directors and Account Executives to improve our view of our distributors organizations/people, focus and specialties. Territorial profiling/mapping to determine business mix, head room opportunities, matched against distributor capability, followed by strategy(ies) to execute and grow the business. Identification of distributors with middle market head-room along with the development, and the assistance in executing plans to capitalize on the opportunity. Contribution to key distributors annual and quarterly planning efforts for the Middle Market at the Regional, cross market basis. Assist in managing distributor compensation elements for the middle market working with the RD (Regional Director) and Home Office as needed. Communication on an ongoing basis with other business units to effectively extend our coverage of the distributor plant in the region and ensure regular referrals. Organization and delivery of product fairs and other special events for distributor(s). Coaching and Skill Development Work with Regional Vice President, Regional Operating Officer and Managing Directors to identify and address marketing and sales skill gaps in the region. Key Activities Include Assessment of our ability to articulate and sell our value proposition. Understand, drive and reinforce middle market initiatives generated out of Booz Allen work. Organization and delivery of training as appropriate. Participate in Sales Training courses to assist in the coaching of MDs and Account Executives and to reinforce our ongoing marketing/sales training investment. Insuring that tools to support marketing, sales and relationship management are well understood and effectively used. Oversee effectiveness, quality and marketability of our marketing collateral. Marketing and Product(ion) Generation Individual will implement long term and tactical marketing strategies to enable the regions achievement of profit and market share objectives. Person will also help identify product needs and opportunities unique to the region. Key Activities Include Helping develop and participate in regionally focused new, enhanced and embedded product launch rollout strategies. Will work closely with home office Product Industry leaders. Monitoring at the regional and distributor level, the success of product launches, while providing tactical responses as needed. Ensuring the region maintains appropriate, consistent product visibility while encouraging distributor intranet shelf-space. Developing regional or national relationships with assoc associations tied to our product interest Ex. Manufacturer Associations, regional purchase groups, etc. Leading an active prospect identification program designed to improve Middle Markets underwriting appetite, knowledge and market share in the territory. Efforts include working with the regional team to help build prospect level strategies, action plans and disciplined follow up tailored to local office needs, and utilize appropriate tools to effectively manage the data and information developed on such key prospects. Connecting with our service team partners as well as other business units to ensure we maximize cross selling and leveraging of our product/service offerings. Communicating wins, losses and competitor intelligence across the region . Driving the IndustryEdge and other industry group product branding images. Minimum Qualifications Bachelors degree in sales, underwriting or related field. A minimum of 7 years of experience in sales, underwriting or related field. Leadership  Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies Consistently sets clear direction by defining goals and priorities. Demonstrated ability to consistently make sound business decisions. Develops a high degree of trust through demonstrated personal integrity, ethics and a commitment to doing the right thing. Energizes others to commit to achieving the highest standards. Establishes and maintains an environment that encourages everyone to act in the best interest of the company. Effectively coaches and mentors the regional team and AEs in effective marketing strategies. Business Knowledge Good working knowledge of the commercial insurance business. Clearly demonstrates specific knowledge requirements as defined by the Middle Market leadership. Understands Middle Market products, financials, objectives and service requirements. Demonstrated ability and know- how to get things done. Marketing A good communicator and coach. Recognizes opportunities to penetrate new markets. Takes advantage of all important opportunities to increase market share. Takes intelligent risks. Demonstrates specific marketing skills necessary to achieve established and stretch business goals. Professionally current. Customer and Producer Focus Identifies customers and producer needs and takes appropriate action to meet those needs. Works effectively with all levels and can easily build new relationships. Acts with a sense of urgency. Strong knowledge of competitive market conditions. Teamwork Can establish strong coalitions and networks both within and outside of the Division/Company. Management & Tools Takes responsibility for decisions and actions. Manages own work. Understands the business and responds to all related issues, concerns and problems. Additional Information The salary range in Colorado for this position is $122,000 to $183,000. To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit. All employees are eligible for performance-based cash awards, either through Travelers annual bonus program or through the Reward and Recognition (R&R) program. Employment Practices  Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.  If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.  Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.  To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

description: Imagine a world where every driver with a smartphone is safer and where massive amounts of data and insights make cities safer and reduce insurance costs for everyone. Zendrive is rapidly executing its mission of ‚Äúmaking roads safer using data and analytics‚Äù and building products to support the evolution of mobility and auto insurance.  If you are passionate about mobility and making a meaningful impact on the world; if you believe that the mobile revolution alongside machine learning and big data can help transform lagging industries, you will love what we do at Zendrive.  We are looking for a highly motivated Director of Business Development to join our fast-growing team. This role will lead and drive strategic partnership development and management with mobile app publishers in support of a new product area. In addition to growing your own book of business, you will help define and implement our sales strategy and provide guidance on priorities in a dynamic space.  This role reports to our VP, New Business Development Strategy. This is a remote (work from home) position that can be based anywhere within the U.S.  Responsibilities Own and lead the business development process end-to-end with publishers, including identifying prospects, building relationships, creating tailored proposals and business models, negotiating and closing new partnerships. Work with cross-functional teams to oversee the integration and launch of new publishers; provide recommendations to continuously improve onboarding for new publishers. Own and nurture existing relationships, ensuring their success in adopting and realizing value from the Zendrive platform. Identify new market opportunities, build pitch decks, collateral, and deliver to publishers on a regular basis, both in-person and virtually. Provide market intelligence and product feedback to internal stakeholders, as well as partners and advertisers. Qualifications 7+ years of business development or partner management experience in a mobile marketing or mobile platform company Hunter mentality with the ability to make an immediate impact and hit the ground running Experience selling SDK solutions required Demonstrated success negotiating, structuring, and closing complex enterprise deals with C-level executives Prior deal experience with data products and relationships with top fintech publishers Experience building first of kind partnerships Deep understanding of affiliate and performance marketing Fluency with data licensing Superb influencing, relationship, communication, presentation, and negotiation skills Team-oriented and collaborative Results-oriented, self-motivated and self-directed Entrepreneurial -- you possess a keen sense of ownership, drive, scrappiness, and persistence A passion for technology, startups, and supporting high-growth businesses  Zendrive Is Very Proud To Offer Competitive salary and equity packages Premium Medical, Dental, & Vision plans Flexible Time Off Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity) Learning & development opportunities Monthly allowance for wellness, Spotify/Apple Music, home internet, and mobile A new MacBook and allowance to set up your home office  But, The Real Perks Are Challenging and fun work - you'll never have a boring day World-class team that thrives working collaboratively and solving challenging problems The opportunity to use data and technology to make driving safer and transform the auto insurance industry (while building the next unicorn) When we say Zendrive is an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are not just adding a legal addendum. Of course, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or beliefs, national origin, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability, but we believe that is quite a low bar. In fact, we celebrate our differences as our strength and actively work to build an inclusive environment for all. If we can do anything to improve your application and interview process, please let us know!  To all recruitment agencies: Zendrive does not accept unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Zendrive employees or any other company location. Zendrive is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

jobTitle: Global Sales Strategy and Technical Lead
description: Stripe‚Äôs Global Sales Team is at the forefront of driving revenue and growth. As trusted business partners, our goal is to help users understand Stripe products and integrate them with ease so they can concentrate on what‚Äôs most important to them: their business. We‚Äôre known for our product expertise, rigorous thinking, and user-first approach to problem solving. Within Stripe, Sales proudly serves as a critical source of user feedback and market intelligence, with direct influence on Stripe‚Äôs product roadmap and growth strategy.  The Revenue Operations team is responsible for overall productivity and effectiveness of the sales organization, partnering closely with the sales team and teams across Stripe to drive initiatives. We are looking for a self-starter to join our team who has demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity, operating in a fast-growing environment, and solving problems with limited oversight. The ideal candidate will demonstrate that they have or can partner closely with cross-functional teams, project manage complex initiatives, and make data-driven decisions. Our ideal candidates will demonstrate owning project management and building scalable processes that outsource from sales critical selling tasks like lead enrichment, pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, and customer risk management. Experience in areas like these will help to ensure we are meeting the needs of the organization by building priority mechanisms that scale selling activities.  You Will Implement Stripe‚Äôs Sales Support Desk global strategy, in alignment with Stripe‚Äôs Sales business strategy Build and own standardized processes or tools to migrate non-customer facing sales tasks into the Sales Support Desk in partnership with Sales, Sales Operations, Data Science, and other Stripe teams Project manage building repeatable and scalable processes that outsource from sales essential tasks such as pricing analysis, renewal analysis, RFP response, account optimizations, supportability, and risk management Cultivate a team culture that includes high ownership, customer-first focus, fast pace, high integrity, and an optimistic and positive environment Report out on a regular weekly, monthly, and quarterly cadence to all key stakeholders, with a strong analytical approach and crisp communication style We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who Has 5+ years of delivering sales/user support or sales operations in a high growth technology environment Proven track record in successfully building and owning sales project programs and developing close cross functional partnerships Strong technical skills and sales tooling experience Sound business judgment, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results Experience working within a high-growth, technology company with the ability to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization Highly organized, multi-tasking skills, taking ownership, and being efficient in ambiguous situations Bachelor‚Äôs Degree Nice To Haves MBA or other advanced degree Lean Six Sigma certification, or proven experience employing the methodology Experience working in the financial services/payments industry

jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales, Brands East
description: About Us:  SOCi is an award-winning all-in-one local marketing platform built specifically for "next-level" multi-location marketers. Our customers include top brands and influencers like Ace Hardware, Sport Clips, and Anytime Fitness as well as top multifamily property management companies like Greystar, Lincoln, and Pinnacle who have the impossible challenge of managing their digital presence across hundreds and thousands of locations. The SOCi platform empowers local management of the entire customer journey across multiple mediums including local business listings, social, reviews, listening, ads, bots, and more. As the central command for multi-location marketers, SOCi makes the impossible possible by enabling top brands and their locations to strengthen and scale their digital presence across limitless local search and social pages while protecting what matters most, their reputation.  Our accolades include:  Recently closed a Series D investment round of $80 million, led by JMI Equity Inc. 5000 honoree fourp years in a row for Fastest Growing Companies in America Entrepreneur magazine‚Äôs #1 Marketing Provider for Franchises, and top provider three years in a row Front Runner for Gartner‚Äôs SoftwareAdvice.com in Reputation Management & Brand Management Top 200 rank on Financial Times The Americas‚Äô Fastest Growing Companies two years in a row Forbes America‚Äôs Best Startup Employers Position Summary:  SOCi is looking for a rockstar Regional Director of Sales for the Eastern USA Region to develop a dynamic team of driven Account Executives that will set out to solve the complex social media and reputation management challenges that are unique to enterprise multi-location brands and franchises and to make a killing doing it.  We are looking for a sales leader who understands and can articulate what it takes to lead a high-performance team in the challenging world of SaaS sales today, has a proven track record of success in leading high-performance sales teams, and believes that they can have a 10x impact on our rocket-ship startup.  Preferred Qualifications:  4-6 years of experience in B2B SaaS Enterprise Sales Leadership Ability to show consistent revenue achievement (not just that you achieved it, but how you achieved it would be even better) Creative entrepreneurial spirit (you won‚Äôt come here if you don‚Äôt have it) Refined and proven sales methodology (Can‚Äôt wait to see it) Creative strategist; develop new ways to drive ales and value to existing and prospective clients (Love that quality) Experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment (Clock Speed required) Creative problem solver with the ability to understand and resolve client challenges/objections Sell cutting-edge, disruptive technology to decision-makers at the enterprise level Willingness to travel (up to 50%, we have big territories and big customers) Strong execution, focus, and ability to develop solutions and strategies to further accelerate growth Provide thought leadership to develop a high performing sales organization and customer-centric culture Recruit, retain, and mentor a remote high-performance and highly engaged sales team Train, develop, and motivate the sales team in skills, sales methodologies and activities, product knowledge, teamwork, time and territory management, and competitive knowledge Executive-level interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to successfully influence and quickly build credibility to maximize organizational growth and profitability Ability to foresee, interpret and rapidly respond to market changes by adjusting strategies and realigning priorities accordingly Proven experience closing or assisting sales team members in closing large ticket deals Strong business and analytical acumen; strong problem-solving skills Manage account and contact information through the entire sales lifecycle process using Salesforce and ensure that the sales team maintains detailed account profiles and prepares sales and activity reports as required. Take ownership of the accuracy of the information in Salesforce What's SOCi's culture like?  Led by a team of industry experts, SOCi is leading the pack in Social Media and Reputation Management. We offer flexible PTO, comprehensive health & benefits packages, and 401k (amongst many other perks). Every new team member is equipped with a MacBook laptop, tech accessories & SOCi swag. We are a fast-paced, agile environment where thought leadership and input is encouraged. If you are looking for a place where you can come and make a difference in the way enterprise organizations utilize social technology, then SOCi is for you.   SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law

jobTitle: Territory Manager- Giftware/Fashion/D√©cor - Illinois and NW Indiana
description: Sell what you love! Home d√©cor, fashion accessories and gifts? We‚Äôve got that! Two‚Äôs Company is the leader in the gift and decorative accessory wholesale industry. We are currently seeking another exceptional "People Person" to add to our elite Sales Team in Illinois.  The Position: As an outside territory sales representative (Territory Manager) you will engage independent specialty retailers from an already established account base with a memorable selling experience and grow your territory by developing new business relationships. Spend your day in Gift Shops, Spas & Fashion Boutiques creating loyal Two‚Äôs fans! Visit our website at www.twoscompany.com to be inspired by our product lines.  What you must do to succeed: Travel to independent specialty retailers daily Monday through Friday to show and sell our products. Identify, solicit and engage with retailers to develop new sales opportunities. Collaborate with store owners and buyers on creative merchandising and marketing ideas. Build and grow relationships with store owners and buyers and effectively communicate the value of our extensive product lines. Deliver an inspiring customer centric experience in sales and service. description: Your Next Adventure Starts at Encamp.   Who we are:  Encamp is on a mission to create a world where good for business is good for the environment. And we‚Äôre doing it with a modern first-of-its-kind SaaS platform for environmental compliance.  Built by our own EHS professionals, the Encamp platform makes environmental compliance and reporting faster, easier, and more accurate by eliminating data silos and arduous technology implementations and adoption life cycles. Being as passionate about the environment as we are, we‚Äôre driven to simplify the process of compliance for EHS professionals nationwide. We‚Äôre also an expanding team of remote happy Encampers, with roots in Indianapolis but quickly expanding throughout the U.S.  As a part of the Encamp team, you‚Äôll tackle challenges of scale and complexity as we develop our product at a fast pace and continue to create the future of EHS technology. Encampers choose us and grow with us thanks to a company culture that supports ownership, optimizes action, and surrounds you with intelligent and supportive colleagues to continually maximize learning.   Who we're looking for:  We‚Äôre looking for curious minds who want to make a big impact, and who don‚Äôt mind going fast. We want achievers to help us keep innovating the EHS platform of the 21st Century, and to delight the thousands of EHS specialists who are using our solution across the US today.   Our ideal candidate:   Will contribute to the success of our company by leading our sales activity and designing new and effective sales strategies to achieve our growth goals. This is a director/manager level position that will have a leadership voice within the company and will be tasked with building a multi faceted team facing off against multiple channels over time. This leader will need to recruit, train, and retain best in class reps as well as run the operational and administrative tasks of this department. Encamp is a distributed workforce and a big part of this job will be creating a culture within this team of happiness, motivation, and connectivity. Data will drive investment and strategy and this leader will hold a key role in developing and evolving our GTM playbook. This role is one of the most important in our organization, and we need a self-starting, motivated, passionate person to lead Encamp into its next phase of growth.   As the Vice President of Sales for Encamp you will:  Meets with prospects and existing clients and showcases command of Encamp value propositions  Work with senior leadership to build on our existing sales pipeline and develop strategies to improve efficiency across the sales organization  Manage and continue to evolve our sales playbook   Produce weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance reports  Cultivate and maintain a culture of perpetual coaching, routine enablement, and servant leadership  Set and communicate clear objectives for individual team members and hold the team to them  Lead the team to hit our revenue goals  Motivate individuals and team to exceed objectives through regular broadcast of results and creative incentives  Utilize our suite of sales and marketing technology to study metrics and improve performance  Recruit, develop, and retain exceptional talent   Requirements:   7-10+ years in Software sales as an IC and/or manager; experience managing a Sales teams in a fast-paced, greenfield software environment preferred  A history of consistently accurately forecasting and performing above team quota.   Effectively lead teams with right combination of data, motivation and strong personal leadership  Experience working in a fast-paced, startup environment  Strong Salesforce skills highly preferred  Passionate about training and developing a team  Exceptional presentation, negotiation, and closing skills with the ability to sell to decision-making levels  Consistent track record of identifying team needs and successfully implementing solutions  Experience prospecting into the Fortune 500 and other enterprise organizations  Demonstrates strong organizational skills and the ability to think creatively   Perks of being a happy Encamper:  The opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment at the intersection of Environmental Compliance and SaaS (Software as a Solution).   Competitive salary and benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) match, and unlimited PTO.  A work-from-anywhere remote culture along with an annual Remote Work Stipend.  Parental leave. Because we think it's important to spend time with your new family.  A significant personal impact on the team and its ways of working because of our strong culture of ownership.   Ready to join us around the Encamp-fire?  If you‚Äôre passionate about teamwork, transparency, accountability, and an appetite for knowledge and forward thinking, we‚Äôd like to hear from you. Come join a team that celebrates diversity as well as technology, and that continues to make a difference in uncharted territory.  With our goal of equity in mind, we are transparent about the salary range that we‚Äôve researched and budgeted against for this role in our invitation to you for an initial conversation. You can then decide if you'd like to proceed.  The Talent Acquisition Partner for this role is Samantha Strube. If you haven‚Äôt heard from us within 10 days of your application and/or you have any questions about your application, please reach out to hr@encamp.com.   Encamp is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We don‚Äôt discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time.
