description: The Company You‚Äôll Join  At Bidgely, we are working to accelerate a clean energy future by enabling energy companies and consumers to make data-driven energy-related decisions.   Bidgely has developed the utility industry's first enterprise energy analytics and customer engagement SaaS platform. Our artificial intelligence (AI) powered platform transforms utility meter data into business intelligence that electric and gas utilities can use to improve customer satisfaction, drive energy efficiency, and create new revenue models by offering customer-relevant energy products and services through the utility‚Äôs marketplace. customer satisfaction, operational efficiency and new revenue models. More than 17M+ homes across 30 utilities in 10+ countries are on the Bidgely platform. Based in Silicon Valley, the company has raised over $77M and provides a fun and intellectually-engaging environment.  The Position and the Team You‚Äôll Work With As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for implementing a structured sales plan aimed at generating new business and for building strong, trust-based relationships with customer decision makers at the ‚ÄúCXO‚Äù level.    Your focus will be to grow the business through persistent, adaptive and smart sales strategy & tactics. You will play a key role in developing new business by managing key utility accounts to rapidly grow the company. Through a consultative sales process, you will work closely with your strategic North American utility accounts to educate, influence and ultimately create the business justification to partner with Bidgely in the following key areas - 1) Grid Modernization 2) Electrification with a focus on Electric Vehicles 3) Decarbonization 4) Demand Side Management.    As Director of Sales You Will Expand business by delivering new bookings and revenue in named utility accounts in North America.   Work with utilities to define, scope and contract Bidgely solutions as it relates to customer programs (demand side management, electric vehicles, distributed resources, time of use, digitization) and grid analytics.   Manage complex sales cycles at accounts through a team based sales approach. This includes partnering with Inside Sales to identify opportunities, Regulatory to influence opportunities and Solution Engineerings to scope opportunities.  Develop understanding and influence over the utility buying process. This includes the ability to speak to the market, regulatory and technical nuance that impacts decision making.  Prospect new and existing accounts to build a solid pipeline multiple to ensure successful achievement of quarterly bookings and revenue targets. Manage all opportunities by navigating the critical success factors, competitive challenges, partner landscape, objections and other complex issues to ensure successful outcomes in the territory. Carry a quota and create quarterly forecasts including committed deals as well as pipeline for the current quarter and beyond. Plan and facilitate meetings between Bidgely‚Äôs executive team, the client‚Äôs business executives, technology and procurement teams to align all parties around the engagement.  Schedule strategic meetings with clients, partners, and thought-leaders to understand global and regional regulatory and industry specific issues that impact our accounts. Interface with Bidgely marketing, product management, and professional services teams to review programs and timelines on an ongoing basis to ensure successful implementation.   You Will Bring BS/BA or equivalent degree At least 5 years utility experience working with/for electric, gas and/or water utilities in North America. Demonstrated knowledge of the regulated utility space with a specific focus on 1) Grid Modernization 2) Electrification with a focus on Electric Vehicles 3) Decarbonization 4) Demand Side Management.   Direct sales and/or account management experience specifically selling multi-million dollar enterprise SaaS software deals to utility companies. Outstanding consultative selling abilities and excellent interpersonal skills with executive level customers Demonstrated ability to handle complex sales situations and to close multi-million dollar transactions. Strong desire to work in a dynamic fast-paced work environment  About You Passionate about a clean energy future Innovative - You challenge the status quo Resilient - You enjoy meeting challenges head on and strive to find creative solutions to problems Data driven - you understand the importance of data in decision making  Why You‚Äôll Love Working at Bidgely  Opportunity to grow with a startup We are a passionate and intelligent team united by the goal of a clean energy future  Great benefit package, including comprehensive medical, dental, vision insurance; 401(k); Paid Parental Leave policy; Unlimited PTO.  Flexibility: this role is remote so you can work from the location of your choosing within the United States. East or West Coast preferred. Once normal business operations resume, you may choose to work from our Mountain View office or stay fully remote.
industries: Computer Software, Renewables & Environment, and Utilities

jobTitle: Vice President Market Development General Surgery
description: VP Market Development General Surgery                                                         About BK Medical BK Medical is committed to designing ultrasound systems that help surgeons image, guide, intervene, and navigate inside the human body. Surgeons are our customers, and they range from HPB surgeons, neurosurgeons, and robotic-assisted surgeons to urologists, colorectal surgeons, and more.  Our mission at BK is to enable real-time intraoperative guidance during surgical procedures, giving surgeons the information needed to immediately make critical decisions.  Real-time visualization supports surgeons in achieving the best patient outcomes by allowing visualization of organs at the time of surgery and imaging the path of surgical devices during the procedure, as well as imaging at the end of surgery. BK Medical‚Äôs intraoperative ultrasound imaging can guide the surgeon through various steps ‚Äì from staging through intervention to validation ‚Äì all in one procedure.  Position Summary BK Medical wants to leverage its leading Active Imaging technology in order to achieve a leading market position as intra-operative imaging partner in General Surgery (GS) inclusive of open, laparoscopic, robotic approaches in the liver, pancreas, Bile Duct, Colorectal, abdominal and Gyn surgeries. With approx. 800 HPB and approx. 18,000 general surgeons in the United States alone, we intend to hire a VP of Market Development reporting to the CCO with the goal of accelerating the definition and execution of a strategy that will consider all sub-specialties within the GS field and the correct positioning for our product portfolio. The position has worldwide responsibility. The VP of Market development acts as the ultimate expert within BK in the selected specialties, works with own team, the sales organization and all other key stakeholders, to meet key business objectives and, to define BK medical vision for success in General Surgery.   Essential Job Duties Define business opportunity in each of the three world regions (NA, Europe, ROW), provide quantitative and qualitative data to justify business plan supporting growth targets that will quickly establish BK medical as leader in General Surgery procedures. Build a three-year business plan that details revenue growth and investments required to achieve targets Develop and manage existing and new potential partnerships/relationships with external companies that fit BK medical‚Äôs strategic goals Hire and manage a team of GS consultants operating in North America. Define business needs for specialists outside of NA, specifically in Europe and selected countries under Distribution. Design most effective sales process in each world region by working with and by maximizing effectiveness of the following roles: General Surgery Consultants (own team), field sales, marketing Responsible to provide vision and content of a General Surgery training program that will help BK medical sales to improve their effectiveness in the various GS subspecialties. Consider different approaches needed for different procedures, for instance: laparoscopic, open, MIS, robotic, and different organs such as: liver, pancreas, bile duct, colorectal, abdominal. Work with strategic marketing to define product messaging (USPs, clinical claims, price, target customers) and correct approaches to different sub-specialties. Work with own team and strategic marketing to identify needs for effective marketing collateral (brochures, videos, white papers) Work with strategic marketing to establish an effective process for product feedback collection from the field/customers that becomes part of product definition for GS. Provide competitive information to strategic marketing on a regular basis Responsible to develop appropriate customers‚Äô workshops/courses. Work with regional sales to identify needs, find the right speakers/KOLs, define annual budget to run the program. Work with own team, sales organization, and marketing, to develop visitation and referral sites in own region Develop key industry and society relationships in the field(s) of general surgery to further establish BK Medical brand  Qualifications Required At least 10+ years of experience in sales and marketing roles, preferably related to any of the general surgery specialties as defined by BK Medical Experience in managing a direct team Experience in working in a multidisciplinary and multicultural environment Microsoft Office and CRM experience Proficiency in written and spoken English A bachelor‚Äôs degree and a minimum of ten years medical device sales experience is required, with five years selling ultrasound machines and/or capital equipment preferred. Demonstrated ability to master all aspects of the capital sales process and consultative selling. A successful track record showing ability to meet targets consistently without straining from company‚Äôs strategy and goals Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Prefers direct and honest communication with superiors, peers, and direct reports. Outstanding organizational, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills. High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy. Strong internal customer focus with desire to learn all aspects of the business. Team-player, positive attitude, and eager to do more and help out. Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision. Result-driven and proactive. Maintains a ‚Äúcompany first‚Äù attitude.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Head of Sales Full-Time Salaried Exempt Position  ***DIRECT CHEERLEADING INDUSTRY EXPERTISE IN THE SCHOLASTIC & ALL STAR MARKETS IS REQUIRED!!!   Please only continue reading if you are a leading Cheerleading expert, live and breathe Cheerleading and understand the ins and outs, politics, and love for our proud sport.  Our ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing ALL Sales Teams' Operations and Strategy. Sales channels include: Domestic and International Distributors, Direct Sales, E-Commerce Marketplaces & Amazon, International and Domestic Distributors and Retailers, Brand Relationship Management, Retail Pop-Up Stores, and Cheerleading Competitions hosted by our Brand - all in the Women's Team Sports, Scholastic and All Star Cheerleading Markets. By researching market trends and conducting competitor analysis, you will develop and implement sales strategies across these channels, as well as Supervise and Lead all Team Managers and Sales Directors.    Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Supervise and Lead all Team Managers and Sales Directors  Develop and implement sales strategies with our Sales and Brand Teams Prepare operational and financial sales department reports Oversee the management, training, ongoing learning, and career development of the sales teams Directly coordinate cross-selling and joint marketing initiatives to maximize exposure and profitability Identifying and requesting marketing materials from the Marketing department prior to scheduled events Responsible for overseeing the project management of Pop-Up Stores and Nfinity Cheerleading Events Travel, evening and weekend work will be required  Qualifications: Direct Cheerleading Industry Expertise in Scholastic and All Star is REQUIRED Bachelor's degree is REQUIRED 5+ years of Sales Director leadership experience managing teams is REQUIRED 7+ years of sales experience is REQUIRED, with working knowledge of the athletic sales industry highly preferred Strong leadership skills including Multi-Team and Multi-Channel Management Must be proficient with Excel, Word & Power Point Must have a high energy level and professional appearance  Compensation: Base + Commission Role Highly Competitive Pay & Generous PTO! Medical Benefits with 50% Company Contribution 401k with a Company Match after 90 days  *Proud Equal Opportunity Employer *Salaried Exempt Position MUST have current & relevant cheerleading experience  OUR STORY What We Do: Nfinity designs its products for the driven female athlete who wants and believes she deserves something better. We are the only brand with a core focus on creating lightweight, high-performance athletic footwear specifically and exclusively for female athletes. Nfinity invests its time and effort in designing shoes for a group of athletes who struggle to get the recognition they deserve. Inspired by the level of athleticism and sacrifice that women athletes put into their sport, we strive to provide them with high performance products designed specifically for their needs. By addressing the unique biomechanical needs of the female athlete, we are able to enhance their athletic performance with the ultimate goal of helping reduce the risk of injury. One thing you‚Äôll notice about our products is the attention to detail and thoughtful design. Everything we create is for our unique customer, from the way she is shaped to the way she moves. We spend a lot of time developing high performance fabrics and materials that out-perform those of our competitors, all without sacrificing fashion. We are passionate about making a profound difference in the lives of female‚Äôs athletes and you can tell by our products. We are a team of marketers that approach all aspects of our business through the lens of seven core values; attributes that we believe result in not only a better product, but also a better company.  Our Values: Brand before all United Gracious Impeccable with our word Aspirational The Experience ‚Äì Constantly striving to enhance the brand with the overall Nfinity experience. Nfinity employees represent the brand at all times, whether it is through interacting with a customer, a co- worker, or on social media. Rocky ‚Äì Fearless, relentless, passionate, dedicated, trains harder, self-starter

description: About Coda  Coda started with an observation: In a world full of applications, why do documents and spreadsheets still run everything? And why haven't they been meaningfully updated in over 50 years? Coda is a new doc that's familiar and flexible like the documents you're used to, but comes with building blocks you can combine to create docs as powerful as apps. It's a big product with an even bigger mission. And we need your help to spread the word! We're backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, and have assembled a world-class team across offices in San Francisco, Mountain View, and Seattle, and remote employees all over the US. In fact, all our jobs are open in any location across the US. Here's a quick overview of what we do.  About The Role  We're searching for our first Sales Development leader to help build our fast-growing sales development team. You and your team will play a critical role in fueling Coda's growth as you build sales pipeline. You will report directly to our Head of Sales & Success. You will help hire, train and coach our SDRs to be best in class sellers and pipeline builders. You have an opportunity to join a growing GTM team at an early and exciting stage. You will have a broad scope of responsibilities with space for creativity and autonomy. You can work across many business partners from marketing to product and senior leadership. In This Role You Will Lead a team of Sales Development Representatives (SDR), who drive outbound lead generation, inbound qualification, and cultivate relationships to create opportunities for our company Recruit, train, mentor and promote new SDRs, while fostering a culture of learning and development Optimize SDR sequences, campaigns, and collateral for optimal results Own, manage, and report metrics and goals that help drive our bottom line Work closely with Marketing and Sales leadership to drive business value You may be a great fit for this role if: You have 5+ years of experience in a B2B or B2C SaaS environment, including 1 year of experience in a management role You have 2+ years of experience using Salesloft, Outreach, or similar cadence tools You delight in selling or prospecting into Enterprise accounts You love working with Salesforce as a daily CRM You love to communicate with internal and external stakeholders You possess exceptional analytical skills and a structured way of thinking You love managing change and ambiguity, taking ownership, and creating structure How we care for our Codans!  Some Of Our Benefits Include  Starting on your first day of employment, Coda offers a wide range of benefits and perks that support eligible employees and their family members. Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance 401k Optional Remote or in-office work Commuter Benefits Cell & Internet Subsidy Lunch Subsidy Fitness Subsidy Parental Leave Annual Educational Stipend At Coda, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Coda believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

description: At Lyft, community is what we are and it‚Äôs what we do. It‚Äôs what makes us different. To create the best ride for all, we start in our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization where all team members are recognized for what they bring.  We‚Äôre looking for an experienced business leader who is passionate about the opportunity to manage and scale our Sales Operations function as we grow Lyft Business. The Head of Sales Operations will lead sales planning, strategic analysis, and operational projects to increase revenue, sales productivity, and efficiency. This role will also develop and implement training, enablement programs, and compensation plans. Identify key market/business trends and assist sale leaders in developing sale plans Build and refine forecasting and planning processes to ensure achievement of revenue and key operating metrics Partner with sales leaders to design territories, allocate quotas, set metrics, and deliver productivity targets Develop compelling sales compensation and incentive programs in partnership with leadership and finance Refine lead scoring, qualification, and routing processes across the organization Drive the monthly and quarterly operating cadence to achieve key operational milestones Build automation, optimize processes, and ensure seamless integration and use of systems, tools, and technology across the team Manage and continue to grow a high-performing group of sales operations professionals Create operational dashboards and benchmarks to measure sales team effectiveness and identify improvement opportunities Collaborate with IT teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications, focusing on CRM system improvements and enhancements. Maintain and update sales training materials using best practices across the sales team Experience & Skills 10+ years‚Äô experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, or similar roles Proven success as a sales operations leader; track record in driving changes and eliminating hurdles by working cross-functionally Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly Experience working in strategy, organizational design, go-to-market definition and process optimization Deep knowledge of sales and marketing systems/tools, with experience upgrading and deploying tools and processes (experience with Salesforce, Tableau, and other core CRM/BI tools is a plus) Outstanding interpersonal skills; proven ability to work effectively with individual contributors, management and executive leadership Operationally focused, process oriented and data driven with a strong sense of urgency Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration or related field, MBA preferred Benefits Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options Mental health benefits In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off 401(k) plan to help save for your future 18 weeks of paid parental leave. Lyft does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Lyft will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Our client's award-winning SaaS platform uses artificial intelligence to streamline how HR teams can support and fuel a high-performing workforce and support the ongoing professional development of their organization's employees.  Following two years of major growth, they are seeking a passionate and experienced Sales Manager to join them from the Greater Atlanta Area to lead a team of energetic Account Executives (1-2 days per week in the office)  Their Success Millions of end users at 2,200 organizations in 70 countries are using their platform today. Publicly-traded and experiencing major stock price increases in light of their solution's value for remote employees. They offer a compelling compensation package with a strong base salary, on-target earnings of $160K - $220K USD (uncapped), and a premium benefits package with coverage for you and your family.  Interested candidates, please note: Our team checks for new applicants every day and, while we would love to be able to engage with each of you personally, given the high volume of applicants we receive we are only able to contact candidates that are best suited for this role.

description: Job Description Summary  In your role as the Strategic Development Leader, X-ray, you will be responsible for driving growth in our largest and most strategic accounts, such as GPO partnerships, government accounts, national accounts and channel partners.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities    Originating sales by positioning GE technology and identifying the best technical and commercial solution. Promote the business value proposition of GE technology. Works in close cooperation with regional sales, account sales and commercial proposal staff. Primary technical role involved in DTI (demand to inquiry): aim at increasing market penetration through technical support during pre-ITO. Developing specialized knowledge of latest commercial developments in own area and communication skills to influence others. Has working knowledge of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses judgment to make decisions or solve moderately complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Takes new perspective on existing solutions. Uses technical experience and expertise for data analysis to support recommendations. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.  Required Qualifications    Master's degree from an accredited university or college OR High school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience. Must be able to travel up to 75% of the time.  Desired Characteristics    Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to lead programs / projects. Established project management skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: We are currently seeking a Director of Sales to lead a team of seasoned Sales Development Representatives, who are charged with the front end of the sales cycle for our clients. In addition to leading the Specialist team, the Director of Sales is responsible for our efforts to acquire net new clients through our Marketlauncher new business channel. The ideal candidate will join our company‚Äôs leadership team and help us take our growing firm and sales team to the next level.  Our team of Sales Development Representatives are responsible for providing strategic outbound services to pre-qualify leads at the top of the sales funnel. We work with clients across a range of technology and professional services and our team specializes in pre-qualifying and setting meetings with executive-level buyers in B2B.  Our business model is designed to attract seasoned professionals looking for an opportunity to leverage their talent in a flexible environment. Our team is fully remote and most of our SDRs have 15 to 20 years of prior consultative sales experience before joining Marketlauncher and the average tenure on the team is over 8 years. The Director will be responsible for leading this highly skilled team remotely and will provide continuous coaching, training, mentoring and motivating to achieve client account goals. The Director will monitor sales metrics and be accountable for the success of the sales development team.  In addition to leading the Specialist team focused on client accounts, the Director will lead the Marketlauncher New Business team and be responsible for our program to acquire net new clients. In addition to leadership, your role on the team will include completing discovery calls with prospects booked for you by the New Business team, converting to proposal stage, managing all follow-up activity through to closing and managing preparation strategy for onboarding.   As a member of the leadership team, you will be tasked with helping the firm continue to scale for growth and maintain our high-performance culture. You will be responsible for providing sound advice to senior management, collaborate with other members of management and able to thrive working in a team environment with a strong emphasis on achieving success across all client programs and our internal growth goals. You will be accountable for building and retaining a high-performance team to ensure client satisfaction.  This is a career opportunity to innovate in a truly unique environment that combines the stability of a 20-year history with the excitement of a fast-growth firm of seasoned professionals who have mastered remote work. We lead by our values of Achievement, Commitment, Improvement and Fun and are looking for a candidate that also embraces these four values.  Qualifications BS/BA required, degree in Business preferred 7+ years of Sales Management experience managing and growing a sales development rep team for B2B complex sales (preferably in tech industry) 7+ years‚Äô experience prospecting and building a net new business pipeline Experience and success as both an individual lead development contributor and sales leader Excellent presentation and listening skills Ability to communicate effectively with multiple internal leaders, cross function teammates and C-level client contacts Must have experience and be able to thrive and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment Strong computer skills, including CRM (preferably HubSpot) and Microsoft Office, Microsoft Teams, video conferencing Self-motivated, ability to work independently and motivate a team. Proven ability to close performance gaps Excellent communication and relationship building skills Proven ability to successfully provide relevant and immediate feedback in a fast-paced environment Demonstrate ability to take ownership and accountability  Duties and Responsibilities Oversee the management, learning, and career development of the sales team Coach, develop, mentor and motivate the sales team, who are charged with the front end of the sales cycle for a variety of clients, to maximize their personal performance Share best practices across the account teams; innovate on new ways to engage high level executive buyers Work closely with leadership on identifying training needs and oversee facilitation of those needs Onboarding for new sales development team hires Conduct formal employee performance evaluations Lead effective team meetings, one on one‚Äôs, and group trainings Build an open-communication environment for your team Hold your team accountable to ensure they are accurately relaying each client‚Äôs marketing message and value proposition and maintain high standards for prequalification of leads Identify specific strengths for SDR team members and recommend client account assignments based on the best fit Build relationships and attend virtual meetings with potential and existing clients Ensure the team is meeting client account goals Plan and deliver monthly, quarterly and annual initiatives Manage the Marketlauncher New Business program and team  Leading discovery calls with prospects booked for you by the New Business team Manage all New Business follow-up activity through to closing  Managing preparation strategy for onboarding new clients     Report needs to senior management by analyzing data and trends Report and implement improvements for sales metrics to hit deliverables Work closely with Operations and Client Service departments   Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate is looking for an opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment and bring new ideas and innovations to a high-performance culture Experience in an agency type environment/working with multiple clients in multiple industries Experience working with clients in professional services, technology solutions and medical/medical device/healthcare industries is ideal Experience working in a data-driven organization that is focused on building predictable front end/inside sales models Experience and leadership with top-of-funnel, inside sales in a complex sale targeting sophisticated buyers Experience and leadership with full cycle sales targeting c-suite decision makers Sales professional and leader with experience as an individual contributor that leads by example Able to empathize with, inspire and relate to a diverse, seasoned workforce and client base Demonstrates ability to implement and train sales teams in strategic selling techniques Strong leadership qualities with the ability to coach, develop and motivate a team Experience analyzing metrics Critical time management skills and personal judgment Experience and interest in helping others grow and change Familiarity collaborating through the use of Microsoft Teams or similar and use of CRM  Work Environment  The MarketLauncher Team is comprised of a seasoned leadership team, tech-savvy associates and analysts, subject matter experts and seasoned sales and marketing experts. Our flexible work environment attracts the best and the brightest professionals who are looking for a career that supports their personal interests while allowing them to also apply their deep skills to support the complex growth objectives of industry leading clients.  100% Remote Workforce: Our team has worked remotely since our inception. We know how to lead and succeed from virtually anywhere.  High Employee Retention: Our culture, values and committed team members are key reasons for low staff turnover. Our team members have been here an average of 8+ years.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

jobTitle: Senior Sales Manager, Mid Market (Remote, East Coast)
description: About Brightcove Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We‚Äôre hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world‚Äôs most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.  As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When video is done right, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of a global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.  About This Role Brightcove is looking for an exceptional person to head up our Americas‚Äô Mid Market and Commercial teams, reporting directly to our SVP of Sales, Americas. This team will focus on accounts that have <$500M in annual revenue, including new business and expansion of our 2500+ existing accounts, and high growth tech unicorns. This leader will guide approximately 10+ individual contributors, one first-line manager, one-team lead, and have responsibility for 100% of our product portfolio. This is an incredible opportunity for someone to step into a 2nd line leadership role.  The ideal candidate has a record of success in leading and motivating a team of sellers, delivering or exceeding revenue goals and has a background with inside and outside sales within the enterprise SaaS platform sales industry. Transaction sizes range from $10k-$200k ARR and are sold to line-of-business (Marketing, Corporate Communications, eCommerce, etc) as well as IT (Centralized Video Platform).  Job Responsibilities Execute against sales goals by driving pipeline growth and new logo acquisitions from enterprise accounts Hire, develop, motivate, and retain a high-performance Mid Market and Commercial sales team Manage and own sales planning and forecasting, territory and quota planning and measurement of inside KPI sales metrics  Directly support sales calls to major accounts and escalations Drive territory growth through up-selling/cross selling existing customers Implement and reinforce sales and product training and methodology  Work with individual sales reps on territory planning and execution Accurately manage an on-going sales pipeline across the team for forecasting purposes Work with marketing to drive pipeline growth Work closely with Global Services team to develop overall customer success strategy Create & articulate compelling value propositions around the use of the Brightcove platform Travel expectation is 25%  Qualifications/Experience 5+ years of managing sales professionals in SaaS Knowledge of sales management & analytics technologies (Salesforce, Engagio, Gong, Insight Squared, Marketo, Conversica, etc) Strong leadership and people management skills to develop and lead high performance professionals as well as excellent communication and presentation skills Strong ability to partner cross functionally, building strong Ability to interface with product and engineering to synthesize customer needs and feedback BA/BS in sales, business management or related field. MBA is a plus  Working at Brightcove As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company‚Äôs success. We offer competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement, as well as generous PTO - and we expect you to use it!
industries: Online Media and Computer Software

description: Job Description  Arc XP is a cloud-based digital experience platform that helps enterprise companies, retail brands and media and entertainment organizations create and distribute content, drive digital commerce, and deliver powerful multichannel experiences. A division of The Washington Post, Arc XP has powered the digital transformation of customers across the globe, currently serving over 2,400 sites in more than 25 countries that reach nearly 2 billion unique visitors monthly.  Built 100% on AWS, the Arc platform follows a microservice architecture. All of our software teams use dev ops to deliver and maintain products. Our processes are lightweight, which allows our teams to innovate quickly to bring new ideas to market. New features and products are deployed to our customer base every day  Do you have experience in selling SaaS? Do you have experience working with enterprise organizations implementing E-commerce platforms? Have you driven new revenue, built customer pipelines and/or exceeded targets for a high growth business?  At Arc, we are looking for a Director of Sales in E-commerce to join a team whose primary focus is to work with customers who are re-platforming their E-commerce experience. Ideal candidates understand the growing role of a scalable E-commerce platform, have an entrepreneurial spirit, and have experience in working in the E-commerce vertical. This individual can work with many different decision makers like CTO, VP of Digital and CMO.  The ideal candidate will possess a business development background that allows you to engage with businesses who currently have a home-grown E-commerce platform or use a third-party E-commerce product. You need to be able to think strategically, manage complex negotiations, build polished customer-facing material and present it in one-to-one and one-to-many formats, and establish and grow relationships.  We expect everyone to be tenacious, scrappy, and wear many hats. You will confidently represent our team in front of leaders of all levels across enterprise organizations and educate prospects on what we have built and how to use it.  What You Will Do‚Ä¶ Manage a customer pipeline, revenue growth targets, and global go-to-market strategies Develop proposals and negotiate/close complex contracts while protecting and managing risk Manage pipeline and portfolios of $5M-$100M Navigate complex organizations to embed Arc‚Äôs E-commerce product as a solution in their operations Work across functional groups within Arc to ensure Arc is meeting the customer demands and requirements to close deals Work across functional teams to provide customer feedback attained during the sales process so as to help improve the Arc product portfolio Conduct post deal RCAs to understand what worked well, what needs improvement, and where we as a business can double down to ensure future deal success Understand first-hand the product and technology portfolio, conduct demos of the suite of tools to provide a deep overview to our customers of what Arc is and what we offer Develop ‚ÄòLand and Expand‚Äô strategies to meet the needs of the customer while allowing for future growth of Arc Collaborate with Professional Services, Product, and Engineering to provide custom prototypes for large customers that require additional personalization of the products to help close the deal Be proficient in Salesforce to update leads, opportunities, and real time status of customers Ensure a smooth transition from sales to Account management and PS after we sign a new customer Work with legal as a partner, mitigating risk while working to meet the needs of the customer Provide at every interaction with our customers and potential customers, a professional and customer first focused attitude and approach Mentor and coach account managers, product specialists, and sales team members to bring the best out of each one of them all while keeping the customer at the heart of everything we do  Skills You Have‚Ä¶ 10+ years‚Äô experience in a sales role with experience in E-commerce 2+ years‚Äô experience in a SaaS business Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Product Design/Development, or related field, MBA a plus Proven track record of delivering on quota Welcomes ambiguity, utilizing it to shape strategic thinking Able to communicate effectively with dozens of internal employees and customers, and synthesize their needs to engineering, product, legal, and finance teams. Strong communication skills and ability to thrive in a team environment Have a good understanding of both business needs and technology capabilities‚Äîplus be capable of translating that knowledge in plain terms  The Post strives to provide its readers with high-quality, trustworthy news and information while constantly innovating. That mission is best served by a diverse, multi-generational workforce with varied life experiences and perspectives. All cultures and backgrounds are welcomed.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Smarking is a leading provider of enterprise software and data technology solutions for the massively overlooked $655B global parking industry.  This is an excellent position for a highly capable and successful enterprise sales professional who's ready to take on bigger responsibilities and a leap of faith, to not only continue closing six/seven figure deals, but also lead and build an army of amazing closers to go after a massive and overlooked market, armed with the best tech solution in the industry.  The Head of Sales will report to the CEO directly, and join the management team to provide business leadership company wide.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (in the order of priorities) Hands on work developing and closing enterprise deals (six/seven/eight figure ACV) Recruiting and onboarding successful sales AEs with great fit Provide managerial, operational, and leadership support to enable a sales team of 3-10 Work with the CEO to refine/improve GTM playbook and strategy Empower other parts of the company with market/clientele/industry insights  QUALIFICATIONS (EXPERIENCE) Successful track records closing enterprise deals (five to eight figure) for software solutions hands on Great and consistent quota achievements Successful experience working with a team of people (cross functionally and leading Jr. sales AEs/SDRs) to win complex deals Successful experience selling reasonably complex software solutions Experience in recruiting solid sales AEs (participation at least if not leading) Experience in mentoring, coaching if not leading and managing other sales AEs/SDRs Experience in very early stage tech start ups is a plus Experience in selling to commercial real estate (asset management, property management), municipality, hospitals, airports, universities, parking operators is a plus  QUALIFICATIONS (CHARACTER) Hungry for responsibility, impact, and growth Humble to learn, curious to learn, open-minded to learn Team first Strong sense of ownership Treat others with respect, empathy, and constructive candor  COMPENSATION Competitive OTE and base. 100% coverage of medical, dental, and vision insurances. 401K plan with 3% company hard match. $100 monthly data plan. Unlimited paid time off. Expenses for setting up home-office.

Job Responsibilities Own and deliver the current revenue target in line with planning process. Manage entire customer deal life cycle from prospecting to deal closure stage. Support Client Engagement leaders to identify and execute new sales opportunities within existing accounts. Support pre-sales and marketing team to develop marketing and sales collaterals. Share insights from client interactions with product teams to enhance product capabilities.  Skills & competencies Prior experience of sales in banking and/or lending Degree in business, marketing, or related field will be preferred. Proven ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty.

The Head of Sales is responsible for building, developing and executing our clients sales and account management strategy within the Hospital/Acute sector for launch and commercialization of their dialysis products across North America.  Responsibilities: Build, develop and motivate a high performing capital sales team. Establish the optimal sales structure, create behaviour driving incentive comp plans, and facilitate development of the necessary systems to measure/report sales activity. Strategically develop a long-term geographic territory plan to effectively and efficiently grow within a rapidly expanding market. Build and maintain a strong network of hospitals and hospital related channels of distribution (potential and current), establishing realistic but aggressive plans for growth, and then driving revenue and unit placement achievement. Work closely with related departments (e.g. Operations, Finance) to drive the development of sales and forecast models in line with regular financial planning cycles.  Experience/Qualification:  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in an appropriate business / scientific / engineering subject. Experience in capital sales and commercialization leadership in the medical device products industry - ideally in renal care/dialysis, home therapies and/or new therapy/market development a plus Track-record selling capital equipment into the hospital sector. Ideally will have existing relationships within hospital accounts and integrated delivery networks (IDN's).

description: Elanders Group is a global strategic partner that offers integrated solutions in the areas of supply chain management, print & packaging, and e-commerce to customers worldwide. As a member of the Elanders Group, Midland Information Resources (dba Elanders Americas), is something different for each of our clients. To some, we are their global supply chain managers, to others we are print & packaging specialists, and to the rest, we are e-commerce experts.  Elanders Americas currently has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated team member to join our Business Development team as a Director, Business Development. Responsibilities for this position include establishing and maintaining profitable relationships with customers, actively prospecting for new accounts, and maximizing sales potential with existing customers. This position will develop and execute a strategic plan with a heavy emphasis on generating new business and creating sustainable repeat business. The ability and desire to prospect, generate leads, identify opportunities, and successfully close business, is essential to this role.  For this role, a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Sales or related field is preferred; minimum five years‚Äô sales experience is required. Candidates must be solutions-oriented, comfortable engaging at the C-Level, and have a proven sales record. Candidates must bring digital print industry knowledge, a strong contact base, and experience working with large industrial clients; software background a plus.

Welcome to the Holiday Inn Chicago Matteson Conference Center located in Matteson, IL; a southwest suburb of Chicago and is in the heart of the four-way intersection of I-57 and Rte 30. We offer a convenient location with easy access to I-80, I-294 and I-90/94. Comfortable with a new contemporary look, the hotel offers 202 guestrooms. The Holiday Inn Chicago Matteson Conference Center provides you with a home away from home. Escape to our exquisite oasis area where the indoor pool, and fitness center awaits you. Bar Louie Restaurant offers selections for breakfast, lunch, dinner and room service featuring menu options for everyone.  The Holiday Inn Matteson Hotel and Conference Center is currently hiring a Director of Sales. This is a selling DOS position.  The Director of Sales will be an intricate part of the management team, leading a sales team to new levels through team work, coaching, creativity and leadership. This is your chance to take your career to the next level. You will be rewarded with unlimited growth opportunities, excellent compensation package, and the chance to work with a leader in the industry.  The ideal candidate should have previous Director of Sales experience in a full service or select service property. A proven track record of directing and motivating a sales team to achieve and exceed goals. The Director of Sales will be responsible for directing the overall sales efforts of the hotel as well as manage and develop the sales staff. Other responsibilities include new business development, account management, preparation and management of a Sales & Marketing Budget, and Revenue Management.  Requirements  2 or more years of DOS experience, may consider a strong Senior Sales Manager.  (ref. 38744)

description: VP, Sales Vice President, Sales will play a critical role in driving the continued growth of HealthEC‚Äôs Population Health Management Solution. The primary duties and responsibilities of the VP, Sales are to execute and drive all aspects of sales activities in commercial and or public sector, ensuring that annual sales targets and product gross margins are achieved or exceeded. The focus is on developing relationships and sales with new clients. Additional responsibilities include securing new product sales with existing clients. This individual will be expected to have strong relationships and to drive direct sales with C-Suite and Senior Executives within Finance, Quality, Risk Adjustment, and/or Commercial healthcare departments. They will participate as a leader in the development of sales strategy, pipeline development and in the identification of business opportunities. In coordination with colleagues, they will manage sales pipeline, market research / feedback and product promotion. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success, be highly driven and possess the following key competencies: Drive for Results/Entrepreneurial Orientation: The ability to focus on the desired result and can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results. Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future-oriented; can articulate a credible vision ; can create competitive breakthrough strategies and plans. Business Acumen and Depth of Client Awareness: Knows how our clients‚Äô businesses work; knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practices, trends and information affecting their organizations; knows our competition; is aware how strategies and tactics work in our marketplace. Communication skills/Influencing Others: is highly effective and persuasive in a variety of formal presentation settings; communicates effectively both inside and outside the organization (verbal and written); presents messages so that they have the desired effect. Negotiating: Can negotiate skillfully in tough situations with both internal and external groups; can win concessions without damaging relationships; can be both direct and forceful as well as diplomatic; gains trust quickly; has a good sense of timing Responsibilities Develop and execute short and long-term sales strategies to achieve outstanding business results Lead and manage sales cycle from initial contact to agreement execution Develop and maintain an active pipeline of prospects and generate pipeline reports periodically to effectively communicate status Establish contact with key prospects and cultivate prospects through the sales cycle Partner effectively with functional business owners, business development team and general counsel to effectively negotiate contracts and transition accounts to account management Nurture key client relationships looking for an opportunity to cross-sell or expand sales organically Deliver on sales goals on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis Collaborate with the proposal management team, the marketing team, finance, and the Customer Account Mangers to develop clearly defined and succinct market strategies and provide guidance for optimized delivery methodology and functionality to existing and potential customers. Qualifications BA/BS required; Master‚Äôs level degree preferred Minimum of 7 - 9 years successful experience in health care sales, 3+ years of experience selling to Commercial or Public Sector healthcare market. Strong understanding of Population Health Management and VBC landscape Ability to work with Sales and Marketing tools (salesforce, hubspots etcc) Ability to building proposals and sow‚Äôs as required Strong influencing, interpersonal and collaboration skills Proven ability to proactively manage multiple priorities Demonstrated initiative, resourcefulness, and agility Ability and willingness to travel 50%.

Lasso is looking for curious, passionate and highly driven individuals to join our growing sales team. At Lasso, our people are our greatest asset and we're committed to creating an environment where all of our employees can thrive doing what they love. The Lasso Sales Director will work directly with the CRO and be responsible for driving the adoption of Lasso‚Äôs omni-channel healthcare marketing platform by building relationships with key decision makers at both healthcare/pharma media agencies as well as the brands themselves. If you are ambitious, a true team player and someone who is ready to hit the ground running on day one, we want to speak with you.  About Lasso Lasso is the first and only omni-channel platform for healthcare marketing and analytics, powering some of the largest pharmaceutical brands and media agencies in the US. Recently named Xandr's strategic partner for pharma and healthcare marketing, Lasso provides media planning, buying, and analytics teams with every tool they need to do their job, and do it well. By simplifying workflows that used to take days into seconds, integrating functionality that used to require multiple vendors into one, and providing faster and deeper insights than anyone else in the industry, we are helping healthcare marketers cut their costs, move faster and drive measurable results ‚Äì all within a single platform.  About the Team The Lasso Sales Team is a diverse group of problem solvers with boundless technical curiosity. Together, we build trusted client partnerships that produce mutual wins through collaboration, empathy, and a readiness to challenge the status quo. stakeholders Drive leads from qualification to close in a rapidly growing and competitive market Share motivating sales presentations and demos, and be able to compellingly explain Lasso‚Äôs unique platform capabilities and overall value proposition Grow and develop our sales team with inventive strategies, thought leadership, and collaborative staff development Identify opportunities for product development in anticipation of new client needs Become an expert on industry use cases and technical needs, and be able to speak to Lasso as a market solution Communicate buying strategies, testing and outcomes, and new opportunities through strong ‚Äústorytelling‚Äù and data-driven analysis Leverage your expertise to improve best practice documentation and client facing articles Escalate client feedback to product and engineering teams to ensure our clients are truly heard  Must Have Deep understanding of the digital media buying ecosystem (programmatic, social, email, etc) Proven track record of success in platform sales and team management Proficiency in breaking down complex technical problems into business solutions Strong presentation and networking skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proven ability to work with and influence cross-functional teams Passion for working in a space that sits at the intersection of healthcare and technology  Bonus Points For Knowledge of agency media planning process, including how programmatic fits alongside social, email and TV Knowledge of paid search and other emerging media channels Familiarity with ad serving platforms (Google Ad Manager, Sizmek, etc.) Bachelor‚Äôs degree  Benefits Competitive compensation package Unlimited vacation 100% covered premiums on comprehensive health/dental/vision plans Company sponsored learning and development 401k enrollment  We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunities employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. description: Stop settling for the good and go for the great!  About The Role  CoachHub is striving for a talented and entrepreneurial individual who helps building our Sales Development function and guiding it to success in addition to remaining hands-on in the role. The Sales Development Manager will be responsible for enabling other Sales Development Representatives for the Northeast US team to be successful in their roles by leading by example. The Sales Development Manager will be the team lead of the other SDRs on the team. You will be reporting directly to our VP Sales Development and to the CEO, Yannis (check them out at LinkedIn here and here)  Tasks And Responsibilities Build and steer CoachHub‚Äôs SDR activities of the Northeast US market, including planning, hiring, coaching and performance management Create an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture Set clear team goals Manage the performance of the Sales Development Representatives and delivery on KPIs Discover training needs and provide coaching and support for career development Build a sales development framework that follows CoachHub‚Äôs strategic direction Keep up with industry trends and best practices, including utilization of new technology and web resources Check Out Our Presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_SDR  Your profile You have gained profound experience in Sales Development, Inside Sales or Sales in the Enterprise Software space, preferably in SaaS, for at least 5 years You are experienced in leading, training and growing your team for at least 2 years You have a very good understanding of the Northeast US market and experience in SaaS You are able to work in a complex, changing environment and to interact with multiple stakeholders You provide great communication skills (positive and energetic, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills, team-player, working with other SDRs and field reps, Sales Management, external lead-gen agencies and marketing among others) What we offer Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular growth conversations with your supervisor Growth: An opportunity to join a fast growing and agile company The people: You will join an international team of driven and supportive people on a mission Impact: You have a direct impact on people's lives and make a true difference Feel welcome: First class company welcome week that will get you settled in, in no time Experience a strong focus on professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance Further ancillary insurances like life and short- & long term disability Unlimited paid time off (PTO) with a fair use policy Paid CoachHub4Good days to give back 401(k) plan including a CoachHub employer-paid add-on A flexible spending account A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‚Äòhelp organisations to unleash their people‚Äôs full potential‚Äô attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‚ÄòCoachHubbers‚Äô hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

description: WE BUILD THE BRANDS OF TOMORROW.  PURPOSE DRIVEN, CREATIVELY LEAD, COMMUNITY INSPIRED.  INDEPENDENT AND ENTREPRENEURIAL AT HEART.  Tomorrow support our brand partners through digitally-enhanced b2b and omnichannel b2c. Our brand partners are across four different levels  TOMORROW ORIGINALS  brands founded by creative leaders who are driven by intent or clear causes. Tomorrow invests directly in the ip of these brands: a-cold-wall*, athletics footwear, charles jeffrey loverboy, colville, coperni  TOMORROW NEXT  brands who we have identified as being the emerging players who are defining the markets of the future  TOMORROW PROJECTS  cutting edge collaborations developed to reinvigorate established brands  GOODS & SERVICES  intent-driven brands for broader markets  We are looking for a Sales Director to develop and implement a USA growth strategy through local leadership and management for an exciting portfolio of Tomorrow‚Äôs menswear/unisex brands  Requirements We are looking for someone with proven success in building luxury streetwear and designer menswear brands across physical and digital wholesale channels in the US and Canada. You will have a strong network and relationships with independent/specialty, Department Stores, and online players across the territory at management level This is a senior level role and will be accountable for developing and executing a 3-5 year business plan, commercial and merchandising strategy in collaboration with the brand commercial leads and Tomorrow‚Äôs product and merchandising leads. This person will also contribute to the individual brand‚Äôs marketing & communication strategies for the Territory and work closely with the relevant local (or international) PR & communication partners in this endeavour.
