description: Position Title Director of Business Development, North America   Position Description Under the supervision and direction of the Managing Director, help shape the Company‚Äôs sales strategies and approach, and scale revenue to the next level across North America. Responsible for architecting a sales strategy and open and willing to sell into new markets, strategize next steps, negotiate deals and help beat the competition in head to head opportunities.   Core Duties & Responsibilities Sales Strategy & Development Own all plans and strategies for developing and growing the business and achieving the Company‚Äôs Revenue and sales goals Assist in the development of the sales plan and preparing sales forecasts for the Executive team and upper Management, for use in organizational planning, financial forecasting, budget setting and strategic planning Headline pitch documents when required to increase winning potential Identify key areas for improvement in the sales process  Travel & Meetings Travel to locations where sales opportunities are present across North America.- when travel resumes Attend key meetings including Screenings, Lunches, Events with members of the team both internal and external Attend industry and networking events to generate new business leads. Act as a spokesperson for the Company at sales events and gatherings both internal and external Establish, maintain and foster relationships/partnerships  with key customers both externally and internally Lead weekly Sales meetings with other members of the business.  Sales Representation & Team Collaboration Maintain and manage relationships with existing and future Sales Representatives Set activity and revenue targets for members of the team involved in Sales, including Sales Reps and producers Work collaboratively with: Management, EP‚Äôs and PR company on press strategy and subsequent releases EP‚Äôs to develop, grow and execute specific sales strategies targeted towards each different territory and market  Production team and EP‚Äôs on annual Awards strategy and submissions Production team and Sales Representatives to develop, maintain and distribute reels as part of Company-wide sales outreach The Social media team to strategize our marketing approach across various platforms and assist in the development and implementation of a social media strategy  Recruitment, Development & Training Recruit, interview, and identify appropriate candidates to fill open sales and business development positions Provide continuous training, development and mentorship to all members of the Sales team and all other team members involved in Sale  Skills & Requirements  Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills- inspire with confidence  Strong knowledge of the advertising industry and market  Established contacts and strong relationships with Music Talent, Production, Clients within the regional markets  Ability to inspire team members in achieving sales targets and goals Excellent multitasking ability and organizational skills Exceptional time management and verbal and written communication skills Business and marketing mindset Commitment to working efficiently and accurately

About Trademo  Trademo is focused on solving the problem of trust and information asymmetry in Global Trade. Trademo‚Äôs first product - Trademo Intel, is a trade data intelligence platform for global trade participants like Buyers, Suppliers, Global Logistics companies and Trade finance institutions etc. The trade data intelligence platform is powered by a global supply chain knowledge graph. The platform helps businesses save time and cost for several use cases like identifying new suppliers/buyers, track competition, understand global product trends and research on other companies etc. Trademo has its offices in the United States and India.  Trademo has been founded by Shalabh Singhal who is a third-time tech entrepreneur. Shalabh is an Alumni of Goldman Sachs, IIT BHU, CFA Institute USA and Stanford GSB SEED.  Role Director of Sales  Website www.trademo.com  Location Remote - United States  What you will be doing here: Lead the sales team to help them achieve their quarterly and annual quotas Drive customer reference and continuous improvement of customer advocacy measures Build a robust team and retain good talent, encourage good sales work culture Oversight of annual sales plans, strategies and sales teams Conducting webinars and other events for the target audience Forecast future sales and plan sales forecasts to adapt to market changes Contribute to the development of industry-leading processes and best practices for delivering Customer Success Strategize sales and market inputs in the product roadmap of the company to gain market share Great communication terms with the customers Mentor the team members in developing and implementing sales strategies for creation of new sales channel  Technical Skills Required: 8+ years of SaaS sales experience with 6+ years of team management experience Experience in working for the SaaS, PaaS or Cloud companies Prior experience in Global Trade/Supply Chains/Trade Data Intelligence/ Market Intelligence would be preferred Leadership profile that unifies, influences, and inspires sales and customer success teams to meet the changing needs of customers Experience in driving sales growth and strategy, preferably in a technology/product (SaaS) industry Experience running engaging webinars and seminars Excellent interpersonal skills to strike a connect with diverse people across the globe Entrepreneurial, self-directed with a passion to succeed Exceptional communication, presentation, problem-solving, and collaboration skills Preferably, metrics and data-driven  Soft Skills Required: Experience in managing and working with a distributed set of team members. A hard-working, humble disposition. Desire to make a strong impact on the lives of millions through their work. Capacity to communicate well with stakeholders as well as team members A quick thinker who can adapt to a fast-paced startup environment and work with minimum supervision. Ability to get the job done Strong decision-making skills.
industries: Computer Software, Logistics and Supply Chain, and International Trade and Development

description: LivePerson is the global leader in conversational commerce solutions and we aim to make life easier by transforming how people communicate with brands. Our 18,000 customers, including leading brands like Citibank, HSBC, Orange, Virgin Atlantic, RBS and Liberty Global, use our conversational commerce solutions to orchestrate humans and AI, at scale, and create a convenient, deeply personal relationship ‚Äî a conversational relationship ‚Äî with their millions of consumers.  Over the next three years, our goal is to transform the 268 billion analogue phone calls between a brand and its consumers to digital on the LiveEngage platform. By doing this, we enable consumers to get back time and experience a more connected relationship with the brand in which sales, service, marketing, branches, stores, and contact centre‚Äôs become a unified experience.  In This Role You Will Identify and hire the best talent to create a diverse team of Enterprise and Mid Market field sales professionals. Continuously mentor, coaching your team; leading by example to enable them to become high performers and overachievers. Your success is their success and you are all about recognising that. Be responsible for the sales strategy of your team across the region you cover and will be able to leverage your creativity and entrepreneurial mindset to cement the long-term success of your team. Utilise your attention to detail and data to ensure the operational excellence, forecasting and pipeline management of your team. Formulate a cohesive partner strategy, working closely with our channel; driving best in class efficiency, effectiveness and productivity. Be involved in large opportunities and represent LivePerson at customer meetings to further support your sales team when required; as well as leveraging your peers, other business areas to support large opportunities when needed. Build and develop Executive level relationships with our customers, to be the Senior Executive face of the business Your Qualifications Are You‚Äôre a recruiter! We are company builders and in this role, you‚Äôll be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring on board to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world. A true team player ‚Äì You‚Äôre a supportive leader, and nurturer of talent. You understand the importance of fostering a collaborative team environment in order to deliver the best results. Energy and Creativity ‚Äì Energy and enthusiasm are your trademarks. You think out-of-the-box and impress people with your interesting angles and quality work. You‚Äôre not afraid to challenge in order to improve efficiency and success Experienced ‚Äì You have a proven track record in managing, building, and developing teams of experienced enterprise and Mid Market sales professionals, within a matrixed, software sales organisation. You know what good looks like. You have a track record in consistently exceeding your quotas and still have that ‚Äòhunter‚Äô mentality. You have a strong background in selling solutions across large enterprise and Mid market customers. Excellent Communicator ‚Äì You know what to say and, more importantly, how to say it. Your inter-personal skills also make you an excellent networker, and you‚Äôre able to use this to your advantage to bring the right people together to get things done. Passion and Conviction - You can inspire passion in others. You‚Äôre a true motivator Customer Focused - You deliver customer service like you expect to receive it; with excellence. Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here  LivePerson was named to FastCompany‚Äôs World‚Äôs most innovative companies of 2020 list for the Artificial Intelligence category. We offer amazing colleagues along with opportunities to push your own limits to grow. We embrace invention and experimentation. You‚Äôll have great benefits plus flexible time off and free lunch on fridays. Most importantly, you‚Äôll have an ability to make an impact at work and at brands across the globe as we build the future with trusted Conversational AI together.  At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to do their best work and be their authentic selves. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world‚Äôs most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified‚Äôs machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  Riskified‚Äôs Growth team plays a key role in defining and executing the company‚Äôs expansion strategy. We are looking for an enthusiastic, highly intelligent individual to join our team as a Director of Strategic Accounts: a role that combines sales, consulting, strategic thinking, and business analysis.  In this position, you will take on leads of potential strategic clients, develop relationships with the largest 50 eComm merchants in the US and Canada, identify their unique needs and challenges, and drive adoption of Riskified‚Äôs solution. You will collaborate with other teams at Riskified to ensure a seamless on-boarding process, and use insights from client feedback to improve our service and offering.  What You'll Be Doing Work closely with potential clients, demonstrating a consultative approach to directly drive Riskified‚Äôs revenue growth Receive leads from, and work together with our BD Team to manage sales pipeline and follow through with presentations, negotiations, and contracts Provide strategic analysis and critical thinking as we plan long-term expansion Represent Riskified at industry events and sales meetings with potential clients around the world Develop a deep understanding of the payments industry and build relationships with key players in the space Create and articulate compelling value propositions around the Riskified solution Qualifications 8+ years of B2B enterprise closing experience managing end-to-end sales cycle with experience with B2B enterprise sales, tech companies, and/or a hyper-growth B2B SaaS startup (payments and eCommerce enablement industry) Experience in a role that requires rigorous business analytics and/or strategic thought (management consulting, finance, business analysis, etc.) is a plus Naturally analytical with a strong passion for persuasion Someone who loves to quantify the qualitative Superb written and verbal communication skills as well as interpersonal skills Problem-solver, resourceful, someone who thrives off of autonomy Ability to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Ability to work in a fast-paced sales environment with minimum supervision Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for other than practical training Life at Riskified  We are a fast-growing and dynamic tech company with 650+ team members globally. We value collaboration and innovative thinking. We‚Äôre looking for bright, driven, and passionate people to grow with us.  COVID-19 Update Our NYC team is currently working remotely. If anyone prefers to work in our office, we‚Äôre happy to offer an option to do so safely. When the situation improves, we‚Äôre looking forward to adapting a hybrid of remote and in-office work for all our team members. We‚Äôre growing at a rapid rate and have transitioned all our interviews to Zoom. Some Of Our NYC Benefits & Perks Fully-covered medical, dental, and vision insurance from your first day Equity for all employees, 401(k) + matching, commuter benefits Catered lunch, fully-stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, birthday celebrations Yoga, pilates, soccer league, wellness classes Wide-ranging opportunities to volunteer and make an impact in local communities Commitment to your professional development with global onboarding, sales bootcamp, skills-based courses, full access to Udemy, lunch & learns Awesome Riskified gifts and swag! In The News  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  Fortune Magazine: 25 Best Workplaces in New York  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Built In NYC: 100 Best Workplaces  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Riskified is deeply committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Our client is looking for a driven and passionate individual with a background in selling a technology platform and managing/building a team of A-players to help their sales team scale.   You will be working with a highly motivated, diverse, and thoughtful group as we rapidly scale to disrupt an industry.  Responsibilities:  Establish all necessary sales material to give our sales team the tools they need to succeed Manage complex negotiations with large corporate partners and close large deals Train and develop staff to be effective in all stages of the sales funnel Manage the KPIs of the sales team via the CRM and provide transparency to the executive team  Requirements:  5-10 years of SaaS sales experience with a significant track record of success 3+ years of experience running sales, with at least 2 years at a single company A thorough understanding of modern sales processes and high-velocity sales Engagement with C-level executives in both partners and customers alike
industries: Internet and Computer Software

description: OneSpace is a team of passionate individuals all working toward the same goal: to help consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies improve their performance on the world‚Äôs largest online retailers. To accomplish this goal, our expert team members work side by side with our customers to deliver full-service digital shelf management solutions that put their products front and center in the digital world. Using our sophisticated and Ô¨Çexible platform, our team improves and optimizes their e-commerce product content at unrivaled speed and scale.  Our clients include the world‚Äôs leading CPG brands and retailers. We have helped them increase their discoverability and conversions online, while creating streamlined content production processes that improve their speed to market.  Account Director  The Account Director plays a lead role in new business sales, account growth, account retention and renewal strategy. The Account Director is responsible for identifying opportunities within new and existing accounts, building relationships across client organizations and driving year over year revenue growth in collaboration with their assigned account team. This role is both strategic and hands on and requires a consultative selling approach and ability to collaborate with internal teams to produce solutions and results that wow our clients.  In this role you will: Have final responsibility for creation and execution of successful new client pitches and deal strategy Lead the development and execution of annual new business and renewal goals Contribute effectively in a matrixed leadership structure ‚Äì providing client-related leadership while working closely with the formal departmental structure Work closely with executive, marketing and assigned account team to engage new accounts and win new business Be responsible for YOY account retention and revenue growth and establish goals and strategy for each account Work in partnership with the Account Manager to plan and execute account strategy and nurture and maintain a collaborative environment within the account team and with executive and departmental leadership. Develop and maintain comprehensive knowledge of clients‚Äô businesses, industry, brands, landscape and objectives to uncover business needs and objectives and craft appropriate strategies to achieve client goals Establish and nurture client relationships, building trust, credibility and client referrals  Requirements  To win in this role you need: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or related; MBA a plus At least five (and preferably ten) years of experience in sales, account management, leadership and business development with a solid understanding of business strategy and success working at the executive level At least five years of experience successfully growing and managing teams Previous success in cold-calling and consultative selling; proven ability to close deals Extensive experience and a strong network in the CPG space Demonstrated track record of client relationship development and extraordinary customer service Demonstrated experience in relationship management, engagement or account management with close involvement in delivery of work and growing service offering within an account Advanced negotiation, communication, writing, presentation and organizational skills The ability to voice your ideas while respecting those of others A passion for technology and innovation Curiosity ‚Äì wants to know the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the ‚Äúwhat‚Äù To be a self-starter who works collaboratively in a team environment and enjoys a fast-paced environment A sense of humor The ability to focus when under pressure, treat clients and team mates with respect and focus on facts, not emotions A solid balance between strategic thinking and tactical accomplishment To be competitive and persistent  Benefits  Why OneSpace? Excellent benefits with significant portion of premiums paid by the company Fully stocked snacks, beverages and meal prep Positive, friendly, team focused culture 15 paid holidays PTO starting at 12 days per year Onsite fitness equipment Pet-friendly office with free parking, free haircuts, free lunch Fridays and more!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description Summary  In your role as the Strategic Development Leader, X-ray, you will be responsible for driving growth in our largest and most strategic accounts, such as GPO partnerships, government accounts, national accounts and channel partners.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities    Originating sales by positioning GE technology and identifying the best technical and commercial solution. Promote the business value proposition of GE technology. Works in close cooperation with regional sales, account sales and commercial proposal staff. Primary technical role involved in DTI (demand to inquiry): aim at increasing market penetration through technical support during pre-ITO. Developing specialized knowledge of latest commercial developments in own area and communication skills to influence others. Has working knowledge of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Uses judgment to make decisions or solve moderately complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Takes new perspective on existing solutions. Uses technical experience and expertise for data analysis to support recommendations. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.  Required Qualifications    Master's degree from an accredited university or college OR High school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience. Must be able to travel up to 75% of the time.  Desired Characteristics    Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems. Ability to lead programs / projects. Established project management skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: About Sundae  Sundae‚Äôs mission is to help homeowners get the best outcome when it‚Äôs time to sell a house that needs some love. For too long, the process for selling outdated and damaged houses has been terrible for sellers. Local property investors capitalize on homeowner distress to purchase houses cheap and resell them for huge profits.  Sundae is putting more of those profits back in the hands of the homeowner. We‚Äôve developed a model to predict when sellers will need our help, and a best-in-class sales and marketing team to reach them and a trusted brand that allows us to grow even faster through word of mouth and referrals. With scale and efficiency we‚Äôre able to redistribute economic value to sellers in the form of the most competitive price so that Sundae can become the largest buyer of homes that need love in the United States.  We are a Tier 1 Venture Capital backed company with product-market fit, scaling revenue, and a massive addressable market opportunity. Our team is composed of seasoned leaders from real estate and marketplace businesses and with significant high-growth company experience (Airbnb, Dropbox, Chime, LendingHome).  Joining Sundae means being part of the team that‚Äôs bringing compassion and transparency to the business of helping homeowners sell in their time of need. If you‚Äôre driven by making a positive impact in people‚Äôs lives and want to support our mission, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.  About the Job  We are looking for a talented, passionate leader to build the foundation of our new Sales Enablement team. Our customer-facing sales teams are the fastest growing in the company. They interface with home sellers and home buyers alike. They hold regional inside sales roles and local outside sales roles. We have a lot of moving pieces! This is an opportunity to develop, improve, and rollout best practices to everyone in the company who helps our customers.  As the Director of Sales Enablement you will be ensuring that all Marketplace Solutions teams have the tools and systems needed to exceed goals and help families. This team obsesses over best practices for every Sales role and documents policies into workflow diagrams, workflow manuals, workplays, and playbooks. Enablement consults with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in each role to inform the standard processes that are followed in all markets.    The department is made up of Enablement Managers who specialize in one of our 5 roles that helps customers through their journey of selling with Sundae. As the Director of Enablement, you‚Äôll hire and train enablement managers and dictate the best practices they use to support their assigned role within the company.    Responsibilities  Maintain Workflow diagrams -Changes and improvements to the workflow itself are owned by the Product team. But the enablement team owns the maintenance of documentation so that all reps know the process inside and out. Maintain Workflow manuals - Document and provide more detail about each stage. Enablement keeps the manual in sync with the diagram as described above after Product makes changes. Enablement also ensures that all workplays are linked in the manual in the correct stage so the team can find the right policies at the right time. Maintain Workplays - Sundae‚Äôs most detailed policy guides on how to perform a discrete task. These range from property valuation philosophies to customer call scripts. .   Create and maintain role and manager playbooks:  Document a rep‚Äôs priorities, walk through the day of a life, examine best parties for staying organized and used by top performers. What are the highest value tasks to do with extra time? Playbooks help new reps turn into top performers in no time. Understand all changes occurring around the organization that have an impact on any Marketplace Solutions role. Create a holistic communication plan in conjunction with the Marketing Enablement Specialist that keeps reps and managers alike in the know. Coordinate with Learning & Development as well if the change is complex enough to warrant new training. As often as possible, act as a proxy for Sales managers in change and initiative management Perform critical manual tasks to set reps up for success with customers when tech solutions aren‚Äôt ready yet. Create & maintain Marketplace Solutions reporting and dashboards in Salesforce Create and own the ongoing process for Sales to review lost customer records and record their notes into Salesforce. This allows Analytics and Sales leadership to review trends and identify areas for improving funnel performance.  Recommend internal tooling improvements to Product that allow reps to reach new levels of productivity and excel in their roles Shadow weekly city and regional meetings to gain insights on customer trends and internal operational patterns Support department leaders with ad-hoc Salesforce report requests and customer funnel data investigations  About You 4 years of experience managing and coaching a sales enablement team 2+ years management experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree  2+ years of Salesforce experience required (could be experience managing teams, power user experience, or admin experience) Preference for Real Estate industry experience.  Preference for Sales enablement support with reps in outside sales positions (our city-based team members will see 15+ customers in person per week) Experience across the customer lifecycle with pre-sales, sales, and customer success teams Strong problem solving, communication, negotiation, and analytical skills Salesforce experience preferred   Compensation & Benefits   Why Sundae?  Opportunity to revolutionize the real-estate industry with a mission to help those in need  Scale with a rapidly growing organization, with tons of opportunity for growth Work with a team of fun and motivated individuals in a highly collaborative culture  Compensation & Benefits   Competitive cash salary Stock option package  Extremely competitive health benefits - 100% medical, dental, vision coverage Retirement benefits including pre- and post- tax options Unlimited PTO Work Remotely with home office allowance and cell and internet stipend  We here at Sundae strive to build a workforce comprised of individuals with diverse backgrounds, abilities, minds, and identities that will help us to grow, not only as a company, but also as individuals. Sundae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Where permitted by applicable law, employees must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire. Reasonable accommodations will be considered. Are you able to comply with Sundae's COVID vaccination policy?

description: Description  We are looking for a Director, Sales to join our team. Our Sales team is responsible for selling an innovative and bundled fertility benefit solution to self-insured employers. In this role, you will act as the dedicated subject matter expert to increase awareness around the need for fertility benefits coverage and to help them understand the unique advantages of partnering with Progyny. Your role will be to identify, pursue and close business with employers through a consultative approach with the HR/executive team as well as with their consultants.  What You'll Do... Drive growth of our bundled fertility product Educate external stakeholders about the need for fertility benefit coverage & Progyny‚Äôs benefit offering Partner directly with clients to enhance current health care product offering within their organizations. Identify, prospect and build relationships with benefits executives and healthcare consultants (please note role includes cold calling) Present the financial value of our solutions to HR benefits team and executives Develop & manage sales activity and pipeline in to meet revenue targets and company goals Understand competitive landscape and be able to position benefit offering to drive new business About You... 8-10 years of experience selling benefits into mid/large size groups in a self-insured marketplace Demonstrated experience working for a health plan, national medical carrier, or vendor providing ancillary benefits to self-insured employers. Proven ability and passion to meet and exceed sales goals. Bachelors degree in business, communication, marketing or related field preferred Demonstrated passion and motivation to sell an innovative fertility and drive new business. Develop and maintain strong relationships with prospective clients Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey the Progyny messaging in both in person and via remote sales capacity. The ability to develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization About Us...  Progyny‚ÄØis a leading fertility benefits management company in the US.‚ÄØWe are redefining fertility and family building benefits, proving that a comprehensive and inclusive fertility solution can simultaneously benefit employers, patients, and physicians.‚ÄØOur benefits solution empowers patients with education and guidance from a dedicated Patient Care Advocate (PCA), provides access to a premier network of fertility specialists using the latest science and technologies, reduces healthcare costs for the nation‚Äôs leading employers, and drives optimal clinical outcomes. We envision a world where anyone who wants to have a child can do so.  Our mission is to‚ÄØmake any member‚Äôs dream of parenthood come true through a healthy, timely,‚ÄØand supported fertility and family building journey. Come join a company‚ÄØthat‚Äôs‚ÄØbeen recognized by Modern Healthcare as one of the Best Places to Work in Healthcare.  Our Perks Family friendly benefits: Paid maternity and paternity Fertility benefits (including egg freezing and IVF) Emergency childcare program Parent‚Äôs group Health, dental, vision and life insurance options for employees and family Paid vacation and summer flex time Company equity Bonus program 401K Match Monday breakfasts/ Friday lunches/ healthy snacks Company social events Sit/ stand desks Progyny is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

description: KidPass, a BEGiN Company, is the leading marketplace for parents to discover and book amazing kids activities including in-person classes, online classes, and tutoring. We work with thousands of teachers and kids activity providers, including Gymboree, Kidville, Super Soccer Stars, Music Together, YMCA, JCC, the Museum of Modern Art, and many more! Backed by leading tech investors, KidPass has rapidly grown to become the largest kids activities marketplace.  As an Educational Sales Account Executive at KidPass, you'll be at the front lines of growing KidPass, speaking to parents and helping them find tutoring and activity programs that best match their needs. Our Sales Team is highly motivated, driven, positive, and skilled to help parents and students with their educational goals. The ideal candidate will have a background in and passion for education that they can apply to help drive sales and support parents seeking solutions. Candidates should have a track record of success, and an entrepreneurial approach that allows them to thrive in a dynamic startup environment.  The Sales Account Executive position is a key role in helping parents and their children get the educational support that they need. Role will report into our New York office or may be remote in select US locations*.  You Will: Lead assessment calls with prospective customers to identify learning goals for their children Consulting new customers on education packages that meet their learning goals including tutoring packages, online classes, in-person activities, and other programs offered by KidPass and our partners Ownership of sales process for prospective customers including consultation, closing sales, set up for customer success, and follow-up consultations and support Ensure customers have all of the information at setup and following up to ensure their success with KidPass Work closely with account management and operations team to ensure seamless communication both internally and externally with parents, partners, and tutors Compensation based on experience with benefits. You should be performance driven, and comfortable working with a commission structure Document inbound and outbound inquiries, follow-ups, and other client activity Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales targets  Must Haves: Excellent verbal and written communication skills - this is a role that requires high-volume calling to speak with parents looking for tutoring and various educational programs Motivated, can-do attitude and ability to get things done while working independently and as part of a team Love talking to people and building relationships Passion for education and helping children Ability to effectively manage a book of customer accounts Ability to think on your feet and thrive in a fast-paced, enterprising environment Skillfully manages multiple responsibilities You must have either prior background in education/teaching OR sales experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree (preferred)  We like people who: Are open to suggestions, collaborative, and thrive in team environments Love and are willing to learn new technologies and styles Are scrappy, entrepreneurial with the ability to turnaround high-quality projects quickly without depending on a large team  What you‚Äôll get: HOMER offers competitive compensation including equity and full benefits. Smart, passionate, and engaged co-workers. Excellent top-tier Medical/Dental/Vision benefits 401k with 4% company match The chance to have a big impact, quickly The rare opportunity to make a dent in the universe. We‚Äôre bringing a love of reading and learning to children globally!  *Remote Locations: AL, CA, CT, FL, GA, ID, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NE, NY, OR, PA, TN, TX, WA, WY. This role is not eligible for CO state.  HOMER is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  At HOMER, we are committed to building a diverse team of talented people who are passionate about creating educational content kids love. We believe in fostering a culture where productivity can flourish, one that is empathetic, respectful, and inclusive. At HOMER, we know that diversity, equity, and inclusion aren‚Äôt just an idea, a one-time initiative, or phrases to throw into a job post: they‚Äôre a daily practice and an ongoing conversation. We survey our team about inclusivity, run trainings on DEI topics, and have a committee to ensure we are all continuing to learn and grow.

description: Let‚Äôs Fix Healthcare. At CareEvolution, the privilege of solving this complex challenge is why we come to work. We believe that patients should own and control their health information and that data should be transformed to educate patients, enable behavior change, and as actionable clinical decision support for clinicians. We provide patient engagement, digital clinical research, and digital therapeutic solutions for research institutions, providers, health plans, and communities in all 50 states and beyond. We are focused and execute quickly, but are a very family-friendly organization and have fun in the trenches for a worthy cause: patient lives! Around two-thirds of CareEvolution teammates are remote, and we provide constant, active teleconference for all our remote employees (US residents only). Many remote teammates unite at least quarterly in Ann Arbor at our company hackathons, holiday party, and summer outing. Our benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, and flexible paid time off.  Patient Engagement Team   CareEvolution is an industry leader in the digital patient engagement space. The team is growing and looking for enthusiastic self-starters and team players to further build out our patient engagement platform and team. The patient engagement team delivers digital clinical research, digital therapeutic and telehealth solutions to our clients, allowing clients to create unprecedented patient data sets and interventions to advance clinical research and preventative care. We work with the world‚Äôs brightest and most prestigious clinical research universities, providers, payors, and wearable/device manufacturers across the globe, including partnering with the NIH and Scripps research institute on the ‚ÄúAll of Us‚Äù research study, the University of Michigan and Massachusetts General Hospital, and market leading device manufacturers. Reach out today to begin your fulfilling journey with an industry leader in this important and rapidly accelerating digital patient engagement space. Together, let‚Äôs fix healthcare!  If you're a dedicated, ambitious, and communicative self-starter who wants to have a positive impact with patient and are open to learning multiple facets of a health tech business, CareEvolution is an excellent place to grow your career, especially if you are interested in a career in health tech or product management.   Responsibilities for Business Development Team  Define and execute Patient Engagement business development strategy, focusing on the digital clinical research business - responsible for driving patient engagement revenue growth Serve as the main point of contact for potential clients Develop relationships and maintain continuous contact with new and existing customers Work with leadership to develop best practices and strategies, while consistently promoting industry trends Manages sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes Assist in defining KPIs and metrics for the team Once needed, assist in building out of the business development team and team best practices and processes; ramp-up and teach the incoming team Collaborate closely with other team members to ensure alignment and integration of sales and channel strategies, projects and programs for successful implementation and execution Assist in the development and implementation of marketing plans and provide leadership on go to market plans for new products Participates in industry events and conferences, as needed Provide input to constantly improve our products and services to add value for our customers and shareholders Assist in drafting clear Statements of Work  Qualifications for Business Development Team  5+ years successful sales experience in healthcare and / or SaaS products with a proven track record of success securing new business in the small to medium sized business space (B2B prospecting sales experience required) Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required Track record of success in selling to physicians, university procurement divisions, health plans, and providers  Firm understanding and/or ability to quickly become a subject matter expert in the digital clinical research and the newly developing digital wellness / therapeutic space  Detailed understanding of sales processes, sales reporting, sales forecasting, territory planning & management Proven ability to recognize and analyze go to market approaches, marketing programs, joint value propositions, and business cases around strategic partnerships Proven leadership role in driving initiatives, working across organizations, and structuring approaches to new opportunities Must be able to lead and mentor others as part of a team Excellent verbal and written presentation and communication skills Strong organizational skills with ability to handle various tasks, attention to detail Outstanding collaboration skills, with proven ability to work with multiple stakeholders across business lines to accomplish shared goals and manage expectations Cross-functional influence, relationship building, and project management skills toward a broad constituency ranging from customers, channel partners, sales, marketing, and technical management Ability to work with both technical and non-technical customers/peers to research and resolve problems Ability to manage multiple tasks, team members, and schedules

About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  Covering the Nevada market, you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you! description: THIS IS A REMOTE ROLE AND APPLICATIONS FROM ANY US LOCATION WILL BE CONSIDERED.  Voxelmaps is building the world‚Äôs most accurate 4D volumetric model of the earth, combining high-resolution scans using the latest LiDAR and HD imaging sensors, fused with a wide variety of other rich content. The result is a new form of mapping which provides superior levels of accuracy, information, and insight. Voxelmaps has developed a patented technology that divides the planet into a dense matrix of multi-resolution voxels (3D pixel), with each voxel having a permanent location and address. The automated feature extraction is performed on this model using Voxelmaps‚Äô developed AI software tools.  Description  Voxelmps is building a highly-skilled Sales Team to grow our geospatial and analytic products and services business. As a key member of the team, you will use your interpersonal skills to develop relationships to become a trusted advisor to our clients. This position will focus on the Electrical Utilities, Transportation, Local Government, and AEC markets. We are looking for individuals who are comfortable working with cutting edge technology to provide solutions to complex problems encountered by our prospective clients.  KEY RELATIONSHIPS Prospects/Clients Solution Engineers / Technical Sales Team Project Managers Data Collection Team Data Analysts  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop new business with a defined list of Strategic Accounts/Prospects Establish a network with prospect decision-makers in order to develop new business Prospect and develop opportunities to contract/partner with customer/prospects that have a need for geospatial, remote sensing and analytical solutions Clearly articulate the strength and value proposition of Voxelmaps Develop and maintain a healthy pipeline of opportunities for business growth Understand the key business drivers within an organization and identify key business stakeholders Understand the client‚Äôs budgeting and acquisition processes Effectively utilize and leverage the company‚Äôs CRM to manage opportunities and drive the buying process Participate in trade shows, workshops, and seminars (as required) Be resourceful and take initiative to resolve issues Maintain leads and opportunities in CRM (Salesforce)  Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent work experience in GIS, Remote Sensing or a related field 7+ years of quota carrying sales experience in the Electrical Utilities, Transportation, Local Government, or AEC industries selling GIS, Remote Sensing, Field Data Collection Services, or similar products/services 5+ years of Strategic Account sales experience SaaS or DaaS sales and contracting experience Deep connections in the Transportation end user community with access to these contacts. The ability to understand the key business drivers within an organization and identify key business stakeholders and business opportunities Ability to solve complicated problems. Must have strong logic skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships Intermediate to high level of proficiency in Microsoft Office Working knowledge of CRM systems (Pipedrive, Salesforce) Ability to travel domestically up to 35% Job Type: Permanent/Full Time  Salary: Base Salary (DOE), plus commission variable  Location: Remote but must be available to travel to site locations within the USA  Work authorization: United States (Required) EEO Statement:  Voxelmaps is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.  DISCLAIMER: All claims and offers to compensation, rewards, and onboarding procedures are at the sole discretion of Voxelmaps.  Powered by JazzHR  62UDOh1n1p

description: Regional Sales Director  SUMMARY The Regional Sales Director is responsible for the profit/loss of a sales team located in a specific priority market metropolitan area. The Market Leader is focused on building relationships with customers and real-estate influencers, and also mentoring Sales Executives (SEs).  WHO YOU ARE You: Raise the bar by taking the initiative to achieve results and make excellence your goal. Create lifelong fans by making customer experience your top priority. Are authentic and say what you mean, share how you feel, and are your true self. Are a team player and foster a sense of community by recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of our team. Believe it‚Äôs possible and look at challenges optimistically ‚Äì seeing opportunities to bring solutions to the table. Embrace change and recognize the industry and the company is evolving.  WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO Responsible for profit/loss for a market and growing market share Lead, motivate, and develop high performing sales teams in major metropolitan area Recruit, develop, and retain top sales talent Demonstrate strategic leadership and help teams focus on highest value opportunities Accurately forecast sales revenue and delivers business results  Identify strategic accounts by actively networking and building relationships Sell the full suite of Vari¬Æ products including desktop and Full Office products through solution-selling techniques. Additionally, actively discuss ‚Äútract homes‚Äù and VariSpace Collaborate with HQ-based leadership, marketing, and other teams  HOW YOU‚ÄôLL GET THERE 10-15+ years leading sales teams and working in a relevant sales, business development, account management, and/or sales executive role (or equivalent) Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build strong relationships Proven track record of consistently meeting sales quotas and helping teams meet their quotas Ability to empathize and understand the customer needs and pain points Robust negotiation skillset and know-how Strong strategic perspective to establish and guide short-term and long-term sales goals Ability to effectively communicate through all mediums (verbal, listening, written)  COMPANY DESCRIPTION We started by developing the world‚Äôs leading sit-stand desk converter to help a coworker with back pain, but now we‚Äôre so much more than a desk. We are flexible workspace solutions made simple and installed fast.  From a collection of office furniture to workspaces offering space-as-a-service, we provide everything high-growth businesses need to unlock the potential of their workforce. Today, we have over 3 million fans worldwide. We‚Äôve shipped products to more than 120 countries, and our solutions are in 98% of Fortune 500 companies.  We promote a company culture that encourages diversity, creativity, innovation, and inclusion. Vari has become one of the most innovative, forward-thinking companies in the world. We‚Äôre growing quickly, so our company is fast-paced and exciting, but also friendly and supportive. Our employee benefits package includes medical, dental, and 401k, but also profit sharing, education reimbursement, and wellness perks, like an onsite gym.  WHY Vari? We‚Äôre award winners: Work at a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù ‚Äì FORTUNE Magazine Grow with the ‚ÄúNational Entrepreneur of the Year‚Äù ‚Äì EY Be part of the ‚ÄúFastest Growing Company in DFW‚Äù ‚Äì SMU Learn from award-winning leadership ‚Äì Most Admired CEO (Dallas Business Journal), CMO of the Year (American Marketing Association), Outstanding CFO ‚Äì Large Private Company (DCEO)  We want you to be happier and healthier: Your own Active Workspace On-site gym with Peloton cycles and a spa-like locker room Group fitness classes ‚Äì from bootcamps to yoga Meditation and chair massage pods Subsidized healthy food from Fresh Caf√© Outstanding overall total rewards package Wellness program and insurance premium discounts Nicotine-free facility  We value our employees: Community Team that cares Enhanced paternity / maternity programs 401k and profit-sharing plan Paid personal time off Paid volunteer time off Team building events on and off site Mentoring and career development Gourmet coffee bar Education reimbursement Short-term and long-term disability premiums covered at 100% by Vari  **Vari provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

description: Who We Are  The B2B Strategy & Operations team develops the go-to-market strategy and operating model for Wayfair‚Äôs B2B business, Wayfair Professional. We help drive both long-term thinking about what customer experience will maximize profitable growth and shorter-term measures improving operational efficiency. We do this in partnership with a sales organization of over 500 agents delivering a nine-figure annual revenue target. Wayfair Professional helps hundreds of thousands of businesses to create the perfect space for their clients, guests and employees. We serve customers in the Office, Hospitality, Interior Design, Contractor, Property Management and other sectors, with a broad assortment across furniture, fixtures and decor. Wayfair Professional has nearly tripled in size over the past 24 months, and we are seeking to expand and upgrade the strategic capabilities that support our growing sales team.  What You‚Äôll Do  As the Leader of Sales Strategy & Program Management, you will be responsible for making sure the sales experience for Wayfair Professional‚Äôs customers makes them want to shop with us again and again. You‚Äôll do so in partnership with a cross-functional team including Marketing, Sales, Product, and Finance, among others.  You manage the organization that determines how our 3 distinct sales programs should interact with our customers. You‚Äôll identify opportunities to improve our operating model to improve efficiency across our entire sales ecosystem. You‚Äôll lead teams that conduct diagnostic analyses to understand and influence the health of our business. You‚Äôll introduce new initiatives into the Sales organization. You‚Äôll influence the long-term strategy for the B2B business unit. Your output will live in the actions of hundreds of sales professionals and associated teams as part of a nine-figure, rapidly-growing business.  What You‚Äôll Need Experience leading strategy projects (i.e. evaluating a portfolio of options to improve growth and/or profitability within a business unit, ideally in the context of understanding industry-level, macroeconomic trends and business unit financial performance) required. Given the cross-functional and influential nature of the role, a qualified candidate has excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset. Strong attention to detail and program and project management skills, including setting a vision and strategy, creating a multi-faceted, year-long roadmap, establishing communications cadences and methods, leading a team to deliver results against established deadlines, and removing bottlenecks and solving issues as they arise. Demonstrated experience leading teams of direct reports (who in turn have their own teams), as well as influencing cross-functional teams who do not report to the candidate. Performance management skills required. Experience understanding an industry sales cycle (e.g. from business development to opportunity pipeline and sales funnel velocity) preferred,. Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 10+ years of experience required. MBA with coursework in management, economics, finance, etc. or Master‚Äôs in Public Administration with coursework in economics preferred. Previous experience in one of the following roles preferred: technology program management, strategy consulting (ideally with exposure to sales strategy, go-to-market strategy, call center operations, or customer experience strategy); inbound sales strategy; call center / contact center strategy & operations or transformations; customer success strategy & operations; or customer experience strategy.  About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the world‚Äôs largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we‚Äôre reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you‚Äôre looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you‚Äôll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We‚Äôre a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair ‚Äì and world ‚Äì for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Responsibilities:  This position is responsible for achieving the sales and clinical expectations of the assigned geographic region and business segment. Success is realized by building strong customer relationships, hiring and effectively managing direct reports (sales representatives and clinical specialists), executing the defined launch and sales plan and advancing the clinical and commercial success of MicroTransponder's Vivistim¬Æ system for Stroke.  Primary Activities and Responsibilities:  The keys to success will include executing the go-to-market strategy of MicroTransponder's Vivistim¬Æ Paired-VNS Therapy. This position reports to the Vice President of Sales and interacts extensively with other departments within the organization to maximize clinical outcomes and ensure the complete satisfaction of our patients, physicians, and healthcare customers. Help successfully recruit, hire and train Territory Managers and Clinical Specialists prior to full launch of Vivistim¬Æ in the United States. Personally oversee and manage existing implanting and rehabilitation accounts during soft launch of Vivistim¬Æ Therapy. Launch first-to-market Vivistim¬Æ Paired VNS Therapy to Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R/Physiatry), Neurosurgery, and Physical Therapy specialties within hospitals, rehabilitation and ASCs. Develops plans and strategies for developing key new healthcare physician customers and accounts. Minimally achieves and preferably exceeds monthly, quarterly, and annual new account sales and therapy adoption goals. Demonstrates daily accountability toward meeting and preferably exceeding sales objectives. Manages accounts in the assigned geography by preparing account plans for top accounts and proactive strategies for pursuing each new healthcare customer. Exceeds customer expectations and contributes to a high level of customer/patient satisfaction. Provides detailed and accurate sales forecasting by maintaining reporting minimally weekly. Prepares thorough and detailed product presentations for prospect accounts and physicians. Monitors customer, market and competitor activity and provides feedback to company leadership. Works closely with the company's marketing department to establish successful patient/customer adoption at each individual account and referring site. Manages customer relationships and provides leadership in closing strategic opportunities. Leads the regional team in all aspects of sales and clinical planning, execution and accountability. Constant driver of sales excellence and possesses a "sense of urgency" in goal attainment. Demonstrates outstanding product, technical, and clinical expertise. Completes all administrative requirements on time and accurately. Maintains company standards involving ethical and moral character while professionally representing the company.  Travel Requirements: This position requires daily travel within defined geography and may require business travel of up to 75% within defined geography. Occasional attendance of local and national industry meetings, trade shows, and sales meetings is also required.  Minimum Requirements and Qualifications: BA/BS degree (preferably in life sciences, business, nursing, or medical product marketing preferred) Have a minimum of 5 years of documented, successful sales leadership experience with supporting results. Experience selling directly to the specialty (Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R/Physiatry), Neurosurgery, Interventional Pain Management and Physical Therapy) healthcare physician communities.  Preferred Experience: Successfully representing and launching a revolutionary, pioneering, and disruptive technology strongly preferred. Strong PM&R, Neurosurgery, and PT relationships and KOL development experience. Rehabilitation experience especially related to Stroke patient recovery strongly preferred. Previous implantable, programmable neuromodulation experience strongly preferred. Experience and success selling to the C-level of large hospital/clinic or ambulatory surgical centers with C-level relationships throughout the region. Experience selling regional and/or national purchasing organizations (NPO/GPOs), national/regional hospital networks, and individual hospitals/surgery centers. Start-up experience related to accountability, culture and professional opportunity. Solid process orientation demonstrated resource management/allocation experience, and the ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Experience utilizing Salesforce or similar CRM. Intellectual, self-starter and independent thinker, with the aptitude to work autonomously. Robust interpersonal skills, with evidence of teamwork and collaboration. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with customers and patients at all levels. Creative thinker and appropriate risk taker. Ability to influence decision makers in a large and complex environment. Capable of selling new solutions in mature markets. Understands and is able to operate within associated legal and regulatory guidelines. Work well in cross matrix organization.  MicroTransponder, Inc. (www.microtransponder.com) is a privately held medical device development company with a strong neuroscience research focus. An experienced team of scientists and engineers has developed a neurostimulation technology platform to treat neurological conditions, including post-stroke motor rehabilitation and tinnitus.

description: Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  Snapchat is looking for a passionate Head of Brand Partnerships to foster and accelerate our organic partnership efforts focused on brands. This role will be focused on driving adoption of Snapchat‚Äôs organic products and initiatives, and help grow brands‚Äô understanding of Snapchat. Ideal candidates for this role will have an extensive understanding and interest in concepts/deliverables as well as a proven background of working with relevant partners to find success and generate high-impact, innovative results. This role requires close cross-functional collaboration with colleagues in Product, Design, Sales, and Marketing in addition to various other Snapchat teams around the world.  As a member of the Partnerships team, you will lead, develop, manage and maintain strategic partnerships for brands. Working from our Los Angeles headquarters or remotely, you will ensure that these important relationships and concepts/deliverables meet the strategic objectives for Snap Inc., serving as the primary point of contact for both internal and external stakeholders.  What You‚Äôll Do Build and maintain strong relationships with Snap‚Äôs key strategic brand partners, and serve as the primary point of contact for partnership execution Drive brand partner strategy while assisting partners in investing and developing concept/deliverables on Snapchat with a focus on organic products that drive brand awareness and adoption (e.g., AR technology, Organic Lenses, Business Profiles (which include Lenses in Explorer, Stories in For You / Subscriptions, and Highlights), and Snapcodes Support the execution of the strategy for Snapchat‚Äôs organic products and initiatives Work cross-functionally across teams and help lead holistic, Snap-wide brand partnership initiatives Track, analyze, and communicate key quantitative metrics and develop and execute against partner account plans Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Experienced relationship builder with a track record of success building long-term, strategic partnerships Experience working with senior/C-suite leaders, both internally and externally Adaptable learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment Ability to be execution and detail-oriented, while simultaneously able to see the strategic ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù Collaborative leader who is able to deftly navigate multi-party partnerships Minimum Qualifications 10+ years experience in a brand partnerships role Experience with working with global brand activations Experience in AR/VR BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience Preferred Qualifications Experience executing innovative partnerships Passion for Snapchat Entrepreneurial spirit At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don‚Äôt be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com.

description: Company Description  Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that‚Äôs built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID¬Æ, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon‚Äôs award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world‚Äôs top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg.  Job Description  About CitrusAd  Launched in 2016, CitrusAd was purposely built with a retailer-first focus creating incremental revenue opportunities through a best-in-class technology platform and a services division to create and develop leading Publisher Monetization programs. This winning combination of tech and highly experienced services allow us to unleash the potential of online shelf space, where CitrusAd effectively turns retailer websites into highly targeted and effective marketing platforms - changing the way in which retailers, advertisers and customers manage and experience e-commerce.  Just 12 months after its product launch, the CitrusAd platform was adopted by more than 36 global retailers in 22 countries reaching more than 300 million customers through 30 billion website page views.  CitrusAd is globally headquartered out of Brisbane, Australia. Our North American headquarters is in St. Petersburg, Florida. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and many of our team members work remotely in many areas of the world. In North America, a large majority of our team is located in Florida with many others in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York, Atlanta, Pennsylvania, Toronto-CA, Vermont and more.  At CitrusAd we run on collaboration and teamwork. We‚Äôre committed to fueling our team members‚Äô passion for creativity, community involvement and work/life balance. After all, it‚Äôs our people that take us from great to incredible. If you thrive in a creative, fun, teamwork atmosphere, this job may be for you!  Characteristics We Look For An eager, go-getter with a roll up your sleeves ‚Äúget it done‚Äù approach A desire to learn, grow and develop within your role and the organization Genuine interest in digital and the power of effective marketing Your Role and Impact to Success  Purpose  The Senior Director or Director of Sales role will be positioned as a part of our growing retail media team specifically within our newest retailer team, Lowe‚Äôs. This team member will drive sales and manage client relationships in the Home Improvement, CPG and / or Electronics categories across our Sponsored Product and Display Ad technology media platform. The ideal candidate should have a proven history of exceeding sales goals and existing in-roads with media contacts in these categories and agencies. Past experience in ecommerce media and sponsored search are a plus.  Duties And Responsibilities Generate revenue and strive to exceed target quota Utilize networks & tools to identify & contact prospective supplier contacts Offer smart client research, trends & ideas (i.e. valid business reasons) to drive interest & cultivate relationships Dissect each brand organization to uncover different rivers of funding (shopper marketing, brand, ecommerce, national media agency) with the intent to simultaneously unlock and elevate each relationship Own a room (even virtually) ‚Äì present dynamically and instill confidence to challenge our clients in a kind, smart and creative way to ensure we are doing what is best for both businesses long-term Analyze campaign performance statistics and recommend performance enhancements Collaborate with internal teams (account management, ad operations, creative, analytics, development) to ensure a seamless experience for both the retailer & suppliers Communicate with retailer teams regarding ‚ÄúVIP‚Äù account outreach, pipeline, messaging + SKU prioritization, URL confirmation, etc. Track outreach & sales activity pipeline using HubSpot ‚Äì participate in a weekly pipeline call with the retailer Qualifications  Strengths  With a focus on sales strategy and operational excellence, this role will require: Working knowledge of retail, eCommerce and digital monetization programs Proficient knowledge in digital ad monetization & sales Strong leadership qualities ‚Äì trust, loyalty, empathy, forward thinking, self-starter Clear, concise and proactive communication skills + prompt response times Strong organization skills ‚Äì proving the ability to prioritize to ensure deadlines are met Ability to problem solve focused on being solution oriented Qualifications 5+ years‚Äô experience in advertising, media sales and/or business development Comfortable with DSP, DMP, PMP terminology & discussion BA/BS degree in marketing, business or related field Post COVID travel to Lowe‚Äôs HQ and/or Supplier/Agency offices Additional Information  Great People, Deserve Great Benefits  We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon‚Äôs policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.  Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.  For San Francisco Bay and Los Angeles Areas: Epsilon will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles‚Äô Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901-4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.  REF122290R
