description: About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  Covering the MA market, you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you!  What You'll Do Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of named accounts by cold-calling and professional networking Build productive long lasting relationships that continue to pay dividends through trusted references in your market Be relentless about meeting personal and team sales targets Research accounts and follow through on sales leads while developing a strategic territory business plan Working with Side leadership to sell at the most strategic level and implementing a definitive strategy to showcase our value proposition to independent brokerages, large teams and unique real estate business models Keep an up-to-date understanding of a dynamic real estate industry and local market WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE? 8-10+ years of full-cycle sales experience (commercial or enterprise) Real estate industry knowledge and domain expertise is a plus A proven hunter and closer Strong top of the funnel engagement skills Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Creative sale techniques and pipeline management A passionate influential sales style Success positioning and selling on benefits instead of feature/function Strong communication, collaboration, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, highly confident, and driven Compensation/Perks Competitive salary plus bonus opportunity Equity options Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental) Flexible PTO $1,000/year for learning and development Pet friendly environment Side is dedicated to working with the highest skilled people from the most inclusive talent pool feasible. We maintain that diversity in all aspects leads to positive change, solutions and innovation for our customers and career fulfillment for our employees. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Location: New York, NY  Who we are:  We‚Äôre Prime Matter Labs, a personal care product manufacturer with over 35 years of experience formulating, compounding, and filling products for some of the most successful and respected brands in the world.  We exist to bring better products to the world by empowering our customers to bring their ideas to life. We strive to be their most valuable partner, delivering a level of efficiency, service, and support unmatched in the industry.  This year, we embarked on a bold new vision to be the leading product development and production partner in the country for emerging and established brands. To realize that vision, we‚Äôre investing at an unprecedented level in new technology, processes, and plans that will completely rethink the way that brands view and interact with their manufacturer. We‚Äôre building the platform that will allow us to serve as the foundation of our customer‚Äôs branded products, from their first sample to their million unit product run, and every step in between.  Come help us build the future of the personal care and beauty landscape, one partnership at a time.  What we‚Äôre looking for:  We‚Äôre searching for the leadership team that will help envision, build, and execute the growth strategy of the company. These leaders will be people with broad experience building and leading teams, developing and executing roadmaps, and who can seamlessly move between strategy and execution on an hourly basis. This team will be a group of builders with an impressive track record of overdelivering on goals and expectations, who are constantly looking for new ways to push the envelope.  How you‚Äôll fit in:  As Director of Business Development, you will be a leader in our sales and customer service organization. You‚Äôll be responsible for building a strong sales culture, attracting world class talent, and inputting on the strategy and execution of our very ambitious growth targets. This is an opportunity for you to be the face of an incredible development and production team. You‚Äôll be the driving force of a strategy to both attract new B2B customers, as well as significantly grow the size of our existing customer base. You will report directly to the Chief Revenue Officer.  What you‚Äôll do: Develop, align, and track a growth forecast that includes new customer conversion and existing customer growth targets Implement predictable, repeatable, and scalable sales processes using data and analytics, and managing a consistent pipeline and forecasting methodology Craft and execute a customer acquisition program that leads to a robust opportunity pipeline Partner with Marketing and Engineering to align organizational goals to sales strategy Recruit, train, and coach a world-class sales and customer service team that is focused and setting and over-delivering on ambitious growth goals Build an extensive network within the emerging brand community, including, but not limited to brand owners, capital partners, and service providers Own the sales budget, driving trade and travel spend, referral programs, consultant fees, and third-party technology solution selection What you have: 5+ years working in B2B sales in product, brand, and manufacturing companies 2+ years leading B2B sales and customer service teams Track record of creating repeatable, scalable sales strategies and processes A deep network of decision makers at: Emerging and established brands, consumer focused venture capital firms, leading personal care retailers, and supply chain partners Impressive interpersonal and communication skills in small and large groups The ability to make tough decisions quickly, and to take ownership over the outcome A desire to be in the weeds, and the ability to step back and see the big picture Extensive experience with third party sales software and a clear idea of their value to different sized sales organizations What we‚Äôre offering: Competitive compensation package Health, dental, and vision benefits 401K program The spirit of a startup with the security of an established, profitable industry leader The opportunity to make waves in a $250B industry At Prime, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We welcome people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. Prime is an equal opportunity employer.  Powered by JazzHR  zw55jkcG4u

The focus will be on Tier 1 CSP's such as AWS and Google.  Location: This is a remote role.  Duties and Responsibilities: Identify potential clients and the decision makers within the client‚Äôs organization Work with cross-functional teams to develop proposals which resolve customer‚Äôs issues and concerns, as well as meeting client‚Äôs expectations and objectives Manage the complex and dynamic relationship with large technology partners to deliver innovative systems and solutions that have the potential to impact the technology landscape and accelerate revenue growth for both companies Lead cross-functional teams and resolve complex issues with high-level of ambiguities Develop Supermicro brand and presence in select verticals. Solid communication skills in verbal, written, and presentation; Superb negotiation skills with ability to influence clients and decision makers Strong leadership ‚Äì ability to lead cross-functional teams in large corporate environment Proven record of successful engagement in tier 1 CSPs such as AWS and Google, prior experience working with tier 1 and/or tier 2 OEM customers is highly preferable

description: VICE PRESIDENT, STRATEGIC CLIENT ACCOUNTS RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans, and implementing technology to help transform organizations.  Working for RGP, you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP, and built on tangible accomplishments.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know: We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them. We like working with people who are positive, adaptable, and growth-minded. We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.   THE RGP EXPERIENCE Whether you desire to work directly with clients or support those who do, RGP connects you to meaningful opportunities designed to put your talents to their best and highest use, and help you develop skills for today and tomorrow. As an RGP employee, you are a champion for your team, driven to develop their functional acumen in a manner that is transformative and valuable. You help guide people and organizations to be and become more than they thought possible and have the ultimate service mentality based on openness, understanding, and teamwork.   PURPOSE OF THE ROLE We are seeking a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts in our Northern California offices, who will be instrumental in growing market revenue through new business development, management and expansion of existing client relationships, and oversight of consultant engagements with one of our most strategic accounts. In keeping with our entrepreneurial culture, the Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts will have an opportunity to build and own a client portfolio while working in partnership with teammates to achieve key business objectives.   Why work for a Strategic Client Program (SCP) Account? Providing exemplary client service runs deep in RGP‚Äôs DNA. Our SCP clients turn to us for thought leadership, insight, and innovation. At RGP, we are focused on humans leading the way to global growth. We take pride in being a trusted partner and strategic advisor to our clients. As a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts, you will be part of a dedicated team that fuels growth and delivers this expertise, providing exemplary client service as you develop and maintain comprehensive, long-term, sustainable, and strategic client relationships.   ATTRIBUTES OF INDIVIDUALS IN THIS ROLE AT RGP  Demonstrates integrity and respect for people and opinions Integrity and respect for people and opinions Entrepreneurial, highly self-motivated, and driven to achieve a comprehensive set of performance metrics and quantitative measures Strategic, thought leader, and trusted business partner to the Account/Client Maintains an executive presence with a strong ability to interact with senior/C-level leaders Strong personal identification with RGP‚Äôs values ‚Äì loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability, and talent  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE  Accountable for the sales activity and results for a defined portfolio of business / Develops and implements tactical plans to achieve portfolio sales goals and objectives Conducts account planning and proactively seeks to bring innovative ideas and approaches to the account strategy Owns and drives key strategic pursuits, leveraging the full range of RGP resources and enablers (including Technical Sales, Advisory Project Services, and Business Development), as appropriate Develops and maintains effective relationships and communicates effectively with key client leaders and staff in order to drive account penetration and sales growth Continually develops new client business by pursuing account penetration within existing clients Serves as the client‚Äôs expert on the RGP business model, risk management, client-specific value-proposition, and business impacts Monitors and coaches‚Äô consultants and account team members on best practices in generating leads, identifying opportunities, and leveraging available RGP resources to enhance account penetration Fosters cross-functional collaboration to deliver the best of RGP to clients and drive continuous improvement in the services and solutions RGP brings to the marketplace Identifies, monitors and manages delivery performance, project risk, and new opportunities within assigned accounts in partnership with Talent Management and/or Delivery Management leads Executes and delivers against established KPIs and performance metrics Executes and supports account planning and forecasting activities, as appropriate, in support of enterprise and regional objectives Supports integration of enterprise and cross-functional initiatives across account portfolio, including account planning, forecasting and budgeting, and best practices Contributes to RGP‚Äôs continuous improvement through involvement in account-related case studies, collateral and thought leadership, and the identification of client and market trends relevant for future RGP opportunities and solutions  DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a four-year accredited institution 10+ years of business development experience with Fortune 500 (global) organizations Proven success in creating revenue and managing accounts Experience selling professional services within large accounts preferred Strong capacity for networking and generating lasting business relationships Proven experience building accounts and lasting enterprise account relationships An entrepreneurial spirit derived from experience building and/or transforming a business Excellent written and verbal communication skills; direct and timely with feedback Experience within the high-tech industry is preferred  Equal Opportunity Employer RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

description: BUILT BRANDS LLC  The VP of Sales ‚Äì Retail, is a key leadership role within the Sales team reporting directly to the President of Sales. The VP of Sales ‚Äì Retail, oversees leads, and develops the Key Account Managers. The VP of Sales - Retail will drive the growth of the Retail business by maximizing current accounts, identifying new accounts, and driving impactful execution and customer satisfaction.  This role will be expected to develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales targets. The ability to build and maintain long lasting customer relationships is vital. The VP of Sales - Retail will assist with developing high level strategy design & be responsible for leading and implementing the overall strategic direction of the Retail business. They are also accountable for acquiring a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements to enable the proposal of solutions that meet both the key retail partners needs and the organizations strategic objectives.  This individual will present a powerful brand image of the organization and act as an advocate for the retail with Built Brands, LLC‚Äôs internal teams while balancing the needs of the organization.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS   Drive consistent, profitable revenue and market share growth. Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales targets and expand customer base with a ‚Äútop down‚Äù and ‚Äúbottom up‚Äù approach. Drive a customer centric mindset. Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships. Partner with customers to understand their business needs and objectives and strategically plan how to meet those needs. Effectively communicate the value proposition through proposals and presentations. Arranges meetings with existing and/or potential customers and presents effectively to sell product offerings. Understand category-specific trends. Report on forces that shift tactical budgets and strategic direction of accounts. Hire the best people and develop them to get better. Focus on building teams, culture, and morale. Provides detailed and accurate sales forecasts based on data-driven assumptions for their scope of responsibility. Insure adherence to customer, regulatory, legal and company requirements. Develop trust relationships with assigned key accounts to maintain and protect existing business through exceptional customer service, advocacy and relationship management. Acquire a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements. Ability to find business development opportunities within new and existing retail relationships through initial and ongoing terms negotiations, business optimization and networking.  POSITION QUALIFICATIONS   Transparency and honesty with customers and business partners Motivational and tactful, encouraging the team to bring their best selves every day Expert in the industry Results oriented Assertive, asks questions, seeks clarification before acting Effective problem solver with excellent conflict resolution skills Knack for developing winning processes Highly organized, effective at planning and leading execution Leadership capability Able to attract, hire and retain top talent with a focus on developing team to the next level Strong business acumen with ability to develop budgets, targets, sales plans  KNOWLEDGE, SKILS, AND ABILITIES REQUIREMENTS  Experience as Retail Sales Account Manager for 5+ years with a proven track record of managing $50M+ in revenue. Experience managing ‚ÄòBig Box‚Äô retail accounts such as Walmart, Sam‚Äôs and Costco strongly preferred. Experience managing 5+ team members. Ability to communicate, present and influence all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level. Ability to drive the sales process from plan to close. Demonstrable experience as a sales leader, developing client focused, differentiated, and achievable solutions to minimize channel tension. Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Possess and demonstrate emotional intelligence. High degree of flexibility and a track record of quickly adapting to an ever-changing environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office, Excel with a strong technical acumen with business software.   This role is located in American Fork, Utah and is not remote. Please apply if you're local or willing to relocate!   NO CONTRACT RECRUITING.

Position Purpose  Lead the development and execution of strategic Sales and Marketing Plans and initiatives that maximize profitability for the hotel in order to achieve budget, revenue and market share targets.  Examples Of Duties ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Direct the resort in the development, implementation and achievement of their annual business and market plan objectives. Provide leadership, guidance and assistance relating to the execution of marketing and sales functions, policies and standards as established by the Corporation. Represent hotel by soliciting, responding to and negotiating with persons requiring large and complex group accommodations (generally over 50 guest rooms) with or without meeting space and/or on-site (hotel) catering. Represent hotel in significant interactions dealing with guests relative to sales and operational questions, concerns, and issues. Negotiate contracts with guests and commission agreements with third party agencies. Initiate the preparation of proposals and/or contracts to advise prospective guests primarily of the hotel guest rooms, but also meeting space and/or banquet date, space and rate availability. Develop and quote prices for same. Capitalize on Trump Hotels‚Äô marketing, sales programs and resources. Engage in outside sales activities to discuss business opportunities and entertain guests in local and assigned markets (percentage of travel dependent on specific market). Direct site visits and programs for respective accounts and participates in tradeshows, industry and guest events. Conduct site inspections with potential guests, visiting guest rooms, meeting space and banquet facilities, as well as other hotel facilities. Direct coordination of cross-selling, joint marketing initiatives and other hotel/brand synergies to maximize exposure and profitability including agency contact, media planning and hotel communications. Direct the solicitation efforts of the sales staff through effective oral and written communication while providing strategic direction of rate, date and space commitments for group room sales of the property. Develop and implement strategic and tactical plans to maintain current base and increase the hotel‚Äôs share in transient market. Direct the preparation of reports pertaining to the operation of the Sales and Marketing Department to include, but not limited to the annual and monthly Forecast, Marketing Budget, Lead Management System, Booking Report, Delphi Reports, and Sales Meetings Minutes. Direct the coordination of ongoing research of the travel industry local and national market to detect market trends and related information for development of new marketing strategies. Direct the efforts to improve potential from various existing and new markets. Provide strategic revenue management plans within the hotel to include; rate development, establishment of group thresholds, space utilization policy, deployment strategies through the review of competitive data, demand analysis and market mix management. Oversee the management, training and career development of sales staff. Responsible for recruiting and identifying candidates for sales managerial positions. Within the framework of the local competitive marketplace recommend appropriate sales compensation. Active participation in continuing education to ensure further professional development. Assure effective utilization and adherence to standards relating to current systems in place at the hotel. Sales information systems Group revenue management system/Profit Pack Email Internet accessibility Other  Due to the cyclical nature of the hospitality industry, associates may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the hotel.  Regular attendance in conformance with the standards, which may be established by Trump National Doral from time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Associates with irregular attendance will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.  Due to the industry that we are in, a need will occur for each associate to provide ‚ÄúLateral Service‚Äù. Our goal is to ensure that we are maximizing customer satisfaction and as a result there will be times when our associates in the Operation will call upon us for support in order to ensure customer satisfaction occurs. When we are fortunate enough for this to occur, each associate will positively respond unless there is a chance that an opportunity resulting in dissatisfying a guest could occur. If this is the case the leader is to be notified and the level of support that is being requested will be obtained.  Supportive Functions  In addition to performance of the essential functions, this position may be required to perform a combination of the following supportive functions, with the percentage of time performing each function to be solely determined by the supervisor based upon the particular requirements of the company. Participate in industry organizations. Maintain an open line of communication between guests, associates and management. Input and retrieve information from computer system for file maintenance, correspondence and preparation of forecasts and marketing input. Assist office in any other administrative duties as needed. Safety Requirements  Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) may be required when performing work duties that may have the potential of risk to your health or safety. The hotel will provide the required PPE. Associates will be trained in the proper use and care of any assigned PPE. It is your responsibility to report defective, damaged or lost PPE, or equipment that does not fit properly, to your Manager.  Physical Requirements  Frequency Key: Never ‚Äì 0 hours; Rare ‚Äì up to 1 hour; Occasional ‚Äì 1-3 hours; Frequent ‚Äì 3-6 Hours;  Constant ‚Äì 6-8 hours  Physical Activity Frequency  Sitting Frequent  Walking, climbing stairs Constant  Crouching/Bending/Stooping Occasional  Reaching Constant  Grasping Constant  Pushing/Pulling Occasional  Near Vision Constant  Far Vision Constant  Hearing Constant  Talking Constant  Lifting/Carrying (20 lbs.) Frequent  Travel Frequent  Other Duties  Assimilate into Trump National Doral Miami‚Äôs Cultural Foundation through understanding, supporting and participating in all elements of the Trump Cornerstones. Demonstrate working knowledge of the service standards.  Qualification Standards  Education  Four-year college degree preferred; additional/advanced degree coursework in business administration, marketing and communications a plus.  Experience Requires substantial operations/sales leadership experience; preferably 10 years or more. Comparable hotel size and scope experience preferred. Proven track record of successes in achieving revenue objectives. Proven ability to recruit, motivate and train sales team. GROOMING/UNIFORMS  All associates must maintain a neat, clean and well-groomed appearance. Specific uniform guidelines and/or required articles of clothing will be explained to you as a part of the orientation process.  Second Language Preferred.  OTHER  Notice  The hospitality business functions seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day. In addition, this is a hospitality business and a hospitable service atmosphere must be projected at all times.

description: Canary Technologies is a fast-growing enterprise hospitality technology company that provides hotels with innovative solutions to drive efficiency and enhance the guest experience. Our core solutions get rid of antiquated technology in hotels. With backing from some of the top investors in Silicon Valley, including Y Combinator, Canary Technologies is trusted by thousands worldwide and serves some of the world‚Äôs largest and most iconic hotel brands.  This opportunity will provide close interaction with senior leaders and founders. Our founders are alums of the Cornell Hotel School, Columbia University, and The University of Pennsylvania- Wharton. They have previously built software companies and have worked at firms such as Bain & Company and Starwood Hotels & Resorts.  We are an organization that strongly believes in meritocracy and performance. There is significant opportunity for advancement and growth in this role, both of which are based on performance and talent.  About This Role  Canary Technologies has a proven track record of success with Sales Development Representatives at scale, and are now seeking a Sales Development leader to help us take the team to the next stage of growth.  We are scaling our SDR team globally and need a Head of Sales Development who can build/manage the team, evolve our processes, and motivate the team to achieve their goals. You are comfortable working cross functionally to drive SDR strategy and enablement. You embody the Canary value of open, honest, direct communication - to executives, peers, and direct reports. You lead with empathy and care about your team‚Äôs personal and professional growth. You love to experiment with ways to drive stronger conversion. You are data-oriented in your approach to coaching and identifying areas of improvement. Above all, you will be critical during this foundational stage of the company, and instrumental in growing Canary‚Äôs presence worldwide.  This job will be based out of San Francisco or New York. While we are currently remote due to Covid-19, we are seeking candidates who are based in the San Francisco/New York area OR who are willing to relocate upon our eventual return to the office (timing to be determined).  What You'll Do Lead and manage our growing team of SDRs and Team Leads Create and manage goals, responsibilities, and professional development metrics Work with our recruiting team to hire top SDRs and Team Leads to join Work closely with our marketing team to facilitate SDR campaigns Provide sales feedback and coaching to SDRs and Team Leads Review cold calling and emailing techniques and provide feedback to SDRs Own sales metrics for the team including trends of leads, meetings set, etc. Report metrics to our VP of Sales and make recommendations to improve efficiency of SDR team Qualifications You have 5-8+ years of experience in B2B SaaS sales You have 2-3+ years in a management/leadership role You have a proven track record of managing and growing a team of SDRs Ability to energize a team and lead them toward action and results Demonstrated background of data-driven sales leadership Proficient with G-Suite, Excel, Salesforce, and Salesloft (or other Sales Automation Platforms) Strong recruiting skills with a track record of hiring successful SDRs and Team Leads Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to be self directed in a fast-paced environment BA/BS degree

description: Reporting to the CEO, the Director of Sales will be responsible for all sales activities within the company. You will be responsible for the direction and management of all sales activities including distribution and channel strategy, market competitiveness, pricing, and revenue achievement. You must have flawless attention to details and an ability to deliver across global markets and cultures.  Director of Sales Responsibilities Develop strategic vision, objectives, financial budgets and forecasts. Manage overall sales process, set appropriate metrics for sales funnel management. Work closely with Marketing to develop, establish, and direct channel and distribution strategies and programs. Develop global pricing and revenue generation to deliver to the agreed business plan. Oversee the design, hiring and development of a global sales organization, appropriate for the company‚Äôs maturity/size. Establish compensation, training, and sales incentive programs. Identify industry and market trends, maintaining keen awareness of industry partner and competitor movements and activities. Collaborate with the Operations team, Marketing team (PR and Brand), Product Development team and other functions to drive innovation throughout the sales and service experience. Effectively communicate company objectives and how the location sales targets and strategies support achievement of those objectives. Ensure location management team set goals and objectives which remain focused on overall business strategies. Maintain key customer relationships and develop and implement strategies for expanding the company‚Äôs customer database. Develop new processes and tactics to provide stellar customer services and retention, while keeping the highly trained, efficient and knowledgeable teams under wing, across all traded categories in our marketplace. Director of Sales Requirements Must have 10+ years of experience in managing multi-functional Sales teams in the Luxury industry Must have at least 5 years experience in luxury Cosmetics, Beauty, Fragrance, or Fashion. Must have retail and/or department store experience Must have international experience. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Management, Business or equivalent. Proven sales track record in a new product and new market environment. Global experience. Strong analytic background and the ability to apply data effectively to make business decisions. Strong negotiation skills. Strategic planning skills. Established contacts and relationships with potential customers and channel partners. Ability to think and perform both tactically and strategically. Thrives in a fast-paced environment, with entrepreneurial attitude. Hands on and enthusiastic leadership style with excellent interpersonal skills. Proven ability to effectively operate in a culturally diverse environment. High degree of integrity and confidentiality. Must have traveled internationally and/or domestically for business in previous roles This job description is not all-inclusive. We reserve the right to amend this job description at any time. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.  Job Type: Full-time  "I grew to admire the brilliance of scent and how it can transport you to another place and time. With this in mind, I have created a line of luxurious and sophisticated fragrances. Gathering wisdom from people who have devoted their lives to this particular kind of beauty, rare components were collected from exotic locales from across the globe. At House of SILLAGE, we have poured our hearts in the art of fragrance to achieve a perfect synthesis of artistry, craft, transition, and innovation. In both scent and presentation, our creations offer timeless elegance designed for the most discerning clientele."  Nicole Mather, Founder & CEO

description: Aon is Looking for a Resident Sales Director in Atlanta, GA  As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Sales group within Aon in Atlanta, GA. As a Resident Sales Leader, you will report directly to the Resident Managing Director and will have direct reports.  Your Impact As A Resident Sales Leader  Job Responsibilities:  Primarily responsible for driving growth across Aon‚Äôs various solutions including Commercial Risk and Health Solutions. This role delivers new business goals for the office. By driving individual goal achievement, the Resident Sales Director helps the office, region and Aon attain aggregate sales goals.  Key Responsibilities and Scope: Drive growth: Achieve or exceed the office‚Äôs quarterly and annual new business revenue goals; Support the execution of the National Sales and Marketing platform and initiatives; Oversee the development and ongoing implementation and quarterly updates of actionable annual Individual and Office Sales and Marketing Plans; Develop and maintain a sales-focused culture across the office; Maintain an accurate, detailed pipeline of new business development supporting revenue forecasting and beneficial sales metric analysis; Monitor and assess ongoing new business results and related pipeline activity tracking across the local team, and promptly anticipate and address negative new business variances or trends and/or activity issues; Forecast new business monthly and quarterly with accuracy; Mentor and develop, problem-solve and strategize with the office‚Äôs Producers, Account Executives, and Broking leaders to create, develop and close specific revenue opportunities; Maintain a fair marketplace in terms of prospect allocation across the office and firm‚Äôs resources and follow protocols for pipeline documentation and production credit disputes; Create, tailor and/or execute marketing campaigns including email campaigns, mailings, seminars, webinars, seminars, roundtables and Forums to drive revenue opportunities tailored to the office‚Äôs new business priorities and market area(s); Educate Producers, Account Executives, and Broking leaders on new products, approaches, services and solutions and Aon‚Äôs capabilities and thought leadership with training on the segment or client applicability and recommended dialoguing with clients and prospects; Work with the Health Local Practice Leader and Account Executive Leader to ensure that the office‚Äôs clients and prospects receive regular written communication applicable to their business(es), exposures and needs; Proactively and consistently communicate and meet with clients, prospects, insurers, and competitors to maintain a current knowledge of talent in the office‚Äôs market area(s); Recruit and present your recommendation and business plan for the best business development personnel (Producers, Account Executives and support personnel to enable others to produce more) for the market area‚Äôs needs; Onboard business developers with a clear understanding of their role and responsibilities and specified sales goals, and training on Salesforce.com, Aon‚Äôs office, national and global resources and systems; Identify and nurture focus centers of influence in the accounting, legal, financial and other segments of the business community in the office‚Äôs market areas for office-wide collaboration and referral; Ensure that Aon has earned a majority of its large clients‚Äô commercial risk and health solutions, wallet or spend; Communicate innovative approaches, best practices, market and competitor trends nationally. You Bring Knowledge and Expertise  Required Experience: Minimum 10 years of Sales Leadership and Marketing Experience in related field Solid collaboration skills enabling candidate to successfully lead global new business teams in pursuit of target prospects Strong negotiation skills Exceptional oral presentation skills and ability to clearly articulate complex messages in written form Track record of personally initiating complex sales Consistent achievement of assigned territorial or practice business goals Active involvement in the development and maintenance of a productive sales and marketing culture Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent, with Sales and Risk and Insurance Management/Business related curriculum preferred We offer you  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience:  From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.  About Aon:  Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.  DISCLAIMER:  Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  IND - US  2493422

description: What You'll Do You will lead a team of Account Managers to help Federal Civilian agencies accomplish their most critical mission: Serving and protecting our country‚Äôs citizens.  You will partner with an Engineering Leader and System Architects focused on positioning Cisco‚Äôs software and hardware solutions to help these agencies accomplish their mission!   You will have overall sales leadership responsibilities for Federal Civilian agencies, such as the FRB, FDIC, GSA, IRS, USPS OIG, SEC, DOT, FAA, Courts and Treasury Your team will consist of 7+ Account Managers, as well as indirect responsibility for Virtual AMs as well.  You will also have a matrix team of Sales Engineers, Solution Architects, Product Specialists, Service Delivery and Finance  Who You'll Work With You will need to strategically drive Cisco's end-to-end vision for our Civilian customers, as well as maintain an in-depth understanding of funding vehicles, capture opportunities, competitive conditions, industry practices, market opportunities, and customer requirements. In addition to leading ‚Äúone winning team‚Äù, the Regional Manager will work closely and cross-collaboratively with Cisco's senior leaders within Customer Advocacy, Technology Business Units, and Cisco's Executive Sales team.  You will also be responsible for creating strategic relationships with our Partner ecosystem to drive $200M+ in Cisco Revenue.   Who You Are You are a proven sales leader with experience selling to Federal customers.  You will bring excitement and passion to lead our talented sales organization to execute on a strategy that aids Civilian agencies to execute their mission.  You will also be expected to motivate, inspire, and continually develop your team and channel partners while taking on new competitors as Cisco continues to gain market share in our Advance Technologies, which include Security, Collaboration, Data Center, and Application Monitoring.  Key experience and performance traits that will aid in your success include:  You have 5+ years of experience leading a sales organization by developing and executing a sales strategy.  You have 5+ years in leadership roles selling solutions to senior executives at Civilian agencies. You have 10+ years of experience in strategic sales and execution in the technology industry. You have deep knowledge and experience in building a strategy for Civilian agencies.  You have demonstrated a track record of leading significant revenue responsibility and over-achieving growth targets to meet stretch goals.    You have cultivated performance by attracting, developing and retaining top sales talent and can motivate in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  You have represented Cisco (or current company) in a large internal and customer-focused industry event.  You are adept at balancing short-term pressures with overall long-term strategic goals.  You have demonstrated the ability to provide thought leadership, think strategically, effectively communicate a vision (both written and verbal), and influence in a matrixed organization.  You have a strong executive presence, you are polished, politically savvy, and you have strong leadership skills in mentoring and developing a sales organization for 20+ people.  You have excellent communication skills with the ability to persuade ‚Äì using simple communications that convey complex concepts in a compelling, concise and creative way.   We Are Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here‚Äôs how we do it.  We embrace technology modernization and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we‚Äôre ‚Äúold‚Äù (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we‚Äôre also a software company. And a security company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects.  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves to our community because giving back is built into our DNA.  We take accountability, we set bold audacious goals, and we take difference to heart.  Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don‚Äôt care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That‚Äôs cool.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.  We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.#WeAreCisco  Cisco is an equal opportunity employer.

Based in New York City, and backed by professional stylists and dermatologists, the brand is emerging as one of the most innovative companies to watch. sales channels through experimentation, and quickly identify channel effectiveness Develop a data-driven growth culture by building a revenue pipeline, forecasting and KPI reports Proactively identify influencer strategy/budget internally and/or alongside external partners/consultants and oversee implementation and growth Establish and implement a retail (traditional and non-traditional) roll-out strategy alongside external partners/consultants and Jupiter‚Äôs Executive Team Collaborate with the design and content teams to drive creative testing Manage and motivate staff to achieve revenue goals, holding team members to a high standard of excellence and accountability Create a ‚Äúlean start up‚Äù mentality of constant experimentation and learning Be a strong voice on the team for all revenue-related discussions, meetings, and brainstorms including changes to the business, strategy, product, and brand   Background B.S. required 5+ years of growth marketing experience as Head of Growth (or equivalent) at a digitally-native B2C company, managing paid campaigns focusing on scale and cost efficiency Experience managing $250k+ monthly paid budgets across digital channels, accounting for an organization‚Äôs messaging nuances In depth knowledge of Facebook Ads Manager and Google Adwords (interest/experience with other digital platforms a plus) Experience or interest in driving growth across off-line retail sales channels  Strategic and highly-analytical with the ability to take large amounts of data and develop innovative solutions Ability to forecast revenue accurately, and ensure operations are measured and optimized to align with sales, budget, and marketing targets Excellent communication skills and success in working with cross-functional teams Track-record of taking ownership and initiative in a fast-paced, collaborative environment Natural brand evangelist, getting energy from your work, sharing your knowledge with others, and having the impact of your work seen and felt across the Company Genuinely optimistic/upbeat personality with a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude, unafraid to roll up your sleeves to get the job done Lastly, we have a no @$$hole policy on the team ;)   Benefits + Misc. Jupiter offers a competitive cash + equity compensation package. In addition we provide the following benefits:  Full health, dental, and vision insurance plan coverage. Budget for the technology tools you need whether a laptop, monitor, or special software.

About this role: As the Head of Sales, you will join the leadership team, where you will report directly to the CEO. We are looking for the right background and skillset, not a certain number of years of experience. We will need you to scale, lead, and coach a world-class team of sales professionals that are already performing well, identify opportunities for improvement and scale, and work collaboratively with the marketing, customer success, and product/engineering teams to attract the right customers and help make them highly successful.  The ideal candidate will bring excellent sales coaching skills, strong strategic/critical thinking, and will thrive in a highly collaborative environment.  We look for these values in team members: Lead with Learning - We help others grow by leading them to new learnings. Achieve with Action - We help others grow by relentlessly pursuing our customers' desired outcomes. Connect with Commitment - We help others grow by reaching out to discover new ways to share success.  What You'll Do Coach sales team members to achieve their highest level of performance and exceed their bookings and sourcing targets. Attract and retain high-performers that execute well and thrive in Demandwell's collaborative, service-oriented culture. Identify opportunities to improve the sales process, discipline, and culture to successfully scale the team and hit increasingly higher growth goals. Take ownership of the entire sales cycle and deploy all sales objectives, which include preparing sales quotas, budgeting, hiring, and training. Collaborate with the marketing and customer success teams to execute strategic GTM plans to drive company growth, market share, and retention goals. Work with Product Team to help define the direction of the software, based on feedback from customers, sales trends, and industry knowledge Maintain strong relationships with all internal partners (Talent, Marketing, Customer Success, Product & Engineering) and external stakeholders. As part of the Demandwell leadership team, help drive the direction and culture of the company.  What We're Looking for: You have relevant sales experience, preferably selling technical solutions to B2B marketers. You're motivated to achieve results and are effective in dynamic, high-growth environments. You're a great sales coach and mentor and focused on building a positive culture. You're an established B2B SaaS sales leader that has delivered results at scale through hiring, training, and enabling a team. You have strong execution disciplines while remaining receptive to input and adaptable on ways to improve. You're great at collaborating across disciplines and teams, including giving and receiving thoughtful feedback. You effectively utilize sales and marketing technology (e.g., CRM, sales recordings, other analytics tools) to improve and scale performance.

description: About US  Constructor.io powers product search and discovery for some of the largest retailers in the world, like Sephora and Backcountry. We serve billions of requests every year, and you‚Äôve probably seen our results somewhere and used our product without knowing it. We differentiate ourselves by focusing on metrics over features, and reinventing search and discovery from the ground up as a machine learning challenge with the specific goal of improving metrics like revenue. We have grown several hundred percent YoY for the last 2 years and have customers in every eCommerce vertical, around the world, and spanning many languages.  We‚Äôre a passionate team of technologists who love solving problems and want to make our customers‚Äô and coworkers‚Äô lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things. Previous Sales Methodology training, SaaS Performance Management or Applications experience, and strong customer references preferred  Benefits Unlimited vacation time A competitive compensation package including stock options Company sponsored health coverage Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact  Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor  At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.

description: Job Description:  OROS is looking for an experienced, passionate Wholesale Director. The internal position will report to the Chief Executive Officer and will be directly responsible for launching and growing all aspects of our wholesale business. This position requires previous wholesale sales management experience, leadership in setting departmental goals, and excellent customer service skills. A successful Wholesale Director will be focused on building the strategy, processes, teams and accounts for OROS‚Äô Wholesale business.  Core Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Development of Wholesale Strategy ‚Ä¢ Manage all aspects of sales reps and new store acquisition ‚Ä¢ Recruit, hire, and educate external sales department on an ongoing basis ‚Ä¢ Direct point of contact for all wholesale sales reps ‚Ä¢ Set financial and other goals with wholesale reps and hold them to those goals ‚Ä¢ Develop internal sales tools, materials, calendars & processes ‚Ä¢ Create wholesale marketing campaigns ‚Ä¢ Research and design point of sale items that promote in store conversion and uphold the brand. ‚Ä¢ Develop in-store event programs in collaboration with Marketing ‚Ä¢ Understand all wholesale ordering systems (Faire, Peeba, Quickbooks Commerce, etc) and communicate with reps about them ‚Ä¢ Wholesale customer service via phone, email, or tradeshows ‚Ä¢ Identify, coordinate and attend wholesale trade shows ‚Ä¢ Survey stores to understand what is working and what upcoming needs are ‚Ä¢ Establish relationships with US reps and distributors ‚Ä¢ Manage customer inquiries and new customer acquisition ‚Ä¢ Research and implement new sales channels ‚Ä¢ Set up relationships with PTOs and independent promotions industry reps Skills & Experience   WHAT YOU NEED:  Minimum of 5 years of wholesale or retail experience Minimum BA, BS degree Excel skills, with ability to build budgets and models Extremely sales driven Good communication skills Able to set goals and manage well

About Pear Therapeutics:  Pear Therapeutics is the leader in prescription digital therapeutics. We aim to redefine medicine by discovering, developing, and delivering clinically validated software-based therapeutics to provide better outcomes for patients, smarter engagement and tracking tools for clinicians, and cost-effective solutions for payers. Pear has a pipeline of products and product candidates across therapeutic areas, including severe psychiatric and neurological conditions. Our first product, reSET¬Æ, treats Substance Use Disorder and was the first prescription digital therapeutic to receive marketing authorization from the FDA to treat disease. Pear‚Äôs second product, reSET-O¬Æ, for the treatment of Opioid Use Disorder, received marketing clearance from the FDA in December 2018. Pear‚Äôs third PDT, Somryst¬Æ, is the first FDA-authorized prescription digital therapeutic (PDT) for patients with chronic insomnia and the first product submitted through FDA‚Äôs traditional 510(k) pathway while simultaneously reviewed through FDA‚Äôs Software Precertification Pilot Program  Inside Sales Specialist The Inside Sales Specialist will utilize remote solution-based concept selling skills to the US marketplace. This person reports into the marketing brand lead and is responsible for meeting and exceeding sales goals, working in partnership with sales support functions, and sales and marketing leadership to accelerate growth and ensure an overall positive customer experience.  Responsibilities: Understand the company's products, clinical data, value propositions, key benefits and target prospects. Execute on marketing-qualified leads and prospects within install base of accounts as well as existing and non-existing accounts. Utilize digital technology platforms and data to analyze territory and effectively target accounts. Answer incoming calls and emails in relation to sales questions. Assist in the execution of campaigns within your territory. Ensure all activities are recorded in company's CRM platform, Salesforce; including prospective deals and orders. Deliver a positive customer experience while improving revenue. Contribute to the development and execution of Sales Training programs. Work with cross functional groups such as Market Access, Patient Services Center, Marketing, Sales, and Product. Monitor and reinforce the use of any applicable systems and use data analysis to understand/predict trends to support business planning. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs, conventions, and tradeshows as directed.  Key Skills & Attributes Field and/or inside sales experience in Pharmaceutical or Medical Device Proven track record of successfully executing inside sales programs Professional phone presence and excellent written/verbal communication skills Passionate about sales ‚Äì hungry to achieve goals; persistent and positive attitude Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively Experience with digital product / technology a plus Proficiency in digital applications and remote selling technologies (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Salesforce.com.) Chronic disease experience preferred  Requirements Bachelors degree in related field, or equivalent work experience, preferred Minimum 2 years documented sales success or equivalent experience in Pharmaceutical, Medical Supply, or Healthcare Occasional travel in territory is required.  You must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date, and must remain fully vaccinated throughout employment, including receipt of booster doses as recommended by federal, state, and/or local health authorities, unless an accommodation is granted by Pear for medical or religious reasons in accordance with applicable law.  Equal Employment Opportunity: Pear Therapeutics is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion or religious creed, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, genetic information, qualified physical or mental disability or handicap, medical condition, qualified military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law. description: The Head of Amazon Business Development is the primary strategic business development leader for growing our revenue, EBITDA and category share for all of Harry‚Äôs Inc. brands at Amazon. This role will lead and execute a comprehensive 3-year growth plan for Harry‚Äôs Inc. at Amazon. The Head of Amazon Business Development will be charged with building a highly talented global team of sales leaders and cross-functional managers that will represent our brands within the Harry‚Äôs Inc. portfolio. This leader represents a vital role for the company‚Äôs future growth and success, as we continue to build innovation and scale.  About The Retail Team  The Retail Team is a critical commercial function that impacts a large majority of the overall company revenue and EBITDA contribution. Retail serves as a vital partner to our Brand GM‚Äôs and Cross-functional leaders. Retail is responsible for all retail partnerships and the business development activities at each retailer. In addition, Retail creates the company's go-to-market decisions and priorities via Retail Strategy and Planning, and cultivates lower funnel brand marketing investments via Retail Marketing. Retail team members need to embody a deep understanding that customers are the humans who use our products ‚Äì and we need to define and create best practices to enable our customers to be delighted when choosing our products and ultimately using our products. Retail team members also need to deeply understand our brands, the customers who use our brands, and our retail partners‚Äô objectives and strategies.  Your Core Responsibilities  Lead Harry‚Äôs Inc. business portfolio development with Amazon, accelerating growth through a dedicated team to deliver budgeted sales revenue, gross profit, category share development, marketing strategies, and supply chain operational excellence. This includes leading a cross-functional team that will surround our partner with a total solutions approach and capability. Lead the implementation and amplification of a 3-year growth plan. Manage and own the Amazon P&L, including all trade investment and overall OpEx considerations. Partner with our Sr. Directors of Walmart and Target teams to collaborate on our digital retail strategy. Develop and execute our overall Amazon go-to-market strategy for driving profitable share growth in alignment with our brand priorities. Build and foster strategic relationships with Amazon,, including merchandising, marketing, supply chain and store operations. This includes building and owning a Joint Business Plan for Harry‚Äôs Inc., measured by a joint scorecard which encompasses our mutual growth targets and strategic investment areas. Ensure we have robust brand-level Joints Business Plans with corresponding scorecards that represent mutually defined annual goals. Lead the hiring, training and personal development of cross-functional team talent supporting Amazon across the company ‚Äì creating a highly collaborative and effective culture that reflects Harry‚Äôs Vision, Mission and Values. Manage a high functioning team, to include potential agency partners, to serve our business management requirements and metrics, at an optimal and mutually defined ROI. Define and lead the necessary business questions and support from data analytics and shopper insights, to position Harry‚Äôs as the thought leader in shave and soft product categories in which we compete.  These might describe you  5+ years of CPG ecommerce experience with a demonstrated track-record of leadership with Amazon directly, and/or digital retail experience including demonstrated success in delivering top and bottom line results. Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively negotiate and influence across multiple levels and functions and drive coordination across groups Strong analytical skills and business acumen, with demonstrated data driven approach to business management A strong leader with a demonstrated track-record for exhibiting an entrepreneurial spirit coupled with a general management mindset and capabilities. Leadership experience in CPG marketing, sales or retail merchandising and marketing is ideal. A model for collaborative behavior and execution in delivering great programming for the Harry‚Äôs brands Strong interpersonal, written/oral communication and presentation skills You are a learner - always seeking to improve yourself, your team, and the world around you You thrive on direct, honest, and supportive communication You are always thinking about how to help the teammates around you excel Extremely organized, dependable and self-motivated with the ability to excel in a fast paced environment  Who You Will Work With  You'll work most closely with key retail leadership and contacts, Sales Strategy and Planning and Brand for go-to-market planning, distribution and planning for operational and fulfillment needs, R&D for product and design needs,and Retail Marketing for demand creation best practices. You'll report to the Head of Retail at Harry‚Äôs  Harry‚Äôs Inc. started in 2013 with simple, fairly priced products that delivered an amazing experience to guys every day. Since then, Harry‚Äôs expanded to the UK, developed relationships with retailers such as Target and Walmart, expanded our grooming brand into a personal care powerhouse, and launched a women‚Äôs brand called Flamingo.  The key to our success? Our amazing people. From chemists, mechanical engineers, CX associates, to creative directors, sourcing managers, and logistics specialists, Harry‚Äôs team is comprised of some of the most brilliant, diverse, and humble people you‚Äôll ever meet.  Our brands answer unmet consumer needs, but our company is a place of inclusion and innovation that attracts some of the brightest minds across industries, geographies, and backgrounds. Whether we have a team of 3 or 300, our core values and our startup mentality remain; we value continuous improvement and learning, teamwork and collaboration, creative problem solving, and open and direct dialogue and feedback. Come for the coffee and free products, stay for the amazing, passionate culture.  Harry‚Äôs is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together.  Harry‚Äôs is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals. We recruit, hire and promote into all job levels the most qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), parental status, age, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, marital, family or partnership status, political affiliation or activities, military service, domestic violence victim status, arrest/conviction record, sexual or reproductive health decisions, caregiver status, credit history immigration status, unemployment status, traits historically associated with race, including but not limited to hair texture and protective hairstyles or any other status protected under applicable federal, state and local laws. Harry‚Äôs commitment to providing equal employment opportunities extends to all aspects of employment, including job assignment, compensation, discipline and access to benefits and training.  We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world‚Äôs most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified‚Äôs machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  Riskified‚Äôs Growth team plays a key role in defining and executing the company‚Äôs expansion strategy. We are looking for an enthusiastic, highly intelligent individual to join our team as a Director of Strategic Accounts: a role that combines sales, consulting, strategic thinking, and business analysis.  In this position, you will take on leads of potential strategic clients, develop relationships with the largest 50 eComm merchants in the US and Canada, identify their unique needs and challenges, and drive adoption of Riskified‚Äôs solution. You will collaborate with other teams at Riskified to ensure a seamless on-boarding process, and use insights from client feedback to improve our service and offering.  What You'll Be Doing Work closely with potential clients, demonstrating a consultative approach to directly drive Riskified‚Äôs revenue growth Receive leads from, and work together with our BD Team to manage sales pipeline and follow through with presentations, negotiations, and contracts Provide strategic analysis and critical thinking as we plan long-term expansion Represent Riskified at industry events and sales meetings with potential clients around the world Develop a deep understanding of the payments industry and build relationships with key players in the space Create and articulate compelling value propositions around the Riskified solution Qualifications 8+ years of B2B enterprise closing experience managing end-to-end sales cycle with experience with B2B enterprise sales, tech companies, and/or a hyper-growth B2B SaaS startup (payments and eCommerce enablement industry) Experience in a role that requires rigorous business analytics and/or strategic thought (management consulting, finance, business analysis, etc.) is a plus Naturally analytical with a strong passion for persuasion Someone who loves to quantify the qualitative Superb written and verbal communication skills as well as interpersonal skills Problem-solver, resourceful, someone who thrives off of autonomy Ability to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Ability to work in a fast-paced sales environment with minimum supervision Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for other than practical training Life at Riskified  We are a fast-growing and dynamic tech company with 650+ team members globally. We value collaboration and innovative thinking. We‚Äôre looking for bright, driven, and passionate people to grow with us.  COVID-19 Update Our NYC team is currently working remotely. If anyone prefers to work in our office, we‚Äôre happy to offer an option to do so safely. When the situation improves, we‚Äôre looking forward to adapting a hybrid of remote and in-office work for all our team members. We‚Äôre growing at a rapid rate and have transitioned all our interviews to Zoom. Some Of Our NYC Benefits & Perks Fully-covered medical, dental, and vision insurance from your first day Equity for all employees, 401(k) + matching, commuter benefits Catered lunch, fully-stocked kitchen, team events, happy hours, birthday celebrations Yoga, pilates, soccer league, wellness classes Wide-ranging opportunities to volunteer and make an impact in local communities Commitment to your professional development with global onboarding, sales bootcamp, skills-based courses, full access to Udemy, lunch & learns Awesome Riskified gifts and swag! In The News  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  Fortune Magazine: 25 Best Workplaces in New York  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Built In NYC: 100 Best Workplaces  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Riskified is deeply committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

jobTitle: Sales Leader - Health Plan Life Sciences
description: Sales Leader ‚Äì Health Plan Life Sciences  At NTT DATA we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees have been key factors in our company‚Äôs growth and market presence. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.  NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Sales Leader for our Health Plan Life Sciences (HP/LS) segment from Dallas to California.  We seek an HPLS Sales Leader to execute our go-to-market strategy and lead sales and business development initiatives to expand growth within existing customers as well as secure new logos. This individual will partner with other NTT DATA leaders and internal solutions and support organizations to execute the sales strategy focused on growing market share in this market vertical.  Need someone with an expertise in Health Plan but will lead a team of Health Plan and Life Sciences Sales.  Responsibilities: Execute the go-to-market strategy Coach and promote continuous development of the Sales Executive team Generate, contribute, track and manage new sales and account plan formulation Engage interdisciplinary account teams (BD, Finance, Marketing, Legal, Recruiting, etc.) to ensure successful workflow process and support Act as senior resource to Sales Executive team to include meeting with prospective, existing and former clients to assist with sales process when needed Promote solution-selling, value add techniques to identify business needs, develop customized solutions, and establish ‚Äúbusiness partner‚Äù relationships at customer‚Äôs C-Suite Manage sales tracking, attainment of sales goals and reporting of sales goals and results Promote an entrepreneur, hunting sales environment focused on increasing market share and continued brand recognition Will also have individual quota   Additional Requirements: Health Plan industry knowledge with solid understanding of industry trends, solutions, and business drivers Relationship/Experience in selling to North America based Health Plan Life Sciences organizations. Background in developing and successfully managing sales organization strategy resulting in enhanced market penetration and increase market share Experience building, managing, and measuring a full cycle, virtual/geographically dispersed sales organization with annual TCV more than $500M Demonstrate a history of building strategic relationships, selling and closing complex deals focused on demonstrating value-add solutions across customer‚Äôs enterprise Position requires travel  Basic Qualifications:  5 plus years of Sales Management in the Health Plan industry to include specific leadership responsibilities (hire, measure, develop, etc.) Minimum 10 years of sales experience in Health Plan Industry   Please send resumes to leslie.wingate@nttdata.com  About NTT DATA Services  NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.  NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.  NTT DATA, Inc. (the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law.
