description: US Regional Sales Director (NE, KS, CO, TX)  ROLE OVERVIEW  Quantum Genetix applies genomic information to solve challenges facing the agriculture industry.  They take genomics beyond the traditional breeding decision and through biological innovation and digital technology, are harnessing data to make critical management decisions to capture unrealized value. This position will play a crucial part in establishing and driving the growth of Quantum Genetix‚Äô products to feedyards and ranchers throughout the US.  As well as being a sales focused position, one of the key objectives of this role is to showcase the way in which Quantum Genetix employs their expertise, new innovations and technology to overcome production barriers in a simplified and efficient way.     RESPONSIBILITES  The focus of this role will be to implement Quantum Genetix‚Äô newly launched feedlot technology called Q-sort. Most of the time will be spent visiting feedyards and key stakeholders, to gain an understanding of their operations and how Quantum Genetix can best deliver technology and value to them. Have a deep understanding of the cattle feeding industry and stay up to date with market trends. Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships, often outside of regular business hours. Create and implement strategic sales and marketing plans that successfully achieve sales targets. Communicate Quantum Genetix‚Äô value proposition by conducting effective meetings and presentations. Create awareness and demand for Quantum Genetix‚Äô technologies across the livestock industry and driving marketing and network opportunities. Work in collaboration with feedyards and ranchers to identify new opportunities to increase sales with Quantum Genetix. Be a representative for Quantum Genetix‚Äô interests and manage partner relationships to ensure successful growth and development in the region. Collaborate with and interact as a key member of industry for the Quantum Genetix team. Represent Quantum Genetix at industry events, trade shows, conference and field days. Utilize online marketing platforms to further enhance sales, marketing and brand recognition of Quantum Genetix.  SKILLS & ATTRIBUTES  Strong communication skills and socially adept to interact with clients and teammates in a courteous and professional manner in person, via email, virtually or on the telephone. Deep understanding and experience in beef production chain is necessary with intimate knowledge of feedyard operations and production. Previous front office feedyard experience an asset. Be effective at communicating and utilizing problem solving skills to interact with customers. Be a self-starter that can seek new clients and manage obligations while travelling. Ability to earn client trust and build lasting relationships. ‚Ä¢      Excellent time management and organization ability. ‚Ä¢      Have established networks within US beef industry. ‚Ä¢      Adept at working in highly fluid, complex, ever-changing environments. ‚Ä¢      Have previous experience and success in the sales process. ‚Ä¢      Strong listening, negotiating and presentation skills. ‚Ä¢      Understanding of feedyard management and interpret the data generated. ‚Ä¢      Ability to understand technical information and technology specific to the beef industry. ‚Ä¢      Willingness to perform additional functions and duties across the company as needed. Computer skills are essential (MS Office, PowerPoint, understanding of social media platforms). Be driven to succeed, interested in challenges and personal growth, with a general openness and positive attitude.  EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS  ‚Ä¢      Agriculture, Animal Science or related degree pertaining to animal production. ‚Ä¢      Ability to conduct business in English. ‚Ä¢      Minimum of 5 years of successful experience in strategic roles within the beef industry with experience in leadership and account management. ‚Ä¢      Strong existing reputation and relationship within the beef industry and key defined segments. ‚Ä¢      Experience and knowledge in the latest technology and software in the agriculture sector is an asset. ‚Ä¢      Have a current and valid driver‚Äôs license.  ‚Ä¢      Possess a passport and willingness to travel, including weekends and evenings.  SALARY RANGE             Commensurate with experience, competitive with industry average.   ABOUT QUANTUM GENETIX  We are an agricultural technology company that strives to make genomics simplified for agricultural producers. Through applying genetic information to farming and livestock management we are continuing to re-shape how ranchers and feed yards evaluate and unlock animal performance. We have integrated genomic information with market variation, input costs and the needs of producers to provide insights to finish cattle more efficiently.   Our cattle genomic technology includes  Q-sort:        digital platform that utilizes market data, pen feed calculations and individual animal genetics to determine optimal harvest date and maximize feeding margin.  Q-select:     identify 4 unique and specific performance traits to increase IMF, marbling, REA, grading scores and docility.  A key aspect in achieving increased herd improvements within two generations.  Q-link:        cost-effective parentage testing, that identifies sires in multi sire pastures, critical for understanding bull battery performance.  HOW TO APPLY Send your CV and letter of interest or relevant recommendations to beef@quantumgenetix.com

jobTitle: Director of Sports Sales & Marketing, NIL
description: Job Description  As the Director of Sales/Strategy for NIL in our Sports Division at Endeavor, your primary goal will be to strategize, source, negotiate, and service athlete deals on behalf of our agency‚Äôs clients ‚Äì specifically our collegiate NIL athletes across all sports. On a daily basis we speak to brands directly, ad agencies, and to third party talent brokers to discuss ways we can partner our talent with brands to the benefit of both. These partnerships include traditional advertising campaigns (TV commercials and Print), licensing, and non-traditional forms of advertising and marketing outreach such as PR campaigns, brand sponsored personal appearances, digital content and social media.  III. Essential Functions Originate, direct, develop and implement marketing schemes, methods, and strategies through the use of our existing client roster Develop, manage and nurture new business partnerships to accomplish revenue goals Effectively communicate and present research to key stakeholders (agents and clients) across the organization and provide strategies to target new opportunities Possess and present a solid understanding and track record of developing sound marketing strategies and opportunities that drive revenue Act as a representative for an athlete when negotiating a new contract, contract extensions, or endorsement signings Review market trends and the latest contract signings, make offers and counteroffers Explain contract details to players while keeping the athlete‚Äôs best interests in focus Oversee Player Marketing and Promotional Strategies Assess and Sign New Talent Scout/assess new talent and contact players seeking representation V. Minimum Qualifications / Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 10+ years of equivalent experience within the sports, media and sales landscape Proven experience leading and negotiating commercial sales opportunities Thorough understanding of data analytics, marketing and brand enhancement Stay atop of brand needs and opportunities Work closely with existing agents to explore and capitalize on client marketing opportunities Comprehensive understanding of established and emerging social platforms, and the tactics required to influence audience these platforms Showcase intimate knowledge of marketing strategies and idea generation, to partner negotiations to program execution and ROI measurement VII. Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Broad knowledge of marketing, sales principles and practices, in sports, media and entertainment Strong relationships with senior level executives across brands and agencies Ability to create and develop innovative marketing ideas which directly support the achievement of brand awareness and client revenue goals Effective communicator who has proven selling and relationship skills with internal and external constituents at all levels Must have strategic agility, organizational ability, and successful track record for building effective relationships Must have analytical, planning and decision-making skills along with demonstrated fiscal responsibility and business ethics Forward thinking and strategic mindset are a must Demonstrated success developing and launching innovative marketing ideas, driving brand consideration and preference using different marketing vehicles (TV, print, digital, social media, experiential, promotions, etc.) Creative mind, well versed in shepherding big ideas, ideally has been involved in developing and producing branded awareness Ability to demonstrate a unique approach to problem solving with a business, brand and consumer lens Demonstrated ability to understand and activate concepts/programs cross-functionally Proven ability to interact with people at all levels of an organization, fostering strong cross-functional teamwork and results Endeavor is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

description: Imagine when You are a vital member of our growth-minded, industry leading, innovative, brand-driven, global employee-owned company. You are challenged to grow, expected to challenge others, are part of something much bigger than yourself, and leave an indelible legacy through the people your life has impacted.  You are leading, building and developing our expanding Southeast Regional sales team, bringing our award winning brands, CAMO, PRO-FIT and STINGER to our network of channel partners, installers and end consumers.  Aligned with each brand‚Äôs unique purpose, your team will execute its assignment of driving brand awareness and the adoption of our innovative products to support our aggressive geographic, channel and company growth plans.  And most importantly, while other things are growing around you, you grow as a person. How cool is that.  About us We are an employee-owned company and a proud part of the American building materials industry for nearly 60 years. We have a storied history of innovation, which many say is in our DNA. We agree. From product to brand, to sourcing to customer-centric solutions, we constantly ask the ‚Äúwhat, why and how‚Äù questions that many are afraid to ask.  In 2021 we were recognized by Inc. Magazine as an American Best Workplace. One of 429 companies nationally to be recognized and only one of 11 in the building products industry. A recognition that is truly humbling, yet at the same time, we know National Nail is a pretty special place to be part of.  Our core brands of CAMO, PRO-FIT, and STINGER are the ‚Äúasked for brands‚Äù in their respective segments, and can be found at the finest names in the LBM, Roofing, Home Center, Distribution and STAFDA channels of the building industry and more recently, through our E-Commerce presence.  Our brand users are the hardworking folks who build things with their hands, and just like us, are business owners. They build our homes, our decks, install our roofs and depend on our brands to support them in delivering a job well done.  Our company's reason for existing Whether supporting our customers, suppliers, employee-owners and their families or the communities in which we live and work, our purpose is simple; inspire whoever we engage with to help them become better. Better people, families, businesses, and ultimately leave better the communities in which we live in. We get this is a moonshot reason for existing. Yet it is one we are committed to.  Our culture Servant focused Founded on Four Cornerstones, 8 character traits and a simple operating philosophy of Serve ‚Ä¢ Better ‚Ä¢ Value ‚Ä¢ Fun. High standard, embraced by a dedicated team of employee-owners who enjoy the fruits of hard work while having a ‚Äúbit of fun‚Äù along the way. Growth-minded, driving the intentional investments in developing our people and our customers and our communities. Innovative  Your assignment You will be expected to drive the needed growth in our sales organization. This team stretches across The Southeast and is composed of growth minded folks who work together. You will be the key face and voice of our company to our customers and those you lead.  This is not an assignment for a first timer. We are seeking a seasoned sales leader who will challenge our leadership team, our sales team and our customers.  Aspire to our 8 character traits. Possess proven experience as a Regional or Director level Sales Leader. You aspire to someday be a Vice President. Value time in the market over time at the office. Be respected by the customers you‚Äôve served and teams you have led. Convert end users from one brand to another. Have a deep working knowledge of CRM toolsets. Be comfortable casting vision and helping customers see what they hadn‚Äôt Challenge and support our large customer relationships and engage in all major growth opportunities. Development and leadership of a mission driven sales team. A team that demands the same of you as you do of them. Creation of clear experiences that will continually ‚Äúpull‚Äù our users in, to learn and want more of our brands. Superior collaboration skills enabling you to partner with internal teams like marketing, inside sales and brand management. Be skilled at launching new brands and products. Hungry. Competitive. Possessing a never quit spirit.  You must be passionate about brands and be able to build one Think of a brand you love. You use it over and over again. You count on it. It delivers every time. So, you engage with it, every time. It may be something as simple as your toothpaste, or coffee. Could be a clothing line, golf clubs or choice of car you drive. Regardless, there is something about that brand experience that calls you back.  It will be impossible for you to achieve this leadership assignment without ‚Äúgetting‚Äù the endearing value of our brands. Our brands don‚Äôt fit into someone else‚Äôs ‚Äúfinished good‚Äù. They embody a unique experience inviting the user to return ‚Äì again.  You must love challenges and thrive on them Our brands exist to improve the experiences that end-users have. We change how work is done! And changing how work is done is a challenge.  This won‚Äôt be easy. You won‚Äôt win them all. Can you take a punch? Do you learn equally from success and failure? And then get back to the mission?  Is this in your DNA? Do you thrive for this challenge?  You must be an outstanding person and teammate and elevate those around you We believe the best ‚Äúbuilding‚Äù moments at work are the moments when we build things together with our teammates. Are you a good teammate? Do you get that you will be part of a company story and vision that is much bigger than you? Are you a great encourager? Are you teachable? Coachable? Correctable?  We demand great teammates. Are you one? You must be humble, competitive, and phenomenal at listening.  Minimum requirements Strong proven performance in sales leadership Ability to perform at both a strategic and hands-on tactical level. 10+ years of related industry sales experience. Innovative and creative thinker. Skilled communicator with a powerful public speaking presence. 10+ years of brand experience focused on end users. Strong customer service orientation that drives a culture of customer appreciation and service excellence within the team and externally. Building materials/contractor experiences a necessity. Flexible with the ability to quickly adapt and re-prioritize in a continuously changing working environment.  So, if this is an assignment, culture, brands and industry you desire to explore further, contact us. Your new adventure awaits.
industries: Building Materials

description: Lookout is an integrated endpoint-to-cloud security company. Our mission is to secure and empower our digital future in a privacy-focused world where mobility and cloud are essential to all we do for work and play. We enable consumers and employees to protect their data, and to securely stay connected without violating their privacy and trust. Lookout is trusted by millions of consumers, the largest enterprises and government agencies, and partners such as AT&T, Verizon, Vodafone, Microsoft, Google, and Apple. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lookout has offices in Amsterdam, Boston, London, Sydney, Tokyo, Toronto and Washington, D.C.

description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in Italy (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. description: Mazooma is a payments technology company on a mission to simplify payments. As a leading solution in both sports wagering and iGaming, our patented technology can be found on the cashier of industry-leading brands such as DraftKings, BetMGM, theScore, and PartyPoker. In August 2021, Nuvei, a global payment technology provider, acquired Mazooma, giving clients access to an even greater suite of fintech solutions.  Offering a best-in-class experience, seamless integration, state-of-the-art risk management, and secure bank connections, Mazooma creates raving fans of both merchants and consumers. We are looking for world-class people to join us in delivering leading-edge solutions to an industry experiencing exponential growth.  As a VP Sales, ACH & Online Banking, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei‚Äôs products with specific focus on the Northern America market. The Senior Business Development Manager will have an in-depth understanding and proven track record within the fintech industry or related technology-based complex selling environments.  Key Responsibilities: Lead a team of 4 FTE focused on key verticals ‚Äì Financial Services, E-Commerce & Travel Experience and understanding of Open Banking model in North America Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Actively understand the prospects business and global payments footprint, their strategic growth plans, and competitive landscape. Present large scale technical products and innovative solutions to prospects at C-level. Introduce Nuvei‚Äôs technical, operational, and strategic resources at the appropriate stages of the sales cycle to move opportunities forward. Develop sales partnerships for both direct and indirect sales. Negotiate contracts in a complex selling environment between various stakeholders. (business, legal, procurement, finance, etc.)  Preferred Qualifications: Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Proven success in complex C-level negotiations, including all technical, compliance, legal and commercial aspects. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications: Minimum seven years‚Äô experience, five of which must be selling directly in a technology or payments solution environment. Complex solution selling (i.e., experience selling or delivering software or services that required the end client to realign certain business processes). Demonstrated success with large transactions and lengthy sales campaigns in a fast-paced, consultative, and competitive market. Pipeline management and forecasting experience. Ability to travel (once Covid crisis is over). Financial modeling and contract negotiation experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits: A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Mazooma does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

jobTitle: West Zone Sales Manager, Pharmaceutical Diagnostics
description: Job Description Summary  Lead the Western US Commercial Sales Team organization, defines and implements the product strategy across multiple channels and partners. Responsible to grow profitability of the franchise, focused on both commercial and operational aspects. Key metrics of success are: sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share. Key role in the global organization, including R&D and product management, suggesting product portfolio evolution and creating business opportunities to leverage & improve products/brands equity.Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is a global leader in imaging agents, used to improve and enhance the images that radiologists use to diagnose and monitor disease. We support healthcare professionals in the administration of neurology, cardiology and oncology procedures that are used to image three patients around the world, every second.  Job DescriptionRoles and Responsibilities   Lead and implement the Sales for the western region, managing overall sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share in a manner that fulfills business and achieves targets. Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources. Strong background in working with cross-functional department within a business. Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision. Manages a small to medium team of senior professionals as well as others. Lead the management team in the region, ensuring strong collaboration between Sales and functions including Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Commercial Operations. Optimize the use of resources to cover market potential to achieve the operating plan. Know, interact and develop the strategy with Key Opinion Leaders and decision makers in product relevant scientific areas; manage professional relations with key Customers to ensure understanding of needs and that GE Healthcare product value proposition is differentiated in the minds of these key Customer groups. Nurture relationships with professional society stakeholders.  Required Qualifications   Education to bachelor‚Äôs degree level, in relevant scientific area. Minimum of 3 years of Management experience Minimum of 6 years in the the Healthcare industry Ability to travel 30% to40% of the time  Desired Characteristics   Exemplary people management, leadership skills, as well as sales coaching, and team building skills. Demonstrated business management and resource allocation skills including business plan development. Change agent with energy, passion and enthusiasm to drive change. Ability to translate strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly. Ability to communicate and present ideas to Customers in a way that produces understanding and impact that builds effective strategic relationships. Strong business acumen; financial and organizational skills. Advanced negotiation, problem solving and influencing skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Description  Position at Springhill Suites Denver Fitzsimons at Anschutz Medical Campus  Come Join Our Team!  Commonwealth Hotels, LLC. is a superior hospitality management company with a "world-class" culture. We are a leading franchisee, committed to providing outstanding services to our guests through attention to detail, with integrity, pride, and intensity.  Currently we are looking for a top performing Director of Sales.  What is in it for YOU? Medical, Dental, Vision- DAY ONE! 401K with a company match! Vacation/ Personal days & Holiday pay Hotel Room and Food and Beverage Discounts Travel Discounts for Travel and Food and Beverage Personal Days Off Online Training Courses Commonwealth University (Grow your Career in hospitality) Referral Program and Bonus Flexible Health Care Spending Account Day Care Flex Spending account Direct Deposit Jury Duty Leave Bereavement Leave Employee Assistance Program Associate of the Month/Associate of the Year/Service Awards Free Basic Life & Basic Accidental Insurance Voluntary Life Insurance Products for Self, Spouse and Dependents Some Key Areas of Responsibilities include: Develop hotel's selling strategy and maintain inventory levels according to market demand and competitive strategy to maximize hotel room revenues. Develop appropriate SRP's and Inventory levels to achieve established goals. Track denials and turndowns to ensure strategy fits market conditions. Maintain a working knowledge of sale and front office operations. Resolve guest complaints appropriately to maintain a high level of guest satisfaction. Requirements: Strong interpersonal skills. Possess telephone etiquette skills. Ability to handle guest complaints. Commonwealth Hotels was founded in 1986 and quickly became a superior hospitality management company with a world-class culture, sought after for our exceptional guest and associate satisfaction, market premiums, superior return on investment and a "Whatever It Takes" attitude. We are a leading franchisee of Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt brands. Commonwealth Hotels, home office is in Covington, KY and led by industry executives who have worked together for more than 30 years and have over 100 years of combined experience with hotels and city clubs in all markets across the United States. Our Mission at Commonwealth Hotels is accomplished by providing quality Products and Services to our guests through Attention to Detail, Integrity, Pride, and Intensity in all we do. This allows us to develop a special relationship with our guests, associates, and owners, carving out our niche in the marketplace. These actions across the board result in superior sales and financial performance.  As a Company we believe the true success of our operation rests with the associates who bring life to the bricks and mortar. A great hotel or club is created by great people who perform their job to the best of their ability and are always friendly and helpful to guest. The attitude of our associates all our associates is the mark which sets us apart from other management companies. As the property becomes known for its quality of service and attitude of its associates, the opportunity for growth and security on the personal level is enhanced. A quality operation begets quality people and this combination in turn yields satisfied guests.  At Commonwealth Hotels, "We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. Employment is decided on qualifications, merit and business need." EOE/Drug Free Workplace

description: Company Description  Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that‚Äôs built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID¬Æ, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon‚Äôs award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world‚Äôs top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg.  Job Description  About CitrusAd  Launched in 2016, CitrusAd was purposely built with a retailer-first focus creating incremental revenue opportunities through a best-in-class technology platform and a services division to create and develop leading Publisher Monetization programs. This winning combination of tech and highly experienced services allow us to unleash the potential of online shelf space, where CitrusAd effectively turns retailer websites into highly targeted and effective marketing platforms - changing the way in which retailers, advertisers and customers manage and experience e-commerce.  Just 12 months after its product launch, the CitrusAd platform was adopted by more than 36 global retailers in 22 countries reaching more than 300 million customers through 30 billion website page views.  CitrusAd is globally headquartered out of Brisbane, Australia. Our North American headquarters is in St. Petersburg, Florida. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and many of our team members work remotely in many areas of the world. In North America, a large majority of our team is located in Florida with many others in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York, Atlanta, Pennsylvania, Toronto-CA, Vermont and more.  At CitrusAd we run on collaboration and teamwork. We‚Äôre committed to fueling our team members‚Äô passion for creativity, community involvement and work/life balance. After all, it‚Äôs our people that take us from great to incredible. If you thrive in a creative, fun, teamwork atmosphere, this job may be for you!  Characteristics We Look For An eager, go-getter with a roll up your sleeves ‚Äúget it done‚Äù approach A desire to learn, grow and develop within your role and the organization Genuine interest in digital and the power of effective marketing Your Role and Impact to Success  Purpose  The Senior Director or Director of Sales role will be positioned as a part of our growing retail media team specifically within our newest retailer team, Lowe‚Äôs. This team member will drive sales and manage client relationships in the Home Improvement, CPG and / or Electronics categories across our Sponsored Product and Display Ad technology media platform. The ideal candidate should have a proven history of exceeding sales goals and existing in-roads with media contacts in these categories and agencies. Past experience in ecommerce media and sponsored search are a plus.  Duties And Responsibilities Generate revenue and strive to exceed target quota Utilize networks & tools to identify & contact prospective supplier contacts Offer smart client research, trends & ideas (i.e. valid business reasons) to drive interest & cultivate relationships Dissect each brand organization to uncover different rivers of funding (shopper marketing, brand, ecommerce, national media agency) with the intent to simultaneously unlock and elevate each relationship Own a room (even virtually) ‚Äì present dynamically and instill confidence to challenge our clients in a kind, smart and creative way to ensure we are doing what is best for both businesses long-term Analyze campaign performance statistics and recommend performance enhancements Collaborate with internal teams (account management, ad operations, creative, analytics, development) to ensure a seamless experience for both the retailer & suppliers Communicate with retailer teams regarding ‚ÄúVIP‚Äù account outreach, pipeline, messaging + SKU prioritization, URL confirmation, etc. Track outreach & sales activity pipeline using HubSpot ‚Äì participate in a weekly pipeline call with the retailer Qualifications  Strengths  With a focus on sales strategy and operational excellence, this role will require: Working knowledge of retail, eCommerce and digital monetization programs Proficient knowledge in digital ad monetization & sales Strong leadership qualities ‚Äì trust, loyalty, empathy, forward thinking, self-starter Clear, concise and proactive communication skills + prompt response times Strong organization skills ‚Äì proving the ability to prioritize to ensure deadlines are met Ability to problem solve focused on being solution oriented Qualifications 5+ years‚Äô experience in advertising, media sales and/or business development Comfortable with DSP, DMP, PMP terminology & discussion BA/BS degree in marketing, business or related field Post COVID travel to Lowe‚Äôs HQ and/or Supplier/Agency offices Additional Information  Great People, Deserve Great Benefits  We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon‚Äôs policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.  Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.  For San Francisco Bay and Los Angeles Areas: Epsilon will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles‚Äô Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901-4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.  REF122290R

description: Department  Press Books Marketing  About The Department  Since its origins in 1890 as one of the three main divisions of the University of Chicago, the University of Chicago Press has embraced as its mission the obligation to disseminate scholarship of the highest standard and to publish serious works that promote education, foster public understanding, and enrich cultural life. Through our books and journals, we seek not only to advance scholarly conversation within and across traditional disciplines but, in keeping with the University of Chicago's experimental tradition, to help define new areas of knowledge and intellectual endeavor.  Job Summary  The Global Sales Director is responsible for overseeing and managing the sales operation of the University of Chicago Press Books Division worldwide. The position is based on the University of Chicago‚Äôs Hyde Park campus.  Responsibilities Develops and implements strategies to increase sales and revenue of Chicago‚Äôs front list and backlist. Leads the work of selling books from Chicago, as well as from marketing and sales client publishers, to the trade, including overseeing the work of sales reps and personally selling some national accounts. Conducts sales analysis at the individual title and Press-wide level. Oversees the management of global inventory and logistics for Chicago, working closely with the Chicago Distribution Center. Working with the International Sales Manager, manages relationships with sales groups and international distribution centers worldwide. Along with the Marketing Director, makes decisions about pricing, discount, and print runs. As part of the Editorial Committee, assesses potential books and makes recommendations about publishing plans and strategies. Conducts research on comparable titles and market conditions. Manages and analyzes sales through Amazon, including, with the Inventory Manager, overseeing our use of KEP/CreateSpace, and, coordinating with the Targeted Marketing Manager, working to maximize and analyze the effects of paid marketing, pricing strategies, and metadata enhancement efforts. Working with the Marketing Director and the E-Book Manager, analyzes library sales and develops plans to improve sales and revenue. Investigates and pursues special and bulk sales opportunities. Oversees the creation and use of the seasonal catalog in Edelweiss. Attends trade shows. Manages six staff members, which currently consists of an International Sales Manager, three domestic sales representatives, an Inventory Manager and Sales Analyst, and a Sales Assistant. Plans, develops, designs and implements the strategic and tactical marketing plans for a department or program. Directs, monitors and evaluates marketing communication and research programs. Maintains departmental priorities, allocates resources, and determines project direction in line with established priorities. Performs other related work as needed. Education  Minimum Qualifications  Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.  Work Experience  Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 7+ years of work experience in a related job discipline.  Certifications  Preferred Qualifications  Education Bachelor‚Äôs degree. Experience Ten years of publishing experience. Preferred Competencies Deep knowledge of book market and publishing landscape. Facility with standard book industry sales reporting tools and techniques. Understanding of sales analysis and forecasting techniques. Strong writing and communications skills. Working Conditions Some travel. Required Documents Resume/CV (required) Cover Letter (required) When applying, the document(s) MUST be uploaded via the My Experience page, in the section titled Application Documents of the application.  Job Family  Communications  Role Impact  People Manager  FLSA Status  Exempt  Pay Frequency  Monthly  Scheduled Weekly Hours  37.5  Benefits Eligible  Yes  Drug Test Required  No  Health Screen Required  No  Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required  No  Posting Statement  Applicant Inquiry Form. Applicant Inquiry Form The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity /Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.  Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.  We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.  All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history.A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment.Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position. description: Job Description  The Director, International B2B & Wholesales Sales is accountable to build the International Sales Division for Cost-U-Less. The Director will lead the profitable sales growth of our B2B/Wholesale business in the Caribbean and Pacific Islands within the strategic directions and tasks provided by the President. Acting as the face of our brand, this position ensures the careful representation of Cost-U-Less by thoughtfully identifying each of our new B2B/Wholesale partners and developing new business partners throughout the island markets currently served as well as developing new markets. The day-to-day work includes planning, developing, and implementing action plans by market to ensure increased sales volume. Reviews product mix, selling price and margins. Keeps current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators and competitors. Monitors costs, competition, and supply and demand while building and maintaining strong, long lasting customer relationships.  Joining The North West Company International (NWCI) gives you the opportunity for growth and development throughout the company, an attractive and competitive salary and benefits package, and to be part of a dynamic and diverse culture.  NWCI is a leading retailer to under-served rural communities and urban neighborhood markets in the following regions: Northern Canada, Western Canada, rural Alaska, the South Pacific islands, and the Caribbean. Our stores offer a broad range of products and services with an emphasis on food. Our value offer is to be the best local shopping choice for everyday household and local lifestyle needs. Check out northwest.ca for more information.  Key Accountabilities Conducts research and travels markets not currently served to identify best prospects; continuously look for new business opportunities in both new and existing markets. Analyzes markets and competition and proposes short, mid, and long term strategies for regions and company as a whole to keep the company competitive and innovative. Develops, negotiates, and manages sales agreements to maximize company profit. Coordinate sales planning with all functions departments of company with close relationships in P&M and Logistics Budget and deliver monthly and yearly sales goals and control expenses per direct account. Develop and plan yearly and seasonal sales plans ensuring ambitious sales growth plans are met in accordance with business plan. Accurately forecast future sales and forming sales plans to adapt to constant shifts in the marketplace. Works with existing locations/B2B reps to increase opportunities in existing markets. Manage customer satisfaction through regular direct contact with customers to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction and return business. Will develop a team of 1-2 people over time and have a dotted line for B2B reps in existing island locations. Desired Skills & Experience  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Proven sales experience of meeting or exceeding targets. A minimum of 5 years previous experience as a sales executive with wholesale/retail business to business sales and service experience; working knowledge of retail operations as well as supply chain operations regarding import and export processes; sourcing and vendor negotiation and relationship cultivation at an executive level. Intermediate knowledge and ability using MS Office Suite and above with intermediate computer abilities for database management and report creation/generation. Ability to meet all country or region immigration regulations and have valid documents to meet these qualifications Ability to communicate, present, and influence all levels of the organization. Proven ability to articulate the distinct aspects of products and services. Ability to drive sales process from strategy, execution, closing, and follow up. Able to correctly manage time to meet deadlines and targets Ability to quickly adapt to new working environments, situations, and cultures Proven ability to position products against competitors. Excellent written, verbal, listening, negotiation, and presentation skills. Must be able to travel extensively and work with a flexible schedule. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or Secondary Education in Business Management or equivalent combination of education and a minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience preferred. A positive attitude Ability to relate and align all duties, customer interactions, and other activities to an underlying business purpose Excellent customer service skills and ability to communicate clearly and effectively Resourceful and skilled in problem solving Superior organization skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and be able to prioritize deadlines Detailed and process oriented and possess critical thinking skills General leadership and mentoring skills MS Office Suite experience including above average knowledge of Excel Knowledge of general island retail practices and purchasing needs by local businesses. What we need: Logikcull has been growing rapidly as it ascends into the enterprise. We are now at the point where we are ready to double down and hit the accelerate button and increase our market penetration. We are looking for a passionate, data-driven Sales Development Manager to help accelerate new business and expansions pipeline across the Enterprise space by building, coaching and managing a team of SDRs.  This is an opportunity to build a team in your image from the ground up and ensure that your team is directly responsible for the next stage of growth! Reporting directly to the Chief Revenue Officer, you will be at the helm of a SDR team that is focused on creating opportunities for our sales team to run with and close.  The problem We live in a world where data is no longer information. It‚Äôs noise. It‚Äôs multiplying by the second. It‚Äôs ALL discoverable. And it‚Äôs making legal discovery -- the process of searching and reviewing evidence for disputes and investigations -- a total nightmare: complex, insecure and extremely costly. Logikcull‚Äôs powerfully simple cloud-based software automatically organizes and culls the data noise to help quickly find the signal. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs the go-to solution for more than 1500 in-house legal teams, law firms and government organizations who rely on it to make discovery insanely fast, affordable and secure.    About us Our mission is to accelerate the democratization of powerfully simple discovery software. Today, the discovery process is compromised by the explosion of data in disputes and investigations -- 97% of which is noise, completely irrelevant to the matter at hand, and making discovery ridiculously expensive. By empowering organizations of all kinds with user-friendly, self-serve software that automatically organizes and culls the noise, we‚Äôre disrupting an $80 billion dollar industry, helping ensure that people and businesses get a fair shake in our legal system, and making access to information fast and affordable for all.  What you‚Äôll do Hire, train and lead the Sales Development Representative (SDR) team  Work to ensure Sales and Marketing alignment and integrate the SDR motion into our overall ABM and demand generation motions Build a strong knowledge of our buyer personas, product offering, target accounts and competitors Work with the sales and marketing teams to create effective business development playbooks and templates Monitor and experiment SDR cadences and outreach methods to identify and replicate best practices and ensure our qualified meeting goals are achieved Develop and optimize sales processes and tools to implement end-to-end lead funnel management Own and manage our sales outreach tech platform to ensure that we are focusing on curated, high quality, tailored messaging directed specifically at our ICP and target accounts. Build reporting in our tech stack to monitor SDR's performance and analyze results Provide management with SDR performance, pipeline creation, and target account coverage reports Own the career development and planning for the SDR team Manage the lead and account lists to ensure that we are surfacing the best, most highly targeted prospects to SDRs  Requirements: Strong background as a SDR leader managing an outbound, enterprise focused team in a high-growth SaaS environment Experience with an outbound target account motion and inbound/outbound follow-up Expert in both managing data and maintaining its integrity Experience in lead funnel management, lead creation, delivery and tracking processes Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills  Strong experience successfully managing and developing a remote teamProcess and data-driven with a strong analytical mindset Ability to work from home with a reliable internet connection and distraction-free environment  Characteristics we seek: Smart, and not arrogant Humble, and hardworking Entrepreneurial, not risk-averse Nice, and not disingenuous Grit, and lots of it!  Our core values: Start with the why Put the customer first Pursue powerful simplicity Do the right thing Be S.H.E.N.G. (see characteristics above)   Our Perks: Logikcull covers 99% of medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and dependents 401K plus matching Equity in a growing startup Flexible PTO 100% remote/distributed workforce in US, Canada and UK  Phone and Internet subsidy New Baby program including 14 weeks for birth parent, 8 weeks for non birth parent(s), two weeks of meals and house cleaning services  Unlimited reimbursement for professional books & annual stipend for conferences / higher education Peer recognition program (called LogikProps) with accumulated points to be cashed in for gift cards, merchandise, cash, or donated to worthy cause  Membership to Calm, a meditation app  Half-day Fridays!  Logikcull is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, sex, age, sexual orientation, military and veteran status, registered domestic partner status, genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Across digital, podcasts, TV, streaming, live events, and print, we tell stories that affect our audience's daily lives and entertain as much as they inform.  Our portfolio features influential and respected editorial properties including Vox, New York Magazine, The Verge, The Cut, Eater, Vulture, The Strategist, Polygon, SB Nation, Intelligencer, Curbed, Grub Street, and Recode. Off-platform, the Vox Media Podcast Network offers one of the largest collections of popular podcasts, and Vox Media Studios produces and distributes the award-winning nonfiction shows. Powered by innovative technology that scales quality, the Chorus publishing platform and Concert advertising marketplace answer the always-changing needs of modern audiences, creators and marketers.  Vox Media has been named one of Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄúMost Innovative Companies in Media,‚Äù an Inc. ‚ÄúCompany of the Year,‚Äù Digiday‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Company for Parents,‚Äù and one of the Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign.  As we continue to grow our portfolio of brands, products and services, we are expanding our sales leadership team to support this continued growth. This leadership position will play a key role in our Growth sales organization and we‚Äôre looking for a talented, proven sales leader to take on this exciting challenge.  Reporting directly to the VP of Sales, the Director of Sales, Growth will lead a team of driven sales professionals helping our advertising partners to unlock the full potential of their brands through a unique blend of premier content offerings, high-value audiences, and cutting-edge technology. This leader will strategically manage, develop and direct the team to achieve aggressive sales targets and revenue growth from new business including mid-market prospects and clients.  This is a high-energy job, requiring proven leadership, persistent and persuasive interactions with clients, deep digital and content expertise, and the ability to work collaboratively with internal teams and senior management to achieve broader company goals.  What you‚Äôll do: Lead a team of digital media sales professionals to achieve and exceed revenue goals Effectively manage team pipeline to ensure revenue goals are met Forecast quarterly, and annual revenue targets to sales leadership on a weekly basis Work with team to navigate complex marketing challenges, identify opportunities to grow existing accounts to facilitate stronger relationships and increase revenue Play vital role in scaling new business generation across different categories Manage senior-level relationships with partners and develop a thorough understanding of their business challenges Consistently deliver market feedback to internal stakeholders Bring unique perspective and relationships in emerging industries Enjoy problem solving in a fast past, evolving environment Provide leadership, guidance and teach strong sales skills Attract, recruit, train and retain exceptional sales talent Collaborate with Directors in the Growth organization as well as other managers, directors and leadership across the revenue organization Maintain a positive team culture while motivating the team to achieve goals What you will bring: 10+ years experience in sales, 3+ years in a sales leadership role with a proven track record of effective leadership Deep passion and knowledge of digital media, technology, the competitive landscape and the industry's key issues An entrepreneurial spirit High emotional intelligence Hunger to exceed revenue goals A proven ability to develop new business A well established network within the advertising industry Demonstrated ability to function and communicate effectively at senior levels Excellent coaching and training skills Strong analytical skills to identify team trends and patterns to drive business results Exceptional communication skills Passion for the Vox Media portfolio of editorial brands and innovative advertising solutions About working at Vox Media:  This is a permanent, full-time position with excellent benefits‚Äîincluding flexible hours and generous parental leave. Vox Media strives to provide comprehensive healthcare options for our employees and to ensure that our healthcare and other benefits are LGBTQ-inclusive. You'll be joining a group of focused, hard-working, creative people who are passionate about doing work that's challenging and fun‚Äîand who strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance.  Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. Assist in the post-sale transition from sales to the professional services team. You'll Need To Have  What we‚Äôre looking for... Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Knowledge of Cloud vs. On-Premise deployment. Experience with Video Management Software, Video Analytics and Sensors. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have one or more of the following: A degree. Experience identifying, documenting and articulating the business and technical requirements of a prospective customer during the full sales cycle ‚Äì qualification, proposal, post-sale transition. Experience communicating software ability to address prospect‚Äôs requirements through compelling presentation (written, oral and product demonstrations) of the applications. Experience with Databases. Experience with Application integration. Experience in Networking. Experience public speaking. Subject Matter Expert in one of the following industries: Manufacturing, Energy, Transporation, Retail or Education. Knowledge of underlying sensor components such as data ingestion, camera technology, AI, ML, DL, and big data. Experience promoting technology innovation with leaders at large tech companies. Compensation  Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401 (k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives,we‚Äôve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.  If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the compensation range for this position is between $121,000 and $225,000 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.  Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more. description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in Nordics (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within Nordic merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Nordic languages will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

description: Director of Sales Job Description  Job Summary:  At VestorPRO, our mission is to change people‚Äôs lives through real estate investing! We provide the coaching, systems and processes needed for our students to become successful real estate investors. Our coaching, materials, tools and courses come from years of personally and actively investing in real estate.   VestorPRO is seeking to hire an Inside Sales Director to build, hire, oversee and lead the activities of all Inside Sales. This will include but not limited to building a highly successful Inside Sales Department. You must have a burning desire to succeed, be extremely driven, and highly motivated and not willing to settle for mediocrity.    The ideal candidate will assist our students in building their goals and vision and help them set for their future. The director will provide his/her expertise, accountability, motivation and demonstrate dedication to the students' success.   To allow our team to remain at home with their family and abide by our core values, our company is virtual in all aspects and the inside sales team will be built and led virtually as well. We utilize daily zoom meetings, Facetime calls, Email, as well as slack and other methods of communication to ensure we stay well connected. We have a very strong sales department at our monthly events, now we are building the inside sales team to follow up sales for the packages and courses ranging from $500 - $40,000 each. We are also building new sales funnels to provide daily warm leads for you and your team to close. This is a new department, but we are not a new company. We have been in business since 2016, and Glenn and Amber have been in the Real Estate Investing space since 2006. Glenn has been a full time entrepreneur and business owner for over 30 years, since he was 19. Amber and Glenn live what they teach.   Since you are working side by side with the owners, please research them on their site at GlennandAmber.com as well as our marketing brand HomeFlippingWorkshop.com. This is where most of the non-buyer leads (non buyers at the event) will come from initially.    This position is not a sales position, it is a leadership position. If you are unfamiliar with the concept of visionaries and integrators, please review the book, ‚ÄúWhat the heck is EOS?‚Äù to better understand this relationship. We will be slow to hire as we are searching for that one special person who is willing to commit to a long term career to build something very special together, and feel incredibly accomplished as we change lives together, including yours and ours. We fully expect this person to be earning a strong 6 figure income inside of the first 12 months, and to grow it each year as we grow and expand as a company. We are looking to build a team of highly skilled sales people, not a room of telemarketers. We only work with the best and that is what we are looking for when filing this role, The Best!   Your core values MUST align with ours.    With your leadership and hard work we will build this department from start up to exceed $20,000,000 in annual revenue. This is a very exciting and rewarding position for the right person. Our visionary leaders are looking for a strong, hard working integrator to make their dream a reality.  Supervisory Responsibilities: Build, hire and train Inside sales team.  Hold each member accountable for daily results   Organize and oversee the schedules, territories, and performance of the sales team. Conduct performance evaluations that are timely and constructive. Handle disciplinary action and/or termination of employees in accordance with company policy.  Duties/Responsibilities: Execute the owners vision listed above Provides strong leadership to the inside sales team. Motivate, inspire and encourage the sales team to meet or exceed all monthly quotas. Reviews and analyzes sales and operational records and reports; use data to project sales, determine profitability and targets, and identify potential new markets. Identify and analyze customer preferences to properly direct all sales efforts. Assigns territories and sets quotas for the inside sales team. Consult with students to understand their needs; identify and suggest new programs that will help students achieve their business goals without them feeling like they are being ‚Äúsold‚Äù. Resolve student complaints, staffing problems, and other issues that may interfere with efficient sales operations. Work side-by-side with CEO/Founders (Glenn & Amber Schworm) on monthly sales goals Prepare a sales budget. Performs other duties as assigned.  Required Skills/Abilities: Excellent sales and customer service skills with proven negotiation skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong supervisory and leadership skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.  Education and Experience: Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred 5 years experience in virtual sales leadership Seminar & course sales experience a plus Experienced Real Estate Investor preferred Small business owner preferred Comparable record of sales leadership experience required.  Job Type: Full time $80,000 - $90,000 base salary plus sizeable commission 1099 Independent Contractor Remote Bonus opportunities  Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Emotional toll of working with and leading sales people all day

Description  The Head of Global of Sales Development will own Mavenlink‚Äôs outbound lead generation function. They will be focused on defining and executing a global strategy targeted at developing sufficient pipelines to meet and exceed company sales targets. The right candidate has a proven track record of both building and leading global teams in prospecting and strategic planning and is passionate about amplifying client acquisition, developing sales funnels, and working in a dynamic environment.  Responsibilities Builds and manages a large global team of Business Development Representatives (BDRs), ensuring the entire function hits lead generation targets (quality and quantity) that match revenue forecasts and goals. Owns the sales process from lead generation to lead nurturing which encompasses the following stages: Stage 1 (Initial Contact); Stage 2 (Sales Accepted Opportunity); Stage 3 (Sales Qualified Opportunity). Develops and executes a comprehensive outbound lead generation strategy and works closely with key leaders in Marketing, Enablement, Sales, and Business Operations ensuring the strategy stays on course and is adjusted as needed based on business conditions. Responsible for collaborating with Business Operations, Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, and various internal teams to communicate targets and performance. Ensures clear and constant communication of goals and success metrics to the organization to deliver consistency and accountability. Drives performance against pipeline goals, ensuring sufficient pipeline to achieve sales goals. Identifies and implements effective growth opportunities for outbound lead generation. Defines and tracks lead forecasts and conversion rates. Focuses on team/individual development and enabling upward talent mobility within Sales & Services organizations. Develops the entire BDR talent supply chain. Motivates team. Guides team on how to progress their career through effective coaching, training and development. Required Skills And Experience 7-10 years of sales leadership experience with a lead generation focus (or relevant initiatives). Proven experience building, scaling, and managing a global BDR team of 50+ members in both a startup and mid market / enterprise SaaS company. Expert and viewed as the authority on lead generation. Proven leader, motivator, and coach with teams of varying levels of experience. Collaborative, team player who can adapt to a fast paced ever changing environment. An analytical minded person who is passionate about numbers and data. Experience working in a fast-growth technology company, developing and executing on strategic initiatives. Experience working with complex solutions and creating brand awareness. Possesses the ability to translate business objectives into effective lead generation strategies. Strong project management skills; comfortable running various sized projects driving people, process, and technology-related initiatives. 30% travel required to Mavenlink‚Äôs office locations in Irvine, Salt Lake City, Boston, London, and Melbourne.
