description: We are hiring multiple Sales Directors in the US and Canada to join our aDolus Team!   Sales Directors will have a significant impact on our business by creating new growth opportunities for aDolus. You will have primary responsibility for outbound sales and will proactively contact potential customers and manage select inbound leads. We are looking for Sales Professionals with great communication skills, business acumen, and a flexible mindset.  This is a great opportunity to join a rapidly growing cybersecurity start-up that solves a critical challenge related to the software supply chain.  Initial Duties and Responsibilities:  Acquire new logos and partners Meet or exceed the monthly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas Manage the entire sales cycle through contracts and transition to Customer Success  Develop and manage the sales funnel: Research, identify, contact, and present to relevant stakeholders  Generate qualified appointments with decision-makers Communicate our value proposition, generate interest, and qualify intent Convert leads to sales opportunities  Receive, respond, and qualify inbound leads Maintain a funnel of high value leads at 5X goal minimum Leverage in-person meetings, digital sales, social media, and HubSpot CRM Progress and expedite all opportunities through the sales cycle  Coordinate and perform product demos for qualified sales leads Attend select conferences to represent aDolus and drive top-of-funnel Take direct responsibility for assigned strategic customer engagements Submit standard metrics, such as weekly pipeline, funnel, and monthly reports   Requirements:  Previous experience in a start-up or early-stage company Hunter mindset: motivation and drive Existing, relevant Rolodex of contacts (OT, ICS, IoT, IIoT, IT)  Self-starter with a proven track record of closing six or seven-figure agreements Experience in the cybersecurity (OT, ICS) industry (preferred) Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills Ability to communicate effectively in person, over the phone, videoconference, and email Experience managing contract negotiations Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Energetic, passionate, and self-sufficient with a can-do approach Ability to develop excellent relationships and network Results-driven sales leader

WorkBoard  Work with purpose.  WorkBoard‚Äôs mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard‚Äôs platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.  WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space ‚Äì it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.  THE OPPORTUNITY  As a Regional Sales Director, you‚Äôll be a key player in driving the adoption of WorkBoard within a defined geography targeting F2000 companies. You‚Äôll own building trusted growth advisor status with P&L owners who have strategic priorities and urgency to achieve them while positioning and driving preference for our platform.  You‚Äôll gain a deep understanding of WorkBoards‚Äô Sustainable Growth Model and how our platform supports P&L owners #1 goal of impacting company valuation by driving growth through alignment and accountability. You will be a key member of the Sales Team that will be achieving 3X+ yr/yr growth while solidifying the preeminent position in a new category; Enterprise Results Management.  Your work will also include collaborating with the leadership team to identify demand generation, messaging, sales enablement and sales execution best practices.  COMING IN  Bring 7+ years of C-Suite business application value-based selling and start-up experience, an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset, and a relevant degree from a great school. Experience working in a fast paced, high growth start-up is a plus as is an MBA from a great school.  YOU'LL BE SUPER SKILLED AND EFFECTIVE AT Articulating differentiated solution value to enterprise buyers and customers before, during and after they purchase your business application solution Quickly building trusted advisor status with P&L owners by demonstrating your business acumen, intellectual curiosity and passion for solving substantive business issues Consistently exceeding your sales targets by executing both land and expand sales motions in net new and existing customer engagements in an Account Executive or similar role for a SaaS business application company. Working at a fast pace while demonstrating professionalism and the attention to detail that is required to support sales engagements with enterprise P&L owners Partnering with peer teams across marketing, professional services, customer success, development and finance to build a company that is great in your customers‚Äô eyes WITHIN ONE MONTH YOU'LL Attend new-hire immersion training to build a deep understanding of our buyers, their pain points, our solution offering and how we work well as a team Attend the WorkBoard OKR Coach Certification program to gain a deep understanding of the OKR methodology and its relevance in the Enterprise Results Management category Review fifteen first meeting recordings and shadow five first meetings with sales leadership Internalize five customer case studies and be able to confidently use these in first meetings Be converting first meetings with P&L owners based on your ability to deliver WorkBoards‚Äô value messaging Be highly proficient at demonstrating the WorkBoard platform to P&L owners and business process owners to support our differentiation Develop a territory plan with the support of the Growth team to identify and execute targeted ABM into your top 20 Named Accounts WITHIN THREE MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a trusted advisor to P&L owners as they engage with WorkBoard to accelerate their growth strategies Have developed a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities >$1M ARR and you will have achieved your first quarter sales target Have attended WorkBoard Super User training to deepen your proficiency in the WorkBoard application Be tapping into your network to help bring fantastic talent to WorkBoard WITHIN SIX MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a key member of the WorkBoard Team for the partnerships that you have established with our customers as they achieve their growth strategies Be contributing valuable insights and ideas to the WorkBoard Team on ways that we can accelerate and enhance value realization for our customers Be overachieving your sales target and managing a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities within your Named Accounts in excess of $3M ARR THE TEAM  You‚Äôll join one of the best category building sales organizations that is regularly meeting with P&L owners to impact their growth objectives. You have the support from exceptional Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement and Thought Leadership Marketing teams that are accountable for providing qualified leads, sales content and category creation activities that are all aligned to ensure your success.  We are remarkably engaged with our customers, so you‚Äôll have immediate access to their insights and voices. Everyone on the team is striving to improve the value and quality of experience we provide customers by delivering at our best and being voracious learners. We are an incredibly supportive team, with powerhouse creative and production team members who quickly bring marketing ideas to life.  We are excited about a lot of things‚Äîwhat ‚Äúbest‚Äù looks like for our customers, what ‚Äúbreakthrough‚Äù looks like in our platform‚Äîand we share these passions across the company and with our customers.  OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 H‚ÄôS  Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team  a Few Of Our Awesome Benefits Flexible PTO & sick days Paid holidays Health insurance 401K with employer matching Quarterly All-Hands Meetings And much more! THE WORKBOARD STORY  WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates‚Äô contributions, then come join us!

description: Our 25 year old company manufactures and sells sophisticated online monitoring systems for a wide variety of critical applications primarily in the life sciences (hospitals, laboratories, pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers) but also those involved with air and water quality. Although we are small, we have provided monitoring solutions to some of the largest enterprises in the country and compete favorably with our largest competitors. We are looking for a person with experience in the life sciences but with training in marketing and sales to help us grow our business to meet our full potential.  Responsibilities Develop sales strategies to achieve business and sales goals Hire sales managers and provide coaching on the company's sales strategies Organize visits to key accounts and be involved with presentations describing upgrade paths using our latest products Monitor industry trends and market competitors to support sales goals Assist the marketing team in developing and implementing strategic marketing campaigns Provide sales forecasts to company management  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant area 7+ years' of real-world experience in the life sciences in an operational role or in marketing and sales Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite

description: VDO.AI is seeking motivated sellers to join our growing sales team in New York. As a Sales Director for VDO.AI, your primary focus will be to promote the sale of our platform to key agency and client accounts throughout North America.  Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To The Following : Prospecting and closing business with a targeted list of agency and advertiser accounts Developing strong, mutually beneficial relationships with clients Working closely with internal teams to ensure a united vision when corresponding with clients Representing VDO.AI in the online marketplace and becoming an active Brand Advocate Meeting quarterly and annual revenue targets Working closely with internal teams such as Account Management, Sales Planning and Publishing to ensure client campaign expectations are clear, on time, and on budget Ensuring a high level of client satisfaction to generate renewals and increase incremental revenue at all times Experience/Background : 8+ years of digital media sales experience is required, ideally within mobile or video Experience at a DSP, trading desk, or ad tech company will be a plus Previous technology platform experience a huge plus Deep relationships with VP level and above contacts at top-tier agencies and advertisers ABOUT VDO.AI :  VDO.AI empowers all segments of the Digital TV Ecosystem. We are structured to provide the full breadth of solutions the advertising industry needs to achieve their goals across all streams and all screens. We provide the technology, data enablement and convergent marketplaces required to ensure buyers and sellers can transact across all screens, across all data types, and all sales channels, in order to ensure the ultimate goal results for marketers.  We bring together the best in media and technology. We drive creative innovation to create the world's best digital video consumer experiences across all screens and all streams. We set a high bar with a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses while generating career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines.  With offices in New York, California, and India, VDO.AI is poised to be one of the largest Video distribution companies in North America.  We're committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, and represents employees across a variety of skill sets. We embrace contributions from all ages, sexes, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations and gender identities.  We are at an inflection point in our North America business expansion and are moving at an amazing pace, thanks to our incredibly diverse teams and collaborative culture of entrepreneurial people. All of whom contribute to our cutting-edge products and services reaching millions of consumers a month.  If you share in our passion for true collaboration, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the growth and next incredible phase of VDO.AI, we want you to fast-forward your career with us.

As the Director of the Inside Sales Team, you are a highly motivated leader with a passion for sales, technology and working with people. You help OnLogic achieve aggressive growth targets by directly overseeing OnLogic‚Äôs inside sales function and ensuring that revenue goals are met. You are a mentor and coach to our strong sales team, to whom winning, collaborating and having fun is the job. OnLogic is growing rapidly; you therefore have a unique opportunity to develop and implement our Sales strategy and keep it in line with the long-term company goals. You will be a full-time team member located in the Cary, North Carolina office.  This is what your day looks like. You: Coach and direct the work of multiple inside sales teams who are responsible for selling organizational products or services through many channels. Establish sales quotas for teams and individuals and tracks performance against expectations. Oversee all aspects of sales order management. Manage US sales forecast process. Establish specialized or targeted sales strategies or calling plans. Provide competitive assessments, product or sales training, or pricing and contracting assistance to the sales team. Develop and oversee outreach goals, activities, resource planning and reporting for the Inside Sales Team. Manage, lead and develop a team of highly motivated, customer focused sellers Develop and implement sales and go-to-market strategies that meet/exceed overall corporate goals. Plan and direct all inside sales for your team, including planning and implementing forecasts, staffing, and team training. Manage and monitor key sales pipeline and performance indicators to ensure financial goals. Conduct regional sales forecasts, territory planning, demand generation, deal strategy development, and trend analysis. In addition to leading the team, you may maintain direct customer relationships and grow key accounts in order to lead by example. Travel 10%-20% of your time with your team members to our North American customers.  Requirements You have a minimum of 10 years sales experience in the IPC/embedded industry or an industry very closely related to OnLogic. You have at least 5 years of sales team leadership experience with a team of at least 5 people. You have a Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field. You have a proven track record of your team meeting and exceeding their goals. You have experience in creating and managing incentive plans. You have demonstrated the ability to thrive in a fast paced work environment with shifting priorities. You have demonstrated the ability to quickly and efficiently learn new processes. You have excellent active listening skills, as well as strong written and verbal communication skills. You have demonstrated the ability to hold yourself and others accountable are essential. You have a strong business acumen: the ability to succinctly describe an opportunity and how to win. You have outstanding consultative selling abilities and customer acquisition skills. You have excellent interpersonal skills and experience in managing executive level customers and partners. You have the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to nurture a results-driven, team-oriented environment. You have experience with a specific sales methodology and sales funnel management, as well as in choosing, deploying and using marketing and sales tools.  Who we are looking for:  The ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong business sense, entrepreneurial mindset and are engaged by sales drive. Successful candidates will thrive in a fast paced, goal oriented environment. You are an empathetic leader who understands that sales is not about being the loudest in the room, but about the right mixture between critical listening and formulating the right questions. We are not a one size fits all shop; our customers have very different application needs, and no one system works for all so knowledge of our products is essential for your success.  Why OnLogic?  OnLogic is growing, and we're offering you the opportunity to grow with us! At OnLogic you'll join our ambitious team, guided by our core values. We operate in an open environment, which extends to everything from our open salary policy and open office layout, to our commitment to having open and honest conversations about all aspects of our work and culture.  We strive to be fair in the decisions we make and the way we treat one another while encouraging input and feedback from every member of our team. Innovation is vital to our continued growth, and we depend on every team member to take initiative and ownership of both their own, and the company's success. At OnLogic you'll have the opportunity to truly build the future of technology while building your own career.  Benefits A competitive Salary and comprehensive Benefits package 401k Plan with 3% Employer Safe Harbor Contribution Participation in the Annual Profit Share Bonus Paid Maternity & Paternity Leave, and Short & Long Term Disability Optional Employee Stock Purchase Plan Open ears for innovations and ideas A personal development plan created to help you (and us) grow Incredibly awesome colleagues, fun working environment and serious responsibilities  Who is OnLogic?  A global industrial PC company focused on hardware for the IoT edge, OnLogic designs highly-configurable computers engineered for reliability. Our systems operate in the harshest environments and power innovation in the evolving Internet of Things. Fueled by a unique direct-to-customer business model that combines vertical integration, modular product design and a powerful online platform, we create computers ‚Äúdesigned to last, built to order, and delivered in days.‚Äù Founded in 2003 as Logic Supply, OnLogic has served more than 70,000 customers and has offices in the US, Netherlands, Taiwan, and Malaysia. Learn more about how builders, makers, and doers are making the impossible possible using OnLogic hardware at www.OnLogic.com or on Twitter @OnLogic.  OnLogic is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Check us out on Glassdoor for actual reviews from current employees and applicants.

description: Tevora Business Solutions is looking for an experienced Account Director (sales) superstar that is a good fit for our team. This senior-level sales position is responsible for new accounts development and expanding existing accounts. As an Account Director, you would be the face of the company and would be responsible for acquiring new customers, communicating the company's story, and driving top line revenue and gross profits by selling the company's products and services. You would be passionate about our value proposition and truly believe you can help in making our customer's initiatives successful. An expert in your field, you would know your products and our services inside and out and would leverage internal resources to add real value to our clients. As an Account Director, you would also be an expert in your vertical as well as your territory. You should be well networked and knowledgeable on industry initiatives. Territory experience is a must! Of primary importance, you would build relationships with customers and sell them multiple solutions throughout the year. You would be in front of budget cycles by being proactive in executing sales plans. About Tevora Tevora Business Solutions is a leader in IT security consulting with a focus on Compliance, Risk Management, Threat Management and Technology solutions. We primarily serve Enterprise/Fortune 1000 customers. Key Responsibilities Responsible for meeting and exceeding assigned GP quota of $1.1M+ Responsible for managing and growing account relationships, building future sales pipeline through demonstrated account and territory planning, and closing deals on a monthly and quarterly basis. Ability to work with a consulting team to close complex security opportunities at the C-Level Partner with key vendor representatives to identify and close security software and hardware opportunities Must be capable of closing software and service contracts in the $50k-$2M range. Qualifications Abilities Passionate about the security industry Knowledgeable across a wide range of technical disciplines to include:Regulatory Compliance Enterprise Risk Management Penetration Testing Knowledgeable about vendors in the security industry to include:Security Operations solutions Governance, Risk and Compliance solutions Advanced Threat, Behavioral Analysis, Next Gen endpoint solutions Communicate effectively across business and technical boundaries Work independently without detailed guidance  Experience 5+ years work experience in security consulting or technology sales Consistent over quota achievement Understanding and working knowledge of IT and Networking Direct selling expertise, 'hunter' mentality Working knowledge of channel sales model Formal sales training (Miller-Heiman, Sandler, Solution Selling etc.) and proven proficiency in implementing selling skills Strong business acumen and professionalism. Leadership, accountability and self-starter qualities required Excellent customer focus, strong attention to detail and ability to operate in a dynamic sales organization required  Education and Credentials Bachelors Degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field from a competitive 4 year university  Personal Qualifications Relationship focused Well networked with their peers Passion for security Presentable Personable Excellent written and spoken communication Punctual Professional  Other Qualifications Valid driver's license and reliable car No bankruptcies or negative reports on credit report No criminal record Successfully pass background and credit check  Benefits Comprehensive Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance Paid Vacation  Tevora is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description: South East Sales Director The world needs our help. By 2050, there will be 9 billion people on the planet with less arable land than ever before. We need a solution to cultivate more using less and define the future of farming for generations to come. In 2004, AeroFarms began transforming agriculture with humans and our planet at the forefront. In 2021, with 20+ current patents, 60+ pending patents, and 200+ invention disclosures, AeroFarms agriculture technology continues to grow unprecedented sustainable products, delivering elevated flavor, taste, experience, quality, access, and unmatched nutrition to you.Here‚Äôs how we‚Äôre growing the best plants possible for the betterment of humanity:Researching and understanding plants to be better, more intuitive farmers Elevating local communities by increasing access to nutritious, high-quality, consistent, and safe products in a way that‚Äôs better for you and the planet Protecting and sustaining our environment for future generationsPioneering consistent, and scalable indoor vertical farming food safety & traceability practices, and manufacturing standards Investing in our AeroFarms humans and fostering our diverse company culture of inclusion, equity, excellence, teachability and curiosity https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pPX7ZS0wqWI]As AeroFarms approaches our next phase of explosive growth, we seek out creative, motivated humans who will join us in disrupting industry standards and lead the way in vertical farming, artificial intelligence, and plant biology breakthroughs to solve, and tackle global issues.If a team of 200+ intellectually curious and caring humans, expansive global operations, and our change-the-world mission resonates with you, apply today:AeroFarms is seeking a Sales Director ‚Äì SE Region. Position Summary:  Southeast Sales Director is responsible for building strategic relationships in the southeast for the Danville expansion, with the goal of authorizing, merchandising, tracking, reporting, and selling of AeroFarms branded retail products as well as excess yield to partners.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Directly manage the retail sales customers inclusive of regional / boutique grocery, and distributors, and independents. (Example: Safeway East, Harris Teeter, the Fresh Market, Publix, Costco, Mom‚Äôs)Partner with key retailers to implement and drive Danville retail strategy at both store, and buyer levels.Develop & manage credible relationships with regional / boutique grocery, distributors, and brokers.Lead relationships with key distributors and brokers to deliver both column & revenue targets.Identify short- and long-term growth opportunities within existing and new retail customers from both the innovation lens and existing portfolio.Ability to problem solve at store shelf and commitment to bring creative solutions to real-time business opportunities.Own forecasting for assigned accounts in conjunction with customer logistics and participate in the development of the account tactical planning. Develop a strong understanding of competitive leafy green landscape and ability to effectively communicate competitive insights through formal/prepared/regular monthly presentations.Ability to guide AeroFarms analyst on customer weekly sales reports on assigned customer accounts.Qualifications:  Preferred 7+ years retail sales and merchandising experience either through employment.Must have clean driving record with ability to be traveling by car within 200-mile radius.General understanding of the consumer package goods retail landscapeAbility to prioritize and manage time effectively, while thriving in a consumer facing environmentExcellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Relationship building and management at department, store manager, and buyer level.Analytical skills translatable to insight driving presentations.Collaborate on trade spend analysis at customer level ROI.Ability to calculate margin and mark-up. Strong/proficient with PowerPoint and ExcelMotivated and enthusiastic with a passion for achieving success (winning).Perform other duties as may be assigned inclusive of deliveries, samplings, product cuttings, or industry events.Leads food service & outlet customer supply chain to ensure the entire farm is sold, every week throughout the year and years ahead... feeding our communities with everything we grow.Education/Experience:7+ years sales, strong preference for fresh produce experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred, but not requires. MBA not required.Track record in delivering strong sales and customer development into new geographies.Hunter mentalityPersonal AttributesCollaboration - we know we cannot fix the worlds problems as an individual, we have to work together as a team to make that happen. Teamwork is how we get there! Communication - we are a small company (in relative terms 200 employees), we work well together because we communicate well with each other. You must demonstrate why our mission is important to you: everyone who works at AeroFarms has a strong link to the mission: we want to hear why it means something to you!Agility What we do has never been done before: we are an innovation company, there is no right or wrong way to do things, we constantly develop how we operate, we can always elevate what we are doing and never claim to have it right. Accountability - we don‚Äôt micromanage, we hire individuals who know what they need to do and can do so with minimal direction and take ownership of their projects and deadlines. Respect We are already starting our journey scaling around the world: we want our team to represent every kind of individual out on plant earth and we need to respect different people, different ideas, different cultures etc. We can learn so much from each other, but respect is keyEmpowerment - we provide an environment for growth and development: we need your help to develop our business, we will help you develop in your career, and sky is the limit given our growth plans!! *Please note that AeroFarms does not work with any external staffing/recruitment vendors. Any unsolicited resumes shared with the AeroFarms team will be considered property of AeroFarms and no recruitment fees of any kind will be paid or owed unless an existing recruitment agreement exists alongside with specific engagement for the role in question.Powered by JazzHR

description: About Carrot  Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility benefits provider for employers built to make fertility care and family-forming affordable and accessible for everyone who wants or needs it. Companies use Carrot to customize a fertility benefit that provides employees financial, medical, and emotional support as they pursue parenthood, reducing healthcare costs and resulting in better clinical outcomes.  The Role  Carrot is seeking a Partnerships Director to lead Carrot‚Äôs commercial/channel partnerships strategy. The Partnerships Director will be responsible for developing Carrot‚Äôs commercial partnerships strategy, identifying new referral/resale partnership candidates, negotiating all aspects of the contract and ensuring the partnership‚Äôs ultimate success.  The Partnerships Director will focus on commercial referral and resale partnerships, excluding health plans. These could include healthcare navigators, wellness platforms, benefits administration providers, etc. The idea candidate brings experience structuring comparable deals and a perspective on the types of partners that would elevate Carrot‚Äôs market reputation and help grow our business.  Key Responsibilities Develop a partnership strategy for Carrot, including key categories to target, commercial positioning, etc. Pursue or respond to partnership opportunities, collaborating with Sales, Product and Legal to align the necessary elements. Own contract negotiations, partnership implementation and ongoing support Partner to design and deliver the necessary internal and external training to ensure partnership success  The Partnerships Director role is an exciting opportunity to build a strategy from the ground up, and have a significant impact on the commercial growth of a rapidly growing health technology company that is on a mission to empower all paths to parenthood.  The Team  The Partnerships Director will partner closely with a designated Solutions Consultant, and will report to the VP of Sales.  Minimum Qualifications 2-3 years in a similar commercial partnerships role Experience working in the digital health or benefits technology industry Understanding of the Benefits ecosystem Perspective on the critical commercial terms of resale/reseller partnerships  Preferred Qualifications 3-5 years in a similar commercial partnerships role 5+ years in the health technology or benefits space is preferred Proven track record of establishing successful partnerships Strong established industry relationships  Why Carrot?  Founded in 2016, CB Insights recognized Carrot as one of the world's most promising private digital health companies. In 2020, Carrot was named to Fast Company‚Äôs World Changing Ideas awards program, which recognizes companies that are tackling society's biggest problems, and Carrot was named to Fierce Healthcare‚Äôs Fierce 15 List of 2021 which recognizes the most promising healthcare companies in the industry. Carrot supports 250+ companies in more than 60 countries across North America, Asia, Europe, South America, and the Middle East.

description: Terradepth is advancing the collection and distribution of ocean data to the next level and has an opportunity for the right individual to drive the engagement and development of our business in all facets of commercial ocean data markets. We are looking for a highly experienced Business Development and Customer Relationship executive who understands the requirements for and has a track record of building service revenues pertaining to offshore survey, mapping, asset monitoring data collection and delivery. This position is responsible for increase in new and existing business opportunities, managing customer relationships, input to product roadmaps and strategic planning for and future execution in commercial markets.  Skills Requirements: ÔÇ∑ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Management, Engineering or related field ÔÇ∑ At least 10 years of experience in core sales experience, partner channel development, business development, alliance management in the ocean technology industry  ÔÇ∑ Understanding of offshore survey and data requirements for vertical sectors including Offshore Energy, Environmental, Telecommunications, Mining, Construction and R&D ÔÇ∑ Experience with cloud technology platforms including SaaS/DaaS product offerings and cloud-based customer access ÔÇ∑ Strong track record of developing and delivering on go to market strategies ÔÇ∑ Experience with domestic and international business development and customer relationships ÔÇ∑ Broad understanding of market players, competitors and innovators ÔÇ∑ Grasp of Autonomous technologies and operations including AUV‚Äôs, ROV‚Äôs and sensor systems ÔÇ∑ Knowledge of offshore development and regulatory issues ÔÇ∑ Experience working with multiple virtual teams across functions and geographies ÔÇ∑ Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills. ÔÇ∑ Strong business acumen, including data-driven research and market analysis. ÔÇ∑ Understanding of enterprise software and hardware space, including cloud, storage, networking and application platform ecosystem players.  Business Acumen: ÔÇ∑ Experienced at communicating business strategies and objectives at an executive level ÔÇ∑ Skilled with sizing, forecasting, analyzing and delivering revenue results across market verticals ÔÇ∑ Able to conceive and articulate complex business proposals, presentations and constructs, externally and internally ÔÇ∑ Skilled at building and managing technically oriented Business Development, Sales and Support organizations ÔÇ∑ Ability to define, manage, and document customer activity ÔÇ∑ Familiar with CRM systems, P&L principles and finance  This is a ground up position reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer. You are responsible for establishing your market approach, developing business, building a cross-functional team and establishing performance metrics and quotas in the aforementioned markets. This position is focused on directing, mentoring and reporting the activity of a professional sales and business development team, establishing objectives and methodology focused on obtaining both individual and team goals.  Additional Involvement: ÔÇ∑ Direct involvement in shaping the Company‚Äôs marketing objectives and activities ÔÇ∑ Working to help improve the overall operations planning and efficiency ÔÇ∑ Product development and long-term product strategy

About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  As a Strategic Partnership, Regional Director you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you!  What You'll Do Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of named accounts by cold-calling and professional networking Build productive long lasting relationships that continue to pay dividends through trusted references in your market Be relentless about meeting personal and team sales targets Research accounts and follow through on sales leads while developing a strategic territory business plan Working with Side leadership to sell at the most strategic level and implementing a definitive strategy to showcase our value proposition to independent brokerages, large teams and unique real estate business models Keep an up-to-date understanding of a dynamic real estate industry and local market WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE? 8-10+ years of full-cycle sales experience (commercial or enterprise) Real estate industry knowledge and domain expertise is a plus A proven hunter and closer Strong top of the funnel engagement skills Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Creative sale techniques and pipeline management A passionate influential sales style Success positioning and selling on benefits instead of feature/function Strong communication, collaboration, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, highly confident, and driven Compensation/Perks Competitive salary plus bonus opportunity Equity options Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental) Flexible PTO $1,000/year for learning and development Pet friendly environment Side is dedicated to working with the highest skilled people from the most inclusive talent pool feasible. We maintain that diversity in all aspects leads to positive change, solutions and innovation for our customers and career fulfillment for our employees. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Posted 6/2/2021  Director of Market Development, AMP Infrastructure  AMP Robotics is a rapidly growing startup on a mission to revolutionize the way we recycle. Positioned at the intersection of AI, robotics, and recycling, our solution matches deep learning and computer vision with robots that rapidly sort materials inside recycling facilities. We have already deployed our technology across the United States to dramatically reduce costs and increase the efficiency of recycling operations.  Our dedicated team is located just outside Denver in Louisville, Colorado, with views of Boulder's flatirons and the Rocky Mountains. With backing from top tier investors including Sequoia and recognition as a "Rising Star Company of the Year" in the 2020 Global Cleantech 100, we're looking for exceptional talent to support our mission.  AMP Robotics is looking for a Director of Market Development to drive commercial efforts and opportunities as AMP enters new businesses and markets. This role will originate and develop commercial deals/agreements and manage relationships with various players in the waste industry, including MRFs, reclaimers and others. This role reports to the Managing Director, Marketing Development and requires a deep background in strategic sales, new business development, closing multi party complex deals and a strong interest in recycling/sustainability, as well as flexibility and adaptability to the evolving needs of AMP programs, projects and organization.  Responsibilities: Quickly develop an in-depth understanding of AMP's business strategies and goals/objectives, key industry trends and players, economic and business models and potential partner goals and economic interests. Source, develop, negotiate and close multifaceted complex partnership deals that support AMP's business strategy and goals. Drive and coordinate deal/project efforts across x-functional internal and external partner organizations to strike mutually beneficial deals and get them closes. Develop and foster relationships and execute commercial agreements with national, regional, and local entities, from F500 enterprises to small, private mid-market companies. Manage complex relationships and business models/strategies with a quick and deep understanding of industry trends, technology advancements and emerging customer challenges and changes in the marketplace  Skills and Requirements: Senior, experienced and natural complex deal originator and negotiator. Expert at managing multi-party, complex partnerships, at multiple levels, across very different potential partners (sophisticated large public companies to small, independent private firms). Methodical approach (with sense of urgency) to manage, assess and execute multiple opportunities concurrently. Strong organizational and planning skills - Highly organized, able to simultaneously drive multiple projects and aspects of project development. Autonomous, self-starter/self-motivated - high-motor approach to execution and achievement. Self-motivated and outspoken about what is needed to get a job done. Strong financial acumen/skills with business model-orientation - Must be able to understand AMP business/financial requirements and partners to develop mutually beneficial deals. Track record of success in managing multiple priorities in an ambiguous environment. Excellent Communicator - Strategic listener, conscious conversationalist, and persuasive of people from a wide range of roles and backgrounds; Comfortable communicating with all types of stakeholders, verbal and written.  Education & Experience Required: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Finance, Business or related field. MBA preferred. 10+ years of business development, project development, origination and/or sales experience with increasing levels of deal size, complexity and strategic importance. Ideally, experience in waste management, recycling, renewables, power trading and/or origination. Strong interest in joining a dynamic, value-building environment and being part of a high-performing and collaborative team.  Working Location(s): Denver area headquarters or home office  Travel Requirements: 20-30%, including partner meetings, conferences, and home office visits  Salary & compensation information: $155,000 -175,000 On Target Earnings (75/25 split)  Benefits information: Medical - The company covers up 85% to 100% of the premium for Cigna healthcare plans depending on the selection. Employees pay the difference in premium if they select a more expensive plan. Up to 75% for dependents. 401(k) retirement plan (non-matching). Seven (7) paid holidays ‚Äì 7 company designated and 2 floating holidays. (salaried employees only) Referral bonuses for staff positions. Paid Vacation Leave ‚Äì Accrues at a rate of ~4.67 hours (0.58 days) per pay period (2 weeks) starting day 1. Unused PTO carries over each year with a 1-year limit. Paid Sick Leave ‚Äì 64 hours per year, given in full on start date, refreshes on anniversary.  Affirmative Action/EEO Statement:  AMP Robotics is an equal opportunity employer. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at the Company will be based on job openings, merit, qualifications, and abilities as required by the position. The Company does not discriminate, and does not permit its employees to discriminate against other employees, applicants, customers, or independent contractors because of: Race Color Religion Sex Sexual orientation (including gender identity or expression, including a person's orientation toward heterosexuality, homosexuality, bisexuality, or transgender status) Pregnancy, childbirth, and related conditions Marital status National origin Citizenship Military or veteran status Ancestry Age (40 or over) Disability (including genetic information) Or, any other consideration made unlawful by applicable laws.  Equal employment opportunity will be extended to all persons in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including recruitment, hiring, upgrading, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, discipline, layoff, recall, and termination.

description: Our Why We are torches that illuminate our client's dreams. Every product in the world is created by someone passionate about solving a problem and marketing is the only thing that will determine its success - or failure. A customer must know it is there to buy it and benefit from it. A bright and intelligently targeted beacon on a sturdy boat is required to bring attention to great ideas; without it will float away, untethered and into the weeds. We are that boat and beacon who carry ideas where they need to go and deliver them in ways that make customers salivate for more. We are on the hunt for a full-time A-player sales pro who has specifically worked in the PR, marketing, or news industry. This is an extremely specific peer-to-peer sale of a PR industry service that is used by account executives and account supervisors within PR agencies and by CMO‚Äôs and in-house marketers inside CPG brands.  Specifically, we seek a team member to convert a list of 18000 PR agency representatives to double our revenues by 2023. This person is being hired to grow our business, will work with our "pull approach" and daily in a trackable CRM system to measure success.  This is a position for a go-getter who will relentlessly make a minimum of 80 calls/touches a week and close 5 sales every month, at a minimum.  If you have worked for PRNewsWire, MarketWire, BusinessWire, Vocus, Cision, Distinctive Assets, any celebrity gifting suites, or related companies, this will a natural, fun and very lucrative job for you.  Part of an extremely focused 5-year growth opportunity, this is a key position to grow this segment beyond our already 26,000 strong list of CPG companies in our database.  This position requires 4 things:  1. A sales pro 2. Someone who can articulate the difference between PR and advertising and why it is valuable. 3. Is tech and social media savvy (extra points if you know Infusionsoft) 4. Has worked with, or for, some of the PR agencies listed above  We seek a sales professional who has equal abilities to: 1. open 2. overcome objections 3. and close  It is important this person actively uses social media for selling, has an online presence and knows their way around LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.  This team member must use, daily, a powerful database / autoresponder that serves as the backbone of our business. This is a robust CRM system with pre-templated sales materials, more than 26K leads, follow up sequences, lead tracking and more. We use Infusionsoft, which is not required for you to know in advance, but easy to learn. This person must be extremely comfortable using a technology day in and day out for all activities and reporting.  We provide leads, training on the product and our approach, as well as ongoing Sandler Sales Training and all sales materials.  Last, but not least, this person must be comfortable on the phone. Though we use email marketing as our primary outreach and social selling produces an exceedingly high hit rate, the old-fashioned telephone is a necessary business tool for success in this position.  CPE products range in price from $849 to $13,000. Spots at our virtual events sell for $3297, physical ones, $4250 and other services from $995 to $2000. We offer a salary of $40,000 - $50,000 + an extremely generous tiered 15-25% commission (that resets every 30 days), plus health insurance after a 6-month vesting period.  We prefer someone in Los Angeles who can work from our office 1x a week and from a home office the rest of the week but are open to a professional who is elsewhere in the U.S. Training emanates from our office in Malibu and can be done remotely.  If you are interested, please email a resume and cover letter. In your letter, we want to hear specifically about:  1. sales experience, specifically in PR, 2. your experience or ability to learn and use an online CRM system and 3. a paragraph on the difference between PR and advertising.  RESUMES THAT DO NOT INCLUDE A COVER LETTER WILL AUTOMATICALLY BE DELETED.

This role is fully remote, we set a location because some job boards require it.  The Role  Kasa offers flexible accommodations for guests in dozens of markets nationwide. We partner with multifamily and hospitality property owners to offer various unit types in our portfolio. The Director of Sales is a remote role that will be laser-focused on reaching out to corporate clients who will use Kasa locations as their preferred accommodations for short and extended stays. The role will involve building a sales team and a sales process, together with an implementation of the industry's best CRM tools.  The Director of Sales will report to the Senior Director of Marketing and work closely with the Distributions, Yield Management, Reservation, and Partner Success teams.  You will be responsible for the complete ownership of a new Sales department as well as the development and execution of a sales strategy for Kasa's portfolio, which may include creating national or regional specific strategies targeting all market segments, including business transient, groups, social, and others. An exciting part of this is being instrumental in changing the way corporate and group travelers view the flexible accommodations space.  Your background should demonstrate a commitment to excellence in building strong relationships with corporate accounts, developing, executing, and meeting sales objectives, and building successful sales teams.  About The Team  The Sales and Marketing team is dedicated to growing revenue at Kasa through all the channels, as well as growing Kasa as a distinguished accommodations brand. Our mission is to build a distinctive brand that has direct relationships with guests.  Day in the life of a Kasa Director of Sales  Like any role at a fast-paced start-up, there is no 'typical day'. To deliver on the role outlined above, we expect to start with a thoughtful planning process. Typically done quarterly, the planning phase includes setting or revising a long-term strategy to guide the team using the latest data and business circumstances.  In your first 90 days, you will tackle questions such as: What is the ideal organizational structure for the sales department? What are the quarterly and annual sales targets that we should create? How do we measure and track the success of our sales organization? What are the tools, systems, and processes that we need to create a strong sales department? As Kasa grows, how do we profitably scale our sales team? How do we consolidate the various sales efforts currently underway in our portfolio? How can we best leverage the tools, systems, processes, and teams we currently have in place to execute our sales goals?  You will also get to participate in company-wide meetings where we discuss the business, interact with leaders from other departments, and share our ideas to help grow Kasa. Our culture is based on a remote work environment where we take pride in getting to know each other and what drives us.  Experience 8+ years of sales experience in the hospitality space with a focus on corporate and extended stay segments Built and scaled a hospitality corporate sales team across multiple markets Broad and comprehensive knowledge of group and business travel segments, including extended stay business Proven ability to negotiate and close deals with accounts of all sizes and from all industries You are a data-driven and influential leader with vision and can easily communicate with the Partner Success team and cross-functional stakeholders alike You are an expert in your field, have a strong EQ, and are able to generate deep empathy with guests and operating team members which enables you to truly listen and implement product feedback If you are not located in the New York City or San Francisco Bay Area, you are able and excited to travel 1-2x per quarter to either New York City or San Francisco Bay Area Travel is part of your DNA and you have a passion for the real estate, tech, and hospitality industry  Plus if... You've worked remotely and managed a remote team Having working knowledge and understanding of hotel revenue management  In one year, you will succeed at Kasa by having: Built a successful team of 3+ commission-based corporate sales managers Built a strong portfolio of corporate partners who deliver 3%+ of Kasa revenue Defined a structured sales process bringing repeatable business Implemented a CRM tool, which allows tracking the revenue from each account and performance of each sales manager  Benefits üåè Remote Work: With flexibility as a core value, and over three-quarters of the team working remotely, Kasa employees are able to work from anywhere! ‚úà Kasa Travel Credit: We love to travel! Kasa employees get an allowance of free stays with us in any of our locations, plus a 50% discount on any nights for friends and family üìà Generous Stock Option Plan: We believe the success of our business should be shared with our team. As you grow with us, we increase the opportunities for you to become part-owners of our company. üôå Flexible PTO: Full-time exempt Kasa employees are encouraged to take time off as they need and see fit, ensuring that it's not disruptive to their work. üì± Cell phone reimbursement: We reimburse a portion of your monthly cell phone bill to say thanks for using your personal phone during the work day. üìà 401(k) plan: As you invest in yourself and your future, Kasa invests in you too: we match 50% of the first 4% of deferred salary. üôå Paid Time Off: Full-time hourly Kasa employees accrue paid time off at a generous rate that increases with tenure. üí∞ Competitive Salary: We offer base salaries at or above market rates plus additional earning opportunities based on the position ü©∫ Health Coverage: We've invested in comprehensive health insurance options to help when you need it most  #ZR  Who We Are  Kasa is building a global accommodations brand unlike any other. We took the best that hotels and short-term rentals had to offer and created a new class of hospitality that is well priced, trustworthy, and that offers a large selection of great locations. Our guests enjoy seamless check-ins, spacious apartments, and attractive amenities, helping them feel right at home. If anything comes up, our remote guest experience team is available 24/7, ensuring our hospitality is always felt, though rarely seen.  Behind the scenes, we build technology that combines with our innovative operations to grow a globally scalable offering that delivers high-quality stays. Our products and systems unlock unparalleled flexibility to operate anywhere from a few Kasa to a few hundred Kasas in any type of building, in just about any location. We currently have Kasas in over 17 states and are expanding into new markets all the time.  All of this is made possible by our team members, each of whom plays a critical role in fulfilling our vision and mission. We strive to foster a culture that values feedback, support, and collaboration throughout the organization. As a remote-first company, we work hard to bridge the gap of distance through initiatives that foster connection across Kasa. A few examples include lively All-Hands meetings, department get-togethers (online and in-person), and teamwide celebrations of important milestones. We offer benefits that encourage team members to stay at Kasa properties to experience our product firsthand and meet local team members when nearby. Guests are crucial to Kasa's mission. Accordingly, every new Kasa team member gets trained in our Guest Experience Akademy during their onboarding.  Our team is fortunate to have diverse backgrounds, personalities, and experiences united by a commitment to excellence and passion for our industry. If Kasa's vision and culture speak to you, and you're up for the challenge of building a company on the cutting edge of real estate, we would love to have you on our team!  Kasa Living is an E-Verify participant. We will verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States by matching information employees provide on the form i-9 against records available to the Social Security Administration (SSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). You may find more information here and here.

description: We are looking for a passionate sales director who can significantly grow our clientele in one year in a dynamic and results-driven startup environment. description: Our client is North America's most exciting B2B payments automation company and a future unicorn.  Having recently gone through a funding round, they are now looking to hire a Sales Director to help expand their presence across North America. This candidate must have experience in the payments automation space and/or experience selling into accounting firms/financial departments. Must also be located within an MST or EST time zone. We're Looking for someone extremely data-driven, methodical in their approach to sales, a thoughtful relationship builder, and capable of building a supporting team. description: WorkBoard  Work with purpose.  WorkBoard‚Äôs mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard‚Äôs platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.  WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space ‚Äì it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.  THE OPPORTUNITY  As a Regional Sales Director, you‚Äôll be a key player in driving the adoption of WorkBoard within a defined geography targeting F2000 companies. You‚Äôll own building trusted growth advisor status with P&L owners who have strategic priorities and urgency to achieve them while positioning and driving preference for our platform.  You‚Äôll gain a deep understanding of WorkBoards‚Äô Sustainable Growth Model and how our platform supports P&L owners #1 goal of impacting company valuation by driving growth through alignment and accountability. You will be a key member of the Sales Team that will be achieving 3X+ yr/yr growth while solidifying the preeminent position in a new category; Enterprise Results Management.  Your work will also include collaborating with the leadership team to identify demand generation, messaging, sales enablement and sales execution best practices.  COMING IN  Bring 7+ years of C-Suite business application value-based selling and start-up experience, an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset, and a relevant degree from a great school. Experience working in a fast paced, high growth start-up is a plus as is an MBA from a great school.  YOU'LL BE SUPER SKILLED AND EFFECTIVE AT Articulating differentiated solution value to enterprise buyers and customers before, during and after they purchase your business application solution Quickly building trusted advisor status with P&L owners by demonstrating your business acumen, intellectual curiosity and passion for solving substantive business issues Consistently exceeding your sales targets by executing both land and expand sales motions in net new and existing customer engagements in an Account Executive or similar role for a SaaS business application company. Working at a fast pace while demonstrating professionalism and the attention to detail that is required to support sales engagements with enterprise P&L owners Partnering with peer teams across marketing, professional services, customer success, development and finance to build a company that is great in your customers‚Äô eyes WITHIN ONE MONTH YOU'LL Attend new-hire immersion training to build a deep understanding of our buyers, their pain points, our solution offering and how we work well as a team Attend the WorkBoard OKR Coach Certification program to gain a deep understanding of the OKR methodology and its relevance in the Enterprise Results Management category Review fifteen first meeting recordings and shadow five first meetings with sales leadership Internalize five customer case studies and be able to confidently use these in first meetings Be converting first meetings with P&L owners based on your ability to deliver WorkBoards‚Äô value messaging Be highly proficient at demonstrating the WorkBoard platform to P&L owners and business process owners to support our differentiation Develop a territory plan with the support of the Growth team to identify and execute targeted ABM into your top 20 Named Accounts WITHIN THREE MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a trusted advisor to P&L owners as they engage with WorkBoard to accelerate their growth strategies Have developed a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities >$1M ARR and you will have achieved your first quarter sales target Have attended WorkBoard Super User training to deepen your proficiency in the WorkBoard application Be tapping into your network to help bring fantastic talent to WorkBoard WITHIN SIX MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a key member of the WorkBoard Team for the partnerships that you have established with our customers as they achieve their growth strategies Be contributing valuable insights and ideas to the WorkBoard Team on ways that we can accelerate and enhance value realization for our customers Be overachieving your sales target and managing a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities within your Named Accounts in excess of $3M ARR THE TEAM  You‚Äôll join one of the best category building sales organizations that is regularly meeting with P&L owners to impact their growth objectives. You have the support from exceptional Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement and Thought Leadership Marketing teams that are accountable for providing qualified leads, sales content and category creation activities that are all aligned to ensure your success.  We are remarkably engaged with our customers, so you‚Äôll have immediate access to their insights and voices. Everyone on the team is striving to improve the value and quality of experience we provide customers by delivering at our best and being voracious learners. We are an incredibly supportive team, with powerhouse creative and production team members who quickly bring marketing ideas to life.  We are excited about a lot of things‚Äîwhat ‚Äúbest‚Äù looks like for our customers, what ‚Äúbreakthrough‚Äù looks like in our platform‚Äîand we share these passions across the company and with our customers.  OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 H‚ÄôS  Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team  a Few Of Our Awesome Benefits Flexible PTO & sick days Paid holidays Health insurance 401K with employer matching Quarterly All-Hands Meetings And much more! THE WORKBOARD STORY  WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates‚Äô contributions, then come join us!

description: About The Team  Revolut does Operations differently. The team sits at the core of Revolut, working with departments across the business to help solve issues and create effective, scalable solutions. Operations has been responsible for major milestones like launching Premium and building our banking infrastructure, as well as saving millions of pounds for the business. Working in Operations at Revolut will give you exposure to a range of different verticals, where you will deep dive into the fundamentals of each business area you work on. This gives you breadth and depth of experience unrivalled in almost any other job and offers you the chance to have a huge impact on Revolut‚Äôs success.  We approach Sales at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to line manager coaching and development, our goal is to create a partnership with our teams that is people-centric and value adding.  Put simply, we come to work to create a world class sales framework and a fantastic experience that our people love and that starts from the very first point we connect with our new joiners.  About The Role  You'll be responsible for:  Building and optimising the operational side of the sales team as we scale from 200 to 1000+ sales representatives in 10+ countries across 4+ distinct product lines. Defining the department vision and strategy for achieving operational excellence. Establishing and tracking key metrics to drive success of teams and individuals within the organisation. Innovating and finding creative optimisation mechanisms which deliver outstanding business results. Assessing department performance toward business goals and connecting regularly with leadership to share updates and progress of initiatives. Using a data-driven approach to solve large scale problems and generate high business value through scalable solutions. Fuelling Revolut‚Äôs 10X growth  What You'll Need  You have 7+ years of experience You are a proven leader, with the ability to motivate individuals and cultivate high performing teams. Sales Operations experience within a multinational tech company or financial institution You are able to prioritise strategically to achieve business goals and communicate effectively with stakeholders at every level of the organisation. You have a strong track record of achievement (demonstrated through - quick assumption of greater responsibility, over achievement on KPIs, fast track promotions) You have exemplary problem solving abilities and are comfortable dealing with ambiguity

description: Slalom Consulting  Slalom‚Äôs Columbus office is currently seeking a talented Sales Director to drive business results by producing a well-managed, profitable, and growing book of business opportunities.  The individual in this role will serve Slalom‚Äôs clients as a trusted partner, building and executing customized business plans and predictable sales engagement processes. Successful candidates must thrive in a people-based corporate culture and be passionate about identifying new client opportunities and growing the Slalom brand.  Responsibilities Drive activity in partnership with the account and practice leaders Work with new and existing clients to build a pipeline and secure new MSAs Meet with broad set of buyers within a territory to learn more about client initiatives and represent Slalom capabilities Lead the sales and proposal process, including pricing and resourcing Create and sustain a diverse book of business among offerings and accounts Leverage Slalom Sales platforms to drive a forecast and collaborate with Account and Practice leaders May be practice-focused and lead Alliance relationships Get to know our consultant and work with them to leverage their networks to identify opportunities Play a leading role in managed accounts Repeatedly sell complex 2 comma deals Host and facilitate Slalom marketing events Primary liaison with some of our client‚Äô most senior executives Mentor other sellers within the market including the sales, account and practice teams Lead a high performing sales team with direct reports Consistently drives $8-15M in revenue* Qualifications Previous sales, account management and consulting experience Previous leadership experience preferred Passionate about sales and technology Able to partner with clients to understand their organizational needs and recommend solutions that add value to their business Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong customer service and interpersonal skills Experienced and adept at aligning teams to work toward a common goal; consistently demonstrates strong people management skills Budget and project management experience Strong coaching experience ‚Äì sales specific Excellent collaboration and team-building skills Organized and methodical; strong prioritization and negotiation skills Strong process orientation coupled with an ability to work with virtual teams Experienced in building relationships with CXOs and business decision-makers Skilled at leading teams through complex technology solution sales Creative and innovative; description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in DACH (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within DACH merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, German language will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.
