description: This role can be based in any of these locations: CA, TX, IL, NY, TN & GA  About Databook  Databook tackles a core problem for enterprise selling teams: understanding their customers. Our leading customer intelligence platform (read more about our Series A announcement on the news page of our website) is already transforming how sales teams at Fortune 500 companies and hyper-growth software companies go to market. We provide real-time insights and personalized recommendations that help our customers prioritize the right accounts and pitch the most relevant solutions to their customers.  Growing fast and backed by Threshold Ventures, M12 - Microsoft‚Äôs Venture fund, and Salesforce Ventures, we are expanding our team. We have a friendly, entrepreneurial and collaborative culture, where everyone pitches in to get the job done. We believe in supporting our team to maintain a healthy work-life balance and learn new skills. We are headquartered in Mountain View, California.  About The Role  Databook is seeking a Global Account Director (Senior Client Partner) who is a results-oriented, motivated and strategic ‚Äòhunter‚Äô, laser-focused on generating new greenfield business within the Western US. Specifically, you will play a pivotal role in helping us become the next anchor sales technology company by winning high visibility deals and crushing your annual quota.  On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for educating the market about the power of Databook and generating opportunities with net-new customers. You must be able to forecast sales activity and revenue achievement while creating satisfied and referenceable customers. To thrive in this role, you will keep up with industry trends, customer needs, and the competitive landscape.  If you‚Äôre passionate about sales technology, providing a world-class customer experience, and thrive in a fast-paced, hyper-growth startup environment, then becoming a Databook Enterprise Account Executive is the career path for you!  Required Skillset Bachelor's degree preferred 10-12 years of proven hunting & closing experience in an enterprise SaaS environment Previous experience in an early stage company Knowledge of how to navigate and be successful in a startup environment Experience hunting in greenfield environments Success closing net-new accounts while working existing accounts Experience establishing strategic executive relationships Ability to run a full sales lifecycle, start to finish, within the enterprise segment Experience building and executing compelling sales presentations Ability to perform engaging demonstrations of software capabilities Adept at identifying and utilizing internal resources Collaborative mentality by prioritizing ‚Äòwe‚Äô and not focusing on ‚Äòme‚Äô Superb listening skills and a genuine curiosity to understand customers‚Äô challenges Consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals w/ a strong W2 track record Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results Ability to create and modify powerpoint presentations and deliver to executives Why you should choose us You will join an early-stage Enterprise tech business with the opportunity to be part of explosive growth over the next few years We are working with some of the world‚Äôs largest and fastest-growing companies and we are growing fast ourselves Working with an extraordinary team of smart, creative, fun and highly motivated people Join us! Here are some of our key benefits: Competitive salary with bonus and equity Medical Dental Vision 401k Retirement Plan 4 weeks vacation plus holidays Employee referral bonus program $500 learning stipend to spend on books, courses or other training materials that help you develop skills relevant to your role or professional development Complimentary subscription to Masterclass Budget for home office equipment Databook provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, military and veteran status, age, physical and mental disability, genetic characteristics, or any other considerations made unlawful by applicable state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoÔ¨Ä, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Databook expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, military and veteran status, age, physical and mental disability, or genetic characteristics.

description: Orderful is the leading self-service Cloud EDI Platform reimagining EDI integrations. Enterprises connect once to our API and trade EDI transactions with their supply chain partners leveraging Orderful's growing network.  We are growing rapidly and continually looking for top-notch talent to join our team. Ideal candidates have a bias for action and curiosity to learn. We don't expect you to know about EDI (won't be mad if you do) but we need you to be an expert at communicating effectively. Additionally, there is ample opportunity for professional growth and career progression.  Position Description  The Head of Sales at Orderful will play a critical role in the company's journey. We are looking for a player/coach resource who wants to get his or her hands dirty. Most important short term objective is to build a sales process that scales. We're looking for someone who can close and build a world class team. Someone who has seen success in this role before. We're at an early stage with ample amounts of content and expertise for the role. We've proven product market fit in North America and we're looking for someone to build a team to scale the effort.  About You Must have a technical background. Orderful is a technical product, we need technical backgrounds to learn and teach the product to the team you build and prospects. Have seen success building a sales organization at an early stage. Taking a team from the founder lead sales process to ~$15MM in revenues. Must be able to establish a sale process. Must be able to recruit great talent. A desire to progress in your career and constantly look for areas of personal growth. Structured in your approach and thoughts. Must have experience selling enterprise software.  Primary Responsibilities Responsible for sales team quota. Reports directly to the CEO. Responsible for building out a repeatable sales process. Leads with curiosity and learns about the industry, product and our company. Coach new sales hires into being great representatives of Orderful. jobTitle: Director of International Business Development - LATAM
description: Emerald is seeking an International Business Development Director to drive growth across our Gift, Home, Merchandise, and Manufacturing verticals in Latin America. This role will be responsible for developing overseas sales and international relations for specific Emerald events, including SourceDirect at ASD, Global Sources at the International Fastener Expo, and other events in the retail space, such as Outdoor Retailer, Surf Expo, NY NOW, IGES, RetailX, and Pizza Expo.     Working closely with the existing staff, the International Business Development Director will maintain international retention client responsibility, cultivate senior-level relationships in both trade show and international trade industries, as well as with government agencies and international organizations around the globe to develop strategies that improve revenues. The International Business Development Director also plays a role in educating international manufacturers in our key verticals on ‚Äòhow to do business‚Äô within the United States successfully.     The International Business Development Director is an ambassador within the global marketplace for Emerald. This position complements our existing tradeshow staff to provide an additional resource to expand opportunities for international manufacturers to do business within Emerald‚Äôs B2B tradeshow platforms.     Candidates must be fluent in English & Spanish; additional fluency in Portugeuese and other languages strongly preferred. International travel required. Candidates must be based within the US.     Identify revenue growth opportunities and present sales plans to senior leadership to drive international attendee acquisition and development Maintain a sales territory of established customer base while identifying new customers through prospecting and timely fulfillment of customer requests Manage a team of international sales agents and report pacing weekly to senior leadership Take a leading role in identifying new products and opportunities for Source Direct and Emerald‚Äôs international clients within Sourcing and, when appropriate across all verticals Generate year-over-year revenue growth in booth space, sponsorship, and digital, and offer support to marketing team on attendee growth Produce and facilitate ongoing educational programs for foreign vendors/exhibitors and agents both in person and via webinars Lead networking and matchmaking strategies for international vendors/exhibitors and attendees Analyze the needs of international clients and propose programs that meet those needs for them to successfully expand their business into the U.S.    English and Spanish fluency required; Portugeuese and other language fluency strongly preferred At least 5 years of international sales experience, with a preference for experience in international trade development or international trade show sales within the sourcing or manufacturing industries; strong telemarketing experience is a plus Ability to clearly, respectfully, and persuasively communicate over the phone, in writing, and face-to-face within assigned territories Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret information from original data sources to create effective presentations. Ability to work self-directed and to motivate and lead a team of international agents/organizers Computer literate in all aspects of MS Office, Salesforce or other CRM databases Ability to travel internationally 5+ times per year and conduct regular local travel as required to meet with clients, attend industry events and stay abreast of market conditions    ABOUT EMERALD Emerald is a leader in building dynamic, market-driven business-to-business platforms that integrate live events with a broad array of industry insights, digital tools, and data-focused solutions to create uniquely rich experiences. As true partners, we at Emerald strive to build our customers‚Äô businesses by creating opportunities that inspire, amaze, and deliver breakthrough results. With over 140 events each year, our teams are creators and connectors who are thoroughly immersed in the industries we serve and committed to supporting the communities in which we operate. For more information, please visit http://www.emeraldx.com.     To support Emerald‚Äôs commitment to provide a healthy and safe work environment we require all of our team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In accordance with law, accommodations may be available in specific circumstances, including religious beliefs and medical conditions. We utilize CLEAR as our verification partner.

description: Job Title: Director of Sales Walmart-ONE Brands  Job Location: Bentonville, Arkansas  Job Purpose Summary  The Director of Sales ‚Äì Walmart / Sams at ONE & FULFIL is responsible for delivering Net Sales and Operating Profit results and other sales objectives as outlined by ONE Brands. The role will accomplish results through successful customer execution of category and brand objectives and strategies aligned with the Sales Department and ONE Brand‚Äôs corporate priorities. This will be accomplished through developing effective customer relationships throughout Walmart / Sams enterprise including its functional departments. The role will require developing effective customer relationships, strategic planning, trade strategy, cross-functional alignment and coordination. Role is responsible for strategic communication, financial analysis and transparency, category and competitive insights and reporting that will influence and align ONE 7 FULFIL brands with customer‚Äôs marketing and branding strategies. The role will also be charged to coordinate and lead sales development by effectively leading team members and brokers and collaborating with cross-functional teams in development of innovative channel items, strategies, and selling processes including leadership of direct reports and agency sales.  Essential Responsibilities Charged with achieving financial results and aligning ONE & FULFIL brand strategies with the Walmart & Sams enterprise. Lead team customer planning process, including driving fiscally responsible planning and coordinated trade planning processes including trade effectiveness and efficiency which drive return on investment. Lead routine and ad-hoc brand specific business and customer analyses (eg: brand performance, competitive analysis, consumer tracking, customer/shopper tracking, shipment, customer spins and other analyses) incorporating varied data sources (eg: POS, panel, Spectra, etc.). Effectively establish, lead, monitor and course-correct strategic team sales and agency priorities. Lead development of customer category management platforms and selling tools for ONE & FULFIL Brands which influence customer category strategy, assortment, pricing, promotion, and layout / location. Identify and lead the development of retailer solutions for base business and innovation sell-in through the integration of consumer, shopper, marketplace and business insights gleaned from data sources and business analysis. Collaborate with cross-functional internal, sales teams and broker support teams in coordinating transparent customer sales planning, volume forecasting and trade reporting. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to provide impactful routine and ad-hoc daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual sales team, customer and competitive communications Development and execution of custom co-marketing programs aligning with customer shopper activation strategy Manage outside vendors and agencies for maximum engagement, support, effectiveness and efficiency Lead, train, monitor performance and develop skills, competencies and capabilities of direct reports Interface with the customer, internal cross-functional, executive leadership and Team Sales leaders Minimum Qualifications  Education and Experience Bachelors equivalent Minimum 5-7 years related industry experience with CPG company Strong understanding of category management/shopper insights practices and principles Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Access) Strong understanding of Club Channel dynamics, relationships Strong understanding of P&L dynamics Strategic channel insights and ability to drive effective customer and channel planning processes Knowledge of industry Category Management processes & systems (POS, HH Panel, Spectra, etc.) Ability to interpret data and determine key actions in response Superior communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to be effective in highly volatile and ever-changing marketplace Demonstrated analytical, collaborative and consultative abilities Travel Ability to travel ~60% of time ONE Brands, a division of The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of ONE Brands is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  ONE Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veterans

description: Regional Sales Director  The Opportunity  We are searching for an experienced enterprise Regional Sales Director to help grow our team. Reporting to the Regional VP of Sales, you'll be responsible for working with your team of 5+ Enterprise Account Executives, providing feedback, coaching and training to ensure quota attainment and overall account development. Your responsibilities include recruiting, team enablement, regional forecast management, customer engagement, territory balancing while contributing to new customer logo acquisition efforts.  The Team  Moveworks‚Äô Field Sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Moveworks platform. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Moveworks sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.  Who We Are  Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees ‚Äì with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advance conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR to policy information. Our platform allows customers such as Docusign, Broadcom, Nutanix and Western Digital to move forward on what matters.  Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We‚Äôve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for the 3 consecutive years while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we‚Äôve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why both Inc. and the San Francisco Business Times called Moveworks one of the Best Workplaces of 2021. Come join one of the fastest-growing teams on the planet!  What You Will Do Engage 1:1‚Äôs with your Account Executives, understand your 30-60-90 plan, and meet & shadow current members of the sales team Work directly with your Regional VP and Regional Director peers on new initiatives and ways to improve day to day operations; build the best Sales Executive team in the industry Understand the Moveworks customer base, ICP, product and value proposition Begin to hire, develop, coach and manage a strong team of Account Executives to meet and exceed sales objectives Define and execute a regional sales plan to meet and exceed sales goals in new and existing accounts. Empower Account Executives through strategic planning sessions, accountability and execution Be a product expert and a customer facing asset feel assisting your team in closing deals and exceeding quota Accurately assess the capabilities, motivators, and career goals of each team member and provide ongoing coaching to improve their performance and support their career path Develop and implement sales strategies and incentives that drive monthly, quarterly and yearly growth against company targets Perform regular pipeline reviews and accurately forecast sales pipeline Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and client care What You Bring To The Table A sales leader with 3-5 years of 1st line management combined with 5+ years of hands-on closing complex software deals (mix of field selling within mid-market and enterprise) Driven and have met/exceeded direct sales goals of $5-10M+ and leading teams consistently closing average deal sizes of $150-500K while continuing to close $MM deals You are a constant Recruiter! Moveworks hires ‚Äúcompany builders‚Äù and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world Experienced in working for an innovative tech company (SaaS, IT infrastructure or similar preferred) selling ‚Äòunbudgeted‚Äô software without a big brand name. Familiarity with the challenger sale or MEDDIC approach President‚Äôs Club, top rep, top percentile performer, consistent YoY overachievement Systematic approach to encouraging Pipeline Generation that ensures both consistent pipeline growth week over week and strong messaging contained in actual emails/calls. NBM Prep & Execution - Ability to walk into NBMs with a perspective, position Moveworks and our differentiation, and schedule next steps Building Champions / Navigating Personas - Developing champions effectively in each sales cycle and getting multi-threaded within accounts Technical Validation - Leverages CDD & SDW to uncover their required capabilities and ties them back to business pain Adherence to Deal Hygiene (Mutual Action Plans / SFDC) Why You Should Apply President‚Äôs Club for top performers Aggressive sales compensation with SPIFs and commission accelerators Continuous Sales training and upward career mobility Pre-IPO new hire stock equity grants (RSUs) Up to 4% match of base salary for 401K plan 2-4 months parenting leave 100% paid medical / dental / vision benefits for employee Unlimited PTO

description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. Assist in the post-sale transition from sales to the professional services team. You'll Need To Have  What we‚Äôre looking for... Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Knowledge of Cloud vs. On-Premise deployment. Experience with Video Management Software, Video Analytics and Sensors. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have one or more of the following: A degree. Experience identifying, documenting and articulating the business and technical requirements of a prospective customer during the full sales cycle ‚Äì qualification, proposal, post-sale transition. Experience communicating software ability to address prospect‚Äôs requirements through compelling presentation (written, oral and product demonstrations) of the applications. Experience with Databases. Experience with Application integration. Experience in Networking. Experience public speaking. Subject Matter Expert in one of the following industries: Manufacturing, Energy, Transporation, Retail or Education. Knowledge of underlying sensor components such as data ingestion, camera technology, AI, ML, DL, and big data. Experience promoting technology innovation with leaders at large tech companies. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more. description: Head of B2B Sales / Remote / Operations / Full-Time  TL;DR: Fast-growing early-stage startup seeking a Head of B2B Sales. In doing so, we‚Äôll empower the most ambitious people in the world to build the future. Details below!  About On Deck  On Deck is building a modern education institution for the future of work.  On Deck is where the world's top talent comes to connect and grow, together. Whatever it is our fellows want to do next, our ever-growing community and action-oriented programming will help them get there‚Äîfast. If our Fellows want to learn something new to up-level their career, launch and scale big ideas, or make lifelong friends, this is the place.  On Deck is in the business of 100x-ing the number of talented people maximizing their potential around the world. We do so by eliminating the obstacles that stand in the way of individuals accessing the community, curriculum, and credentials they need to pursue their most ambitious dreams.  Role Overview  In this role, you will help build our B2B sales approach for a new L&D (Learning & Development) offering serving high-growth companies.  Who You Are You thrive in early-stage environments and have significant experience building out B2B sales functions at other startups. You know how to build, scale, develop, and manage great sales teams. You have experience selling to mid-market/enterprise customers. You thrive in ambiguity and love figuring out creative, strategic solutions to problems. You are a natural storyteller with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. You are confident selling to and engaging with stakeholders at any level - from team managers to executives. You are always learning and investing in your own growth. You move fast and are willing to iterate many times without giving up when things get tough.  What You Will Do Collaborate with our VP of Business Development and other Go-To-Market leaders to implement a scalable, repeatable revenue engine selling On Deck fellowships to high-growth companies. Identify ideal customer profiles within a B2B audience and articulate the value in On Deck fellowships to their teams. Build our full-cycle sales motion, from prospect to close to the expansion. Hire, develop, and retain world-class sales talent. Develop our sales strategy to scale our B2B business and become the market leader in learning and development.  Why You Might Be Excited About Us We‚Äôre tackling a big problem with even bigger potential. Participants in our existing Fellowships say great things about us. You‚Äôll be able to work remotely and (mostly) set your own schedule. On Deck was a remote-first team even before COVID, so we know what makes for a great remote environment. You'll have a lot of flexibility in your role, and will be able to help define what our operations infrastructure looks like going forward. We're backed by a who‚Äôs who of the biggest names in the venture investing world, including Village Global, Marc Andreessen, Keith Rabois, Chris Dixon, Balaji Srinivasan, Bloomberg Beta, and so many more. (Read more about our Series A in this memo)  Why You Might Not Be Excited About Us We're small (~150 people in the company now), so if you like more established companies, this role isn‚Äôt for you. You'll help create our company's culture. We're an early-stage startup. Projects and priorities are likely to shift. Everyone on the team is extremely mission-driven and works incredibly hard to push towards our lofty ambitions. You should be comfortable with just a dash of chaos. This is not the kind of job where you show up and we tell you exactly what to do every day. On Deck is an unabashedly pro-startup, pro-tech organization. If that‚Äôs not your thing, this isn‚Äôt the place for you. Compensation  This role comes with a competitive salary, stock options, you can take any PTO you need, anytime you need, and employee benefits including generous healthcare.  Location  Our team works remotely, and we are excited about candidates globally. Please note that our team works on GMT-7 PST-friendly hours, so your location will affect your work hours, which may be difficult from Europe or Asia.  You would start as soon as possible.  Equal Opportunity Employer  On Deck is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We strongly encourage applications who are members of underrepresented communities to apply.  Summary  In summary, On Deck may not be the place for you if  If you were to join On Deck, we'd want you to love it. We also know that it can be hard to tell from the outside looking in whether that would be the case for you. So, we challenged ourselves to develop an honest set of reasons someone wouldn't want to join our company. We hope it helps you make an informed decision about whether On Deck is a place you'd love to work. Another company's mission gets you way more fired up. You want a 9-5 job. You do your best work in highly-structured, steady-paced, and meticulously-planned environments. You like finding and poking holes more than you like filling them. You see differences as divisions You believe that something has to be exclusive for it to be cool You can read the details of why On Deck may not be the company for you on our Non-Values page.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are looking for a Director of Sales to join our rapidly growing team. This person will be given the budget to build a team and will need to meet and exceed sales objectives quickly and efficiently. Kizen is a new company competing in one of the largest markets in the world with unlimited upward growth potential. For the right person, this is the opportunity of a lifetime.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We‚Äôve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent 5 years of experience in Sales acquiring new customers 2 years experience leading teams Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and teams Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems  Preferred Qualifications. 10+ years exemplary track record in Sales acquiring new customers 5+ years experience leading teams Experience selling CRM, Marketing Automation, Business Intelligence, Project Management, or similar  At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life‚Äôs work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

Overview: The Director of Sales (Located in South East USA ) is a highly organized, results-driven hunter, who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has a proven track record of hitting quota. The ideal candidate has experience in software sales in the Hotel industry, and is responsible for new business acquisition across the entire range of Cendyn products and services.  Main Activity: The Director of Sales is responsible for developing and executing a territory sales plan primarily focused on the acquisition of new customers. The individual will maximize every sales opportunity and achieve sales quota for an assigned territory. We are looking for a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù with a proven track record of selling over the phone and face-to-face, who can present the Cendyn Solutions via on-line demonstrations, and represent the company at trade shows, hotel conferences and association events. This position will sell to all hotels, management companies, ownership groups and/or other accommodation providers within the assigned region (either North East or South East). Knowledge of MEDDICC methodology is an advantage.  Develop and maintain rapport with key stakeholders for prospects and customers to build strong long-term partnerships  Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and sales proposals  Identify additional product opportunities and upsell existing customers  Timely and professional follow-up with both internal team members and customers Negotiate and prepare contracts with potential customers, understand the legal ramifications of contracts. Achieve Sales Quota on a consistent basis throughout the year ¬∑        Represent the company during trade shows and other official occasions/events Use Salesforce (or other CRM) as the system of record for all sales activity, comply with SOPs for keeping accounts, leads, opportunities, contacts and activity up to date Establish thorough knowledge of Cendyn‚Äôs product and service offerings, pricing structure, contract management parameters, policies and procedures.  Liaise with Cendyn Marketing team to implement Marketing strategy within assigned territory.  Promote Cendyn brands during trade shows and other events in your region  Follow internal processes to assist Project Management and Customer Success teams successfully onboard new customers. Participate in regular structured sales and business training programs to improve sales performance ¬∑        Develop and maintain awareness of industry trends, opportunities and competitive landscape    Interaction: This position has daily interactions with customers, team members and various critical departments within the organization. In many cases, interactions with both internal and external parties will be at mid and upper management levels.  Non-Essential Functions:  N/A  Requirements: Bachelors Degree required Minimum of 5 years sales experience in hotel, travel or hospitality suppliers in a sales environment Proven experience in successfully selling cloud-based software, SaaS solutions. Experience in working on your own and being self-motivated Successful track record of building, managing and closing sales pipeline Strong sales, analytical, pragmatic, organization, communication and people skills required. Working knowledge of hotel sales management Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies, products and procedures Ability to work and thrive in a multi-tasked and fast-paced environment. Ability to innovate, overcome obstacles and implement best practices including sales methodologies Ability to travel as required to support regional and corporate business objectives Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite required (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and computer savvy to learn other applications as needed      Expected Competencies: ¬∑        Sales: Proven experience in successfully selling cloud-based software, SaaS sales; preferably in Hospitality industry ¬∑  Relationship Building: Builds effective relationships through positive communication that motivates and influences others in achieving corporate objectives. ¬∑  Personal Effectiveness: Produces outstanding results both professionally and personally by being proactive and committed. Continually focuses on achieving positive results contributing to company‚Äôs business success. ¬∑  Customer Focus: Passionately meets and exceeds customer expectations. Enters the customer‚Äôs world through listening and understanding. Nurtures relationships by recognizing and delivering on customer needs and opinions. ¬∑  Managing complexity: Is able to work effectively in a highly complex, diverse, changing environment. Adapts and copes successfully with changes. ¬∑  Business Management: Produces outstanding results both professionally and personally by effective management of business processes. Effectively plans, budgets, tracks and evaluates performance of his/her business area. ¬∑ Professional ‚Äúget it done‚Äù attitude and work ethic. description: About TELUS International  TELUS International (NYSE:TIXT) focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With over 50,000 team members and locations across 30 countries in the Americas, Europe and Asia, TELUS International empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, content moderation, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk management, and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS International partners with some of the world‚Äôs most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services and fintech, games, travel and hospitality, healthcare, and ICT industries. The company serves clients in over 50 languages. Learn more at: telusinternational.com    This industry sales leadership position will have a significant impact on the revenue growth of TI and will drive that growth across all TI product lines. The ideal candidate will possess a deep industry knowledge and be considered an expert in the industry. The individual will have executive sales experience across global BPO call center solutions, IT solutions, and data analytics. This highly professional individual will employ a partnering approach to business development efforts and will be responsible for developing, managing, and executing the strategies required to build and maintain productive alliances with key decision makers (‚ÄúC‚Äù level) of potential Client organizations. This candidate will be a leader and a coach of front-line industry sellers.   Responsibilities: Create and maintain industry segmentation and use case solutions applicable for each industry sub-segment Maintain high levels of knowledge and expertise regarding our clients, their industries, outsourcing, managed services, digital transformation, and information technology Compare TELUS International solutions to competitor offerings to create the TELUS International go to market automated and digital solutions for new and existing Clients  Develop a sales and marketing strategy for the industry that includes value proposition, market segmentation, strategy and differentiation, market insight, brand strategy and industry trends, and white space opportunities Build a target list of new logo named accounts. Prioritize targets based on fit to TI ideal customer criteria Develop and maintain relationships with named Client Key accounts as well as potential clients through presentations, business networking, telephone calls, personal emails, personal mailings, business forums, and/or other business or social networking Generate Client awareness and preference for the business and its services. May include developing/sending promotional material, authoring articles, presenting in business forums, business associations, etc. Provide accurate, relevant and timely management information on the performance metrics (i.e., sales funnel) in order to facilitate effective territory planning and forecasting Build / maintain sales and client account plans for prioritized named accounts ‚Äì identifying outsourcing opportunities, emerging client needs, existing competitors in the account (with relative view on strengths and weak points) while being fully aware of upcoming RFPs Responsible for the end-to-end RFP strategy, process, and proposal production. Engage with solution architects, product managers, operations managers, customer success managers, professional service centers of excellence and actively create the solution and implementation of automated and digital technologies Negotiate and enter into contractual agreements in accordance with Company policy and Procedures while creating profitable Client engagements Analyze Client needs, drive opportunities for increasing revenue through a thorough understanding of customer business and market opportunities Work with the Client to build their business plans in support of both the Client and Company strategic objectives Coach and mentor front-line industry sellers  Qualifications and Requirements: Passion for bringing a better industry tailored product / solution(s) to Clients  15 - 20 years sales experience with a proven track record in IT solutions and managed BPO services and sales Desire to be the best at what you do along with a commitment to creating and providing a superior customer experience throughout the sales and service process for given current and future industry accounts Outstanding communication, both verbal and written, along with the strongest presentation skills Position requires national /global travel, approx. 25% and up to 50% annually Bachelor‚Äôs Degree preferred  Skills and Competencies ]Customer Focus ‚Äì Establish and maintains relationships with C-level buyers (both existing and potential) and understands their changing needs along with their challenges. Proactively anticipates and provides holistic solutions to delight customers. Acts as a thought leadership partner to build their trust rather than a single solution provider Industry and Complex solution design Conduct competitor and market analysis to ensure an up-to-date understanding / position on all competitors, industry changes and marketplace strategic opportunities Ownership and Accountability of Sales Performance - Intense drive-to-results approach including demonstrated ability to achieve or exceed quarterly/ annual sales quotas. Includes a record of developing and implementing processes to develop leads, pipeline, relationships, and presentation opportunities as well as leveraging upsell and cross-sell opportunities through targeted and proactive strategies. Demonstrates Entrepreneurial Spirit - Has good understanding of how the business makes money and is guided by financials such as profit and ROI for decisions. Balances short term with long term client and company needs while building and sustaining relationships with key people in the Client environment  Location: Remote position - Anywhere in the US  TELUS Values:  TELUS recognizes and embraces the importance of values in our ever-changing workplace. To be successful, all applicants must demonstrate behaviors that are reflective of our values: We embrace change and initiate opportunity We have a passion for growth We believe in spirited teamwork We have the courage to innovation At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability

description: About Us  Heartbeat Health is a venture-backed health tech startup in New York. We are working to deliver the most effective, efficient, and engaging virtual heart care in the world. By 2030, over 40% of the US population will have heart disease, with direct and indirect costs approaching $1 trillion USD. Heart disease may be the most important health crisis we confront in our time.  Heartbeat addresses this problem via virtual cardiology services that include diagnostic interpretation, telecardiology, and procedural referrals to bring virtual-first care to cardiology, and improve the outcomes and efficiency for cardiac patients.  Our team consists of passionate and proven physicians, engineers, scientists, designers, and founders attacking this problem from first principles, applying human-centered design, and developing evidence-based AI to solve this global issue. We collaborate with the American College of Cardiology, and we have been recognized as one of the 150 most promising digital health startups by CB Insights. We recently closed our Series B funding and are backed by Echo Health Ventures, Optum Ventures, DaVita Venture Group, .406 Ventures, Kindred Ventures, Lerer Hippeau, Designer Fund, and Max Ventures. We‚Äôve been featured in TechCrunch, CNBC, Fast Company, and Forbes.  Heartbeat Health is growing fast, and we're looking for Regional Sales Directors to join our team!  About The Gig Intimately understand how our virtual first cardiology program, available in all 50 states, drives better outcomes, more convenience, and lower costs for at-risk entities (Payers, ACOs) Introduce and cultivate new payer and ACO client relationships Generate and qualify new payer prospects Make sales calls to new client prospects; prepare sales action plans and strategies Relay pitch feedback and recommendations to the broader team. About you 5+ years of sales experience with Payers and/or ACOs You've sold virtual care solutions featuring physicians and/or nurses as the providers, in primary care or any specialty, and with fee-for-service and (extra credit) value-based models Detailed and process-oriented, ability to add context and mode switch easily Excellent communication skills, combined with the ability to collaborate across functions and use available tools Works well in team-based, collaborative environment Outstanding organizational abilities, driven by deadlines and demonstrated results Proven ability to operate successfully in remote role, though ready and willing to visit prospects and customers face-to-face (as covid allows) Why you'll love working here We're mission-driven: we're revolutionizing the way cardiovascular care is delivered Up for the challenge: make a big impact by joining a fast-growing team in its early stages Great people: become a part of something incredible, and do it with an exceptionally talented, multidisciplinary team. We care about diversity: diversity allows us to build an excellent patient experience. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Perks opt into comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits enjoy flexible leave and work from home policies  In Addition To Finding People Who Are Truly Excellent At What They Do, Our Team Is Founded On a Set Of Values We Hold Close To Heart  Our Values Be amazing at what you do, without ego. Take ownership and be accountable to yourself and the team. Move fast with our stakeholders' best interests at heart. Be open to a breadth of ideas, but focused on delivery. Measure and improve what really matters. Be candid and honest with people. Demonstrate high integrity, always. Help others and appreciate those who help you. Be a kind and decent human. Have fun. We are looking for exceptional, experienced Regional Sales Directors to join us. You‚Äôre open to new ideas, thoughtful in your approach, pragmatic in your delivery, constantly learning, and up for a challenge. You elevate the work of those around you. You want the superpower to save millions of lives.  We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  We do not accept unsolicited resumes from outside recruiters/placement agencies. Heartbeat will not pay fees associated with resumes presented through unsolicited means.

description: ModSquad is looking for an experienced sales dynamo to join our team as a Director of Sales. This position reports to the VP of Sales with responsibility for sales to global brands, emerging startups, and their agencies.  You will have the ability to quickly understand the client‚Äôs business and demonstrate the value of our offering. You will be an ace at prospecting; willing to conduct cold calls and mine established contacts to aggressively foster our growth. You enjoy owning the end-to-end sales process, can juggle many sales tasks at the same time, are technically savvy, and preferably experienced in Salesforce.com.  The company has operation centers in Austin, Northern California, Northern Ireland, and Costa Rica with business operations in San Francisco, New York, and London. Most of the ModSquad team works remotely, and this position will also be remote with a preference for those located in the United States.  Hours: Standard business hours; more as needed  Preference: Located in Mountain or Central time zone  Key responsibilities: Cultivate and develop new business relationships and serve as a trusted business consultant to senior decision-makers Assume a lead role in managing sales opportunities and customer negotiations in your region Identify proficient sales strategies and tactics for generating leads and closing business (it's all about MRR!) Develop strong relationships with key strategic partners and, when appropriate, orchestrate the sales process through channel partners Assist the marketing team to help you best target regional prospects  Desired Skills and Experience: University degree in business, marketing, technology or related field 7+ years of consultative or value-add sales experience, with a background in closing recurring services such as customer support, moderation, community management, and social media management.   Ability to close, manage, and grow multiple deals each month Excellent sales organizational and communications skills; experience working in Salesforce.com, Zoom, GoToMeeting, and similar online/mobile apps Strong Excel formula skills for revenue and cost modeling is a must Knowledge of the top social and messaging platforms, and customer-service toolsets, and their role in engaging today‚Äôs digital customer Great address book of high-level contacts throughout the US Ability to travel as needed A flexible work schedule allowing for regular interactions with customers and ModSquad teammates in time zones around the world Ability to collaborate and strategize on complex issues with the team

About Rand McNally: Chicago-based Rand McNally has been transforming travel and transportation for 165 years. Today, Rand McNally provides innovative fleet management and commercial transportation solutions, connected vehicle technology, and consumer travel and education products. While most people know us for our best-selling navigation devices and Road Atlas line, we are also a leading fleet management company with a large base of SaaS fleet management subscriptions and a suite of fleet management SaaS products and services for all types and sizes of fleets. Under new ownership, Rand McNally is poised to dramatically grow the Company's consumer and enterprise electronic businesses through rapid expansion of core product lines and continued innovation of commercial transportation solutions ranging from advanced mileage and routing software to fleet management, electronic tracking, and fleet navigation.  About the Role: The ideal candidate is a high performing sales executive, looking for the next step in their career as Enterprise Sales Account Executive for Rand McNally, covering the Southeast region. This role reports directly to the SVP of Sales, commercial fleets. The Enterprise AE will be responsible for generating profitable revenue as the company moves towards its next phase of growth. Specifically, as an enterprise sales executive on our growing team, you will manage the sales process through customer qualification, needs analysis, product demonstration, negotiation and close. The ideal candidate for this role will have a demonstrated track record of success in developing and implementing a comprehensive hunting strategy in the enterprise technology and SaaS space, ideally with exposure in the fleet management and telematics industry. Additionally, through voice-of-the-customer, you will participate in developing the company's overall market strategy and provide input to product development teams based on feedback from the field.  Job Duties and Responsibilities: Leverage complex technical, solution-based selling approach to sign new customers and win new business Quarterback the entire consultative, strategic sales process in the assigned region Continuously develop, grow, and manage a healthy sales pipeline by leveraging existing relationships and implementing a strategic and targeted cold calling / outreach approach Learn about what's important to prospective clients and their teams and highlight how our solutions can make their lives easier while driving successful outcomes for their organization Using extensive knowledge of the market and competitors, identify and develop unique selling propositions and key differentiators Oversee proposal development, including coordinating and facilitating multi-stakeholder responses to RFP‚Äôs, RFQ‚Äôs and SOWs. Outstanding presentation and communication skills Collaborate with the SVP of Sales, commercial fleets to formalize a creative and strategic ‚Äúsales plan‚Äù and execute a go to market strategy that will drive revenue growth for Rand McNally Collaborate with peer Enterprise AE‚Äôs and team members on key learnings and successes from field experiences and wins  Professional Qualifications: Minimum of three to five years of quota carrying sales experience, successfully selling telematics solutions and services to commercial, private, for-hire and field service fleets A proven track record of exceeding assigned sales quotas while targeting and winning new business Possess a go-getter attitude! Enthusiastic, consultative, thoughtful, and empathetic in your professional interactions and communications with customers and teammates Operates with an attention to detail and exhibits high ethical standards at all times Hunts with a drive to win new and close highly complex enterprise fleet solutions Works well with cross functional teams to create solutions that contribute to Rand McNally‚Äôs overall success, all while having fun! ¬∑      An existing Rolodex of target accounts is a plus. Experience working with enterprise sales and CRM tools; Salesforce and/or NetSuite experience is a plus This is a remote position located and covering the Southeast Region. This role requires the ability to travel as needed (up to 50%+) post-COVID, domestic travel.  Educational Requirements: A bachelor's degree from an accredited university or equivalent experience in the field is required.  Compensation: We offer a competitive and attractive compensation package that includes base salary + commission based on experience and performance, and a comprehensive employee benefits package. We value teamwork, innovation and productivity and foster an exciting and committed work environment that will help you become successful and grow your career with Rand McNally.

As the market leader in portable solar power, Goal Zero solar panels, power stations, and accessories give a new breed of consumers and outdoor enthusiasts the power to go farther, regardless of their gear‚Äôs battery life. We invite you to join our adventure.  Goal Zero is looking for a Director of International Sales to lead revenue and profit growth in countries outside of the United States. Primary focus will be working with our international distributors and operations teams to significantly increase sales revenue and margins across both developed and under-developed markets. This person will oversee a team based out of our Utah HQ, as well as in Europe and potential management in the APAC region. in presenting to outside sales teams and merchants Quarterly review of individual distributors, including regular assessment of specific retail/B2B targets Work closely with Sales Operations to ensure the fullest, with a shared desire to help others do the same. We‚Äôre mountain bikers, skiers, and climbers, world travelers and weekend warriors, technology mavens and creatives, moms, dads, soccer coaches, volunteers, and everything in between. Leadership experience is strongly preferred A strong degree of technical competency preferred High level of both verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in a matrix environment across therapeutic areas and commercial teams Requires a Valid Driver's License  Job Description Recognized as one of Forbes 2020 World's Best Employers and named to Fast Company magazine's list of 2021 Most Innovative Companies, is seeking to hire a Regional Manager Business Development to help identify and shape opportunities for our continued growth across our Dallas region.  This is a unique opportunity to join the management team of a leading global life sciences company that advances patient health and powers clear, confident decisions through its diagnostics and drug development offerings. We have developed 100 new tests in 2020 with the same output of first in class, best in class diagnostics planned for 2021.  As an RMBD, you will hold a key position within the organization with the responsibility of overseeing divisional sales and account management while working to implement and drive strategic initiatives and launch new products.  We are seeking a competitive and collaborative individual with a high degree of communication and business acumen skills who enjoys building, leading, and working with a seasoned, high performing team across a wide variety of high growth therapeutic areas including cancer, Alzheimer's disease, autoimmune disorders, kidney and liver diseases, diabetes, and other conditions.  This individual should possess the ability to leverage our data analytics, clinical trials, scientific expertise, and unique partnership models in order to create a unique customer value proposition. The right individual will have the opportunity to take on additional responsibility with multiple career growth opportunities as we expand our footprint and leadership in the fields of precision medicine and companion diagnostics.  Responsibilities: Oversee the regional sales and account management function for representatives who promote our line of products to physicians Develop and implement new revenue generation models as well as targeting and positioning strategies Develop and maintain high-level relationships with key accounts and C-suite customers Implement and direct the field sales plan within the assigned sales region/division so as to achieve stated sales objectives Act as the interface between the sales force and laboratory operations leadership Continue with the build-out and development of a world-class team Understand industry and local market trends to help create customer and segment-specific targeting and positioning strategies

description: Job Description  Budweiser. Bud Light. Stella Artois. Michelob ULTRA. That‚Äôs right, over 100 of America‚Äôs most loved brands, to be exact. About The Position  The Golden State Warriors are looking for a results-oriented sales leader to develop new sponsorship sales revenue across multiple properties, including: Golden State Warriors (NBA), Chase Center, Golden Guardians and Warriors Gaming Squad (eSports), Santa Cruz Warriors (NBA G League), etc. As Director, Partnerships, you will be expected to make a positive impact on the sales culture of the Partnerships team. This position reports to the Vice President, Partnerships.  This is an excellent opportunity to share your expertise while learning more about this growing sports and entertainment organization that values your initiative and dedication!  This is a full-time position based in San Francisco CA.  Willingness and ability to provide proof of completed COVID-19 vaccination will be required. All religious, medical, or other legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.  Key Responsibilities Research, identify, and track sponsorship prospects regionally, nationally, and internationally within target industries and segments Prospect, pitch and close new sponsorship deals in support of individual and department revenue goals across multiple properties Develop key sales strategies and go-to-market initiatives to generate long term partnership revenue streams Oversee sales reporting and sponsorship prospect pipeline to ensure transparency and organizational visibility into sales activity Build and lead an innovative, best-in-class partnership sales team that meets and exceeds organizational expectations Lead and direct ongoing sponsorship sales presentations with internal and external partners; develop positive relationships with prospects to execute against short and long-term strategic sponsorship sales plans Collaborate with Partnership Development and Partnership Insights teams to maximize cross-platform sales and activation opportunities Provide weekly reporting of sales metrics including pipeline generation, account status, revenue and quota attainment, and relevant sponsor interaction Required Experience & Skills Bachelor's degree, preferably in business administration, or equivalent work experience Minimum 7 years in sales and business development role for a sports/entertainment company with 2 years supervisory management experience; able to demonstrate consistent history of exceeding sales goals Experience developing and selling fully integrated sponsorship packages utilizing a variety of assets including (i.e. entitlement and naming rights, in-venue visibility, digital media, broadcast media, social media assets, etc.) Experience developing engaging and impactful sales plans and presentations, promotional campaigns, proposals and associated contract negotiations Strong internal drive and work ethic; willing to go above and beyond to deliver for the organization Excellent written and verbal communication; ability to collaborate, influence and build positive relationships within a multitude of business environments Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and efficiently lead and prioritize multiple projects at once Ability to attend all Warriors home games and special events; minimal travel also required Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Golden State Warriors is an equal opportunity employer.  We will ensure that qualified applicants with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.  Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Visit www.warriors.com/employment

jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales - Great Lakes
description: Regional Director - Great Lakes Region  Position Description: The Regional Director position is responsible for the distribution of Horizon‚Äôs investment products including ETF model SMA strategies and mutual funds through financial advisors affiliated with broker/dealers or other assigned distribution networks. Regional Directors work from a home office and must travel within an assigned geographic territory (MN and WI) to call on financial advisors in financial institutions, wirehouses and independent broker/dealer channels to establish new relationships and maintain existing ones.   Organization Structure: The position reports directly to the Divisional Director of Sales.  Performance Objectives:  Develop and implement a strategic territorial business plan to grow market share Increase sales with existing relationships and be able to develop new relationships within the territory Effectively communicate detailed product information and provide ongoing support to financial advisors Travel within the territory to build meaningful relationships with top advisors Attend B/D client regional & national conferences as needed Effectively use CRM to keep notes as well as utilize additional technologies to provide support to business partners  Position Requirements: Minimum experience - 5 to 7 years in a sales role at an investment management firm Experience with large Independent firms / Regional BDs / RIAs / Wirehouse firms Platform model deliver sales experience a plus Minimum education ‚Äì Bachelor‚Äôs degree FINRA series 7 and 65/66  Qualifications: Strong public speaking and presentation skills Willingness to travel frequently within the territory Established relationships within territory Proven track record of establishing and growing a territory Ideally based in Minneapolis  ABOUT THE FIRM Horizon Investments is a registered investment adviser that offers goals-based investment strategies in the form of SMAs, model accounts, mutual funds, and wrap strategies to financial intermediaries. Horizon has approximately 70 employees and manages $7 billion as of August 2021.  Horizon is fun, challenging, fast-paced and exciting. Our office environment is emblematic of a growing business. We believe that earnest face-to-face collaboration is often required to solve hard team challenges. We have a great office full of talented people!

description: Looking for a high energy; sales leader to partner with Rebel Hospitality and lead the sales efforts of an independent lifestyle hotel located in downtown NYC.  The Director of Sales will have direct oversight of planning and managing the overall sales efforts and marketing. The intention is to achieve optimal occupancy growth in existing accounts and generating new business all to maximize total revenue and meet/exceed hotel profit objectives. This role will oversee day-to-day operations of the hotel sales division including but not limited to direct sales efforts follow-up and proper sales administration and training. This role will ultimately recommend the sales forecast marketing advertising sales plans programs and annual budget; manages within approved plans and budgets.  Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ At least 6 years of progressive hotel sales experience preferred. ‚Ä¢ Must possess highly developed verbal & written communication skills to frequently negotiate convince sell and influence other managerial personnel hotel guest(s) and/or corporate clients. ‚Ä¢ Must have thorough experience with professional selling skills: opening probing supporting closing ‚Ä¢ Shows strong analytical skills and strategic vision in establishing appropriate sales deployment ‚Ä¢ Must be proficient in general computer knowledge especially Microsoft Office products ‚Ä¢ Must be able to work independently and simultaneously manage multiple tasks ‚Ä¢ Strong organization and presentation skills ‚Ä¢ Requires advanced knowledge of the principles and practices within the sales/marketing/hospitality profession.

Position Summary:  The Director of Field Sales is responsible for leading the development, implementation and execution of North American. strategies for all MX, MTB and Lifestyle Dealers/Customers in the West Region. This position is responsible for securing and maintaining strategic MX and MTB parks and endemic properties/events that help build brand awareness with the loyal consumer. The individual will be responsible for the planning, day-to-day operations and management of west region sales reps in the U.S. ‚Äì 4 MX Reps, 5 MX/MTB/LFS Reps . The director of field sales will partner with the East and Canadian directors of field sales to lead the strategies for MX ‚Äì This will include the development, implementation and execution for North America. They will work closely with the directors of MTB and VP of national accounts/lifestyle to ensure strategies are understood and executed against in the North American field to deliver annual Key Performance Indicators and set the team up for success.  Essential Functions of role:  Develop plans to deliver annual net sales and contribution plans for the region. Develop, coordinate and execute sales objectives, strategies and marketing programs to gain market share. Develop and lead strategy process with regard to: competitive environment, account sales/development strategy and territory progression. Aggressively research, identify, qualify and target potential new accounts, delivering on a new account goal annually. Effectively manage all trade, visual merchandising and selling expense budgets. Manage overall planning process including strategic planning, target development, customer tactics and retail execution goals. Includes MX Dealers, Independent Bike Dealers, Lifestyle customers, Parks and Endemic Properties. Manage overall sales forecast process throughout the year to measure achievement vs. AOP and implement corrective actions as needed. Deliver Fox Freestyle placement goals ‚Äì manage the process from end to end by identifying targets, working with the reps on financials, securing the contract and executing for growth, so the targeted ROI is delivered. Work with the finance director to review and assess business opportunities as they emerge by leverage financial data and understanding to inform trade spending and investment decisions. Understand and leverage key business data sources and draw appropriate insights as well as internal reporting. Development of Accounts Beach Head Markets ‚Äì deliver growth above targets in key markets. Develop and Maintain MX Raceways/Bike Parks/Endemic Accounts Inspire the team to drive for results. Develop talent through market/account workwiths, coaching, etc.  Director of Key Accounts Page 2 of 3  Competencies:  Leadership Target driven and vigilant - Drives for Results -- Sets standards of excellence and strives for improvement. Holds him/herself and others accountable Excellent Communication Develop Strategic Plans Utilizing Data Focus on the Customer -- Forms active working relationships with customers by anticipating, analyzing, and responding quickly to opportunities, needs, and problems while aligning with prioritized areas of focus as it pertains to the region. Knows the Business -- Speaks and acts with up-to-date knowledge of issues relevant to the organization, and business. Walks the Talk -- Builds trust, delivers on promises, communicates directly, respects other opinions, maintains confidentiality, and treats people fairly. Demonstrates consistency between words and actions. Sound Judgment and Decision Making -- Makes effective decisions based on logical assumptions and adequate information; takes into consideration resources, constraints, and organizational values. Fosters Teamwork -- Works with others both as a leader and a team member towards shared goals related to business objectives (within regional team, corporate internal departments, and executive leadership). Encourages the open expression of ideas. Financial acumen -- this is necessary to understand the financial impact of decisions on the business as it pertains to sales growth and margin improvement. Attract, acquire and develop talent. Knows how to motivate and inspire. Utilize a customized management approach.  Supervisory Responsibilities:  4 MX Reps 5 MX/MTB/LFS Reps Define strategy and execution plans for all field sales representatives MX & MX/MTB/LFS reps.  Work Environment:  This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.  Physical Demands:  May be required to work more than 8 hours during a workday Sitting long periods of time Significant manual dexterity for keying in data for long periods of time  Expected Hours of Work:  Must be available to work occasional off-hours and weekends Must be available during standard business hours  Travel:  Possible overnight travel and occasional local day travel  Required Education, Experience and Skills:  Bachelor's degree (B.A or B.S.). Master's degree (M.A.) preferred. It is expected that the successful candidate will have a strong market presence and will have built up a track record of successive promotion and recognition over a 7 to 10-year period of professional experience.  Director of Key Accounts Page 3 of 3  It is expected that the successful candidate will have experience working in the industry. Having strong relationships with the major partners is preferred. A minimum of 7-10 years' visual merchandising experience with proven record of sales success and history of accomplishments. Experience in the actions sports, wholesale apparel or retail industries preferred, but not required. Knowledge- Powersports, Cycling and Lifestyle  Other Duties:  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  #LN-RN1
