description: Fort Worth Magazine, Fort Worth INC. and Fort Worth HOME  We are seeking a dynamic sales leader to lead and continue to grow our print and digital revenues and define and implement specific sales strategies to exceed our objectives. A leader with experience in the media industry, and with a performance-based mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about Fort Worth and must reside in the Fort Worth area.  Our Core Values: Passionate, Positive, Team Player, Excellence, Respectful, Philanthropic  Job Description  This position is responsible for developing and implementing the sales strategies and tactics to reach objectives and leveraging our systems and marketing/sales strategies to drive acquisition and retention for scale.  Responsibilities Building and leading the company‚Äôs sales organization. Direct, oversee, strategize with the Sales team. Work in conjunction with Publisher to manage a strategic planning process to achieve revenue budgets by product type and develop new revenue opportunities. Develop and Execute business plans Participation in Level 10 leadership meetings. Traction. Development of multimedia packages based on client needs. Design and manage all aspects of the sales compensation plans to reach objectives. Meet the minimum monthly, quarterly and annual objectives established within each objective area. Short and long-term goal setting, plans and strategies Cultivate relationships with existing key advertisers, partners & ad agencies to help grow revenue. CRM / Sales Management Process: Responsible assisting with the ongoing development, implementation, and management of the MagHub CRM rollout initiative. Identify, develop and implement strategies to improve operational efficiencies including new technology. Determine measures of adoption and track performance. Develop, execute and enforce the minimum activity levels to build a pipeline of business and close contracts. Ensure that sales team is utilizing CRM to build relationships with customers and to close to new business. Support operations with efficiencies and improvements for sales, marketing and support. Establish and report on sales metrics, forecast/commits, churns & another key sales metrics. Manage the process of the sales pipeline and revenue forecast in MagHub to ensure accurate recording of prospecting activity, conversion success and active sales opportunities at each stage of the sales process as well as future new business revenue. Manage the process of delegating Accounts /Territories and new business leads to Sales Staff. Ensure that CRM is updated with customer segmentation data to be used for email prospecting and marketing campaigns. Manage administrative responsibilities such as filling out orders in a timely and accurate manner, tracks contracts and sales, follows through on contract expirations and performs other related duties as assigned. Collaborate with sales support to continually refine efficiencies and improve both internal and external experiences. Responsible for recruiting, hiring, training & retaining a team of top performing Sales Professionals. Recruit and interview continuously to develop a virtual-bench of qualified candidates ("A Players") for hire. Use company provided recruitment tools & Top-grading interview methods throughout the hiring process. Regularly communicate standards and expectations of performance. Provide each sales team member w/ performance appraisals twice each year; assist in the design and update of employee job scorecards & individual development plans. Create and monitor sales performance management dashboard and rankings. Establish and conduct on-boarding process for new hires. Meet weekly w/ sales staff to benchmark progress & make recommendations for multimedia (print/digital) bundles and offerings of digital-only products. Participate in customer-facing sales calls/appointments with Account Executives on a regular basis. Staying informed of media industry trends as well as trends affecting clients and our competition, and positioning of our value story. Monitor the sales team to remain up to date on product knowledge and market intelligence. Assist in the development and execution of Advertising Department's Marketing Plan. Management Team: Work cooperatively and collaboratively with all colleagues and other executive management and department managers. Community Involvement / Networking / Events: Represent the Panther City Media Group brands through business networking, community involvement, sponsored company events & connections with our customers. Other: Assist with any other task or project assigned by Publisher. Qualifications Minimum of 5+ years in leading sales teams with a successful track record. Must have experience and strong understanding of media space. Must have extensive knowledge with CRMs and fast learner who loves technology. Bachelors‚Äô degree in Marketing, Business Administration or another related field. Well versed in the sales call process - Prospecting, gap discovery, agreement, recommendation and close. Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks to deadlines and work effectively in a cross functional environment. Excellent negotiation and leadership skills. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. High competency with Microsoft office, G Suite, Excel, Power Point, Basecamp or other project management platforms, Zoom. Past success working with teams and collaboration. What are the benefits of being on the TEAM? We have amazing brands and loyal followers in print and online - Fort Worth Magazine, Fort Worth Home and Fort Worth Inc. Over 40,000 followers on Facebook and 30,000 email subscribers and growing! We put on incredible events and are connected in the community - Best Companies to Work For, Entrepreneur of Excellence, Best of, Top Doctors, Top Attorneys, and more! We are philanthropic and give back to the community. We move fast and make adjustments based on the needs of the market. We embrace empowerment and decision making in our environment. We are growing and scaling! We offer benefits - Health, Vision, PTO, and 401k. This position is a base plus commission position with no cap. Compensation  SALARY is commensurate to experience. BASE plus commission.  Panther City Media Group, LP is an award-winning, multimedia publishing company located in Fort Worth, Texas. Its monthly flagship city lifestyle publication is Fort Worth Magazine founded in 1998. The company publishes two other magazines, Fort Worth INC., a high-end, bi-monthly business magazine and Fort Worth HOME, a bi-annual luxury shelter magazine.

description: Skills / Experience (Required)  Graduate / Post Graduate Qualification (B.Tech/BE & MBA ‚Äì Preferred) 15+ years of total work experience with at least 5+ years of experience in partnerships & alliances management in the US market At least 8+ years of experience in strategic sales or business development in the US market Desired candidate should demonstrate sound understanding of the overall IT services business. description: Company: Admin Awards Position Location:   Philadelphia or Boston, Remote Compensation: Base + Commission Category: Sponsorship Sales & Client Relations Job Type:  Full Time, 20% Travel Position: Sponsorship Sales Director, Philadelphia & Boston Markets Company HQ: Dallas, TX  The Admin Awards is the first and only awards program of its kind to publicly recognize the invaluable contributions of Administrative Professionals and provides executives with a unique opportunity for showing their appreciation through what is considered the Administrative Profession's highest honor and nationally known as the 'Academy Awards for Admins'. Additionally, The Admin Awards presents a unique marketing platform that reaches the C-suite audience and their Administrative counterparts while also providing a one-of-a kind recognition platform. We work with the country's top brands who trust the Admin Awards to deliver an exceptional recognition and marketing platform.  The Admin Awards Sponsorship Sales Director position is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-paced entrepreneurial organization and is responsible for generating sponsorship revenue in two markets, Boston & Philadelphia.  The Admin Awards offers an incredibly positive work environment with little ‚Äúred tape‚Äù and the autonomy to make great things happen if you are a self-motived, driven person. There is tremendous fulfillment in the Sponsorship Sales Director‚Äôs job role as the impact this program has on the lives of Administrative Professionals and their coworkers is significant. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly skilled salesperson comfortable selling our products with an average deal size of $15k. This position reports to the CEO.  Please send your cover letter, compensation requirements and resume to sunny.nunan@adminawards.com.  Key Objectives of The Admin Awards Sponsorship Sales Director Position Are:  Utilize creative and traditional outreach to drive sponsorship revenue growth Must be comfortable presenting our product in an effective, organized and persuasive way that inspires the prospect to act Research and develop a list of potential sponsors, understanding our buyer personas and why companies work with us with the ability to deliver strategic recommendations based on those personas Track all sales activities, opportunities and deals in our CRM You must be confident you can meet or exceed sponsorship revenue goals by targeting local, regional, and national business decision-makers that desire a C-level audience and/or their administrative counterparts Maintain deep relationships with existing and potential sponsors and strategic partners Maintain extremely high levels of service toward all sponsors, program participants, and strategic partners Manage contract process with sponsors Ensure that all sponsor deliverables are being met proactively and conduct ongoing communications about the level of satisfaction in the program Support the establishment of the local advisory board, board of judges, and other key participants of The Admin Awards program Presentation of The Admin Awards to trade and business organizations to both large and small audiences Organization and co-facilitation of monthly advisory board meetings Collaborate with headquarters staff including the Marketing & Events Program Manager and Coordinator supporting the local market  Qualifications: Bachelors You are a proven salesperson who excels in an entrepreneurial environment with the autonomy to make things happen You are passionate and driven to achieve results Proven track record of 5 + years of experience in business to business sales preferably selling sponsorships, advertising, or marketing products or services Ability to persuasively sell intangibles, concepts, and opportunities to influence potential sponsors, partners, and program participants  Committed to exceptional client service  Advanced tech skills in MS Office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Must be very comfortable on a Mac. This position requires about 20% travel including travel to the Philadelphia and Boston markets and all 10 markets as we fly our team to program cities for event execution. A flexible schedule is required to support meetings and events which may occur outside normal business hours such as nights and weekends for scheduled events

The Director,  Business Development is a ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù executive that will plan, direct, coordinate, and oversee operations and business development activities for the organization, ensuring development and implementation of efficient processes and creating direct to consumer strategies to meet current and future needs of the organization. This role will have day-to-day ownership of the organization and have the opportunity to build a brand and product from its infancy to a successful business. As this is a brand-new opportunity, the incumbent will need to be both resourceful and comfortable with ambiguity, as they will shape this role over time. The Director, Business Development will report directly to the CEO & Co-Founder of H.P. Shelby Manufacturing Ltd.    Essential Responsibilities & Duties The primary responsibility will be partnering closely with the Co-Founders and their team to develop business strategies and plans that both shape and support the overall business.   Responsibilities include (not limited to): Provide day-to-day leadership and management to the organization focused on developing and executing operational excellence and building a direct-to-consumer business development plan.  Partners closely with the CEO to align with the corporate strategy & finance support to create financial models and scenarios to support new and ongoing business planning and modeling. Partnering closely with the CEO to lead the company to achieve and surpass sales, profitability, cash flow and business goals and objectives. Responsible for the measurement and effectiveness of all processes internal and external. Provides timely, accurate and complete reports on the operating condition of the company. Spearhead the development, communication and implementation of effective growth strategies and processes. Establishes, communicates, and implements operations-related policies, practices, standards, and security measures to ensure effective and consistent support and execution. Collaborate with the management team to develop and implement plans for the operational infrastructure of systems, processes, and people designed to accommodate the growth objectives of our organization. Maintains a strong pulse on market trends, competition and consumer feedback. Analyzes market research and data to develop and strengthen business cases and scenarios. Understand and define existing and potential consumer segments: demographics, psychographics, behaviors. Foster a success-oriented, accountable environment within the company. Represent the brand with clients, investors, and business partners. Presents periodic performance reports and metrics to the CEO and other leadership.  Basic Qualifications  7+ years of professional experience and five or more years of leadership in operations, business development, supply chain, or logistics leadership or similar fields. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration or equivalent with strong aptitudes and relevant experience.  5+ years of experience in business strategy, consulting and/or go-to-market strategies.  Experience in direct to consumer (DTC) brands and business development/sales for a DTC organization.  Familiarity with and ability to identify key insights, assimilating them into thoughtful strategies and executable plans; Experience in strategic planning and business development. Deep understanding of consumer facing businesses with product management or leadership roles in the toy, toy gun, paintball, airsoft or similar DTC product.  Ability to creatively deliver seamless end-to-end consumer journeys, while managing P&L accountability and driving solid returns. Experience managing the customer service, operations, logistics, and supply chain of a DTC product.  Proven experience and ability to advise and influence key executives and stakeholders across an organization. Ability to use data analysis and performance metrics to make decisions and drive a business forward.  Ability to motivate teams and contractors to produce quality products within tight timeframes and budgets, while simultaneously managing several projects. Ability to demonstrate exceptional discretion, judgment, integrity and confidentiality. Open to changing situations and opportunities, demonstrating a willingness to consider new ways of doing things and diversity of opinion. Skilled in organizational development, people leadership, budget and resource development, and strategic planning. Excellent people skills, with an ability to partner with a dynamic leadership team. Flexible and able to multitask; can work within an ambiguous, fast-moving environment, while also driving toward clarity and solutions; demonstrated resourcefulness in setting priorities and guiding investment in people and systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to and willingness to travel as needed; extensive travel not expected.   Preferred Qualifications  MBA or master‚Äôs degree in a related field. Experience in a startup company leveraging a scrappy, resourceful approach to business. Experience in and thorough knowledge of the toy gun, paintball, or airsoft gun industries.

jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales, Brands East
description: About Us:  SOCi is an award-winning all-in-one local marketing platform built specifically for "next-level" multi-location marketers. Our customers include top brands and influencers like Ace Hardware, Sport Clips, and Anytime Fitness as well as top multifamily property management companies like Greystar, Lincoln, and Pinnacle who have the impossible challenge of managing their digital presence across hundreds and thousands of locations. The SOCi platform empowers local management of the entire customer journey across multiple mediums including local business listings, social, reviews, listening, ads, bots, and more. As the central command for multi-location marketers, SOCi makes the impossible possible by enabling top brands and their locations to strengthen and scale their digital presence across limitless local search and social pages while protecting what matters most, their reputation.  Our accolades include:  Recently closed a Series D investment round of $80 million, led by JMI Equity Inc. 5000 honoree fourp years in a row for Fastest Growing Companies in America Entrepreneur magazine‚Äôs #1 Marketing Provider for Franchises, and top provider three years in a row Front Runner for Gartner‚Äôs SoftwareAdvice.com in Reputation Management & Brand Management Top 200 rank on Financial Times The Americas‚Äô Fastest Growing Companies two years in a row Forbes America‚Äôs Best Startup Employers Position Summary:  SOCi is looking for a rockstar Regional Director of Sales for the Eastern USA Region to develop a dynamic team of driven Account Executives that will set out to solve the complex social media and reputation management challenges that are unique to enterprise multi-location brands and franchises and to make a killing doing it.  We are looking for a sales leader who understands and can articulate what it takes to lead a high-performance team in the challenging world of SaaS sales today, has a proven track record of success in leading high-performance sales teams, and believes that they can have a 10x impact on our rocket-ship startup.  Preferred Qualifications:  4-6 years of experience in B2B SaaS Enterprise Sales Leadership Ability to show consistent revenue achievement (not just that you achieved it, but how you achieved it would be even better) Creative entrepreneurial spirit (you won‚Äôt come here if you don‚Äôt have it) Refined and proven sales methodology (Can‚Äôt wait to see it) Creative strategist; develop new ways to drive ales and value to existing and prospective clients (Love that quality) Experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment (Clock Speed required) Creative problem solver with the ability to understand and resolve client challenges/objections Sell cutting-edge, disruptive technology to decision-makers at the enterprise level Willingness to travel (up to 50%, we have big territories and big customers) Strong execution, focus, and ability to develop solutions and strategies to further accelerate growth Provide thought leadership to develop a high performing sales organization and customer-centric culture Recruit, retain, and mentor a remote high-performance and highly engaged sales team Train, develop, and motivate the sales team in skills, sales methodologies and activities, product knowledge, teamwork, time and territory management, and competitive knowledge Executive-level interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to successfully influence and quickly build credibility to maximize organizational growth and profitability Ability to foresee, interpret and rapidly respond to market changes by adjusting strategies and realigning priorities accordingly Proven experience closing or assisting sales team members in closing large ticket deals Strong business and analytical acumen; strong problem-solving skills Manage account and contact information through the entire sales lifecycle process using Salesforce and ensure that the sales team maintains detailed account profiles and prepares sales and activity reports as required. Take ownership of the accuracy of the information in Salesforce What's SOCi's culture like?  Led by a team of industry experts, SOCi is leading the pack in Social Media and Reputation Management. We offer flexible PTO, comprehensive health & benefits packages, and 401k (amongst many other perks). Every new team member is equipped with a MacBook laptop, tech accessories & SOCi swag. We are a fast-paced, agile environment where thought leadership and input is encouraged. If you are looking for a place where you can come and make a difference in the way enterprise organizations utilize social technology, then SOCi is for you.   SOCi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law

jobTitle: Emerging Markets Rates Institutional Sales - Banking
description: IFI salespeople are responsible for marketing BBVA's capabilities in FICC products to financial institutions including banks, pension funds, insurance companies, hedge funds, mutual funds, and family offices. The geographic areas of expertise include Latin America, Turkey and peripheral Europe.  Responsibilities Trade emerging market bonds and transact derivatives with large US and Latin American institutions. Develop and open new clients for the IFI sales team. Provide market feedback and trade support to other team members when necessary. Arrange and host meetings with issuers and colleagues throughout the Americas region. Answer detailed questions about government bond auctions and auction participating strategies. Market new issues and arrange road show meetings. Manage and resolve trade settlement problems. Maintain close ties with large institutional clients. Calculate franquicia for trades, unwind values for derivatives and relative values across multiple bond curves. Detailed relative analysis should be provided to clients on a regular basis. Generation of trade ideas is mandatory.  Education/Experience  Bachelor's degree required with a minimum of ten (10) years of experience in a fixed income sales role or an institutional sales trading capacity. Meet credit history and criminal background requirements associated with Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry registration process, to include FBI fingerprint criminal history and review of credit report. Must be fluent in Spanish and English. Proficiency in Bloomberg and Excel is required. Deep knowledge of markets with some experience in Latin American securities or currencies strongly preferred. Experience liaising with internal departments to support the negotiation of legal documentation for foreign exchange and derivatives contracts.  Lic/Cert/Reg  Required: Series 7 and 63 Preferred: None preferred   THIS POSITION IS FOR AN INDICATION OF INTEREST ONLY. FOR MOST UP TO DATE JOB POSTINGS PLEASE VISIT THE BBVA CAREERS PAGE.

description: Cloud security is becoming increasingly important as organizations are accelerating their cloud migration. Britive is at the forefront of the emerging cloud security industry with the only modern privileged access management platform that provides unified Privileged Access Visibility, Dynamic Privilege Management and Secrets Governance across cloud infrastructures, platforms & SaaS.  Our patent-pending technology is deployed at several large and Fortune 500 customers and we have repeatedly ranked among the hottest Cloud Security startups. Britive is founded by CyberSecurity industry veterans with a successful prior exit and is backed by top-tier VCs through a recent Series A raise.  Reporting to the CEO, this revenue leader is responsible for the day to day management that includes onboarding, coaching, and tracking an enterprise oriented sales team to achieve revenue and logo acquisition targets. This leader acts as a trusted partner to the broader go-to-market organization and is tightly aligned to a repeatable, and scalable, sales methodology and process. A key part of this role is helping the organization acquire new logos, while doubling and tripling revenue. With key enterprise logos like Lululemon and Toyota, Britive is well positioned to grow rapidly, and needs the right leader in place to create a repeatable, and scalable, enterprise motion.  Role And Responsibilities Recruit, build and scale a high performing sales team of A players that can meet short-term revenue goals and scale for long-term success; develop training and talent retention strategies. Define how Britive positions their product in the market by refining the overall selling strategy. Identify and define how to position the product to customers, and develop a departmental selling motion to be utilized across the sales team. Create and execute short and long term metrics driven sales plans, including strategies, goals, quotas, tracking mechanisms and analytics, building a highly metrics driven and predictable revenue flywheel. Foster a low ego and collaborative sales culture at Britive as you scale the team, with an approach that is focused on consultative sales. Establish an understanding of key market and competitive dynamics to develop and refine a differentiated sales strategy for the Company. Share data and metrics across the revenue organization to develop clear and approachable goals across teams to work toward effectively and efficiently. Maintain knowledge and understanding of technical product details and roadmap to win the hearts and minds of buyers.  Professional Qualifications Extensive sales leadership experience with a proven track record of scaling revenue in an early stage, high-growth company. Ideally has seen revenue scale in the #1 or #2 seat at a SaaS business sub 10M ARR. Experience selling a technical product; familiarity with the Security space is ideal. Track record of building successful sales teams with an enterprise sales approach. Track record of systematizing the sales approach and playbook in an early stage environment; developing a scalable approach to selling that is repeatable, informed by data and consistently yields strong revenue growth. Proven ability to create and execute on successful GTM strategies, including the creation and implementation of relevant and accurate KPI's. Experience managing a geographically distributed sales team preferred.  Personal Characteristics Strong intellectual horsepower; thoughtful, data driven approach to decision making. Leads with integrity and has a low ego. Extremely resourceful, with the ability to be scrappy in an early stage environment and operate within ambiguity. Decisive and action-oriented, yet collaborative. Strong chemistry with existing leadership team and board. Results-oriented leader who is energetic, resilient, and personally committed to achieving success.  In return, we offer: We empower you to think critically and contribute to our development. Every team member has the power to make our company better! We recognize that honesty and openness breeds trust, which is the foundation of great teamwork. This extends to customers and anyone who interacts with us on any level A Culture of life-long learners We celebrate all forms of diversity and our commitment to inclusion drives us forward each day Competitive Compensation Equity Full Benefits, including for dependents 401k Unlimited PTO

description: Leaf Group‚Äôs Brand Partnership division is looking for an Account Director to join our Chicago team as a brand evangelist, helping us deliver smart, out-of-the-box solutions across all of Leaf Group‚Äôs owned and operated media properties for leading advertisers. Chicago preferred but must be in the Midwest.  Leaf Group is a house of brands, creating and cultivating digital-first companies in growing lifestyle categories: Fitness & Wellness (Well+Good, Livestrong.com); Home & Decor (Hunker, Society 6), and Art & Design (Saatchi Art, The Other Art Fair). Additionally, we have performance focused brands in key categories such as Travel, Pets, and DIY (OnlyInYourState, Cuteness, eHow). Our media and marketplace brands are authentic and authoritative, reaching a large and growing passionate audience.  We work in a fun, collaborative environment that is diverse, adventurous, and open-minded. We look for proactive, accountable people focused on continuous learning and growth to push themselves and our businesses forward. Check us out here.  A big vision calls for top talent. As we grow, our need for an Account Director grows with us.  You‚Äôll report to: Midwest Sales Director  A Typical Day As An Account Director Might Include Prospect, ideate and secure brand partnerships with leading advertising brands agencies Manage a growing pipeline and accurately forecast new business and existing revenue booked Foster and nurture client and agency relationships and be responsive, visible and relevant to designated account list Collaborate with internal marketing and account management teams to create advertiser solutions/advertising proposals, partnership programs for clients and agencies Secure new business by developing and presenting relevant solutions that help clients achieve their marketing objectives Participate in regular sales meetings and provide ongoing reporting and feedback to sales management Utilize Boostr to track all pertinent account information and sales progress as well as forecast and prioritize to achieve quarterly and annual quotas You‚Äôll be successful in this role if you have strong knowledge of the digital media landscape including branded content, experiential marketing, programmatic media, using data and insights to sell, and the ability to storytell in your pitch. You will understand how to navigate through organizations to get to senior level decision makers, how to open doors and secure meetings that deliver an outcome. You‚Äôll be a hard worker with persistence and curiosity.  What You Have 5+ years of digital advertising sales experience Proven go-getter with ability to meet and exceed sales quotas Demonstrated success in a goal-oriented, highly accountable sales environment Strong relationships with key decision makers at advertising agencies and national advertising clients Diligent and motivated work ethic with a high energy, results-oriented style Experience in high-volume cold calling and pitching to senior executives/stakeholders Excellent communicator: outgoing, great writer, and public speaker A team player with collaborative spirit Not afraid to wear multiple hats - no job being too small or too large Experience selling integrated digital programs Extra plus: experience working with health and wellness, home brands and products; experience selling experiential programs We're casual and informal but we work hard and work responsibly. Personal accountability goes a long way. We believe we are the change. What We Have Among Comparably‚Äôs 2020 Best CEOs for Diversity and Best CEOs for Women eHow is the 2019 & 2020 People's Choice and official Webby Winner for Social Video/How To-DIY OnlyInYourState is ranked the #3 Travel and Information Site (ComScore) Well+Good is the 2019 People's Choice winner of the Webby‚Äôs Award for Best Lifestyle Brand Leaf Group is among TalentDesk‚Äôs 2019 Best Companies To Work For Leaf Group is among the 2019 Built In LA Best Companies To Work For Well+Good is the 2018 winner of Fast Company‚Äôs Most Innovative Company Award MyPlate is the 2018 winner of the Webby Award for Best Design Winner of the 2017 Best Company for Diversity award Comparably Competitive compensation and benefits packages (i.e., Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, 401K) Paid-to-play vacation rewards Discretionary unlimited vacation time Employee discounts for Saatchi Art, Society6, and Deny Designs Leaf Group is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace that reflects our customers and the world we live in. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply for our roles. Leaf Group is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Agency Disclosure  If the Leaf Group Talent Acquisition department, or any current company employee, receives an unsolicited resume from a third party recruiting agency and Leaf Group does not have a signed Agency Agreement active, Leaf Group will not be deemed liable to pay a placement fee. The unsolicited resume will be considered a gift and can be considered for our recruitment efforts.

description: To apply, please submit a resume and cover letter to careers@powerhouse.fund with subject line ‚ÄòYour First and Last Name - Head of BD Application‚Äô.  Position: Head of Business Development (Director or VP) Entity: Powerhouse (Innovation Firm) Location: Oakland, CA (2-3 days/week in office with the remainder work from home)  About Powerhouse Addressing the climate crisis requires a complete transformation of our global energy and mobility systems. Our mission at Powerhouse is to identify the most innovative startups, connect them to the world‚Äôs leading corporations and investors, and drive decarbonization at scale.  Our innovation firm partners with corporations and investors to help them find and engage with cutting-edge startups, tap into proprietary market insights, and lead the next century of clean technology innovation.  Who are we looking for? Powerhouse is hiring a Head of Business Development to lead our sales strategy, develop a robust client pipeline, and deliver top-line revenue.  What you will lead:  Business Development Strategy & Execution Lead Powerhouse‚Äôs business development strategy and execution, from identifying key leads to closing new contracts Serve as the point of accountability for achieving sales goals and top-line revenue at Powerhouse Build a robust sales pipeline and engage with key stakeholders across the energy, mobility, and climate landscape Attract, develop, and retain outstanding talent to build out Powerhouse‚Äôs business development team  Engage with potential clients to identify key opportunities for innovation and decarbonization in collaboration with the Vice President of Strategy and Director of Partnerships Leverage industry expertise to inform client development and deliverables Conduct competitive analysis and evaluate market to improve product and sales strategy  Business Development Processes & Materials Manage our business development process and internal data systems, with support from the Director of Partnerships Support the development of sales materials and tailor materials to each prospective client Collaborate with the Marketing & Operations Associate to leverage Powerhouse‚Äôs marketing channels for business development  Product Refinement Work with existing clients to identify opportunities to expand upon Powerhouse services in collaboration with the Vice President and Director of Partnerships  About You 6-10+ years of relevant business development experience, including building business development functions and teams from the ground up Experience leading enterprise business development with global energy and/or mobility companies, tech companies, and utilities Demonstrated experience building a sales pipeline, pitching to prospective clients, and exceeding enterprise sales goals Experience attracting, developing, and retaining top business development talent Proven ability to identify and work with key decision makers within large and complex organizations Strong understanding of key corporate pain points in innovation and decarbonization Familiarity with the clean energy and mobility technology landscape Empathy for our clients and prospective clients and a drive to help them decarbonize their businesses Strong strategic, analytical and critical thinking skills and willingness to dive into the details and navigate through ambiguity Excellent oral and written communications skills Thrive in a fast-paced environment with limited support staff and a small but highly effective team  Compensation Competitive pay will be offered commensurate with qualifications, and competitive benefits will be provided including select comprehensive medical plans, 401(k) plan, flexible time off, and an annual professional development budget.  Diversity One of our values is to broaden leadership opportunities for women, people of color, LGBTQ+, and anyone with an experience historically underrepresented in companies, board rooms, and venture funds. We believe that everyone in the industry and at our company has to be committed to anti-racism. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive, safe, and growth-oriented environment for all members of our team.  Purpose, Culture, and Values Our purpose is to address the climate crisis with innovation.  The Powerhouse team has built a high-performance, results based, and impact oriented environment. We‚Äôre committed to cultivating a positive workplace that embraces feedback and supports personal and professional growth.  As Powerhouse has continued to grow, we have remained rooted in our values:  Ambition. Addressing the climate crisis requires the ambition to completely reimagine and rebuild our energy and mobility systems. At Powerhouse, we challenge ourselves‚Äîand our partners‚Äîto act boldly, innovate quickly, and decarbonize equitably.  Collaboration. No company‚Äîno matter how big‚Äîhas the ability to decarbonize by itself. Through our partnerships, we‚Äôre enabling collaboration between the biggest corporations and the most effective startups.  Innovation. The structures of the past hundred years are insufficient to address the climate crisis. Rapid decarbonization requires a radical expansion of new technologies to deploy our best solutions at scale.  People. Every startup, partner, and organization we work with is driven by people. Our work is rooted in strong and personal relationships with the people changing the way we power our world.

Aon is looking for a Resident Sales Director  As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as co-leader of our Sales team in Boston, MA. As a Resident Sales Director, you will report directly to the Resident Managing Director or Regional Sales Leader and will have direct reports.  Your impact as a Resident Sales Director  Responsible for driving growth across the Business Development/Sales functions, the Resident Sales Director (RSD) is accountable to the Resident Managing Director for delivering the new business goals of the office.  Job Responsibilities: Drive growth: Achieve or exceed the office‚Äôs quarterly and annual new business revenue goals; Support the execution of the National Sales and Marketing platform and initiatives Oversee the development and execution of personal, direct reports and other revenue producing colleagues sales goals. Develop and maintain a sales-focused culture across the office (direct reports and other colleagues) Maintain an accurate, detailed pipeline of new business development for confident revenue forecasting and beneficial sales metric analysis Monitor and assess ongoing new business results and related pipeline activity tracking across the office‚Äôs personnel, and promptly anticipate and address negative new business variances or trends and/or activity issues Forecast new business on a monthly and quarterly basis with accuracy Mentor and develop, problem-solve and strategize with the office‚Äôs Producers, Account Executives, and Broking Leaders to create, develop and close specific revenue opportunities Maintain a fair marketplace in terms of prospect allocation across the office and the firm‚Äôs resources and follow protocols for pipeline documentation and production credit disputes Create, tailor and/or execute marketing campaigns including email campaigns, mailings, seminars, webinars, seminars, roundtables and Forums to drive revenue opportunities tailored to the office‚Äôs new business priorities and market area(s) Educate Producers, Account Executives, and Broking Leaders on new products, approaches, services, solutions, and Aon‚Äôs capabilities; provide thought leadership with training on the segment or client applicability and recommended dialoguing with clients and prospects Work with the Account Executive Leader to ensure that the office‚Äôs clients receive consistent business expansion information Proactively and consistently communicate and meet with prospects, insurers, and competitors to maintain a current knowledge of talent in the office‚Äôs market area(s) Recruit and present your recommendation and business plan for the best business development personnel (Producers, Account Executives and support personnel to enable others to produce more) for the market area‚Äôs needs Onboard business developers with a clear understanding of their role, responsibilities, specified sales goals, and training on Aon Connect, as well as Aon‚Äôs office, national and global resources and systems Identify and nurture focused centers of influence in the accounting, legal, financial and other segments of the business community in the office‚Äôs market areas for office-wide collaboration and referral Ensure that Aon has earned a majority of its large clients‚Äô risk management, and, where applicable, employee benefits, wallet or spend Communicate innovative approaches, best practices, market trends and competitor trends nationally You Bring Knowledge and Expertise  Experience: Minimum 10 years of Sales Leadership in the Property and Casualty or Health Insurance industry Solid collaboration skills enabling candidate to successfully lead global new business teams in pursuit of target prospects Strong negotiation skills Exceptional oral presentation skills and ability to clearly articulate complex messages in written form Track record of personally initiating and closing complex sales Consistent achievement of assigned business goals Active execution in the development and maintenance of a productive sales and marketing culture Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience We offer you  A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience:  From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.  About Aon:  Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.  Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.  DISCLAIMER:  Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  2020-38032

description: Overview  Topgolf is the ultimate venue for FUN! We have a high energy, high volume food and beverage and entertainment concept that is like nothing else you have seen. We are seeking a Director of Sales for our new location to recruit, coach, mentor and lead our local Sales team, build strong community partnerships, network and introduce the awesome Topgolf brand to a new market!  If you are a current B2C Sales Leader that lights up the room when you enter, capable of showing others the influence and finesse of sales, and love the opportunity and challenge that comes with introducing our Topgolf concept to a new part of the nation, we would love to hear from you!  Topgolf participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.  Responsibilities Include  Key Responsibilities Mentoring, coaching and motivating the Topgolf team to exceed the quarterly and annual team sales goals set for the Topgolf site Perform revenue forecasts and win/loss reports that illustrate your team‚Äôs overall performance against quotas Creates sales campaigns focused on communicating and nurturing relationships with guests and driving repeat sales Conduct market analysis and devise strategies for generating new business Work closely with the National Director of Sales and Events and our Corporate Marketing Team Provide leadership to the day-to-day operations of the sales team, while maintaining focus on the company strategic goals Establish performance goals for sales team and monitors performance on a continual basis Develop, or participate with Senior Staff in the development of the Strategic Marketing Plan Ability to communicate effectively with new guests, return guests, co-workers and management Strong computer skills, particularly with Excel, Word and CRM Applications Ability to excel and multitask in a fast-paced environment Knowledge of local area business and existing client database Friendly, positive, outgoing personality who relates well and gets along with people Requirements Include  Key Qualifications Minimum 7+ years current Sales experience, preferable in hospitality, restaurant or entertainment venue focused on event sales 3+ years current B2C sales team management experience to include entry and mid experience levels Bachelors Degree either in Business Administration or Marketing, preferred. Will also consider applicants with relevant work history Topgolf is a global sports and entertainment community and is committed to equal opportunity and is firmly committed to preventing discrimination and harassment, including sexual misconduct, based on legally protected diversity characteristics (such as race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family status, citizenship, genetic information and veteran status) in its application and hiring processes and in its employment decisions. As an affirmative action employer, Topgolf also takes steps to prevent retaliation and to create a respectful, equitable and inclusive environment for our Guests, Associates, business partners, vendors, and the communities we serve.

description: Job Type  Full-time  Description  Here at Black Diamond it's all about climbing and skiing. We share the same experiences that you do on rock, ice and snow and these experiences push us to make the best gear possible for our worldwide family of climbers and skiers. We're a company of users. It's who we are. We're the greatest dreamers about what could be, and the harshest of critics about what exists. Because of this, the creation of Black Diamond is a process that will never end. The company today is more committed than ever, thanks to the many people here in the U.S. and at Black Diamond Europe whose limitless energy and hands-on involvement have created a promising future for all climbers and skiers worldwide.  The Key Accounts Sales Director will serve as the business development director on select strategic accounts and establish best practices for the BD Business Development Strategy. This individual is wholly responsible for directing all activities, functions, strategies and operations of the Sales Department‚Äôs internal division to achieve Sales Department strategic goals and objectives with Black Diamond Equipment Key Accounts as well as to offer the best service in the industry.  The Key Accounts Sales Director will proactively partner with Senior Sales Management, Sales Operations, Sales Agency Principals and Retail Marketing to define account level strategic plans and effectively communicate these details to key touch points within the organization and effectively leverage internal business partners across all geographical areas to ensure site level connection to the accounts strategic plan. He/she will work primarily at a strategic/vision level and oversee the tactical execution by means of working closely with the Key Accounts Sales Representative. He/she will serve as the primary spokesperson for both the in-house sales perspective and on behalf of the key accounts. He/she is also responsible for personally managing a couple of BD‚Äôs most important accounts and may also be required to take on additional Sale‚Äôs Department responsibilities as directed by Sales Department management.  In addition, KASD is responsible for developing and implementing a strategic business development best practices that can be utilized across the sales organization. The Business Development strategy will include (but is not limited to): target markets, target accounts, and sales revenue goals by account and territory. The KASD will be responsible for partnering with Regional and National Account Sales Reps to ensure they are aligned with the BD Development practices and philosophy.  Education  Requirements Required: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business or related field of study. Work Experience Preferred: 10 years of sales and customer/dealer service experience in the specialty outdoors industry. Proven track record relative to territory development and successful account relationships and immediate sales responsibility for a minimum of $5M. Preferred: 3 to 5 years of sales management experience with specialty outdoor business and a proven track record with key accounts both online and brick and mortar. Immediate sales responsibility for $25M. Skills And General Experience Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, as well as sales and product knowledge, are mandatory. Time management, account management, and computer skills are required. Must be articulate, detail oriented, and project the appropriate company image. Alternative qualification: A vast wealth of on-the-job experience that is directly applicable.  Required license: Driver‚Äôs License and Passport.  At BD, benefits begin on the first of the month following your date of hire with a generous portion of medical and dental paid for by BD. You also will get employer paid life insurance, Short and Long-Term Disability, as well as other wellness benefits, 401k, vacation and wellness time off, and company paid holidays. If that isn't enough, we are also a pet-friendly workplace with a casual dress code! If your passions are also in the outdoors, then you will also enjoy employee discounts on BD gear and apparel.  Black Diamond Equipment, Ltd is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex; including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Black Diamond Equipment HR representative.

description: Addteq is looking for an experienced, dedicated, and self-driven leader to manage sales and business development efforts with a data-driven approach.    Location: Remote  What You'll Do: Develop and execute strategic plans to facilitate achieving sales targets to meet the revenue goals. Maintain a transparent and active pipeline to support sales goals and objectives and ensure C-level executives are informed on the progress of those goals. Work closely with Marketing and Sales resources to create and manage the pipeline of new business in both existing customers and prospects. Create value propositions and manage how it is communicated to the clients.  Actively work with internal teams to perform all the necessary steps for effective prospecting and qualification and determining accurate sales cycle. Responsible for leading and mentoring the sales team, including assigning sales territories, setting quotas, assigning sales training, building a sales plan, and hiring and changing the sales team to meet the goals.  Directing and coordinating all sales activities. Working closely with the finance team to build sales budgets and projections to meet the revenue goals.    What We Are Looking For: Successful track record in SaaS or software sales leadership going through rapid growth during the expansion phase. Experience in data-driven sales approach in developing new and existing clients.  Understanding of AWS, Cloud, SaaS ecosystem along with its application to various verticals (BFSI, Healthcare, Pharma, Telecom). Excellent communication, preparation, strategy, presentation, and execution skills. We are looking for a coachable, enthusiastic, and dependable person who can scale and lead a global clientele. Maintains a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude toward customers at all times. Ensure customer satisfaction and provide professional customer support from the sales organizations. Curious, confident, and driven to present solutions to the customers Proven skills to create and enforce highly efficient and effective sales processes.  Dedicated to learning and mentoring in an ever-changing environment.  CRM (Hubspot, Pipedrive) and sales systems knowledge.  Comfortable working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Exposure to partner relationships within Atlassian, AWS, Monday.com, and other key partners is desired. BS or BA in business administration, sales, or marketing, communication is helpful.  Who We Are: Addteq is a company with high expertise in services focused around DevOps. The goal of DevOps is to change and improve the relationship between Development and Operations teams, by advocating better communication and collaboration between the two. Addteq looked at the market strategically and addressed some critical needs within the burgeoning ecosystem. The response has been 250% YOY growth and a successful launch of a suite of products that are quickly becoming ubiquitous in the Atlassian ecosystem.   Addteq is proud to be a Platinum Atlassian Solution, Government & Marketplace Partner. Our Atlassian marketplace products are being utilized by some of the largest companies and financial organizations in the United States, Japan, and Australia. We serve enterprise & public sector organizations by delivering the solutions our Fortune 500 client base has come to expect. We have offices located in NYC NY, Pune India, and Singapore, with our headquarters in Princeton NJ. If you feel the same as we do about DevOps, please join us!

description: About Side  At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.  Side is the only real estate brokerage platform exclusively for the nation‚Äôs best agents. Based on its belief that homeownership is a fundamental human right, we provide top-performing real estate agents, teams, and independent brokerages with the best system, support, and service, in order to elevate the experience and results of buyers and sellers.  Side is led by experienced industry professionals and world-class engineers who develop technology designed to improve agent productivity and enhance the client experience. The company is backed by over $250M in funding from top tier venture capital firms, including Coatue Management, Tiger Global Management, D1 Capital Partners, Sapphire Ventures, Trinity Ventures, Matrix Partners, and 8VC. Side currently partners with agents in California, Texas, and Florida, with plans to expand nationally in the coming months.  At Side, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you‚Äôll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life!  About The Role  Covering the Oregon market, you'll identify and sell into larger, high-value accounts which include recruiting top-producing independent brokerages who are producing $100M+ in transaction volume per year. Your main goal will be to help independent business owners join Side and convey the benefits of our offering.  This role is consultative in nature; your job will be to understand the brokerage's existing systems, processes, and resources and then create an economic benefit model as to how their business would be better off leveraging Side‚Äôs innovation, service and support platform. Your learnings and feedback will be instrumental in helping Side internal business functions such as; onboarding, product development and customer success scale this enormous business opportunity. If you have experience in and a passion for fast-paced, progressive work environments where you get to create solutions rather than simply execute them, then this could very well be the role and company for you!  What You'll Do Create and drive revenue within a specified region or list of named accounts by cold-calling and professional networking Build productive long lasting relationships that continue to pay dividends through trusted references in your market Be relentless about meeting personal and team sales targets Research accounts and follow through on sales leads while developing a strategic territory business plan Working with Side leadership to sell at the most strategic level and implementing a definitive strategy to showcase our value proposition to independent brokerages, large teams and unique real estate business models Keep an up-to-date understanding of a dynamic real estate industry and local market WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE? 8-10+ years of full-cycle sales experience (commercial or enterprise) Real estate industry knowledge and domain expertise is a plus A proven hunter and closer Strong top of the funnel engagement skills Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM Creative sale techniques and pipeline management A passionate influential sales style Success positioning and selling on benefits instead of feature/function Strong communication, collaboration, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Self-motivated, highly confident, and driven Compensation/Perks Competitive salary plus bonus opportunity Equity options Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental) Flexible PTO $1,000/year for learning and development Pet friendly environment Side is dedicated to working with the highest skilled people from the most inclusive talent pool feasible. We maintain that diversity in all aspects leads to positive change, solutions and innovation for our customers and career fulfillment for our employees. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply!  Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.  Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Job Title: Director, Sales  Job Number: #1433  Date Posted: 09/01/2021  Location: Las Vegas, NV  As Director, Regional Sales - Western Region, you will have the responsibility for managing and developing customer relationships to achieve sales targets including new business development from key prospects within the assigned region. This includes working closely with Marketing, Accounting, Service and Corporate staff to jointly represent the company‚Äôs products to clients and expedite customer orders. This also includes overseeing game sales recurring revenue objectives and coordinating product installation and ensuring customer satisfaction throughout the sales and installation processes.  Key Metrics Are  Success in this role is measured in terms of your ability to successfully manage your team and business within the assigned region. Activity - The number of customer activities that take place (meetings, phone calls, etc.) and are accurately logged within Salesforce. It is the Sales Directors responsibility to ensure the team is productive and hold each team member accountable. An accurate pipeline is a priority metric in measuring performance and a key function of the Sales Directors role is to coach, guide and support pipeline input and management to ensure strong and accurate forecasting. Results - Achieving revenue, profit, and margin goals. Ability to push each team member to achieve and exceed their goals. Assists with contract negotiations, closing sales and developing marketing plans for contract accounts Maintains expertise of new products, services and other general information of interest to customers. Monitors competitive activity Conducts presentations and meetings with key customers Troubleshoots problems regarding products provided. Answers questions from sales account executives and handles complaints Interfaces cross functionally to meet business objectives and solve problems Maintains up to date customer information Identifies and implements training programs to develop and enhance team‚Äôs product knowledge Proactively communicates business risks and field issues to internal management Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Aruze Gaming America, Inc.‚Äôs policies and applicable laws Other duties as assigned Qualifications  EDUCATION: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration or a related field or equivalent Required Experience 10+ years of sales and territory team management experience required Proven ability to achieve sales quotas Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics and requirements Willingness to travel (overnight travel by car and air required) Superior communication skills Able to operate independently Presentations Skills Performance Management Building relationships Results driver Ability to mentor other sales personnel Proficiency in MS applications including Word, Excel, and Access required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Strong written, and oral communication skills Strong attention to detail Excellent customer service skills Ability to multi-task and manage priorities Ability to work independently either individually or within a team structure with minimal direction Strong organizational and analytical skills and good follow-through required Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Demonstrated organization skills and attention to detail. Intermediate knowledge of Excel and Microsoft Word. Physical Requirements All team members are responsible for their personal safety and safety of others. Participate fully in company health and safety programs and comply with all company OSHA policies and procedures Follow all lawful employer safety and health rules Wear and/or use Personal Protective Equipment, when and how instructed Report hazardous conditions to management Report any job-related injury or illness to management, and seek treatment promptly Assigned duties are accomplished primarily in an office/production setting. Must be able to maneuver around an office/production setting, work at a desk/workstation and respond to written and oral cues Must have the manual dexterity to operate a computer and other necessary office/production equipment Must be able to sit for extended periods of time May be required to bend, reach, and lift up to 25 lbs. Must be comfortable working in an open work environment with limited ‚Äòprivate office‚Äô working space for extended periods. Prolonged periods of sitting, leaning, and bending. Extreme repetitive motion using keyboard, mouse, and telephone. Position can be high stress and extremely fast paced. Ability to handle directive, assess situations, enter into dialogue, and complete tasks. Must be able to effectively communicate verbally and in writing in English.  All employees are responsible for their personal safety and safety of others. Therefore, all employees must: Participate fully in company health and safety programs and comply with all company OSHA policies and procedures Follow all lawful employer safety and health rules Wear and/or use Personal Protective Equipment, when and how instructed Report hazardous conditions to management Report any job-related injury or illness to management, and seek treatment promptly Other duties as requested Work Conditions Office environment/desk job The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. description: We are assisting our client, SeerTech, in identifying a new Senior Business Development Executive  About SeerTech:  A privately-owned company, Seertech Solutions is one of the world‚Äôs foremost learning management system (LMS) providers, delivering mission-critical learning and compliance management solutions for their customers. SeerTech‚Äôs ability to deliver core LMS features as well as meet complex, global and industry-specific needs, has established Seertech Solutions as a leading niche provider for organizations all over the world. SeerTech is the preferred learning management system provider for more than 2 million people across more than 190 countries and in 39 languages.   Seertech brings together a market-leading software as a service LMS technology with US-based client opportunities to transform mission-critical extended enterprise service delivery business and organization workforce enablement outcomes. Seertech is well-positioned in ANZ and Asia-Pac, with an established presence in the US which it is now looking to significantly scale.    For additional information, visit www.seertechsolutions.com  Overview Reporting to the Americas Managing Director the Senior Business Development Executive will play an integral role in establishing the strategic sales direction and future growth plans for Seertech‚Äôs US-based go-to-market strategy. This role will work with leadership and help develop Sales, Marketing, Direct & indirect channel partnerships and go-to-market efforts. By generating and closing new LMS solution sales opportunities, the Senior Business Development Executive role will be a catalyst for change and lead the client acquisition efforts for Seertech.  Duties and responsibilities ‚Ä¢       Generate new sales leads in defined industry sectors and segments ‚Ä¢       Identify and grow sales accretive relationships in defined industry sectors and segments ‚Ä¢       Deliver on sales-related activities ‚Äì including creating and delivering sales pitches, pre-sales ‚Ä¢       product and solution demonstrations ‚Ä¢       Coordinate and attend marketing/networking events ‚Ä¢       Manage and maintain a database of Customer Opportunities and Relationships (CRM) ‚Ä¢       Manage records of sales, revenue, and other important data - CRM ‚Ä¢       Respond to RFP/I/Q ‚Ä¢       Prepare and negotiate new sales contracts, including pricing ‚Ä¢       Motivate other BDM team members with achieving sales goals ‚Ä¢       Brainstorming with the Managing Director and business development team members to create new marketing strategies ‚Ä¢       Arrange business meetings and one-on-one conversations with prospective clients ‚Ä¢       Build trust and long-term relationships with clients/customers ‚Ä¢       Cultivate positive interactions and relationships with sales representatives, team leaders and managers and executives to evaluate sales strategy and results ‚Ä¢       Develop ways to improve the customer experience and build brand loyalty ‚Ä¢       Research the market and industry trends   Skills and Qualifications ¬∑      Proven capability to rapidly develop and grow value-based sales opportunities in the learning technology, software services, or related sector ¬∑      Well-developed relationships and understanding of your assigned industry sectors ¬∑      Eager to expand the company with new sales, clients, and territories ¬∑      Goal-oriented, organized team player ¬∑      Encouraging to team and staff; able to mentor and lead junior staff as needed ¬∑      Able to analyze data and sales statistics and translate results into better sales results ¬∑      Excellent verbal and written communication skills ¬∑      Able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively ¬∑      Self-motivated and self-directed ¬∑      Experienced at preparing and presenting sales goals and forecasts ¬∑      Creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge ¬∑      Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, administration, or related field ¬∑      Highly Desired: Minimum 10 years of previous experience in complex technology sales, management, with specific emphasis on learning technology ¬∑      Demonstrated and proven sustainable sales results ¬∑      Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel) ¬∑      Fluent communication in person, on the phone, and in email ¬∑      Abide by all non-compete/solicit agreements ¬∑      Fast-paced decision making

description: Who We Are Since 1987, DocMagic has been solving the mortgage industry's toughest challenges with innovative technology solutions! By anticipating a change in advance of industry trends, DocMagic delivers unmatched service, compliance expertise, and strategic digital transaction management in support of our customers.  Position Summary The Director of Sales is responsible for managing and building a high-performance sales, marketing and lead generation team. This position will drive and ensure applicable metrics associated with all sales and marketing efforts are followed and successfully accomplished. Using the vision of the CEO as a guide, this position will assess a variety of market opportunities and will lead those efforts. The Director of Sales will direct activity to meet and exceed revenue goals and objectives.     Essential Functions Supervise and provide day-to-day leadership, coaching, mentoring and feedback to sales personnel to support talent development and ensure DocMagic sales goals are met, control expenses and adhere to established department budget. Ensure that every sales team member is trained and qualified to effectively sell every DocMagic product and service, and is regularly re-evaluated and graded based upon agreed metrics. Ensure all metrics are adhered to (i.e. calls, demos, etc.) and all communications, opportunities, leads, status updates, etc. are properly undated/reflected within Salesforce. Effectively manage the sales funnel and determine if additional leads are required to meet DocMagic sales goals. Work to establish annual and semi-annual sales goals. Consistently monitor, review and report performance relative to established sales goals. Oversee new account acquisitions and manage all sales efforts to drive growth and meet or exceed established DocMagic sales goals. Retain a diverse team of top-notch sales talent to infuse original thinking, creativity, innovation, analytical and execution skills into the company and specifically, the sales process. Participate in sales calls, demos, etc. with staff to ensure that sales personnel are properly presenting DocMagic products and services, executing established training knowledge, and meeting the customer's needs. Work with Sr. Marketing Manager to gage effectiveness of digital marketing, print, and convention/conference/tradeshow effectiveness. Track sponsorship effectiveness, related expenses, and provide feedback relative to lead generation efforts. At all times be an advocate of the company and inspire and lead Sales and other departments to adhere to the company's mission and promote a positive culture. Continue to provide weekly/monthly and other sales reports to CEO Responsible for working with Controller and CEO and assuring sales commission plans are in place and that all calculations are accurate Continue to provide weekly/monthly and other sales reports to CEO Because this position involves the managing a group of individuals in the Torrance office, must be in the Torrance office at least 2 weeks/month Responsible for working with Controller and CEO and assuring sales commission plans are in place and that all calculations are accurate  Other Skills Works as a team player and builds strong working relationships by collaborating with peers, and those across the company. Works in a positive, friendly manner at all times and inspires the company‚Äôs culture. Must be well-organized, extremely detail-oriented and willing to take ownership of responsibilities. Completes assignment on time or advises in advance of delays. Excellent time management, organizational and communication skills. Exercises sound judgment and decision-making skills. Works well under time limits, handles multiple tasks concurrently and prioritizes responsibilities. Strong problem-solving skills with ability to identify and correct situation. Takes risks to innovate and create better solutions for the job, department and the company.   Required Qualifications BA/BS degree in business administration or related field 5 years management and supervisory experience. 2 years experience with Salesforce or similar platform. 2 years using strong problem-solving, time management and analytical skills. 2 years experience working with Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Outlook. 2 years Mortgage industry experience and knowledge preferred. Frequent travel

jobTitle: Vice President of Health Plans Sales
description: Charlton Morris has recently teamed up with a leading Digital Healthcare company. We are looking for a Vice President of Health Plans Sales  Vice President of Health Plans Sales My client is a leading digital health platform that was created for doctors, by doctors and was designed to integrate directly into the provider‚Äôs workflow, reducing administrative burden and improving patient outcomes. While their clients today are primarily health plans and networks, their users are providers and their administrators.  The Vice President (VP) of Health Plan Sales is a critical addition to my client's growth strategy. With recent successes, they are expanding their team, and are looking to add this key player to help others as they grow.   The Candidate Candidates are expected to have 8‚Äì10 years of direct health plan sales experience, preferably in the technology space. The candidate will also have a strong understanding of the health plan markets, particularly the Medicare Advantage market.  The candidate should have an understanding of risk adjustment, Stars and HEDIS, and bring a Rolodex of contacts in the industry responsible for these initiatives within the health plan.  The candidate needs the ability to create opportunities for growth across the Medicare Advantage market through creative outreach, targeting, and building value for the prospects that will drive success in this position.  Desired work experience and skills: A Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) with 8‚Äì10+ years of work experience in health care sales is required, plus 5+ years of experience in a managerial sales role. An advanced degree such as an MBA or MPH is a bonus. 8+ years in a client-facing role is ideal. Proven ability to interact professionally and effectively with customers is a must. Experience understanding the complex business needs of large organizations. Proficient in Salesforce. Expertise in leveraging all Microsoft Office applications‚Äîcan‚Äôt be tech-averse and must be a quick learner.  Proficient in Microsoft Excel with experience working with, analyzing and presenting data.  The successful candidate will have: The ability to be unflappable and to remain poised in the face of client objections, tight deadlines, etc. The tenacity and proficiency at developing ‚Äùtrusted advisor‚Äù status with customers and internal staff. The ability to think independently and problem-solve, including as it relates to technical components, to satisfy clients. The ability to delegate. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail; a thorough thinker. Strong professionalism in written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment.  Compensation: Competitive salary commensurate with experience, plus commissions, medical, 401k.
