description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. Assist in the post-sale transition from sales to the professional services team. You'll Need To Have  What we‚Äôre looking for... Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Knowledge of Cloud vs. On-Premise deployment. Experience with Video Management Software, Video Analytics and Sensors. Willingness to travel. description: Freshly is a fast-growing, food-tech startup and the largest fresh-prepared-meal delivery service in the country. It‚Äôs our mission to make eating healthy easy (for all kinds of people with all kinds of different needs) by delivering fresh, nutritious, fully cooked meals directly to customers. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. This is your chance at being a part of history and future success.  Director, Strategic Partnerships  Who We Are  Freshly is a fast-growing, food-tech startup and the largest fresh-prepared-meal delivery service in the country. It‚Äôs our mission to make eating healthy easy (for all kinds of people with all kinds of different needs) by delivering fresh, nutritious, fully cooked meals directly to customers. Who You Are  You are customer-obsessed and thrive on building innovative and customized solutions and products to maximize performance and impact. You have strong communications skills and are able to swiftly mobilize cross-functional teams towards a shared vision and common set of goals. You are highly motivated and creative, capable of delivering breakthrough concepts that deliver results.  You have 7+ years of experience in strategic partnerships, retail sales and/or partner marketing with a strong foundation of bringing impactful strategic deals to life from conception to execution. We‚Äôd be super impressed if you have relationships in the grocery/convenience retail sector.  What The Role Is  Reporting to the VP of Brand Partnerships, the Director, Strategic Partnerships will play a critical role, responsible for leading the development and execution of the company‚Äôs channel expansion strategy. It will also include ownership and management of key relationships at partner organizations and with stakeholders internally.  In This Role You Will Own the discovery and feasibility assessment of various channel expansion opportunities and partnerships to meet key strategic goals Originate and develop new partnership and channel growth strategies for our business Build and help deliver compelling business cases around key priorities to gain organizational support and resourcing Build partner-facing proposals, helping develop new business around strategic partners and supporting strategic relationship management Craft the strategic plan, work across internal teams to gain internal alignment and present to the leadership team for final approval Act as the primary liaison for potential new partners, owning deal negotiation and structuring commercial terms in coordination with Finance and Legal Partner with internal commercial, marketing, product development, insights, and supply chain teams to develop partner programs/initiatives. Basic Qualifications 7+ years of strategic partnerships, retail sales and/or partner marketing Creative problem solver who doesn‚Äôt get discouraged easily Data-driven in evaluating partnership opportunities and success Flexible self-starter with attention to detail who is able to work in a fast-paced environment and support multiple projects at once Experience managing a budget Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal

description: PandaDoc has a phenomenal product and a badass inbound funnel. We receive over 40,000 inbound leads per month (not a typo!) and you can lead a global SDR org that is turning this demand into revenue.  With the help of Revenue Operations, SDR Enablement and a state of the art toolset (Hubspot, proprietary lead scoring system, Salesforce, SalesLoft, Drift, Calltrackingmetrics, Chilipiper) this is your opportunity to do career defining work in one of Forbes Best Startup Employers.  We are a team of amazing pandas, customers and VCs - join us and get ready for takeoff.  In this role, you will: Report directly to the SVP of Sales to define the strategy and objectives of your organization Lead the strategy and execution to drive inbound and outbound pipeline for revenue teams covering our Commercial and Enterprise segments Manage a global org with team leads in the US, EMEA and APAC and motivate them through creative incentives Management of KPIs and Benchmarks for SDRs and LDRs across the globe to drive higher conversion rates and career progression for each team member Develop SDR plays and tactics to drive consistency in the global team and implement new technologies, processes, and strategies to improve productivity Partner with Marketing, RevOps, Sales, Enablement, Product and GTM leaders to build and scale a world-class funnel  About you: 5+ years of sales leadership experience in SaaS, including global experience 7+ years of total sales experience Experienced 2-3x headcount growth in one of your roles. You know what it is like to grow fast Have a knack for hiring, building, and retaining talent Outstanding coaching skills, hands-on leadership style, and passionate about talent development Direct experience managing SDRs/BDRs/LDRs Previously worked in a high activity transactional sales environment in SMB or Mid-Market Data-driven and able to identify gaps and opportunities to improve the pipeline in the day to day for the team. You can read data and build your own SFDC reports Comfortable with change and a fast-paced work environment Love collaborating across departments and have demonstrated a strong ability to execute cross-functionally  Company Overview PandaDoc empowers more than 30,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visit https://www.pandadoc.com.  Company Culture We're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.  Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency, and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers.  Benefits Our benefits include tremendous career growth opportunities, a competitive salary, health and commuter benefits, company-paid life & disability, 20+ PTO days, 401K and FSA plans, and of course, a fun team of Pandas to work with!    PandaDoc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.   EXTERNAL RECRUITERS Approval Requirement The use of external recruiters/staffing agencies requires prior approval from our HR Team. The HR Team at PandaDoc requests that external recruiters/staffing agencies not to contact PandaDoc employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. Complying with this request will be a factor in determining future professional relationships with PandaDoc.

description: About the Role:  As Director, Sales Operations, you will be responsible for defining and organizing prospect priorities, and tracking the performance of Papaya's sales team. You will drive key strategic initiatives to influence success of the sales organization.  Teamwork, flexibility, communication, and a willingness to learn are of the highest importance. Papaya believes that diversity helps build an inclusive culture where all team members can grow, contribute, and feel valued. If you agree, we'd love to hear from you!  What you would be doing: Market research to identify prospects, size market and drive prioritization. Evaluate and report on performance of sales channels, reps and individual programs. Act as primary interface between Sales and Finance and Technology. Data analysis to support sales initiatives. Build slides for board and investor presentations.  We'd like to hear from candidates with: Experience in Salesforce, ZoomInfo, or other CRM and research tools Strong organizational skills and comfort developing and managing sales reports Proven analytical expertise Flexibility to thrive in a fast-paced environment on a growing team  Why Papaya?  Papaya started in 2016 with a goal to alleviate the stress of paying bills. We've adopted our phones for everything else, why not eliminate the need for calls, mailing checks, and tedious web forms? We are expanding mobile share of the $4T US consumer bill space, and are one of the fastest growing startups in Los Angeles.  The key to our success? Our people. From engineering, sales, to operations, Papaya's team is comprised of some of the most intelligent, humble, diverse, and resourceful people you'll ever meet. With the help of successful investors including Sequoia Capital, First Round Capital, and Silicon Valley Bank; Papaya is building something special. Our impact-driven team receives competitive salary, benefits, and equity.  We love to celebrate our incredible group of hardworking employees - and it shows. We're proud to say that we were voted one of Built In LA's Best Small Companies to Work for in 2020! Learn more and come join us. Find out what the next step in your career could look like here at Papaya.

description: Drop is a rewards platform on a mission to inspire people to live their optimal lives by empowering them financially. Through our personalized platform, Drop intelligently surfaces the right brands, at the right time, to make members‚Äô everyday better than it was before. Powered by machine learning, Drop matches consumers with over 500+ partner brands to satisfy two main goals: to earn points from their purchases and redeem them for instant rewards.  Headquartered in Toronto, with an office in New York, Drop is backed by world-class investors including NEA, HOF, Royal Bank of Canada, Sierra Ventures, and White Star Capital.  To learn more, visit: www.joindrop.com, or follow us at @joindrop on Instagram and Twitter.  The Role  We‚Äôre looking for a dynamic and high performing Director, Channel Partnerships to spearhead the growth of Channel Partnerships team! Reporting to the VP, Enterprise Sales and Strategic Partnerships, you will be working closely with our clients and partners, while also working with other leaders across Sales, Client Success, Data, Engineering and Product at Drop.  You Will Be Responsible For Generating and converting qualified opportunities Identifying, prospecting and contacting potential partners; engaging clients and delivering the value proposition; following up with proposals based on client needs. Managing and servicing active accounts - working with internal partners to ensure timely client deliveries while ensuring the products are of the highest quality. Consistently securing renewals and exposing partners to new products and services that will have a positive impact on their business and Drop‚Äôs revenue. Establishing long term partnerships and looking for creative ways to develop a continued pipeline of new business. Distilling, prioritizing and communicating client needs across the organization so that Drop can enhance its product suite to better serve our clients.  What You Bring To The Table 5+ years of proven experience in a similar sales/BD role ideally in Alternative Data, Finance, and Technology (SaaS). 5+ years of proven experience in a similar sales/BD role ideally at an FI or Fin-tech. A consultative mindset. Strong understanding of Fin-techs, FI's role in the marketplace A metrics-driven individual with a proven track record of achieving and consistently exceeding revenue quotas and goals. You are a self-motivated and tenacious individual who can change a ‚Äòno‚Äô to a ‚Äòyes‚Äô and are all about driving results. Strong presentation development skills (Powerpoint, Keynote). Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to respond to rapid change, perform duties with accuracy and with a strong degree of urgency. Good listener - Ability to understand client needs, create relevant solutions, set proper expectations and communicate important details. Experience working with tools like Looker, Hubspot, etc. is an asset. Comfortable selling a product that is unknown to the market and can effectively educate prospects and find creative ways to get in front of them.  Bonus Points You have worked at an FI, neo-bank, payment card network or startup that has partnered with one of the former You a good working knowledge of merchant funded offers and/or rewards  Benefits Unlimited time off Parental leave benefits Stock options Don't have Drop yet?  Check us out in the Google Play or App store  Follow the Link below and use Code: "Candidates" to get a 5k welcome bonus on us! Happy saving Friends!  https://b.ewd.io/candidates  At Drop, we're committed to providing an enjoyable and meaningful environment for every member of our team. description: Live shows make us feel good. They're a time to hang with our friends, discover new artists or lose ourselves on a dance floor. We're on a mission to bring all of this to more fans, more often ‚Äì and that's where you come in.  We're looking for a West Coast Account Director to join our Account Management team in Los Angeles and make it easier for partners to put on incredible events.  At DICE, you'll be part of the company that's redefining live entertainment. It's a place where you can be yourself, influence the culture, and create work that you're proud of.  About The Role  Our partnerships are a big part of what makes DICE special. We develop relationships with the world's best venues, promoters and artists so that together, we can change the live music industry for the better. You'll be responsible for the success of these incredible people, helping them grow their businesses all around the world.  You'll be Building relationships with partners to drive revenue and ensure retention Leading and coaching our team of account managers in LA Working with the Global Head of Account Management on your market strategy Collaborating with other teams on high impact projects Using your knowledge of DICE and industry best practices to provide through leadership Helping the Sales team win new business  You are Well-versed in the ticketing/live industries A proven manager with strong account management experience Passionate, humble and talented A fan of music and culture Actively responsible Skilled at relationship building Confident in pitching and negotiating Able to develop & execute on a strategic vision  You'll need Strong problem-solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication Rigorous attention to detail A track record of delivering financial results  About DICE  Our teams work from London, New York, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Paris and Milan. We're building products that will revolutionise the industry for fans, artists and venues ‚Äì and we're growing fast.  We know that having a variety of perspectives makes us a better company ‚Äì it's why we strongly encourage members of underrepresented communities to apply. Find out how we're creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive DICE.  Our Benefits Unlimited vacation Private healthcare 401k, FSA and HSA  During the pandemic, we've learned that working from home can help us focus, but many of us are missing the buzz of the office. We're still figuring out the best way for us all to work together in the future, and we'll involve the whole team in any decisions we make.  Application process  Our process usually involves a quick chat on the phone, a portfolio review or task and a couple of interviews where you'll meet the people you'll work with. We'll keep you fully informed along the way.  For information on how we use your data, please view our Candidate Privacy Policy

description: Club Feast is a technology company that connects subscribers with their favorite local restaurants and saves them 40% on their pre-scheduled food delivery. By re-imagining the current paradigm, Club Feast saves customers money, enhances restaurants' profitability, and improves the food delivery experience for all!  Club Feast is backed by General Catalyst and other top investors. For more information, visit www.clubfeast.com or check us out on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook at ‚Äú@clubfeast‚Äù.  We are looking for a creative, strategic-thinking and highly driven Vice President of Sales to build and develop our sales team for our rapidly-growing food-delivery startup. The VP of Sales will be responsible for our restaurant acquisition strategy, directing our territory expansion, and overall management of our sales organization.  As the VP of Sales, you will collaborate closely with various in-house leaders across Operations, Growth and Product. As a hands-on leader, you will support your teams sourcing and converting leads whilst ensuring they are outperforming their sales targets at all times. You will strive to balance encouraging mentorship with effective performance management, to develop everyone into the future top-billers of the company.  Key Responsibilities: Building and driving a solid outbound sales strategy, overseeing team‚Äôs cold calling, networking, and restaurant outreach in order to get the best restaurants on our platform Managing and building the Club Feast sales team, recruiting top talent, developing our existing team, and creating a strong sales culture Driving our expansion and territory opening strategy and execution Creating a culture of continuous improvement through regular analysis of the team's performance - being reactive and inspiring change Assisting the Executive Leadership team with analytics and data driven decisions  Requirements You are a proven strategic sales leader, with at least 7 years of sales leadership experience in the food-tech, restaurant, e-commerce and/or B2B/B2C markets Have scaled a sales organization at a VC-backed start-up Highly collaborative, with ability to work cross-functionally and provide insight to various internal stakeholders across the business You have experience leveraging data and metrics to assess current operations and make analytical recommendations for improvement Highly organized and able to prioritize shifting workloads and responsibilities effectively You know how to balance agility with building the systems and practices required for scale Honestly, formal education doesn‚Äôt matter as much as your results. What have you done? What have you built?  Benefits  Competitive compensation package with generous equity upside. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**  We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: Description  The Head of Global of Sales Development will own Mavenlink‚Äôs outbound lead generation function. They will be focused on defining and executing a global strategy targeted at developing sufficient pipelines to meet and exceed company sales targets. The right candidate has a proven track record of both building and leading global teams in prospecting and strategic planning and is passionate about amplifying client acquisition, developing sales funnels, and working in a dynamic environment.  Responsibilities Builds and manages a large global team of Business Development Representatives (BDRs), ensuring the entire function hits lead generation targets (quality and quantity) that match revenue forecasts and goals. Owns the sales process from lead generation to lead nurturing which encompasses the following stages: Stage 1 (Initial Contact); Stage 2 (Sales Accepted Opportunity); Stage 3 (Sales Qualified Opportunity). Develops and executes a comprehensive outbound lead generation strategy and works closely with key leaders in Marketing, Enablement, Sales, and Business Operations ensuring the strategy stays on course and is adjusted as needed based on business conditions. Responsible for collaborating with Business Operations, Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, and various internal teams to communicate targets and performance. Ensures clear and constant communication of goals and success metrics to the organization to deliver consistency and accountability. Drives performance against pipeline goals, ensuring sufficient pipeline to achieve sales goals. Identifies and implements effective growth opportunities for outbound lead generation. Defines and tracks lead forecasts and conversion rates. Focuses on team/individual development and enabling upward talent mobility within Sales & Services organizations. Develops the entire BDR talent supply chain. Motivates team. Guides team on how to progress their career through effective coaching, training and development. Required Skills And Experience 7-10 years of sales leadership experience with a lead generation focus (or relevant initiatives). Proven experience building, scaling, and managing a global BDR team of 50+ members in both a startup and mid market / enterprise SaaS company. Expert and viewed as the authority on lead generation. Proven leader, motivator, and coach with teams of varying levels of experience. Collaborative, team player who can adapt to a fast paced ever changing environment. An analytical minded person who is passionate about numbers and data. Experience working in a fast-growth technology company, developing and executing on strategic initiatives. Experience working with complex solutions and creating brand awareness. Possesses the ability to translate business objectives into effective lead generation strategies. Strong project management skills; comfortable running various sized projects driving people, process, and technology-related initiatives. 30% travel required to Mavenlink‚Äôs office locations in Irvine, Salt Lake City, Boston, London, and Melbourne.

description: US Sales Director 4M is on a mission to create a geo-database of subsurface infrastructure across the world. Our advanced solutions are changing the industry and we want to find a partner who will grow our business with us!  As Sales Director, you will: Establish 4M‚Äôs US sales division Recruit, manage, and grow a sales team Handle everything from lead generation to closing deals Activate your existing network and knowledge across the utility, engineering, and construction industries Introduce new clients to the value propositions and proven success of an innovative technology for the industry Establish robust relationships with strategic clients and partners  We‚Äôre looking for someone who is: An experienced professional from: Option 1: SUE (Subsurface Utility Engineering), EPC (Engineering-Procurement-Construction), or Design & Build sectors Option 2: Oil & Gas or Energy sectors Based in the US, preferably Texas  You may be a great fit if: You were born to sell You‚Äôre always on top of your KPIs and sales analytics You have tons of passion and ambition for the future of the industry You keep up-to-date on changing standards, new legislation, new technologies, and policymakers in the utility, engineering, and construction industries You‚Äôre hands-on and comfortable working at every stage of the sales pipeline You work fast and adjust quickly to the intense environment of a growing company You can put your amazing communication and presentation skills to work in any situation, whether it‚Äôs an official sales deck or a one-on-one beer with a client You‚Äôre ready to jump on a flight and meet a potential client, no matter where You want to join a young but rapidly expanding company and shape its future  What‚Äôs it like to work at 4M? We are revolutionizing the way we deal with our entire utility infrastructure from the ground down. The service we provide doesn‚Äôt exist yet as an industry standard‚Äîit‚Äôs an opportunity to completely innovate how the industry works with geo-data. Our technology is a game changer: it‚Äôs based on artificial intelligence and remote sensing, as well as tried-and-tested applications and years of military and civilian experience.  This isn‚Äôt your average office: we‚Äôre a family, full of energy and new ideas, and we‚Äôre growing rapidly. Joining 4M now is not just a new job, it‚Äôs an opportunity to shape the future of a company with some of the best industry experts and significant investors supporting our progress.  Want to join our mission? APPLY NOW

Who We Are  Talend, a leader in data integration and data integrity, is changing the way the world makes decisions.  Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all.  Over 6,500 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is consistently recognized as a leader in its field by Forrester and Gartner.  We pride ourselves in our values of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.  Regional Sales Director  Passionate, focused, intellectually curious, goal driven? These are the success attributes for Talend‚Äôs Regional Sales Director. Enterprise businesses are rapidly transforming into data-driven businesses and our open source-based Big Data, Master Data Management and Data Services solutions are in demand from companies across all verticals. You will be responsible for driving revenue, within existing and new customers, developing and mentoring high performing Account Execs and working cross-functionally with various stakeholders to drive success.  Talend is a rapidly growing leader in the cloud, data and application integration space. We are a global company with offices in Redwood City, Paris, London, Bonn, Beijing, Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, and Bangalore. Our customers are thought leaders in data integration, cloud, and big data, and they represent some of the biggest and best names in retail, financial services, consumer products, and business services.  We are seeking an experienced leader who is recognized for his coaching and management ability and proven record of delivering sales results. A background in selling Data Management, Application Integration, Cloud and subscriptions are a plus.  As The Regional Sales Director, You Will Meet quarterly quota targets objectives Define and develop account and territory strategies for new and existing customers Define and own the regional marketing plans Personally engage in deals as executive sponsor, as a difference maker for Account Executives and for prospects Deeply engage with internal stakeholders - professional services, finance, marketing, sales, pre-sales, and executive teams - on customer/sales proposals, campaigns, programs, customer events, etc. Actively manage regional territory and deal flow for both current and next year quota and pipeline targets Deliver accurate forecasts on a monthly, quarterly, half, and annual basis Identify, hire, mentor, and coach high-performance Account Executives Be a key member of Americas leadership team helping develop Americas wide strategy working with SVP and other regional leaders. Why You Will Like Working At Talend Nothing‚Äôs more exciting than working at a dynamic leader, recognized multiple times by leading analyst firms. Highly collaborative environment, where every opinion matters Our drive to constantly innovate attracts the best and brightest talent Opportunity to make a difference, excel personally and professionally and have fun! What You Need To Be Successful In This Role Bachelor‚Äôs degree required Exceptional character; operating with high integrity Passionate about customer success through demonstrated executive relationships, a track record of long-term trusted partnerships, and a willingness to make every wildly successful Deep understanding of land and expand subscription/ recurring revenue models and proven success of growth and revenue attainment within that business model ‚Äì ideally with an ASP > $75K. 5+ years senior management experience in software sales with proven year after year quota achievement 10+ years‚Äô experience selling complex software into Fortune 500 mid-market companies; ideally with data management or application integrations software Proven ability to take a new product to market, execute and deliver on sales goals Self-starter, independent, resourceful ‚Äì driven to action and results Extensive customer interaction experience and proven account and territory management experience Outstanding collaboration and communication skills; verbal and written Ability to perform and thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity environment; able to think strategically and execute tactically Strong operations skills around forecasting, account management, commission plans and budgeting Proven success structuring complex deals with multiple variables; must have strong analytical skills Proven success in identifying, building, growing and managing a distributed field sales team Strong leader and problem solver with excellent customer facing capabilities to influence and negotiate Strong teamwork and collaboration skills with the ability to drive decision-making across multiple organizational functions Talend is committed to equal employment opportunity and prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.  And Now, a Little About Us  Talend has received some pretty impressive accolades along the way: CEO named a 2020 Top Diverse Leader by the National Diversity Council 5th consecutive year named a Leader for Data Integration Tools in the Gartner Magic Quadrant 2020 3rd consecutive year named as a Leader for Data Quality Solutions in Gartner Magic Quadrant 2020 Recognized as a Challenger for Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service ( iPaaS ) in Gartner Magic Quadrant 2020 "2018 Best Public Cloud Computing Companies To Work For" by Glassdoor Named Leader in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Enterprise Data Fabric Ranked in the DBTA ‚Äú100 Companies that Matter Most in Data‚Äù Listed in the CRN Big Data 100 Companies We are passionate about helping companies become more data driven; and, if we can be honest, we are all geeks at heart who pride ourselves on the vibrant company culture that we have built.  As a global employer, Talend believes our success depends on diversity, inclusion and mutual respect among our team members. We want to look like our customers, and we recruit, develop and retain the most hardworking people from a diverse candidate pool. We are committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of business need, merit, capability and equality of opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

description: We are looking for an experienced Sales Development Director to oversee and support our Sales Development team. The Sales Development Director will be responsible for overseeing the Sales Development team and ensuring quarterly business and meeting goals are met. In addition to meeting quarterly goals, the Sales Development Director will also manage the entire sales development administration process. The position is highly collaborative across various internal teams, including a field sales team of 16 sales representatives and marketing.  Responsibilities: Manage the Sales Development team Own planning and coordination of sales development campaigns and outreach Set and track quarterly and annual meeting, RFP, and attributable revenue targets for your team Suggest and implement improvements in the inside sales administration process Coordinate department projects to meet deadlines Report on inside sales metrics and suggest improvements to leadership on a quarterly basis Prepare quarterly and annual meeting, RFP and attributable revenue forecasts Use industry news, sales team feedback, and marketing intel to generate ideas about new outreach campaigns  Research and discover methods to increase prospect engagement Ensure equitable distribution of leads across national sales team Build an open-communication environment for your team Liaise with Marketing department to ensure brand consistency and increase sales  Key Competencies: 5+ years of sales development experience in the Ad Tech/MarTech space Proven work experience as an Inside sales manager or director In-depth understanding of the digital media landscape Hands on experience with CRM software and MS Excel Excellent interpersonal and team management skills Strong analytical and organizational skills Numerical abilities and problem-solving attitude Experience managing a remote team BS degree in Sales, Business Administration, Marketing or relevant field a plus  Life at Digilant: Digilant was started 10 years ago with the mission to help agencies and brands connect their digital advertising spend to revenue. We do this with omnichannel digital advertising strategies that are data-driven, actionable, and effective. We‚Äôve succeeded because we continually innovate to help our clients with purpose-built solutions tailored to their needs.  At Digilant, we foster an atmosphere of trust and respect. We‚Äôre a nimble team of data-obsessed strategists, platform experts, analysts, and creative marketers. Consequently, we seek those who roll up their sleeves, get excited by data, and can rise to the challenge of delivering excellent service and measurable results for our clients. Sound interesting? We‚Äôd love to hear from you.  Digilant employees receive competitive benefits and perks that include the following: Extensive health benefits for you, your partner, and your immediate family are effective on Day 1 and include medical, dental, and vision insurance as well as short-term and long-term disability insurance. Uncapped paid time off (PTO), Summer Fridays and regular ‚ÄúWellness‚Äù days to help our employees stay happy and productive both inside and outside of work. Minimum of 8-weeks paid time off for new parents. This benefit covers the birth of a child and adoptions. Flexible work from home policy. Annual Company Meeting trip, paid for by Digilant. Pre-tax commuter benefit programs. 401k with a matching contribution. Internet and cell phone reimbursement.  Digilant, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

description: DIRECTOR OF SALES -WEST REGION  THE OPPORTUNITY - 7SIGNAL - The Leader in Digital Experience Monitoring  As a key member of a dynamic, game-changing software company, the Director of Sales, you will:  Be responsible for the overall sales strategies and results of the CA,NV,OR WA States and Western Canada. Plan and direct all sales activities to sell products/services to new and current customers to close large enterprise deals and achieve/exceed quota. Establish and maintain customer satisfaction in area accounts working collaboratively with systems engineering, customer support and channel partners  Present and communicate complex technical concepts effectively, matching customer requirements with company solutions. Prospect new customers and develop effective proposals for presentation to customer.  Have applied knowledge WiFi, the company solution, the IT industry, competing technologies, emerging technology trends and local geography business environment.  Coordinate sales and corporate resources effectively to develop new business opportunities and expand existing customer deployments. Using salesforce.com, maintain an extremely accurate 90 day forecast, manage pipeline development and document the sales progress for each opportunity. Can live anywhere on the west coast.  QUALIFICATIONS The ideal candidate will have these characteristics and experiences:  Seasoned industry professional with strong experience in selling networking infrastructure and performance monitoring solutions.  Has a consistent record of over achievement of sales quotas.  Possesses a network of contacts and recent sales successes in large enterprise accounts in the West Region. Possesses excellent written, verbal, and presentation communication skills.  Can sell to economic buyers as well as technical buyers, and understands how to communicate ROI, payback period, and risk avoidance concepts.  Agility to learn and understand complex technologies quickly, and apply knowledge directly to customer interactions. Customer focused, attuned to customer needs. Places a premium on meeting customer expectations and maintaining customer satisfaction. Has strong prospecting skills and motivation to create opportunities  Is a strong team player, has extremely high integrity, has a very high energy level, is able to multitask effectively, and can adapt to overcome barriers to selling. Holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent training in business or sales management.  Is hungry for the opportunity to work with a young, groundbreaking company.  About 7SIGNAL 7SIGNAL is a leader in enterprise Wireless Network Monitoring. The 7SIGNAL platform is a cloud-based Wireless Network Monitoring (WNM) solution that continuously tests the wireless network for performance issues - maximizing network uptime, device connectivity and network ROI.  The platform was designed for the world‚Äôs most innovative organizations, educational institutions, hospitals and government agencies and is currently deployed at Booz Allen Hamilton, IBM, Kaiser Permanente, Walgreens, Microsoft and many others.  7SIGNAL continuously monitors the connectivity of over 4 million global devices. Learn more at www.7signal.com.

description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in Spain and Portugal (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within Spanish and Portuguese merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Spanish and Portuguese languages will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now! jobTitle: Vans Senior Director, Sales, Strategic Accounts
description: Costa Mesa, CA  Job Ad  Vans: Be a Part of the Original  ‚ÄúIt was never about waving the brand like a flag, it was always about the people‚Äù ‚Äì Paul Van Doren  Vans is the original action sports footwear company, rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, Vans has thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the expressive creators within our company and community as they bring new and innovative perspectives to help shape and transform the future of our business.  At Vans, our culture sets us apart and influences everything we do. We are driven by five values: We are determined. We are connected to our consumers and to each other. We are inclusive. We are expressive and fun. And most of all, we are a family. Vans is a subsidiary of VF, one of the world‚Äôs largest apparel and footwear companies with socially and environmentally responsible operations spanning numerous geographies, product categories and distribution channels. As we continue to expand, VF and Vans take great measures in developing and growing our people.  Vans is founded on a culture of learning. We take pride in our ability to facilitate learning opportunities by providing the resources and tools necessary to support each individual‚Äôs pursuit of growth to achieve future goals driven by our brand purpose.  Our purpose to enable creative expression and inspire youth culture is fostered through inclusivity. We welcome anyone and everyone into our global family and proudly celebrate an environment where individuality is embraced, equal opportunities thrive, and everyone is empowered to reach their greatest potential.  By joining the Vans family, you will be immersed in an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work very hard across a multitude of large initiatives to bring the Van Doren spirit to life. We live for what we do.  Senior Director, Sales, Strategic Accounts: Become the Newest Member of the Vans Family  Here at Vans, our purpose is to enable creative expression - and inspire youth culture - by celebrating and encouraging the Off the Wall attitude that comes from expressing your true self.  We are searching for an individual that stands out from the rest; one who catches our eyes with their confident demeanor and unwavering curiosity. We need someone who is a visionary with a stream of innovative ideas that will lead our strategic accounts into their next chapter of growth thru a laser focus on the consumer. We are looking for a strategic business driver who can elevate our business to next level growth with enhanced partnership. In this role, this individual is responsible for driving the Go To Market (GTM) process across the US sales team. They will ensure that strategic apparel and footwear initiatives are executed to the highest standards. This individual is responsible for leading and coaching the strategic key account team to propel our strategic initiatives. They will be responsible for delivering brand and financial goals and positioning the brand for long term health.  This position is fast paced and will be responsible for driving some of our most dynamic wholesale partnerships. This person will be a key liaison for connecting sales, merchandising and marketing to develop a collective vision across the brand that comes to life within each of our accounts. Looking for someone who leads with a balanced art | science approach, cultivating teams with passion and empathy, driving results and bringing new thinking to life while grounding every decision with data.  How You Will Make a Difference  Initiate the Go-To-Market (GTM) processes throughout U.S. Wholesale with a specific focus on key strategic accounts, apparel and footwear. Communicate needs of business that support long term growth plans.Validation of decisions with data driven insights and development of strategic plans to drive business solutions. Hone in on white space to deliver growth specific to consumer needs within each unique business. Establish and refresh long term strategic growth plans for each account to ensure long term success. Development and mentorship of team to deliver results and engagement. Partner with global counterparts to drive synergy across business. Drive with digital first approach.Fuel business with innovative tactics to unlock digital momentum.  Skills For Success  Years of Related Professional Experience: 12+ years  Educational/ Position Requirements A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business or related field and a minimum of 10 years general management experience in the Wholesale, Retail, Buying, or Merchandising field or an equivalent combination of experience and training that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. Experience working in the Sales / Retail industry Special Physical And/or Mental Requirements Travel by air and overnight, as required 35-40% amount of time. Lifting and/or bending 20 lbs amount of weight. Posted 30+ Days Ago Full time R-20210715-0013  Vans is about a state of mind. Thinking differently. Embracing creative self-expression. Authenticity and progression. Choosing your own line on your board and in your life. Vans holds 50 years of youth culture connectivity, Vans continues to advance its roots in action sports while recognizing the global 'Off the Wall' connection between the brand and art, music and street culture enthusiasts.  Today, the Vans brand evolution continues- from its foundation as an original skateboarding company since '66, to a leading action sports brand, to defining its anthem of living 'Off the Wall' as youth culture. From its birthplace on the West Coast, Vans has grown beyond a shoe. It's a global movement- reaching from Barcelona to Beijing, Sao Paulo to Sydney, Orange County to New York.  Vans goes to market through its network of deeply rooted wholesale partners and its direct-to-consumer platform with more than 450 owned retail stores worldwide. Given this amazing platform to connect with consumers, we're constantly looking for better and more creative ways to amplify the brand's in-store presence. And equally strong is the Vans' extraordinary e-commerce and social media presence, inclusive of its digital video platform, OffTheWall.tv. Through its various online channels, Vans has access to over 14 million brand loyalists at any given time.  At Vans, providing consumer-focused product is essential and among perhaps one of the staunchest critics there is - the world's youth - the continued relevance and authenticity of Vans' product, whether performance-based or fashion-forward, must be in the right balance at all times. From weatherizing the head-to-toe collections to enhancing the durability of the performance based footwear, Vans is elevating the level of quality and technology and enabling active consumers everywhere to enjoy Vans through all four seasons.  We also believe it's important to deliver more than just great products. Vans supports the action sports lifestyle, youth culture and creative self-expression by promoting the sports, music, art and culture that matter most. The Vans team includes many top names in action sports including skateboarding legends Steve Caballero and Christian Hosoi, skate pros Geoff Rowley, Anthony Van Engelen, Gilbert Crockett and Tony Trujillo, BMX riders Dakota Roche and Scotty Cranmer, surfers Dane Reynolds, Nathan Fletcher, Joel Tudor and Leila Hurst and snowboarders Louri Podladtchikov, Andreas Wiig, and Hana Beaman.  Vans owns and sponsors world-class events in skateboarding, surfing, snowboarding and BMX including the Vans Triple Crown of Surfing¬Æ, the Vans Pool Party, the Van Doren Invitational and surfing‚Äôs most prestigious contest the Vans US Open of Surfing.  Vans supports original and creative music acts ranging from Band of Horses to Public Enemy to Turbonegro by bringing memorable shows to global audiences at the House of Vans roving music venue that echoes Vans‚Äô Brooklyn-based cultural hub and to more than half a million fans each summer at the Vans Warped Tour, America‚Äôs longest-running music tour. description: WorkBoard  Work with purpose.  WorkBoard‚Äôs mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard‚Äôs platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.  WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space ‚Äì it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.  THE OPPORTUNITY  As a Regional Sales Director, you‚Äôll be a key player in driving the adoption of WorkBoard within a defined geography targeting F2000 companies. You‚Äôll own building trusted growth advisor status with P&L owners who have strategic priorities and urgency to achieve them while positioning and driving preference for our platform.  You‚Äôll gain a deep understanding of WorkBoards‚Äô Sustainable Growth Model and how our platform supports P&L owners #1 goal of impacting company valuation by driving growth through alignment and accountability. You will be a key member of the Sales Team that will be achieving 3X+ yr/yr growth while solidifying the preeminent position in a new category; Enterprise Results Management.  Your work will also include collaborating with the leadership team to identify demand generation, messaging, sales enablement and sales execution best practices.  COMING IN  You‚Äôll Be Skilled And Super Effective At  Bring 7+ years of C-Suite business application value-based selling and start-up experience, an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset, and a relevant degree from a great school. Experience working in a fast paced, high growth start-up is a plus as is an MBA from a great school. Articulating differentiated solution value to enterprise buyers and customers before, during and after they purchase your business application solution Quickly building trusted advisor status with P&L owners by demonstrating your business acumen, intellectual curiosity and passion for solving substantive business issues Consistently exceeding your sales targets by executing both land and expand sales motions in net new and existing customer engagements in an Account Executive or similar role for a SaaS business application company. Working at a fast pace while demonstrating professionalism and the attention to detail that is required to support sales engagements with enterprise P&L owners Partnering with peer teams across marketing, professional services, customer success, development and finance to build a company that is great in your customers‚Äô eyes WITHIN ONE MONTH YOU'LL Attend new-hire immersion training to build a deep understanding of our buyers, their pain points, our solution offering and how we work well as a team Attend the WorkBoard OKR Coach Certification program to gain a deep understanding of the OKR methodology and its relevance in the Enterprise Results Management category Review fifteen first meeting recordings and shadow five first meetings with sales leadership Internalize five customer case studies and be able to confidently use these in first meetings Be converting first meetings with P&L owners based on your ability to deliver WorkBoards‚Äô value messaging Be highly proficient at demonstrating the WorkBoard platform to P&L owners and business process owners to support our differentiation Develop a territory plan with the support of the Growth team to identify and execute targeted ABM into your top 20 Named Accounts WITHIN THREE MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a trusted advisor to P&L owners as they engage with WorkBoard to accelerate their growth strategies Have developed a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities >$1M ARR and you will have achieved your first quarter sales target Have attended WorkBoard Super User training to deepen your proficiency in the WorkBoard application Be tapping into your network to help bring fantastic talent to WorkBoard WITHIN SIX MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a key member of the WorkBoard Team for the partnerships that you have established with our customers as they achieve their growth strategies Be contributing valuable insights and ideas to the WorkBoard Team on ways that we can accelerate and enhance value realization for our customers Be overachieving your sales target and managing a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities within your Named Accounts in excess of $3M ARR THE TEAM  You‚Äôll join one of the best category building sales organizations that is regularly meeting with P&L owners to impact their growth objectives. You have the support from exceptional Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement and Thought Leadership Marketing teams that are accountable for providing qualified leads, sales content and category creation activities that are all aligned to ensure your success.  We are remarkably engaged with our customers, so you‚Äôll have immediate access to their insights and voices. Everyone on the team is striving to improve the value and quality of experience we provide customers by delivering at our best and being voracious learners. We are an incredibly supportive team, with powerhouse creative and production team members who quickly bring marketing ideas to life.  We are excited about a lot of things‚Äîwhat ‚Äúbest‚Äù looks like for our customers, what ‚Äúbreakthrough‚Äù looks like in our platform‚Äîand we share these passions across the company and with our customers.  OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 H‚ÄôS  Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team  a Few Of Our Awesome Benefits Flexible PTO & sick days Paid holidays Health insurance 401K with employer matching Quarterly All-Hands Meetings And much more! THE WORKBOARD STORY  WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates‚Äô contributions, then come join us!

description: Corporate Accounts Strategic Sales Manager  About Viz.ai Viz.ai was the first company to create AI-powered suspected stroke detection and triage. Viz.ai was honored with numerous awards, including being among Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in 2019. Viz.ai is currently in more than 850 hospitals. Viz.ai is funded by top-tier Silicon Valley investors, including Greenoaks with participation from Threshold Ventures, CRV, Kleiner Perkins, Google Ventures, Scale Venture Partners and Insight Partners. Viz.ai and has raised more than $150 million to date.  The Role:  At Viz.ai, we are excited to have received the first ever De Novo approval of our Artificial Intelligent, Deep Learning technology to triage devastating disease-specific stroke workflow and decision-making pathway for physicians. Predicated on our success with our stroke platform, we are quickly expanding into other AI powered technology including our recent FDA Cleared PE and Aortic Disease Platforms. We take pride in creating a positive work environment and collaborative culture, treating our employees as our most valued resources. This means that we take our employees onboarding, training, career development, and feedback very seriously.   This position will report directly to the Vice President of Sales U.S., and will support Viz.ai United States business development strategies to execute enterprise sales agreements at the corporate IDN, GPO, and strategic account levels. The Corporate Account Sales Manager (CASM) is responsible for driving business growth and market development initiatives within key IDNs, GPO‚Äôs and strategic accounts in collaboration with the cross-divisional sales leadership teams to include the Vice President, Area Directors, and Regional Sales Managers (RSM). The current market dynamics and business conditions call for a stronger focus on administrative selling and business development initiatives. The position has three macro responsibilities that support the Regional strategies. The CASM will focus on three distinct areas: sales execution, business collaboration, and customer engagement.   You will:  The position is expected to provide commercial leadership, drive business growth and coordinate between the Vice President of Sales and the sales field sales teams for all aspects of the sales pipeline focusing on strategic key accounts and IDNs, including: Convert service line software for neuroscience, cardiovascular, neurosurgery, cardiology, and more as we broaden our AI powered portfolios beyond stroke. Additional expansion into Telehealth solutions, and clinical support staff to execute on Viz products, utilizing a consultative and strategic executive-level sales approach Organize cross-functional resources and programmatic solutions to profitably sell the product lines to key physicians, nurses, and hospital administration up to the C-level at the local, regional, divisional, and national levels Develop a quarterly business plan for assigned strategic key accounts and IDNs that aligns with the respective cross-divisional sales leadership teams‚Äô annual/quarterly objectives to close new business and expand the existing business Facilitate multi-stakeholder selling in multi-hospital opportunities in collaboration with the local sales teams and support by providing C-suite administrative, clinical, and technical expertise and experience Collaborate with the cross-divisional sales leadership teams in targeted key accounts and their referral networks to identify product, program, and education opportunities to workflow process improvement, market development strategies and tactics to drive market access and volume ROI to close sales. Assess customers‚Äô financial status and objectives in an effort to either leverage existing financial solutions or develop new programs to optimize volume growth and drive profit, orchestrated with both the internal Viz.ai sales team and our distributor partners. Build relationships with key physicians, administrators, service line executives in an effort to enhance Viz.ai reputation as a strategic partner Increase customer awareness via attendance and professional representation at trade shows, site visits, professional organizational meetings, etc. Provide an internal monthly / quarterly key account sales momentum progress report that highlights engagement activity, business conditions and go-forward opportunities and plans in Salesforce and presented to Vice President of Sales Prospect for new business in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio, and qualifying new leads to maintain identified business in supporting a balanced sales funnel for future sales Conduct effective sales negotiations and close deals at the strategic IDN & GPO level as well as in concert with the field sales teams on assigned key opportunities by interfacing with all key buying influencers focusing on top- level C-Suite leadership. Develop and maintain a high level of Viz.ai product knowledge as well as intelligence on competitive products in the market Achieve annual and quarterly revenue targets through accurate monthly and quarterly forecasting, prioritizing selling time to generate sales volume and achieving account penetration by conducting a thorough business analysis of key accounts  Develop account penetration strategies for key targets and overall account development and communicate updated market intelligence back to the business, along with field concerns, issues, and requirements Develop a monthly report that captures sales performance and macro dynamics; highlights feedback from physicians, administrators, and the Field Sales Organization on macro procedural trends, reimbursement information, key physician developments, and competitive intelligence Develop action plans in collaboration with the cross-divisional sales & leadership teams to improve execution in under-performing territories.   Requirements:  BS/BA Degree required Minimum of 6 years successful sales, and / or management experience in the healthcare sales sector is required; 3-4 years of successfully managing teams, is preferred.  Experience and proven success with sales and closing deals with large IDNs such as but not limited to Ascension, Providence, Tenet, HCA, Commonspirit, CHI, Kaiser Permanente, IHC. Experience with selling software, digital health, medical device, pharmaceuticals and/or capital products to multiple call points in the hospital. Demonstrated record of influence management across multiple decision-makers; experience influencing and building relationships at the C-Suite level General knowledge of healthcare purchasing and contracting practices along with a demonstrated knowledge of Viz.ai portfolio.   Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% nationally including overnight is required. Job descriptions change from time to time. The Company retains the right at its sole discretion to modify, delete, or add to any of the information contained in this document. Changes will be discussed with the employee.  Viz offers competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401k, generous vacation, and other great benefits to full-time employees.    Viz.ai is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. If you‚Äôre applying for a position in San Francisco, review the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance guidelines applicable in your area.

description: At TomTom‚Ä¶ You‚Äôll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow‚Äôs mobility for the better. We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions. What You‚Äôll Do Act as a primary point of contact for selected strategic Enterprise customers and maintain relationships with decision makers at the executive and management levels Exceed assigned quotas and other performance objectives Provide account leadership and direction in the post-sales process Partner with customer program management team to drive implementations and high levels of adoption within customer accounts to ensure upsell potential and renewals Create and maintain account plans in alignment with the Vice President of Global Sales and execute on the identified success criteria‚Äôs and playbooks Responsible for maintaining a high level of client satisfaction to ensure client realizes full value working with TomTom Maintain the TomTom CRM regarding current deals, account activity and revenue forecasts Build a strong product knowledge of TomTom Product offerings, to provide high levels of client satisfaction Excellent negotiation, presentation and closing skills Develop and deliver strategies that help drive our clients business What You‚Äôll Need To be successful as a Enterprise Account Manager, this is the kind of profile we have in mind University degree in business, marketing, finance or a related field 7 + years of experience in B2B sales/technical sales/product development/business development/licensing Successful track record in high velocity land and expand go to market sales Outstanding organisational skills, ability to manage multiple projects - passionate about technology adoption Ability to create new and leverage established relationships within VP/C levels Effective communicator, strong interpersonal skills and excellent team player Self-motivated, driven and results oriented Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities Produce high quality and accurate work consistently Ability to travel Meet your team We‚Äôre TomTom Enterprise. We provide high-quality mapping and traffic data and a range of Maps APIs. In building a safe, clean and congestion-free society, we partner with some the world‚Äôs most innovative companies. Our customer base ranges from application developers and internet of things companies to logistics services and fleet management experts, governments and cloud service providers. On our team, you‚Äôll bridge offline and online worlds, providing developers and businesses big and small with the location technologies they need to build next-generation location-based applications. Achieve more We are self-starters who play well with others. Every day, we solve new problems with creativity, meet new people and learn rapidly at our offices around the world. We will invest in your growth and are committed to supporting you. In everything we do, we‚Äôre guided by six values We care, putting our heart into what we do; we build trust (you can count on us); we create ‚Äì driven to make a difference; we are confident, but don‚Äôt boast; we keep it simple, since life is complex enough; and we have fun because life‚Äôs too short to be boring. After you apply Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout the process, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews through your onboarding. TomTom is an equal opportunity employer We celebrate diversity, thrive on each other‚Äôs differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment at our offices around the world. Naturally, we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, national origin, genetics, or age. Ready to move the world forward?

description: The most security-conscious organizations trust Telos Corporation to protect their vital IT assets. The reputation of our company rests on the quality of our solution and the integrity of our people. Explore what you can bring to our solutions in Cybersecurity, Cloud Security and Enterprise Security.  Be a part of the Telos culture and see what sets us apart! Telos offers an excellent compensation package with benefits that include generous paid time off, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, and 401k. Our employees enjoy more than just a great work environment!  Telos is looking for three Global Sales Directors for Healthcare and Life Sciences, Energy, and Telecommunications and Information Communications and Technology (ICT) markets to join and grow with our dynamic team!  This position may be based in Dallas, TX; Denver, CO; Los Angeles, CA; Atlanta, GA , or other major hub location, as a remote employee with 50% travel expectation.  Overview  As a Global Sales Director - you represent the tip of the spear of a respected Cyber Security industry brand with highly differentiated products and extensive customer support capabilities.  In this role you will grow your business acumen and strategic sales capabilities while consulting a portfolio of Strategic & Enterprise accounts in your respective Healthcare, Energy or Telecommunications and ICT vertical focused on selling to and with the global largest customers. You will establish Telos as the preferred partner for your customers and influence technology investment decisions, resulting in increased share of wallet. Through individual action and deploying extensive company and partner resources, you will regularly qualify, advance and win sales opportunities while tackling and overcoming tough customer organizational and competitive challenges.  You will enjoy collaborating in an open culture with coworkers and leaders who inspire you to new heights in your personal and professional development. You're on a career track that leads to increased impact as leader of your region. Successful growth in your region will mean hiring of additional account managers, inside sales and engineers to support the sustained growth.  Responsibilities Planning and executing territory and account development initiatives to generate demand in identified areas of greatest opportunity to deliver or exceed quota on a quarterly and annual basis. Consulting with Customer executive leadership and engineers and managers to understand and address their technical and business requirements with the best systems and services that meet their needs. Managing and closing sales opportunities discovered as a result of account initiatives through collaborations with partners and internal resources. Networking and discovery within assigned accounts to engage with new groups, create and sustain valued relationships with customer leadership, and identify new qualified sales opportunities. Achieve annual quota and quarterly targets by closing sales within assigned portfolio. Generate demand for Telos products and Services through effective documented account plan strategies which have been signed off by Telos Sales Leadership. Assess the current state of business with assigned territory. Establish renewed account plans and overall territory strategy and review with our sales management. Set co-authored objectives and priorities with top accounts through business driver reviews. Effectively lead highly complex matrix internal organizations and partner resources to close sales. Develop a clear understanding of all relevant team resources. Establish a system for keeping internal and partner stakeholders in sales opportunities informed and involved. Conduct quarterly top account plan reviews with sales management and select stakeholders. Keep CRM (Salesforce.com) documentation up to date with key activities and opportunities to enable effective internal collaboration and provide input to business forecasting. Take the lead in coordinating development of all client proposals. Adapt and lead client presentations and product demonstrations. Be prepared to lead effective professional sales presentations and product demonstrations, adapted from existing enablement content or created in collaboration with Product Marketing and Systems Engineering. Great presentations and demonstrations begin with an attention-grabbing introduction, incorporate specific stories from the prospect's world that remind the audience of their painful current situation, and incorporate relevant success stories of our implementations. Learn and ultimately reach master skill level of Telos offering and relevant value proposition. Learn the core services/solutions and be able to effectively present these solutions using cost-benefit, ROI and solution trade-off techniques. The knowledge learned will include: Our overall points of differentiation and value in key applications, business case modeling tools, high level sales enablement content, key technical white paper content, case studies, our web site and significant success stories to facilitate the sales process. Demonstrate account knowledge and ability to impact revenue by utilizing sales tracking systems and providing accurate forecasts. Develop an accurate 12 to 24-month account sales forecast. Effectively use Salesforce.com daily to provide organizational insight regarding active opportunities in all stages of the sales cycle. Manage entire client lifecycle from acquisition, development and retention. 25-50% regional travel is expected. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher is required. Minimum of 10 years of relative experience is required. Strong presentation skills, written & verbal communication. Strong technical knowledge with a broad range of security technologies. The successful candidate must meet eligibility requirements to access sensitive information, which requires US citizenship. Telos maintains a drug-free workplace and will conduct drug testing on all applicants who have accepted an offer of employment  Telos Corporation participates in the E-Verify program. Therefore, any employment with Telos will also be contingent upon confirmation from the Social Security Administration (‚ÄúSSA‚Äù) and/or the Department of Homeland Security (‚ÄúDHS‚Äù) of your authorization to work in the United States  Telos Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to equal opportunity for all, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. Telos Corporation will make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you are interested in applying for an employment opportunity and feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, please contact us at 1-800-283-1911. If you require relay service assistance, please click on the following link to review information on your state‚Äôs relay service: http://transition.fcc.gov/cgb/dro/trsphonebk.html  Telos Corporation is an EEO/AA employer.
