description: Requisition ID: 47622  Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is committed to being the best global kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home. In an increasingly digital world, the company is driving purposeful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit and Yummly. In 2020, the company reported approximately $19 billion in annual sales, 78,000 employees and 57 manufacturing and technology research centers.  Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by FORTUNE as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Diversity, One Whirlpool, and Spirit of Winning propel our teams to excellence. Get to know us and see what it's like to be part of a company that is in constant pursuit of improving life at home.  Manager Channel Sales - Gladiator Brand  Currently, we are seeking qualified candidates for a Manager Channel Sales opening to join our Gladiator sales organization. Gladiator is a leading brand of storage and organization systems and solutions for the garage and commercial use.  This Role In Summary  The Manager Channel Sales will be responsible for leading and growing the Lowe‚Äôs and Build.com businesses for the Gladiator brand. This candidate will own the customer relationship, including buyer and other key account management, achieving sales targets, and strategic development. The role requires an innovative, visionary leader who can grow our Gladiator business and the overall business for our trade customers. This candidate will have a solid background in B2B and Ecommerce Sales, with a track record of successful account management for national customers. Communicating and building relationships at all levels of an account is important to be successful in this role. description: Summary/Objective This position is responsible for driving growth, planning, forecasting, pricing, and customer service.   Essential Functions Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  1.      Develop and implement annual sales plans and forecasts to achieve corporate objectives for products and services. 2.      Management of all inside sales and customer service activities as is incorporated into the Customer Care Organization. 3.      Leadership of the inside sales and customer service staff in support of the multiple selling channels deployed, that being through Company outside Sales, Third Party Sales Agents or Companies, Distributors, Wholesalers and OEMs. 4.      Oversee the execution of the pricing policy that will support the company‚Äôs margin goals. 5.      Establish and maintain selling prices that reflect market requirements and opportunities, cost changes, and meet profit margin objectives. 6.      Daily management of all Inside Sales and Customer Service teams within the Inside Customer Care Organization which includes hiring/terminating, disciplining, administering rewards and pay raises, training, guiding, and directing, overseeing, implementing improvements in processes and practices/methodologies, and any and all adjustments to headcount and expenses required to achieve and maintain the budget. 7.      Maintain an understanding of business unit capabilities and work with multiple plants, as necessary, to serve the customer as a ‚Äúone-stop‚Äù source. 8.      Provide support to other team members to assist in winning new business. 9.      Responsible for the attainment of direct booking and sales goals. 10.   Define, measure, establish and maintain positive customer relationships and high customer satisfaction. This includes making field visits to end users, distributors and prospective customers. Clearly communicate customer needs to Management Team. 11.   Manage the sales cycle from design through to the issuance of either discrete, entering, and management of purchase orders or the implementation of long-term supply contracts. 12.   Develop and maintain the sales toolbox, ensuring inside sales, key account managers, outside reps, and customer service are efficient and persuasive in communicating the capabilities and advantages. 13.   Support and drive trade show participation and other promotional activity as needed. 14.   Develop and maintain a strong selling team culture across inside sales, key account managers and outside reps. 15.   Manage reporting systems which includes but is not limited to sales activity and prospect reporting, pipeline management, quotes, CRM data, new customer, key account and lost order reporting. 16. jobTitle: West Zone Sales Manager, Pharmaceutical Diagnostics
description: Job Description Summary  Lead the Western US Commercial Sales Team organization, defines and implements the product strategy across multiple channels and partners. Responsible to grow profitability of the franchise, focused on both commercial and operational aspects. Key metrics of success are: sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share. Key role in the global organization, including R&D and product management, suggesting product portfolio evolution and creating business opportunities to leverage & improve products/brands equity.Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is a global leader in imaging agents, used to improve and enhance the images that radiologists use to diagnose and monitor disease. We support healthcare professionals in the administration of neurology, cardiology and oncology procedures that are used to image three patients around the world, every second.  Job DescriptionRoles and Responsibilities   Lead and implement the Sales for the western region, managing overall sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share in a manner that fulfills business and achieves targets. Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources. Strong background in working with cross-functional department within a business. Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision. Manages a small to medium team of senior professionals as well as others. Lead the management team in the region, ensuring strong collaboration between Sales and functions including Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Commercial Operations. Optimize the use of resources to cover market potential to achieve the operating plan. Know, interact and develop the strategy with Key Opinion Leaders and decision makers in product relevant scientific areas; manage professional relations with key Customers to ensure understanding of needs and that GE Healthcare product value proposition is differentiated in the minds of these key Customer groups. Nurture relationships with professional society stakeholders.  Required Qualifications   Education to bachelor‚Äôs degree level, in relevant scientific area. Minimum of 3 years of Management experience Minimum of 6 years in the the Healthcare industry Ability to travel 30% to40% of the time  Desired Characteristics   Exemplary people management, leadership skills, as well as sales coaching, and team building skills. Demonstrated business management and resource allocation skills including business plan development. Change agent with energy, passion and enthusiasm to drive change. Ability to translate strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly. Ability to communicate and present ideas to Customers in a way that produces understanding and impact that builds effective strategic relationships. Strong business acumen; financial and organizational skills. Advanced negotiation, problem solving and influencing skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

description: ScottCare Cardiovascular Solutions is a market leader in cardiac rehabilitation telemetry, cardiac rhythm device management and diagnostic monitoring solutions. Our mission is to facilitate improved patient care and clinical outcomes while reducing the overall cost of healthcare. We accomplish this with high-quality devices, software and monitoring services that aid hospitals and cardiology practices in the diagnosis, management and rehabilitation of cardiovascular patients.  ScottCare Cardiovascular Solutions is seeking a growth-oriented Director of Sales & Marketing to design, develop, and implement sales and marketing strategies and tactics for a business segment. The candidate must have a strong business acumen and a hands-on style.  Job Responsibilities: Develop and roll-out sales and marketing goals, strategies, plans and tools. Accurately forecast sales activities and anticipated revenue results. Achieve monthly, quarterly and annual sales quotas. Recruit, hire and train sales professionals to maintain a high level of selling and negotiating skills among the team. Direct marketing efforts including new product rollouts, sales tools development, trade show strategy, peer-to-peer marketing, etc. Develop and direct lead generation programs including telemarketing, internet-based initiatives, trade shows, etc. Establish and build relationships with key accounts and key opinion leaders. Identify opportunities for new product and service development through customer research, competitive analysis and monitoring technology trends. Job Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, engineering, clinical or related field; MBA is highly preferred. At least ten years of sales and marketing experience in the medical field. Five years of experience in managing and building sales & marketing teams. Proven track record of consistently growing sales, with an ability to understand and address the needs of multiple stakeholders (clinical, business, IT, etc.). Experienced in planning and executing new product introductions. Sales experience in cardiac monitoring products and services is highly preferred. Strategic thinker. Good problem solving skills. Excellent communication skills. Benefits ScottCare offers an encompassing and competitive Total Compensation Package that consists of a highly competitive salary and a range of benefits that include: Health, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match, HSA and FSA options, Vacation, Sick Leave, Company Observed Paid Holidays and Tuition Reimbursement.

Director of Business Development JETCOOL Technologies is an MIT-spinoff startup commercializing paradigm-shifting cooling solutions for high power electronics in aerospace, electric vehicle, and data center applications. Unlike legacy thermal management solutions, JETCOOL‚Äôs novel microconvective cooling technology offers 10x performance improvements with unparalleled energy efficiency, freeing customers from existing tradeoffs with regard to performance, cost, and sustainability.  As Director of Business Development, you will build key partnerships, execute strategic sales efforts, and shape the business model of a fast-paced technology company, all while having a positive impact on society. In addition to developing and executing an effective sales strategy that grows our existing roots in the electric vehicle and data center industries, you will also leverage your experience to create business opportunities with new partners ‚Äì and potentially in new sectors. A successful candidate has a track-record of leading financial growth in a customer-facing sales role and forging strong relationships across stakeholder groups, from customers to partners to company leadership. Your efforts will directly feed JETCOOL‚Äôs top-line growth, providing you with significant executive-level visibility.  Responsibilities Strengthening JETCOOL‚Äôs value proposition through market research, including analyzing market trends & new opportunities, while partnering with the CEO to continually sharpen the go to market strategy Building deep relationships with existing and future customers ‚Äì from global technology companies to fast-paced start-ups ‚Äì to understand their needs in a consultative approach to complex sales Through strategic research and preparation, developing sales content for high priority customers to highlight the compelling business justification in addition to the technical justification Identifying, cultivating, and executing strategic partnerships Engaging multiple external and internal stakeholder groups throughout the sales process, including JETCOOL‚Äôs marketing and engineering teams Building and maintaining a robust sales pipeline Meeting and exceeding revenue forecasts; closing deals with existing customers and new accounts Recommending changes in products, services, and strategy by evaluating results and competitive developments  Requirements Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited 4-year university, or equivalent 7+ years of experience in a high-performance business development role, or similar Experience with computing, semiconductor, automotive, or data center industries Proven sales record with complex buyers in technology hardware Comfort with all stages of a consultative sales process, including customer discovery, lead engagement, collaborative negotiation and closing deals Familiarity and fluency with modern prospecting skills Flexibility and comfort in a variety of work environments, including in the office, in the field, or virtual Equally comfortable being an individual contributor or leading a small team Strong written and oral communication skills High integrity, low-ego, and strong drive to succeed U.S. Citizenship  Nice-to-have Working knowledge of thermal management for high power electronics or other cooling applications Prior sales experience and network in the computing, semiconductor, or data center industries Familiarity with HubSpot CRM   Why work at jetcool? At JETCOOL, we‚Äôre producing game-changing cooling solutions for aerospace, electric vehicles, and data centers.  Be part of a small team playing an important role in some of today‚Äôs fastest growing industries, while having a positive impact on climate change through technology. Some other benefits of being part of our team: Be an early employee, with a huge impact on the company Solve real thermal problems on the forefront of new technology Opportunity to participate in Boston innovation events / community Direct mentorship by the senior leadership team Free snacks, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate! On-site gym/showers, ping pong. and foosball Less than a 10-minute walk from commuter rail train station Free parking is always available  This full-time position is based out of our Littleton, MA offices. The position offers opportunities for advancement and expanded responsibilities for exceptional candidates. JETCOOL Technologies Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.   Please send a resume to careers [at] jetcool.com to begin the application process!

Regional Sales Director - West    Position Summary: We are searching for a results-driven Sales Director to actively seek out and engage customer prospects. You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every customer to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels and profitability. The right candidate will be a seasoned technology sales pro who is excited by our industry leading technology, our plans for future company growth, and our aggressive over target accelerators and no-cap commission plans.   Responsibilities: Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers Establish, develop, and maintain positive business and customer relationships Reach out to customer leads through cold calling Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments Analyze the territory/market‚Äôs potential, track sales and status reports Supply management with intelligence on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends and continuously improve through feedback and insights   Qualifications: A bachelor‚Äôs degree and 5+ years proven success as a sales representative in a Storage enterprise or hardware / software company Highly motivated and looking to further his/her career by working for a top enterprise software company Naturally disciplined, organized and relationship-oriented - excellent communicator with superior selling and negotiation skills Excellent knowledge of MS Office and the ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience Familiarity with BRM and CRM practices along with ability to build productive business/professional relationships   What We Offer: Innovation, growth, and progressive thinking. Competitive compensation package with aggressive accelerators for over target performance and un-capped commission plans to drive top performers.

description: Presidio Director Job Description ‚Äì  The Business Entity / The Team  This Director position is responsible for leading one of Cisco‚Äôs largest and most strategic Partner relationships ‚Äì Presidio. Given the complexity of managing a multi-billion dollar business partnership, we are looking for a leader with a ‚ÄúGeneral Manager‚Äù approach to working in a complex, dynamic and fast paced account. This GM mindset is critical to working cross functionally with multiple organizations and stakeholders to accelerate sustained business growth. This GM would lead a team of Partner Account Managers (PAMs) and will have the responsibility of setting a multi-year vision and investment strategy supporting Presidio‚Äôs business gtm. This leader will also ensure adoption of Cisco strategies/technologies to capture new market opportunities and satisfy evolving customer consumption demands. The leader will tightly interlock with Cisco sales teams across various business Segments, Marketing, Architectures, Services and the Global Partner Organization.  Responsibilities Accountable for balancing short and long-term business strategies aligned to Cisco's long-term goals. Set business approach inclusive of go-to-market strategies to grow customer and partner loyalty and partner wallet share. Create strategies focused on acquiring and developing a diverse, high performance workforce. Develop CXO relationships within the partner. Engage Cisco Executives with key partner leadership teams.  Experience  The successful candidate will be an experienced sales leader with an extensive track record of excellence with the following capabilities Minimum 5 years RM and/or OD role, while directly and indirectly managing a large team of cross-functional employees. Proven success as a collaborative leader in a solution sales organization with strong knowledge of partner business models Experience with a Commercial, GES, Public Sector sales model (companies with 1500 employees and less). A tireless, high-energy professional with an entrepreneurial, risk-taking flair and will possess a brand of confidence, which allows for delegation and empowerment of the team. Strategic and innovative with an external awareness to adapt to market transitions and understand the nuances of selling complex solutions. Strong leadership skills in coaching and developing a sales organization as well as ability to have difficult conversations with team and partner Excellent communication skills and ability to persuade - using simple communications that convey complex concepts in a compelling, concise, inspiring and creative way Demonstrated ability to build and lead in a matrix-managed team culture. Experience overseeing and driving a channel partner led strategy. A strategic thinker and able to communicate effectively and influence cross-functionally. Adept at balancing intense short-term pressures with overall long-term goals. Excellent command of financial metrics. description: Company Description  At Atlas Ocean Voyages, we invite modern explorers to embark on a new style of luxe-adventure travel. Our inaugural itineraries in the Holy Land, Mediterranean, Black Sea, and Antarctica will take bucket-list travel to new levels of discovery, while our intimate size ships enable guests to experience port cities and landscapes that are impossible for larger ships to reach. Holding just under 200 guests, World Navigator began sailing in 2021.  Atlas Ocean Voyages comes from a distinguished travel pedigree. We are a U.S. brand of MysticInvest Holdings (MIH). With more than 25 years of hospitality experience, MIH is a business leader in the travel and tourism sector, including river cruises, tours and attractions.  Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, our leadership consists of cruise industry experts with almost 10 decades of combined experience. We are also travel enthusiasts, and we look forward to crafting experiences that take elite travelers off the beaten path.  Job Description  Looking for Luxury, Expedition Sales Professionals. Evaluate ROI of trade shows and consumer events; participate when identified as valuable Ensure that marketing collateral is utilized effectively and efficiently; manage inventory and distribution appropriately Utilize company CRM tools to maintain territory database, record sales activities, distribute travel partner production reports and manage e-mail communication Coordinate and oversee marketing initiatives executed by travel partners. Efficiently manage a sales and cooperative marketing budget inside established guidelines while mindful of policies and procedures Attend and actively participate in any national or regional sales meetings, including, when scheduled for Sales attendance Submit weekly report to management which summarizes the competitive environment in their Region, to advise management of any specific problems that need attention, and report any trends or observations of any kind they feel are important for management to be aware of that affect AOV Cruises‚Äô operating environment Submit Expense reports with all needed backup in a timely fashion and comply with company guidelines regarding expense procedures Handle related job functions as requested Qualifications Must have 3 to 5 years expedition cruise sales experience Legally permitted to work in the United States and possess required documentation Have a valid driver‚Äôs license and own a reliable vehicle Have a valid passport and able to travel internationally as overseas travel may be required Ability to travel within a large territory on a regular basis. 60% travel required Able to manage irregular work hours that include both evenings and weekends Proficient with the Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.) as well as internet, conference call and webinar tools Able to lift 20lbs with or without reasonable accommodation Able to sit, stand & walk for long periods of time Proficiency using Microsoft Teams and Video Conferencing platforms Additional Information  About You You reside within the territory You exemplify our brand You are flexible and able to adjust to changing needs in a start-up environment You are ‚Äúwell-traveled‚Äù and have 10+ years of sales experience in the luxury/premium travel industry You have at least 3 years of field sales experience and working remotely In addition to selling cruises, have experience selling expedition type travel and land packages that include hiking, luxury, and/or expedition-type vacations. description: Nationally known, 50-year-old growing, profitable company, designer and manufacturer of industrial products used by recognizable brands, outdoor products, recreational leaders, fitness, business equipment and specialty components for various Arms Companies, Ruger, Sig Sauer, Savage and U.S. Military, DOD & Law Enforcement is looking to add a top-notch sales executive to elevate the Government and Military program. description: GivingData Is Changing How Philanthropy Works  Philanthropists want to improve the world. That‚Äôs why GivingData is helping foundations improve the way they give.  With GivingData's dashboards, workflows, and collaboration tools, foundations can streamline complex processes and transform how they work with their nonprofit partners. The end result is better grants management, healthier relationships, and increased impact.  We are seeking a Business Development Principal who‚Äôs passionate about helping grantmaking foundations adopt new technology to support their work. This is an opportunity to join a purpose-driven company where you can contribute meaningfully to our clients‚Äô success.  The opportunity  Taking a consultative sales approach, you‚Äôll introduce the GivingData platform to grants administrators, program staff, and foundation executives. You‚Äôll be focused on qualifying leads, engaging with prospects, building a pipeline of opportunities, and closing new business. You will also cultivate relationships with existing accounts to drive retention and identify expansion opportunities that address client‚Äôs evolving needs. Close new logo and expansion business and nurture relationships with existing clients to drive retention. A high degree of comfort in business meetings, with excellent presentation and communication skills and a strong ability to demo purpose-built software that highlights key features and capabilities most relevant to clients. Experience selling technology services or custom software solutions is a must. Highly motivated to thrive and work independently for a fast-growing company where all team members work remotely. Be willing to do what needs to be done to grow a business that is committed to social impact with high standards of ethics and professionalism. Why join GivingData? We are a purpose-driven company with a goal to strengthen the work of social impact organizations You will benefit from the flexibility and autonomy of a remote work environment, regardless of your time zone We offer Competitive compensation with bonus payouts tied to performance Medical/Dental/Vision plans and optional Health Savings Account 401k Plan with employer match up to 4% GivingData is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment, where we welcome and support people of varying backgrounds, beliefs, and perspectives for the benefit of our company and the philanthropic community we serve. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and seek to hire qualified individuals regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socio-economic status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. About Eightfold.ai  Eightfold was founded with a vision to solve for employment in our society. For decades, the connection between individuals and opportunities has been based on who the individuals are and the strength of their network, vs. their potential. Eightfold leverages artificial intelligence to transform how to think about skills and capabilities for individuals as well as how jobs and career decisions are made. Eightfold offers the industry‚Äôs first AI-powered Talent Intelligence Platform to transform how organizations plan, hire, develop and retain a diverse workforce, enabling individuals to transform their career.  To date, Eightfold AI has received more than $400 million in funding and a valuation of over $2B from leading investors to further our mission of finding the right career for everyone in the world. If you are passionate about solving one of the most fundamental challenges of our society - employment, working on hard business problems and being part of an amazing growth story - Eightfold is the place to be!  About the Role  Eightfold is seeking a driven Vice President, Channel Partnerships. Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, this role will lead the channel sales team and all channel programs. You will develop the strategy and vision for our channel program as you accelerate new routes to market and growth in our channel revenue. You will collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and Product Management and will be the focal point for the technical alliance Partners for all matters. You will own the responsibility of managing and growing our overall Partners revenue objectives within an assigned geographic territory.  Responsibilities:  Create a clear enterprise strategic channel vision and strategy Build and lead all partnership programs that will deliver a best in class experience and company growth Act as the voice of the channel internally to ensure cross-functional collaboration in driving partnerships Enable partner organizations to engage effectively with Eightfold prospects by driving partner education, training, sales enablement, and joint marketing programs Assume responsibility for Channel Sales pipeline and Quota goals  Create and oversee the channel processes, policies, objectives and key initiatives Run regular business and quarterly business reviews at ensuring consistency across the partners Build & manage Partner forecast process, fully integrated with the overall Sales forecast process Create joint Go To Market plans and join investment plans with our strategic partners Ensure all partners are building the necessary capabilities in demand generation, sales engagement and product knowledge to deliver our join goals  Desired Qualifications, Skills and Experience:  15+ years‚Äô of enterprise software channel experience with a track record of developing strategic and mutually beneficial partnerships Strong track record of consistently overachieving revenue goals  Deep channel expertise in all RTMs (resale, ISV, Service Provider, Distribution, Global Systems Integrators) Must have proficiency in multi-pathway channel selling environments; must be familiar with how solutions are sold and fulfilled through the channel, and how distributors provide services to resellers Understanding of Cloud Infrastructure ecosystem is highly preferred Understanding of how partnership sales activities are measured and deemed successful at a board level Demonstrable ability to understand, develop and navigate complex sales cycles involving a variety of stakeholders Experience working in a start-up environment is essential. This means‚Ä¶ Must be comfortable operating in an environment where there are often processes and systems that need to be built / optimized in the course of day-to-day business. In high growth companies there's always more to do than people to do it. As such, the ability to set priorities, focus on details and motivate internal and external teams to deliver agreed upon goals is very important Ability to travel 30-50% of the time BA/BS degree required. Technical competence is strongly preferred.  We are a team of self-starters who excel in their fields. We believe in giving you responsibility, not a task. We want you to have ownership and pride in the work you are doing, and see the positive impact of your work on your colleagues, our customers, and the world. We believe in providing transparency and support, so you can do the best work of your career.  We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including family medical, vision, and dental coverage. We also offer a 401k plan, stock options, and unlimited paid time off for all eligible employees.  Eightfold.ai provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or disability.

identify areas for improvement and implement them Must be able to travel as required  Practical stuff we anticipate you having: BA/BS required, MBA preferred Minimum 5 plus years‚Äô sales closing experience carrying a quota Managed a territory in a direct business-to-business sales function (SaaS preferred) Proven leadership qualities through coaching and mentoring new and/or tenured sales reps Demonstrated advanced knowledge of multiple industry/business and priorities  Ability to effectively run a New Deal Strategy Session and understand and analyze sales performance metrics Outstanding written and verbal communication skills  Ability to run consistent predictable sales cycles and identify new marketplace opportunities Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude  What we‚Äôre looking for from the heart: True Cerosian - A strong alignment with Ceros‚Äô core values  You possess the qualities of charisma, advocacy, trustworthiness, and authority. Disruptive innovator - You write your own playbooks. You continually review processes and systems and suggest ways to improve the status quo Delegator - You empower your team to take ownership of their work. You empower yourself to make decisions for the well being for the company and your team. Accessibility - You make yourself available for your team, conduct regular review sessions, and prioritize facetime and feedback Strategy - You have a vision for where your team is headed. You see the future and know how to guide your team.  Key Things to Know We want you to start ASAP This is a full-time position This is a remote-first role with ability to work Eastern Standard Time  Benefits Competitive Salary Stock options Premium health insurance 401K match Paid parental leave Unlimited vacation days Wellness Fridays (Half Day Fridays) Excellent gear (Macbook Air, external monitor, etc.) Stipend for the home office set up Growth and Learning opportunities within the company Virtual experiences in which Cerosians can collaborate, educate, and create social connections with one another  At Ceros, we are deeply committed to the recruitment, retention, and growth of diverse talent; uniting people from unique backgrounds in our shared passion for unlocking creativity through technology. description: The Director of Business Strategy identifies new opportunities and develops and implements business strategies. They work with senior management across business functions on high impact, complex, and confidential projects and drive change through leading, coaching, and project execution.  Success will be measured by the identification and implementation of business strategies, achievement of individual and team goals, and meeting Company objectives.  Key Job Responsibilities: Identify critical business issues, risks, and growth opportunities. Establish brand and category strategies to drive growth in a competitive environment. Apply analytics and structure plans to solve complex problems. Analyze findings to develop insights and recommendations for senior management. Coordinate cross-functional collaboration to ensure execution of initiatives.  Manage assignments and resources over discrete time periods with minimal intervention. Leverage technical, analytical, interpersonal, and management skills to implement projects across the organization. Translate the Company strategy to actionable, quantifiable, and measurable market-level plans. Articulate Company strategies to relevant stakeholders, including senior- and executive-level management. Impact company profit and loss through growth and productivity projects. Support execution of transformational work, such as Direct Store Delivery Excellence (DSDE), Manufacturing, Maintenance, and Supply Chain Transformations. Assure associates engaged in or affected by strategy projects possess the operational capabilities to achieve business strategy and project goals. Achieve safety goals, including delivering on safety awareness programs to eliminate unsafe acts and lead local organization to achieve the goal of zero injuries. Engage and collaborate with individuals at all levels and across functional and geographic areas. Empower and hold team accountable to successfully achieve business initiatives. Drive continuous improvement.  Salary Range:$135,000 - 155,000 Paid Time Off Bonus Eligible Benefits: Healthcare, 401k Company Match  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Management or Marketing, MBA preferred. A combination of education, training and experience that results in demonstrated competency to perform the work may be substituted.  Ideal candidate will possess: Eight or more years management experience in all aspects of food sales or relevant responsibilities in comparable industry. Experience leading salaried associates. Demonstrated problem solving ability, including strong conceptual and analytical skills and ability to turn findings into executable plans. Excellent presentation and written/oral communication skills, as well as the ability to effectively negotiate and influence others. Strong organizational, analytical, and planning skills. Computer skills and proficiency, specifically PowerPoint, Excel, and Word are required. Labor relations experience with union organizations preferred. Regular travel within geographic area of responsibility. Occasional travel outside geographic area of responsibility.  Key Behavioral Competencies: Make strategic business decisions impacting short and long term objectives/goals. Cultivate talent through coaching. Build strong business relationships and collaborate cross-functionally. Lead and coach special projects while meeting specific timelines and objectives. Establish objectives, ownership of work, and accountability for results. Communicate effectively and build alignment. Manage and influence profit and loss results.  The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be requested to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description: We are looking for a highly motivated and forward-thinking business development director to lead our sales initiatives. The business development director will support and guide internal and external relationships. This professional must be a strategic and critical thinker with a proven record of success in expanding company objectives and exceeding business goals.  Job Responsibilities Identifies and develops new business opportunities. Focus on neuro-based CAPTCHA and Liveliness products‚Äô sales Builds relationships with prospects, customers and partners. Evaluates existing partnerships and sales efforts, implements new sales strategy. Works to build new client relationships. Expands the profile and reach of the company and its brands. Develops and strengthens internal and external relationships that will lead to increased lead generation and market share. Tracks emerging markets and trends. Fosters an entrepreneurial growth culture throughout the company. Identifies and recommends new product applications. Proposes and develops strategic partnerships. Works to meet quarterly and annual new business, sales and strategic accounts performance targets; determines plans for how to meet them. Updates the contact management system, as well as weekly sales status reports. Attends weekly senior management meeting with the CEO, engineering, marketing and operations teams. Researches and identifies new markets. Provides advice on product development and distribution, as well as promotion strategies. Negotiates contracts. Travels to prospects and customers‚Äô offices. Fulfills requests for proposals (RFPs) from potential customers and partners. Develops and organizes new business development initiatives. Collaborates with the marketing department to ensure proper branding. Required Education, Skills And Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, marketing, or related field, MBA a plus. Sales and negotiations certifications. 5-10 years‚Äô sales experience. Consultative selling, effective organizational and negotiation skills. Knowledge of product and sector. Financial and business acumen. Excellent presentation and communication skills. Ability to communicate accessibly and concisely about products to outsiders, including prospective customers, clients and partners. Familiarity with Aerendir‚Äôs technologies and their applications. This position is mostly in-person and based at Aerendir Mobile, Inc‚Äôs headquarter in Mountain View, California, and will require a regular commute to the office.  About Aerendir Mobile Inc  Aerendir Mobile Inc. is the developer of a neural tapping technology based on mobile devices that allows for a next-generation AI-powered authentication, identification, encryption and bot segregation platform. Among the first two products available are a foolproof authenticator and a neural anti AI-bot. Aerendir‚Äôs products use its patented NeuroPrint¬Æ technology to extract a unique proprioceptive signal from micro-vibrational patterns found in the user‚Äôs hands, using the existing hardware found in today‚Äôs mobile devices. Aerendir‚Äôs solution can be embedded in any device or active surface to capture a biometric reading from any muscle in the body. Aerendir‚Äôs code can function at all levels of integration from binary libraries, OS and firmware to SoC/ASIC. Aerendir‚Äôs biometric technology is designed to put security back in the hands of the individual. For more information, please visit www.aerendir.info.

description: Summary:  Cargo Chief has built a logistics platform, C4¬Æ, servicing hundreds of logistics professional to win the freight market by buying better and more efficiently. As the Director of Partnerships, you will report to the CEO and be responsible for developing and implementing a strategy to expand the Cargo Chief eco-system through strategic partnerships with other freight tech providers, financial firms and key players. Matching candidates will have a history of steadily increasing success in generating sustainable, multi-year revenue partnerships in the massive freight and logistics sectors. By joining Cargo Chief, you will have the unique opportunity to make an impact on companies moving almost everything you use, eat, and drink and help tailor solutions to an increasingly changing market.  How You Will Contribute:  The Director will identify prospects, craft proposals, pitch, respond to partnership inquiries The Director will drive and close the natural selling steps to get term sheets and agreements signed The Director will coordinate and manage partnership activities/relationships, so they exceed expectations The Director will coordinate with the product, marketing, and sales teams to align partnership strategy with business use cases. The Director will be responsible for reporting on strategic partnerships  You: 3+ Years of strategic business development experience Knowledge of Full Truckload sector, freight brokerage knowledge is even better Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment Proven ability to take initiative and deliver results without tight supervision Superior organizational skills with the ability to manage hundreds of partners and prospects Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal, written/email) skills Being smart, partner passionate, and determined Comfortable and productive working in a remote environment Strong understanding of modern freight technology and comfortable working with a CRM and sales tools 4 year College degree Pluses: History working as an Account Executive or Carrier Representative at freight broker Transportation Management System (TMS), logistics technology experience Startup (sometimes ambiguous, very dynamic, fast-paced) experience  Us: Cargo Chief is a leading SaaS software provider in the $800B domestic trucking industry. The C4 platform helps logistics companies, which buy $Billions of freight, uncover areas of improvement to move more loads more efficiently with actionable data, accurate pricing information, and process improvement tools. We are VC backed and have recently raised a multi-million dollar round and are taking the company to the next level by adding to our already successful, fun and inspiring team. We offer competitive salary, generous incentives and Silicon Valley stock options, as well as, health, dental, vision.  Next Steps: If this is a role that you see yourself in, are excited to dive deep and wanting to work in a fast-paced startup environment, please apply by first sending a LinkedIn message when connecting with Russell Jones of Cargo Chief include in your message who you want to approach initially. Then please send an email to RJones@CargoChief.com. Please do not call. We will contact candidates that are a strong match.  Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Cargo Chief are considered the property of Cargo Chief and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

jobTitle: Vice President of Enterprise Sales - Americas
description: The VP of Enterprise Sales is responsible for driving the growth of sales to corporate/enterprise accounts and managing the Account Executives on the Enterprise team. The qualified candidate possesses a proven track record of software sales success and sales management. This role collaborates with other sales and business leaders within Panopto. Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Sales, a successful candidate has the ability to work creatively and collaborates well with other sales and business leaders within Panopto.  About the Role This role is an essential part of Panopto‚Äôs overall growth in new and upsell business. You will be responsible for:  Directly leading the enterprise sales team and facilitating effective collaboration and resource allocation with other Panopto teams such as Sales Development, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Customer Success Developing a thorough knowledge of the Panopto platform to serve as an escalation point for individual contributors in key deals and be capable of delivering product demonstrations to facilitate sales conversations Building and managing a pipeline of new logo and upsell opportunities to meet and exceed revenue targets for North America Working with Account Executives to execute account planning and engaging directly with senior executives at our customers to advance opportunities through the sales cycle Using systems and processes for the effective and timely management of pipeline and forecasting and assessing future needs Taking an active role on client negotiations while exercising solid business judgement, demonstrating thorough understanding of pricing models, and articulating the business case and customer benefit of our solution Efficiently managing expenses for the region in the pursuit of deals, internal activities and skill development of the team Providing product feedback based on insight from the sales team, prospects, and customers  About You We are looking for someone that is enthusiastic, self-motivated, and has a positive attitude with a passion for building customer relationships and high performing sales teams. In particular you have:  A successful history of managing a sales team including hiring, onboarding, and developing enterprise-level sales talent Sales experience in enterprise software/SaaS products with a track record of successful target achievement Experience or strong interest in video, search and digital multi-media Expertise in using CRM to record, communicate, report on, and manage prospects, consolidated pipelines, and forecasts, particularly Salesforce.com Ability to balance compelling business-focused presentations to prospects and effectively demonstrate technology products to audiences of various levels of technical proficiency  Willingness to travel up to 30% to support the enterprise sales team  About Panopto We believe that video can have a transformative effect on learning. So we built a video platform that helps businesses and universities improve the way that they train, teach, and share knowledge. Since 2007, we have been a pioneer in video capture software, video management, and inside-video-search technology. Panopto has been adopted by more than 1,300 companies and universities worldwide with over nine million end users. Today, Panopto‚Äôs video management system is the largest repository of expert learning videos in the world. Headquartered in Seattle, with offices in Pittsburgh, London, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Sydney, Panopto has received industry recognition for its innovation, rapid growth, and company culture. Panopto‚Äôs mission is to help anyone share knowledge using video. Our user base is as diverse as the world‚Äôs universities and businesses. To fulfill our mission with the best products and services, we eagerly seek individuals who bring diversity of background, experience, and thought to create an engaging work environment, foster innovation and better understand and meet the needs of our users. We encourage people from underrepresented and/or marginalized backgrounds, including BIPOC, LatinX, LGBTQ+, women, and people with disabilities, to apply. Panopto is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Passion and enthusiasm for driving sales and providing unparalleled service to our prospects and clients. Benefits  For the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. It's rounded out by: Healthcare, vision, and dental healthcare plans, with add-ons for life and disability insurance 401(k) retirement plan Three weeks of PTO per year, plus six paid holidays Uncapped Commissions ‚Äì top reps making over $200k $600/mo. car allowance + mileage reimbursement Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll enjoy spending the day with.  PathAI is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. description: Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), and growing their savings* -- all for free. play a key role in guiding strategy for the Credit Card vertical Work in a highly cross-functional, highly collaborative environment - you are the hub of many spokes within Credit Karma Use business acumen, analytical skills and relationship experience to market and execute complex initiatives with both new and existing partners Minimum Basic Requirements Has 7+ years of experience in consumer lending customer acquisition, media buying or digital marketing Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field from an accredited college or university, or at least 7 years of related business experience and a track record of continuous professional development Preferred Qualifications MBA preferred Executive presence with the ability to succinctly, confidently and articulately defend and challenge positions in verbal and written communications Hyper-focused on partner satisfaction and substantial experience developing and managing complex relationships, preferably proven by at least 7+ years of experience in a client-facing or senior management role in a sales/consulting/business development capacity Develops senior relationships to serve as a trusted advisor with major partners to optimize their digital acquisition, activation and engagement strategies An understanding of the consumer finance industry's challenges, a vision for its growth and a commitment to advance Credit Karma‚Äôs forward-looking initiatives within the marketplace Work collaboratively with a cross-functional team that is passionate about innovation and disruption to the benefit of members and partnersLeverage proven frameworks to evaluate potential business opportunities, structure the team‚Äôs thinking, and reach insightful answers Possess a natural ability for analyzing & synthesizing information to develop plans and strategies. Moreover, you can effectively use data to make decisions and communicate this to others in a succinct and easy to understand manner Proven performance in independently researching and resolving complex partner questions or concerns. Has the ability, acumen and confidence to know when and how to say ‚Äúno‚Äù when necessary Equal Employment Opportunity  Credit Karma is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We welcome all candidates without regard to race, color, religion, age, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, veteran or military status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. description: Our client, a manufacturer based in Greater Portland, is seeking a Director of Business Development to build customer relationships, provide strategic direction and contribute to growth. As part of the senior management team, the Director of Business Development will be responsible for all business development, sales, and marketing activities. A successful Director of Business Development will be able to work with cross-functional teams and lead strategy across the company. This role is heavily focused on developing and maintaining relationships. Successful candidates will have excellent interpersonal skills, as well as an innovative mindset and the ability to have a deep understanding of the company‚Äôs offerings.  In the role of Director of Business Development: Sales / Commercial ¬∑      Identify new customers and new opportunities with existing customers that are suited to the Product Design and Manufacturing business model. ¬∑      Provide a constant pipeline of new RFQs and new customers, as well as create and proactively manage a robust pipeline tracking system enabling the ability to continuously report on progress of pipeline and leads. ¬∑      Partner with key stakeholders to create, develop and execute a voice of customer strategy that will empower and position the business for continued future success.   ¬∑      Partner with Finance to ensure potential new customers have strong financial status and credit worthiness. ¬∑      Ensure new opportunities can deliver minimum levels of gross margin and revenue.  Marketing ¬∑      Create and maintain the company brand image, both internally and externally, including but not limited to web, print and presentations. ¬∑      Monitor, evaluate and report on competitor positioning and identify and implement strategies to win additional business. ¬∑      Ensure business deliverables are in line with marketed deliverables. ¬∑      Drive the marketing and branding at industry focused events. ¬∑      Promote key differentiators.      Management ¬∑      Significant interaction with Senior Management Team to achieve consistency in relation to Business Structure Development and Process Development. ¬∑      Define and develop the working relationships with the Program and Account Managers to ensure clear lines of communication and ownership of specific tasks are undertaken and implemented. Communication ¬∑      Generate and present reports to the management team providing information on current status and future expectations of business activity relating to adopted strategies. ¬∑      Ensure implementation of an accurate weekly status reporting process which can be issued in a controlled manner to both customers and staff. ¬∑      Represent at customer quarterly business reviews and provide relevant data for review. ¬∑      Create visit reports after every customer meeting and distribute to management and owners of relevant actions. ¬∑      Ensure communication processes are implemented that are consistent across all functions. Customer Satisfaction ¬∑      Ensure all outstanding issues / customer complaints are resolved swiftly and to the customer‚Äôs satisfaction. ¬∑      Define and develop an escalation process to ensure customer issues that cannot be addressed by the customer facing team are closed out by the management team within an agreed timescale. ¬∑      Ensure customer expectations are managed in line with the ability to deliver.  The skills to succeed: ¬∑      Be commercially astute ¬∑      Proven excellent customer service ¬∑      Excel at critical/strategic thinking ¬∑      Proactive communicator ¬∑      Motivational with the ability be able to lead by example ¬∑      Ability to prioritize & manage multiple projects ¬∑      Structured and professional ¬∑      Ability to stay calm under pressure      Education and experience of a successful candidate: ¬∑      Degree qualified in a relevant technical field or business administration. ¬∑      Proven experience in Sales Management role ¬∑      Experience with Salesforce ¬∑      Background in Electronics Manufacturing, Contract Manufacturing, Product Development ¬∑      A level of technical understanding / competence, degree in engineering a plus ¬∑      Cross functional experience  Salary will depend on experience and includes full benefits. description: Job Description  Anheuser-Busch is leading the way of future growth in the industry. The Commercial Strategy Director of Texas drives the execution of our Texas agenda through deep analysis, insights, strategy, and execution. This role will be relentlessly passionate about achieving AB's dream of Leading Future Growth in Texas and delivering on key commercial priorities.  Job Role  As a Commercial Strategy Director of Texas, you will help the company drive and deliver on executive-level strategic priorities while ensuring alignment and success of day-to-day operations in the state of Texas. You will be a collaborator with senior leaders across Sales, Marketing, and external partners, as well as be an esteemed thought leader as a catalyst for growth.  To be successful in your role, you will have a bias for action and use sophisticated analytic skills to make sense of unstructured and complex data. You will be able to bring structure to ambiguity and derive key insights and growth opportunities for all initiatives related to the growth and performance for the state of Texas. Your ability to construct compelling narratives and impactful presentation skills will help you influence and impact the direction and success of the strategic vision of Texas. You‚Äôll drive the execution and implementation of strategic decisions with determination to ensure our Texas strategy is brought to life.  Qualifications  Job Qualifications 3-5 years‚Äô experience in fast paced consulting environment Excellent communication, planning analyzing influencing and organization skills Strong ability to set, supervise, drive, and meet goals Strong verbal, written presentation, and communication skills Ability to work under tight deadline requirements Excellent attention to details and ability to multi-task Forward-thinking leader that is willing to give to our company‚Äôs growth and expansion Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Management, or related degree required. MBA, or related Master‚Äôs degree, is preferred. Strong ability to work within Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and PowerPoint Cross-functional experience with Sales and Marketing is preferred Benefits And Work Perks  We offer generous benefit plan options that can be tailored for your unique needs and wellbeing. Here are just a few: Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Wellness and Tax-Advantaged Savings and Spending Accounts Life Insurance and Disability Income Protection Generous Parental Leave and FMLA policies 401(k) Retirement Savings options with a generous company matching contribution Chance to work in a fast-paced environment among a company of owners Free Beer! Job Function Commercial  Primary Location United States-Texas-Dallas  Schedule Full-time  Job Type Permanent  Posting Date Aug 21, 2021  Budweiser. Bud Light. Stella Artois. Over 19 billion dollar brands, to be exact. But there‚Äôs more to us than a portfolio of top notch brands.  We are a company built on a dream. We have a vision that we share with our wholesalers, retailers, consumers and partners. We want to brew great beers that can not only be enjoyed responsibly but which are also created with a low impact on the environment.  We are a company of go-getters dedicated to providing unparalleled quality and results. We take pride in our work, regardless of the task or department. Over 160 years, we‚Äôve grown to operate 15 breweries, 17 distributorships and 23 agricultural packaging facilities across the United States. And our Brewmasters still taste every batch made at every brewery before being packaged and sent to market.  We are a company that believes our people are our greatest asset. We believe in the spirit of ownership because our employees take results personally and want to build something great together. We value talented employees who aren‚Äôt afraid to be bold, resourceful, and committed.  At Anheuser-Busch, it‚Äôs not about what you studied or where you worked, it‚Äôs about what you can do. If you see yourself working for a company that allows you to excel at the pace of your talent, then a career at Anheuser-Busch may be for you.  Want to learn more? Visit us at anheuser-busch.com/careers.  As the leading global brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev is committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: About DeepScribe  DeepScribe is an artificially intelligent medical scribe produces comprehensive clinical documentation - simply through the natural patient encounter.  Despite our physicians devoting their entire lives to providing patients with the best care possible, physicians today are experiencing dangerous levels of ‚Äúburn-out‚Äù. While innovation in medical diagnosis and treatment has skyrocketed in the past few decades, there has been little innovation for the front line physicians. In fact, new technology such as Electronic Health Records (EHRs) were designed with little to no consideration for the front line physicians, resulting in the epidemic of ‚Äúdeath by a thousand clicks‚Äù. Instead of spending time caring for patients and delivering healthcare, our physicians are spending nearly 40% of every single day on documentation alone.  Our mission at DeepScribe is to restore the joy of care back to medicine. We help physicians around the world restore the balance in their lives, so they can not only provide better care, but can also be happy while doing it.  DeepScribe started in 2017 with three patients and a few computers. Today, our team is growing fast and our products are saving physicians up to 3 hours per day on their documentation.  Are you looking for a dynamic work environment with the opportunity to deliver high impact work and have fun while doing it? Are you a curious learner who is unafraid to question the status quo? If you are a friendly, passionate, and lifelong learner who is looking to make a real difference in physicians lives, we are looking for you!  Learn more at www.deepscribe.tech  About The Job  DeepScribe is looking for a Director of Sales to lead our Sales and Marketing efforts. You will work directly with the co-founders to develop and execute our sales and marketing strategies to expand our customer base and meet our monthly growth targets.  This is a full-time, in-office position based in the DeepScribe office in San Francisco, CA with a competitive, equity-based salary. You must be authorized to work in the US.  Responsibilities Include  Design and implement sales and marketing infrastructure for the entire life cycle of sale: prospecting, selling and closing. You will work directly with our COO to design, validate, and iterate an end to end sales and marketing infrastructure.  Effectively manage team pipeline to ensure revenue goals are met  Effectively manage sales pipeline to meet monthly sales projections  Lead recruiting, training, objective setting, and reporting for all Sales and Marketing team members and act as primary liaison to senior leadership  Develop data driven performance monitoring and evaluation methodology to provide accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts  Work with team to identify opportunities for optimization and/or growth of existing accounts to facilitate stronger relationships and increase revenue  What Makes The Perfect Candidate  Go getter: Demonstrated ability to take initiative and get the job done  Team mentality: Works as a team player and committed to building a community that helps and empowers others  Question the status quo: Not afraid to play the devil's advocate and invites opposing opinions for discussion  Requirements  A bachelor‚Äôs degree  Minimum of at least 5-8 years in achieving success in carrying sales quota  Experience selling in healthcare IT or related field a plus  Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal  Proven sales presentation and demonstration skills  Strong business acumen  Exceptional organizational and time management skills  Working knowledge of CRM (preferably Hubspot)

description: Wistia is the leading video and audio marketing platform for B2B marketers. We have the opportunity to both simplify how marketers do their jobs, but also maximize the results that they are after. There has never been such a huge push to invest in content marketing like we are seeing today, including both video and podcast. Wistia is uniquely positioned to serve this rapidly growing market as an end to end platform that supports the creation, hosting, publishing and measuring of video and podcast content for marketers.  The Director of Sales Development will be responsible for evolving and executing on the Sales Development strategy at Wistia. They will work closely with the rest of the Sales Leadership team, as well as marketing, revenue operations and finance to grow the sales pipeline in our most strategic segments. They will quickly grow the sales development effort by recruiting, training and mentoring a diverse and motivated team of sellers. This team is critical to the expansion of Wistia's strategic customer segments and offers the opportunity to impact revenue growth within an already successful company.  Key Responsibilities Develop and implement the sales development playbook to optimize pipeline generation within our top strategic customer segments, namely Small and Medium sized businesses. This will include, but is not limited to: Collaborate with sales leadership to build a steady flow of conversations into our AE organization. Partner with Marketing, Sales Operations and other Go To Market leaders to identify and prioritize SDR lead pools and target accounts. Optimize head count and specialization within the SDR org to inspire conversations with target companies both inside our database as well as completely new to Wistia. Build and mentor a strong management team focused on coaching and supporting our SDRs. Develop quota strategies that align with the growth goals of the company and ensure that salers at Wistia are motivated to pursue the right business and are highly engaged in their work. Develop, Measure and report on key performance indicators that will lead us to reliably forecasting our sales numbers and make the necessary adjustments to address any shortcomings or opportunity that are discovered along the way. Collaborate with sales enablement and the sales leadership team to build a strong feeder organization for the sales effort at Wistia This will include, but is not limited to: Recruit a diverse team of junior sellers that are self starters with empathy and curiosity. Create a team culture that is inclusive and celebrates bringing ones whole self to work. We are a human and authentic community that celebrates each other's differences! Create a rapid promotion path the enables tangible growth for high performers and those that support our customers in ways that we can be proud of. Create a measurable and repeatable professional development plan designed to ramp new SDRs quickly, prepares them for consistent quota attainment and ultimately gets them ready for promotion to the AE org. Provide leadership as a key stakeholder on the Sales Leadership and Go To Market leadership team at Wistia This will include, but is not limited to: Collaborate with GTM leaders to identify the most effective and efficient way to acquire customers across different customer segments. Develop annualized hiring plans for the SDR org, projecting pipeline generation for the AE org. Participate in rolling strategic planning at the company level. Qualifications  Must Have: Track record of exceeding quota as a sales manager or sales director. Demonstrated ability to drive pipeline growth while not compromising on the core values and diversity of the team they build. Experience coaching and mentoring more junior sales people towards habits and tactics that will drive consistent results. Strong communication skills, including documentation, async collaboration and in person presentation skills. Strong coaching/mentorship skills and a commitment to professional growth of both ICs and Managers on their team. Passion for building diverse and inclusive teams  Nice to Have: Prior ownership of the sales development strategy and playbook Experience with new market or segment penetration and discovery Experience and knowledge with selling systems and the ability to pair these (or components of them) with GTM strategy that is not exclusively sales led (Inbound Marketing, Product Led etc). Passion for contributing to voice of customer efforts to influence the direct of the product and marketing roadmap.  About Wistia  We try to ensure Wistia is an inclusive and diverse place where everyone feels happy, fulfilled, respected, comfortable, and welcome. We're proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We care a lot, so our benefits are actually benefits, not just the fun stuff like swag and snacks in the office (though we also have lots of those too!).  We know the biggest investment we can make is in our employees, so we provide: A great compensation package 401k with 3% company contribution, regardless of whether you contribute Profit Sharing Flexible hours Fully paid healthcare coverage for you and your family (including dental) and a healthcare FSA Up to 16 weeks paid family leave Flexible vacation and sick leave Transportation subsidies
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Why You Would Want to Join XtalPi While at MIT, our founders had a vision to overcome high failure rates in drug discovery by combining machine learning with physics-based models and wet-lab experiments into a tight iterative cycle. In your role as the critical interface in translating the benefits of this novel platform to pharmaceutical collaborations, you will accelerate the development of life-saving drugs across diverse therapeutic areas.  What XtalPi Can Do for Your Career As a core member of the Business Development team, you will not only spearhead our sales and business development effort, but will also have the freedom to participate in various partnership and licensing activities. Insofar as XtalPi has raised more than $380M, you will have the opportunity to work in a cutting-edge‚Äîyet stable‚Äîenvironment to grow your career along many exciting dimensions.
