description: VICE PRESIDENT, STRATEGIC CLIENT ACCOUNTS RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans, and implementing technology to help transform organizations.  Working for RGP, you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP, and built on tangible accomplishments.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know: We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them. We like working with people who are positive, adaptable, and growth-minded. We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.   THE RGP EXPERIENCE Whether you desire to work directly with clients or support those who do, RGP connects you to meaningful opportunities designed to put your talents to their best and highest use, and help you develop skills for today and tomorrow. As an RGP employee, you are a champion for your team, driven to develop their functional acumen in a manner that is transformative and valuable. You help guide people and organizations to be and become more than they thought possible and have the ultimate service mentality based on openness, understanding, and teamwork.   PURPOSE OF THE ROLE We are seeking a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts in our Northern California offices, who will be instrumental in growing market revenue through new business development, management and expansion of existing client relationships, and oversight of consultant engagements with one of our most strategic accounts. In keeping with our entrepreneurial culture, the Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts will have an opportunity to build and own a client portfolio while working in partnership with teammates to achieve key business objectives.   Why work for a Strategic Client Program (SCP) Account? Providing exemplary client service runs deep in RGP‚Äôs DNA. Our SCP clients turn to us for thought leadership, insight, and innovation. At RGP, we are focused on humans leading the way to global growth. We take pride in being a trusted partner and strategic advisor to our clients. As a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts, you will be part of a dedicated team that fuels growth and delivers this expertise, providing exemplary client service as you develop and maintain comprehensive, long-term, sustainable, and strategic client relationships.   ATTRIBUTES OF INDIVIDUALS IN THIS ROLE AT RGP  Demonstrates integrity and respect for people and opinions Integrity and respect for people and opinions Entrepreneurial, highly self-motivated, and driven to achieve a comprehensive set of performance metrics and quantitative measures Strategic, thought leader, and trusted business partner to the Account/Client Maintains an executive presence with a strong ability to interact with senior/C-level leaders Strong personal identification with RGP‚Äôs values ‚Äì loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability, and talent  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE  Accountable for the sales activity and results for a defined portfolio of business / Develops and implements tactical plans to achieve portfolio sales goals and objectives Conducts account planning and proactively seeks to bring innovative ideas and approaches to the account strategy Owns and drives key strategic pursuits, leveraging the full range of RGP resources and enablers (including Technical Sales, Advisory Project Services, and Business Development), as appropriate Develops and maintains effective relationships and communicates effectively with key client leaders and staff in order to drive account penetration and sales growth Continually develops new client business by pursuing account penetration within existing clients Serves as the description: Job Description  Of course our sales organization includes our field reps (who sell our leading brands into retail accounts, bars and restaurants across the country) but that barely scratches the surface. Opportunities include roles in forecasting, trade marketing, business and wholesaler development, pricing and promotion analysis and key account management; it‚Äôs the strategic side of how we sell our beer. Sales are the backbone of our company‚Äîwe work hard to get our product in the hands of every one of our target consumers‚Ä¶ of legal drinking age of course.  In this role, you will be working directly with dedicated main house wholesalers, cultivating a strategic relationship at a higher level of the wholesaler organization. Using a strategic, forward thinking mindset, you will elevate our role/presence with wholesalers in your specific market.  Job Qualifications Mandatory University Degree in Business or related field Minimum 3-5 years of general sales, marketing and distribution experience in a fast-paced, high performance consumer packaged goods environment is recommended Ability to understand and develop strategic direction and ability to develop plans to get results Strong leadership skills and the ability to develop and engage people to build a high-performance sales team Strong influencing and communication skills ‚Äì both internal and external Strong Customer Management relationship skills Knowledge of Commercial and Sales strategy, Distribution and Supply Preferred Industry Specific Market Knowledge Knowledge of ABC laws & regulations and marketing & advertising guidelines for promotions Knowledge of key consumer product drivers: distribution, merchandising, promotion, pricing, category management Job Function Commercial  Primary Location United States-Texas-Lubbock  Schedule Full-time  Job Type Permanent  Posting Date Sep 21, 2021  Anheuser-Busch is here for the times that matter. The moments where we celebrate, defy challenges, dream of the brighter future we are building today‚Äì and all the moments in between. We are a company that brings people together for richer conversations, sweeter celebrations and stronger communities.  Challenge Accepted! Apply Today! Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Wellness and Tax-Advantaged Savings and Spending Accounts Life Insurance and Disability Income Protection Generous Parental Leave and FMLA policies 401(k) Retirement Savings options with a company matching contribution Chance to work in a fast-paced environment among a company of owners Free Beer! As the leading global brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev is committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity, and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: Established in 1976, COE Press Equipment designs and manufactures a complete line of premiere coil handling and servo roll feed equipment from stand-alone roll feeds, straighteners, reels, cradles and air feeds to complete integrated feed lines and cut-to-length systems. We are dedicated to providing the highest quality of products, services and solutions for our customers throughout the world. We earn our customer‚Äôs loyalty by providing high-value, innovative, and technically advanced systems that are delivered on-time and on-budget. We are committed to continuous research and development, world-class engineering, vertically integrated manufacturing, and relentless customer service. Our solutions are developed by an experienced staff of dedicated employees that utilize best practices in a dynamic work environment. We work together as a team so our weaknesses become stronger and our strengths are unsurpassed. If this sounds exciting, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!  THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL: Be a proven leader with passion for instilling a self-starting attitude in others Possess the ability to set, pursue and attain goals for sales activities and a knack for implementing plans to achieve desired outcomes and KPI‚Äôs Have had success building long term, high quality relationships with customers Understand how to affect others‚Äô actions, decisions and sense of value for all things THE DIRECTOR OF SALES WILL: Achieve sales and growth targets for the organization Balance workflow, analyze dashboards, manage CRM and drive consistencies in the sales organization Own management of the Coe Press brand Serve as a steady voice on the leadership team REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in sales, marketing or business administration or equivalent number of years of experience Eight years or more of progressive management in metal processing or a related industry, with a minimum of 2 years business to business sales management Computer competency to include MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access and Outlook Coe Press Equipment is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

What You'll Do  You will lead a team of Regional Managers and Account Managers to help our Civilian agencies accomplish their most critical mission Protect and manage our natural resources, our cultural heritage and how we move and live daily in our communities. These agencies are tasked with serving, building and protecting our most valuable assets. You will partner with Engineering Leaders and System Architects focused on positioning Cisco‚Äôs software and hardware solutions to help Civilian agencies accomplish their mission! You will have overall sales leadership responsibilities for four main verticals inside Civilian - Healthcare, Entitlement, Financial & Services, and Scientific Your team will consist of Regional Managers and Account Managers in those four verticals - 4 Direct Reports, 25+ Account Managers. You will also have a matrix team of Sales Engineers, Sales Engineer Leaders, Solution Architects, Product Specialists, Sales Engineers, Service Delivery Executives, Legal and Finance.   Who You'll Work With  You will need to strategically drive Cisco's end-to-end vision for our Federal Civilian customers, as well as maintain an in-depth understanding of funding vehicles, capture opportunities, competitive conditions, industry practices, market opportunities, and customer requirements. In addition to leading ‚Äúone winning team‚Äù, the Director will work closely and cross-collaboratively with Cisco's most senior executives within Customer Advocacy, Technology Business Units, and Cisco's Executive Sales team. You will also be responsible for creating strategic relationships with our Partner ecosystem to drive $1B+ in Cisco Revenue.This is one of the largest, most visible, and complex roles within Cisco's Federal Sales Organization.  Who You Are  You are a proven sales leader with deep Civilian knowledge and have experience building a strategy with Civilian agencies.You will bring excitement and passion to lead our talented sales organization to execute on a vision that aids Civilian agencies execute towards their mission.You will also be expected to motivate, inspire, and continually develop your team and channel partners while taking on new competitors as Cisco continues to gain market share in our Advance Technologies, which include Security, Collaboration, Data Center, and Application Monitoring.Key experience and performance traits that will aid in your success include You are a senior manager with 8+ years of leading a sales organization by developing and executing a sales strategy. You have 8+ years in leadership roles selling solutions to senior executives at Federal agencies. You have a deep knowledge and experience in building a strategy for Civilian agencies. You have 15+ years of experience in strategic sales and execution in the technology industry. You have demonstrated a track record of leading significant revenue responsibility and over-achieving growth targets to meet stretch goals. You have cultivated performance by attracting, developing and retaining top sales talent and can motivate in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. You have represented Cisco (or current company) in a large internal and customer-focused industry event. You are adept at balancing short-term pressures with overall long-term strategic goals. You have demonstrated the ability to provide thought leadership, think strategically and effectively communicate vision (both written and verbal) and influence in a matrixed organization. You have a strong executive presence, you are polished, politically savvy, and you have strong leadership skills in mentoring and developing a sales organization for 60+ people. You have excellent communication skills with the ability to persuade ‚Äì using simple communications that convey complex concepts in a compelling, concise and creative way.  We Are Cisco  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here‚Äôs how we do it.  We embrace technology modernization, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we‚Äôre ‚Äúold‚Äù (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we‚Äôre also a software company. And a security company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects.  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves to our community because giving back is built into our DNA.We take accountability, we set bold audacious goals, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don‚Äôt care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That‚Äôs cool. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Recount Media is looking for a Sales Director to join its sales team. As Sales Director, you will work with new and existing partners to grow The Recount revenue through native newsletter placements, podcasts, social, signature events, streaming, and OnDemand, as well as other programming opportunities. Our product is unique, and we need a person who understands how to ladder its value to the business needs of quality brands across multiple categories. The Recount offers a competitive salary with impressive benefits and great perks portfolio.  The Recount is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. jobTitle: Regional Director of Sales - Full Service Hotels
description: Ascent Hospitality Management, Atlanta, GA - Remote job  Please note that this position is based in Atlanta, GA or remote in Alabama / Tennessee. Candidates must be willing to relocate and relocation assistance will be provided.  Ascent Hospitality has an extensive portfolio of hotels and a strong pipeline of new properties and acquisitions, but we're not about numbers...we're about people and that remains our foundation. Our culture expresses a memorable experience for all of our Team Members and guests alike. So we're constantly looking for individuals who work well together for a unified purpose. For our leadership, we're looking for accomplished individuals with a passion to serve others, strong communicators who clearly understand the needs of others and trendsetters who excel at challenges and change. If this is what you're all about, consider joining our Team.  We are currently looking for an seasoned individual for the position of Regional Director of Sales - Full Service Hotels out of our corporate office in Atlanta, GA or remote in Alabama / Tennessee.  The Regional Director of Sales - Full Service Hotels position will provide strategic sales and revenue direction to their assigned portfolio of hotels for the purpose of driving TOP LINE REVENUE and GROWING MARKET SHARE for Ascent Hospitality. This individual will work with other corporate and property level team members to maximize revenue and maintain strong interpersonal relationships. This position is for a ROAD WARRIOR!!!! Someone who is ready to travel and be hands on with their portfolio of hotels. If you're looking for a new adventure with great rewards, this position is for you!  Regional Director Of Sales Responsibilities Develop and Implement sales strategies designed to attack specific market segments, key accounts or identified need time periods to achieve Hotel Budget and RevPar Growth. Participate in weekly Revenue Management meetings with thorough understanding of Star Report, accurately forecast revenues and ability to make recommendations with changes in rates, mins/maxs and LOS restrictions Become a brand sales expert for the company portfolio, adhering to and being knowledgeable to brand programs, resources, tools and initiatives. The Regional Director of Sales will establish sales performance goals for your hotel sales team members Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce group and transient business for your hotels. Travel to assigned properties in the region conducting property visits, sales calls, with written documentation of the visits with attention to follow up. The Regional Director of Sales will mentor, coach, and assist as necessary, assigned sales teams, to ensure their success. The Regional Director of Sales will supervise sales initiatives. Represent Ascent Hospitality at Trade Shows and sales blitzes as necessary. Serve as first point of contact for above property sales support to hotels in the region. The Regional Director of Sales will act as interim Director of Sales for any hotel in the company as directed by the VP of Sales & Marketing. Provide training assistance to hotel sales leaders and GMs to develop, coach and provided continuous training. Produce sales department reports on a timely basis Regional Director Of Sales Qualifications Five or more years of above property, multi-property, sales management experience is preferred Major brand experience with Marriott and Hilton is an absolute requirement Working knowledge on CI/TY, OneSource, OnQ, R&I, Delphi Must be able to travel at least 90% of time. This position is only for the "Road Warrior Strong leadership skills resulting in mentorship and development of sales managers to reaching goals. Strong oral and written communication skills combined with computer, presentation and negotiation skills. Regional Director of Sales candidates must have excellent time-management skills and ability to handle multiple priorities. Strong decision-making capabilities and strategizing skills. Demonstrates creativity in finding solutions to problems. Finds the win-win when resolving conflicts. Remains calm and acts appropriately when faced with hectic or tense situations. Strong mathematical skills with the ability to accurately interpret data to create forecasts and budgets. Regional Director of Sales candidates must have a good understanding of various market conditions and influencers. Education And/or Experience Bachelor's degree or a combination of advanced education and equivalent work experience. Minimum of 5 years overall hotel experience to include 3+ years as an Area or Market Sales Leader with Full Service Hotels. Management or senior supervisory experience in hotels or experience in the industry with transferable skills. Regional Director of Sales candidates must have a proven ability to sell. Must be able to conduct and manage meetings, as well as speak to large groups as needed. Must have an outgoing, sales minded personality with the ability to close. *Candidates with Marriott or Hilton Brand Certification will have top consideration** We are seeking a "game-changer" and proven sales leader who can communicate a vision and collaborate with a sales team to generate extraordinary growth.  If we've caught your attention, we encourage you to apply today!

We are hiring highly creative, energetic professionals to join our high-performing organization and help us execute against our vision to expand our cutting-edge health promoting beverages and sports nutrition products worldwide.  Role: The Director Sales Operations (DSO) manages support functions essential to sales force productivity. These include planning, reporting, quota setting and management, sales process optimization, sales job design, sales training, sales program implementation, sales compensation design and administration, and recruiting and selection of sales force talent.   The DSO is responsible for the overall productivity and effectiveness of the assigned sales organization. Reporting to the Vice President Sales Operations, the DSO also works closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the appropriate objectives and priorities are enabled within the sales organization supported.   Essential Duties & Responsibilities:   Provide strategic decision support for sales leadership by generating sales insights through analytics, KPIs and metrics Implements enabling technologies, including CRM, to field sales teams. Monitors the assigned sales organization‚Äôs compliance with required standards for maintaining CRM data Supports the equitable assignment of sales force quotas and ensures quotas are optimally allocated to all sales channels and resources. Work closely with management to develop sales structures, performance goals and objectives to maximize revenue potential Coordinates sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes used within the sales organization. Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organization‚Äôs planning efforts Drives processes that achieve results through others that are not direct reports Lead strategic decision support to sales leadership and broader sales organization Collaborate on a regular basis with Finance, other Sales Operation leads and supporting functions Develop and manage key performance indicators and metrics to assess sales effectiveness and achievement of the function‚Äôs goals and objectives Proactively identifies opportunities for sales process improvement. Works closely with sales management to inspect sales process quality and prioritize opportunities for improvement. Assists sales management in understanding process bottlenecks and inconsistencies. Facilitates an organization of continuous process improvement. Generate insights through analytics, deliver actionable data to customers in a variety of reporting mediums (PBI, PPT, XLS) Develop and recommend sales objectives and performance plans Manage the sales region and territory structures and partner with sales management to optimize structure to maximize sales growth potential Assess and recommend commission programs and promotions and use data to provide feedback on effectiveness Educate and train sales management and team on systems and processes Manage division-wide Sales Operations Coordinators and related sales order management processes and inquiries Act as subject matter expert in all sales operations process, reporting tools, data models and systems Collaborate with enterprise programs impacting sales operations processes Formulate policy, guidance documents and education and training material Lead cross business unit process improvement opportunities Responsibility to work with members of the Sales Team to understand industry trends and anticipate the Products the market will value most Communicates cross-functional updates across the organization and to upper management Supports leadership in developing and executing against our long-term strategic plans Other duties as assigned  Accountabilities and Performance Measures (KPI‚Äôs):  Achievement of sales, profit, and strategic objectives for the business unit supported Accountable for the on-time implementation of sales organization quotas and performance objectives Accountable for the thorough implementation of sales organization-impacting initiatives Responsible for the efficient allocation of technology, support, and training resources impacting the sales organization Accountable for accurate and on-0time reporting essential for sales organization effectiveness Achievement of strategic objectives defined by company management  Qualifications: Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business or similar Experience: 5+ years work experience including building, developing, and running sales processes, sales operations in a fast-growing, quickly scaling business Deep expertise on sales automation and CRM systems. Strong cross-functional collaborator; ability to communicate effectively with Leadership, Sales teams, product teams, and operations among others Strong business/financial acumen with excellent communication skills Track record of building and maintaining high performing teams High EQ and ability to build strong relationships throughout the organization, including with senior leadership Proven track record making, sponsoring, and guiding teams to complex and large-scale initiatives and data-driven business decisions from start to finish. Excellent skills in business modeling and pressuring testing model assumptions, and ability to inspire a culture of excellence in the same Strong communication, synthesis, and project management skills. Self-driven and proactive; able to confidently lead and sponsor workstreams or projects to enable the team to execute successfully.

description: WorkBoard  Work with purpose.  WorkBoard‚Äôs mission is to help companies and the people in them achieve their best results. We pioneered the Enterprise Results Management solution category so leaders can communicate strategy and align efforts well in a faster changing world, and so team members are energized by the purpose and impact of their work. Our customers drive faster growth and competitive advantage because they have higher alignment, real-time transparency, and sharper focus on the results that matter. Companies like Cisco, Microsoft, Juniper, Workday, 3M, Zuora, Anthem, Humana, and many others use WorkBoard‚Äôs platform, expert services, and professional certification programs to achieve their ambitious vision.  WorkBoard has built a clear lead in the space ‚Äì it is the size of all the other OKR app providers combined, in large part because its founders and team members are experienced company builders focused on true, differentiated value for our customers. WorkBoard is backed by top-tier venture investors including Andreessen Horowitz, GGV Capital, SoftBank Investment Advisers, and Workday Ventures.  THE OPPORTUNITY  As a Regional Sales Director, you‚Äôll be a key player in driving the adoption of WorkBoard within a defined geography targeting F2000 companies. You‚Äôll own building trusted growth advisor status with P&L owners who have strategic priorities and urgency to achieve them while positioning and driving preference for our platform.  You‚Äôll gain a deep understanding of WorkBoards‚Äô Sustainable Growth Model and how our platform supports P&L owners #1 goal of impacting company valuation by driving growth through alignment and accountability. You will be a key member of the Sales Team that will be achieving 3X+ yr/yr growth while solidifying the preeminent position in a new category; Enterprise Results Management.  Your work will also include collaborating with the leadership team to identify demand generation, messaging, sales enablement and sales execution best practices.  COMING IN  You‚Äôll Be Skilled And Super Effective At  Bring 7+ years of C-Suite business application value-based selling and start-up experience, an entrepreneur‚Äôs mindset, and a relevant degree from a great school. Experience working in a fast paced, high growth start-up is a plus as is an MBA from a great school. Articulating differentiated solution value to enterprise buyers and customers before, during and after they purchase your business application solution Quickly building trusted advisor status with P&L owners by demonstrating your business acumen, intellectual curiosity and passion for solving substantive business issues Consistently exceeding your sales targets by executing both land and expand sales motions in net new and existing customer engagements in an Account Executive or similar role for a SaaS business application company. Working at a fast pace while demonstrating professionalism and the attention to detail that is required to support sales engagements with enterprise P&L owners Partnering with peer teams across marketing, professional services, customer success, development and finance to build a company that is great in your customers‚Äô eyes WITHIN ONE MONTH YOU'LL Attend new-hire immersion training to build a deep understanding of our buyers, their pain points, our solution offering and how we work well as a team Attend the WorkBoard OKR Coach Certification program to gain a deep understanding of the OKR methodology and its relevance in the Enterprise Results Management category Review fifteen first meeting recordings and shadow five first meetings with sales leadership Internalize five customer case studies and be able to confidently use these in first meetings Be converting first meetings with P&L owners based on your ability to deliver WorkBoards‚Äô value messaging Be highly proficient at demonstrating the WorkBoard platform to P&L owners and business process owners to support our differentiation Develop a territory plan with the support of the Growth team to identify and execute targeted ABM into your top 20 Named Accounts WITHIN THREE MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a trusted advisor to P&L owners as they engage with WorkBoard to accelerate their growth strategies Have developed a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities >$1M ARR and you will have achieved your first quarter sales target Have attended WorkBoard Super User training to deepen your proficiency in the WorkBoard application Be tapping into your network to help bring fantastic talent to WorkBoard WITHIN SIX MONTHS YOU'LL Be recognized as a key member of the WorkBoard Team for the partnerships that you have established with our customers as they achieve their growth strategies Be contributing valuable insights and ideas to the WorkBoard Team on ways that we can accelerate and enhance value realization for our customers Be overachieving your sales target and managing a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities within your Named Accounts in excess of $3M ARR THE TEAM  You‚Äôll join one of the best category building sales organizations that is regularly meeting with P&L owners to impact their growth objectives. You have the support from exceptional Growth Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement and Thought Leadership Marketing teams that are accountable for providing qualified leads, sales content and category creation activities that are all aligned to ensure your success.  We are remarkably engaged with our customers, so you‚Äôll have immediate access to their insights and voices. Everyone on the team is striving to improve the value and quality of experience we provide customers by delivering at our best and being voracious learners. We are an incredibly supportive team, with powerhouse creative and production team members who quickly bring marketing ideas to life.  We are excited about a lot of things‚Äîwhat ‚Äúbest‚Äù looks like for our customers, what ‚Äúbreakthrough‚Äù looks like in our platform‚Äîand we share these passions across the company and with our customers.  OUR VALUES - WE LIVE BY THE 4 H‚ÄôS  Humble experts ~ Hungry for the opportunity ~ Intellectually honest ~ Operating as one happy team  a Few Of Our Awesome Benefits Flexible PTO & sick days Paid holidays Health insurance 401K with employer matching Quarterly All-Hands Meetings And much more! THE WORKBOARD STORY  WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates‚Äô contributions, then come join us!

description: Developers, Data Science, and Product teams trust People Data Labs to power their products, fuel predictive modeling, conduct analysis, drive revenue, and more. We work with highly technical teams as their engineering-focused data partner.  As our first dedicated channel hire, the Head of Partnerships will join our Revenue team with a keen focus on owning current partnership relationships while unlocking new strategic opportunities for PDL and our partners. This includes working with businesses in the early stage of strategy development with a focus on partnerships, developing and piloting new commercial models and partnership ecosystems, and expanding on existing strategic partnerships all in support of PDL priorities and strategies. Current partnerships include ADX (AWS Data Exchange), Snowflake, IBM, Dun & Bradstreet, and Demyst, among others.  The Opportunity: Be the first hire focused on helping to build our channel program. Help identify, evaluate and prioritize focus areas for the team to pursue. Help craft and execute thoughtful business and partnership strategies. Collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders across the company and with external partners as you develop and execute on partnership strategies. In particular, you will partner closely with your Product counterpart who will be a key resource in your go-to-market strategy and success.  What Success Looks Like: Focus on emerging company strategies and products related to expanding our B2B offerings. Develop frameworks and conduct analyses to evaluate and prioritize initiatives for the team to pursue. Develop and test hypotheses for business and partnership strategies. Work cross-functionally with Product Management, Sales, Legal, Marketing, and Finance teams. Refine strategies and execute initial partnerships, including exploring partnership models and conducting negotiation.  About You: A minimum of 5-7 years of experience in strategy consulting, channel partnerships, or a comparable role in high growth Tech companies. Experience working with hybrid delivery models including APIs and flat files. You‚Äôll be working with our product team to expand the ways our customers can tap into our data. Deep business development acumen, with a background in DaaS preferred. Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to influence stakeholders through your analysis and strategic vision. Comfortable with ambiguity, willing to roll up your sleeves and figure things out. Extremely well-organized, quick-learner, self-directed, highly energetic, professional, and flexible. Comfortable multi-tasking in a fast-paced team environment. Sense of humor. Your persistence is unparalleled. A creative, assertive problem-solver, you are curious, prepared, team-oriented and a self-starter. Ability to not only balance, but effectively manage competing priorities, and multiple projects/deals at the same time. Understand and articulate technical concepts and translate them into industry or business relevant terms with ease.  Yearly Salary: $180-200k OTE  Our Benefits Stock Competitive Salaries Unlimited paid time off Medical, dental, & vision insurance Health, fitness, and office stipends The permanent ability to work wherever and however you want  About Us:  Customers like IBM, PayPal, Home Depot, Stripe, Experian, Adidas, Chegg, eBay, Acxiom, Madison Logic, Zoho, Workable and many others trust People Data Labs to help them build amazing products and conduct deep analysis.  We are a deeply technical company backed by two top-tier engineering-focused VC firms: Founders Fund (Asana, Facebook, Flexport, Lyft, Palantir, SpaceX, Stripe, Twilio, Wish) and 8VC (Asana, Flexport, Oculus, OpenGov, PathAI, Wish).  No C2C, 1099, or Contract-to-Hire. Recruiters need not apply.  People Data Labs does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

description: Are you an experienced Sales Manager or Team Leader looking for more opportunity?  Maybe you are an experienced sales agent/team leader who knows their strengths are managing, nurturing, teaching or holding others accountable, rather than selling. Your management objective is to increase the performance of each member of our sales team, specifically increasing the deals closed from each salesperson‚Äôs database/center of influence. description: About The Role  As the Senior Regional Sales Manager (RSM), you will be responsible for prospecting and developing business within the assigned territory, establishing relationships with key decision-makers and driving the sales process from prospect through close. In this outside sales positions, you will be expected to speak to Brivo‚Äôs complete portfolio of solutions as well as components and systems supported through integration (such as Video Management Systems, Identity Access Management Systems, wireless locks).  In this role you will also be expected to: Manage assigned territory Work in tandem with Vertical Sales Teams, Inside Support and Field Support personnel to drive world class customer satisfaction and exceed sales quotas. Maintain good communication, both verbal and written, with inside and field resources to facilitate sales growth in Brivo‚Äôs independent and national dealer channels. Build understanding of the Brivo security platform, including supported devices and integrations and effectively demonstrate the capabilities to prospects. Prospect, onboard, cultivate and grow new dealers. Respond to customer requests for information in a timely manner. Provide system sales and product training for system integrators.  About You Live in a major market within the territory. Channel field sales experience (NOT business development, overlay or inside sales). Have a successful track record of prospecting, qualifying, onboarding and supporting new dealer opportunities. Minimum of five years sales experience preferably within the security industry, SaaS, software sales, or information security and two or more years‚Äô experience selling in a defined territory with an established current client base. Demonstrate self-confidence, energy and enthusiasm in a professional manner. Present ideas, expectations and information in a concise, well-organized way. Demonstrated ability to meet/exceed a sizeable quota. Proficiency with CRM tools (SFDC), Google Apps (Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.) and other business tools. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or extensive relevant experience in the security sales industry. Travel 60-70% within assigned territory and domestically (to HQ office, conferences, etc.)  About Us  Brivo is the global leader in mobile, cloud-based access control for commercial real estate, multifamily residential, and large distributed enterprises. Our comprehensive product ecosystem and open API provide businesses with powerful digital tools to increase security automation, elevate employee and tenant experience, and improve the safety of all people and assets in the built environment. Having created the category over twenty years ago, our building access platform is now the digital foundation for the largest collection of customer facilities in the world, trusted by more than 25 million users occupying over 300M square feet of secured space in 42 countries.  Our dedication to simply better security means providing the best technology and support to property owners, managers, and tenants as they look for more from buildings where they live, work, and play. Our comprehensive product suite includes access control, smart readers, touchless mobile credentials, visitor management, occupancy monitoring, health and safety features, and integrated video surveillance, smart locks, and intercoms. Valued for its simple installation, high-reliability backbone, and rich API partner network, Brivo also has the longest track record of cybersecurity audits and privacy protections in the industry.  Brivo is privately held and headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland. Learn more at  Brivo is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer  Powered by JazzHR  u6SnbPc4Tc

Sunstone is seeking a Director of Business Development to join our team. DSPolitical is hiring a Director of Business Development (BD) to further solidify DSPolitical as the leader in targeted advertising for Democratic and progressive digital campaigns by growing our presence in the market. Essential Attributes and Experience 5-7 years of experience in political technology and/or campaigns or media sales experience. Significant experience writing proposals, networking and sourcing new business, and pitching to current and potential clients.  Proven success reaching and exceeding sales goals. Client-focused attitude, with a collaborative problem-solving approach. Successful track record of new client outreach through cold calls and emails. Experience performing online demos and in-person pitches. Comfort and experience sourcing and following up on leads, and completing responses to RFPs. Ability to manage and maintain pre-existing relationships with a network of progressive allied organizations and Democratic media consultants. Ability to drive new revenue by developing relationships outside of DSPolitical‚Äôs current client base and strengthening existing client relationships. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism. Authorized to legally work in the United States.  Our ideal candidate may also have extensive experience in some or all of the following: Building a network of consultants and contacts in the Democratic and progressive, digital, and/or political market. Managing multiple projects on tight deadlines. Strong track record of creating and managing sales plans. Creative mind, goal-oriented mindset with demonstrated results.. Ability to thrive in an environment where structure and flexibility combine to meet clients‚Äô needs. Proficiency with project management tools, such as Asana. Bachelor's degree from an accredited university.  DSPolitical is proud to offer: Base salary that commensurates with experience with an opportunity for limitless earning potential via commissions.  Open leave (paid time off) 100% employer-paid health insurance for employees (including dental and vision) Flex Spending Plan Employee Assistance Program 401K with company matching Student Loan Repayment Program Professional development opportunities Rewards and recognition programs Mobile Phone reimbursement and much more  Office Hours Work hours are consistently 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., with the expectation that evening and weekend work will be required as necessary and travel may be required up to 75%. Weekend work and travel typically occur in conjunction with the election cycle. Due to COVID-19, this position is temporarily remote for the 2021 year.   DSPolitical works hard to provide our clients with innovative solutions based on the diverse perspectives of our team. description: Regional Sales Director, PathAI Diagnostics  PathAI's mission is to improve patient outcomes with AI-powered pathology. Our platform promises substantial improvements to the accuracy of diagnosis and the efficacy of treatment of diseases like cancer, leveraging modern approaches in machine learning. Rigorous science and careful analysis are critical to the success of everything we aspire to do. Our team, comprised of diverse employees with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, is passionate about solving challenging problems and making a huge impact  As a Regional Sales Director you will report to the Vice President of Sales. You‚Äôll cover a specific territory generating and closing new accounts and managing an existing client base for PathAI Diagnostics. You‚Äôll be traveling to client sites and focusing on building relationships with a focus on meeting with physicians, providers and decision makers within the practice to discuss quality, service, and new products and services.  What You‚Äôll Do Drive sales by providing unparalleled service to our prospects and clients. Exceed sales goals for new & base business ‚Äì must be able to show documented sales success (Past President's Club winners, etc.) and is committed to over achievement, must have a "never quit" attitude to exceed all targets despite any adversity that may be faced. Generate new business through prospecting, consultative selling, presentations, networking, and referrals. Manage and grow an existing book of business through on-going customer service, client visits and problem solving. Meet with physicians, providers and decision makers within the practice to discuss quality, service, and new products and services. Challenge decision makers to think differently ‚Äì disrupting status quo with new product launches. Prepare sales forecasts via CRM for territory and manage all sales expenses, logistical costs, and service levels to maximize profitability. Operate in compliance with all regulatory requirements and company policies. What You‚Äôll Need A Bachelor‚Äôs degree 3-5 years of experience in B2B or medical sales experience Outstanding work ethic. Notable interpersonal skills along with great written and verbal communication. Excitement to problem solve and network with clients Excellent organizational and follow up skills. Passion and enthusiasm for driving sales and providing unparalleled service to our prospects and clients. Benefits  For the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. We have a strong benefits package, including heavily-subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you in peak shape. It's rounded out by: Healthcare, vision, and dental healthcare plans, with add-ons for life and disability insurance 401(k) retirement plan Three weeks of PTO per year, plus six paid holidays Uncapped Commissions ‚Äì top reps making over $200k $600/mo. car allowance + mileage reimbursement Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll enjoy spending the day with.  PathAI is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications ‚Äî that's all. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, health, personal beliefs, age, family or parental status, or any other status. description: The ED is responsible for leading sales and achieving profitability targets nationally for salons throughout the US. This will be done by executing with excellence the Go to Market Strategy and Action Plans for the salons, driving the team overseeing the development and maintenance of strategic partnerships with salons, the execution of seasonal brand plans/promotional calendars and events that will drive enthusiasm and engagement with the consumer. The ED will ensure the teams are focused on consumer facing activities and growing market share for Aveda. Collaborates with Marketing to create field action plans to differentiate brand in region amongst competitors. Maintains a consumer -centric service focus amongst all salons in the region. Understand competitive offers and strategies to elevate the consumer experience. Lead the implementation of Consumer Engagement strategies to drive clients to salons and maximize client loyalty through service experiences. Ensure appropriate utilization of COEs by teams to better support and enable focus on consumer by teams. Develop Staff 30% of time. Provides direction to Directors ensuring corporate objectives are communicated and met. Leads by example and creates a culture of accountability. Role models and teaches the ability to influence others, be resilient, build great relationships and close the sale. Leverages sales methodology, coaching tools, etc to coach and develop the team Leads staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, developing and appraising performance. Partners with Human Resources. Develop the talent and capabilities through accompanying salon visits, regular management meetings and one-on-ones to help others strive for excellence and reach their highest level of contribution. Actively seeks feedback from stakeholders (e.g. salon owners) and prioritize the need to identify and develop the capabilities within the team. Champion of brand field culture and protection of brand equity at the point of sale. Constant elevation of the execution and skills of the Field team. Aid in the education of salons on leveraging digital/ social network tools to extend reach, improve pace and increase relevance Partner with North America education teams to develop and host relevant brand, product, and skills seminars. Qualifications Strong sales leadership experience with proven results in driving sales growth and profitability. Able to lead, inspire and motivate a large, geographically dispersed sales team and establish a clear sales vision build top talent for competitive advantage. Deep understanding and appreciation for brand equity and relevance -maintaining brand pride and quality in all interactions. Understanding of brand products and the attributes that drive consumer purchasing behavior. Strong communication skills to represent the voice of the Field and capture consumer and field learnings to communicate to relevant stakeholders. Strong understand of the salon industry, and the landscape of the business. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in France (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within French merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, French language will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. description: Ideal candidates will have 7-10+ experience selling digital health / benefits solutions to the employer segment or selling SaaS to HR / C-Suite.  HealthKick is a NYC-based digital health company that empowers employers to seamlessly deliver comprehensive wellness benefits to meet the diverse needs of a global population. HealthKick‚Äôs platform provides personalized wellbeing solutions for employees‚Äô unique needs through an ecosystem of over 500 leading consumer health and wellness brands, encompassing physical, mental, emotional and financial wellbeing, so employees can build and maintain healthy routines that fit their lifestyles. HealthKick's turn-key platform of comprehensive consumer wellness services and programming, stipend/incentive administration and robust communications, help employers achieve consistently high employee engagement, and provides employees with wellness benefits tailored to their individual needs that they not only use, but love.  HealthKick is looking for an experienced sales executive to lead HealthKick‚Äôs wellbeing sales process in all stages from qualification to close. This role would be responsible for generating new business opportunities (individual contributor), focused on the enterprise segment and driving revenue creation. You are a sales professional with demonstrated experience closing complex business deals, consistently meeting and exceeding goals. You will work with prospects to not simply buy HealthKick offerings, but also to build business partnerships that enhance the growth of HealthKick‚Äôs business. The candidate must be a strong leader, extremely well organized, creative, results-oriented, quality minded and help champion HealthKick‚Äôs product portfolio in the marketplace. This is a great opportunity to be at the forefront of a fast-growing company where your responsibilities will increase exponentially with your ability. The role will report to our Chief Revenue Officer.  As a Sales Director at HealthKick, you will: Own a sales strategy and process that results in landing and retaining new clients Manage groups through the sales process - qualification to close Develop and maintain a network of relationships with key stakeholders in healthcare: brokers, benefits admin. platforms, exchanges, etc. Present and deliver HealthKick‚Äôs value proposition virtually and in person Highly motivated, self-starting, and results-oriented  We‚Äôre looking for you to bring: Successful track record and 100%+ quota attainment for past 3+ years Minimum of 5-7+ years experience in digital wellness sales, ideally selling to HR/Benefits Experience leading sales with large contract values Ability to adapt presentations on-the-go to cater to different settings Experience in Salesforce and Salesloft/Outreach.io  Helpful experiences and backgrounds: A network of relationships with key stakeholders in healthcare: brokers, benefits administrators, platforms, exchanges, etc. Passion for documenting and contributing new ideas and feedback from market to product Experience working cross-functionally in a small start-up environment  Benefits & Perks: HealthKick seeks to empower all of our team members to fulfill our wellbeing mission. That‚Äôs why we invest in our employees, who are our most important asset in achieving our mission. To that end, we offer: Choice of great medical, dental, and vision insurance plan options with employer subsidy Annual wellness stipend to use toward health, fitness & wellness brands of choice Flexible location / remote work setup or NYC HQ

description: Highgate is a leading real estate investment and hospitality management company widely recognized as an innovator in the industry. Highgate is the dominant player in major U.S. gateway cities including New York, Boston, Miami, San Francisco and Honolulu, with a growing Caribbean and Latin America footprint. The hospitality forward company provides expert guidance through all stages of the property cycle, from planning and development through recapitalization or disposition. Highgate has a proven record of developing its diverse portfolio of bespoke lifestyle hotel brands, legacy brands, and independent hotels and resorts with contemporary programming and digital acumen. The company utilizes industry-leading revenue management tools that efficiently identify and predict evolving market dynamics to drive outperformance and maximize asset value. With an executive team consisting of some of the most experienced hotel management leaders, the company is a trusted partner for top ownership groups and major hotel brands. Highgate maintains corporate offices in New York, Chicago, Dallas, London, Miami, and Seattle. www.highgate.com.  The Director of Sales is primarily responsible for leading & driving top line revenue strategy for traditional sales related segments to include group, volume transient & catering. The individual is additionally responsible for staying ahead of market trends, market share movement and ongoing competitive hotel analysis, while directing the property sales teams (rooms & catering) to insure budgeted revenues are met or exceeded. The Director of Sales & Marketing is also responsible for developing and implementing a marketing communications plan designed to achieve the desired positioning for the hotel, as well as managing the sales and marketing budget that supports revenue attainment. Responsible for leading & driving top line revenue for traditional sales segments to include group, volume transient & catering. Assesses & reacts to market trends, market share & the competitive hotel environment. Develops and implements a marketing communications plan designed to achieve the desired positioning of the hotel, as well as manage the sales & marketing budget that supports all initiatives. Act as the hotel‚Äôs voice of the customer and communicate key issues/concerns at all levels of the organization. Fluent in reading/assimilating/using Smith Travel Research data, financial P&L, mix of sales, forecasting, group pace/position & a wide array of traditional hotel reporting. Ability to understand and communicate market trends, demand generators, supply/demand and economic factors affecting hotel performance. Conduct comprehensive competitive set reviews, SWOT analysis & keep tabs on new supply. Understand GEO source & ability to develop a plan to penetrate the primary markets. Develop/implement key segment strategy & managing key accounts (both existing & target). Design effective sales deployment schemes & market assignments. Develop sales goals designed to achieve budget & market share targets. Manage group pace measurement and set sales production goals. Manage sales activity & travel schedule. Marriott Experience preferred. At least 3 years‚Äô experience as a sales leader, with prior hotel sales experience. Experience dealing with/communicating with ownership groups and asset management. Proficient in managing/using sales automation (STS) & PMS systems. Experience working collaboratively with revenue management. Well rounded knowledge of all market segments and channel sources, as well as ability to develop a strategic plan for each. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment. Ability to direct, lead, train, motivate & drive a direct sales team; and develop a cooperative & competitive team spirit & winning attitude. Must be proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel, and Power Point. Must be able to multitask and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines For California Applicants Only  Highgate Hotels, L.P. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and maintains the policy of recruiting and retaining the best-qualified personnel who demonstrate the ability to perform competently and work well with others. description: Position Description  The North American (NA) Sales Director is responsible for driving the overall regional sales growth and profitability. Key responsibilities include leading, developing and managing functions of NA sales team, Inside sales team, Application Engineering Team, Internal operations, and service within the North American Region to achieve revenue targets, growth strategy, maximize profits, increase market share, and maintain customer loyalty in the local market. The Regional Sales Director is also responsible for maintaining a positive work environment for our employees and adherence to all company and legal policies. Cross global communications with other Regional sales directors in other parts of the world is also a critical element to this position. This position can be based out of the Ingersoll Rand Thomas‚Äô Sheboygan facility but will be primarily homebased.  Responsibilities Achieves or exceeds annual financial targets including revenue, bookings, profitability, and market share. Uses data analysis to strategize risk, growth opportunity, market focus, customer segmentation, potential acquisitions, and competitive targets. Cultivates relationships with customers to foster a collaborative climate yielding the highest levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty. Ownership of the NA region and market strategy within the region. Able to recognize where growth, resources are needed and build an effective business case to support the growth strategy. Prepares and presents results and reports to senior management, including forecasts, market conditions, strategic selling strategies, and competitive landscape. Actively seeks opportunities to increase external awareness. Participates in specific sales initiatives and major account activities as needed, but always maintaining touch with customer base. Drive the philosophy of ‚ÄúStrategic Account Management‚Äù excellence throughout the region and mentor/train the commercial team in this regard. Interact and work closely with the Marketing organization to support various campaigns, webinars and other lead generation activities. Effectively coach, counsel, train and develop all team members within the NA region and enable them to provide the same for their teams where applicable. To communicate clear expectations and drive continuous improvement through company performance management and personal development processes. To show strong engagement results and improvement over time with the teams the role is responsible for. Responsible for environmental, health and safety compliance. Support measurement and control systems to monitor and improve safety performance. Ensure a culture of safety that is acknowledged by all employees to maintain a safe and productive work environment for both shop and office areas.  Critical Competencies / Skills/ Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required - Engineering, Technical, Marketing or Business; MBA preferred. Proven experience in our industry with strong strategic and sales management methodologies is acceptable in lieu of a degree. A strategic customer/business mindset is important. Long term views and plans are required for success. Business analytical skills are needed to determine which priorities have the greatest ROI for the business. Requires ability to understand markets, customers and ongoing trends affecting the business. Profit & Loss experience is critical. Individual must have had 10 years (minimum prior experience) in managing field sales teams and office staff, processes, and budgets. Consultative selling experience in an OEM/component environment is critical. The ability to develop and sustain customer relationships must be demonstrated. Strong organizational, interpersonal, and leadership skills are critical. Individual must be able to manage effectively with both leadership levels above the position and individual contributors actively doing the work, and be able to relate to all in an equally effective manner. PC proficiency in MS Office and proven ability to utilize other applications such as SalesForce CRM, AX or similar ERP, etc. Travel 30-40%  Ingersoll Rand is committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request and a member of our team will contact you.

Summary: UCEazy is a national virtual academy headquartered in Cupertino, CA. Our mission is to simplify the high school journey and college admissions for students whose parents were educated outside the U.S.   To support our rapid growth, we are looking for someone that can lead our entire Enrollment team while also driving sales directly as an individual contributor.   This person will report to our CEO with a dotted line reporting to our VP of Programs. You will own UCEazy‚Äôs sales and enrollment growth, team and processes.   This is a tremendous opportunity for someone with leadership aspirations, looking to make a positive impact and earn a six-figure salary. This is a full time position but would require some work on weekday evenings and weekends. Base pay and commissions. Stock options will be offered to high potential candidates. 100% remote (work-from-home) opportunity as long as you live in the Pacific time zone.  Responsibilities: This role has dual responsibilities - as the team lead as well as an individual contributor. As UCEazy grows, this role could evolve into just a leadership role.  Team Leadership: Responsible for overseeing Enrollment and Sales team to drive overall student enrollment and sales targets Analyze sales and market trends. Share these trends with UCEazy leadership team Responsible for hiring, training  and mentoring Enrollment Specialists  Cultivate a positive experience for our Enrollment team and clients Drive the development of effective sales materials    Direct Sales:   Meet virtually with prospects (parents and students). No cold calling required. You will be provided warm leads.  Use consultative sales techniques to help families select the right program for their needs. We are not looking for overly aggressive sales people.  Provide personalized follow up to parents  Our Ideal Candidate:  Has 8+ years of sales experience and at least 2-3 years experience as leader of a sales team  Ability to lead a team in a fast paced environment  Has experience in the education industry and understands the college admissions landscape Understands the nuances of selling to immigrant parents. Typically, our clients are highly educated, upper middle class or affluent and speak English fluently. Highly organized and detail oriented with a strong focus on maintaining high quality, up to date data and notes on all interactions. We use Zoho CRM.  Strong verbal and writing communication skills, with the ability to liaise between internal and external team Highly motivated  Highly collaborative and thrives in a 100% virtual environment  Send resume to recruitment@uceazy.com

Why work at TRAFFIX?  You Must Work At TRAFFIX To Enjoy Our Culture of Respect, Expertise, Collaboration and Entrepreneurship Get involved with our Book Club, join one of our Steering Committees, or sign up for one of our employee events such as Game Night, Cooking Classes, and more! Work with a team that Supports and Respects each other at a company where Diversity & Inclusion is a Celebrated! Flexible work environment that will allow you to work remotely part of the time! If you have ideas that you wish someone would listen to - tell us! We love the Entrepreneurial spirit, and we strive for Continuous Improvement! Get involved with your community through our partnership with Big Brothers Big Sisters Enjoy Self Improvement opportunities through our Learning Management System and TRAFFIX Academy; or take advantage of our Tuition Reimbursement Program And of course - get paid fairly for your Experience with included Benefits! Sound good? Keep reading and APPLY TODAY!  What is a Director of Sales?  As Director of Sales at TRAFFIX Chicago you will play a vital role in the achievement of branch targets. Using the player/coach leadership model, you will assess each salesperson‚Äôs strengths and areas for improvement to design a strategy that sets them up for success. You will be the motivating force that drives your team to win.  What does a day in the life of a Director of Sales look like?  A day in the life of a TRAFFIX Director of Sales could include some or all of the following: Building and maintaining customer relationships Identifying further business opportunities to expand TRAFFIX business with the branch‚Äôs clients Monitoring trends and changes in customer purchase behaviour and following up to determine the root cause Proactively identifying potential problems and resolving them before they escalate Accompanying members of the sales team on discovery calls and in-person meetings Assist your team with generating pricing strategies that fit the client‚Äôs budget while supporting the success of the branch Monitor trends in the sales team‚Äôs performance Recruit and onboard new sales staff as needed while always keeping your pipeline of top talent warm Develop and promote monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets for each member of the sales team Using TRAFFIX business intelligence software, you will generate reports, develop sales strategies and targets to present to the Branch Director(s) Who are you?  After at least five years working in a Director of Sales role, you have become an expert multi-tasker, active listener, and excellent communicator with a friendly and confident personality. You love getting to know people and building lasting relationships. You display empathy when dealing with client challenges and use emotional intelligence to guide your interactions.  You are a compassionate leader that trusts your team to work hard without being micromanaged; however, you are ready to step in when one of your reports is struggling.  Strategy is your passion! You love the challenge of getting to know the players on your team and leveraging their strengths to win! Collaborating with your sales reps, you devise plans that knock down obstacles, win RFPs, and close business.  When a problem comes your way ‚Äì you face it head on. You look for creative ways to solve the problem and understand that mistakes should be considered opportunities to learn and grow.  You love sales! Hunting for new business and delighting customers is your team‚Äôs top priority and you will go above and beyond to support them in those efforts.  Does all this sound good?  APPLY TODAY to start your new career with TRAFFIX! Set up roots with a team you can depend on and have fun working with!  www.traffix.com/careers  This is a full time position
