description: Position Summary  For more than 40 years, the name Samsung has been at the forefront of innovation. Samsung's discoveries, inventions, and breakthrough products have helped shape the history of digital evolution. Today, Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. is a global leader in technology, opening new possibilities for people everywhere. Guided by a simple philosophy ‚ÄúInspire the World, Create the Future‚Äù Samsung is committed to developing new technologies and innovative products that enhance the lives of its customers, employees, and the global community.Samsung Electronics America is the largest subsidiary of the Samsung Group, amounting to 70 percent of the group's revenue and reigning as the world's largest technology company with more than $200 billion in revenue. Globally the company has a presence in 80 countries and employs more than 270,000 people. Samsung is the world‚Äôs leading provider of mobile phones, smartphones, and tablet computers‚Äîfueled primarily by the popularity of the Samsung Galaxy line of devices.Samsung Electronics USA is a $40 billion dollar business with a vast portfolio of superior quality mobile and electronics products. The business also plays a leadership role globally for creating the best new and next-generation products and platforms. Samsung‚Äôs vision is to reach and engage the consumer through revolutionary retail stores and experience centers.  Role and Responsibilities    Sr. Director Enterprise Sales is responsible for development and implementation of sales strategies aligned to targeted enterprise vertical markets and customers.  You will lead a large and skilled group of Sales Directors and Senior Sales Executives providing c-suite engagement and relationship development, customer account management and end client support across a broad commercial mobile product portfolio in the U.S. market.  In this role you will represent Samsung at the executive level to industry representatives and end customer executive management as well as direct the development and ongoing business operations for the sales team.  You will create and lead the execution of key business strategies and direct sales team on a determined path to increase market share within the United States across industries and verticals to ensure profitable results for the company.  This role requires a high degree of responsibility for human and financial resources will be required to provide recommendations to optimize returns on resource investments.  This candidate will provide leadership to maximize individual employee and team performance, position the team for growth, and significantly scale the business.  Key responsibilities include:  Providing overall direction of Samsung‚Äôs mobile enterprise sales strategies and is responsible for sales and profitability growth of Samsung Mobile B2B organization‚Äôs Enterprise Sales business. Develop strategies for key verticals including Healthcare, S/W & Services, Transportation & Logistics, Manufacturing, Retail, etc. Developing, directing, and negotiating end customer sales agreements at the corporate level on behalf of Samsung. As part Mobile B2B division‚Äôs executive leadership team, working collaboratively with fellow leaders of B2B Carrier Sales, Product and Category Management, Product Marketing, Strategy and Operations, and Headquarters (Korea) teams to drive results. Ability to lead an existing team of Sales Directors and Senior Sales Managers as well as develop and implement strategies for vertical / horizontal market expansion, organizational team build up and new market creation to drive aggressive business growth targets. Conducting corporate client business meetings with customer leadership to pursue new profitable business opportunities and develop new addressable markets. Providing ongoing communications and negotiations with existing customers to ensure satisfactory performance while identifying customer needs, resolving issues, and developing new business opportunities.  Representing Samsung as a senior sales leader at industry venues and events.  Identifying and developing new business opportunities and business relationships directly with enterprise companies resulting in achievement of increased revenue and profitability. Identifying and directing the most effective application of Samsung end user sales activities in cooperation with available resources. Developing and retaining a high quality workforce. Directing the preparation of reports and management analysis, making presentations to market, establishing business plans, and reporting on the performance of the assigned business division against plan.  Skills and Qualifications    The successful candidate will have the following experience:  Proven track record of success selling complex mobile enterprise hardware and services solutions across a range of verticals, industries, lines of business. The ability to see and clearly communicate the revenue game plan across all functions An innate ability to commit to short-term results while forecasting future revenue, and able to be held accountable for both short-term success and longer-term strategy 15+ years of sales and leadership experience; extensive B2B experience, specifically in mobile device software/services and solutions, healthcare industry, public sector, and specifically enterprise PC or Tablets  products preferred. Success record at leading cross functional customer business teams Engineering background and/or deep expertise with strong technical foundation is considered a plus  Ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, as well as managerial and critical problem solving skills. They will be market savvy and comfortable in a multi-tasking environment. Other characteristics include:  Strong collaborator who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment A bold, charismatic leader who is not afraid to be the disruptive force behind new and innovative industry movement Unquestioned integrity and personal values Strategic thinker, imagination, creativity and foresight to con¬≠ceptual¬≠ize innovative approaches to exiting pro¬≠ducts, new prod¬≠ucts, and new marketing oppor¬≠tunities as well as the im¬≠plementa¬≠tion skills to bring them to fruition Results-oriented; capable of significantly increasing business unit perfor¬≠ma¬≠nce, as well as formulating and imple¬≠menting strategic business decisions People-oriented, hardworking, intelligent, profes¬≠sion¬≠ally aggressive, with a strong work ethic and stami¬≠na; high energy and action orientation with the ability to make things happen Credibility and leadership; capable of generating a high degree of respect and trust rapidly from the organization¬≠, as well as from customers, and corporate staff, a strong team player, mentor and coach Ability to recognize talent, to evaluate the ability of personnel and to attract and hold capable and talented people A ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude which responds positively to new business ideas and challenges rather than finding reasons why something cannot be done An intense desire/drive to ‚Äúwin‚Äù High energy and a passion to be part of creating something new The ability to listen to the customer and articulate the customer‚Äôs needs internally Undergraduate or Graduate technical degree (BSEE, BSME, etc.) is preferred; Plus relevant (MBA) post-graduate degree is highly desired       * Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here .    * Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and  provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. description: This position is responsible for the ground-up development and nurturing of key Client relationships within the commercial fitness industry, including health clubs, boutique studios, and anywhere functional training solutions may be needed.  Client Details  We amplify functional training spaces for health clubs, boutique studios, and fitness amenities alike. Our mission is to design safe, and supremely functional spaces supporting our clients delivery of inspirational exercise experiences.  We balance exercise trend and technology to create user engagement in every gym we design. Our team of Functional Design Specialists are passionate about creating spaces for exercise that will keep every workout fresh.  Our creative process establishes efficiency and purpose for every project. We incorporate leading architectural and interior design principles with the latest in exercise trend and equipment solution.  Description  Identify prospective clients from a variety of sources (known key accounts, trade shows, marketing, referrals and beyond) and achieve targeted sales goals. Schedule meetings with, and present to, leading health club and studio chains- you will primarily target clients seeking to create dedicated space(s) for movement-based programming and the equipment solutions that facilitate them. Provide facility design expertise around our unique dynamic training solutions and the equipment required to power them. Prepare and presents proposals to prospective and repeat clients (including equipment recommendations, space plans, installation guidance, and payment options). Attend designated trade shows, cultivate relationships, and represents the energy of the brand always. Profile  Customer Focus, Managing & Measuring Work, Problem Solving, Drive for Results, Action Oriented, Process Management, Planning, Listening, Conflict Management, Timely Decision Making.  Job Offer  Seeking well-qualified sales and project management professionals ready to join our rapidly growing team as a Regional Sales Director.  Collaborative, innovative, visionary leadership Full Benefits package (Medical, FSA, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance) 401(K) Plan A PTO policy that ensures you can find a happy work-to-life balance Access to cutting-edge functional fitness equipment Flexible Work-from-Home and Remote Positions available Headquarters located in sunny Santa Monica, CA Desired Skills and Experience  -Business Development and Relationship Management. -Effective interpersonal, negotiating and conflict management skills required. -Ability to articulate complex business solutions to clients through presentations and proposals -Ability to manage multiple projects, work under pressure, and adapt to sudden changes in the work environment is essential. -Demonstrates strong organization, planning, communication, diplomacy and presentation ability. -Minimum (8) years successful national or key account sales experience within the fitness industry. -Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal -Ability to organize well during multi-faceted projects -Proficiency in Microsoft for Windows Applications -College degree with a concentration in business or exercise science and/or compelling equivalent fitness industry work experience required

description: About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones. Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface ‚Äì made by innovators for innovators ‚Äì is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers in Israel (responsible for the whole region), to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals.  Job Responsibilities Represent Unlimint serving as a brand ambassador, with a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings. Qualify, develop, and maintain thorough company and product knowledge, research consumer needs, and identify how our solutions can meet them Maximise the sales performance by establishing strong relationships and gaining insight into the needs and lifestyle of the client Generate leads and commit to excellent customer service throughout the whole sales cycle Adjust sales techniques based on interactions and results in the field and provide valuable feedback to Unlimint Perform incisive and insightful market and competitive research based on Unlimint‚Äôs global expansion plans Collaboration: Work with individuals and teams across Unlimint to ensure the best possible merchant experience and to develop yourself and your colleagues professionally Commercial Growth: By focusing on meeting merchant needs and strategic targets and KPIs for personal growth and development. Meeting sales projections, generate ongoing sales opportunities, and achieve company and individual KPI goals Your Experience And Mindset Hunter, not a farmer, the success will depend on you Commercially driven individual with a goal-oriented attitude and excellent negotiations skills Proven track record of performance Relevant business network within Israeli merchants Minimum 4+ years of experience in sales or financial services (specifically payments) role Experience in the payments industry Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Hebrew language will be an advantage + other languages Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships at all levels of management, both inside and outside of Unlimint Driven by the results and capacity for innovation in the payments space, and passionate in your willingness to create value Experienced in B2B environment from either payment service provider/acquirer (or similar complex enterprise software) or merchant side A self-standing associate with the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision We Offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Remote work A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

description: THE ROLE The Sales Director is a sales hunting machine, with a focus on building and nurturing successful new relationships with large commercial, institutional, and industrial customers. Our product is proven and tested and we are moving from startup stage to significant (and rapid) growth stage. We‚Äôre looking for an evangelical, process-oriented salesperson who believes in our mission. If you love to sell, if your track record of success gives you confidence in your ability to close profitable deals with large commercial and industrial customers, and if you want your work to make a difference in the energy industry, we‚Äôd love you to join our world-class team.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Deliver against a quota Prospect, present proposals, negotiate, and close business Report on all sales activities through Voltus‚Äôs CRM systems Continually make us a better company

LV Tech is focused on helping the hotel and assisted living industries to reduce the maintenance costs of the low voltage equipment in their facilities. We specialize in a wide range of technology maintenance services including door lock, phone system, interior and exterior surveillance systems, call accounting services, and music systems. Our team of technicians currently operates throughout the United States.  We are looking for a talented individual who will be responsible for expanding community relations and opening the door with new strategic partners. Your job duties are to work closely with the VP of Sales and Marketing to define strategies and then connect with external groups to expand on these company visions. Qualifications for the position include years of career experience, existing contact networks with business partners, and superlative interpersonal skills.  As Director of Strategic Partnerships, you MUST be skilled at managing strategic-level partnerships, driving mutual growth and negotiating win-win arrangements. We are looking for a 'people person' with strong business acumen who is analytical with the ability to connect dots in the bigger picture. You will need to be persuasive, manage interpersonal relationships effectively for the long-term, and be able to execute at the tactical level day-to-day.  We are searching for a proactive and passionate leader with exceptional account management skills to join our team with responsibility to develop preferred relationships with strategic partners in the Hospitality vertical.  The successful candidate will open the door to and deepen partnership engagements, helping to differentiate LV Tech as a premier partner. Working directly with senior executives and leaders across the business, this individual will define and grow long-lasting, mutually beneficial opportunities, creating a book of business for LV Tech which optimally balances the goals of our partners with LV Tech‚Äôs business strategy and performance objectives creating mutual value for both.  To succeed in this position, candidates should have exceptional communication and analytical skills.  The role requires resourcefulness, adaptability, and a high degree of organization, with the ability to build rapport with our partners at the most senior levels.  Responsibilities Interacting with groups and 'large owner' partners to understand their goals and explain the value delivered by the LV Tech SMA Building relationships based on trust, honesty, transparency and mutual advantage Developing a deep understanding of partner‚Äôs strategic goals and of the ecosystem of partner organization's supplier base to gain access and become a main supplier Negotiating with partners and advocating for LV Tech  Collaborating with internal departments to fulfil partner needs, building relationships and creating leverage Maintaining an up-to-date knowledge of LV Tech services in order to demonstrate value of the Company to potential partner organizations Identifying industry and competitive trends and developing new relationships (and offerings based on trends) aligned to LV Tech's strategic direction Requirements 5+ years‚Äô experience in strategic partnership management, account management, channel sales management, product management, business development or equivalent role Excellent active listening and interpersonal skills, and exceptional verbal and written communication skills Ability to develop relationships, ingest and present complex information, handle detail, influence decisions and drive outcomes with individuals at all levels of the organization Adaptability and strong problem-solving skills High levels of organizational ability Ability to build rapport and collaborate with colleagues and across the partner organizations Ability to travel (Trade Shows, Conferences, etc...)- including overnight domestic or international trips The Director of Strategic Partnerships position is a salaried +++ position, based on experience and ability. Professional References REQUIRED. Please send all inquiries to Bruce@LVTechnow.com.

REPORTS TO: President & CEO  LOCATION: 1920 Race Street, Cincinnati, OH 45202  About Rookwood Pottery  The Rookwood Pottery Company is located in the bustling Over-the-Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati, Ohio‚Äîand it has been for decades. Pioneering artist Maria Longworth-Nichols founded our studio in the Queen City over 130 years ago, building the business and laying the foundation for what Rookwood is today: a world-renowned artisanal ceramics company, operating in the heart of the Ohio River Valley.  From New York‚Äôs Grand Central Station to The Louvre in Paris, contemporary boutique hotels to historic homes, Rookwood has truly made its mark on the world in the past three centuries. And now, it‚Äôs embarking on the next chapter.  Today, Rookwood continues to build upon its rich heritage, creating the highest-quality pottery and architectural tile in the United States. With a team of just over 70 employees, we‚Äôre deeply committed to our mission: cultivating artistic inspiration, giving back to the community, and balancing our rich legacy with forward-thinking momentum‚Äîideas that are central to the Rookwood brand. We take pride in our process, our people and our product, ultimately creating premier pieces with a story‚Äîand a one-of-a-kind luxury experience that can only be Rookwood.  Position Overview  As an integral part of our plan for growth, Rookwood Pottery is seeking a Director of Sales to help lead our scaling company and, specifically, expedite the build and launch of a world-class sales team. The right candidate must come with superior experience in the tile industry and an aggressive appetite for expansion and ownership. This position will encompass all elements of sales‚Äîfrom managing and generating demand and leading the art of selling to building the sales department ‚Äúyour way.‚Äù We are looking for an action-oriented individual who wants to own and dominate this position with the goal of eclipsing the competition, all the while cultivating a renowned customer experience.  With three retail stores selling our home goods and a factory capable of producing hundreds of thousands of square feet of tile, our growth will be expanding year-over-year. In fact, we‚Äôve already seen the results and we‚Äôre hungry for more: in the last three years, our home goods space has expanded by 50%, and our tile industry is being outfitted to scale even faster. Moving forward, our focus is 70% architectural tile and 30% ceramic wares‚Äîa strategy in alignment with the growth forecast we see in the American tile space.  Responsibilities Leading sales efforts, including setting and contributing to goals for the existing team. Establishing and scaling a sales force throughout the United States. Managing, growing and developing our sales team, while recruiting likeminded individuals. Working closely with our Marketing Team to develop targeted sales campaigns. Reviewing, modifying and creating sales training and onboarding programs. Driving the sales conversations by actively selling and demonstrating a strong example for fellow team members to emulate. Implementing best practices as it relates to sales, follow-up, outreach and closing. Working closely with Production and Finance to discuss capacity planning, pricing, product and sales opportunities. Overseeing CRM utilization, training and management‚Äîmust be obsessed with data and tracking. Conveying commitment to grow our business and become the leading brand in tile across all sales channels, including but not limited to commercial, residential, trade, architects and designers. Representing the Rookwood brand and values at all times‚Äîboth internally and externally‚Äîto ensure that we go above and beyond for our customers, our products and our people. Minimum Requirements Past sales leadership experience for another product or architectural brand with a minimum of 5 -10 years of experience. Hunger and capacity to build your own clients while supporting your team‚Äôs growth. Analytical prowess and the proven ability to ‚Äúmeasure what matters.‚Äù Flexibility and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, changing environment. Proven aptitude in new business acquisition and CRM, and the intuition to continuously nurture your network. Knowledge of stone, ceramics, architectural tile and related industries. Self-starter attitude that doesn‚Äôt need hand-holding. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong organizational skills with a keen attention to detail. Background in design is a plus. Understanding that Rookwood is a drug-free workplace. Please note you must successfully pass a pre-employment background check and drug screen to be considered for this position.  Benefits offered Include: 401k, PTO, medical, dental, vision, life Insurance, LTD, STD, AD and D.

description: Why your work at Quantgene matters  Quantgene combines biotechnology, AI and cloud to build the future of medicine. Our mission is to extend our members‚Äô lifespan by a decade within a decade through cutting edge genomics, data science and medical process innovation. Our core products are deep genomics liquid biopsy that detects the deadliest cancers at early stages in the blood as well as a uniquely powerful clinical-grade Whole Exome Sequencing solution. Last year, we also applied our cloud and AI expertise to deliver one of the most reliable same-day RT PCR COVID testing platforms that powers solutions for the movie industry, enterprise clients, and Walk-In COVID testing sites in cities all across the country today. jobTitle: Director of Sales & Operations - Upstate SC
description: Are you a multi-unit retail leader with exceptional coaching skills? Looking to join a growing nationwide retailer with exciting future growth plans? The Director of Sales & Operations is a multi-state field leadership position, located in South Carolina, that will manage a multi-store territory of both Corporate and Franchise stores throughout South Carolina. Batteries Plus has been acknowledged as an "essential business" and we have remained open to provide our customers with essential products during the current pandemic  Through weekly in-store and in-person visits throughout the assigned district / territory with both franchise-owned stores and corporate-owned stores, the Director of Sales & Operations drives best practices in retail sales and operations, provides leadership, coaching, and guidance, and hold stores accountable for customer satisfaction while ultimately helping stores achieve and exceed sales targets to exceed Batteries Plus organizational goals.  The ideal Director of Sales & Operations candidate will have 5+ years of multi-unit retail management experience, extensive experience in a selling based environment, success creating action plans that drive financial results, demonstrated influence and coaching abilities, and the ability to travel 75%-90% of time on a weekly basis- including regular overnight stays. Batteries Plus has 700+ stores nationwide and is growing. Does this sound like the next exciting opportunity in your retail field leadership career? If yes, apply today for consideration.  Responsibilities Lead and develop high performing teams within a multi-store, multi-state district through regular in-person, in-store visits Providing direction and leadership to both Franchise-owned and Corporate-owned stores Develop and maintain a positive team culture within stores Drive execution through clear goals, expectations, ethics, guidance, and measurable results Create actions plans with Store Managers and Franchise owners to meet and exceed monthly and annual sales goals Act as a brand ambassador and the key liaison between the corporate office and Franchisees Ensure Batteries Plus contract compliance with franchisees Drive assigned district to exceed sales and operational goals Qualifications 5+ years of multi-unit, multi-store retail store management experience Ability to travel 75%-90% of the time on a weekly basis via airplane and vehicle, with regular overnight stays required Valid Driver's License, clean driving record, ability to rent a vehicle Bachelor's Degree or a combination of education and experience in lieu of degree Preferred Qualifications Specialty, small-box retail experience preferred Exceptional leadership and coaching skills and the "ability to influence without formal authority" Sales experience in a retail store environment. "selling" environment, cross-selling, upselling, sales training of retail store associates Track record of improving sales through coaching and training Demonstrated experience developing store associates and store managers Extensive knowledge of financial reports, merchandising, inventory, cash controls, operations Knowledge of franchising desirable or experience with overseeing franchise-owned stores A Bit About Us  Batteries Plus is the nation's largest and fastest-growing battery, light bulb, phone repair and key fob replacement franchise with a nationwide network of over 720 stores. We work hard here at Batteries Plus, and we have a lot of fun while we do it. Whether you work in our warehouse, one of our stores or at our corporate headquarters, our goal remains the same: to satisfy our customers, build trust and drive business, while nurturing our team and working to be experts in our fields. That's life at Batteries Plus  Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

description: A successful candidate is results-oriented, strategic thinker, able to develop and deliver their agenda. This leader must have a diverse background in Operations, Warehouse Management, Logistics and Supply Chain and have excellent relationship management skills with a proven track record of results in Operational Excellence. Broad understanding of the various Direct-Store-Delivery routes to market and/or a B2C environment is critical to support the development of the KDP portfolio of brands with a laser-like focus on growth of our brands, business, and our people.   The Regional Operations Leader drives strategic analysis, execution, and organizational development to achieve financial and non-financial goals in addition to creating a lean mindset throughout the assigned region to improve safety, productivity and performance through standardization and process discipline. This leader must excel in strategic planning and execution on a regional level while achieving Business Unit goals as well as broader KDP priorities. This individual sets direction for the team and creates proactive solutions to achieve these goals. This role will lead the creation and delivery of the business unit's long-term agenda and short-term activity plan while minimizing costs through an effective operating strategy.  This individual consistently demonstrates KDP values and competencies, builds a high-trust and high-performing culture. Critical also to the success of this role is the partnership they must create with the broader organization. This role will work closely and cross-functionally with the Sales leadership team. The ability to influence senior leaders and cross-functional partners, such as Sales, Sales Effectiveness, Supply Chain, National Sales Teams, Finance, Marketing, and HR, is critical as this role will be driving both strategic and executional direction for the Region and Business Unit while being mindful of KDP wide enterprise priorities and goals.  Accountabilities:  Lead, coach and develop a team to deliver top-notch execution and achieve operational excellence Lead teams in annual planning process in partnership and alignment with national Direct Store Delivery Sales and Operations leadership team, including development of SMART objectives, strategies, and sales plans. Drive decision-making that will lead to enhancements and process improvements Leverage consumer insights to develop programs that will increase conversion at the point of purchase and measure the effectiveness of account-specific programs. Build a high-performing team and build bench strength for future leadership roles - ability to identify top talent, provide ongoing coaching/feedback, manage dynamic change, identify training needs to enhance skill sets, and conduct career path discussions and progression planning. Identify and reinforce positive leadership behaviors to drive change and raise the bar on performance Grow Employee Engagement & Inclusion Work with location leadership teams to ensure proactive, consistent approach to driving engagement and inclusion to Strategically partner with leadership team and recruiting to ensure the workforce represents our local communities Encourage and support employees to engage in Employee Resource Groups Set the strategic direction and vision for the regional operational excellence Identify and drive cross-functional alignment between sales, operations and supply chain Provide leadership and management of AOP development and the planning process. Partner with Network Optimization teams to ensure operational effectiveness for both warehouse operations and distribution routes. Support all new business and acquisition efforts Drive reduction in waste by ensuring assigned region meets or exceeds break/shrink/obsolescence goals on a cost per case basis. Ensure labor costs in the warehouse and delivery operations of assigned region meet or beat plan on a cost per case basis by driving home Warehouse University principles, including the deployment of the Warehouse Self Assessment tool. Collaboration/Alignment with Key Stakeholders Work in close partnership with region sales leader to design and execute on strategic plans, customer service and delivery optimization Partner and effectively build relationships with Sales and Marketing leadership including Fountain Foodservice Sales, Warehouse Direct, Packaged Beverages Immediate Consumption, Cola/ISO Systems, Managed Services, Convenience, Brand Marketing, Category Management, Market Research and Finance. Work closely with cross functional partners to identify potential business risks Identify and drive cross-functional alignment behind priority channels and customers, including supply chain and demand planning Continuous improvement, operational efficiencies and effectiveness Lead the Operations teams to ensure consistency of constant continuous improvement culture Partner with Network Optimization teams to delivery continuous improvements Lead and coach leaders and the frontline to increase productivity and efficiencies in day to day operations Drive increase in First Pass Yield (FPY) and On Time and Accurate (OTA) score by addressing routing and delivery issues as well as ensuring pick accuracy exceeds 99.8% through full execution of Voice Pick standards and compliance to daily checklist and reduction of haulbacks Keep our employees safe and healthy Lead DOT compliance efforts for delivery organization Partner with Employee Health & Safety teams to drive a culture focused on safety first both in our locations and when employees in the trade and on the road Drive accident and injury reduction and vehicle accident reduction targets in assigned region. Provide case management and follow up on all SAFE system cases and ensure that proper accident investigations, classifications, follow-ups and Root Cause Counter Measures are determined. Lead and ensure regulatory compliance by conducting OSHA style audits and ensuring closure of any regulatory gaps to achieve 100% regulatory compliance.  The ideal candidate will possess a proven track record of improving safety results, successful continuous improvement initiatives and superior cost and management results. This candidate will have strong leadership and communication skills; excellent verbal and written skills along with experience presenting to regional leadership teams, local leadership teams, and front line employees. Possess a background in the management of Warehouse, Inventory and Delivery. They will have knowledge of Department of Transportation (DOT), Federal, State and Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) compliance. The candidate will have experience working with MHE, (material handling equipment) understand warehouse capacity requirements, building, loading, and delivery principals, FIFO and logistics principals.   Qualifications: 10+ years of leadership experience in positions of increasing responsibility Successful experience in working in Warehouse, Distribution, Supply Chain and/or Delivery Operations Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), B2C, Retail and Distribution experience a plus Strong understanding of Department of Transportation (DOT), Federal, State and Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) and OSHA compliance Experience with a frontline workforce in both union and non-union environments Data Analytics & Strategic Insights Leverages data, has a deep understanding of the customer/consumer and good judgment to develop a clear and coherent data driven strategy and insights Leverage relevant external insights (industry, competitors, category, brand, channel, consumer and account) to develop a strategic agenda that drives focus and results behind the KDP portfolio strategy Project Management ‚Äì executing a project from start to finish ability to communicate long-term vision and shorter-term opportunities through clear & simple messages Judgment - Ability to proactively identify business opportunities and deliver innovative solutions to address business needs. Strong analytical rigor that drives results-orientation Influence ‚Äì ability to leverage internal and external relationships to drive strategic agenda, alignment and capabilities development for team.
industries: Food & Beverages

description: Why Birdeye?  15 years ago brands controlled customer experiences. But in 2021, it‚Äôs customer experiences that control brands. Customers now choose businesses based on shared experiences, not ads. So marketers now have to create and promote great experiences, and they need a platform that can do this at scale.  Birdeye is an all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses. More than 60,000 businesses of all sizes use Birdeye every day to be found online and chosen through listings, reviews and referrals; be connected with leads and customers on the channels of their choice, and deliver the best customer experience with survey, ticketing and insights tools.  Founded in 2012, Birdeye is headquartered in Palo Alto, and led by alumni from Google, Amazon, Salesforce and Yahoo. Birdeye is backed by Salesforce founder Marc Benioff, Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang, Trinity Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The company has been the highest-rated Experience Marketing platform over the last 5 years on G2.  To learn more, please visit: https://birdeye.com  What You'll Do:  Birdeye, the all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses, is looking for a Small Business Sales Manager Account. If you possess the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive and track record of success in Sales Management, this is an opportunity that you cannot afford to miss.  The market opportunity for Experience Marketing software is roughly $50B+ in the US and 2-3x that number globally. To put this opportunity in perspective - there is not a single business in the US (or globally) that could not use our software, something difficult to say about other types of point solutions. Birdeye needs winners that will help our company grow, exceed goals and expectations, and have a whole lot of fun along the way!  Responsibilities Hire, train and manage a team of Account Executives (~10) who are focused on prospecting, closing company provided leads, running online demos and proof of concept campaigns, while delivering high quality deals which will drive business. Drive strategy and vision for the team in support of sales goals and create a scalable infrastructure to support our high growth. Analyze business and industry trends and implement best practices to continue to evolve the team to stay ahead. Partner with Sales, Marketing and Business Development to ensure all parties are aligned with sales goals, marketing initiatives and Business Development plans. Work closely with Sales Operations to establish, enforce, and improve team efficiency, effectiveness, and reporting.  Requirements BA/BS degree required, MBA a plus. 3+ years of success building, leading, and managing a team of Account Executives (closing roles), or inside sales professionals in a B2B technology company. Proven abilities to think strategically and influence cross-functionally to drive results. A deep level of experience in sales development best practices and developing, coaching, and scaling sales development teams. An outstanding history of leadership, strategy and analysis. A track record thriving in a fast moving, entrepreneurial and self-starting environment that leverages creativity and insight. Outstanding organization and time management skills. High degree of business acumen High attention to detail while being able to multi-task  Benefits Employer-paid benefits with multiple health plan options (HSA, PPO) Unlimited PTO 401(k) with company match Flexible work from home options available Maternity & Paternity Leave Employee Resource Groups - network with like-minded "Birds" Abundant opportunities that come with a dynamic and fast-growing organization!

The Global Director will work cross-functional with the sales, marketing and enablement teams as an operational leader managing the base of target accounts; orchestrating coordinated plays to consistently identify opportunities and grow pipeline. We are looking for a dynamic, results-driven, process-minded leader that is an exceptional coach and motivator of people, driving execution and sales development excellence. The right candidate will tenaciously grow their organization, increase pipeline volume, optimize sales velocity and revenue via Closed-Won Business.  You Will Recruit, manage, train, and retain a high performing team of sales development representatives Set and meet key performance indicators and objectives and key results with the sales leadership team Develop and maintain SDR best practices, pitches, and objection handling Achieve and consistently exceed monthly and quarterly SDR team goals Provide leadership, development, and training for our SDR team to hit and exceed monthly goals and achieve other defined objectives Work as a strategic partner to the marketing and sales organization to optimize the sales funnel and help to develop demand generation campaigns/content Evaluate the current sales tech stack to manage the sales process and set standards for performance Accurately forecast the sales development pipeline and proactively flag risk We're Excited About You Because You Have 4+ years of sales management experience 4+ years of sales experience, ideally having served as an SDR Team Lead 6+ years of experience working in a fast-paced technology/SaaS company Capacity to hire, inspire, lead, and motivate team members and establish a healthy and collaborative work environment Track record of meeting and exceeding individual and team goals Proven planning, organization, and project management skills Excellent reporting and analytics skills (using Salesforce, Excel, and equivalent tools) Strong organization/prioritization skills and ability to consistently meet deadlines About Udemy  We believe anyone can build the life they imagine through online learning. Today, millions of students around the world are advancing their careers and passions by exploring and mastering new skills on Udemy, and expert instructors are able to share their knowledge with the world. Through our global marketplace and our solutions for businesses and governments, we connect people everywhere with the skills they need for success in work and life. We‚Äôre a close-knit bunch that enjoys problem-solving and collaboration, and we share a serious belief in the power of learning and teaching to change lives. Udemy‚Äôs culture encourages innovation, creativity,passion, and teamwork. We also celebrate our milestones and support each other every day.  Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and headquartered in San Francisco‚Äôs SOMA neighborhood with offices in Denver (Colorado), Dublin (Ireland), Ankara (Turkey), Gurugram (India), and S√£o Paulo (Brazil).  At Udemy, we value diversity and inclusion and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability. description: About Cordial  When we founded Cordial in 2014, we were determined to change the way brands communicate with their customers. We build technology to help brands send a better message‚Äîones that are personal, relevant, and emotionally intelligent across any channel. Leading brands such as Revolve, Eddie Bauer, 1-800 Contacts, and TOMS use our cross-channel messaging platform to increase customer engagement, drive transformational speed-to-market, and future-proof their marketing technology.  We chose the name Cordial to symbolize how we empower our clients to communicate with their customers, as well as how we do business: with transparency, collaboration, and trust. We're building a passionate team of individuals willing to learn, grow, and be thoughtfully challenged on a daily basis to continuously improve our product, company, and culture every single day.  OUR VALUES Communicate better than the rest Tenacious about our clients and the problems we solve for them We're owners, and we act like it Be Cordial  Position Summary  We are looking for the ultimate cordial salesperson to be part of our growth stage company that is disrupting a legacy industry and competing head to head with enterprise cloud platforms. Reporting to our VP of Sales, this position will play a critical role in driving new business to aid in Cordial's growth. The person in this role will have the distinct superpower to create new relationships and self source their own opportunities, never relying on others for their own success. Though this individual contributor will also be the utmost teamplayer as we win as one team and the team comes before the individual‚Ä¶ so humility matters.  YOU WILL Self-source and qualify client needs and opportunities within a vertical and semi-regional focus of Enterprise targets across B2C retail, digital publishing, gaming, travel and hospitality, etc. Be a hunter in this role with marketing support for inbound and event generated opportunities. Our Client Success teams are responsible for account growth post-sale. Develop a pipeline with viable opportunities and be able to forecast accurately within and across marketing, IT and leadership functions within the target accounts. Exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets with consultative sales or challenger sales approach. Understand your product. While relationships are critical to you, you also get excited about creating ways to sell value through the technical components of a platform and recognize that this approach will truly differentiate you as a sales person. Quarterback resources across departments including Sales Engineering, Product, Engineering, Marketing and Leadership.  About You 6+ years of experience selling complex SaaS solutions. Networked with Digital/Ecommerce VP's, CMO's, CTO's, Product and Customer Experience executives. A marketer at your core after selling to - or even better - playing one previously for years. Storytelling and speaking a marketers language is core in your approach and you understand B2C Marketers, Retailers, and Media Publishers initiatives.. A superstar and passionate about self-sourcing your own opportunities. Believe in selling value through product and cherish opportunities to work with IT. A stable record of 2+ years in each position throughout your career and have consistently achieved top-performing awards Embody Cordial's sales cultural values; Integrity, Discipline, Ingenuity, Intelligence, Curiosity, Passion, and excellent written and verbal communication (yes‚Ä¶ words matter...). Desire to work in a fast-paced growing company environment where self-starters who want to help all facets of a company improve can thrive.. "That's not my job" is not in your vocabulary. Intellectually curious and proven ability to adapt and learn new technology. Able to lead by doing. A hands¬≠-on mentality and low ego that embodies an extreme ownership approach to building a great company and team.

description: NYC 299 Park Avenue (22957), United States of America, New York, New York  Senior Director of Sales  Job Description  The Senior Director of Sales will lead a new and evolving Specialty and Industry Verticals team within our B2B Payments organization. This is an exciting time to join a successful and growing organization within Capital One‚Äôs Commercial Bank. This leadership role will be responsible for the day-to-day leadership of the Specialty and Industry Vertical sales team by developing a strategy and vision for a team of high-performing salespeople and leaders while achieving overall revenue and financial objectives for the organization. This individual will also serve as a key partner and liaison with several lines of business across the Commercial Bank and partner directly with senior leaders to drive alignment and collaboration as well as results. Additionally, this leader will oversee talent identification, development and mentoring, performance management, and customer experience, while serving as a key customer and influencer for operations, product, technology, strategy & analysis, underwriting & credit, finance, and compliance. This individual will be integral to the ongoing development of the organization‚Äôs strategy and objectives.  The Ideal Candidate Will Have Excellent writing and oral presentation skills Strong organizational, problem solving, interpersonal, communications, and technology skills Ability to proactively and effectively communicate with all levels and groups Independent decision-maker who demonstrates sound judgment to seek senior support or expertise when needed Strong financial and business acumen Strong track record of sales management skills including recruiting, training, and coaching   General Responsibilities Defining and executing against a new go to market strategy for Specialty and Industry Vertical sales. Day-to-day leadership, including coaching and managing a geographically dispersed team of associates by providing strategic direction, overseeing overall team performance, budgeting, expense management, customer experience, operations, etc. Leading through inspiration, setting a vision, and developing a winning culture that rewards and recognizes associates for their contributions and reinforces Capital One values. Preparing and delivery of regular financial and performance updates to senior leadership. Building and maintaining relationships with various cross-functional teams within Capital One including product management, technology, Treasury Management, and Small Business Card, & Commercial Card in order to create strong partnerships that enhance the overall customer experience. Ensuring that all customer and prospect interactions are conducted in accordance with Capital One Legal, compliance with Bank standards, and regulatory guidelines. Providing client-facing leadership for strategic deals and customer support. Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of competitor‚Äôs products and pricing across the US. Planning and forecasting the upcoming year's growth for the business Basic Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree or relevant experience At least 12 years of sales leadership experience Preferred Qualifications MBA degree 2+ years experience in commercial banking product sales leadership 2+ years experience in commercial card product sales leadership 2+ years Consumer or Small Business Card product experience 2+ years experience leading a national sales team 2+ Years Experience selling within treasury management or payments, including: Cash Conversion Cycle Procure to Pay process Accounts Payable Commercial Card Invoice Management Payment Automation Corporate travel & expense management No agencies please. description: At a Glance: LOCATION: Flexible ‚Äì Sales region North East USA TITLE: Sales Director RESPONSIBILITIES:  Ensure growth and profitability of the US subsidiary COORDINATING WITH: Global Head of Exports in Germany TEAM SIZE: 4/5 COMPANY: German Manufacturer of high quality robotic assistant devices for Neurorehabilitation Therapy Equipment  Do you want to be a game changer and a crucial part of the success story of THERA-Trainer USA? We launched in the US last year immediately facing the challenges of the pandemic. But now the situation couldn‚Äôt be better to re-start our success story. We are looking for a great SVP Business Development to lead our team and give the patients what they deserve ‚Äì the best equipment!  You will ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ make a real difference to the lives of patients, by giving them the tools to recover faster, get better results and get their lives back. ‚Ä¶ be working with professional clients, from therapists and doctors who will appreciate the design and ease of use of our equipment to financial directors who will understand the business case for buying the best systems available. By offering them the best quality products, you support them in increasing the quality of the treatment and their returns. ‚Ä¶ achieve this by using your profound neuro rehab knowledge alongside extensive existing relationships in this field to bring potential customers in contact with our robotic devices. ‚Ä¶ be hands on closing sales working directly with customers as well as supporting your team to deliver outstanding performance ‚Ä¶ shape the strategy like making revenue plans, implementing sales strategies and defining strategies to generate new leads and opportunities together with our Global Head of Exports in Germany ‚Ä¶ get the best support from HQ. We have a more than 30 years of experience in international business, a proven marketing strategy and successful sales tools. Our customers love our high-quality products. You will also get a detailed product training during your onboarding ‚Äì and we are committed to giving you the support you need to succeed.   What will You be doing? in a typical Day Manage and lead the Regional Sales Manager and the Clinical Director as well as coordinate with the Operations Manager. Identifying new leads and opportunities and support them end-to-end until deal close. Demonstrate products to interested buyers and - of course - close sales. in a typical Week Promote the brand at trade shows, events and conferences to build strong and lasting relationships with new and existing customers, key opinion leaders and dealers. Deliver sales support and marketing with the whole team to ensure the highest levels of customer care. Optimize business processes, interfaces and structures for the US subsidiary. in a typical Month Define (together with the leading employees of the HQ) the US marketing and sales strategy. Continuously optimize our processes for sales and management to improve performance and growth. Build relationships to key customers and KOLs and continuously interact with them (build reference centers Constantly extend our market knowledge on customer segments and the competitive situation. Create revenue plans, forecasts and pricing together with the team in Germany. Analyze current sales and implement sales strategies to continuously grow the business.  What will your new employer be like? Family business Family run and owned; we value everyone individually. All are encouraged to speak up, be heard and to bring their ideas and creativity. Customer oriented Our mission is to create high-quality therapy equipment, that gets patients back on their feet quickly. We are driven to make a difference to the lives of anyone going through rehab. Long-term focus This family business is driven by long-term progress and not by quarterly earnings numbers. Founded in 1990 and now with the 2nd generation taking over there are ambitions to grow the business in the US and worldwide.  Sounds interesting? Let‚Äôs look at the numbers: Permanent, full time position Trust-based working hours, but this is not the ‚Äúnine to five‚Äù 15 days PTO Company vehicle, mobile phone and laptop Great relationships and market knowledge is a must Starting as soon as possible

Papaya Global is reinventing global payroll and workforce management. Our automated platform helps companies hire, onboard, manage, and pay people in more than 140 countries. As the SDR Manager, you will be responsible for building a world-class sales development team.  Responsibilities Ensure we efficiently qualify outbound demand. Recruit, train, and develop a team of SDRs. Ensure sales accepted opportunities are sourced following Papaya‚Äôs targets and that our Sales Executives have enough opportunities to work with to be fully productive. Motivate SDRs to exceed goals through coaching and incentives. Partner with regional sales directors and field marketing to execute cross-functional enterprise demand generation in key accounts for our field sales team. Plan, forecast, and understand the ramp-adjusted capacity to ensure the team is grown effectively in tandem with our sales needs. Manage SDR KPIs reports and dashboards Partner with sales and marketing operations to ensure the SDR team has the best tools to do their job. They are configured to provide SDR efficiency and productivity, especially salesforce.com and Outreach. Analyze Outreach cadences with an eye towards continual improvement and up-to-date messaging, by buyer persona and by industry. Develop paths for career advancement within the SDR functions as well as to closing sales roles. Experience managing an outbound prospecting team with at least ten total direct and indirect reports. Power-user of salesforce.com and SDR cadence management software. Ability to drive cross-functional alignment and coordination across sales and marketing teams. Ability to attract, retain, and motivate exceptional SDRs. Awareness of industry trends in Global Payroll, Digital transformation, and Partner echo system. Excellent written and spoken English. Accurate, nuanced, direct, and kind messaging. Being able to work independently and respond quickly. Able to articulate Papaya‚Äôs mission, values, and vision.

description: We are looking for a Director of Account Management/heavily experienced Senior Account Manager to join our team. You will supervise Account Representatives (we call ours Program Advisors) to ensure startup client needs are met, revenue is attained, and increase each clients lifetime value to our company. You will also be responsible for creating new business by identifying profitable opportunities with our product team. Our ideal candidate has a drive for achieving goals and maintaining a great client experience first and foremost. We also expect you to bring forward-thinking ideas to promote our brand and create a positive culture within your team that ultimately increases revenue while building successful long-term client relationships.      Responsibilities Set revenue targets and specific performance metrics, aligned with business strategies for the accounts team (10-15 individuals) Supervise and support account managers and representatives to ensure client satisfaction, success, and growth Communicate with clients at a senior level to resolve issues, inquiries, and establish processes for the future Generate innovative ideas to support clients success and boost brand and cross product awareness Use client feedback to improve client experience by working with product team in developing new product features Report on revenue growth results on a regular basis and suggest improvements using proposal process Ensure brand consistency, product to fit alignment for clients, and overall support team endeavors Stay up-to-date with product launches and provide support to clients and the account management team Organize meetings with the account management team to ensure all members are on board and deliver within deadlines  Requirements:  Proven work experience as a Senior account manager Hands on experience with CRM software and MS Office (particularly MS Excel) Familiarity with sales and growth performance metrics Exemplary team recruitment, leadership and management skills Excellent communication skills with a client service attitude Strong analytical, process driven, and organization building skills BSc degree in Business Administration, Sales or relevant field  Benefits:  Be a part of a global team with a hybrid in-office and remote culture with a headquarters in East Austin, Texas. Compensation packages include competitive rates, performance incentives, equity, and company stock options. Covered benefits that include medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances. plus we offer a 401k program. Up to 30 days of vacation allotted per year including PTO, Holidays, Sick Days and Election Day. Build culture and engage startup community with frequently planned outings and team events. Access to all of our certified accelerator programs if you launch a startup during your career here (valued at $250k+). Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a revolutionary space working with thousands of startups around the globe!
