jobTitle: West Zone Sales Manager, Pharmaceutical Diagnostics
description: Job Description Summary  Lead the Western US Commercial Sales Team organization, defines and implements the product strategy across multiple channels and partners. Responsible to grow profitability of the franchise, focused on both commercial and operational aspects. Key metrics of success are: sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share. Key role in the global organization, including R&D and product management, suggesting product portfolio evolution and creating business opportunities to leverage & improve products/brands equity.Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is a global leader in imaging agents, used to improve and enhance the images that radiologists use to diagnose and monitor disease. We support healthcare professionals in the administration of neurology, cardiology and oncology procedures that are used to image three patients around the world, every second.  Job DescriptionRoles and Responsibilities   Lead and implement the Sales for the western region, managing overall sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share in a manner that fulfills business and achieves targets. Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources. Strong background in working with cross-functional department within a business. Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision. Manages a small to medium team of senior professionals as well as others. Lead the management team in the region, ensuring strong collaboration between Sales and functions including Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Commercial Operations. Optimize the use of resources to cover market potential to achieve the operating plan. Know, interact and develop the strategy with Key Opinion Leaders and decision makers in product relevant scientific areas; manage professional relations with key Customers to ensure understanding of needs and that GE Healthcare product value proposition is differentiated in the minds of these key Customer groups. Nurture relationships with professional society stakeholders.  Required Qualifications   Education to bachelor‚Äôs degree level, in relevant scientific area. Minimum of 3 years of Management experience Minimum of 6 years in the the Healthcare industry Ability to travel 30% to40% of the time  Desired Characteristics   Exemplary people management, leadership skills, as well as sales coaching, and team building skills. Demonstrated business management and resource allocation skills including business plan development. Change agent with energy, passion and enthusiasm to drive change. Ability to translate strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly. Ability to communicate and present ideas to Customers in a way that produces understanding and impact that builds effective strategic relationships. Strong business acumen; financial and organizational skills. Advanced negotiation, problem solving and influencing skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

jobTitle: Sr. Director of Sales - Johnson Brothers Division
description: Phillips Distilling Company is currently inviting candidates to apply for a full-time Senior Director of Sales position. This position will support the Johnson Brothers Division.  Since 1912, Phillips Distilling Company (PDC) has been producing high-quality spirits brands. As one of America's oldest family-owned spirits companies, we pride ourselves on our independent spirit and our commitment to innovation, quality, partnerships, community and consumers. Our passion is evident in our diverse portfolio of premium and ultra-premium brands.  The candidate selected for this role will enjoy competitive compensation, annual bonus potential, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package! This position is based in Minnesota and requires 75% of time in the ‚Äúfield‚Äù.  The Sr Director, Johnson Brothers Division will manage assigned division including training, mentoring and managing staff in a multi-state division to meet or exceed the company‚Äôs business objectives. The role directs the planning, development and execution of market and customer sales plans, strategies, objectives, systems and procedures to maximize volume and profit growth. The role also ensures effective relationships at a high level with key customers, distributors, and key stakeholders.  The Sr Director will manage a team of sales managers.  Essential Duties Define and articulate the Operations/Product Supply Operating Plan in line with overall strategic plan and financial goals. Meet or exceed divisional EBITDA goal and all annual case objectives. Hire, train, mentor and manage staff within the Division. Communication with each direct report must occur on a weekly basis, at a minimum. Conduct assessments with all staff at least bi-annually, and hold them accountable for all items on their job descriptions. Work with Chief Revenue Officer to develop pricing, promotional, merchandising and distributor incentive strategies for each region and ensure that they are implemented and effectively managed by the appropriate Manager. Develop a comprehensive understanding of the company‚Äôs brands, organizational structure, culture, cost components and strategies and a thorough understanding of the US distilled spirits industry. Establish and maintain strong professional and personal relationships with key distributor and trade personnel in all markets. Meet at least annually with all ‚ÄúA‚Äù and ‚ÄúB‚Äù market distributor principals/owners/Presidents and review financial, qualitative and quantitative performance. Attend Managers‚Äô bi-annual business review/planning meetings with each distributor (preferably in Feb & July) and annual survey with senior management of distributor and Phillips. Continually investigate and identify both opportunities for the company and ways in which it can improve. Ensure a culture of legal compliance. Be a positive ambassador for the company and its sales organization. Lead with an entrepreneurial spirit. Minimum Job Requirements A four-year college degree is required with 8+ years‚Äô sales management experience in the distilled spirits industry, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant sales leadership experience in distributor relationship management ideally in both large and small supplier-side companies Be highly energetic, creative, and self-motivated. Able to operate in a fast-paced environment with finesse and passion Must have the ability to develop relationships with distributors and manage pricing and profitability while holding them accountable to key objectives. Requires excellent communication skills; proficient computer skills including electronic mail, spreadsheet, internet, etc. Relevant experience effectively preparing and managing a budget; and ability to prioritize, organize and delegate assignments. Experience with pricing, use of data, and knowledge of POS Sales management experience and ability to effectively manage, coach, and develop a remote staff. Reports To: Chief Revenue Officer  Candidates offered employment will be required to submit to a background check and drug test. Phillips Distilling Company is an E-Verify participating employer.  Phillips Distilling is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. If a disability prevents you from applying for a job online, contact us via e-mail or in writing.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: Key Requirements  Stanchion Head of Business Development for the America‚Äôs is responsible leading the business development and sales effort and for developing market presence, attracting and acquiring new Customers and Markets and achieving the targeted financial growth within the America‚Äôs. The right person will be an excellent networker, Customer centric, constantly seeking new opportunities within the broader market to expand the reach and footprint of Stanchion. S/he will continuously explore new opportunities within existing Customer relationships and in the broader market to expand the reach and footprint of Stanchion whilst playing a critical role in building relationships with existing clients as well as new prospects. It is crucial for the incumbent to combine a thorough understanding of the retail payments environment and Stanchion products and services in order to professionally and effectively explore the needs, requirements and initiatives of our Customers and new prospective Customers.  The candidate will work with the internal product and service delivery teams to ensure that Customers are delighted with our service delivery and products, increasing customer satisfaction and reference ability. The candidate will proactively identify potential issues and head them off or, where necessary, adeptly handle any problems or escalations in a timely and effective manner.  The successful candidate will have a thorough understanding of the Fin-Tech and Retail Payments environment using strong problem-solving abilities to identify opportunities, problem areas or vulnerabilities where Stanchion can deliver value. S/he will be responsible for effective collaboration and leadership to drive the necessary pre-sales activities required to sell Stanchion‚Äôs offerings to existing and potential clients. The construction of a Sales & Business Development Strategy leading to the achievement of sales targets and delivery against strategic account plans is ultimately the most signifcant output of the incumbent  Some Examples Of Key Tasks  Deliver the agreed sales targets (quotas) and revenue targets as per the BDM & Sales Strategy Own and drive pre-sales engagement activities with potential / prospective new clients and close Develop professional, ‚Äòtrusted advisor‚Äô customer interactions by actively building business relationships and networks with multiple contact points in client environments and beyond Interface with clients, key decisionmakers, third-parties as well as the Stanchion management and operations teams about new, existing and ongoing engagements Provide effective reporting mechanisms such as forecasting which should include the accurate update of the company‚Äôs CRM system. Own and drive proposals and RFPs to customers with input from technical and product teams Price the solution/service. Acquire a thorough understanding of key customer needs and requirements Identify, size and close new business opportunities and contribute to design and packaging of solutions using insights gathered from clients and the market needs Evaluate competitive actions with respect to the existing customer portfolio and within the market and recommend appropriate action Ensure the correct products and services are delivered to customers in a timely manner Serve as the link of communication between key customers and internal teams Resolve any issues and problems faced by customers and expedite the resolution of complaints to maintain trust  Core Skills, Knowledge & Abilities  Working knowledge of the payments industry, associated products and services Stanchion‚Äôs offerings in particular Thorough understanding of sales methodologies, strategies and frameworks and extensive Sales & Business Development A high degree of commercial and contracting acumen together with the experience to structure commercially appropriate and sustainable engagements, including pricing Strong influencing and negotiation skills Extensive applied experience in business and account development within a complex, multi-solution client portfolio Experience and convincing evidence in developing new Customer relationships and accounts, as well as growing existing accounts Proven ability to develop and maintain professional business relationships throughout an organization Experience in working with and negotiating with Senior and C-level parties externally , e.g. Customers and internally Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with evidence of a strong ability to facilitate and sell high quality and sustainable solutions Strong interpersonal skills with aptitude for building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels Ability to positively influence others to achieve results Ability to grasp technical concepts quickly High stress tolerance and the ability to effectively deal with multiple tasks and demands such as managing several requests, deadlines, customer interactions, complaints, shifting priorities, resource constraints, etc

Neon One develops cloud-based (SaaS) software products that helps nonprofit organizations raise more funds, grow their databases, run successful events, and manage their programs. We are currently hiring two Regional Sales Directors in our Ravenswood, Chicago office.  The Regional Sales Director will be responsible for supporting and managing a team of 6 Territory Sales Managers and 1 SDR who are responsible for lead generation, new logo sales, upsell opportunities and renewals within their respective territories that fall within the region. The Director will ensure that company targets are met, performance is forecasted accurately and the team stays motivated & engaged.  Responsibilities Manage a team of 6TSMs and 1 SDR who are responsible for lead generation, new logo sales as well as facilitating upsell opportunities within their respective territories that fall within your region Coach the team in strategic and consultative selling approach, to help them succeed in their goals Responsible for accurate monthly and quarterly forecasting of your team‚Äôs performance using Salesforce and Salesloft tools and provide timely reports to VP of Sales Collaborate with with Sales Enablement team to ensure Reps are set up for success Facilitate 1:1 weekly Pipeline Reviews as well as coaching sessions to ensure quota achievement from your team and individual growth of team members Jump in on demonstrations and calls where leadership bridge is beneficial Qualifications  4+ years in a Sales Management position with supervisory responsibilities with a track record of success is preferred 2+ years of experience in solution and consultative selling with demonstrated success closing new business is required Direct experience closing SAAS business is preferred Exceptional communication and motivational skills to coach territory representatives for success and motivate them to reach their goals Capacity to become proficient in our full product suite including Neon CRM & other product offerings Capacity to deliver accurate forecasts of their team‚Äôs performance Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities in a fast-changing environment Demonstrates a consistent, professional demeanor and high emotional intelligence. Experience collaborating with Sales Enablement professionals to set up reps for success Experience using pipeline management tools such as Salesforce and Salesloft is preferred Competencies  Management and Coaching Leadership and Teamwork Negotiation Consultative Sales Problem Solving Client Management Technical Capacity Communication Proficiency Time Management  Why work with us? Neon One offers great benefits, including health/ dental/ vision insurance, life and disability insurance, 401k with company match, and flexible spending accounts. We recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible time off, sick days, and family leave. We believe in giving back so much that we made it into an official benefit - employees are encouraged to use one workday per month to volunteer with any nonprofit in your community.  And finally: Be extraordinary. Be yourself.  Neon One embraces the distinctive qualities of all members of our community and fosters an environment where everyone is conscious of the different experiences each of us brings to the table.  We are committed to advancing equity, pursuing diversity, and fostering inclusion; each of these are crucial to our capacity for innovation and success.  We strongly believe in a diverse workforce where everyone is fairly compensated according to their experience and the demands of their position.   We pride ourselves on our collaborative culture where each employee feels safe, respected and free.

description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. Assist in the post-sale transition from sales to the professional services team. You'll Need To Have  What we‚Äôre looking for... Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Knowledge of Cloud vs. On-Premise deployment. Experience with Video Management Software, Video Analytics and Sensors. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have one or more of the following: A degree. Experience identifying, documenting and articulating the business and technical requirements of a prospective customer during the full sales cycle ‚Äì qualification, proposal, post-sale transition. Experience communicating software ability to address prospect‚Äôs requirements through compelling presentation (written, oral and product demonstrations) of the applications. Experience with Databases. Experience with Application integration. Experience in Networking. Experience public speaking. Subject Matter Expert in one of the following industries: Manufacturing, Energy, Transporation, Retail or Education. Knowledge of underlying sensor components such as data ingestion, camera technology, AI, ML, DL, and big data. Experience promoting technology innovation with leaders at large tech companies. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more. jobTitle: Head of Sales Development US (Central Region)
description: Stop settling for the good and go for the great!  About The Role  CoachHub is striving for a talented and entrepreneurial individual who helps building our Sales Development function and guiding it to success in addition to remaining hands-on in the role. The Sales Development Manager will be responsible for enabling other Sales Development Representatives for the Central US team to be successful in their roles by leading by example. The Sales Development Manager will be the team lead of the other SDRs on the team. You will be reporting directly to our VP Sales Development and to the CEO, Yannis (check them out at LinkedIn here and here)  Tasks And Responsibilities Build and steer CoachHub‚Äôs SDR activities in the Central US market, including planning, hiring, coaching and performance management Create an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture Set clear team goals Manage the performance of the Sales Development Representatives and delivery on KPIs Discover training needs and provide coaching and support for career development Build a sales development framework that follows CoachHub‚Äôs strategic direction Keep up with industry trends and best practices, including utilization of new technology and web resources Check Out Our Presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_SDR  Your profile You have gained profound experience in Sales Development, Inside Sales or Sales in the Enterprise Software space, preferably in SaaS, for at least 5 years You are experienced in leading, training and growing your team for at least 2 years You have a very good understanding of the Central US market and experience in SaaS You are able to work in a complex, changing environment and to interact with multiple stakeholders You provide great communication skills (positive and energetic, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills, team-player, working with other SDRs and field reps, Sales Management, external lead-gen agencies and marketing among others) What we offer Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular growth conversations with your supervisor Growth: An opportunity to join a fast growing and agile company The people: You will join an international team of driven and supportive people on a mission Impact: You have a direct impact on people's lives and make a true difference Feel welcome: First class company welcome week that will get you settled in, in no time Experience a strong focus on professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance Further ancillary insurances like life and short- & long term disability Unlimited paid time off (PTO) with a fair use policy Paid CoachHub4Good days to give back 401(k) plan including a CoachHub employer-paid add-on A flexible spending account A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‚Äòhelp organisations to unleash their people‚Äôs full potential‚Äô attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‚ÄòCoachHubbers‚Äô hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

description: Venture-backed Jaanuu is looking for passionate, proactive, strategic, and creative problem-solvers to join us, specifically as a Director of B2B Sales.  As a Director of B2B Sales, you will take ownership of all B2B related sales, new business opportunity outreach, and sales and marketing activities.  This position will report to the Chief Strategy Officer.  Requirements BA/BS Degree required. 10+ years of sales experience Track record of developing and achieving sales quotas Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls) Excellent communication and negotiation skills Proven ability to meet and exceed sales quotas and revenue targets, prospecting and developing new and existing accounts, and growing strategic relationships.  Preferred qualifications: Uniform / scrubs sales experience Strong understanding of healthcare industry  Venture-backed Jaanuu is a digital-first retailer changing the world of medical scrubs through its innovation in fabric and design. We‚Äôre a lean but fast-growing group of eCommerce and apparel veterans, digital marketers, creatives, engineers, and customer service experts working together in the name of performance - and we're eager to have you join us!  But what's in it for you? Glad you asked!  In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a multitude of benefits and perks, including:  Full suite of medical insurance with employer-sponsored contributions for both employees and dependents, plus no-cost access to Employee Assistance Programs, Meaningful stock options grants for eligible full-time employees, 9+ paid holidays + winter break (Christmas Day to New Year's Day), Unlimited, flexible time off, Generous monthly WFH stipend, Jaanuu Employee Discount and more!  At Jaanuu, we don‚Äôt just accept differences ‚Äî we celebrate it and we learn from each other for the benefit of our people, our products, and our community. Jaanuu is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We interview and hire applicants of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities.

description: Job Type  Full-time  Description  Don‚Äôt just land a job. Launch your future.  Our all-in-one software platform gives HR pros a way to easily manage daily tasks in payroll, benefits, talent, and workforce management.  But what makes us different is that our technology is backed by a culture that cares. We care about our team members, clients, and partners ‚Äì because people matter most. And people have always been at the heart of our business.  Since our founding in 1997, this is the thing that's stayed the same, from our employees to the millions of users nationwide that access our platform. We pride ourselves on partnering with our clients to build the workplace they and their employees crave.  Let's go forward together.  Position Overview  The Director, Sales is responsible for managing, coaching, teaching and training a group of Human Capital Management Account Executives  Location: Houston, TX  Reports To: Regional Vice President of Sales  Responsibilities Plan, organize, direct and coach your major market sales staff to meet objectives. Teach and train the Paylocity sales process to maximize your sales staff‚Äôs potential. Report weekly the team‚Äôs sales results for the month and for the quarter. Achieve forecasted sales by following (and, if necessary, adjusting) your written plan of action. Monitor each salesperson's weekly performance and compare it with that month's objective. Understand department sales expenses and monitor monthly. One on one weekly with each member of your team with an outline of what will be covered during this time. Develop and retain top talent, and ensure full headcount is executed Constructively handle (or supervise the handling of) all customer complaints related to your department. Have an established chain of command for all escalations. Requirements 1-4 years of experience in sales management. Experience with major account payroll, HR, and time and attendance solutions as well as large, complex organizations. Extensive experience in all aspects of the Major Account Payroll space. Proven track record in managing and directing a highly-skilled, motivated, successful, and results-oriented salesforce Soft Skills Assist in the selling process whenever needed. Strong leadership qualities with good communication and interpersonal skills Our journey forward.  Paylocity strives to create an organizational culture where every employee has a voice, feels truly welcome, appreciated, and free to be themselves, and is empowered and enabled to do their best work. A strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is critical to creating such a culture.  Our Current Focus Is On The Following Initiatives  We‚Äôve made great strides to support diversity, equity, and inclusion. That being said, we realize there‚Äôs still room for improvement. Education & Awareness Client Community Company Representation Advocacy & Support Fairness & Equality PCTY Gives Want to learn more, click here to access our DEI flipbook. https://www.flipsnack.com/paylocitycom/diversity-equity-and-inclusion.html  This job description has been written to provide an accurate reflection of the current job and to include the general nature of the work performed. It is not designed to contain a comprehensive detailed inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employees assigned to the job. Management reserves the right to revise the job or require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change.  This role can be performed from any office in the US. The pay range for this position in Colorado is $85,235 - $153,409/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for annual bonus, and restricted stock until grant based on individual performance in addition to a full range of benefits outlined here. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via www.paylocity.com/careers.

TAT Technologies (formerly Piedmont Airlines and Limco Airepair) is a multi-site global aerospace company dedicated to our customer experience of exceeding expectations. We are the leading MRO, APU leasing and OEM partner of key commercial and military aircraft solutions with over 50 years of experience in the industry.  We have an ambitious and fast-growing environment that believes in the power of team collaboration with the deep-rooted belief that there is no substitution to personal relationships and interactions. We offer a flexible work environment enabling talented individuals to fulfill their development goals through drive, energy, and passion for the customer.  Requirements  To achieve our goals, we need to reinforce our team with a new military sales professional. In this position, the successful candidate will represent TAT within the global MRO military market.  The main objectives of this position are to: Establishing and sustaining long-term strategic relationships within the US military branches Lead the sales process to successfully deliver customer centricity utilizing the TAT‚Äôs Proactive Account Management process Oversee a portfolio of assigned military bases and MRO companies to grow new business within the US DoD and foreign military entities while ensuring high level customer satisfaction Actively seeking new sales opportunities Establish a strong reputation and foothold within assigned accounts Identity and promote SAR opportunities  Our Global Sales Team are located the progressive Charlotte (Mooresville), NC area with great access to the airport and within walking distance of North Carolina‚Äôs largest lake ‚Äì Lake Norman. When we are not traveling, we enjoy a fun and convenient office environment and therefore relocation to that area would be highly preferred. Position current has 50% travel with potentially for more as COVID-19 restrictions lift  Benefits  TAT Technologies Group is dedicated to providing an inclusive, fun, and unique workplace. We believe in acknowledging and appreciating the value of our team members. One way we value our team is by providing a comprehensive and expansive benefits offering to include Major Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K with company matching, STD, LTD, accidental coverages, EAP, and more. description: Amylyx was started in 2013 by two Brown University undergraduates who proposed a proprietary combination of two known drugs to treat ALS. In the Fall of 2020, the successful results of their clinical trial were published in the New England Journal of Medicine. It showed that patients lived longer and suffered less decline in neurological functions.  Amylyx Pharmaceuticals offers a unique opportunity to be part of a team that is truly building a culture and company from the ground up! With over 50 full time employees, you will play a key role in creating a company that has potential to shape the way therapeutics for neurodegenerative disorders are developed in the biotech industry.  Now is a great time to join Amylyx! Our team has advanced AMX 0035 for ALS and we are preparing for global commercialization. In June we filed for registration in Canada, and we are working with regulatory agencies in the US and EU.  Our pipeline includes a Phase 2 study in Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease, and we are designing clinical studies in adjacent orphan diseases to broaden potential applications for AMX 0035.  With strong financial backing from Viking Global Investors, Bain Capital, Belinda Termeer, and Morningside Group and strong clinical data recently published in prestigious international medical journals, we are planning a global launch in ALS, one of the world‚Äôs largest orphan diseases with no adequate therapy.  We provide a competitive employee benefits package including pre-IPO stock options, flexible work options, discretionary time-off, comprehensive healthcare, and a 401k plan.  The Opportunity  The Regional Sales Director (RSD) at Amylyx will provide leadership and strategic direction to a team of Key Account Managers (KAM) to exceed performance objectives for the assigned region and the organization. This is accomplished through effective mentoring, coaching and cross functional collaboration across all facets of the Company.  Regional Sales Directors will lead, motivate and inspire the KAM team all while displaying the highest ethical standards. This is achieved by planning, hiring and leadership of field-based Key Account Managers calling on all those who serve patients living with ALS.  Amylyx Pharmaceuticals is looking for established Sales Leaders to build a best-in-class regional sales team to support our first commercial launch. Those with a passion for building and leading high-performance teams with a patient centric approach while driving for results are encouraged to apply.  The Role  The RSD will attract, develop, and manage a high performing team of Key Account Managers to achieve or exceed sales objectives The RSD is responsible for the creation and implementation of a strategic business plan to execute agreed tactics focused on driving demand while representing a consistent Patient First approach. Identify, cultivate, and maintain long-standing relationships with national and regional Neurology/Neuromuscular KOLs, and advanced treatment centers. Support the commercial organization with building a sales model, CRM inputs and partner with training to identify training needs. Support regional commercial influence-mapping initiatives by developing profiles and engagement / communication plans for each assigned region. Understand academic medical centers/ multidisciplinary care centers and the interplay and influence or multiple specialties to include (Neurology, critical care, PT, OT, SLP, Nursing and Social work ‚Äì develop analysis of each unique account to prepare for a commercial launch Act as a liaison between regional needs and senior leadership. Align with field partners such as Medical Leads and Market Access representatives on commercial strategic initiatives with shared customers Demonstrate Elite Clinical Acumen of (ALS) Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, understanding the multidisciplinary care team and ability to work collaboratively to serve those living with ALS Ensuring talent recruited represents a truly diverse team of professionals to enhance our competitiveness and innovation  The Requirements  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required; advanced degree preferred Minimum 10 years sales and leadership experience, previous 2nd line sales leadership experience Ability to lead and inspire a sales team to achieve top performance Team player a must; cross functional and collaborative approach to doing business Launch experience in competitive markets/ Neurology/ Neuromuscular disease/ Academic Medical Centers/Rare Disease Deep knowledge of academic medical centers understanding referral patterns and influence networks Demonstrate fluency in articulating complex scientific concepts and data Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to listen actively and synthesize information in a meaningful way, patient centric mindset Exceptional organizational skills Strong understanding of the laws, regulations and rules governing the pharmaceutical industry, and history of ethical and compliant behavior Ability to travel 60%-70% required  Watch this inspirational video of how our Co-founders worked with Patheon and Thermo Fisher in the early days of starting Amylyx.  To stay connected with us, follow Amylyx Pharmaceuticals on LinkedIN.  To return to our website please click here .  Amylyx is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical matters), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Accommodations are available for candidates who require them in our selection process. If you need an accommodation, please let your Amylyx Talent Acquisition contact know.

description: Sales Director, U.S. Northeast/Midwest Utilismart Corporation is currently seeking a highly motivated, experienced, and organized team player to join our growing team. Don't miss this exciting career opportunity with a successful and growing company serving customers across North America and beyond. Envision the future and help us get there. Utilismart Corporation offers a competitive base pay with a commission structure for this position.  Utilismart Corporation is a dynamic company with a portfolio of solutions that enable digital utility transformation. Utilismart data-driven solutions help utilities gain capabilities and realize efficiencies in regulatory accounting, billing, settlement, grid visualization, digital transformation, outage management, real-time engineering analysis, asset management, and more. It welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

jobTitle: Business Development Director - Telecommute in OH
description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Director of Business Development is responsible for selling the IE/ISNP value proposition to potential business partners in an assigned geography. The role is assigned business targets and penetration goals for Institutional Special Needs Plans (ISNP) and Institutional Equivalent Special Needs Plans (IE-SNP).  If you are located in Ohio, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Analyze assigned geography to identify, segment and prioritize all skilled nursing facilities (SNFs) and/or assisted living facilities (ALs) Conduct traditional business development activities to engage customers, to illustrate the value proposition and benefits of participation with Optum/UnitedHealthcare, and to collaborate with Optum stakeholders to execute contracts which lead to successful implementation Provide a monthly pipeline forecast by stage, utilizing the CCM Business Development Model, including risks and opportunities relative to budget and/or assigned production goals Partner with network and sales leaders to ensure strategies are aligned, and drive incremental growth Serve as the executive contact for client groups, including the development and management of C level and C level equivalent positions in the SNFs/ALFs You‚Äôll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs Degree 3+ years of sales, business development, or negotiation experience Experience meeting targets/metrics/goals year over year Experience driving the entire new business development process and immediately identify and correct any barriers preventing the closing of the sale Intermediate level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) Leadership skills to ensure all deliverables are completed timely and as required to facilitate the closing of the sale and execution of the contract Able to travel up to 60% Preferred Qualifications Master‚Äôs Degree in Business Administration or Healthcare Administration 3+ years of experience working with a skilled nursing facility Experience in healthcare sales Experience working with the executive and market leadership in the development of the budget and setting goals and expectations for the market Experience using a CRM (salesforce.com, Siebel, or a similar product) Contract negotiation experience Experience in a high energy position, requiring significant client contact, entertainment and engagement Ability to work a heavily matrixed environment Self-motivated and goal oriented individual Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  OptumCare is committed to creating an environment where physicians focus on what they do best: care for their patients. To do so, OptumCare provides administrative and business support services to both owned and affiliated medical practices which are part of OptumCare. Each medical practice part and their physician employees have complete authority with regards to all medical decision-making and patient care. OptumCare‚Äôs support services do not interfere with or control the practice of medicine by the medical practices or any of their physicians. All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group‚Äôs Telecommuter Policy. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment  Job Keywords: Sales, Business Development, Long Term Care, Cold Calling, Prospecting, Nursing Homes, Assisted Living, Medical Supplies, Medical Device, Infusion, Home Health, DME, Laboratory, OH, Ohio, Telecommute, Telecommuting, Telecommuter, Work From Home, Work At Home, Remote

jobTitle: Regional Director, Enterprise Sales (Midwest Region) - Remote
description: Want to work with big brands? Love coaching and developing individuals? Ready to kick things up a notch? Yelp‚Äôs mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp‚Äôs Enterprise team partners with multi-location businesses to provide industry leading advertising solutions. Our native search advertising products deliver strong ROI by helping clients connect with potential customers at the bottom of the purchase funnel. Yelp has become an essential part of a client‚Äôs Local advertising mix and the Enterprise team is growing fast.  We are looking for an experienced Regional Director, Enterprise Sales to remotely lead a team of Enterprise Account Directors in all areas from prospecting, pitching and closing new business to driving incremental revenue from existing enterprise accounts. The Regional Director, Enterprise Sales must have a proven record of developing and coaching a team, while navigating through an evolving organization. The Regional Director, Enterprise Sales role is key to Yelp‚Äôs success and offers significant career growth opportunities within Yelp‚Äôs Enterprise Sales team.  Where You Come In You will manage and coach a team of 6-8 sales directors to develop successful sales strategies including implementing multi-tiered approaches, establishing a wide network of contacts, defining measurable success metrics, developing successful campaigns, navigating conversations around attribution, identifying and staying ahead of risks, and accurately forecasting opportunities You will meet and exceed quarterly sales team quotas by holding your team accountable for activities that lead to revenue generation You will provide regular updates to management on team activities, opportunities, and risks You will implement strategic planning, forecasting and ongoing development of sales team You will identify improvement in all areas of productivity, process and efficiency You will develop and maintain executive level relationships to help drive sales activities You will assist in closing complex multi-million dollar programs with your team What It Takes To Succeed You have 5+ years managing a team of 5 or more You have 10+ years relevant Enterprise experience across Sales, Digital, and Advertising roles You have a proven track record of exceeding multi-million dollar sales targets You are an experienced communicator with a proven track record of executive outreach You are an entrepreneur with a history of building partnerships from scratch You have the ability to handle critical conversations internally with reps as well as client escalations You are able to successfully navigate uncertainty for all parties and lead to desired outcomes You believe in Yelp‚Äôs mission and naturally put the company and team first You are able to travel 30% of the time You are easy-going, cool headed, with a track record of collaboration and working well internally You are ready and willing to roll up your sleeves and build something big at Yelp What You'll Get Available your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (Employee-only plans available at no cost to the employee) 15 days PTO per year for first 2 years of employment (accrual begins on date of hire); number of PTO days increases after 2 years of tenure, 5 paid wellness days, 12 paid holidays, 1 floating holiday Up to 14 weeks of parental leave Monthly wellness reimbursement Health Savings, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care accounts 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match Employee stock purchase plan

description: Gusto‚Äôs mission is to create a world where work empowers a better life, and it starts right here at Gusto. We provide a modern, online people platform that helps businesses and accounting professionals onboard, pay, insure, and take care of their teams. On top of full-service payroll, Gusto offers health insurance, 401(k)s, expert HR, and team management tools and an increasing array of financial benefits. Gusto has home-bases in Denver, San Francisco, and New York and we serve more than 200,000 small and medium businesses, over 10,000 accounting professionals, and 1 million members nationwide.  Gusto is building a sales leadership team of innovators and goal smashers who come to learn and to serve our customers and our Gusto employees. We are pioneering an entirely different approach to selling. One where we nurture raving fans of small and medium business owners and the accountants who advise them. We do this by helping these customers solve complex people challenges with Gusto solutions. Our leaders are passionate about building the playbook and leaving a legacy and driving - always - for learning, iterating, and scaling with science, art and heart. They are thinking months / quarters/ years ahead, not just hitting monthly targets.  Our sales leaders are true empowerers of representative and inclusive teams - they will bring together teams that represent the diversity of customers we serve and help those individuals develop, grow, and pioneer a new sales model. They are in it for others and they have fans of previous team members saying - ‚ÄúI am better b/c I was empowered by this leader.‚Äù  Here‚Äôs What You‚Äôll Do  We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional hands-on sales leader that is ready to take on the challenge of maximizing growth, productivity, and the depth of partnerships with Gusto‚Äôs current and growing base of accountant partners. In this role, you will lead a team of Account Manager leaders and sellers who are empowering accountant partners to do their best work for their clients and in their firms. In this role, you will. Drive the Business: You will continue accelerating growth rates, while also building a scalable acquisition engine for long-term Grow the number of new accountant clients using the Gusto people platform and meet monthly revenue goals with accountant partner needs at the forefront Set and achieve ambitious goals by focusing on process improvements that will shorten sales cycles and make closing new deals more efficient (and when you hit your ambitious goals - beat and stretch the next set of goals) Accurately forecast pipelines and refine (and rethink) scalable and repeatable sales processes and procedures with the leaders you empower Maintain and improve alignment across cross-functional teams (product, marketing, finance, CX, etc.) for a unified strategy that supports the accountant‚Äôs journey optimization Contribute to product priorities and marketing campaigns through feedback loops Work with supporting teams (data, business ops, business technology, recruiting, etc) to build infrastructure for a growing team and accountant base Build a Representative and Inclusive Team Hire, develop and manage a growing, high-performing sales team with an exceptional team culture defined by high standards, deep care, and psychological safety Celebrate and encourage us to think creatively about how to reward progress, not perfection, and winning/growing/learning/getting better as a team. We‚Äôre committed to building a collaborative and inclusive workplace, both physically and virtually. Learn more about our Total Rewards philosophy. Model Self Awareness and Gusto Values Understand the strengths, motivations, and opportunities of those you empower Maintain a desire to learn, grow professionally and personally, and accept new, ambiguous challenges as we scale Take care of yourself physically, emotionally, and mentally to ensure you can serve others Communicate for Impact At the pace we move, sharing communications that are radically candid, clear and crisp in audiences of all sizes is imperative. Present information and strategies in a way that facilitates understanding and influences others to make decisions to take action Here's What We Are Looking For 8+ years overall experience with 5+ years leading sales teams Experience building and managing high performance teams across multiple types of sales High energy, high integrity. Able to motivate and inspire with a track record of building high-performance team cultures Proven ability to build a pipeline and achieve revenue targets in a predictable way Strong relationship builder, skilled at leading and aligning large cross-functional teams to drive scale, including marketing and product Excellent at using data to solve problems and drive decision making Passion for achieving impact and results that is driven by an entrepreneurial mindset Strong social selling and persuasion skills with a strong sales process discipline A strong communicator (both written and verbal) Passionate about Gusto‚Äôs mission and the impact we can have on the world Our cash compensation amount for this role is targeted at $160,000 OTE to $187,000 OTE in Denver and most remote locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above.  Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.  Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@gusto.com.

description: Job Title: Regional Sales Director Reports To: Vice President, Sales   Job Summary: Provide field based leadership, coaching and overall management of a region. Represent KPA in all regional business applications and play a vital role in motivating exceptional performance and fostering the company‚Äôs culture, reputation and image.  Applicants must live near a major airport. This Region covers the western United States including Alaska and Hawaii. Applicants must live in or near one of the following hub cities in order to be considered (some relocation assistance may be considered): Dallas, TX; Houston, TX; Los Angeles, CA; San Francisco, CA; San Diego, CA; and Phoenix, AZ.   Minimum Required Qualifications: Must have obtained a minimum of a Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited college or university; Minimum of 8 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry; Minimum of 5 years of experience in pharmaceutical sales management; Valid US Driver‚Äôs license and clean driving history; Excellent communication, presentation and leadership skills; Demonstrated ability to coach and lead district managers to execute National expectations;  Track record of success in an ever-changing and highly competitive pharmaceutical industry; Track record of success with launching new products;  Must live within the defined geography for the Region within easy access to a major airport hub;  Preferred Qualifications: MBA Therapeutic Area Knowledge/Experience preferred  Essential Job Functions: Manage the activity of selling and promoting assigned products in a highly ethical and competent manner; Manage and develop all regional personnel including District Managers and Sales Representatives; Achieve sales performance and accomplish goals by working with the regional sales team and direct reports; Effectively recruit and hire a regional sales team while adhering to Human Resources policies and practices, including EEO and AA requirements; Develop District Managers and coach the management team in their development of sales representatives to achieve key business objectives within the region; Operate company vehicle in a safe manner and in accordance with our fleet policy; Analyze market data to evaluate sales trends within the region and regularly review performance against objectives. Design and implement new business strategies to meet or exceed sales results; Plan and conduct effective sales meetings within the region to establish regional sales strategy and direction; Direct the execution of approved marketing plans and promotional campaigns and work closely with all co-promotion partners to ensure a cohesive, synergistic approach is implemented; Interpret Company policies in connection with questions that arise in the sales region; Conduct annual performance evaluation process for the assigned region; Operate a digital tablet or other device to appropriately demonstrate Kowa‚Äôs marketing and sales tools to contribute to the sales process; Independently drive a company vehicle daily in a safe manner in accordance with company Fleet policy; Travel independently to all areas of assigned region, including overnight stay; travel of 70-75% is expected; Submit all business expenses in a timely manner according to policy; Comply with all federal and state laws and guidelines including, but not limited to FDA, AMA, PhRMA, HIPAA, Sunshine Act, AE and Safety; Comply with all company policies; Additional duties as assigned;   Additional Responsibilities: Create and promote a professional image of integrity in relationships with all internal and external customers; Drive a sense of urgency, focus, and priority holding others accountable for achieving sales results within a changing business market; Contribute on the national level by sharing ideas from the region at quarterly National Managers Meetings and by participating in company task forces;  Active involvement with the development and coordination of tactical plans for managed care pull through within the geography; Maintain awareness of the development and potential advancement of employees within the region by developing regional talent plans to assist in the development of those individuals for such advancement;  Possess knowledge of medical, healthcare or pharmaceutical industry; Learn and understand regulations related to healthcare industry; Learn and disseminate complex clinical and biological information; Display strong independent work ethic, self-motivating; Use time efficiently; set goals and objectives; Uphold organizational values;  NOTE: The information presented, while not an exact or exhaustive listing, describes the work, performance standards, and qualifications typically required of employees in this job. A specific position description or employee performance plan may differ as long as it is consistent with the core responsibilities, standards and qualifications for that job. Nothing in this job description restricts management‚Äôs rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.  Kowa is committed to provide equal opportunity, employment, and advancement opportunities to all individuals. Kowa does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran, pregnancy, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, State, or Local Laws. Employment decisions at Kowa will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities.

jobTitle: Head of Institutional Sales, North America
description: Who We Are:  Okcoin is one of the world's largest and fastest growing cryptocurrency exchanges. We help millions of people buy and sell bitcoin, and over 20 other crypto assets every day ‚Äî but our work is a whole lot more than that. We're building an inclusive future of finance, one that opens new opportunities to learn financial literacy, store value, and build wealth for everyone.  Ready to help the next billion people experience the future of finance with us? Come on board. We have offices in San Francisco, Malta, Hong Kong, Singapore, Japan, and Korea, but we believe in you working wherever you work best.  About the Team:  The Okcoin sales team drives volume and revenue growth. We focus on institutional customers and HNW individuals globally. We cover a full range of crypto institutional customer segments, such as trading firms, market makers, financial intermediaries, payment providers, buy-side managers, retail brokers, etc. We work with liquidity, distribution, custody partners to build a mutually beneficial crypto ecosystem.  Okcoin sales teams are strategically located in North America, Europe, Asia and Latam to provide the best experience for our local customers. Each team has regional customer ownership and collaborates with other regional teams on global accounts.  About the Opportunity:  The successful candidate will think big about the future of crypto and how you can best serve institutions and HNWs in the ever growing crypto economy. You'll own the strategic direction and go-to-market strategy, including the ideal customer segment, roadmap, value proposition and messaging. You will possess the ability and willingness to balance customer needs with business priorities and articulate the rationale behind decisions.  The candidate is fully responsible for the volume and revenue growth in the North America region. You will identify the market with best ROI, lead marketing GTM strategy for institutional business, lead sales/account management/BD team to focus on NA VIP and institutional segment growth.  You're genuinely bullish on crypto assets and the adoption of blockchain in "traditional" finance. You are excited to develop long-term strategies and shorter term plans to meet the revenue goals.  This role is preferably based in New York, but there is flexibility to be based remotely.  What You'll Be Doing: Become and serve as an Okcoin platform expert and brand ambassador. Build and maintain a high-quality sales pipeline, by qualifying and prioritizing leads efficiently and intelligently. Hire, train and develop a team of sellers. Develop and grow relationships with prospective institutional clients. Proactively cultivate existing client relationships and drive value with senior stakeholders. Implement strategies to deliver on key revenue targets for the business. Help the business scale by collaborating with teammates to create, optimize, and maintain processes for sales, support and the CRM. Develop and deliver a white glove experience to every client. Collaborate across Product, Support and Compliance teams to continuously improve the customer experience. Train a team in technician product demonstrations, delivering the value propositions for every business line, service and offering of the Okcoin platform. Form relationships, manage deals, and close business in a remote world.  What We Look For In You: 12+ years relevant experience, preferably in a sell-side role covering institutional clients. Natural leader with proven effectiveness in leading, training sales teams You have experience using a CRM for client management and sales forecasting. Ability to independently source and close high profile clients. Solid strategic thinking, client-facing communication, and interpersonal skills. Story verbal and written storytelling capabilities. Ability to think creatively beyond the current market and contribute to the expansion of new business at Okcoin. Willingness and ability to travel for business (as health orders permit).  Nice to Haves: You are an expert in the blockchain and cryptocurrency landscape and will understand how speculators, traders, digital asset exchanges, blockchain money services businesses and financial institutions operate. Experience working in a disruptive technology, successfully driving sales in new markets, ideally, within FinTech, eCommerce, SaaS, AdTech, or Digital Wallet business experience A history (and preference) of being both strategic, analytical and execution-oriented Intellectual curiosity  Highlights of Perks and Benefits: Market competitive total compensation package Comprehensive insurance package including medical, dental, vision, disability & life insurance (Company pays 100% for employee/80% for dependents) 401K with company contribution Flexible PTO policy, company paid holidays, and flexible hours UberEats Program Paid Parental Leave Employee Referral Bonus Program paid in BTC Company Donation Match More surprises when you join!  Okcoin Statement:  Okcoin is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, and non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. description: Stackline is an all-in-one ecommerce platform for brands and retailers. By combining market intelligence, advertising automation, workflow management, and operational analytics into a single platform, Stackline delivers the industry-leading operating system for companies to scale their online retail business globally. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Seattle with additional offices in Minneapolis, New York and London, Stackline is on a mission to engineer the world‚Äôs most powerful data, tools, and services for commerce.  Over the past year, Stackline has raised $180 million in strategic investments from Goldman Sachs Growth Equity and TA Associates. Stackline‚Äôs extensive brand list includes Starbucks, Sony, General Mills, Mondelez, and Levi‚Äôs.  The Business Development Team‚ÄØat‚ÄØStackline‚ÄØis responsible for the company‚Äôs continued growth. description: LEGENDS  Founded in 2008 as a hospitality management company, Legends has transformed into a holistic experiential services agency with more than 1,200 full-time and 30,000 seasonal team members globally. Legends has three core divisions operating worldwide: Global Planning, Global Sales and Hospitality, offering clients and partners a 360-degree platform to elevate their brand and execute their vision. Currently, Legends works with marquee clients across business verticals including professional sports; collegiate; attractions; entertainment; and conventions and leisure. We are the industry leaders in designing, planning and realizing exceptional experiences in sports and entertainment.  THE PROJECT  Legends and Georgia Tech Athletics have entered into a first-of-its-kind partnership to combine all main revenue opportunities across multi-media rights, premium seating, ticketing, annual fundraising, corporate hospitality, data and analytics, business intelligence, and e-commerce into one integrated partnership. The partnership will take a customized and holistic approach for identifying new, engaging, and entertaining platforms for corporate partners and Yellow Jacket fans to connect with Georgia Tech athletics and position the Institute for success and growth in the evolving collegiate athletics landscape.  THE ROLE  The Director, Partnership Sales will conceptualize, develop, and secure key corporate sponsorships and marketing partnerships with companies wishing to maximize their relationship with Georgia Institute of Technology. The Director of Partnership Sales will be primarily responsible for driving new business development as a key member of the sales team. The Director will also be responsible for individually driving six- and seven- figure, multi-year partnerships. This position will report to the Senior Vice President, Partnership Sales & Activation.  Essential Functions Work with new partnership development team to manage key category development and platform ideation for new and existing partners Secure and conduct partnership development meetings with potential clients by leveraging relationships as well as cold outreach Aim to understand the marketing and business objectives of prospective clients and their agencies to determine how a partnership with Georgia Tech Partnerships can help them achieve their goals Develop relationships and work directly with key Institute colleagues to create a collaborative business development process and the opportunity for integrated partnerships. Work with business development team to design high-level vision decks and interactive practice pitch meetings Present Georgia Tech Athletics to potential national/international sponsorship partners and develop an integrated, solution-driven approach to creating sponsorship packages Create, package and sell solution-based naming rights and sponsorship while leading a team to meet and exceed all revenue goals Manage a pipeline of new business prospects for the entire Partnership sales team Develop and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers at client marketing companies and their respective advertising agencies Understand the marketing objectives of prospective clients and their agencies and determine how a partnership with Georgia Tech Athletics can help them achieve their goals Research and identify industries and organizations to solicit for sponsorship Negotiate and close sponsorship deals and work with counsel through contract execution Attend weekly meetings with senior-level executives and provide routine recruit updates. Be a team player and contribute to the general success of Georgia Tech Partnerships across all facets, including positively representing Georgia Tech Athletics among all corporate and Institute partners Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty above at the highest levels. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent required Minimum of five (5) years of high-level partnership revenue performance preferred selling partnerships for professional, collegiate or media sports property Preferable experience includes working with new and/or facility renovation projects within the Entertainment or Sports Industry Renowned solution-selling pedigree Solid book of business with high-level contacts at large and midsize corporations, particularly companies with sponsorship portfolios A proven track record in pitching, negotiating and closing six and seven-figure sponsorship deals Expertise in identifying opportunities, developing strategies and negotiating creative solutions Strong interpersonal and leadership abilities with excellent communication skills High energy and a personality that thrives in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment Strong work ethic and a competitive drive to win Excellence in pitching, negotiating and closing six and seven-figure sponsorship deals Ability to communicate the value of sponsorship vs. pure media as a marketing solution Ability to develop creative proposals that meet and exceed potential partners‚Äô needs Ability to excel in a collaborative, team-oriented environment Ability to quickly earn and maintain trust Ability to develop strong peer-level relationships and work in a team environment Compensation  Competitive salary, commensurate with experience, and a generous benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid vacation, and 401k plan.  Legends is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information.

description: Flexe solves the hardest omnichannel logistics problems for the world‚Äôs largest retailers and brands. Integrating technology, open logistics networks, and elastic economic models allows Flexe customers to move fast, at scale, and with precision. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Seattle, Flexe brings deep logistics expertise and enterprise-grade technology to deliver innovative eCommerce fulfillment, retail distribution, same-day delivery, and network capacity programs to the Fortune 500. For more information, please visit flexe.com .  The Director of Strategic Accounts (DSA) will have responsibility to manage primary relationships between FLEXE and a select group of highly strategic customer partnerships. The DSA will be responsible for developing a strong understanding of the customer‚Äôs supply chain and business objectives, and will design strategic account plans that facilitate long term business growth, continuous improvement, and client satisfaction. The DSA will also be required to operate collaboratively within the internal FLEXE organization, influencing & executing effectively within a matrixed organization environment.  Responsibilities Function as primary advocate for the client, understanding business needs, and developing and implementing effective solutions. Build strong, cross functional relationships with all levels of a customer organization. Responsible for budgeting, forecasting, and overall account profitability. Develop a firm knowledge of the client‚Äôs supply chain and industry. Organize & lead strategic business reviews with a client to: review service, develop consensus on short & long term initiatives, and create new growth opportunities. Understand competitive landscape, market insights, and effectively communicate across key internal and external stakeholders. Ownership of and accountability to revenue projections for account portfolio. Accountable to defined revenue growth targets for account portfolio. Drive solution concept, design, vision and relay that vision to both the client/partner and within our organization. Utilize data and scorecards to review trends and develop actionable outcomes. Facilitate contract negotiation & pricing with clients. Qualifications 10+ years experience in account management, business development, or sales in a supply chain/logistics industry required Bachelor's Degree preferred Demonstrated understanding of WMS and/or warehouse process and strong ability to articulate logistics process flow Experience in Fulfillment, eComm, and Distribution Experience working with executive-level leadership internally and externally General experience with business systems - ERP / TMS / WMS / IMS / OMS Experience in negotiating customer contracts & pricing Exceptional written, oral, and presentation communication skills Industry Certification (APICS (CSCP), SCPro, or similar) preferred Ability to travel up to 50% in a post COVID environment Must be authorized to work in the US without restriction. We will not be sponsoring visas for this role at this time This role is fully remote #LI-PW1  Benefits  The benefits package at Flexe is thoughtfully designed to help people lead healthy lives in and outside of work. Health benefits for individual: Dental and vision are covered 100% Medical is covered 100% for HSA or a small premium for PPO. 401k Matching Program Internet Stipend, while we're 100% work from home $300 Work from home office reimbursement 20 days of PTO 13 Total Holidays 10 company holidays (We've added Juneteenth to our list of holidays observed) 2 floating holidays Take your birthday off! Paid Parental Leave & Bereavement Leave Paid Volunteer Time Industry learning initiatives with talks, demos, site visits. Etc. Working At Flexe  Here are a few perks that make day to day work at Flexe even more enjoyable: Choice of MacBook or PC and monitor setup, and height adjustable standing desk Located in historic Pioneer Square; restaurants, bars, shops, and mass transit hub PhilanthroFlexe program. A quarterly program where we give back to the community through volunteer work, fundraising drives, etc. Other Benefits Available When In-office Bike lockers and showers Fully stocked pantry and beverage fridge Bake-off challenges Team sports such as Kickball, Softball, etc. Flexe participates in E-Verify, an employment authorization program through the U.S. Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration.  Flexe is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
