description: UserTesting was founded in 2007, and is backed by world class VCs: Accel, Greenspring, Insight Partners, and OpenView. In 2020, we crossed $100M in revenue, and are accelerating our international growth from our San Francisco headquarters. UserTesting is now present in 12 countries, with regional offices in Atlanta, Edinburgh, Singapore, and Oslo. Today, more than 2,000 organizations in 45 countries use the UserTesting‚ìá Human Insight Platform to make more informed, customer-first decisions at scale.  Choosing to join our team means being part of a passionate group focused on transforming the way companies learn about their customers and build better products and experiences. Using our powerful software combined with the industry‚Äôs largest and most diverse panel of test participants, our customers can quickly target their audience and receive think-aloud video feedback from real people sharing their thoughts to your questions. UserTesting‚Äôs industry-leading platform enables companies to get rapid feedback on all types of customer interactions and experiences: websites, mobile apps, prototypes, campaigns, real world experiences, and more! A recent Forrester study found the ROI of using UserTesting to be 655%!  We‚Äôre proud that this is our third year of being honored as an Inc. Best Workplace and a Fortune Best Workplace in the Bay Area, along with having received a variety of additional workplace and corporate growth awards. We‚Äôve made a commitment to build and develop a diverse workforce that reflects the labor markets in which we operate. We actively look to add amazing people to our team who will bring diversity across many lines, including race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital/family status, disability, gender identity, sex, and country of origin, in addition to bringing a variety of backgrounds, interests and opinions. At the end of 2020, our global team was 43% women and 36% minority; in the U.S., our underrepresented minority population was 16%. In the last year, we‚Äôve had more than a third of our employees take on new roles within UT. We do everything we can to make UserTesting a place where you feel you belong and are empowered to do the best work of your career.  About The Team  As a member of UserTesting's Global Accounts Sales team, you will work to grow the Usertesting footprint within Strategic accounts of target strategic prospects, and recruit them as UserTesting customers. This is a named account sales position focused on upselling large companies that are heavily focused on mobile apps and/or websites.  The Opportunity Execute a complex, solution-based consultative sales process encompassing multiple groups within Global Accounts a large enterprise located in the region Develop new business opportunities by analyzing and proactively targeting high-potential departments within Global Accounts a large enterprise Articulate and demonstrate UserTesting‚Äôs unique business and technical value Execute end-to-end sales activities, including: lead follow up, opportunity qualification, sales process, subscriber acquisition and retention Lead cross-functional team (business development, solutions consultant, client success, etc,) to guide overall account strategy as well as drive platform adoption and utilization Proactively develop unsolicited proposals that justify the expanded use of UserTesting throughout the enterprise Effectively forecast sales opportunities, while tracking and using critical metrics that predict sales success Track all relevant sales activity using the company's CRM platform (SFDC) What We‚Äôre Looking For Minimum of 8 years experience selling enterprise SaaS solutions Demonstrated enterprise/global sales success ‚Äì track record of exceeding quotas; recognition, awards Ability to travel up to 30% of time Track record of building relationships with Global 2501000 senior line-of-business and Digital Marketing, Product Management, Mobile, and Market Research executives Proven 'hunter' (new business) selling skills as well as strategic expansion selling skills Passion for working with emerging technologies and a desire to deeply understand and demonstrate UserTesting‚Äôs functionality, use cases, as well as business and technical elements Excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal and presentation skills Experience with, and effective execution of, a complex, solution-based enterprise/global sales process Experience working in a fast-paced, high growth software company where change is a constant Understands the difference between activity and results; solid work ethic Able to function independently, as well as collaboratively with UserTesting team members Passion about fundamentally transforming the way companies learn about their users To learn more about our team, culture, and customers, check out our careers page, company blog, and press/awards. Aside from a great work environment and the opportunity to change the world, we‚Äôre also growing the team quickly - join us!  UserTesting is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. jobTitle: National Director of Sales - Public Sector
description: Job Description  Summary/Objective  Carrot is currently seeking an entrepreneurial sales professional who possesses a deep understanding of the digital health market and a proven track record of exceeding past sales targets with a solution-based sales approach. This position will report to the SVP of Sales. It will establish commercial relationships with unions, federal, state, and local government accounts to dramatically reduce tobacco prevalence and improve the lives of employees by helping those employees quit nicotine with a digital-first approach. The National Sales Director is a quota-carrying rep responsible for the full sales cycle. They will also be accountable for the forecasting of and regular reporting on his/her sales pipeline. The ideal candidate will possess the determination and flexibility to leverage resources to achieve key milestones and deliver on annual goals.  Essential Functions  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Partner with SVP of Sales and Marketing to build demand for and identify leads. Monitor and analyze performance metrics and develop strategies for improvement Prepare monthly sales reporting that reflects activity, conversion rates, and accurate forecasts. Perform research and identify new potential customers and new opportunities. Develop and implement sales strategies to achieve sales targets. Communicate with marketing, client success, product, and technology as necessary to ensure partnership and buy-in when bringing clients through contracting. Live and breathe the Pivot product and demonstrate a firm grasp of clinical trial publications, new marketing, reporting, and integration of the Pivot program to ensure compelling prospect meetings and move deals forward in the pipeline. Leverage personal connections with benefit leaders and consultants to identify and accelerate opportunities. Negotiate and close client opportunities that meet the needs of Carrot's long-term mission. Initiate sales negotiations, prepare and execute close strategies for each opportunity Achieve assigned targets, including those targeting activities, leads, forecasting accuracy, and sales objectives (estimated value and contract completion) Collaborate with Carrot resources in developing sales proposals and responses to RFPs. Provide high-quality market feedback on competitive activity, pricing, and other industry trends. Embrace and embody company values.  Competencies Proven track record of success in digital health and a passion for helping tobacco users Demonstrated success with large employees benefits sales of innovative products and/or solutions. Well-versed in the strategy, negotiation, and alliance management activities necessary for developing and supporting sales channels. Ability to think creatively and develop non-traditional solutions to complex business challenges. Embrace CRM usage to improve lead tracking, close rates, and seamless customer experience. Ability to be hands-on as well as be strategic.  Work Environment  This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones.  Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.  Position Type/Expected Hours of Work  This is a full-time position Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. This position may occasionally require long hours and weekend work.  Travel  This position requires frequent travel, more than 50%. Most travel is outside the local area and often overnight. Currently, there is no international travel.  Required Education And Experience  Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience in a sales/commercial/business function.  Additional Eligibility Qualifications  Maintain current knowledge of industry trends.  Work Authorization/Security Clearance (if applicable)  Employment eligibility and authorization to work in the United States.  AAP/EEO Statement  It is the policy of Carrot Inc to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Carrot Inc will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. description: About You  ABOUT MAIDBOT  You are a motivated individual with the desire to build strong partnerships with prospective clients, deliver solutions to hospitality, commercial cleaning and other industries, and convert leads into closed deals. description: The Serb National Federation (SNF) is a 120-year-old nonprofit Fraternal Benefit Society providing quality life insurance protection and retirement plans according to the needs and means of its members.  Headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, our philosophy of service and policyholder protection has made the SNF one of the most progressive and highly regarded Fraternal Benefit Societies. We are seeking an experienced results-driven National Sales Director with a passion for success. An individual that can teach people to invest in themselves through SNF insurance and retirement products. Job Summary: National Sales Director Duties/Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢        Continue the establishment and supervision of a national sales force. ‚Ä¢        Recruit and supervise agents and members to sell SNF products. ‚Ä¢        Educate agents and members about SNF‚Äôs various insurance and annuity products. ‚Ä¢        Develop sales and marketing tools for SNF‚Äôs insurance and annuity products. ‚Ä¢        Assist agents and members with SNF‚Äôs insurance and annuity products. ‚Ä¢        Assist and educate agents and members concerning state licensure procedures. ‚Ä¢        Contact prospective clients about insurance products and policies. ‚Ä¢        Meet with potential clients to discuss adequacy of existing insurance coverage and related financial resources. ‚Ä¢        Explain various insurance policies and products to potential and existing clients; guide clients in selecting coverage to best meet their needs. ‚Ä¢        Suggest modifications and updates to clients‚Äô existing insurance policies. ‚Ä¢        Build customized insurance policies and packages to meet clients‚Äô needs. ‚Ä¢        Perform other related duties as assigned.  ‚Ä¢        Translate corporate goals into functional and individual goals. ‚Ä¢        Monitor performance and initiate action to strengthen results. ‚Ä¢        Monitor and control expenses and budgets. ‚Ä¢        Track and report scorecard results to senior management. ‚Ä¢        Plan and goal-set for future periods. Required Skills/Abilities: ‚Ä¢        Extensive knowledge of various insurance products and policies. ‚Ä¢        Ability to determine the best insurance policy for individual clients. ‚Ä¢        Excellent interpersonal and sales skills. ‚Ä¢        Ability to identify and contact prospective clients. ‚Ä¢        Excellent written and verbal communication skills. ‚Ä¢        Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.   Education and Experience: ‚Ä¢        Demonstrated track record of building a network of agents with documented new policy sales growth. ‚Ä¢        Insurance Sales Experience: 7 years; experience in Fraternal Life Insurance industry (preferred). ‚Ä¢        Licensed to Sell Insurance required; able to pursue licenses in applicable states within 6 months of hiring. ‚Ä¢        Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred. High school diploma or equivalent required. ‚Ä¢        Driver‚Äôs license required.  Physical Requirements: ‚Ä¢        Ability to withstand prolonged periods of sitting at a desk, driving, and working on a computer. ‚Ä¢        Ability to lift a minimum of 15 pounds. Benefits: ¬∑        Health Insurance (Dental and Vision) - Life Insurance ‚Äì Disability Insurance ¬∑        403(b) matching retirement plan ‚Äì Paid Time Off  Compensation will be commensurate with experience.  If you feel that you have the experience and drive to succeed as a National Sales Director for the SNF, please submit your resume to careers@snflife.org.  Serb National Federation; An Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobTitle: West Zone Sales Manager, Pharmaceutical Diagnostics
description: Job Description Summary  Lead the Western US Commercial Sales Team organization, defines and implements the product strategy across multiple channels and partners. Responsible to grow profitability of the franchise, focused on both commercial and operational aspects. Key metrics of success are: sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share. Key role in the global organization, including R&D and product management, suggesting product portfolio evolution and creating business opportunities to leverage & improve products/brands equity.Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is a global leader in imaging agents, used to improve and enhance the images that radiologists use to diagnose and monitor disease. We support healthcare professionals in the administration of neurology, cardiology and oncology procedures that are used to image three patients around the world, every second.  Job DescriptionRoles and Responsibilities   Lead and implement the Sales for the western region, managing overall sales, profit, cash, Customer satisfaction and market share in a manner that fulfills business and achieves targets. Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources. Strong background in working with cross-functional department within a business. Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision. Manages a small to medium team of senior professionals as well as others. Lead the management team in the region, ensuring strong collaboration between Sales and functions including Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, Marketing and Commercial Operations. Optimize the use of resources to cover market potential to achieve the operating plan. Know, interact and develop the strategy with Key Opinion Leaders and decision makers in product relevant scientific areas; manage professional relations with key Customers to ensure understanding of needs and that GE Healthcare product value proposition is differentiated in the minds of these key Customer groups. Nurture relationships with professional society stakeholders.  Required Qualifications   Education to bachelor‚Äôs degree level, in relevant scientific area. Minimum of 3 years of Management experience Minimum of 6 years in the the Healthcare industry Ability to travel 30% to40% of the time  Desired Characteristics   Exemplary people management, leadership skills, as well as sales coaching, and team building skills. Demonstrated business management and resource allocation skills including business plan development. Change agent with energy, passion and enthusiasm to drive change. Ability to translate strategy into specific actions with clear accountability, making decisions with speed and accuracy based on best available information and communicating priorities clearly. Ability to communicate and present ideas to Customers in a way that produces understanding and impact that builds effective strategic relationships. Strong business acumen; financial and organizational skills. Advanced negotiation, problem solving and influencing skills.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Cooler Screens is backed and lead by some of the most prominent Chicago & Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors and has developed a digital solution to create and transform a multi-billion dollar industry and positively affect the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. If you‚Äôre looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story ‚Äì this opportunity may be for you.  As the VP of Advertising Sales at Cooler Screens, you will be responsible for dramatically growing advertising revenue. Specifically, you will work with the Cooler Screens team to execute and evolve our Go to Market Sales approach, partnering with Verizon Media who is our Go to Market Sales channel. You will need to have experience and success in direct and indirect sales. Importantly, we need you to have experience with brands and their agencies for Major Accounts like: P&G; J&J, Kellogg‚Äôs; General Mills, etc.  We are hiring 6 VPs of Advertising Sales and looking for people with relevant experience in CSD, Water, Food, Wine & Spirits, Energy, Sports Drinks as well as Sales VPs who have experience with key accounts such as P&G, J&J, etc. VP of Advertising Sales: Major Account VP of Advertising Sales: CSD VP of Advertising Sales: Food VP of Advertising Sales: Wine & Spirits You need to have a passion and a track record on building and leveraging key brand, shopper and digital relationships within our customers‚Äô organizations to drive required results and exceed goals. You need to be well versed in executing and developing both B2B and B2C Value Props and have a rich understanding of how data and results drive the outcomes for our CPG customers. Importantly, you need an appreciation and ability to partner with key sales channels to grow revenue, relationships and evangelization of our new industry.  As we transform the retail customer experience with our digital media platform, we invite you to join Cooler Screens in enabling the journey.  Who You Are: You have expansive experience and a track record of both Indirect and Direct success to selling digital advertising to senior executives. You possess strong relationship skills and a track record on Indirect selling- especially within key Major Accounts. You have experience and a successful track record driving results with and through a sales channel. You are comfortable and have a track record working in fast-paced environments. (Start-up experience is helpful). You are a team player and will work well within the existing Cooler Screens team and growing industry. You have a deep appreciation of leveraging value propositions to win and grow accounts. You have an understanding, expertise, and experience in the fast-changing retail media ecosystem. Experience partnering with retail merchandising teams to maximize value. You can partner with Product, Operations, Finance, and other internal Cooler Screens teams to develop the future of GTM capabilities and plans. You are a positive team player with a passion for winning and having fun.  What You Need To Succeed Expertise and a track record of rapidly growing digital revenue. Comfortable partnering and driving results via our sales channel. Track record and comfortable in working with CMOs/Heads of Sales and leaders of leading companies. Command of digital sales ecosystem: Value Prop to sales cycles. Track record of working with big CPG companies (and/or other large Fortune 500 companies) and their agency partners. Capacity to effectively communicate key metrics and value props to grow revenue. Ability to leverage insights surrounding the performance of advertising and provide recommendations to maximize advertising effectiveness. Cooler Perks  For the right candidate, we have a competitive compensation and ownership package with an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks. Come join our fast-growing team. You can be based in Chicago or possibly elsewhere.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. description: Description  Zycus is hiring Director for Customer Account Management in the North America region. The Customer Account Management role is an individual contributor role, reporting to the Vice President-Customer Account Management. We are a SAAS cloud product company recognized by Gartner as leader in GMQ. You will be responsible for farming the accounts and cross-selling and up-selling into out existing accounts which are very large enterprises.  The incumbent is the key owner of our existing customer relationships, and is responsible for driving the ongoing adoption, benefit realization, and retention and growth of the Zycus solution within an assigned set of customers. This individual should be comfortable consulting and influencing customers, developing, positioning and closing sales opportunities and managing all financial aspects of the relationship - backed by a strong understanding of the customers‚Äô business objectives and the capabilities of the Zycus solution. Performance in the role is measured by customer retention, account growth, and customer reference-ability.  Requirements Be the face of Zycus for our customers. Be the Voice of the customer and collaborate with various Cross-functional teams to ensure ROI. Work closely with Implementation, Product & Support teams to ensure customer requirements are met with committed schedule and required quality. Generate sales opportunities & leads for upsell and cross-sell. CAM is directly responsible for negotiating and closing customer renewals, cross-sell and upsell opportunities. Define customer account plans and strategy in various accounts. Customer Account Manager must have managed renewal of existing client contracts ranging from $250K + to $1 Million+ Connect with senior client stakeholders to fully understand their strategy and roadmap to ensure alignment with Zycus. Continuous engagement & consulting with customer and create a platform for sharing Industry & Zycus Customer best practices. Minimize Customer churn and ensure higher customer adoption of Zycus solution, with high satisfaction ratings (CSIs). Ensure customer references for Zycus Solutions. Create value added services around Zycus Solutions. Enabling customer to get the desired ROI from Zycus solutions. Skills Be a self-starter, a highly motivated person able to work in a fast-paced environment that is continually changing. Ability to be pro-active with a sense of urgency. Strong analytical skills; problem solving skills. Ability to read, understand and communicate technical documentation and relate to clients and business needs. Excellent engagement and solution selling skills including discovery skills, negotiation skills & networking skills Experience working with Customer Relationship Management and/or Customer Success solutions. Open to Travel. A US Citizenship or Green Card. Open to work from home / remote office / regional office. Get the accurate pulse of customer needs, goals and expectations from implementation through to operations. Identify opportunities and execute strategic and tactical initiatives to ensure the customer pulse is strong. Benefits  WHY YOU SHOULD WORK WITH US? Join the Experts: Zycus has been consistently recognized by Gartner and Forrester as a Leader in Strategic Sourcing and Source-to-Contract Suites. We moved further on the ‚Äòcompleteness of vision‚Äô axis within a year in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Procure-to-Pay Suites, published in October 2020. (https://www.zycus.com/ ) Play a critical role in taking the business to the next level and champion thought leadership in Autonomous Procurement with our Merlin AI Suite Enjoy 401K and competitive health insurance benefits Advance your career with us. We‚Äôre enthusiastic to help our employees learn different aspects of the business, be challenged with new tasks, be mentored and grow. About Us  Zycus is a pioneer in Cognitive Procurement software and has been a trusted partner of choice for large global enterprises for two decades. Zycus has been consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and other analysts for its Source to Pay integrated suite. Zycus powers its S2P software with the revolutionary Merlin AI Suite. Merlin AI takes over the tactical tasks and empowers procurement and AP officers to focus on strategic projects; offers data-driven actionable insights for quicker and smarter decisions, and its conversational AI offers a B2C type user-experience to the end-users.  Zycus helps enterprises drive real savings, reduce risks, and boost compliance, and its seamless, intuitive, and easy-to-use user interface ensures high adoption and value across the organization.  Start your #CognitiveProcurement journey with us, as you are #MeantforMore

description: Quit Genius is the #1 digital clinic for substance addictions. We are on a mission to help 100 million people overcome tobacco, alcohol and opioid addictions by combining technology, healthcare and design. It‚Äôs an ambitious mission, but one we fully believe in and we hire people who share our aspirations and core values.  We are a global team of doctors, designers, engineers and researchers who are aligned by one common goal. Authenticity, creativity, purpose and thoughtfulness are at the heart of everything we do to deliver that goal, so finding exceptional people to come on the journey is everything to us. Quit Genius has scaled to dozens of health plans and employers, covering over 2 million lives and has already helped more than 750,000 members conquer their addictions. As of 2021, we have raised $78M from leading global investors and now work with 100+ world-class team members across our New York, London, and remote offices.  If you are passionate about making an impact on the health of others, join us and make it happen!  We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Sales Executive to help drive growth by closing key accounts. In this role, the candidate will help drive growth and shape the future of an emerging service that will have a significant impact on our business and the digital healthcare industry at large. Our ideal candidate will be a strong relationship builder and has a strong track record of sales success working with large enterprise organizations. Must be open to regular travel.  Please note - this role will be fully remote and based anywhere across the South-East.  Responsibilities Take charge of the sales process from beginning to end: from first contact to signing the contract and closing the deal. Generate new leads by reaching out to decision makers in benefit teams and excite prospects about the Quit Genius program. Manage a pipeline of self-insured employer clients and maintain clean records in Salesforce.com in accordance with all company data policies Be in charge of building partner relationships with key benefits and wellness consultants. Become an additional spokesperson for the business at conferences and other industry events. Work cross functionally to drive organizational value Act as the ‚Äúquarterback‚Äù of your deals bringing in subject matter experts that can drive value to prospects and earn new clients The background we are looking for Minimum of 5 years experience selling digital health solutions in the employer benefits space with a history of closing complex deals. History of consistently exceeding quotas with a results-oriented nature. The ability to lead on high level sales pitches to senior executives. Excellent organization, communication (verbal and written) and management skills. Positive attitude: go getter who does not quit and is not afraid of rejection. The ability to innovate and solve problems creatively and are comfortable working with the uncertainty of a fast-paced start-up. A commitment to personal growth with a strong desire to learn and self-develop. Passion for the company‚Äôs mission to help millions quit smoking and improve their lives. A willingness to take a large degree of responsibility from the outset. A willingness to travel. Nice to have: Existing relationships that they can leverage in the employer benefit or healthcare space. Nice to have: Entrepreneurship or startup experience. Ideal locations: Atlanta, Charlotte, Tampa/Miami/Orlando, Nashville Benefits at Quit Genius Generous and meaningful stock options. A competitive base salary with variable compensation. Full Medical, dental, vision coverage. 401k An awesome culture - check it out here www.quitgenius.com/careers Highly flexible work schedule. Flexible vacation policy. Opportunity to join the executive team and significantly contribute to key decisions in the development of the business as a whole. Accelerated career growth opportunities to match the fast-paced growth of the business. Join a talented, passionate and ambitious team of doctors, designers and technologists with a fun-loving culture. The opportunity to have a big impact. What we do saves lives. Our teams at Quit Genius are made up of an incredible range of talented people from all walks of life. We believe that diversity of any description leads to innovation, idea sharing and collaboration.  Quit Genius is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status. Diversity and Inclusion are paramount to the success of our mission and our culture is driven by our differences, each of which we embrace with open arms.

description: SALES & MARKETING:  ‚Ä¢ Responsible for hunting new accounts, building pipeline, book revenues from Global markets (predominantly US and Canada). ‚Ä¢ Formulate & implement short & long term Sales & Marketing strategies for Datamatics‚Äô LeadGen, Marketing and Data Services. ‚Ä¢ Participate in strategic sales and marketing planning and trade planning by analyzing business, service, competitors and market situations. ‚Ä¢ Responsible for carrying out the prospect mapping, pipeline mapping, proposals in line with customer requirement, preparation of reports, cost analysis, negotiations and closure of deal. ‚Ä¢ Attend meetings regularly to understand client‚Äôs requirement & provide best solutions. ‚Ä¢ Interact and maintain relationships with existing clients to enable cross-selling and up-selling activities. ‚Ä¢ Perform SWOT analysis and recommend appropriate strategic decisions to Top management. ‚Ä¢ Plan, Organize, Implement and Control all marketing functions such as new service launch plan, set up pricing according to price structure, develop and implement promotional activity.  CRITICAL COMPETENCIES:  ‚Ä¢ 15+ years of overall experience with majority of them in sales in Marketing Industry. ‚Ä¢ Independently manage a revenue target of USD 1 to 2 Million. ‚Ä¢ Pipeline Management ‚Äì Builds a pipeline with reasonable timelines and is able to continually manage it and follow through with individual prospects, delivering successful sales. ‚Ä¢ Deal Management ‚Äì Closes deals as per pipeline and forecast sales as per agreed time commitments. Able to measure success against competition and where forecast deals are unsuccessful, is able to understand and gain market information as to why a deal is lost.  Scope of Services: LeadGen, BANT, Email Marketing, Data, Content Syndication and other Marketing Services. Please visit the website links mentioned below for more information on our services.  https://www.datamaticsbpm.com/b2b-demand-generation/ https://www.datamaticsbpm.com/b2b-data-solutions/ https://www.datamaticsbpm.com/content-moderation-solutions/  Please share your resume to deepali.shetty@datamaticsbpm.com and rakesh.jadhav@datamaticsbpm.com

description: Summary:  As the Business Manager (Americas), you are responsible for the go-to market strategy and the success of our Global Business Units from a regional perspective. You are focused on business results, first and foremost, making sure we hit and exceed our sales and market share targets. As the Business Manager, you craft amazing plans that ensure those goals are met. You are an extension of the Global Business Unit and responsible for driving that strategy, while also adding your unique knowledge of the regional market and passing that onto the Global team. You are an excellent communicator and are heavily valued in the organization.  Responsibilities: Product Launch and Lifecycle Planning for Americas ‚Äì Developing detailed product launch and lifecycle marketing plans, messaging, promotions, budgets, and campaigns. New Category Launch Plans ‚Äì Developing channel strategy. Competitive Product Analysis ‚Äì US market share tracking, reporting & analysis. Prepare and present Key Account Sales Presentations. US pricing/channel analysis and strategy development with sales leadership Drive the BU strategy in the Americas ‚Äì Aligning marketing and sales to deliver results in both sell-through and market share. Evaluating competitive products ‚Äì provide insights to engineering/design team. Execute impactful product launches that grow Razer's share of the TAM. Master the platform's unique abilities to position Razer for continued growth. Implement promotion plans and strategies based on sales and market data analysis. Focus on Advertising optimization, traffic, and conversion as main KPI's. Travel required up to 15% of the time, domestic and/or international.  Qualifications: BA/BS degree in Business, or related field from competitive college or university. MBA desired. 5+ years business management experience or combination of sales and marketing experience in consumer technology/entertainment categories. Must have experience pitching/launching/selling through products in Retail & Ecommerce. Experience with Amazon Advertising or other digital media platforms. An established record of meeting or exceeding goals. Excellent analytical skills with loads of examples of data-based decisions. Exceptional communication, persuasion, and presentation skills. Outstanding teamwork, organizational interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Passionate, ambitious, self-starter, charismatic.  About Razer  Razer‚Ñ¢ is the world's leading lifestyle brand for gamers.  The triple-headed snake trademark of Razer is one of the most recognized logos in the global gaming and esports communities.  With a fan base that spans every continent, the company has designed and built the world's largest gamer-focused ecosystem of hardware, software and services.  Razer's award-winning hardware includes high-performance gaming peripherals and Blade gaming laptops.  Razer's software platform, with over 125 million users, includes Razer Synapse (an Internet of Things platform), Razer Chroma RGB (a proprietary RGB lighting technology system), and Razer Cortex (a game optimizer and launcher).  Razer also offers payment services for gamers, youth, millennials and Gen Z. Razer Gold is one of the world's largest game payment services, and Razer Fintech provides fintech services in emerging markets.  Founded in 2005 and dual-headquartered in Irvine (California) and Singapore, Razer has 17 offices worldwide and is recognized as the leading brand for gamers in the USA, Europe and China. Razer is listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (Stock Code: 1337).

description: MALKA Media is seeking an Account Director to join our Client Services team to support our growing list of clients and build the best client experience for our creative partners! You will help drive our business and creative and production services for several of our Fortune 500 clients. Given the success of our integrated creative studio model, you will identify net new opportunities within the organization, while maintaining existing relationships and overseeing current projects. This could include anything from branded content, docuseries, testimonial videos, animated explainers, VR projects, podcasts, social media campaigns and traditional broadcast advertising, just to name a few. This role is a hybrid of new business development and client management; servicing a list of existing relationships that you will have the opportunity to build and continue to grow. You will be able to work with clients across every department and in every creative medium, ensuring that their needs are matched with the highest level of customer service and satisfaction.  You will need to invest yourself in the client‚Äôs creative and business needs, understanding their marketing strategy and objectives to work with our creative team to brainstorm content solutions that fit within their timeline and financial guardrails. You will act as a creative consultant, bringing the wealth of knowledge we have across every creative proficiency and industry to the forefront to solve real business problems, both large and small, on our clients behalf.    You will need to be team orientated, an agile thinker and have a creative viewpoint to ideate with our creative staff in real-time. You must be an effective communicator, incredibly well organized and able to build sales decks, proposals and budgets. You also must be able to present and pitch effectively, and feel confident standing in front of a room of 20 executives and/or on the phone with just one.   Requirements / Responsibilities: 3-7 years of successful sales/account management experience in a creative/media agency, production company or related creative service industry Proven track record of working on a quota structure and exceeding revenue expectations Ability to create and present budgets to executive level clients, both via phone and in-person A self starter who can outreach to new and prospective clients without hesitation Must understand sales tactics and marketing/outreach campaigns, and can formalize a sales plan and achieve monthly quote goals Proven ability to navigate large client organizations and have experience selling to, and working with, large brands Excellent track record of building impactful client relationships and delivering the best client experience Ability to lead, develop and motivate a team Superior written and verbal communication skills, and outstanding presentation abilities Ability to manage several projects and/or accounts simultaneously, while remaining sensitive to deadlines  About Us:  MALKA is a creative studio with the instincts of a creative agency, but built on the backbone of an agile production company. We don't just dream it, we create it; because we know how and we have everything we need to do it. We produce feature documentaries, shows, and podcasts, represent talent in the NFL, UFC, and esports, develop ad campaigns and creative for some of the biggest brands in the world, produce daily live streams and entertainment for virtual audiences, and create thousands of pieces of video, design, and animated content across every visual medium that exists. We took what was typically done by multiple vendors and built it under a single roof. Not only does that allow our creatives to expand their capabilities‚Äîit elevates every piece of content that comes out of our studio. This is content at the speed of culture. With facilities in Santa Monica, CA, and Jersey City, NJ and over 120 creatives, we plug in anywhere, anytime, on projects large and small, for clients across every industry.  At MALKA we are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/D/F/V.

Our mission is to improve the performance of athletes and teams, which we do by engineering the premier technology platform for sport. We've been at the forefront of sports technology and science since 2006 - we don't just work in the sporting industry, we are actively changing its future. Our solutions are designed to help athletes and coaches "play smart" in a world where 1% can literally mean the difference between winning and losing.  We work with over 3,000 teams around the world, empowering coaches, managers and trainers in premier teams in the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLS, EPL, AFL, NRL, NCAA and more. We provide the information they need to optimise athletes' health, game-day readiness, and performance, as well as in-game tactics. Our solutions include wearable technology, video analytics, and athlete monitoring solutions, and we are passionate about helping sports organizations at all levels to better scout, recruit, teach, and win.  WE WANT PEOPLE WHO ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT SPORTS, SALES AND WANT TO WIN  We are looking for a talented and inquisitive Sales Director whose drive for learning and determination for continuous improvement aligns with our ambitious, fast-growing and transforming company. You will be a key player and responsible for leading and developing the North American Commercial team. Using the resources and technology provided, you will grow and expand the client base, strengthen the brand and drive revenues while adhering to the Catapult culture code and values. This will be a remote-based position with responsibilities across multiple sports across the country while reporting to the VP Commercial - North America  What You'll Do Effectively manage the sales staff training, motivating, and supporting a passionate team of employees Identify key sales metrics, define and measure the sales process to develop benchmarks for growth Build the sales team beyond the current size and help attract and train gifted and passionate sales associates Manage the implementation and execution of the global and local sales strategies. Ensure that sales goals are thoughtfully developed and executed Develop, implement and manage systems and processes to ensure maximum productivity, great client experience and a fun work environment Maintain proper documentation of sales processes and best practices. Complete quarterly commission and performance reports for each sales team member Ensuring that customer contracts are in a position to be signed by Catapult with regards to legal administration. Effectively communicate and collaborate with the customer support department, to ensure client expectations are set realistically and achieved as promised. Participate in the interview process when adding to the inside sales team. Prepare relevant internal sales documents and reports for the executive team. Maintain accountability for team sales targets  What You'll Need Proven track record selling to elite sports teams Bachelor's degree desired Exceptional, proven sales track record in similar roles, preferably in a sports, or technology/SaaS environment. Proven track record of driving discipline and rigour in the sales process, including being accountable for CRM data entry and maintenance to enable accurate pipeline and metrics reporting. Proven ability to drive the sales process for large and complex deals, from lead generation to close. Proven ability to grow a high performing team by recruiting and developing talent Excellent communication skills and ability to influence at all levels both internally and externally. Including C-suite. Adaptable. We know our current needs, and we work at a very fast pace to achieve these. At times, we'll demand a lot, but you'll be rewarded well in return. We understand life balance and respect it. 8+ years of business development to business sales experience required 3-5 years managing or leading a sales team required Willing to travel (up to 50% of the time when local restrictions permit)  WHY CATAPULT? We have amazing people. We can promise you will work with some of the most ambitious and intelligent people in an exciting industry, and you will do some of the best work of your life. We encourage our people to have constructive, open and honest communication in order to make Catapult extraordinary; innovate and create smart solutions; establish a collaborative, yet challenging, environment to develop our performance and the performance of our customers. Our workforce spans more than 20 countries, you'll have the opportunity to work across multiple nationalities and cultures, and build your global awareness and capability We value improvement and development. We are challenging ourselves to continuously grow and become a high-performance company. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do, and our people are always looking for ways to do things better. There is unlimited opportunity to grow, do more, and do better.  Whether you're interested in sports or not, you'll have the satisfaction of knowing your work is supporting some of the most successful teams and athletes on the planet!  Research shows that while men apply for jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't meet every single point in our job ad, please still get in touch! We would love to have a chat and see if you could be a great addition to our team. We are building the future of sports performance, our priority is to find the brightest talent that can add to our team culture, those who actively contribute and who are excited about what they do.

description: We all interact with some form of customer service every day, whether it‚Äôs buying coffee, returning that shirt that looked a lot cooler in the photos, or trying to find somebody to help us when we‚Äôre shopping online.  We know the difference between great customer experience and one that leaves us feeling frustrated and neglected.  A great customer experience is the differentiator when it comes to brand loyalty, repeat purchases and lifetime value.   Thanks to Amazon Prime, our expectations have never been higher when it comes to how quickly we expect brands to respond to us, and we have very little patience when we don‚Äôt get what we want.   So why do so many brands still get it wrong?   The problem is the outdated Contact Center Model.   Decades old and never designed for the round the clock world of digital channels like email, chat, text and social media, the traditional model is inflexible and hard to scale.  It‚Äôs impossible to stay consistently responsive without ballooning costs, so brands make constant costly trade offs between engaging their customers and deflecting them with bots, forecasting as best they can and hoping to get it right.  They never do!     Simplr set out to solve this problem with a unique Human First, Technology enabled approach.  Launched in 2017 and backed by Asurion, one of the largest customer support organizations in the world, Simplr‚Äôs NOW CX model enables brands to offer best in class customer service across all digital channels 24/7.High quality, fast responses with a human touch for empathy and brand loyalty, and AI and Machine Learning for precision, accuracy and product/service recommendations to help drive revenue and repeat business.   We‚Äôre changing the model and it couldn‚Äôt be more timely.  We have a unique opportunity with the only enabling platform in the market, and a network of thousands of specialists who help deliver exceptional experiences to our partners. With double digit growth last year and on track to do it again, our team is growing fast.     Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options. Sells products by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions. Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements. Remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors. Develops relationships with target base of customers, identify and understand customer pain points and challenges using a consultative sales approach, and position Simplr's on demand customer support solution effectively to address those challenges. Conducts and coordinates resources for discovery calls, presentations, and demos with a broad level of audiences including Customer Experience leaders in Contact Centers, Ecommerce and Operations leaders Track all opportunity and customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in HubSpot. Work strategically with management and teammates to identify opportunities to accelerate our sales processes, capitalize on emerging market developments and strengthen our value proposition. What You‚Äôll Bring to the Team: 5+ years of experience selling technology products and/or services to Large and Enterprise customers, navigating a complex sales process selling to multiple decision makers and influencers. ($500Kto $1.5M for ‚Äúlarge‚Äù deals, $1.5M and up in ARR for Enterprise on average Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent time of work experience. Demonstrated success in quota and territory management and selling through influence. Strong presentation skills to small and large groups including VP and C-level executives. Experience in a fast paced start up, with a willingness to contribute ideas, take initiative without waiting for processes, and a sense of humor when things get a little chaotic. The ability to create a vision, tell a compelling story in your selling process.  Territory:  Candidate location is flexible, but ideally near Nashville or Boston. Individuals will cover a list of named accounts. Travel will be required, in line with ongoing safety and health consideration of Covid.

description: Company Description  At Atlas Ocean Voyages, we invite modern explorers to embark on a new style of luxe-adventure travel. Our inaugural itineraries in the Holy Land, Mediterranean, Black Sea, and Antarctica will take bucket-list travel to new levels of discovery, while our intimate size ships enable guests to experience port cities and landscapes that are impossible for larger ships to reach. Holding just under 200 guests, World Navigator began sailing in 2021.  Atlas Ocean Voyages comes from a distinguished travel pedigree. We are a U.S. brand of MysticInvest Holdings (MIH). With more than 25 years of hospitality experience, MIH is a business leader in the travel and tourism sector, including river cruises, tours and attractions.  Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, our leadership consists of cruise industry experts with almost 10 decades of combined experience. We are also travel enthusiasts, and we look forward to crafting experiences that take elite travelers off the beaten path.  Job Description  Looking for Luxury, Expedition Sales Professionals in Texas  Successful Candidates Are Able To  We are searching for an exceptional Regional Sales Director to join our small and agile start-up team. Our Regional Sales Directors play a key role in introducing our new expedition cruise brand to the North American trade and adventure travel marketplace. Potential candidates will be responsible for establishing new relationships, building brand awareness, executing sales strategies, generating revenue from travel advisor partners, surpassing established goals and achieving objectives. Prospect and hunt for new adventure travel partnerships Develop and execute penetration strategies that are in-line with the company‚Äôs overall sales strategy Maintain strong and effective long-term relationships that are consistent and continue to evolve with company objectives Effectively manage travel partner relationships and set/achieve growth targets through regular contact and informative communication via innovative sales calls appropriately designed to manage a large territory Maintain a high level of product knowledge and understand the overall marketplace, competitors‚Äô strengths and weaknesses, economic and industry trends, etc. Leverage technology and social media platforms to provide robust training and elevate engagement with our Brand; seize any virtual training opportunities in an effort to reach the largest audience as possible Focus on time management in an effort to create the greatest revenue generating opportunities that support regional growth Respond to customer needs and process all paperwork in a timely manner. Evaluate ROI of trade shows and consumer events; participate when identified as valuable Ensure that marketing collateral is utilized effectively and efficiently; manage inventory and distribution appropriately Utilize company CRM tools to maintain territory database, record sales activities, distribute travel partner production reports and manage e-mail communication Coordinate and oversee marketing initiatives executed by travel partners. Efficiently manage a sales and cooperative marketing budget inside established guidelines while mindful of policies and procedures Attend and actively participate in any national or regional sales meetings, including, when scheduled for Sales attendance Submit weekly report to management which summarizes the competitive environment in their Region, to advise management of any specific problems that need attention, and report any trends or observations of any kind they feel are important for management to be aware of that affect AOV Cruises‚Äô operating environment Submit Expense reports with all needed backup in a timely fashion and comply with company guidelines regarding expense procedures Handle related job functions as requested Qualifications Must have 3 to 5 years expedition cruise sales experience Legally permitted to work in the United States and possess required documentation Have a valid driver‚Äôs license and own a reliable vehicle Have a valid passport and able to travel internationally as overseas travel may be required Ability to travel within a large territory on a regular basis. 60% travel required Able to manage irregular work hours that include both evenings and weekends Proficient with the Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.) as well as internet, conference call and webinar tools Able to lift 20lbs with or without reasonable accommodation Able to sit, stand & walk for long periods of time Proficiency using Microsoft Teams and Video Conferencing platforms Additional Information  About You You, ideally, reside in Texas You exemplify our brand You are flexible and able to adjust to changing needs in a start-up environment You are ‚Äúwell-traveled‚Äù and have 10+ years of sales experience in the luxury/premium travel industry You have at least 3 years of field sales experience and working remotely In addition to selling cruises, have experience selling expedition type travel and land packages that include hiking, biking, kayaking, and other outdoor adventure activities in addition to selling cruises is a big plus You have a book of business consisting of travel professionals focused on selling adventurous, luxury, and/or expedition-type vacations. References are required and will be contacted You are goal-oriented, an overachiever and have a track record of consistently hitting your assigned revenue and/or guest targets You lead an active lifestyle; health and wellness are important to you. You have a savvy social media presence. You will be asked to friend us on Facebook and allow us to follow you on Instagram You are a team player, strategic thinker, and have strong negotiation skills. description: Opportunity: Director of Sales   Develop and execute strategic sales plans through direct sales, marketing, e-commerce channels, public relations, and community partnerships. Required to sit for extended periods, lift up to 10 pounds, bend, reach, use hands and fingers to operate keyboard. Moderate travel between hotel and client‚Äôs locations required. What We Believe  People Are Our Capability ‚Äì Hearts That Serve ‚Äì Only Excellence ‚Äì Stay Nimble - Own It

description: Company Overview  WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world‚Äôs best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  This is our story  We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.  See what it‚Äôs like to work at CNN! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.  Join us. Shape your story here.  The Job  The Director, Business Operations role is responsible for consulting with external vendors, internal Sales, Client Success Managers, Product Management, Ad Traffickers, Content Partnership, Billing/Invoicing and Engineering teams regarding the business needs and goals for current and future process, organizational structure and technology. The role is both client-facing (mostly internal) and process improvement focused.  The Daily Identify gaps in WarnerMedia‚Äôs ad sales workflows and lead the development of system, organizational and process solutions to address Own cross-functional business and operational workstreams in partnership with key stakeholders across Sales & Sales Leadership, Client Success, Content Partnerships, Ad Trafficking, Billing and Product Own business reporting metrics and analytics, creating visibility into our sales funnel, conducting analysis on sales effectiveness, and bringing insights and leadership into our business processes Assist in the development of GTM sales strategy and ongoing progress of our sales function Define and help create the Business Operations team necessary to ensure success Assist Salesforce team with testing new development and integrations on behalf of Sales Develop and share management best practices within the organization Assist AMSU with creating training curriculums on new technology and workflows The Essentials Bachelor‚Äôs Degree You are willing to roll up your sleeves to do what‚Äôs needed to be done. description: CafeMedia is looking for a seasoned, go-getting VP, Midwest Sales to join our team! Your mission is to connect our publishers with leading brands through programmatic media and branded content sales. You will lead CafeMedia‚Äôs Midwest sales team, managing your own book of business along with our team of Midwest-based Sales Directors. You will own the sales process for the company: leading agency and client partner meetings, uncovering new opportunities, developing proposals, and achieving winning results for all our advertisers. This role is perfect for a consultative seller who is passionate about coming up with the best solutions for advertisers, digs into every aspect of the account, stays up to date on programmatic technologies, and cares about developing sales talent. The ideal candidate is both right- and left-brained, someone who creates innovative concepts for advertisers and embraces analytics too. You go the extra mile because you care deeply about driving success for advertisers‚Äô businesses and ours.  As part of a growing team, you will make a direct and immediate impact for the company. You will also play a big part in shaping our future sales strategy. We are at the programmatic forefront ‚Äì offering our media primarily via programmatic channels and continuing to push the envelope on first-party data and other fronts. We have a lean team and an all hands on deck attitude. This is an excellent opportunity to show your entrepreneurial spirit and accelerate CafeMedia‚Äôs growth!  What you‚Äôll be doing Driving advertising revenues via programmatic media and branded content sales Managing our team of Midwest Sales Directors, providing the guidance, training and support to grow our brand and revenues in this territory Developing new business through prospecting and own network of contacts Building relationships with key senior agency stakeholders and clients Establishing a deep understanding of our products, ideate strategic solutions based on client briefs, and putting together proposal responses Managing existing programmatic clients and scale up our partnerships Packaging insights for clients and proactively identifying growth opportunities based on content consumption and deal delivery/auction data Helping shape our sales strategy, new product offerings and agency positioning Working closely with internal teams to set up, manage and optimize programs  The skills and experience you‚Äôll bring to the job 10+ years in digital advertising sales. Comfort with selling programmatic media and influencer/branded content Experience leading and managing sales directors is preferred Deep understanding of digital ad sales marketplace and confidence driving opportunity in all contexts ‚Äì agency investment teams, programmatic teams, client-direct, PR agencies True student of the media industry - advertising trends, programmatic landscape Proven closer of new business Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral Highly organized and strong attention to detail A knack for creativity Team player with a desire to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment  About CafeMedia  CafeMedia‚Äôs mission is to build a creator-first future. We empower the world‚Äôs best creators and independent publishers to grow thriving businesses for the long term. Under our CafeMedia and AdThrive brands, we manage digital advertising sales and technology and a growing number of services for more than 3,000 creators and independent publishers. We make it easy for them to focus on what they do best ‚Äî produce great content.  Our passion and expertise have made us a leader in advertising and creator services. Today we rank as the 10th largest digital property in the U.S. and #1 in Food, Family, Home, and Lifestyle--with a reach of nearly 175M monthly unique visitors in the U.S. alone. jobTitle: VP of Sales & Business Development - East Region
description: ABOUT US  Enbala Power Networks, a subsidiary of Generac Power Systems, is focused on making the world‚Äôs power grids greener and more reliable, efficient and predictable by harnessing the power of distributed energy. Enbala‚Äôs real-time energy-balancing platform is transforming energy system operations through its revolutionary, highly flexible approach for creating controllable and dispatchable energy resources. It unobtrusively captures and aggregates available customer loads, energy storage and renewable energy sources to form a network of continuously controlled energy resources. The platform dynamically optimizes and dispatches these resources to respond to the real-time needs of the power system ‚Äì all without impacting customer operations. For more information, visit http://www.enbala.com or follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/Enbala.  WHY JOIN ENBALA? Highly competitive salary package, commensurate with your skills and experience Highly autonomous role Enjoy a healthy work/life balance Become a key contributor to Enbala's mission to making the world's power grids greener and more reliable  ABOUT THE ROLE  This is a newly created position on the East Coast US within a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative software company located in beautiful Denver, CO and Vancouver, BC. The position will report directly to the President of Enbala. This position will have the ability to leverage global offices and resources.  The role is viewed as a strategic team member within the company which will help accelerate new utility / energy services revenue, develop a comprehensive go-to-market strategy, and strengthen the overall sales presence in the US. The VP of Sales will be responsible for all facets of the go-to-market strategy for his/her region. The Sales VP will identify the appropriate accounts, markets, etc. to enter that represent the best opportunity(s) for Enbala to win new growth accounts.  This is considered a ‚Äòhunting‚Äô sales position with the opportunity to build a support team as the business grows and the financial business case supports additional investment. The ability to deliver compelling value propositions in the area of Virtual Power Plants, Distributed Energy Resource Management, Demand Response, Performance / Capacity Contracting, Wholesale Market Integration / Ancillary Services, and Energy Trading  Highlights include but not limited to the following:  Developing regional sales strategy  Understanding and documenting the most appropriate markets, states, and accounts to target in 2021 Assisting with sales leadership of several accounts that are currently in the sales funnel Developing a go-to-market strategy that supports $10M+ in Revenue and $50M+ in contract backlog in a 24mth period Providing sales strategy leadership to the commercial operations team which assists in proposal generation and financial analysis of strategic deals On-the-Field Leadership, this role is viewed as the trusted advisor for the account and your supporting team members will look to you as the sales strategy leader.   Assisting with proposal writing, executive summaries, financial modeling guidance and overall win themes during strategic pursuits Providing leadership during deal qualifications and deal reviews Delivering new top-line revenue and long-term financial backlog for the company Engaging with potential clients early in the buying process to ensure we have the ability to influence project requirements prior to RFPs Providing industry leadership and increase Enbala‚Äôs overall industry visibility Building and manage $50M+ sales pipeline Leading quarterly business reviews  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from Accredited University in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or Finance Masters Degree - Preferred 10 years of Enterprise Sales Experience in the Utility and/or Energy Industry. Industry Experience is a Must. Software experience is very important. Having other IT/OT systems Mechanical\technical\analytical perspective and experience.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:  Knowledge of utility industry practices and market trends is critical Strong listening, writing verbal communication and analytical skills. Ability to easily persuade and influence others. Ability to communicate effectively ‚Äì Comfortable Leading Presentations  Ability to deliver new revenue in new markets is critical ‚Äì this is a strategic sales leadership position Ability to manage internal resources to meet demanding timelines Ability to develop new accounts / customers.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Originating Strategic Deal Pursuits Leveraging Generac Brand (Clean Energy Solutions) Developing & Manage $50M Sales Funnel Developing Win Plan for each Strategic Account Sales Reporting ‚Äì Revenue, Forecasting, CRM Supporting Development of Bid Strategy Assisting with Proposal Development (as needed) Driving Top-line Revenue and Long-Term Backlog Developing Deal Financial Summary & Risk Reviews Coodinating and managing resources PowerPoint Presentation Development & Support Quarterly Business Reviews Planning & Support    WORK LOCATION/ENVIRONMENT  Remote / Home Office ‚Äì accepting applicants from any location (remote opportunity). Position will be west coast focused. The position requires a "hands-on" and at times with "non-traditional" working hours   COMPENSATION  Salary commensurate with industry experience and skills  PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting; close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.   Enbala is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
