description: Do you have a strong focus on delivering a Premium Customer Service experience? If you are a natural leader with an extensive background in sales, this is the opportunity for you. In this role you will establish focus accounts and clear strategic account plans based on SAM to maximize revenue and profitability for Infineon's IR HiRel division. In your new role you will: Understand NA HiRel customer base, needs and applications and communicate effectively throughout cross regional team. You will establish focus accounts and clear strategic account plans based on SAM to maximize revenue and profitability Understand the Infineon IR HiRel products. Assign the organizational resources to maximize design wins while securing involvement and support of relevant IR HiRel departments. Contribute to new product ideas, utilizing Infineon and IR HiRel core IP and competencies Drive value based pricing for products to ensure IR HiRel P&L requirements are met while monitoring competitor behavior Define, align and monitor sales goals and strategy with direct reports, Sales Reps, and distribution team. Execute and win customer programs while providing clear feedback and accountability to the extended team Establish Sr. Executive relationships at strategic customers to proactively drive next generation designs with a focus on early entry, and a deeper level of customer engagement and partnership Challenge and Drive process improvement within the Global IR HiRel sales team, ensuring efficiency improvements within Utilize ModelN CRM to drive business and accountability within the IR HiRel internal, rep, and distribution teams. Coordinate the input for revenue forecasts and budgets. Put NA 5 year Blue Book in place yearly Drive Divisional Cross Selling SAM expansion program with IFX products for up-screened military applications Lead team with Premium Customer Service efforts Secure significant revenue growth to increase the IR HiRel top line revenue to meet the NA sales Blue Book 5 year projection for IR HiRel and Legacy Cypress HiRel, creating a focused One Hi Rel team  You are best equipped for this task if you have: Bachelor of Science 12 years of Sales and Sales Management Experience Expert technical understanding of IR HiRel products and Space customer base in NA Strategic thinker who can implement proactive plans to leverage IR HiRel products into focus customers for maximum ROI and profitability Capable of building solid relationships through the Senior Executive level at strategic accounts  Infineon Power & Sensor Systems (PSS) semiconductors play a vital role in enabling intelligent power management, smart sensitivity as well as fast and reliable data processing in an increasingly digitalized world. IR HiRel, part of Infineon PSS, is a leader in high-reliability, rad hard power management and RF solutions for space and other extreme environments.  Our leading-edge power devices make chargers, adapters, power sources and lighting systems smarter, smaller, lighter and more energy-efficient. Our trusted sensors increase the context sensitivity of ‚Äúthings‚Äù and systems such as HMI, and our RF chips power fast and reliable data communication.  ‚Äì We drive leading-edge power management, sensing and data transfer capabilities ‚Äì Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.  We make life easier, safer and greener ‚Äì with technology that achieves more, consumes less and is accessible to everyone. Microelectronics from Infineon is the key to a better future. Efficient use of energy, environmentally-friendly mobility and security in a connected world ‚Äì we solve some of the most critical challenges that our society faces while taking a conscientious approach to the use of natural resources.  IR HiRel Products Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws. Applicants with questions about access or requiring a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should contact the Talent Network by phone at (408) 503-2194.  Employment at Infineon is contingent upon proof of your legal right to work in the United States under applicable law, verification of satisfactory references and successful completion of a background check and drug test, and signing all your on-boarding documents .  In some instances, if applicable, U.S. export control laws require that Infineon obtain a U.S. government export license prior to releasing technologies to certain persons. This offer is contingent upon Infineon's ability to satisfy these export control laws as related to your employment and anticipated job activities. The decision whether or not to submit and/or pursue an export license to satisfy this contingency, if applicable, shall be at Infineon's sole discretion.  IMPORTANT NOTICE:  Infineon is requiring all new U.S. employees and contractors to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Full vaccination is defined as two weeks after both doses of a two-dose vaccine or two weeks since a single-dose vaccine has been administered. Anyone unable to be vaccinated, either because of a sincerely held religious belief or a medical condition or disability that prevents them from being vaccinated, can request a reasonable accommodation.  Infineon Technologies takes data privacy and identity theft very seriously. As such, we do not request personally-identifiable information (PII) from applicants over the internet or electronically. Please kindly refrain from disclosing your PII electronically during the application process or to unauthorized websites that may purport to be Infineon or any of our affiliates.

description: GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION:  The Director of Sales and Marketing is responsible for all sales and marketing activities. The primary focus will be growing the business and defending a high market share in key segments. Fulfilling the needs of these customers will require the ability to remain highly efficient and organized in bringing together R&D, Operations, and Sales Leadership to ensure customer needs are met and new products are created and delivered in a timely manner. The person in the role will manage a team, in addition to having responsibility for managing key global customers.  CORE AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  Lead sales growth activities through the commercial development of product adjacencies with current customers and their competitors. Sales of complex engineered polymeric products intended to be utilized as a component part of a larger system. Develop a system and cadence for the establishment of deep and intimate multi-level customer relationships. These activities should begin with key customers and ultimately include all customers that have the capacity to grow to a significant size. Bring new product development activities to the table as business expansion opportunities including specification and performance analysis in comparison to market alternatives. Participate and lead (as appropriate) as a member of teams engaged in new product development activities. Conduct the marketplace assessments necessary to understand the magnitude and likelihood of new product sales success in comparison to the cost of development. Create and describe the attributes that differentiate a new product offering from the rest of the pack to make it a commercial success. New product development leadership and subsequent commercialization selling to demanding blue chip customers. Support financial counterparts in the development, utilization and analysis of a competent product costing system. Sales management responsibilities for both direct reports and outside reps including hire/fire authority. Inspire confidence and effectively work with customers (internal and external) to facilitate translation of market and performance needs into actionable product development initiatives. All other special products and duties as assigned.  QUALIFICATIONS:  Possession of at least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Management, Marketing or a related field is required. A Master‚Äôs Degree is preferred. Must be strongly motivated by achieving goals and building on success into adjacent market spaces. Have a demonstrated track record of superior planning and analytical capabilities to understand specification driven product requirements. Possess a strong mechanical aptitude with solid capability to engage with customers to fully understand their product and application needs. Function well in a mentoring role as co-workers will need to expand capabilities from the perspective of customer service and depth of communications. Must be results-oriented and able to work both independently and within a team environment. Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite applications. Finally, driving is a requirement for this position. Must possess and maintain a valid Driver‚Äôs License and driving record which is acceptable to our insurance provider.  EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:  United Plastics Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, military status, veteran status, marital status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, citizenship, sexual orientation, age (40 and older), disability (except where the disability prevents the individual from being able to perform the essential functions of the job and cannot be reasonably accommodated) or any other legally protected characteristic under federal, state or local law.

description: The Asset Protection Division of Protective Life Corporation has been providing F&I solutions for the automotive industry since 1962. We proudly serve thousands of dealerships in the automotive, RV, powersports and marine industries by providing innovative F&I products, training and technology.   SUMMARY: The Regional Sales Director is responsible for the oversight and directing a network of independent insurance agents to drive sales growth of our specialty(RV, Powersports, Marine) product portfolio in the southcentral/southeastern region of the U.S. This includes acquisition of new customer accounts, maintaining and developing existing specialty dealer relationships, and servicing current agent partnerships   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Drive sales growth by acquiring new business and cultivating new agency relationships. Work with agents to develop and execute strategy for sales revenue growth through additional sale of products to existing clients. Gather customer insight and drive solutions to enhance the customer experience. Build and maintain relationships with senior level personnel within customer accounts. Conducts financial reviews with executive ownership of all dealership groups within their region. Utilize CRM to actively track and analyze sales leads and customer interactions to enhance business relationships with customers and drive sales growth.  COMMUNICATIONS: This position is in continuous contact with external and internal customers. As an ambassador of our company and brand, this position requires strong presentation skills and communication skills.  PROFESSIONAL SPECIFICATIONS: Bachelor‚Äôs degree preferred Prior sales management experience required 5-7 years  industry experience preferred REQUIREMENTS Must possess strong leadership abilities; including managing and motivating a team Strong focus on customer service, which includes excellent listening skills, verbal communication skills, and interpersonal skills Must have a proven track record of developing sales results in an assigned territory. Possess an organized approach in problem solving ability Must have own vehicle with a good driving record Must be able to travel up to 75% of the time by air or car

description: Freshly is a fast-growing, food-tech startup and the largest fresh-prepared-meal delivery service in the country. It‚Äôs our mission to make eating healthy easy (for all kinds of people with all kinds of different needs) by delivering fresh, nutritious, fully cooked meals directly to customers. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. This is your chance at being a part of history and future success.  Freshly is looking for an experienced Director of Sales and Operations Planning reporting directly to Freshly‚Äôs VP of Planning and Operational Excellence. The Director of S&OP is responsible for all strategic demand and supply planning efforts at Freshly. This role will be challenged to build, implement, and maintain a world class Sales and Operations Planning process across the enterprise to improve customer satisfaction, profitability, and capacity utilization. The core functions of the position include strategic and tactical decision-making related to balancing demand and supply; aligns volume and mix with capacity and capability; and integrates financial and operating plans within strategic objectives to deliver improved operating and financial results. Working with functional stakeholders, this role will seek to gain consensus and achieve sales targets.  Successful Candidates Will Oversee and direct all S&OP activities including collaboration sessions, data analysis, and strategic planning with the intent of delivering consensus forecasts Proactively collaborate with Marketing, Finance, Logistics, Procurement, and Operations to build statistical demand plans for multiple markets from multiple production facilities Use integrated business planning techniques to facilitate a weekly S&OP consensus meeting ensuring that all essential stakeholders are aligned to shared targets and objectives Maintain a set of weekly demand planning models designed to provide detailed demand, financial, and capacity plans Challenge forecast assumptions based on analysis of market data, industry dynamics, statistics, business trends, and demand patterns Understand and communicate known production capacity limitations and general challenges of production facilities Deliver informative forecast variance reports to the Operations and Procurement teams Develop and implement advanced supply planning models governed by a set of specified targets Continuously improve statistical analysis, forecast variances, and other planning tools to build and maintain accurate item level forecasts Manage, communicate, and hold the planning team accountable for a defined set of demand planning KPIs Document major assumptions in the demand plan, including the coordination of new product launches, opportunities, promotions and campaigns, and customer activities Critical Skills And Abilities Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in business; Master‚Äôs Degree preferred 5-10 years of experience managing S&OP. Direct to consumer experience preferred Ability to manage a high-performance team with cross-functional, diverse capabilities Perform independently as well as in a team environment Excellent analytical and organizational skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated ability to take initiative, prioritize work, manage time, and respond effectively to a rapidly changing environment A "team player" orientation able to work collaboratively with and through others at all levels of the company, with good conflict resolution skills. Travel as required

description: Description Job Title: Director, Sales Job Location: New York, NY or East Coast Remote About Bond: Bond is revolutionizing personal security by providing greater safety and peace of mind for all people and situations. Our 24/7 Personal Security Agents are just a tap away from our app, ready to help with any safety need. Our mission is to reimagine what it means to feel safe. What it means for you. For your loved ones. For everyone. Because we believe every life should be lived fully, confidently, and without fear. Reimagining safety is our promise. Keeping you safer is our bond. Download our app in Google Play or iTunes. If you want to learn more, visit our website www.ourbond.com . Interested in joining our human-centric mission as a Sales Director to help shape the future of personal safety and security? We‚Äôre looking for enthusiastic and passionate professionals who wish to join our sales force and drive the growth of our novel services while revolutionizing personal security. THE ROLE The Bond personal security services are offered directly to consumers and in parallel to institutions: corporations, universities, and communities. Encouraged by our success and growing demand for services, we‚Äôre in the process of growing a world-class enterprise sales organization. WHAT YOU'LL DO Drive full-cycle sales from prospecting to close. Consult with and present to executives and decision-makers at such enterprises/companies to showcase the unique value of our services and technology Successfully navigate the complex organizations with multiple decision-makers to negotiate and close deals Successfully develop and execute against sales plans to consistently meet or exceed revenue targets Create and maintain an accurate sales pipeline and forecast through the use of CRM tools; tracking trends and potential risks for a robust, methodical, and data-driven sales process Requirements 5+ years‚Äô experience as a Sales Director/ Senior Manager, prospecting, generating leads and selling software or services to medium and large enterprises/companies, including SaaS or cloud software. 3+ years of selling experience in the security industry Experience working in corporate security, government security (e.g. FBI, CIA, Homeland Security, Secret Service) or other institutional security teams a plus Previous experience in a big and successful enterprise (For example: Everbridge, VMware, Oracle, Microsoft, Google, SAP, Workday, Salesforce.com, Rave, etc.) Experience selling solutions directly into large corporations, navigating complex organizations, and the ability to adapt your communication style to different audiences with proven success closing large deals. Experience creating a methodical, data driven sales process to fill and drive the sales pipeline Strong organizational, management, communication and presentation skills Experience working with sales tools Salesforce (CRM), ZoomInfo (lead gen) Education - Bachelor‚Äôs degree at a minimum, technical degree preferred You'll need the following to work from home, while we temporarily operate in a remote capacity (and follow the most current stay-at-home guidelines): Well-lit, dedicated and quiet area from where to work remotely without interruption or distraction. Must have a neutral visual background Workspace large enough to accommodate one monitor and a notebook computer (which will be provided to you by Bond). High Speed Broadband service (wired only) with a minimum of 150 Mbps in a dedicated (single person use) environment or 300 Mbps if in a shared environment (having a backup internet provider is a plus!) All communication regarding this role will come from one of the following domains: OurBond.com or from SMS (text message to your mobile device).

description: Job Title: Director, Sales Development  Desired Location: Chicago, IL  THE COMPANY:  YCharts enables financial professionals to make smarter investment decisions and better communicate that information to their prospects and clients. Our cloud-based software provides investment advisors, wealth managers, asset managers and retail investors with powerful research tools, comprehensive data, compelling visuals, and customizable sales collateral.   Thanks to our best-in-breed software and unparalleled support, YCharts has transitioned from a fintech startup to a thriving growth company (Inc. 5000 Honor Roll 5x Fastest Growing Company) in the burgeoning ‚Äúwealth-tech‚Äù space. YCharts proudly services industry-leading names such as Vanguard, TD Ameritrade, Fidelity, Charles Schwab, Invesco, Northwestern Mutual, John Hancock, and many more.  THE POSITION:  As the YCharts Director of Sales Development, you must enjoy working in a busy sales environment where you will train, coach, lead, and manage a team of 20-30 sales development representatives in both a remote and in office setting. You‚Äôll be responsible for developing a strong team, fostering communication between team members, inspiring growth, and establishing procedures to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate will be a highly autonomous, professional, dynamic team player with excellent communication skills. We‚Äôre looking for a self-starter that flourishes in a fast-paced environment full of change.  PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  Recruit and maintain a top performing Sales Development Team proficient in developing relationships with financial professionals and driving awareness of the YCharts platform through outbound/inbound calls and emails Train Sales Development reps to improve their sales and product knowledge to increase productivity and efficiency Hold Sales Development reps accountable for daily activities using a metrics and data-driven approach  DAILY AND MONTHLY RESPONSIBILITIES  Accomplish team results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, training, coaching and praising job results Responsible for performance evaluations and monthly quality and productivity profile and feedback to team members Monitor metrics for team and create corrective processes to meet customer and company needs Administer performance management, recognition, and accountability actions on a timely basis Perform routine call quality reviews on recorded or live calls according to procedures  Set and execute on priorities for self and team based on department strategic goals Improve quality results by evaluating processes and recommending changes. Coordinate and enforce system policies, procedures, and productivity standards Conduct interviews and is involved in the hiring process Coach, counsel, and motivate team members to maintain a positive and productive work environment Maintain scheduling and validate all daily work is completed on time Perform related job duties as assigned and required Lead by example and be ready to ‚Äúroll up the sleeves‚Äù when necessary  REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent total professional experience 3+ years of relevant management experience working in a fast-paced dynamic work environment Strong leadership skills with ability to inspire, coach, and develop associates into an effective, highly motivated, results oriented team Strong multitasking computer skills, knowledgeable with Google Suite Ability to analyze data and make decisions based on needs of the business Ability to effectively write and administer monthly and yearly performance reviews Ability to hold others accountable for department and company standards Ability to identify points of failure, come up with feasible resolutions, and implements them in a timely manner Familiarity with the financial advisor, broker dealer, and RIA vertical Exceptional interpersonal, oral and written communication skills  Detail oriented and well organized Ability to prospect within a targeted group of advisors Broad financial market knowledge  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE   Minimum 3 years prior internal sales management experience at a financial services, asset manager, or financial technology (fintech) firm Bachelor degree with a business related concentration preferred   WHY YCHARTS?:   5x Inc. 5000 ‚ÄúFastest Growing Companies‚Äù  American Banker's "#1 Best Fintechs to Work For" Inc.‚Äôs ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù  Inc.‚Äôs ‚ÄúTop Regionals: Midwest‚Äù  Fintech Global‚Äôs ‚ÄúWealthTech 100‚Äù  Crain's "Best Places to Work in Chicago" Deloitte's "Technology Fast 500" InvestmentNews' "Biggest Fintech Innovations" Technology Tools for Today & Inside Information‚Äôs ‚ÄúTop Tool Advisors Are Thinking About Adding‚Äù   PERKS & REC:  Chicago (River North) & NY (Chelsea) offices with flexible remote options 100% Employer-covered medical, dental & vision insurance  401k match Paid parental leave Generous PTO including ‚ÄúCelebration Days‚Äù DEI commitment Continued education via ‚ÄúStarbucks and Study‚Äù Summer hours‚Äî we head out early during the warm months! In-Office perks include: $60/week Grubhub credits for in-office lunches Rotating selection of high-quality coffees Craft beer, kombucha, and cold brew on tap Snacks and drinks to get you through the day Opportunity to join team leagues like kickball Fun company outings including an annual celebration in Chicago, Whirlyball, community service, baseball games and happy hours!  YCharts provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  At YCharts, we feel strongly that respect and inclusion are essential ingredients for creativity, innovation, and success. While we know there‚Äôs more work to be done to advance diversity and inclusion, we‚Äôre proud of our success thus far and excited for the journey to come. Want to help us?

description: About Us  Ecosense is a rapidly growing technology company based in Los Angeles. Our purpose is to invent, inspire and transform how we experience light. Our strategy is audacious and our expectations are high. We are pioneering in the areas of color science, photometry and mixed reality. Using the sun and the moon as inspiration, we are using our inventions to enhance our industry's understanding of light and materially transform expectations for artificial light.  We have been fortunate to light some of the most coveted spaces on earth and to be recognized by the likes of Red Dot for innovation and design, as well as Inc 500 and Deloitte for consistently making their fastest growing companies lists.  Ecosense hires curious, collaborative, autonomous and smart people who also happen to be very nice. We have a passion for tackling the unknown, solving hard problems, and answering questions that haven't been explored.  Primary Role And Responsibility Use the companies Go to Market playbook to create strategies and plans that drive sales in the New York region Within 18-24 months have best practices implemented in your region compared to other North America regions Measurement of success will be based on penetration rates by product family. Penetration rate should be north of the average of the top 10 North America Specification Markets Ability to effectively launch new products into market Mandate the adoption of sales tools Hubspot and Sisense within your region Hubspot and Sisense should be viewed as tools to track activity, success, and areas that need to be improved Partner with VP of Sales and the finance team to craft aggressive annual quotas that are linked to the best in-class penetration rates Initiate accurate sales forecasts that provide information to management of each customer's potential revenue within the sales cycle Ability to manage others while still being responsible for a territory (Player/Coach) Plan, conduct, and lead marketing activities, e.g., informational seminars and/or user group seminars. Attend and participate in Company sponsored trade shows Required Skills/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or higher is preferred Industry experience is required Results oriented and driven Excellent motivational and leadership skills Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills Excellent presentation skills and intimate contacts with local business associations Detail oriented, sensitive to customers' needs and company's requirement for interaction to record and track customer information in company CRM program Ability to adapt creative solutions Strong business acumen Must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and have strong organizational skills with a strong attention to detail Travel Required; Field time/customer face to face 75%+ All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, or covered veteran status.

description: Position: HEAD OF ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT Location: Boulder, CO  Webscale the Cloud Platform for Modern Commerce announced March 2, 2021, the closing of $26 million in growth capital financing from investors and Silicon Valley Bank. (The Series C round was led by BGV, STCAP Ventures, and Mohr Davidow Ventures, with participation from Grotech Ventures.)Webscale grew 108% in 2020, powering thousands of storefronts, particularly those leveraging newer trends with headless and progressive web app (PWA) architectures. This growth is expected to continue as merchants demand more flexibility, scale, and security, coupled with fast, simple deployments, for seamless user experiences.  Job Description  Webscale is seeking a strategic customer lifecycle and account management professional to join the Webscale team as a Head of Account Management (or similar title). In this role, you‚Äôll be responsible for being a champion for our customers through tracking growth, upsell, NPS, CSAT, churn, and net retention as key metrics of success. Enhance their experience by interacting with sales, support, product and executive leadership to ensure new feature requests and market changes are understood internally and webscale enhancements are communicated externally. Supporting the sales function to create programs, growth opportunities, and supporting collateral that inspire our largest believers, retain customers and increase revenues.  Job responsibilities:  As the Head of Account Management at Webscale, you will initially work directly with customers and over time, grow and manage a team that acts as the point of contact between our company and our clients to help solve problems and achieve business goals and understand customer sentiment. Serve as the lead point of contact for all clients while building and nurturing trusted, long-lasting relationships. Collaborate with our sales, advertising, and product development teams to ensure the client is served appropriately and the feedback loop flows in all directions. Develop strategies to grow existing accounts and ensure quality and cost-effective services while expanding relationships within key accounts Gain a deep understanding of the changing commerce market, client‚Äôs needs and what they expect from our company Use your outstanding communication skills to present to and influence key stakeholders in our company and with clients Develop your team of Customer Advocates or Account Managers and oversee key accounts Understand and know how to execute on churn prevention, NPS growth, CSAT tracking and customer happiness Track your own success through net retention revenue for the business Extensive ability to travel and meet customers across the country and worldwide as necessary  Qualifications  Must have deep, technical expertise in B2B SaaS, cloud infrastructure, ecommerce and/or hosting Bachelors required/ Masters preferred and practical experience 8+ years professional experience in sales, account management, customer success, product marketing and/or product management or customer experience functions  5+ years working in sales and account management in a cloud infrastructure company in a customer facing role Experience working with teams to define strategy Strong quantitative analytical ability and excellent written and oral communication skills Comfort in a face-paced, entrepreneurial, start-up environment and a great attitude   Characteristics  Talented presenter and communicator with an ability to take complex topics and convert them into strong customer-facing messaging Strong collaborative, organizational and analytical skills Takes ownership of problems, seeks out help when needed, and knows how to prioritize work. Inventive and thrives in a dynamic, very fast paced environment. Willing to be a doer and a leader  About Webscale Webscale is the world‚Äôs only cloud platform for the successful delivery of modern commerce applications. Offering enterprise-grade security, predictive scalability and blazing-fast performance, the Webscale SaaS platform leverages automation and DevOps protocols to simplify the technology needs of growing brands. The platform supports omni-channel use cases across a variety of ecommerce platforms and architectures, including headless, progressive web applications, self-hosted and fully hosted commerce clouds. Deployed in multi-cloud environments, including Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure, Webscale powers Fortune 1000 brands including Dollar General, Unilever, Swarovski, Olympus, Regal Cinemas and thousands of other B2C, B2B, and B2E ecommerce storefronts across 12 countries. Webscale has offices in Santa Clara, CA, Boulder, CO, San Antonio, TX, Bangalore, India and London, UK.  For more information, visit www.webscale.com. Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook. Confidential Recruiting Contact for this role: Rebecca Lonergan Saga Recruiting rebecca@sagarecruiting.com

Company Overview:  We've partnered with a data-driven video platform that enables world-leading companies such as Microsoft, Twitch, and BuzzFeed to understand their audiences and increase revenue. They are looking for a consultative SaaS Sales Director that is able to succeed in a results-driven startup environment. As a Sales Director, you will be responsible to prospect, build relationships, and close business with leading brands, platforms, media companies, and agencies to help drive our new business goals.  Responsibilities: Consistently meet quarterly and annual quota and revenue goals. Engage with internal stakeholders to collaborate on opportunities, resolve customer issues, share best practices, and partner with cross-functional teams. Validate prospect‚Äôs critical business issues to inform and demonstrate relevant solutions. Lead discussions to convey company value to prospects and demonstrate that value and resulting ROI. Proven ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with executive-level decision-makers and champions.  Requirements: 7+ years of successful SaaS and/or consultative sales experience focused on new business with brands and agencies Experience working with online media & social video platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, & Youtube) Track record of building and maximizing strong relationships with key contacts at prospect accounts. Proven top performer (consistently achieving sales goals) that delivers an exceptional customer experience. Demonstrated experience selling technology solutions or applications at the C-Suite level. Strong ‚Äúhustle‚Äù mentality with a desire to work in a dynamic startup environment where your input can help shape our offerings  Additional Info/Benefits Bonus points if candidate is located near the following cities: New York, NY - Chicago, IL - Los Angeles, CA - San Francisco, CA - Boston, MA

description: Description  Thought Machine are solving one of the biggest problems in banking. Since launching in 2014, our mission has been to liberate banks from outdated, legacy technology which stifles their ability to innovate. Thought Machine's core product, Vault, is a cloud native, core banking engine built to run any type of bank - from established Tier 1 banks all the way to new challenger banks  To move closer to achieving our mission, we are looking for highly talented individuals to join the fast growing team. With a founding team drawn from Google, we have a deep culture of engineering excellence and we believe it is this which delivers a solution compelling enough to engender a seismic shift in the banking industry.  Thought Machine was ranked as the most desirable London fintech to work at by Sifted when comparing employee reviews on Glassdoor and named in Fintech 50 (2020). We pride ourselves on having an excellent internal culture, where we take cultural fit as important as technical fit when we make new hires. At Thought Machine, we strive hard to create a fast-paced, supportive and fun working environment to enable the team to produce the best technical work in the industry.  This is an exciting opportunity to be one of the first Sales Directors in the region as we expand Thought Machine into Central America. The Sales Director will be responsible for the region and will own the full sales cycle for Central America. This will involve building and forecasting the pipeline, qualifying leads generated by yourself, the marketing team and our partner organisations, through to managing large scale contracts to close. You will need to be technically and commercially literate, but in addition you will have the full support of the sales engineering and marketing teams. This role will suit a candidate who relishes the opportunity to build a regional footprint from scratch, is able to work autonomously and is able to collaborate strongly across teams in the business.  DUTIES Develop and deliver proposals that address customer and prospect critical needs. Build and develop relationships at multiple levels ‚Äì executive sponsors, influencers and decision makers across the Region to stimulate interest and feed into the pipeline. Exceed annual Regional targets for software licencing and professional services contracts. Partner with our Sales Engineers, Client Services and Marketing teams to build targeted sales campaigns. Manage your time between progressing the ‚Äúgood fit‚Äù leads that have a high chance / near term win and stimulating opportunities that will progress in the longer term. Understand the issues facing potential and existing customers and interacting with our in-house product and engineering teams.Building and delivering on the regional sales plan. Essential  Requirements Minimum 10+ years of exceeding enterprise software sales targets in a region in the US - during this time you will have built a reputation as an adviser and partner with your clients, building solutions that lead to real value creation Experience in consultative sales roles within the retail banking sector (specifically core banking or payments) Knowledge and experience of Banking procurement practices and processes and overall typical sales lifecycle for selling enterprise platforms into banks. Excellent understanding of the issues facing retail banks ranging from technological, regulatory and commercial pressures. Proven ability to generate leads and show high conversion rate to completion Able to quickly understand prospective clients needs, to converse competently regarding both the technical and commercial aspects of the proposition. Confident in challenging the status quo and you engage customers in new ways of thinking. Able to manage and influence key decision makers, particularly at C-suite level in organisations through your ability to build credible, trusted and lasting relationships. Experience in fast moving start-ups and or enterprise software sales in more established businesses. Able to demonstrate consistently hitting and exceeding sales targets Bring energy, gravitas and enthusiasm to the conversation Desirable Knowledge and experience with cloud infrastructure technology Experience having worked in a global scale-up/ being an early stage employee in a new market Benefits Highly competitive salary Healthcare, vision and dental 20 days holiday 10 days sick pay 401K matching (up to 7%) Share options All the latest tech you need A talented & experienced team as your colleagues An environment where we encourage learning and progress Thought Machine are committed to making a measurable positive impact on people's everyday lives. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We actively hire for cultural growth. We welcome people of all ages, backgrounds and value people who take a journey unique to them. We provide everyone with equal access to professional development. You are encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: BettingJobs.com are seeking a Head of Sales for an innovative sports betting company offering a unique product proposition.  Led by a team of respected betting industry veterans, they are bringing to market a new product which will offer customers a new sports betting experience.  The Head of Sales will be responsible for developing the sales strategy, accountable for scaling the business and developing and growing revenue streams. With time the Head of Sales will also be responsible for building and developing a small team.  This role would ideally be suited to an experienced sales professional with a strong knowledge of sportsbook and a successful track record of selling into the gaming industry. You will be excited by the prospect of bringing a new product to the market and selling into new markets.  Responsibilities Own all plans and strategies for developing business and achieving the company‚Äôs sales goals Assists in the development of the sales plan. Prepares forecasts and KPI reporting for the sales leaders, C-level and upper management, for use in organizational planning, financial forecasting, budget setting and strategic planning. Land and expand build process and funnel for manual top-down reach out, onboarding, activation, and expansion Evangelize the product and personally help close largest deals Work collaboratively across teams - including Engineering, Product and Marketing Establish the inbound lead requirements needed to meet your sales objectives, Global perspective Provide full visibility into the sales pipeline at every stage of development Establish and foster partnerships and relationships with key customers both externally and internally Requirements +5 years of relevant sales experience including management of AM/KAM functions and a track record of exceeding quota. preferably in Sportsbook Possess extensive knowledge of sales principles and practices, and an ability to coach others on them Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions. Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams Strength in problem solving, issue-resolution, ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment, attention to detail, and ability to multitask. Strong leadership and team building skills Proven skills of working in a multinational environment Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including C-level and executive management Proven ability to manage multiple accounts, with proven ability to deliver key requirements efficiently and on time with precise detail Fluent in English, both in writing and verbally Ability to travel and work remotely Organized and structured Ability to act quickly on opportunities Positive and agile as individual

description: COMPANY OVERVIEW BVI¬Æ is refocusing the future of vision.   As one of the fastest-growing, diversified surgical ophthalmic businesses in the world, our purpose-built portfolio spans more than 115 countries. We‚Äôve set our sights on touching the lives of millions of patients affected by conditions such as cataracts, refractive error, glaucoma, retinal disease, and dry eye.  Unburdened by legacy or bureaucracy, we have developed our strategy around a simple concept ‚Äî taking pride in delivering innovative solutions for our physicians and patients, based on their needs.  We trust and empower our associates to make decisions and solve problems because collaboration drives us. Valuing agility, simplicity, and transparency, we stay committed to listening to our customers, delivering for our patients, and keeping the future in focus.   Learn more at www.BVImedical.com.   PURPOSE The Director, Sales is responsible for attaining the sales and profitable goals in line with US regional objectives. The sales goals include direct territory sales, and OEM sales in the region. This includes management of all sales activities and implementation of sales programs within the Company‚Äôs strategic plan including but not restricted to recruiting, hiring, training, developing and management of the Regional Sales Managers, and indirectly the sales reps. The Director also manages and oversees all interaction with KOLs, distributors, equipment, and OEM relationships within the region(s).  RESPONSIBILITIES  ¬∑        Key member of the US Commercial Leadership team. ¬∑        Direct management of Regional Sales Managers, with indirect responsibilities over reps throughout the assigned area. ¬∑        Overall responsibility for driving assigned revenue, budgets, quota, margins, and executing the overall sales plan. ¬∑        Influential and responsible for the operations of the Region including T&E, Expenses, compensation details, pricing approvals, and any financial impacts, risks, and benefits to the business assigned. ¬∑        Fully accountable to assigned budget/quota as a roll up to the P&L.  ¬∑        Develops and drives regional strategy and execution of operation plans in order to perform against revenue plan ¬∑        Manages team in accordance with organization‚Äôs policies and applicable regulations. Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance and guiding professional development; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing employee relations issues and resolving problems. Approves actions on human resources matters ¬∑        Full accountability to Performance Management issues. Will work closely with Region Managers on rep issues, both positive and negative. Will align with HR policies and procedures to align with overall BVI Strategy and Initiatives. ¬∑        Responsible for driving a positive cutlure, driving rep and manager retention, and creating synergies that drive execution and accountability ¬∑        Responsible for working in tandem with US Training team, and Field Sales Trainers to ensure all reps and managers are fully trained and capable with every tool and resource necessary to hit revenue and budget targets. ¬∑        Will participate in national and from time to time global ophthalmic industry meetings. Will be a key contributor to all mgt team meetings as part of the Commercial team, where being a key contributor is the expectation. ¬∑        Other duties as required  REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES ¬∑        Knowledge of Microsoft Office‚Äôs suite of products, including Outlook, Word, Excel, SharePoint, and Teams. ¬∑        Expert in consultative selling ¬∑        Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Can clearly convey sales messages across a variety of key stakeholders, including surgeons, office, and surgical staff. ¬∑        Ability to analyze sales reporting and data to make well informed decisions on territory strategy and customer engagement. ¬∑        Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and customers. ¬∑        Ability to resolve complex issues with a high degree of initiative. ¬∑        Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously ¬∑        Self-starter with the ability to plan and manage time to achieve desired results ¬∑        Works with a high sense of urgency to meet and exceed company and customer expectations.  MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE ¬∑        Bachelor's degree in business, life sciences, or related field and 10 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience ¬∑        5+ years sales management experience in a supervisory role with documented budget attainment. Recruiting, hiring, training, working in the field and OR with reps and surgeons a must. Capital and consumable med device experience preferred.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS          ¬∑        Ability to drive a car ¬∑        Use a laptop ¬∑        Use a telephone and other mobile devices ¬∑        Stand or walk for a least 2 hours at a time ¬∑        Lift up to 20lbs ¬∑        May require frequent and overnight travel  Beaver Visitec International is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.  The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. description: Buffalo Groupe is a collection of agencies and media properties serving audiences in golf, active sport, fitness, outdoor and real estate industries. Brands that help create ‚Äúmoments of escape‚Äù are deemed a trusted and welcome contributor. This is the highest form of advocacy ‚Äì the power of ‚Äúescape marketing.‚Äù  Our ‚ÄúHerd‚Äù is on the lookout for a Senior Director, Business Development to serve as a trusted advisor in the industries our companies engage. We are looking for leaders who are detail-focused, diligent, organized and team-oriented with a passion to converse with prospects in identifying opportunities with our data, digital and creative solutions.  \We value candidates possessing relevant experience in golf, travel and sports. This includes understanding marketplace opportunities and fearlessly building relationships with relevant targets, developing impactful proposals, delivering insightful presentations and more. If you‚Äôre inspired by the idea of aligning with exciting brands in golf and adjacent sports, outdoor, fitness and lifestyle categories, then we‚Äôd like to speak with you. Buffalo Groupe is headquartered in Reston, VA (just outside Washington, D.C.). We have a ‚Äúwork from anywhere culture‚Äù and open to candidates from all locations.  Overview What we are looking for in the ideal candidate: An outgoing and energetic personality fitting our Buffalo culture of ‚Äúkindness, clarity and courage.‚Äù Quick-thinking and sharp wits to guide meetings, adapt to business development needs and lead presentations. An eagerness to play a quick nine holes when time allows is also encouraged! Strong proposal writing and editing skills. Must be comfortable crafting catchy pitch ideas, as well as authoring business-oriented communications for clients and prospects. The ability to effectively manage, monitor and proactively assess business development activities from different geographic locations and industries. Experience building and enhancing relationships with clients and prospects, with a focus on decision-makers and the most senior levels within the organization. Deep understanding of integrated marketing services, profitability, employee utilization and realization, and budget management as it pertains to proposals and current clients. Positivity and excitement to thrive in a fast-paced environment. We are a high-growth company that trusts our team members to take initiative, bring big ideas to the table and execute on a vision. The sky is the limit, if you‚Äôre willing to seize the opportunities ‚Äì boldness and ambition will be rewarded. Ability to think creatively in developing revenue-driving solutions to benefit our clients and prospects. Understanding of golf and media landscape. Media or advertising sales experience is a plus. Position will require selling advertising on our partner‚Äôs website, Sports Illustrated (SI.com/golf), as well as a soon to launch B2B golf newsletter. Knowledge of and passion for the game of golf, fitness and outdoor lifestyle. Event sponsorship and product integration are also a critical element of the total sales portfolio. Provide market feedback to the company leadership regarding competitive offerings, prospect needs and generate service development ideas.  Requirements A Bachelor‚Äôs degree and a minimum of eight (8) to ten (10) years of business development and digital marketing agency experience is preferred. Proficient in SalesForce, Microsoft (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams), Google (Sheets, Slides) and project management platforms (Monday.com). Graphic design experience a plus. Willingness to travel to industry conferences and other new business meetings, sometimes under short notice. Experience in working with senior management to align sales strategies and solutions. Proven track record of successfully pitching (and closing) new business, identifying opportunities and increasing revenue through generation of leads. Ability to drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the company`s ambitious growth goals. Planning and coordinating the implementation of business plans and the penetration of new markets. Working to stringent annual targets, this individual will be required to adopt a professional and knowledgeable approach to each new business conversation.  If interested, please send your cover letter and resume to Glenn Gray (ggray@buffalogroupe.com). Kindly include ‚ÄúNAME ‚Äì Senior Director, Business Development‚Äù in the subject line.

jobTitle: Head of Sales Development US (West Region)
description: Stop settling for the good and go for the great!  About The Role  CoachHub is striving for a talented and entrepreneurial individual who helps building our Sales Development function and guiding it to success in addition to remaining hands-on in the role. The Sales Development Manager will be responsible for enabling other Sales Development Representatives for the West US team to be successful in their roles by leading by example. The Sales Development Manager will be the team lead of the other SDRs on the team. You will be reporting directly to our VP Sales Development and to the CEO, Yannis (check them out at LinkedIn here and here)  Tasks And Responsibilities Build and steer CoachHub‚Äôs SDR activities of the West US market, including planning, hiring, coaching and performance management Create an inspiring team environment with an open communication culture Set clear team goals Manage the performance of the Sales Development Representatives and delivery on KPIs Discover training needs and provide coaching and support for career development Build a sales development framework that follows CoachHub‚Äôs strategic direction Keep up with industry trends and best practices, including utilization of new technology and web resources Check Out Our Presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_SDR  Your profile You have gained profound experience in Sales Development, Inside Sales or Sales in the Enterprise Software space, preferably in SaaS, for at least 5 years You are experienced in leading, training and growing your team for at least 2 years You have a very good understanding of the West US market and experience in SaaS You are able to work in a complex, changing environment and to interact with multiple stakeholders You provide great communication skills (positive and energetic, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills, team-player, working with other SDRs and field reps, Sales Management, external lead-gen agencies and marketing among others) What we offer Your own personal coach for unlimited sessions that will help you to unlock your potential and regular growth conversations with your supervisor Growth: An opportunity to join a fast growing and agile company The people: You will join an international team of driven and supportive people on a mission Impact: You have a direct impact on people's lives and make a true difference Feel welcome: First class company welcome week that will get you settled in, in no time Experience a strong focus on professional and personal growth across all teams (we are a Coaching company after all!) Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance Further ancillary insurances like life and short- & long term disability Unlimited paid time off (PTO) with a fair use policy Paid CoachHub4Good days to give back 401(k) plan including a CoachHub employer-paid add-on A flexible spending account A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement Apply now and explore your talent at CoachHub!  About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‚Äòhelp organisations to unleash their people‚Äôs full potential‚Äô attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‚ÄòCoachHubbers‚Äô hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.

description: Are you motivated by growth and by your impact on the success of that growth? Energized by creating scale-up sales strategies that exceed business goals? Really enjoy building high-performing teams and seeing those teams collectively succeed?   Perhaps you‚Äôre our new Sales Director!  Our K12 sales team is driven, motivated and invested in the importance of their contribution to realizing their goals. Headcount has exploded from zero to a 30-strong team in under a year and we‚Äôve got plans to double that in the next six months. Our team is looking forward to your leadership and direction to achieve our continued growth, consistently, and to develop and nurture the next generation of sales leaders.   What you‚Äôll be doing   Lead, create and execute our go-to-market plan to achieve financial targets and expand our customer base.  Own the sales processes from initial prospecting to close and upsell.  Deeply assess and evaluate our current processes to mitigate risks and create disciplined, repeatable practices to accurately forecast and exceed our goals.   Analyse and refine our sales team structure, sales model, sales training and sales materials.  Hire, manage, coach and develop sales managers to drive both performance and accountability.  Partner with marketing to refine and control our ideal customer profile, market segmentation and targeted messaging.   Build and nurture long-standing relationships with our customers to develop valuable knowledge of the K12 landscape.  Share learns, customer feedback and market data with product and content teams, aligning our roadmap to meet customer needs.  Leverage your insights to collaborate with customer success teams, ensuring best-in-class onboarding experiences.  Be an inspiring leader who garners respect and loyalty through actions.   Be bold. The trifecta of a new team, a new product and a fast-evolving market conditions doesn‚Äôt daunt you. In fact, you‚Äôre ready to get stuck in and do what it takes to build a healthy pipeline.  If you‚Äôve got these skills, we‚Äôd love to hear from you    You‚Äôre a strategic thinker and a customer-focused, consultative sales leader.  You‚Äôre a pro at running a SaaS sales model with a background in vertical / account-based SaaS / software sales, ideally in the K12 space.   You eat quota and territory assignments, and compensation plans for breakfast.   You‚Äôve successfully led sales organizations or sales teams so you know what it takes to lead, motivate and develop people.  You can demonstrate a history of outperforming quota in a sales environment, preferably at K12 or SaaS companies.  You‚Äôre a collaboration savant, partnering effortlessly with cross-functional departments.  You‚Äôre focused on impact, attracting the talent to successfully build, scale and manage teams.   Change is constant, and you thrive with it. That‚Äôs where your agility and resilience really shine. You move quickly and encourage continued improvement while sharing learnings with your team.  You communicate clearly and transparently, positively influencing all levels of an organization, articulating the distinct aspects of our offering.  You‚Äôre self-aware, transparent, collaborative, and open to feedback with outstanding listening and negotiation skills.   You love building and implementing processes, coaching & developing talent, and continuously driving OKRs.  Why Labster.  We are Labster. Creators of virtual science lab software that makes learning engaging, effective and accessible, to as many students as possible. We exist to empower the next generation of scientists to change the world. It‚Äôs our mission to support 100 million science learners globally by 2025.   In the same way our technology empowers students, we thrive on an autonomous and innovative culture based on Holacracy, and ensuring that your work fits into your lifestyle.   We encourage individual expression, boldly challenge how it‚Äôs always been done, and foster learning, creativity and growth. How you work is in your control, balanced by the comfort of access to like-minded, inspiring people, when you need it.  What‚Äôs in it for you?    Work fully remotely with flexibility  Be a part of making science accessible and engaging to the world‚Äôs future scientists   Embrace the autonomy of holacracy, and work that fits into your lifestyle  Fair and attractive salaries  Unlimited paid vacation (which we encourage you to actually take!)  Learning budget & freedom to decide what you learn!  Company-wide equity program  Opportunities to travel and meet your colleagues from around the world! (Covid permitting)  Our commitment to all of you  Labster, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. jobTitle: Director of Sales and Success Enablement
description: Wunderkind is seeking a Director of Sales and Success Enablement to join our commercial team. This is a unique opportunity to own this function and join us at an exciting stage in our growth.  In this role, you‚Äôll be a key partner to the Commercial Leadership Team, focused on making sure we have the programs in place necessary to fuel our continued scale. You‚Äôll be tasked with building on our existing robust training programs across Sales and Customer Success to make them as efficient, accurate, and effective as possible while ensuring they are meeting our ever-evolving needs. Best of all, you‚Äôll be working with teams who are committed to keeping a growth mindset‚Äî‚ÄùCome Hungry‚Äù is one of our core values at Wunderkind, and everyone is eager to build on their skillset.  By partnering with key leaders in sales management, success management, and product marketing, you‚Äôll ensure we deliver the right information and skill development to the right employees, both when they start and throughout their career at Wunderkind.  How You‚Äôll Impact Wunderkind Collaborate with Commercial Team Leadership to develop and define an Enablement strategy for our Sales and CS teams Partner with management and top leading sales reps to identify business needs, craft solutions, launch, iterate, and measure impact. Hire and manage a team that will leverage their personal experience and internal expertise to build enablement programs that drive impact. Partner with key leads, individual contributors and subject matter experts across the organization to develop enablement content and trainings. Design and develop Sales Enablement solutions across a variety of mediums (e.g., in-person, virtual, eLearning, videos, on-the-job support, management reinforcement & mentoring) to improve upon the way we sell into Enterprise customers. Establish & create assessment and evaluation strategies to measure and iterate on the efficacy and value of various initiatives. Qualifications 8+ years aggregate professional experience including: 3+ years of leading both trainings as well as a broader Sales Enablement programs 3+ years direct enterprise sales experience, enterprise account management, or customer success There‚Äôs no one specific background required here, but this role would be best suited for someone with practitioner experience in some capacity. Strategic thinker who can also execute end to end. You excel in establishing priorities and meeting swift deadlines in a rapidly changing environment. Passion for developing others and helping individuals grow Demonstrated success at leading cross functional teams and partnering with external vendors. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Wunderkind is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  JOIN US ON OUR MISSION  Wunderkind (formerly BounceX) is a leading performance marketing engine that delivers tailored experiences at scale. Digital businesses use Wunderkind to remember who users are better than ever before, allowing them to deliver high-performing, one-to-one messages on websites, through emails and texts, and in ads at a scale that‚Äôs not otherwise possible. Wunderkind recently acquired SmarterHQ so marketers can now unlock more revenue than ever before across SMS and email.  Wunderkind drives $1.2 billion dollars annually in directly attributable revenue for top eCommerce brands like Uniqlo, Sonos and HelloFresh, often ranking as a top-3 revenue channel in their own analytics. Wunderkind is maniacally obsessed with ROI and aims to be the infrastructural interface between individuals and brands in a world where consumers choose what they want, from whom, and when.  Having raised over $44.9 million in funding from proven firms like Battery Ventures, Cross Creek Advisors and Primary Ventures, Wunderkind was named the Fastest Growing Software Company in America by Inc Magazine. With headquarters in New York and London, Wunderkind has been recognized by Glassdoor and Crain's for its exceptional culture and being one of the top places to work in the country. The company recently signed both the White House Equal Pay Pledge and the United Nations Women's Empowerment Pledge and continues to set the bar as a pioneer in technology innovation and workplace inclusion initiatives.  What bonds our community together is our commitment to 5 Core Values: Come Hungry Carry Each Other Drive Undeniable Performance Respect People, Privacy, Ideas Bounce Back Come join us on our mission.

description: If you are ready to take your sales career to the next level while sharpening your sales skill set selling some of the world's best heavy equipment, then our VP of Sales role is what you have been waiting for. Our team is looking for an energetic and motivated self-starter who will be driven to help our team excel to new heights. Essential to success in this role is an ability to manage a successful sales team and develop new accounts to penetrate new divisions and organizations within our designated sales territory.  As the VP of Sales, you will: Establish, monitor, and meet aggressive departmental sales/gross margin targets for existing and new products Establish sales/gross margin objectives for each RSM and ensure they are held accountable to those goals Be the primary customer and dealer facing executive of the leadership team Manage staff, including coaching, professional development plans, goals setting, evaluations, counseling, and disciplining Create and implement a structured sales process (including policies, procedures, and guidelines) that maximizes revenue, margin, and customer satisfaction Implement and manage the company's CRM (including providing visibility into every stage of the sales pipeline) Act as the primary sales strategist and planner within the company Own all plans and strategies for achieving the company's equipment sales goals Develop and implement sales strategies for products the company sells Develop a long-term strategy and plan to augment and evolve the company's existing product lines based on market needs and the company's competitive strengths Other duties as assigned.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Big ticket item sales. Ability to identify, develop, and implement growth opportunities. Strong personnel management skills (i.e., plan, organize, lead, direct, coordinate, train/mentor, control, communicate and evaluate). Applicable hands-on technical knowledge and experience. High aptitude to utilize software, including the company's dealer management system. Ability to exercise judgment and discretion in dealing with matters of significance for the company. Entrepreneurial spirit (resourcefulness, flexibility, profit generation, competition, new business, cost containment, etc.). Ability to read, analyze, and interpret financial/operational reports, equipment manuals, training materials, policies and procedures, and corporate communications. Effective written and verbal communication skills, including reports, memos, letters, e-mails, calls, meetings, and presentations.  Qualifications Associates degree required, Bachelor's degree preferred. Minimum of 5 years' sales senior leadership experience in a similar industry. CDL preferred or must have CDL within six (6) months of employment Minimum of 3 years relevant hands-on mechanical experience.  Mid-Atlantic Waste Systems is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants based on race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, age, sex, marital status, national origin, disability or handicap, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Director of Acquisition Sales, North America
description: FreshBooks Has a Big Vision  It turns out‚Ä¶ unicorns are real! In fact, FreshBooks just became one after raising our valuation to more than $1 billion. And ever since launching in 2003, we‚Äôve been on a steady incline towards one goal: Building easy-to-use accounting software for small business owners. It‚Äôs the goal that‚Äôs driven us to expand into five offices, serving customers in over 160 countries. And it‚Äôs the goal we‚Äôd love for you to be a part of as a member of our global team as we continue our journey.  Known for extraordinary customer service and HQ in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries. We have offices in the U.S. currently in Raleigh, NC and San Antonio, TX.  The Opportunity  Reporting into the Head of NA Sales, this is a high impact leadership position within the FreshBooks Sales Organization. You will be responsible for the management of the Sales Strategy for the FreshBooks North American Acquisition Sales Team that is responsible for generating revenues from net new Accounts to FreshBooks primarily focused on small businesses billing more than $100k + in annual revenue. This role currently has multiple direct report managers, with 50+ sellers reporting into their organization. You will be responsible for managing the Inbound/Outbound Lead Generation strategy and execution for the Acquisition Sales Team as well and closing revenue from product sales to net new customers to FreshBooks. The Head of NA Acquisition Sales will also be responsible for sales forecasting, analytics, productivity (Salesforce.com) and other sales support functions. You wake up thinking and energized to lead your team to overachieving your team‚Äôs revenue goals on a daily basis.  Specifically in this role, you will: Develop an in-depth knowledge of FreshBooks‚Äôs core products via successful completion of required Sales training and Support training programs and utilize this knowledge to successfully lead the Acquisition Sales teams Create a scalable outbound sales process that results in net new acquisition of customers to FreshBooks Continue to improve the inbound lead sales process that will also result in net new customers to freshbooks via marketing demand generation campaigns as well as working with our valued partners. Work with the Head of North American Sales to create and maintain a world-class Sales culture, focussed on the over-achievement of assigned revenue targets by providing ongoing visibility and insights into the Acquisition Sales team‚Äôs sales processes Produce accurate sales forecasts, sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner. Work with the BDR Manager to create effective sales processes that results in sufficient Lead generation and closed revenue Work effectively with all internal departments (Marketing, Product Marketing, Professional Services, Finance and Product Development) to help develop effective sales strategies and marketing campaigns that promote sales to new customers to FreshBooks Work with the Sales Operations team to effectively manage your Acquisition Sales Team‚Äôs Compensation Plans including monthly/quarterly bonuses and ensure accurate and timely communication to Finance Work with Sales Leadership to grow and scale this Acquisition Sales team Remain knowledgeable of key processes, business initiatives and internal resources in order to assist the sales team and recruitment in accomplishing company goals Working with Sales Enablement team for coordinating Sales Training requirements for your Sales team May attend conferences and professional association meetings to promote FreshBooks product solutions and our Brand to increase leads and drive sales  You will bring: College or University degree in Business, Finance or other related field or equivalent work experience Minimum of 5 years experience as a successful Sales Professional, with a minimum of 3+ years experience in Sales management Demonstrated leadership, strong communication skills and comfortable with presentations Ability to build and deliver detailed PowerPoint or Google Slide presentations Understanding of Software-as-a Service (SaaS) revenue model Ability to effectively utilize CRM tools (Salesforce) to monitor performance and effectiveness of Lead generation. Experience with Microsoft Excel Demonstrated effectiveness in New Business Development strategies and Demand Generation Ability to work effectively in an office-based environment  What You‚Äôll Love About Working Here: Three week onboarding that brings you up to speed on our brand, product, and most importantly, our customers. It‚Äôs an awesome opportunity to dive in and understand what we‚Äôre all about and build your network within the company. Plus, there‚Äôs prizes! Our ever-expanding, global team who care about making accounting incredibly easy for business owners around the world. Amazing growth and mentorship opportunities from a team with a laser-focused mission of shipping extraordinary experiences. Collaborating remote or hybrid model with a global team A work/life balance you can brag to your friends about: Two weeks parental paid leave and paid leave top-up Health & dental coverage tailored to your local office Generous time off - including vacation, volunteer and innovation days Health and Wellness credits Learning and development opportunities that are both in-house and external Retirement savings programs matched to your local office Stock options for all full time employees And finally, we have fun at work...Want to start a chess team? Awesome. Want to host a homemade-ice-cream-making Zoom night? Whatever your passion is, bring it to FreshBooks, tell others about it, and enjoy what you do every day.  Apply Now  Have we got your attention? Submit your application today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch with you shortly!  FreshBooks is an equal opportunity employer that embraces the differences in all of our employees. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all FreshBookers. All applicants are evaluated based on their experience and qualifications in relation to this position.  FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com.
