description: VICE PRESIDENT, STRATEGIC CLIENT ACCOUNTS RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans, and implementing technology to help transform organizations.  Working for RGP, you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP, and built on tangible accomplishments.  As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know: We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them. We like working with people who are positive, adaptable, and growth-minded. We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.  If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.   THE RGP EXPERIENCE Whether you desire to work directly with clients or support those who do, RGP connects you to meaningful opportunities designed to put your talents to their best and highest use, and help you develop skills for today and tomorrow. As an RGP employee, you are a champion for your team, driven to develop their functional acumen in a manner that is transformative and valuable. You help guide people and organizations to be and become more than they thought possible and have the ultimate service mentality based on openness, understanding, and teamwork.   PURPOSE OF THE ROLE We are seeking a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts in our Northern California offices, who will be instrumental in growing market revenue through new business development, management and expansion of existing client relationships, and oversight of consultant engagements with one of our most strategic accounts. In keeping with our entrepreneurial culture, the Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts will have an opportunity to build and own a client portfolio while working in partnership with teammates to achieve key business objectives.   Why work for a Strategic Client Program (SCP) Account? Providing exemplary client service runs deep in RGP‚Äôs DNA. Our SCP clients turn to us for thought leadership, insight, and innovation. At RGP, we are focused on humans leading the way to global growth. We take pride in being a trusted partner and strategic advisor to our clients. As a Vice President, Strategic Client Accounts, you will be part of a dedicated team that fuels growth and delivers this expertise, providing exemplary client service as you develop and maintain comprehensive, long-term, sustainable, and strategic client relationships.   ATTRIBUTES OF INDIVIDUALS IN THIS ROLE AT RGP  Demonstrates integrity and respect for people and opinions Integrity and respect for people and opinions Entrepreneurial, highly self-motivated, and driven to achieve a comprehensive set of performance metrics and quantitative measures Strategic, thought leader, and trusted business partner to the Account/Client Maintains an executive presence with a strong ability to interact with senior/C-level leaders Strong personal identification with RGP‚Äôs values ‚Äì loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability, and talent  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE  Accountable for the sales activity and results for a defined portfolio of business / Develops and implements tactical plans to achieve portfolio sales goals and objectives Conducts account planning and proactively seeks to bring innovative ideas and approaches to the account strategy Owns and drives key strategic pursuits, leveraging the full range of RGP resources and enablers (including Technical Sales, Advisory Project Services, and Business Development), as appropriate Develops and maintains effective relationships and communicates effectively with key client leaders and staff in order to drive account penetration and sales growth Continually develops new client business by pursuing account penetration within existing clients Serves as the client‚Äôs expert on the RGP business model, risk management, client-specific value-proposition, and business impacts Monitors and coaches‚Äô consultants and account team members on best practices in generating leads, identifying opportunities, and leveraging available RGP resources to enhance account penetration Fosters cross-functional collaboration to deliver the best of RGP to clients and drive continuous improvement in the services and solutions RGP brings to the marketplace Identifies, monitors and manages delivery performance, project risk, and new opportunities within assigned accounts in partnership with Talent Management and/or Delivery Management leads Executes and delivers against established KPIs and performance metrics Executes and supports account planning and forecasting activities, as appropriate, in support of enterprise and regional objectives Supports integration of enterprise and cross-functional initiatives across account portfolio, including account planning, forecasting and budgeting, and best practices Contributes to RGP‚Äôs continuous improvement through involvement in account-related case studies, collateral and thought leadership, and the identification of client and market trends relevant for future RGP opportunities and solutions  DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a four-year accredited institution 10+ years of business development experience with Fortune 500 (global) organizations Proven success in creating revenue and managing accounts Experience selling professional services within large accounts preferred Strong capacity for networking and generating lasting business relationships Proven experience building accounts and lasting enterprise account relationships An entrepreneurial spirit derived from experience building and/or transforming a business Excellent written and verbal communication skills; direct and timely with feedback Experience within the high-tech industry is preferred  Equal Opportunity Employer RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.

You must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, be customer-service orientated, and have ample sales and marketing experience, along with a proven track record of performance and results-oriented thinking. You will solely support long-term strategic customer relationships, following the initial prospect/onboarding and stabilization period with our partners.  You will initiate conversations, educate, promote, and engage with all iFit partner accounts, as well as clarify goals and metrics within the iFit, Sales, Product Development, Marketing, and Executive teams.  This Position is ON-SITE in Logan, Utah  Job Responsibilities Develop and engage in new relationships to promote the iFit product Develop and build rapport with new accounts and partners Work with partners to understand unique business dynamics, challenges, and implementation objectives Review data and look for opportunities to improve Oversee the onboarding process of new partners, including program and product implementation Meet and exceed targets for customer acquisition and new accounts Relay market needs and works cross-functionally with other departments, including Sales, Marketing, Technical and Product Development, and Executive teams Develop a firm understanding of every aspect of the iFit product, as well as all project and business goals DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION, And/or EXPERIENCE Outstanding technical and non-technical communication skills Bachelor's degree in relevant field or equivalent experience required 5+ years in account management Experience in brand engagement and growth Proven ability to multitask Ability to be detail-oriented and efficient Strong customer service skills Strong business acumen Sales and/or Marketing Experience Ability to understand abstract, complex systems, form technical descriptions, preferred. description: Quit Genius is the #1 digital clinic for substance addictions. We are on a mission to help 100 million people overcome tobacco, alcohol and opioid addictions by combining technology, healthcare and design. It‚Äôs an ambitious mission, but one we fully believe in and we hire people who share our aspirations and core values.  We are a global team of doctors, designers, engineers and researchers who are aligned by one common goal. Authenticity, creativity, purpose and thoughtfulness are at the heart of everything we do to deliver that goal, so finding exceptional people to come on the journey is everything to us. Quit Genius has scaled to dozens of health plans and employers, covering over 2 million lives and has already helped more than 750,000 members conquer their addictions. As of 2021, we have raised $78M from leading global investors and now work with 100+ world-class team members across our New York, London, and remote offices.  If you are passionate about making an impact on the health of others, join us and make it happen!  We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Sales Executive to help drive growth by closing key accounts. In this role, the candidate will help drive growth and shape the future of an emerging service that will have a significant impact on our business and the digital healthcare industry at large. Our ideal candidate will be a strong relationship builder and has a strong track record of sales success working with large enterprise organizations. Must be open to regular travel.  Responsibilities Take charge of the sales process from beginning to end: from first contact to signing the contract and closing the deal. Generate new leads by reaching out to decision makers in benefit teams and excite prospects about the Quit Genius program. Manage a pipeline of self-insured employer clients and maintain clean records in Salesforce.com in accordance with all company data policies Be in charge of building partner relationships with key benefits and wellness consultants. Become an additional spokesperson for the business at conferences and other industry events. Work cross functionally to drive organizational value Act as the ‚Äúquarterback‚Äù of your deals bringing in subject matter experts that can drive value to prospects and earn new clients The background we are looking for Minimum of 5 years experience selling digital health solutions in the employer benefits space with a history of closing complex deals. History of consistently exceeding quotas with a results-oriented nature. The ability to lead on high level sales pitches to senior executives. Excellent organization, communication (verbal and written) and management skills. Positive attitude: go getter who does not quit and is not afraid of rejection. The ability to innovate and solve problems creatively and are comfortable working with the uncertainty of a fast-paced start-up. A commitment to personal growth with a strong desire to learn and self-develop. Passion for the company‚Äôs mission to help millions quit smoking and improve their lives. A willingness to take a large degree of responsibility from the outset. A willingness to travel. Nice to have: Existing relationships that they can leverage in the employer benefit or healthcare space. Nice to have: Entrepreneurship or startup experience. Ideal locations: Boston, Providence, New York City and surrounding areas Benefits at Quit Genius Generous and meaningful stock options. A competitive base salary with variable compensation. Full Medical, dental, vision coverage. 401k An awesome culture - check it out here www.quitgenius.com/careers Highly flexible work schedule. Flexible vacation policy. Opportunity to join the executive team and significantly contribute to key decisions in the development of the business as a whole. Accelerated career growth opportunities to match the fast-paced growth of the business. Join a talented, passionate and ambitious team of doctors, designers and technologists with a fun-loving culture. The opportunity to have a big impact. What we do saves lives. Our teams at Quit Genius are made up of an incredible range of talented people from all walks of life. We believe that diversity of any description leads to innovation, idea sharing and collaboration.  Quit Genius is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status. Diversity and Inclusion are paramount to the success of our mission and our culture is driven by our differences, each of which we embrace with open arms.

description: The Durham Hotel is a 53-room independent, mid-century modern boutique hotel located in the heart of downtown Durham in the iconic Home Savings and Loan building. We value and support the community, and firmly believe relationship are the cornerstone to a successful, sustainable sales effort.  The Director of Sales (DOS) is a key position to the hotel's success and reputation within the community. The DOS will oversee the property's sales efforts and business development pipeline, customer relationships, sales experience and market positioning.  Overall Responsibilities Represent the hotel and community with integrity, professionalism and poise. Advocate and maintain service excellence, professionalism, teamwork, and an environment to have fun, learn and succeed. Provide pricing and guidance recommendations to sales team, review and approve any special corporate negotiated rates with the help of corporate revenue management. Develop a working knowledge of the operations of the hotel, including food & beverage, guest services, and reservations. Develop a complete knowledge and ensure adherence to company sales and events policies and processes. Drive customer loyalty to grow market segment share by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience and expanding on existing relationships to identify additional business opportunities. Ensure all pertinent aspects of solicitation, closing, group and event detailing, and customer communications are complete and documented for the team. Identify and pursue new and repeat business through prospecting calls, visits, site tours, business meetings, networking events, and tradeshows. Monitor all direct and indirect lead channels, qualifying and responding appropriately to all group, meeting, and catering inquiries. Develop and maintain market awareness to ensure ability to predict revenue opportunities and set proactive sales strategies. Analyze sales and revenue management reports to identify trends and future demand opportunities. Monitor transient and group pricing to ensure it is within an acceptable range based on availability inventory, current sales/revenue strategies, and market demand. Participate in forecasting revenue and managing monthly sales expenses. Conduct ongoing competitor price and product analysis alongside customer needs research to ensure proper rate positioning and product offerings relative to the competition and customer base. Recommend and implement new sales programs at the hotel and accurately track ROI. Works collaboratively with the corporate marketing team on all collateral and online marketing efforts to include all printed sales collateral, direct email, discount promotions, e-mail marketing, and website content. Prepares annual sales budget and business plan. Set and monitor team member goals including weekly sales activities, room night and revenue goals monthly, quarterly, yearly. Abides by prime time selling hours based on the customer landscape. Effectively manage a sales team that is empowered to work both in the office and remotely. Maintain accurate, legible records and files consistent with established sales and catering systems. Participate in continued education through industry organizations and trainings. Perform special projects and other responsibilities as assigned. Attend weekly team meetings and provide update on business. Work effectively with a sense of urgency and focus.

description: We're looking for a stellar Sales Director here at Snappy. You will be instrumental in contributing to the fast-growth of our gifting platform and experience. We currently have openings on both the enterprise and mid market sales teams!  You will: Manage the full sales life cycle from prospect to close Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, generating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects Cultivate lasting relationships with customers Crush your quota!  You have: 5-7 years of relevant sales / closing experience Previous SaaS and enterprise software experience Top-notch verbal and written communication skills  You are: Passionate about providing an exceptional customer experience Solutions oriented and excited by a good challenge Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, and well-organized A strong team player and a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment At your best when given responsibility and a sense of ownership  Snappy is an award-winning all-in-one enterprise gifting platform. We're reinventing the way companies express appreciation to their employees by offering a fun and interactive digital experience that lets employees choose a gift they actually love. We specialize in building recognition programs for all sorts of businesses - Zoom, Salesforce, Microsoft, Uber, Deloitte and over 800 more. Plus, we're growing everyday - 400% YOY, if you want to get technical! We've seen firsthand that our experience boosts morale, improves performance, and (most importantly!) spreads joy.  Of course, we practice what we preach! Here at Snappy, we believe wholeheartedly in building a culture of appreciation, dedication, and fun! We offer all sorts of benefits and perks to our employees including but not limited to: Free healthcare including vision and dental and a generous 401k match, unlimited PTO and paid family leave, Snappy Summer Fridays (which we actually enjoy year around!), snacks and lunches delivered to your home while we're working remotely, and Snappy gifts galore!

description: What we do at Codat Our mission is to make life easier for the lifeblood of economies globally; small and medium-sized businesses. Codat is a universal API for consented business financial data, powering the next generation of products and services for this historically underserved market.    We have offices in London and New York, and a San Francisco office will be opening soon. We are a privately held company, and have recently closed our Series B funding and are funded by Index Ventures, Tiger Global, American Express, PayPal and a line-up of world-class angel investors.  We live by our values of being united as a single team, building a product that is useful to our clients and their customers alike, with a focus and urgency that makes us unstoppable.  What we do at Codat  Codat is a fast-growing technology company based in London which is growing rapidly in the US and Canada. Our product is a universal API for small business financial data. Banks and fintechs use our technology to easily connect to the software systems used by their small business customers, allowing them to read and write data via a single API. Codat‚Äôs technology has many applications across financial services and business services, but lending is our most established sector. Given the current economic climate, lenders need for real time data on their business customers has never been greater. We are well-funded with a large and growing number of enterprise and fintech clients. We most recently received a $10M investment from Index Ventures, a leading global venture capital firm. We have also been awarded $10M in grant funding from the RBS Capability and Innovation Fund to help power our growth.  What you will be doing  Directly support a team of Strategic and Enterprise Account Executives who thrive while learning and winning together Support ongoing team growth and development including recruitment, hiring, training, and mentorship As a senior leader, you will be a valuable cross functional contributor to our US and global go to market strategy Participate in customer and prospect meetings and help define strong business cases Collaborate with Solution Engineering, Customer Success, and other cross-functional teams to drive success and guide investment Identify product and technology gaps through customer relationships and present a point of view to Codat‚Äôs Product and Leadership Teams Run weekly forecast meetings and coach Account Executives on strategies to accomplish their goals Report on sales activity and manage a regular revenue forecast Achieve key performance metrics and goals Work with your team to discuss, plan and implement process improvements You will be based in New York Metro Area or the San Francisco Bay Area Our values  No matter what we‚Äôre doing - whether we‚Äôre speaking to customers, partners or to each other - we live by our values.  We believe in delivering useful technology that solves real problems for real businesses. We have a real want to do the stuff that isn't always ‚Äúcool‚Äù but makes a difference.  We believe that the people in the best teams push and enable each other to excel. We‚Äôre united when we have each other‚Äôs backs - when something goes wrong, we don‚Äôt blame, we work together to fix it. We embrace differences of opinion to end up with better outcomes. We don‚Äôt let our egos win.  We believe that an unstoppable drive towards a single, clearly stated goal is the best way to build great things. We are biased towards action - we make informed decisions and then we act. There is no such thing as an impossible problem, just a great challenge to sink our teeth into.  What excites us  10+ years of Sales experience preferably within an Enterprise SaaS organization 5+ years of Sales Management experience preferably selling to the financial sector Solid understanding of fintech, APIs, and Enterprise SaaS applications Consistent track record of selling software into Large Enterprise accounts and achieving personal and team goals Ability to grow business in a strategic manner including demand generation Excellent coaching, writing, discovery and presentation skills History of thriving in a rapidly changing environment Passion for customer success and deep customer relationships Comfortable and willing to be a hands-on contributor Ability to be flexible and adaptive Bachelor's degree The ability to travel whenever required If you are excited about applying for this role but aren't certain you meet 100% of the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you.
industries: Financial Services

description: Kitchen Cabinet Distributors (KCD) is one of the country's fastest-growing distributors of wood cabinetry. KCD has more than 500,000 combined square feet of warehouse & assembly space over three locations in Raleigh, NC, Houston, TX, and Reno, NV, which allows for nationwide distribution. KCD's goal is to become the leading provider of stock cabinetry solutions in the United States. Successful candidates will find significant opportunity for career advancement within KCD.  Job Description The Director of Sales, West will be responsible for the growth of sales in our Western markets covered by Reno and Houston Distribution Centers through the management of a network of independent and internal sales representatives as well as KCD‚Äôs various sales channels (dealer direct, regional distribution, etc.).  This role will have direct responsibility for customer- and channel-level P&L, focusing on driving profitable top line sales. The Director of Sales, West will be a key contributor to KCD‚Äôs strategic business decisions and will be expected to build, articulate, and execute the company‚Äôs go-forward sales strategy. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of the importance of competitive intelligence, a demonstrated ability to understand and react to market trends, and strong aptitude for using data and analytics to make decisions and evaluate results.    The Director of Sales, West will be a senior sales leader within the organization and will report to the Vice President of Sales & Marketing. The position will also need to work collaboratively with the Director of Sales, East to coordinate and execute sales strategies.  Responsibilities Lead KCD‚Äôs West sales team, directly managing internal staff and more than 10 independent sales representatives across the territory. Recruit, train, and manage sales staff and external sales representatives to support the territory and growth projections. Effectively manage external sales representatives providing clear expectations, frequent communication, mentoring, coaching, training, accountability, and corrective action where necessary. Create a sales team culture that is coherent, positive, and performance-driven. Articulate and execute big picture strategy for aggressive sales growth and channel management. Establish and achieve aggressive sales targets. Manage customer-level P&L with focus on large accounts. Advise on product development and rationalization by leveraging product-level analytics and customer feedback. Successfully develop existing and new channels of business to create depth in customer portfolio. Work with marketing leadership on campaigns and programs that support sales strategy and deliver results. Make extensive use of sales analytics and KPIs. Develop and implement weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual KPIs presented to entire sales team, VP of Sales & Marketing and executive leadership team . Work cross-functionally on key company activities such as demand planning, large project bidding, operational improvements, and customer initiatives. Monitor competitive intelligence and take action to improve KCD‚Äôs competitive positioning in the market. Continuously assess the market to maintain understanding of threats and opportunities; leverage assessment to provide recommendations to the organization that drive growth.  Qualifications Live within the defined territory ‚Äìin or close to a major market. Sacramento/Reno area is preferred. Familiarity with building products market and Dealer/Distributor channels. 10+ years relevant experience in the building materials industry ‚Äì cabinetry experience preferred. 5+ years directly managing a sales team, including both internal and external sales representatives. Proven ability to use data and analytics to manage team, make decisions, and make recommendations to senior leadership. Track record of producing strong, consistent sales growth within a rapidly growing company. Experience negotiating with large customers and aligning on mutually beneficial solutions. Experience in sales planning and forecasting. History of strategic leadership and ability to develop and execute a coherent sales strategy. Ability to create scalable, repeatable processes. Strong technical aptitude and eagerness to embrace company systems and technology to improve results. Willingness to do whatever it takes to get the job done ‚Äì even if it falls outside of the candidates‚Äô job description.  Work Environment ¬∑      Travel required 50%.

The Senior Director will partner and work closely with key individuals in regards to sponsorships for HBSE. He or she will work closely with the Corporate and Marketing Partnerships teams, organization departments, as well as other staff as needed.  The candidate selected into this key role will have a proven track record as a revenue generator and for selling successful partnerships as well as consistently securing seven-figure investments. He or she already has an established reputation and track record of success, gained with any combination of major brands, teams or agencies and is now looking to further enhance their reputation with one of the leading sports and entertainment companies in the world.  Responsibilities Include, But Aren't Limited To The Following  Renowned solution selling pedigree Ability to synergize the efforts of individuals and teams from multiple business units to accomplish the goals of the company High energy, excellent communicator, engaging, entrepreneurial and has a roll-up-sleeves mentality Qualifications  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of revenue generation partnership sales experience with a professional team, league, media or entertainment organization Expertise in developing and selling partnership platforms A track record of driving revenue growth for major events (e.g. entertainment or sports events) Known throughout the industry for their poise and professionalism when interacting with internal and external contacts Working Conditions Travel Requirements: Newark, NJ is home base. Travel to Camden, NJ depending on business needs. Must also travel for other offsite events, client meetings, etc. Physical Demands: This position requires the ability to lift up to 50 pounds. description: Job # 570770  When you join Verizon  Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We‚Äôre a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing...  As Business Development Consultant, you will support all strategy driven by the head of the new sensor business in Verizon‚Äôs New Business Incubation unit. You will be supporting the new business, product, and technical capability inside NBI, which will leverage Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and Intelligent Edge Network (Mobile Edge Compute) to power orchestration for the autonomous future indoors and outdoors including support for robotic sensor arrays, fixed and mobile IoT both indoors and outdoors.This position plays a vital role in assisting with establishing, qualifying, and supporting all sales opportunities for the new business unit and also creating new solutions leveraging Verizon‚Äôs 5G network and MEC architecture. Support to Build and scale NBI‚Äôs Sensor Fusion team to deliver transformational revenue growth and product leadership. Establish and execute the strategy for NBI‚Äôs sensor fusion capabilities and business opportunities across the diverse technology businesses already in place and the new ones to come. Align the diverse sensor ingestion and processing approaches within NBI to execute a unified sensor fusion strategy designed to enable the business strategy. Facilitate communication across the department by leading all-hands and sub-department leadership meetings. Participate in the opportunity discovery process to identify and document business and technical requirements during the prospect qualification phase of the product suite sales cycle. Assist in the post-sale transition from sales to the professional services team. You'll Need To Have  What we‚Äôre looking for... Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Knowledge of Cloud vs. On-Premise deployment. Experience with Video Management Software, Video Analytics and Sensors. Willingness to travel. Even better if you have one or more of the following: A degree. Experience identifying, documenting and articulating the business and technical requirements of a prospective customer during the full sales cycle ‚Äì qualification, proposal, post-sale transition. Experience communicating software ability to address prospect‚Äôs requirements through compelling presentation (written, oral and product demonstrations) of the applications. Experience with Databases. Experience with Application integration. Experience in Networking. Experience public speaking. Subject Matter Expert in one of the following industries: Manufacturing, Energy, Transporation, Retail or Education. Knowledge of underlying sensor components such as data ingestion, camera technology, AI, ML, DL, and big data. Experience promoting technology innovation with leaders at large tech companies. Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.  Job Family: CML  Business Unit: STDBU
industries: Telecommunications, Information Technology and Services, and Computer & Network Security

description: BillingPlatform is a VC-backed, industry-leading, fast-growing SaaS company in the Denver Tech Hub. Our decision to build the industry‚Äôs leading monetization platform was driven by the belief that all industries are facing disruption‚Äîdigital and physical goods are being sold on a subscription basis, on a consumption basis, and in a variety of other formats. BillingPlatform was built to give enterprises a flexible and scalable platform to monetize the customer relationship using virtually any variable.  Leveraging successful years of product development and customer feedback, aided by leading venture funding (Columbia Capital), we have built the industry's most powerful, cloud-based monetization platform, able to automate the entire workflow from quote to cash, including CPQ, mediation, billing, invoicing, revenue recognition, payment, and collections.  We are a member of the Deloitte Tech Fast 500, the Inc. 5000, Colorado's "Companies to Watch", and are recognized as a leader by industry analysts and enterprises. Our values-based culture centers around collaboration, innovation, and transparency. Whether working from our company HQ in the Denver Tech Center, or virtually, we are seeking bright, enthusiastic, and creative professionals looking to displace antiquated technology and processes, and re-imagine an industry.  BillingPlatform Sales Directors are focused on enterprise business accounts within the assigned geographic territory. You are a driven hunter, with a proven track record of exceeding quota in technology sales and a motivated and tenacious self-starter who is comfortable selling to senior level execs.  Responsibilities Execute on the account plan to deliver maximum revenue potential and meet or exceed sales quota Identify and qualify opportunities within your account territory. Sell business application solutions to prospective and new enterprise customers. Prospect, forecast, and planning of new business deals Participate in the creation, presentation and sales of a complete value proposition via the telephone, internet, webinar and customer meetings Evangelize the BillingPlatform vision through product demonstrations, in-market events, and account specific initiatives. Manage complete and complex sales-cycles Deliver outstanding results through cross team collaboration.  Requirements Located in Southern California 7+ years of experience in enterprise solution software sales, preferably within SaaS Billing, CPQ, Accounting/ERP applications. Sold to CFO‚Äôs, VP of Finance, VP of Billing and Controllers Demonstrable track record of consistent over-achievement of quotas and revenue goals. With deals size exceed One Hundred Thousand per year. Leverage inbound and outbound lead flow and create new opportunities from personal prospecting efforts, utilizing contacts, existing accounts and partners, being creative with sales tools provided. Experience in managing complex sales-cycles and demonstrated ownership of territory and account management. Outstanding communication (written and oral), negotiation, presentation and solution selling skills in order to manage complex organizations A proven ability to effectively identify and sell to senior executives. Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment. Solid computer skills including Salesforce.com, Microsoft, Google and collaboration tools Travel up to 50% Bachelor's Degree  Benefits  This position is remote and not located in Colorado. BillingPlatform offers a great benefits package including 3 medical plans to choose from, dental, vision, HSA (match), FSA, 401(k), company provided and voluntary life and AD&D, voluntary disability insurance and other great perks.  BillingPlatform provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: The Director of Sales and Marketing will oversee, coordinate, and participate in the development of sales and marketing strategies for the organization.  Responsibilities Achieve Closing Goals set by the Division President. Achieve Sales Goals set in collaboration with the Division President and Sales Manager. Authorize and sign off on all new agreements, sales addenda & design addenda. Report the progress of the sales organization & marketing efforts to the Division President on a weekly basis. Continue leading the team to sell homes at full value. Collaborate with and train the Sales Manager to achieve company goals in addition to each individual Sales Professionals‚Äô goals. Analyze, strategize and drive the Closing and Sales Goals. Oversee all personnel adjustments, including hiring, terminations, and transferring Sales Professionals to a new community, etc (must be approved by Division President and HR). Provide constructive and timely performance evaluations. Manage and oversee the tasks of the Sales Manager. Motivate, inspire and lead the Sales team by fostering a culture of teamwork, accountability, consistency and professionalism. Roll out new communities, including the review of pricing, model home setups, sales addenda updates, design updates, signage, grand openings, homesite premiums (approved by Division President), etc. Lead and strategize all marketing efforts and delegate to the Marketing Coordinator (including all social media campaigns, large-print signage, small signs, model office marketing materials, flags, events, etc). Maintain knowledge on emerging products and services. Establish processes and systems to help achieve and excel business goals and objectives. Manage Vacation and PTO days for the department, keeping track and approving time off requests in ADP, ensuring appropriate coverage while employees are out to maintain quality and achieve deadlines. Oversee starts and closings for all communities. Order all spec homes necessary each month to continue ensuring an even starts process. Approve of monthly pricing with the Division President on a monthly basis. Collaborate with senior leaders to develop growth plans for the organization. Resolve short appraisal issues as needed. Resolve conflicts that arise between customers and Hakes Brothers that have escalated beyond the Sales Manager's capabilities. Interface between the Director of Construction and the Director of Purchasing, Designer, and other departments as needed to resolve issues as they arise. Ensure pipeline viability by focusing on the spec homes available for sale, presale opportunities and any deficiencies that may exist in the pipeline by communicating with the Division President. The Director of Sales is the direct supervisor for the Sales Manager and Marketing Coordinator.  Qualifications Required: Bachelor's degree in relevant area Required: At least four years of relevant experience
